Reviews.Title: “Too Far From Strip”
Reviews.Author: sourfriday
Reviews.Content: Really a nice establishment, beautiful room with distant strip view and floor to ceiling windows, nice restaurants, staff were fine, pretty small casino, nice bowling alley, but WAY too far from the strip. Last shuttle leaves strip at 10pm, and the cab ride back was $70. Not exactly something you'd want to do nightly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious room”
Reviews.Author: travelholicena
Reviews.Content: Best hotel room I have ever afforded to stay in. 20 mins away from the Las vegas strip. Free shuttle bus to and from. Last bus going back to hotel is a bit early though. Not enough time to see all the places on the strip. Free wifi in room. Love the bathroom. Separate areas for the toilet, tub and shower. TV in tub. Love the free toiletries, seems to come from their spa. Would love to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average business trip”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelette
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here for a conference. Even though I do not like Las Vegas, I was a little excited at the prospect of staying at a resort. Right. Not really a resort, per se. The hotel was amazing in that it had a huge selection of restaurants and clubs. But to get anywhere you have to walk through smoke, and even my room itself smelled of smoke. The people are friendly, and the food was all very good. But I would not go back unless they made it non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer service in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: scarr416
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Red Rock for a conference. From the instant I arrived, everyone went out of their way to make sure my stay was great. Rooms are perfect size, modern decor, large bathroom, very clean and well appointed. Casino is good size, lots of games. Good dining options. Had breakfast at the cafe, great food at reasonable price. Had dinner at the Japenese Sushi place - outstanding! Great place to hold a conference, great place to stay off the strip, close to the Red Rock canyon. Bowling alley, kids zone, food court. large pool. Customer service was outstanding. Everyone was extremely friendly. Would definently recommend if looking for a place off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you are ok with not being close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: DivingDad13
Reviews.Content: The facility is very nice and seems clean. The room amenities were great and I found the hotel to have great value as we picked it up on priceline for $80.00 a night. Of course there was a resort charge which is reasonable when you look at what you get (WIFI in the room was included). The pool is not heated and during our stay the whirlpools were being repaired. The elevators stopped working, the locks in the spa didn't work on the lockers, the attendant was nowhere to be found to help with this, and the maid forgot to change the glasses in our room, but when I brought these items to the attention of the desk manager (Laura B) she removed some charges from our room and promised to send glasses right away. An hour later we were still waiting on glasses and that was after calling again, but these things happen in a big resort. Overall we were pleased with the property and the value. The food deals on steak and eggs late night were awesome. You do need a car if you are staying here or you'll pay big charges for taxi's as it really is far from the strip. The spa with the exception of the attendant is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel even though not on the strip...”
Reviews.Author: starjem66
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed what I thought it would be. It was a like a little city in itself! Great service, great people working there and plenty to do!

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: vacationfamily05
Reviews.Content: The hotel and amenities are okay…for adults but you can probably get the same at a cheaper hotel. However, there is not much for kids to do. It is a costly stay. The good thing is that it is close to the Red Rock center which has a lot of sightseeing, but it is distant from the strip…30minutes to be exact.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Bar in side the Red Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfred s
Reviews.Content: Thank to the Hostess at the Lucky Bar "BEX" she is an amazing person. We been there 2 times and on March 24 we came out to celebrate friend’s birthday party and got a booth for us because it was empty and we were told it’s ok to take that place then hours past next thing we were told that we could not have this space because it was reserved. Bex comes by and handled everything nicely we did not move and we end up ordering bottle of Belvedere and the night just started again because of Bex. She came by couple of times to make sure that we were ok and if needed anything. Thank you again and we are going to come back and hope to see Bex and party hard. Also thank you to Andy the security at the Lucky Bar he was great.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: nmnative
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Red Rock. We stayed there a year ago while in Vegas for our daughter's wedding and felt like it was such a positive experience that we had to go back. I'll start with the positives. The bell staff and the Valet staff are by far the best employees on this property. They will take care of you with a friendly smile every time. We had no problems in this area. There was some communication problems with getting the room we wanted but it all worked out once we moved from the initial room we were given. The rooms are spacious, comfy and well appointed. You have every thing you need. Love the extra tv in the bathroom, such a nice touch ;) There is a seperate shower and tub. The casino was loads of fun as usual and the smell of smoke is kept to a minimum. There are plenty of places to eat, you will not go hungry and if you get tired of Red Rock there are other places in the area to eat. We used the work out room and we found it to be big enough for what we needed, the spa area is clean and there is plenty of room to relax or jump in the jacuzzi or sauna. The hot tea and fruit are an added bonus. What I didn't like was the layout and the inconvenience from the shower to the lockers to the vanity area..Now for the negatives.... the lighting in the room is very bad. Every time I went to my suitcase I was searching for more light because you cannot see much in the room at night. The view is normally awesome out the window towards the pool area and Red Rock Canyon but this time..NOT SO MUCH! This was my chief complaint. When I called to book the room I specified that I wanted the pool view because at night when it's all lit up it is just beautiful to look at..well they happened to be resurfacing the pool while we were there and the pools over on our side under our window were all drained and we woke to jack hammers every single morning at 8 a.m. By the second day I'd had enough and I did call down to complain because not one single employee told me about this on my several calls to the property prior to our trip. The Feast buffet was good. You cannot complain about the food, not at that price. The food was always hot and good, but we were surprised that breakfast wasn't open until 8 a.m. which was an inconvenience on the morning we went out for a hike. Another big complaint above and beyond the pool situation was the cleanliness of our room. There was hair and dirt in the corner of our bathroom at check in. There was also hair in the tub..eww. The housekeeping staff did come by each day to freshen our room but that hair, etc never moved. Our sheets were never changed either. Do NOT touch the food on the mini bar unless you plan to pay for it. They warn you at check in so do heed those warnings! Room service is sllloowww, go downstairs to eat. The cocktail waitresses in the casino are hard to find but once you do, they deliver even if you move around ;) If you fly to Vegas and don't rent a car I'm not too sure I'd recommend staying at Red Rock unless you plan to stay put and not go to the Strip. It is pretty far from the Strip, there's a shuttle but we saw people lined up for quite some time waiting on the shuttle. We drove our own car to Vegas so going back and forth was not a problem for us. Overall our stay was fabulous. We will most definitely be back..hopefully sooner rather than later. In fact, I wish we were there now!

Reviews.Title: “Event Site Visit”
Reviews.Author: Sherry H
Reviews.Content: The reason for my stay was to tour and experience what the Red Rock had to offer to an upcoming Convention that I am planning. During my stay in Las Vegas, I toured and stayed at 4 other properties. By far Red Rock is the very BEST VEGAS has to offfer! Very Classy, Friendly, Up Beat! The casino areas did not have a strong smoke smell, the rooms were very spacious and comfortable, the spa and fittness are were amazing, many places to eat and great pools. I was very impressed! I did end up booking my event at the Red Rock and Cannot wait for my 400 guest to enjoy this beautiful venue! I highly recommend the Red Rock for your next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property but it has flaws”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: The first question you have to ask yourself is why are you there. To gamble, business, vacation, etc. For me it was business. So this review should be taken in that context. First, let's start with the positive. This is off strip. So the property doesn't feel tacky or overhyped. It gives the impression of being an upscale property. The rooms are modern and nice size. There is plenty to do on property. Shop, eat, gamble, movies, bowling, etc. it is also very easy to get to from the airport. However, the property has a number of flaws. First, it is a maze. For a first time guest, I had a difficult time simply getting from the parking ramp to the hotel registration desk. No good signs showing the way. And keep in mind, I am a very seasoned traveler. Not someone who can't find their way around hotel properties. And once you get checked in, the elevators are hidden away in a dark corner. Also, the property feels like a combination of mall, casino, conference center and hotel. All patched together as if someone had done a series of additions over time. Second, the hotel rooms are dark. While they are modern, the lighting is pretty poor. There are also only 2 power outlets in the room. Granted, I'm traveling for business not pleasure. So trying to plug in a laptop, 2 cell phones and a internet card is a bit of a problem. Finally, room service has a problem. While the food arrives quickly, I spent 10 minutes on hold during my 2 calls. None of these issues are property killers. But when you add them up they quickly become shortcomings that make this property far from perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property & Excellent Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Rock for our twentieth wedding anniversary and had a fantastic time. The staff somehow found out it was a special occasion for us and went above and beyond to make us feel special. The property is very new and in excellent shape. The rooms were very clean and very comfortable. We ate at several of the restaurants including the steak house and Italian restaurant and all were excellent. All staff members we interacted with where focused on creating a memorable experience for the guests. I was extremely impressed with the whole operation and will stay there again when I return to vegas and definately will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite...”
Reviews.Author: Pam N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Red Rock on many occasions. The most recent trip was for a slot tournament held on St. Patrick's Day. We had a great time! The tournament was not one of my favorites, but the rest of the trip was great. We bowled, went to the movies, at ate the buffet, and of course played in the casino! Our room was up to the usual standard. Love, love, love the beds! Woke up to a beautiful view of the red rocks...my choice over the strip view. Can't wait until the weather warms up and can sit out by the amazing pool. Take a chance and stay off the strip. It isn't a long or bad drive to visit the strip and it is soooo relaxing here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carm C
Reviews.Content: Went to the Redrock to avoid the cold weather in February.. The rooms are very comfortable!!! The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was a pleasant one. This hotel has a lot to offer. From restaurants to movie theaters. The pool area is so beautiful and relaxing. Nice gambling area too. I highly recommend this hotel. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay at Red Rock Casino”
Reviews.Author: Brooks S
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Red Rock Resort and Casino. Since it was off the strip I expected it to be rather lame but it was quite impressive, beautiful and the staff were very professional. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: roadtripin1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a more relaxing atmosphere away from the strip, I highly recommend the Red Rock Hotel and Casino. We are very low maintenance travelers, so although we did not task the staff much, those we interacted with were very personal and accommodating. Our room was fantastic. The furniture is top of the line, the decor modern, and the beds were comfortable making for a great night's sleep. Both the hotel and rooms were spotless and I look forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “It's Not on the STRIP!”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence H
Reviews.Content: Negative: It's not on the Strip! Positive: It's not on the Strip! You fill out multiple "customer service" forms in various places. This is the first location where indicating "exceeded" our expectations was true (except the Grand Cafe). Rooms were exceptional. Full service casino (and less expensive than the strip). Only drawback was it was quite a hike to get to the strip for shows. Good - exceptional choices for meals (except the Grand Cafe). So if you want to relax, enjoy great gaming, mingle with locals, not have to deal with hyper-Vegas, and you avoid the Grand Cafe (breakfast was OK) for meals, this could be your favorite Vegas place. It's become ours. We've been to many of the Vegas Strip hotels, and I won't say we won't go back to a few of them. But we will always include a stay at Red Rock now that we've discovered it.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: This was an excellant hotel with an accomadating staff and superior rooms. I have stayed at new hotels on the strip before, and in every way the Red Rock was superior, EXCEPT that you can't be further away from the strip and still be in Las Vegas. This is either an asset or a detriment depending on your point of view. e.g.the cab fare to the airport was $60. If the plan is to go to Las Vegas and never leave the grounds; as in a conference(this is why I went) then this is an excellant choice. If you are going to have a diverse Vegas experience, go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Smckee1961
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night, and it was very nice. I stayed here on a Sunday night. Very good food, a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kpair
Reviews.Content: We had a stopover in Las Vegas on our way to New Mexico. Stayed at Red Rock for the first time. It was an excellent experience. The room was excellent.......including the bed. The view was awesome........mountain view room...........Restaurants were also excellent. Many choices. I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and nice place to relax”
Reviews.Author: service06
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Red Rock as it is away from the strip some people would say its too far out. The rooms where clean and the food good. Was great for a couple of days in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Buildings at Red Rock! at least a nice one”
Reviews.Author: aykayeh
Reviews.Content: We heard from a friend that there was now a Station casino at Red Rock. Some years ago, there was little more than red stuff at red rock, and I'm sure we saw wild donkeys along the side of the road as we drove out there. Now it's wall to wall little buildings all the way, part of the over-expansion that has all but broken Vegas. Still, the Red Rock Resort is actually pretty nice, if that is what you are going to have there. Most of the slot machine were of the video poker variety, more than in other casinos we thought. There were surprise benefits of St. Patrick's Day when we were there, and a floor manager suggested we get one of the benefit cards and put it in the machine. When we did we each got one of the $25 bonuses. Which the machine all but immediately took back of course. The resort looks like a nice place to stay, but checking the rates quickly might suggest that you could get luxury there, but not a bargain of the kind to be had on the Strip. So, if you stay on the Strip, rent a car--or take a Red Rock Resort shuttle bus--and head out. At the very least you'll find some of the best in Casino restaurants around. Reviews elsewhere (of the Feast buffet).

Reviews.Title: “Huge resort has something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: ATL2World
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Las Vegas experience that is perhaps a bit different from all of the hotels on the strip, the Red Rock could be the hotel resort you're looking for. It's a fairly new place, and we found the room accommodations to be larger than average, clean, comfortable, and well appointed. Be prepared to do some walking -- from our room at one end of the long curved hallway, it was nearly 200 yards to the elevator and a full 10+ minute walk from the lobby to the other end of the resort. Further, the resort is huge, with an almost mall-like atmosphere to it with many restaurants, food court (!), theatre, clubs, bars, bowling alley, kids' center, and video game arcade centered around the casino (naturally) and an equally large number of outside pools. With a number of conference center venues for the business set as well as the activity options available, the Red Rock offers a fairly complete resort destination for family and/or corporate travelers. We found the service and food to be very good and friendly. One caveat regarding internet use: Wired and WIFI service is not free, and even then, WIFI seems a little spotty in its speed and quality. The Red Rock is about 17 miles west from the airport -- a 20+ minute ($65) cab drive. If you are so inclined, there is a hotel shuttle to and from the airport every two hours from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. or so. That puts it about 12 miles or so from the strip -- and the Red Rock also runs a shuttle to the strip and the mall on the hour until about 9 p.m. or thereabouts. All in all, we believe that the Red Rock is a pleasant alternative to the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for breathtaking views of red rock mountains that form part of the canyon”
Reviews.Author: Pickydoc
Reviews.Content: RRC is nicely located at the foothills of the RRC mountains, with stunning views on most days. There are several great restaurants, Tbones being one of them. The buffet was not the best I have been to in Las Vegas, as food quality was overall average, at best. The Casino was not spectacular and was quite ordinary for a Resort of this caliber. Upfront Bellman charges appeared on the final bill; we were not old about these in advance, having already given the bellman a generous tip. Staff were overall very helpful and polite, especially the concierges. Overall a pleasant experience. Would return when the outdoor pool is open.

Reviews.Title: “Best off the strip place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Az86401
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock is a beautiful property with very nice rooms. Great entertainment with bowling, food court and theater inside. The pool area is very pretty also. Only downside- Wish the resort fee wasn't so high.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful retreat off the strip”
Reviews.Author: bageltraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for large business conference- was very impressed with staff friendliness, quality of room and the overall atmosphere. I am not much of a Vegas person since I don't gamble but I found the casino area clean and bright with good food and entertainment options. There is a fairly good food court as well as a bowling alley and a movie theater that seems to be popular with the locals. The room was large and modern. It smelled new. The toiletries were high end. I really like the scale in the room! Help me keep track of my buffet limits! Nice TV in the soaking tub was a good touch. I have Verizon wireless and had a very hard time getting a signal from inside the room so I had to call my colleague using the room phone. My friends with AT&T did not have a problem. I eventually found that leaving the phone against the window worked pretty well. The gym is pretty nice though small. Has nice free weights. Pool was beautiful. Would have loved to try it out if it were warmer! The conference area smells smokey starting at about 9 am. Thankfully that didn't travel up to my room 1 level up. Since it is off the strip, it is much quieter and good for couples. The only con is the shuttle to the strip and airport only runs every 2 HOURS. I think this is unacceptable since the shuttle only accepts 29 people at a time. If you don't get in line early enough ~20 minutes, you might miss out and have to take a taxi ~$50 to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: K8MN
Reviews.Content: I was worried that staying so far off the Strip would be a let down, but Red Rock provides a total Vegas experience without having to leave. The room were very nice, the pool area is amazing (although the drinks are weak), and the casino isn't crowded. The restaurants we tried were all good. One night I got a blister from my heels and a security guard came over and offered me band-aids! That has never happened to me anywhere else in Vegas. I always said I'd never bring my kids to Vegas, but with a bowling alley and a movie theater in the hotel, I would consider making my next visit a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: PSS_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I landed at this resort due to a bogo coupon in the Las Vegas Advisor. It was for the buffet. We arrived a little early for dinner so we decided to get a loyalty card and try the slot machines. The place was quiet and not crowded, however, the waitresses were seen from afar but never came to hour section in the hour there. If you are a senior citizen, you get a sticker that earns you a discount at the buffet. The buffet was vast and had different countries. Everything was fresh and hot. My favorite part was the dessert. There is a person before the desserts who gets what you want. You see the desserts in the closed in case, like the deli section of a grocery store, but can't get it yourself like the rest of the buffet. The desserts were great! We ended up going again while we were there and had another great time! This resort is not on the strip and in a palm tree setting. Keep strolling and you will see the bowling alley, movie theater, and different fast food restaurants. The resort also has live shows like most casinos. We would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: fischman44
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Nice rooms with great views, nice casino with friendly employees, good food on premise, a movie theatre, bowling alley and nightclub. It is close to Summerlin, so is very near great golf courses. It's off the strip so its much quieter, which can be good or bad, depending on what you are looking for. The only things that weren't good was the Feast buffet and the silly policy of putting liquor in the room with sensors that charge you if they move them. Don't understand that one. I would recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best in town”
Reviews.Author: ChuckDenver
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best Casino in Vegas It is way out west but it is worth the drive. They have one of the best buffet in town , the food is alway fresh and well cooked,

Reviews.Title: “If you want the Vegas atmosphere away from the strip, great place!”
Reviews.Author: shayre21
Reviews.Content: Great resort, great food options, great atmosphere. Gives you everything that Vegas has to offer but away from all the rush of the Strip. Highly recommend this place. Did a lot of sports betting here. The staff was very friendly all over the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience”
Reviews.Author: SuperRn11
Reviews.Content: What an amazing resort! Enjoyed our stay, came to lay by the pool and relax, the pool was closed but we made do with the spa outside pool. Enjoyed the spa and amenities, staff very helpful and informative. Overall, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaKololia
Reviews.Content: Usually, we find Trip Advisor's reviews to be accurate and helpful. Not in the case of the Red Rock hotel. 5th best hotel in Las Vegas? You've got to be kidding me! We went from the Red Rock to the Palazzo, and the Palazzo is much much nicer. This is the first time I have wondered if the Trip Advisor reviews were all genuine. The hotel food is terrible. We ate at the LBS cafe and also ordered room service. Both were highly overpriced with poor quality food. Room service ($58 for two sandwiches and one glass of wine) was particularly bad. Neither my spouse nor I finished our sandwiches. After those experiences, we found a local grocery store and sustained ourselves on supermarket food for the last night of our two night stay. The surroundings are unimpressive. There is nothing interesting within walking distance of the hotel, so, unless you want to take the half hour shuttle to the strip, you are stuck with the limited variety at the hotel. On the plus side, the staff is friendly and helpful, and there is good video poker in the Casino. Rooms are nice, bathrooms are great. The only reason to stay at the Red Rock hotel is if you are going to go out to the Red Rock Canyon area (which we did, and the canyon area is truly beautiful and a wonderful place to hike.... but we could have easily driven out to the canyon from the strip, and in retrospect, I wish we had).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Charges & Managers”
Reviews.Author: V E
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is a nice property, the attitude of the floor management was terrible, they were rude to my children and family members. We had about 80 people staying at the hotel for a wedding and we will never come back. Many of the services areas opened up very late or never opened at all and it was difficult to find the servers or bartenders at times. Many of the food court helpers were not nice. Be sure to check your charges daily, they make lots of mistakes and it took us 4 or 5 calls and visits to the front desk to get resolution. I come to Vegas frequently, this was first and last time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rocking Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: This is place is fantastic. Great food, great spa, great employees, most beautiful women employees anywhere. For you gals, the men ain't bad, either. Check out the airport shuttle and USE IT! If you want a top-notch check in, use Jonathan late night. Tell him Tex sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort to Stay in Las Vegas off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Tonya F
Reviews.Content: I had lived in Las Vegas for 45 years. I got around town quite a bit. What is so wonderful about the Red Rock - really there is no reason for you to have to leave the property! It has everything a Hotel/Casino/Resort can offer. Of course if you want to leave, it is located in a Very nice area of Las Vegas! There is shopping nearby, RedRock Canyons to hike, the 215 Beltway runs close to the resort, that makes it easy to access and go anywhere including McCarran International Airport. As far as staying at the Hotel, the rooms are very spacious, including a very large Bath area which is one of my favorites!! I don't live in Las Vegas now, but I visit a few times a year and this is where I prefer to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Madhu A
Reviews.Content: The winter pool hours are very limiting and unable to use the pool outside of those hours: 10-4pm. This is difficult with kids. Furthermore, only one pool appeared heated (out of 7?? or so) and that one was for cabana-paying guests only. I did let the manager know and the hotel was going to "check the thermostat." The food, facilities, and service were otherwise highly enjoyable. If your little ones enjoy fast food, there is a large "mall-style" food court for the whole family...as well as movie theatre, bowling alley, and shuttles to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: Little far from the strip but what an excellent place to stay. Everything you need is at the resort. I can't wait to go back and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Local Las Vegas at it's best”
Reviews.Author: Lilly B
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Red Rock as often as possible - great service, great food, friendly staff and very nice spa. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are very clean. I've had the pleasure of staying at Red Rock several times a year for the past 3 or 4 years and never get tired of visiting my "home away from home". I told my husband I'd like to see our homes and buy a suite at the Red Rock - they have something for everyone. Thanks for the great memories.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mdpai79
Reviews.Content: Registration - easy and online, completed one and half months before stay. Check in - My flight was delayed getting in so, I called ahead and let them know that I would be late. The lady I spoke to told me they would block my room (a king bed room). When I arrived, the gentleman said they did not have a king bed and that I could get one tomorrow. Needless to say, my wife and I were not happy. We asked to speak with the supervisor. Instead of the supervisor coming out, the gentleman came back out from the back room and said I was upgraded to a larger room with a king at no cost. Room 3151 - This was supposed to be a larger room (upgrade). When we arrived to the room, it is the last at the end of the hall on the 3rd floor. Keep in mind elevators are on one side of the hotel, not in the middle. The room had a great view of the parking garage and a semi-erect steel structure. We weren't happy with it, but didn't complain. If the room was 5 floors up, it would have a great view. The room colors are dark with poor lighting, unless the curtains are open. The A/C was sporadic, sometimes humid and hot and other times cold. Bathroom - nice. Shower with glass door, soaker tub, double vanity. Separate toilet. Pool - closed as it was not in season. It won't open until mid March. It looks very nice. Casino - smaller than the others, but nice. They cater to locals. They have a Boarding Pass (free to sign up) that brings discounts at the restaurants. Restaurants - good, but nothing special. The buffet has a good breakfast, but not so good dinner. Business Center - they charge to use the computers and print. Not a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Red Rock Resort great..as usual”
Reviews.Author: Doool
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Red Rock..and we're planning out third! From start to finish a great stay. Terrific service, both fast food and great dining selections, wonderful casino, clean well serviced rooms with great views of red rocks or the strip. Highly recommended. Thanks Red Rock, we'll be seeing you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and unfriendly attitude can be found here”
Reviews.Author: jhagstrom
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness of the room was the first thing I noticed upon check in -- hair on the floor in the bathroom and behind the doors. Rooms are dark and lighting is rather odd. Was not told pools would be closed when making reservation directly with hotel. The staff at the Grand Cafe was probably the worst customer service experience I've had in a year. The Valet service -- call well in advance for your car -- and be prepared to wait additional time - for their excuses. Very poor attitude. All around very poor experience -- typing this as I prepare to check out. Look for people doing about as little as they can with offering the smallest amount of friendliness as they can. Conceirge attitude is quite poor too. All in all, I find it hard to believe this venue is still in business. It has great features to offer -- but it takes people to run, people who care -- and that is where they fall incredibly short.

Reviews.Title: “Dark decor, sluggish catering, quirky amenities. Not for me.”
Reviews.Author: sweetnneka
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock for a conference. The hotel was obviously built circa 2005; both the rooms and hotel decor are very dark. Imagine faux brown leather wallpaper & faux fur throw pillows on the bed. I like my rooms bright, to ensure that they are clean! The bed is on a platform, so every night I ended up scraping my ankles trying to go to the bathroom. Hot water was lukewarm at best, and the showers didn't have great water pressure. The gym was located inside the spa, and it is only open from 6am to 7pm! This was frustrating to an evening exerciser. Our event was also catered by Red Rock. Everyday, they either ran out of a food 30 minutes into service. They also had problems keeping hot water for tea during our scheduled breaks. I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is a 12 on a scale of one to ten. You guys Rock,Sweet!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: william m
Reviews.Content: From the time i pull up to valet parking until the time i leave i feel very very welcomed and at home. It makes you feel good that the bellman actually remembers me when i get there and welcomes me back. The hotel in itself is very beautiful. From the lobby to the rooms, pool area,casino,restaurants,you name it. Restaurants, everything that you can imagine, they have it.As far as the staff, these are the most friendly, attentive,and genuine bunch of people you'd ever want to meet. From the person that takes care of my room, the cocktail waitress's to the casino hosts,they're all fantastic. I recommend Red Rock everyone. Oh, and if your a golfer like myself plenty of great courses in the area,including The Arroyo at Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Vegas...hands down!”
Reviews.Author: cindysue57
Reviews.Content: If you want rowdy drunk crowds, crazy traffic, overpriced food and drinks, weirdo's clicking cards at you on the streets and slots that never pay...go to the Strip! If you want total class, room to breath, the most luxurious of hotel rooms and amenities, every food choice from affordable sandwiches (good luck with THAT on the Strip) to five star gourmet steaks, loose slots and even a fabulous movie theater, come on over to Red Rock! We stay here every chance that we get and we are never, ever dissapointed. The rooms are so large with every upgrade imagineable and the bathrooms are solid marble with a soaking tub to die for. Hmmmm...we just got back today from Red Rock and I think I'm ready to rebook again!

Reviews.Title: “Hot Spot is Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Patricia T
Reviews.Content: Really great ambiance. Very elegant decor. Gaming was great with lots of choices and all the best slots. Didn't stay the night so can't comment on the rooms but are in the Cafe twice and it is great! Great food, great service, you must try the chicken soup!!!! We really enjoyed the Red Rock and would highly recommend it to everyone! Go and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of things to do at Red Rock for the whole family!”
Reviews.Author: Kay F
Reviews.Content: I love Red Rock. Whether I want to stay there to visit family in Vegas or stay to enjoy a movie, bowl, or gamble, it is a wonderful place to stay. The rooms are big. The bathroom is beautiful and the beds are very, very comfortable. It is a great place to stay away from the strip,yet you have everything right there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Vegas experience at a world class resort.”
Reviews.Author: Captjames21
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Resort in Las Vegas was definitely an amazing experience. This property is a treat for the senses, from the moment you step foot in the lobby your senses are stimulated. The lighting, the music and smells all come together to make you feel refreshed, and alive yet comfortable. You are treated like VIP from the start. To be pampered at this resort is one of life's true luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resorts "A Jewel in Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: Dperri
Reviews.Content: If you don't take in Red Rock Resorts on your next trip to Vegas it's the wrong gamble! Our recent experience was one of the best trips to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “College softball tournament”
Reviews.Author: George D
Reviews.Content: My college women's softball team stayed recently at the Red Rock Resort. Red Rock was the host hotel for the tournament as we played in nearby Summerlin's Majestic Park. Rooms, service, and amenities make Red Rock to be a very special place to stay. We would definitely return to Red Rock next year if the tournament is held again in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: CherylH59
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa and we absolutely loved it! The hotel is gorgeous, the staff is friendly and helpful and the atmosphere is amazing. We loved the fact that it had various places to eat, the casino, a movie theatre and bowling! Plus is was close enough to the strip if you wanted to go there. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Go”
Reviews.Author: Stefan C
Reviews.Content: On my most recent visit to Las Vegas I stayed at the Red Rock and it was outstanding. Although I did not go with my family this time, I could easily see my family and I coming back to this hotel for a vacation. The atmosphere was great. The entire staff was helpful and courteous. The thing that I like the most is that even though you are away from the strip there is plenty to do. I was there for 5 days and had a blast. The casino was pretty busy but no over crowded. A couple of the restaurants were expensive but the food was outstanding. All in all this place was great

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Surprise”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect from an off the strip property but the Red Rock exceeded my expectations. I was there for a conference and the property was fantastic and had everything I needed for my 4 night stay. Conference facility were excellent and the staff was very accomodating. Both sides of the hotel offer great views of either the city lights or the sunrise on the Red Rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock ROCKS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Owen T
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Red Rock was an awesome experience. The room was a huge 500+ sq. ft. with a bathroom that was almost the size of the bedroom (love big bathrooms). The bed was extremely comfortable, rivaling any of those at other 4 and 5 star hotels on the strip. It has an "automated" toilet that will flip you out hahaha....The room was clean when we first arrived and the housekeeping staff made sure it stayed that way. I had a strip view room which was very nice, but am hoping to get the canyon view next time as I've heard it is incredible. The casino is very spacious and has a great selection of machines and tables to suit any type of gambler. They have a great selection of restaurants to choose from so you'll definitely not go hungry. All the staff, from the valet to front desk to the gambling staff are very professional without being stuffy. They'll go toe to toe with you as far as humor is concerned - very friendly, and also very helpful when you need them. I highly recommend Red Rock, and will definitely stay there again on my next trip to Vegas. Enjoy folks....it is a class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “My recent stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Rick C
Reviews.Content: This is about my 12th visit to Red Rock Casino in Vegas and each time it has been just fantastic! The rooms our modern, the beds unbelievably comfortable and the service is, well, keeps me coming back. This property is about 20 minutes from the middle of the Vegas Strip yet has all of the amenities that any other Vegas Casino has except better prices and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas Property”
Reviews.Author: caboblueheaven
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel because it was near where I had arranged appointments. I loved the hotel. The food was good, rooms great and the staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “College softball tournament”
Reviews.Author: Patty O
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Red Rock Resort for a 28-team college softball tournament. Initially the relocated 4 teams to The Station for one night which was a bit inconvenient for all of us. The Station is not in a nice part of town and parents were worried about the girls. Once everybody was back at one hotel, it was very convenient since there was plenty of food and entertainment choices for the under-21 guests. The spa is complimentary but hidden away so well that not many guests are aware of it. It's a beautiful spa. The buffett was average but I guess a good deal for the price. Valet parking was quick and the everyone from the concierge to housekeeping was helpful and knowledgeable. The pool closes at 4 pm in Feb which was a bummer for the kids since the weather was nice. The hotel is close to the fields.

Reviews.Title: “best place in las vegas to celebrate a 45th wedding anniversary”
Reviews.Author: carlotta W
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at red rock on previous visits to las vegas and have always received service that is second to none. this trip was no exception. the rooms are modern, spacious, well maintained and clean. the view is breath taking. we have always had a room facing the las vegas city lights but after seeing the mountain view i think we will request a room facing the mountain on our next visit. the staff does an outstanding job providing friendly, professional service. whether your taste is extravagant or just plain good food or fast food, you can find it at one of the many restaurants located on this property. for the most relaxing experience you must try the spa and pool. we will be returning to red rock on our next visit to las vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a beautiful stay. Service was great! And best of all everyone says hello!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisasavers1099
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views! Great staff! Awesome accomedations!!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite new location in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BizTravellers
Reviews.Content: As a California resident I have stayed at many of the hotels on the strip in Vegas. I decided to check out the Red Rock this time and will not look back. I generally have a car and can easily park at any of the hotels if I want to go exploring. The Red Rock offers a shuttle if you want to go the strip for the night. The Red Rock is beautiful and the Station Casinos players club is second to none for rewards. They have hotels closer to the strip if you want to enjoy their service as well. The front desk at the Red Rock was amazing, they handled everything I needed for the hotel. There is also a HUGE Bowling Alley and Movie Theater at the Red Rock if you need a break from the machines. I wouldn't suggest this place if you are on Vegas for vacation and want to experience the strip. If you are looking for an affordable weekend getaway, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Much better Vegas Options”
Reviews.Author: MTrav
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed in a number of Las Vegas hotels previously, both for business and pleasure. Overall, I would not recommend the Red Rock Hotel unless you have a work conference in the hotel like I did. In my mind, the biggest drawbacks of my stay were the very dim lighting my hotel room. I can tell it’s intentional as there are a number of small lights in the room, but the dark carpet and walls coupled with the dim lighting make simple tasks like looking through my clothing in the drawers difficult. And my vision is perfectly fine. I just prefer a well lit room and I thought the lighting in the room was just too “moody” to be practical. Also, I found the air circulation to be a bit stuffy all over the hotel and casino. As smoking is allowed in the bars and casino, I would expect a much better circulation system. Compared to other Vegas hotels on the Strip, the pool here is just ok. There’s nothing wrong with it, but other hotel pool areas I have seen are much larger and more extravagant. But if you are with a family, I think this hotel pool would be just fine. My other dislike of this hotel is that it’s just so isolated. There’s nothing nearby if you want to go for a walk, unless you want to walk to a strip shopping center with the usual suspects such as CVS. Assets of the hotel include T-Bones Steakhouse and Terra Rossa Italian restaurant. Both have very good food and are conveniently downstairs in the casino area. Overall, the hotel is ok if you have a work conference, but for pleasure, I couldn’t see myself having a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: MinnaVancouver
Reviews.Content: The reviews before me say it all: Best part of Las Vegas = off the Strip, near the beautiful Red Rock Canyon and nature. Peaceful, beautiful rooms, clean and modern property, great pools, excellent service and staff. Free shuttle to and from the airport. Great buffet at steal prices at Feast.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend, but not long enough!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaykayram
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Vegas to attend a family party and we needed to stay in the Summerlin area. We have stayed at the J.W. Marriott in the area years ago, so I really wanted to stay at Red Rock this time. I did some research and discovered you can get this hotel through Hotwire for around $85 per night, so that is what we did. We booked two rooms because we were traveling with our two kids plus my in-laws. When we got there we asked about connecting rooms and they offered us an upgrade to the signature suite for an additional $85 per night. We went for it and it was really nice to have the living area in between the two bedrooms and I would have felt crowded in two regular rooms with 6 people. It was basically the size of having 3 connecting rooms - a bedroom on each side and the middle living area room also had wet bar, dining table for 4 and a half bathroom. When you book through Hotwire they also hit you with a daily resort fee, which was $27.99 per night in our case and this included wi-fi. If you book directly through the hotel I think you avoid the resort fee, so you just have to see which works out to a better deal. It was still a good deal for us because the rates directly through the hotel for our dates of travel were $160 per room and we wound up paying close to that for the two bedroom suite versus just having two hotel rooms. We only stayed 3 nights and didn't get to use all the facilities of the property, but what we did get time to use was great. They have a very nice gym that we went to a few times and we always loaded up on the free bottles of water on our way out. We ate at the buffet several times because it was quick, cheap, and easy with the kids in tow. It was $6 to order a bagel from room service and $4.99 for the breakfast buffet, so kind of a no brainer to go to the buffet. It wasn't a bad buffet and for the price you really can't complain. This is a great place to stay in Vegas with kids. I only take my kids to Vegas when we are visiting family and I prefer staying off strip when I take them. This resort was great for us and I would definitely stay here again next time we take our kids to Vegas, but I still prefer the Strip area hotels for trips without kids. The only negative complaint I have is about the jacuzzi in our room. I never use jacuzzi's in hotels because I know they aren't cleaned properly, but my daughter begged and I told her I wanted to run it to clean the lines first. A ton of gross black stuff came out and of course I didn't let her use it after that. They really need to run some bleach through the jets on a periodic basis.

Reviews.Title: “There is more to Vegas than you know!!”
Reviews.Author: darlene65000
Reviews.Content: 11 miles from the strip, close to the mountains.you will find tone of he best that Vegas has to offer. Actually it is not in Vegas, it is in Summerlin. The accomodations and the service are impeccable. You start your trip by being picked up at the airport by a complimentary shuttle. Once at the hotel, check in is always speedy. Your room is beautiful and has a greatr view of the surrounding mountains. In the warmer weather DO NOT MISS THE POOL. The chaise lounges are in the shallow water of the pool. There are also circular beds for soaking in the sun or just relaxing.with a drink from one of the many waiters. Sometimes their are shows held at the pool area,,. sometimes there are weddings or private functions and the pool area may be closed for a few hours in the evening. The food choices are immense. Everything from a food court,to a steak house called the "Chop House". They have a wonderful buffet very reasonable priced, except the champaagne brunch on the wwekend. But it is still worth it with all the variety of foods available. The casino has a wonderful variety of all the latest slots. If you are not a slot player, You will find one of the best sport books in all of Vegas. There is also a Bingo hall.. The table games range from $5 to ???. It is not difficult most of the times to find a $5-$10 table. If you would like a complete break from gambling (or if you travel with children) there is a movie theater and an arcade to keep you occupied. The One BIGGEST DRAWBACK I have found IS.....If your room is not comped, they have a $24.99 a day surcharge added to the daily room rate. You will find many offers, including free play and free rooms and buffets if you are a player at the casino. Lastly, if you are staying on the strip and would like to check out the "Red Rock", there is a free shuttle that departs from the Fashion Show Mall. Wait on the north side you will see a couple differnt shuttles departing from there. check it out first, play a little and maybe next time you go out to Vegas, you might decide to stay

Reviews.Title: “Best Graduation Hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: tiara b
Reviews.Content: I had this best graduation weekend getaway with my friends staying in this hotel. The pool is amazing, the spa is fantastic and the food is delicious. The rooms were roomy and comfortable and big enough for all of us. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Something Has Gone Wrong”
Reviews.Author: Keving2009
Reviews.Content: Four years ago I stayed at the Red Rock for a conference where I was presenting. I was there for four days and the service was definitely five star along with the rooms. The rooms are still good but the service has gone south. If I owned this hotel, I would definitely figure out what management changes have been made in the past four years and change them back. It's gone from staff being proud and passionate to just doing their job. Four years ago when you said "thank you" the response from every employee was "our pleasure". I've recommended this property to so many people...but not any more. From check in, to bar service, to restaurant bar service it was like they all wished they were somewhere else (and so did I). My fiance and I escorted some friends to there car and sat down in the lobby. I had may arm around her, and gave her a few kisses, when Andrew the security guy comes up and tells us to "take it to our room". I called for his manager and she supported him. They said our behavior was "inappropriate" where I invited them to visit some of the other public areas of the casino to witness some really "inappropriate" behavior. I'm always amazed when properties like this will sell you as many drinks as you can consume at $12 a pop and then they want to hold you to account on your behavior. The next morning on our way out we go to the Starbucks and ask for soy milk to add to our coffee. My fiance is told it will cost $.75 extra. We inform them that Starbucks never charges us...ever! In a snippy voice the Starbucks employee informs us that this Starbucks is owned by the casino and they make their own rules (say no more). While I'm getting the car, my fiance overhears a customer complain that his latte is cold. The same employee roles her eyes at him and in a snarly voice says, "fine, do I have to make you another one?" I'd be concerned if I was Starbucks. The rooms are great and the pool area and spa are a sensation, but I'll never be able to get my fiance back to this property as she felt she was treated like a second class citizen. If you can get a 2 star rate, it's worth a visit, but I can guarantee they will lose their five star rating if there isn't a huge change in management. My suggestion to the owners of Red Rock (in case they excuse themselves by thinking that they can't get good help in Las Vegas) is to go stay at the Mandarin Oriental for a couple of nights and observe how a five star hotel is properly run...it will bring back memories for you on how the Red Rock use to be.

Reviews.Title: “They have it all, skip the strip n hit their spa, oh the spa, the spa, ahhhh...”
Reviews.Author: jstark
Reviews.Content: Ok, 4 outta of 5 star because their computers kept forgetting my room rate special I booked on their website n spa discount they emailed to me. They did fix every error calmly n very kindly, but I do not like the stress of catching $75-$400 errors more than once! Unheard of for me, but i've been to Vegas only once (stayed at The Hotel at Mandolay Bay, which had everything as well). However, everything else at Red Rock was so awesome, that when I return to Vegas I will book again. Read the traveler tips, they r useful. And Heather their concierge was outstanding, she took care of us more than we knew we needed! She knows the definition of VACAY! The room was very luxe, quiet n comfy, loved the robes n bathroom! The resort had so many restaurant n bar options, all good food! Entertainment, we saw acoustic singer, bands, dj--all fantastic! So much going on, we didn't get to see it all. Bowling n theatre looked great but we didn't use. Gambling, we r not big gamblers, but could tell they have some serious ones here. Plenty of options, machines, tables, sports, etc--huge!! What I liked best is when I did gamble, workers there treated me with utmost courtesy, impressive! The pool is incredible, n I could see spending entire days out there, it's a wow. BUT the spa pool was the most relaxing one I have ever been too, a sweet lil quiet oasis, unbelieveable, if u need to relax, this is it! And it was the best spa I have ever been to, by far. We had planned to just stay here whole weekend n that is what we did n loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jemal75
Reviews.Content: Red Rock casino resort is one of my favorite places in Vegas. Best place to relax with great outdoors, beautiful pool with mountain views.Excellent food choices, Feast buffet is the one of the top Las Vegas buffets, but always long line to get in

Reviews.Title: “Beware of HIDDEN RESORT FEES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa F
Reviews.Content: I just made a reservation to stay at this resort in August. Then I get an e-mail telling me that there is a resort fee of $24.99 per night + applicable taxes at 12%. WHAT??? That makes this hotel is not a good deal for the $. I called customer service and the man was rude telling me, "Sorry, but you should have read the website more carefully and opened all of the terms and conditions windows." Then he told me it is non-refundable so he would see us in August. Now I am NOT looking forward to even staying here anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the strip - but still first class”
Reviews.Author: gershl00
Reviews.Content: This facility is a fifteen to twenty minute ride from the strip and downtown areas, but is really on par with almost every property and better than many of them. The rooms are beautiful, modern, and very tastefully and well furnished. Real nice TV's [including a small one in the bathroom for viewing while relaxing in the tub].

Reviews.Title: “Nice casino off the strip”
Reviews.Author: MA250
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Rock Casino for a business meeting. Great pool area and I liked checking in without going through the casino. I'm not a gambler so I can comment on that. I wish they had better ventilation in the casino; it was smoky. There are several restaurants, a bowling alley with 60+ lanes and 16 screen movie theater. I saw too many kids going to the movies waiting in a smoky, casino noise area; didn't like that.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: IrvineBeary
Reviews.Content: For a break from the strip area Red Rock Resort is the place to stay and you'll feel like a local. The dealers at the tables are very friendly and take time to explain the games like 3-Card Bonus, Let It Ride Bonus and 4-Card Poker. This self contained resort has been our alternative to the main strip area for the last 5 years. The Resort has a great variety of restaurants including the best buffet in Vegas. Get your boarding pass & you'll have access to lower room rates and free comps as your points mount up. Take the time to explore the beautiful Red Rock Canyon area and you'll find great photo op vistas just a mile down Charleston Blvd. Families activities can be enjoyed from the great pool, enjoy the Regal movie theaters or just go to the bowling centers which are all located within the Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the second visit”
Reviews.Author: manatee181
Reviews.Content: Absolutely nowhere else I would ever want to stay in Vegas. Excellent food choices for all the price ranges and tons to do! I love the spa area, totally worth the resort charge. The service is excellent everywhere and the accomodations are top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Room-price haggling. Are you kidding me?!”
Reviews.Author: reluctant_travels
Reviews.Content: I am a Vegas local and my boyfriend and I booked to stay at Red Rock for 2 nights over Valentine's Day because of the close proximity to my workplace. Upon check-in, I was disappointed when the lady at the front desk informed me that the king bed we booked online was unavailable and they only had rooms with 2 queens left. She offered that I can upgrade to a king suite for a "discounted" $50 a night which I reluctantly accepted. I've never stayed at this hotel before and have only been at the casino to check out restaurants or go for happy hour. I've heard good things about the hotel so I was really surprised and annoyed when I discovered that my room was in the farthest end of the hallway of almost 60 rooms which makes for the longest walk to get to any hotel room, in my experience. I was cursing whoever designed this elevator/room layout as I was making the long trek to the room. Ah, the room. It was definitely spacious. So spacious that it appeared all the furniture was pushed towards the window, leaving a dance-floor-sized empty space between the bed and bathroom. If this was their handicap-accessible room, they have succeeded in the fact that you could park a dozen wheelchairs in this space. I assessed the room and decided it was not worth paying an extra $50 per night. It was essentially the regular king-size room furniture thrown into a large space. I was now highly annoyed when I called the front desk and the same lady answered. She was nice enough to move us back to the 2-queen bedroom. But before that, she actually offered to lower the luxury king price from $50 extra/night to $35. Seriously? She was trying to haggle with me? This made me realize that she could've probably given us the crappy king-size room at no extra charge in the first place. So chintzy. This kind of service does not deserve the 4-diamond award.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Mystic_in_a_Kilt
Reviews.Content: My Ragnar Team was able to get a couple of rooms there after the Ragnar Las Vegas Relay. Most of the team took off to the strip after the race, so my wife and I took one of the rooms for ourselves. I’ve stayed in a couple of the larger Hotels on the Vegas Strip, and I have to tell you, I’d go back to the Red Rock before any of the others. The rooms are clean, the beds are fantastic, and our room had a big soaking tub with a TV. I’ll tell you, checking in there after running across the desert for 27 hours was a wonderful experience. Yes, it was a bit of a drive to get back to I-15 the next day, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A way-off strip casino - glossy on the outside”
Reviews.Author: Sionel
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at this hotel for business reasons so didn't really get much chance to experience the casino side of things. As a standalone hotel, it's okay but nothing exceptional. It has all the facilities you'd expect of a hotel with this kind of rating, but it is not the easiest of places to navigate. While the rooms themselves are spacious, comfortable and clean there are elements within the place that can drive you absolutely nuts; the lifts, for one. For a hotel of this size to have so few lifts (and for the three days I was there, 33% of those lifts were locked on a a single floor and never moved), and for the lifts to be so haphazard in how they function, is bewildering. The lifts would often take up to five minutes to show up at your floor and then, despite suggesting they'd go in the direction you wanted them too, they go where they chose, stopping at every floor regardless of whether the buttons were pressed of not. This is annoying enough when you're not in a rush - when you have a meeting to attend and it takes ten minutes just to get in and out of the lifts, it's incredibly frustrating. Given the attached casino, there's not shortage of places to eat, and all are of a good quality too - having eaten at T-Bones (meat grill), Terra Rossa (Italian) and Grand Cafe (good breakfast stuff), I can say that what was served was of a high quality and that service in all three places was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebiz
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a convention. That's why we were there. Nice meeting rooms, except the elevators did not work properly. Usually only a couple working and for some reason they would stop on every floor. The rooms are dark inside. Hotel was responsive and brought up a floor lamp which really helped. The shower is small. The slot machines were tight, so it was a long drive to the Strip to see shows and play at other hotels (of course that is probably why they are so far away. They do have a lot of restaurants that run the gamut of prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property... Accomodating... Upscale Luxury”
Reviews.Author: pbath50
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Red Rock many times. It is a true resort that is located by Red Rocks State Park with amazing views. We have enjoyed concerts by the pool, bowling, movies and many of their fine eateries. Relaxing atmosphere with great gaming choices.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jarasta
Reviews.Content: If you have to spend time in Vegas this place is a sure bet. Close to Red Rock NRL to the west and far away from the strip to the east this place is an oasis. An adequate buffet (started out as a great one), a Yard House beer paradise (150+ kegs of world beers), and a very interesting Japanese restaurant get you fed well. Avoid The Bones Steakhouse unless you are a Carnivore exclusively. The pools outside are pleasant with incredible wait staff although the hot tubs are not hot enough. Great convention area and an airport bus free of charge allows us to sleep and ride on our way abroad. The spa is nice, but Green Valley's (a sister resort 30 miles to the southeast) is far superior. As for the casino, "if you've seen one you've seen them all..."

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: TheSixHotelhardbed
Reviews.Content: I've stayed and played in many of Vegas's hotels and casinos. For the best comfort and environment Red Rock is for me. Well kept grounds and when showing off Vegas to Friends it's probably the most impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock rocks”
Reviews.Author: TanG68
Reviews.Content: It was so refreshing to stay out at the Red Rock Resort. We'd stayed in Vegas a couple of times before, always on The Strip, so it was nice to be away from the craziness and see a little bit more of the place. The free shuttle was very reliable. At the airport I think we had to find an elevator to go downstairs from the arrivals/baggage hall and we just asked a helpful attendant to find where it would pull up. You can't miss the red shuttle though. Times are on the website. The rooms at the resort were GORGEOUS: Stylish, modern, spacious. The bathrooms were huge with a shower and a bath and there was a tv over the bath. However, ours didn't seem to work. We had a Strip-view room which we chose because we stayed over New Year's Eve and kinda new, that with an 8 year old we wouldn't be on The Strip at midnight to see the fireworks. They were pretty impressive even from our distant viewpoint and would have been sensational up closer. But at least we had a quiet night, uninterrupted by revellers. We were on the Strip earlier in the day, but returned to Red Rock on the last shuttle of the day at around 5.40pm, due to the strip closing at 6pm for the festivities. We had dinner at Red Rock at the Yard House. The were lots of other great eating options at the resort. We had an excellent burger the first night and Mexican the night after new year's eve. For breakfast, there is a foodcourt with a Starbucks which we had out by the gorgeous pool area. New years' day we saw a move at the resort's cinema, booked our daughter in at the Kid's play club for an hour and went Ten pin bowling that afternoon. Overall, a great place, I think for a family holiday or romantic getaway. Very stylish place.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: the1queenca
Reviews.Content: I have always loved to gamble here, and then I had the opportunity to stay at the hotel. I walked in, and since there was a line, someone came to direct me to the VIP area. What a great thing that was. We were able to have our own elevator to our rooms, and as many trips to the VIP lounge for coffee, and sodas as we wanted. They bent over backwards to make our stay awesome! I get comp'd rooms a lot on the strip; but this is by far the best one I have ever had. I love the cleanliness of the rooms, the casino is one of my favorites because you don't smell the smoke, and it is always clean. We make many trips to Las Vegas in a year, and we can't wait to come back to the Red Rock..

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock view”
Reviews.Author: sherrie1012
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time staying at Red Rock. Beautiful location away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. They have everything on the premises from movies, bowling and great restaurants. Their rooms are large, clean and decorated tastefully. Awesome pool area. Fabulous sushi at Hachi. Hope to see you at the blackjack tables.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock rocks...without the Strip”
Reviews.Author: WhineyTraveler
Reviews.Content: A real pleasure to be wanted at a major hotel, the staff and accommodations were superb, and very accessible. The shuttle will whisk you to/from the Strip, but most every amenity can be found in the Hotel. Don't miss the Midnight to 6 AM All-Nighter cafe specials; great breakfasts early and inexpensive. And the Happy Hour at T Bones Restaurant stuffs you with bar menu specials and huge drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort and casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Colleen L
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Vegas was made even more fun because we stayed at Red Rock. We stayed for six nights and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel is beautifully designed. The modern mix of natural elements definitely has the wow factor. The guest rooms are equally beautiful. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We ate most of our meals at the hotel. The food is delicious at all of the restaurants. We especially like the Grand Cafe, which is always open. The casino is huge, clean and offers more slots and games than than most casinos in Vegas. I can't say enough about how nice the employees are and the service we were given. We did visit other casinos while we were in Vegas, but couldn't wait to get back to Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Tom B
Reviews.Content: We needed a weekend away, wanted a show on the strip but didn't want to stay there - what a great solution. This is a great, clean property with all of the strip's services and quality but with an added bonus: a view of the strip or of Red Rock Canyon. Out the door and in the canyon for three hikes early on Saturday morning, down to the strip for dinner and a show Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent excellent-THE BEST RESORT IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: Cristine L
Reviews.Content: Went with family, great place to bring your children, they have activities and restaurants for the kids as well. The restaurants were A1, the food was amazing everywhere we went on this resort, hotel service was A1, super clean, NO BED BUGS, beautiful rooms, spectacular view of the mountains, just a gorgeous place. Another thing I will stress, ALL EMPLOYEES were not only extremely helpful, but they were extremely friendly and professional. There are no words to describe the friendliness, and I never held a door open for myself, they literally run to hold a door for you. The Red Rock is literally another planet, it's indescribable, many people in the customer service industry should learn from these very people. Not one person there ever frowned! Not one frown, nor huff and puff, it was incredible. They also have a shuttle bus service that brins you to and from the Vegas strip. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Away from all the Hustle”
Reviews.Author: rlb924
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Red Rock Casino Hotel. The place is absolutely beautiful and clean. If you want Las Vegas class with out Las Vegas crouds this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “TOP OF THE LINE”
Reviews.Author: GARYCHRISTINA
Reviews.Content: This property in Las Vegas is well of the strip. It offers wonderful very large rooms with views of the strip but far enough away from the normal... From the moment you check into this hotel you know that it is different....Since it is winter the pool was closed, but on previous visit in the spring I can attest tot he fact that it is one of the nicest....There are great high end restaurants ( we loved TBone ) as well as the normal buffett which is also very much better than the average ones on the strip...The sportsbook was a little smokey, but it was the Super Bowl so it was much busier than usual....A great place to stay !!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Resort off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiigirll
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here in the winter and the summer. The pool area is wonderful during the summertime. During the winter it closes at 4 pm. I would have liked to enjoyed the jacuzzi. I believe you can use the indoor one in the spa but I believe it closes at 6 pm. This is one of the ammentities your resort fee covers. There is a shuttle that takes you to the strip until 9 pm. Another perk for your resort fee. I was surprised that the resort fee increased from $25 to $27 a night. I suggest you use the gym, read your newspaper, use the Internet and take the shuttle to the strip. That way you will not feel like they added extra cost to your room. This is why I gave it a 4 and not a 5. Although that extra expense the rooms are nice and the staff is very friendly. Especially the new bartender Parker. If you have a chance have him make you a Mojito or a fresh Margarita.

Reviews.Title: “Smoke Smell is Horrid”
Reviews.Author: Heatherpdx
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days here for a work trip. When I checked in, I was assured that my room was non-smoking. My room reaked of smoke.. I know this is Vegas, but really? I came back to my room, and the housekeeper had left my door open. The food was okay, it is about a $50 cab ride from here to the strip...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference location”
Reviews.Author: Giumesciscotti
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference at the hotel and had a great experience. Everything I needed was in the hotel and casino, so I only had to leave if I wanted to sight-see. The pool area was awesome! The room was very clean, stylish, and roomy, and I had a great view of the pool and the red rocks.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is the best "Strip" hotel and casino not on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Jbtraveler64
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, casino and hotel. A Grand Hotel feel with the coziness of a smaller hotel. This must be what old Vegas was really like.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corky12
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights and we liked it but did not love it. It is very expensive for what you get. We bought a restaurant pakage and it is limited with your choices. The rooms were nice but we just came from Green Valley Ranch and they were equal and we paid alot less there. I expected it to be really fancy to go along with the prices but it wasn't. It is in a good location to explore Red Rock Canyon but kind of far from Vegas. We didn't use the pool because it was too cool but it looked nice. The food was just OK at the buffet , Asian restaurant and Mexican restaurant. All in all if you need to choose between Green Valley or Red Rock- choose Green Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Employees -- Great Property”
Reviews.Author: pelkeyw
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull into the valet area, both hotel and casino, you are greeted with a smile and a big hello. They always ask if you need directions within the casino and wish you good luck, along with having a great time. The Bell staff were also very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable with a great view of Red Rock. The bathrooms are large and have everything a person could need. I have stayed there twice and the level of guest service both times have exceeded my expectations. The casino has a variety of machines, I never felt like I had to go anywhere else to find some fun machines to play, I also love the Bingo room.

Reviews.Title: “4 star room / 2 star service”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: I attended a 4 day conference at the property with approx 500 attendees. The check-in process was a train-wreck. No formal line, just jump in the blob of other guest. When i was next up the agent decided it was break time, logged out and left ( seeing all guest were lined up five deep across the counter). After approximatley five minutes a new agent arrived, when asked about the king room i was informed that is only a request and they are first come first served. Given it was 3:30 (30 min after check-in starts), seems odd. I was given a room with two beds facing the mountains/pool. The rooms are well appointed and a feature a large bathroom. The TV in the bathroom was not working, turns out it wasn't even connected to the cable. The A/C was not cooling properly, however a quick call to the front desk and it was repaired within an hour. I wanted to like the hotel but the entire stay was good service and then terrible service ( carried over to the restaurants i visited as well). With other choices nearby that provide a higher level of service for a similar price i will not be backing.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best OF Them ALL!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: When my husband Michael and I first learned about Red Rock thru my brother and sister inlaw we said how good and exciting could it be (a casino away from the Vegas strip). How wrong we were. Its lights, cameras and plenty of action. Have not considered another place to stay when I often visit Red Rock with my entire family of 14. often we travel with the 14 family members including kids and they like the adaults cannot wait tto stay in the beautiful rooms and the great views. Six are grand children and there is always plenty of excitement for them. The staff and house cleaning crews are always friendly and ready to service you. Thanks to my brother and sister in-law Red Rock is The wonder of them all. See You Soon Red Rock. Michael and I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: bigbob60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Red Rock Resort January 20th through 23rd. I had stayed here on two other occasions, but this was the first visit for my wife. We had a king room on the 15tj floor overlooking the pool and Red Rock Canyon. Bed was very comfortable and large bathroom had a separate shower and soaking tub. Extremely nice amenities. We used the fitness center which had a nice variety of machines. There was a separate sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, and cold plunge in the men and women's locker rooms. My wife also had a massage, which she really enjoyed. Enjoyed blackjack, slots and my wife even took in some bingo. Good variety of restaurants. Plenty to do here, including a bowling alley and movie theater. Very enjoyable stay all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie C
Reviews.Content: The staff here are the nicest! We dropped a $20 bill when we played the roulette tables and the dealer found us hours after and returned it to us. Then, when were checking out, I forgot my pillow in our room. A gentleman was helping another room loading their luggage, and he was nice enough to let me back into the room to get it. The hotel and rooms are beautiful. Definitely a great place to stay if you want to stay away from the busy strip. Lots of things to do (bowling and movie theater) and good selection of restaurants. The only bad thing I have to say is the long hallways to the rooms. We got a room on the far end, very long walk from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure near Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQandMamama
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa IS a hidden treasure! Everything you need is right there! From the moment we drove up to Valet, we felt so welcomed. And, it didn't stop there! All staff we came in contact with really wanted to be there and wanted to help wherever they could. Beautiful hotel, rooms, casino, restaurants - oh, did I mention the rooms? Our room was absolutely beautiful - the bathroom so spacious - the beds so comfortable! We had an amazing dinner at Cabo's - and, you cannot beat The Grand Cafe for breakfast, lunch or dinner! Quality service and food! We are looking forward to going back in March! Can't wait to try the Steakhouse....

Reviews.Title: “Nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: TreasureMe007
Reviews.Content: Over the past two months I have come to make Red Rock my place to run a way from home. The rooms are very spacious and nicely decorated. I love that the rooms a placed close enough to the casino to go out, but far enough away that you don't hear or see all of what goes on.
