Not that you get any of the riff-raff that goes on at some of the strip hotels. NOT even close. Everything from the staff at the hotel, to the casino and mot of the restaurants...stay away from the cafe until they get new management. Everything is absolutely beautiful. T-bones Steak house is one of the best in the city. Yardhouse is always a hit with my hubsand. the beer is always great and the service is always exceptiona./ Red Rock has everything that anyone could need for a relaxing get away, even a spa and fitness room. What more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Sshigdon
Reviews.Content: The entire experience was amazing, especially the service and the pit bosses!

Reviews.Title: “For the best stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: MrXterra
Reviews.Content: Enjoy vegas a few miles off the strip for a great hotel, great restaurants, casino, pool and more. Alot of Vegas hotels are a nightmare, long check in lines, crowds, bad designs with long narrow corridors, blah blah blah. Red rock is really a nice place, with seriously good food and service, really nice rooms and reasonable rates. So if you don't mind being a few miles away from the glitz and glamour you will be rewarded.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful all in one resort”
Reviews.Author: perkinscat
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Vegas. Stayed off the strip for two nights then went to the Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa because of my husband's work for two nights. We had our two boys with us. Great place. The room are very modern and the bathroom is very nice. All the wait staff is wonderful. I think my favorite thing is you don't have a do not disturb sign but you push a button to tell the staff not to disturb you. Very handy when I went to the gym and the boys were still sleeping. You either have a view of the mountains or the strip. Can't go wrong. Rooms can be a hike from the elevators. Also the gym only allows guests over the age of 18, bummer when you have a 16 year old who wants to work out. It has a movie theater, a bowling alley,a food court and a game arcade for the family to enjoy. I wish the whole place was non smoking. The floor we stayed on was but you could still smell the smoke from the whole place. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great casino/resort experience”
Reviews.Author: Ted B
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights, would certainly return; didn't want to be along busy strip area. so easy to get to anywhere in West LV if have own car from hotel, but shuttle service was nice too, but doesn't run late. Restaurants are all seriously great, like 10 of them(we ate in 5)in their own right and a food court was a nice touch. The rooms and baths were very spacious and modern, comfortable bed, great TV. Did not get to use pool due to weather, but seemed like nice layout. Casino layout takes a few trips through to get it down, and sports book was very accommodating and fairly large for being in the 'burbs. Bowling alley, Cineplex, brewpub were nice bonus amenities. View of red rock hills is beautiful. Staff all seemed very helpful to most all our needs, except front desk on a minor snafu at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Fav hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Drabiu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two years ago for a conference. The hotel is beautiful. The spa is awesome! My boyfriend and I will be back in March!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SweetAl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are average. Nothing special. Asked to be moved because of noisy people in the next room. No response from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “I'll up it to 4 -- for the rooms”
Reviews.Author: lexi1980
Reviews.Content: Am I the only person who got lost for 20 minutes after being dropped off by first part of casino and then trying to find check-in desk? Whoa..This place is confusing to get around. Rooms are only 1 room unlike other nice hotels on the Strip but they are huge, with great sleek decor and the bathroom is beautiful. Great lighting in the rooms and huge flat screen. Good fitness center and with the resort fee they let you use the relaxation room in the spa without paying for a service. Nice! That was the best part. But then the loud hyenas came storming in… 8 women on some sort of girl’s trip. The workers did nothing to quiet them down. The relaxation feeling was impossible once they arrived. And beware the locker door – awkward design- banged my elbow badly. No ice pack or help from front desk with this. Front desk help – not the best.

Reviews.Title: “NFL Playoff Weekend”
Reviews.Author: CHRIS B
Reviews.Content: Great property, wonderful location, lots to do and see. Red Rock National Park is right up the street as well. Would strongly suggest a stay at this Hotel. Very freindly associates and the spa and restaurants are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Red Rock as little get-away and had a great time. The rooms are large, well appointed, and very comfortable. The casino offers all types of gaming and a nice variety of bars. The selection of restaurants is great. The buffet is very nice, not just your standard buffet. We also enjoyed Terra Rosa. The atmosphere there is elegant, the service is great, and the prices are reasonable. We highly recommend Red Rock for a great Vegas experience without the insanity of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay off the strip..Relaxing and fun!”
Reviews.Author: WKC3
Reviews.Content: We love this place! My wife and I spend our anniversary in Vegas each year, usually at one of the nicer strip hotels. I contacted the concierge at Red Rock after seeing the rates of the strip hotels during the Consumer Electronics Show in Jan. (None of my casino hosts could help me out either!) Johann answered all my questions via email and convinced me to try Red Rock. We upgraded to a Signature Suite at check-in and fell into the lap of luxury on the 17th floor facing east with a beautiful eveninv view of the strip. Beautiful accomodations and the bath was spectacular. By far, the friendliest staff we've experienced in Las Vegas, starting with the concierge to the valet, check-in, housekeeping, and even the bartender at T-Bones (watched the Alabama vs. LSU game). After 2 days, even the valet knew me by name! The blackjack dealers were friendly and fun, and the craps table was like a party! There's a Starbuck's 50 feet from the guest elevators on the casino level for that morning jolt to get you started. Well equipped fitness center. Beautiful pool and cabanas, but chilly in January...maybe in July :-). While we went to the strip to see Celine Dion, there is plenty to do at the resort. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty entertaining”
Reviews.Author: James_in_MT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a week long conference on the strip. We wanted to unwind with some personal time here. The location of Red Rocks is off strip. It takes approx. 20 minutes to get to the strip area. The good: 1. Trendy. It is a modern, trendy hotel all the way through. 2. Resort. Movie theater, bowling, casino, restaurants, pool/spa. There is something to do here for you. We went to a movie, hit the casino and had some great food. Great restaurants inside with good selections. 3. Location. Great off-strip location. Close to great hiking in Red Rocks Canyon if you want some outdoor activities to do. 4. Friendly dealers. Dealers and staff seem to like their job and were friendly/chatty. They weren't stuck up like many other casinos on the strip. Lots of locals playing here, got a lot of Vegas knowledge while sitting with them. Interesting. 5. Pool is open in January. A lot of hotels shut down their pools in the winter. The pools were open, but unheated. The spas were on and heated. Nice pool area with lots of pools available. We visited in the winter, so we underutilized it. Would be great in warmer months. 6. Trendy room, large tv, good water pressure and warm water. 7. Easy parking, not a long walk. A bonus in Vegas for those with tired legs from the Strip. 8. Close to other restaurants in the vicinity. 9. Casino games easy access. No waiting on a busy night to get a table. 10. Conference area. Large venue for conferences. I would go there or host a conference here. The bad: 1. No coffee maker in the room. For having a $20+ resort tax, there should be free coffee and a coffee maker in the room. There is a Starbucks downstairs to save the day, but not if you have an early flight, it wasn't open yet, doh! 2. For having a $20+ resort tax, there should be free water. Even Trump Tower had two free waters a day. You had to purchase it in-room if you wanted it from the pressure sensitive device. 3. Long walk down a long hall to get to the room. Needed a Segway or bicycle to get to the room. 4. Doors were loud shutting. Second hotel in a row with loud, heavy doors. 5. Room cost. Nice resort, but a little spendy/overpriced compared to other strip locations with similar ratings, especially with the resort tax. 6. Winter pool hours. Open from 10 am-4pm. Would like to use the warm spa at night. 7. Spa/hot tub was heated, but on the cooler side. Could have been heated up another 5-10 degrees. One of the spas/hot tub's jets were not working at all. 8. Parking garage music is inordinately loud. Is there a reason for blaring music? 9. Boarding passes. For having a $20+ resort tax, printing a boarding pass should be included. They cost $5 to print in the business center. Others may find it kid friendly, but you have to bring kids through the smoky casino to reach kid friendly activities...Leave the kids at home whilst in Vegas. Did not get a chance to use the fitness center. Overall, a good place to go off strip. We are going to return, perhaps with another couple for a quick get-a-way.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Four Star Resort with Panoramic Views of Las Vegas Finest”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl H
Reviews.Content: Upscale Four Star Resort with all the excitement of the Las Vegas Strip. No crowds, but still the thrills. This Resort is self contained, pleasure awaits to those who stay at the Red Rock! Entertainment for all ages. I have stayed at the Red Rock on several occasions never having been disappointed in rooms appearance. This is absolutely a Four Star Resort! You will not be disappointed by all it has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way!”
Reviews.Author: cindysk
Reviews.Content: Loved this resort! We stayed for 3 nights for our daughter's soccer tournament. The minute you walk into the lobby it is first class from the valet to the hotel clerk to the bell hop...all extremely polite and helpful. We liked that the lobby is completely separate from the casino area, a different level completely. The non casino areas are very friendly for families. Great kids zone with arcade and bowling alley, movie theater. The casino has a non-smoking area, but the casino as a whole was not that smoky compared to other casinos in Vegas. The rooms are beautifully appointed large. Beds extremely comfortable. The rooms are designed so that the doors are offset from the main hallways, much reducing noise from other guests. The bathrooms are WOW. All marble with great deep soaking tubls and big! Our view was on the 14th floor overlooking the Las Vegas Strip in the far distance. My husband and I both had massages at the spa.....we have been to many and this spa was 5 star. The therapists were top and the spa itself was wonderfully appointed. Large changing area, with great amenities to get ready. Big jacuzzi, rain shower, cold plunge. Dry and wet saunas.....great lounge waiting area. The gym is great as well. Also a great lap pool that is heated. We had our meals at the Grand Cafe and the food and service was top notch. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit to Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: bahamaman5
Reviews.Content: My family (two adults, one 9 year old) traveled to Red Rock. Let me describe why we choose Red Rock the first time, and why we elected to return. In a word, it offers the perfect combination of kid-friendly activities, excellent restaurants, and extensive gaming. We don't really have the ability to go to Vegas without our son, and so I had been searching for a hotel that would have something to offer to all of us. Some friends recommended Red Rock, and we promptly booked a Signature Suite. The advantage of this room is that it allows our son to have his own room (rollaway provided without charge) and bathroom, while offering similar levels of privacy for parents. On this return trip, I wasn't seeing any availability for each of our four nights, so I took a chance and called one of the Hotel's Casino Hosts. While we are certainly not big gamblers, he was able to find a Signature Suite at a price that easily bested what the Hotel offered on-line. On the first day, we rented a car from Enterprise (which happened to have a rental car on property). We explored Red Rock Canyon (incredibly beautiful, and a short drive away), then did some horseback riding at Bonnie Springs Ranch (again, very close by, and fun for kids). This was our pattern most days, spending time with our son during the day (and with a bowling alley, a multi-screen movie theater, and an arcade, there is certainly enough to keep parents and kids well entertained!) and reserving the evening hours for us. During the evenings, our son would go to the Kids Quest (on property) while we enjoyed dinner and gaming. A couple of things to note about Kids Quest: your child(ren) cannot stay more than five hours per day and they ask you to bring your child's shot records. We found the Kids Quest to be very competently run, and was much beloved by our son. We ate at Hachi (twice), T-Bones (steak) and Terra (Italian). Our favorite (just barely) is Hachi, which we feel is one of the top sushi restaurants we've ever experienced. At Terra, we opted to eat at the bar and limited ourselves to appetizers, which were uniformly excellent. Our last night was at T-Bones, which we loved. My wife's Filet Mignon and my lamb were both prime cuts and wonderful. I would like to report that we were successful at the table games, but that was certainly not the case. It was a total washout. Even so, we would return to Red Rocks in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very well done”
Reviews.Author: letucker
Reviews.Content: pool area was wonderful, spa was fantastic. Lovely room, everything was safe and secure. Who needed the strip?

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stockjock26
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock has something for everyone. The movie theaters, bowling alley, food court, and arcade make this a favorite destination for the whole family. For those with young children, KidsQuest is fantastic. A very safe fun play space with a basketball court, I-Pad station, food service, ball pit, etc....My son loves it and after I drop him off we can go to the Spa, gamble, or see a movie. The hotel is also beautiful. The dark wood gives everything an elegant look. The casino is also excellent. There are a ton of slot and video poker machines so you can always find something to play. I would recommend this hotel/casino to anyone, but especially those with a family who want the best of both worlds...a family vacation with some adult fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Edward G
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay from the minute we got there. Staff was very nice and got us right in our room. Enjoyed the LBS Hamburger resturant. Ate thier twice. Loved the sports book. Overall we had a very relaxing stay had a lot of fun.Will return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great way to start 2012”
Reviews.Author: mheaps19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Rock over New Year's and had a great time. We go to Las Vegas 3-4 times a year and always stay at the Red Rock Casino and Resort. We love the weather in Las Vegas and the Red Rock is far enough off the "Strip" to just relax and enjoy Las Vegas. We feel it offer's everything you need when going to Las Vegas. Friendly staff, beautiful pool, a choice from economical to elegant dining experiences and the casino and sports betting staff couldn't be nicer. The airport and "Strip" shuttle is a plus as well. The room TV could be upgraded along with adding NFL Sunday ticket but that doesn't stop us from choosing this hotel. Try the Yard House restaurant.....with their on site crafted beer's, it's a blast!!! Hope to see you at the Red Rock in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Rock Resort Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: qbgrimes
Reviews.Content: Whenever I have to be in Las Vegas for business, I choose the Red Rock. It's close to my office, so I don't have to fight the Strip traffic, and everything I need is in one place. I can eat my breakfast & evening meals in their 5-star restaurants without having to leave the building, and when I'm ready to let down my hair with a little bit of slot machines and bingo, it's all right there. When I'm not ravenous, I can catch a quick snack at the Food court. If I don't feel like gambling, I can go to the movies. Everything is first class, and the service staff treats you like royalty!! This is my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Vicki B
Reviews.Content: Great restaurants, clean - clean - clean rooms! Pillows,pillows and more pillows make my night wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great little kick it spot”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: I would generally come here for Drinks and social hangouts. I Have never won a dime in this place, EVER! but maybe that was just my luck @ Red Rock. They have plenty to do in the Casino ( Bars, Lounges, etc.) and pretty good food joints as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!! We will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: escobop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in the last couple of months - once over Thanksgiving and once over New Year's. Brought our 10 year old daughter both times. This is by far our favorite place to stay if we come with our daughter cause the Kid's Quest is awesome and the casino is even better! Movie theaters, arcade, bowling alley and food court also very appealing to kids. The roomas are really nice and the food options are plenty for a short trip. You won't run out of choices. Going back for Superbowl weekend. But really can't wait to go back in warmer weather to use the pool because it looks amazing. We are heavy gamblers and had some really good luck in the casino over New Year's. Happy New Year to us! Can't say anything about the cost of the rooms because they were comped by Casino Marketing and/or Casino Hosts. Bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great off the strip hotel and casino”
Reviews.Author: joannethev
Reviews.Content: Would stay there again when we visit Las Vegas. The staff is very well trained and the rooms are big and very nice. Love the food at T-Bones and Terra Rossa makes the best risotto!!! Go you will see!

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Kurt F
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of the nicer resorts in Las Vegas over the years and the Red Rock became my first choice several years ago. The people make the destination for me. The restaurant, spa, gaming table and host personel are second to none. The day spa is wonderful and the restaurants are superb! I have noticed that most of the people I've met who work there have all been there 8 years (since it opened as best I know), which speaks volumes to what it must be like to work there. The property is always pristine and the room s are more than comfortable. The fact tthat is off the stip has great appeal to me as well. I live in Houston Texas and If I wanted to see what a million tourists in one spot look like I can go to the Galleria. I highly recommend the Red Rock and will be back there next Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, friendly service, awesome ammenities!”
Reviews.Author: PauLBoRo24
Reviews.Content: Even though this property is not on the strip, Red Rock has always provided stellar rooms, food, and service. Great local Vegas atmosphere, with superb activity options. I wish the Cherry nightclub was still open, but not being on the strip has its downsides when it comes to nightclub clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David P
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most of the top hotels on the strip and this was the first time at the Red Rock. This Decor in this Hotel was exactly our taste. Elegant, Zen and a perfect getaway from the overdone decor and fast pace on the strip. We are planning my wife's 40th B-Day in March and we have at least 10 couples coming out to Vegas with us and we are looking at every 5 star hotel on the strip. I can't find a suite that even comes close to the suite that we had at Red Rock, this is making it hard to stay any place else!

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip...”
Reviews.Author: Dejah P
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock may be off the strip, but if you happen to end up there while visiting Vegas be sure to stop by the sandwich shop in the food court for the "turkey dinner sandwich". One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. And for dinner at Cabo be sure to get the guacamole, it was divine. The hotels rooms were beautiful and the casino decor (crystal chandiliers anyone!!!) was very well done. All in all a great trip to Vegas, even if it was for work!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Redrock Is Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Oahuwoman
Reviews.Content: The Redrock is one of my favorite places to stay when I'm in Vegas. The rooms are great! I just love their bathrooms with deep soaking tub and tv over the tub, a fantastic place to just unwind. A person could just stay the entire time in their rooms and still have a great time while in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: sgthotc
Reviews.Content: My sister, a friend and I had a great stay at the Red Rock Casino Resort recently! Such a beautiful hotel and casino including the personnel! Would return in a "New York minute"! Our only disappointment was our gambling luck wasn't better...

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Merlita F
Reviews.Content: My husband and i been staying at Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa since they opened..We love this Resort because of the great customer service. From the valet to front desk, restaurant and casino.They go above and beyond to make your stay memorable..Especially when you celebrate b-day or anniversary..They always honor your request, especially room reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Suited us fine, balancing between location and cost”
Reviews.Author: Steamingaround
Reviews.Content: Fully resourced hotel and resort about 25 minutes hotle courtesy bus ride from downtown. We chose it for ecconomy as we stayed over New Year and everything else cost much more. Rooms excellent, great bathroom and WC. TV system good. Beware of the room mini bar and snacks - touch them and you will be found-out and charged by their computer! To be fair they do warn you at check-in. Check-in was slow, and the staff the most curt and unfriendly i have experienced in USA. They have to tap all manner of info into their computer terminals even though we had booked on line and had several emails welcoming us pre-arrival. Think it's something to do with gambling regualtions. Anyway if I could offer the management any advice it would be to completely re-think check-in. There were slow moving queues and that is the last thing one wants after a lenghty plane-ride. It was taking well over triple the normal time it would in any other hotel. That's the gripe, but I offer it hoping that it might be heard. Once you are in - then all is good. A variety of bars, eateries, a casino if you really do want to loose your shirt. A big sign promised they had the 'loosest slots in Vegas' - I didn't check this out! We observed the New Year's fireworks - it was a long shot and couldn't photograph as the wonderful picture windows are reflective. Pull-back the curtains and watch the sun rise in the morning - a superb vista! We used the courtesy bus into town. Beware it can leave several minutes early in both directions and we had to watch it dissapear up the road once (next one was two hours - oh well back to the strip! There is a self-service canteen style rfixed-price estaurant near the casino where you can eat as much as you like with about five styles of food - Asian, Pasta, American etc. Breakfast was good and reasonably priced. We enjoyed our stay and it is an ecconomic way of visiting Las Vegas - but if you have the money stay Downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieR10
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas week at the Red Rock. Our daughter lives near the casino and we stayed here to make room for others to stay at her home. It was GREAT !!! Great fitness center, great room, great view of the strip, and the best bathroom ever !!! The room was always clean, fresh towels, nice staff, yummy food served in the buffet--a really nice experience. Hope to be back soon for another fun time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to vacation.”
Reviews.Author: rzrbmp
Reviews.Content: The hotel seems to exist for meetings and conventions only. It is in a remote location and far from the airport. Their shuttle only runs till 9 pm. If you do not make the shuttle then be prepared for a $50.00 cab ride Once at the hotel be prepared to be fleeced for the entire stay. The small gift shop ran out of soda?!?. It was $4.00 to buy a can of soda from the mini-bar. There were no soda machines and there is no where in walking distance to purchase odds and ends at atypical retail price. Food prices were high and if your meeting breaks at noon then you will need to fight the crowds to get a table and eat. This caused us to be late getting back to our meetings. Sadly, in spite of this predictable pattern the restaurants were poorly staffed for lunch. Several of the restaurants did not even offer lunch service. Room was large and well appointed. Meeting room had almost no outlets for laptop computers but were otherwise ok. Gym was nice as was the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Hotel and Casino off of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SunSeeker62
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of these reviews before staying at the Red Rock and it is hard for me to believe that anyone could say anything really bad about this place. I had a great 4 night stay during a recent business conference and found everything to at or above my standard. The rooms were spacious and well-appointed. Very nice decor and very comfortable beds. Huge bathrooms with both a shower and a tub. Nice large screen TV and comfortable work area. The property had excellent restaurants and amenities on site which include a spa, fitness center, nice pool area, more than adequate casino, a nightclub, a bowling alley, a movie theater, and excellent restaurants (including a food court!). We tried several of the restaurants and the food quality and choice was outstanding. Would be a great choice for families with kids to get them away from the riff-raff of the strip. It is about 25 minutes off of the strip at the base of Red Rock but I saw that as a positive They do have a free, 32 person shuttle bus that takes you to the strip and the airport. My only complaint with the shuttle is that the last one from the strip at night is at 11:00 pm which is much too early for Vegas. I would highly recommend staying at this property and would suggest that most read the bad reviews posted here in a different light now having had the pleasure of staying there. Hard to see how someone could be disappointed with choosing this hotel/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort--30 Minutes from Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: Leslie V
Reviews.Content: I adore the Red Rock. The rooms are massive with amazing bathrooms. The event space is top-notch. The casino floor is great with a huge variety of machines and table games. In addition, the have tons of restaurants AND a food court. They also have a movie theatre and bowling alley off of the casino floor. The Red Rock is only 20 minutes from the airport and 30 minutes from the Strip. I wouldn't stay here if I was going to Vegas to go out "clubbing" and planned to stay out late because it does get more difficult to find cabs in the early morning hours that want to take you to the Red Rock (I'd rather walk/stumble home), but for work or for a relaxing Vegas vacation this is an A+. My favorite part of the property is the pool (see attached pictures). My least favorite part is that they don't have a coffee maker in the room so in order to have a cup of morning Joe you have to order a 13.00 pot (once you include tip delivery tax). Still this place is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SoonerFan73
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Hotel is wonderful! The staff is so friendly and helpful! We need a handicapped access room, and the one we were given was excellent! It was large and the bathroom was outfitted with all the needed devices for a handicapped person. We were also very close to the elevators. The food at the buffet is great, and the food court is nice for a quick meal. The casino is also good! We highly recommend Red Rock Resort, and we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Spontaneous Overnight Gift”
Reviews.Author: Sancerre1Dublin
Reviews.Content: Made last minute decision to attend holiday event for an overnight stay in LV. Searched on the internet and found RR online deal amongst others. Pleased that I made the CORRECT decision! My only regret was I wish it had been more than one night. From check in to check out, it was a great experience. Loved my room, location, amenities, etc. The ambiance is warm and inviting! I look forward to a longer stay in the not-so-distant future!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Red Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smcrawford38
Reviews.Content: My stay was fantastic. I had to be in town for two days while assisting my Uncle who was staying in a local rehab. hospital. The staff was very accommodating and made things easier for me during a difficult time. The valet staff was prompt and polite and the folks I spoke to on the phone were just as nice. I love staying here and will always book at this hotel when I come to Vegas. :)

Reviews.Title: “Love Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Tess D
Reviews.Content: It was a great Christmas experience, though there so many checking in at the same time, the staff were quick in helping us. The housekeeping staff were very nice. We got our exercise just by walking from the room to the elevator (good for some, not so good for the handicapped). The food selections at the buffet were good when we visited the place and the servers were attentive. No stress looking for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Jason C
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel I ever stayed at in Las Vegas. The Valets actually hustled and ran for your car. All the staff were great and friendly, the rooms were awesome, so was the fun. My wife and I agreed this is the only place we want to stay when we return to vVegas. Top notch!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special,”
Reviews.Author: We_enjoylife100
Reviews.Content: Went for a get away weekend. Was dissappointed, the folks that work there didn't seem to care if guests were there or not. They'd walk by and not speak, you opened the front entrance doors yourself, even there were porters, door men etc....Internet in room did not work even after staying on phone with tech support for apple products, they said they have issues with apple products. The buffet was ok.... we shuttled to the strip and the airport, the drivers were very nice. Will stay on strip from now on. No live entertainment till 10 pm on a Saturday night. Movie theatre was convenient. They also added a $10. tip on our bill we did not create, guess someone needed $10..

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Red Rock, again and again”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas Holiday. My seventh stay and second Christmas there. I was not disappointed. Made several pre-arrival arrangements with their excellent concierge sevice. The rooms are great and full window wall view of Red Rock canyon is beautiful. The deep bathtub and full sized glass shower are delightful (even a flat screen tv over tub!). There are restaurants for every taste and a great deli next to the Sports Book. Terra Rossa Restaurant is my favorite for excellent food, service, wine and atmosphere. The casino offers games for adults that you gotta love, machines, live gaming,keno, bingo, movies and bowling. I think if I could, I would move in! It would be easy to go on and revisit every corner of this place, but I have a better idea, Go there. Stay there. Enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: This place is a great Family Resort. It has all the great parts of the Las Vegas Strip without all the bad parts. My family and I stayed a week and we didn't leave the resort once. We saw movies at the theater and in the room, went bowling, gambled, ate great food at the Buffet, etc. We were very relaxed and comfortable. The rooms are amazing. We had a suite attached to a double. The suite is amazing and has the most incredible bathroom with Spa Tub. The double is just as great with an incredible bathroom as well. Overall, my family has decided we will be staying at the Red Rock Resort at a minimum of once a year. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxin' at The Red Rock Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Billy B
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough how awesome my two stays at the Red Rock Hotel have been. The property is beautiful, priced reasonably, and maintained by some of the most attentive staff I've ever seen. Let me stress how good the customer service is....it's amazing! I was actually contacted every day to make sure my room was cleaned to my satisfaction. A nice touch. There was also a follow up call for any customer service requests that I had. The restaurant I visited was called T-Bones. GREAT food and a very cool atmosphere. The spa sold some of the very, very nice lotions that you got in your room and I made a point of buying a big bottle of their body lotion. Its smells great and I'd drive back to Vegas again for it. :) I went solo this particular trip to have some 'me' time. It was quite enough to just plop down on that super comfy bed and play on my laptop. I had a great view of the strip in the distance and a nicely quiet room. My trip wasn't about the fast paced Vegas, but to get away and relax. Check out the online room specials for great pricing. I'll go back to Red Rock for my recovery again after my next stressful project here at work.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasurable resort casino experience.”
Reviews.Author: RawLand13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at quite a number of resort casinos over the years. This trip I decided to avoid the strip and stay above the clamor of drunken crowds by staying at the Red Rock. What a pleasant change this decision turned out to be. Here is what sets Red Rock apart from the others I have stayed at on the strip: 1) The air quality was excellent. Somehow the cigarette smoke is dealt with in a very effective manner. 2) Very easy parking and access to the hotel rooms. By following the remarks other before me made, I parked in the garage close to the hotel elevators. This made rolling our suitcases from the car to the room a snap. 3) The variety of places to eat was nice. In addition, we were close to so many other dining options in the immediate area. 4) The 16 screen cinema was a fun alternative to gaming. 5) The bowling alley was the largest I have seen, and very busy. Maybe next time I will play. 6) Having two Starbucks location makes the morning treat oh so easy. 7) The hotel hallways have deep separate hallways for two room doors. This makes for much less hallway noise making it into the rooms. 8) The privacy and make-up room lights make coordinating with housekeeping easy. 9) The housekeeping staff was always so pleasant, and friendly. Never before have I been greeted so warmly by every housekeeping staff member. 10) Everyone who worked at the resort was friendly. I left thinking that everyone really enjoyed working there, and was glad to see me there. 11) The workout facility, inside the spa area, offered everything we wanted, including little bottles of water. 12) The buffet was good, but crowded so much of the time. I would take advantage of the Boarding Pass breakfast price and get there a bit before they opened to avoid the long lines. I will definitely return to the Red Rock. My experience there convinced me that staying off the strip was a good decision. Tip: You must have a room key to use the hotel elevators. The hotel lobby is one floor below the hotel garage. By the Starbucks there is a separate hallway with the convention center and hotel lobby elevator. Use this elevator if you have luggage and need to check-in. We checked-in before getting our luggage to avoid the issue. Early check-in begins at 11 AM. Before that you will pay a $25 fee. The $27+ daily total resort fee was worth it to us because we used the wifi and workout facility. This fee seems to be hidden in the fine print somewhere, but we expected it all the same.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property - Reserve Online”
Reviews.Author: welapa2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days. The property is beautiful. The single king room was quite large, the bathroom, shower, and tub were all nice sized as well; all immaculately cleaned and cared for. The view was gorgeous. It's just a short 10 minute drive into Vegas, The only issue we had was that we went to the counter to book a room. They wanted $278 a night. I had seen it on tripadvisor for $107. They said they couldn't match the price so we stepped aside, reserved through tripadvisor (expedia) and then went back to the front desk. So book online somewhere 1st. Loved the entire property and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a stay--a walk through visit. WE WILL STAY NEXT TIME!”
Reviews.Author: pterbd
Reviews.Content: ON our recent visit to Las Vegas we wanted to try to broaden our list of acceptable hotels and really wanted to find one off the Strip. After a day at Red Rocks Conservation Area we decided to stp in and visit Red Rocks Resort. I was sad that we did becasue I did not want to go back to our hotel (which is pretty darn nice). Every experince we had on this property was top notch. We were welcomed to look around and even toured a room! The pool facilities were a real selling point. We almost stayed the rest of the afternoon just to hang out by the pool. Every part of this property is dramatic with wonderful strome and wood surfaces that draw your eye to great heights or over emphasise the size of everything. When we stood at the bar in the reception area we were not even aware of the casino which is just above and behind the bar! Thereis such attendtion to detail. The restaurants are numerous so that you can find exactly what you want. From the location of the Resort you can jump on the I-215 beltway to get back to the strip down around New York New York and the Tropicana or you can follow Charleston back into town to get to the north end of the strip. It is really well placed. we were looking for a day away fomr the lights and business and this resort is the place to do it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the new years weekend. Have a great time at the hotel. We wanted to stay away from the strip this time for New Years so we decided to try this place. The Hotel is clean and quiet besides the smoking that goes on in the casino. However, every casino allows smoking so you cant get away from that. The bed was very comfortable and the shower pressure was nice. We ended up getting a view of the mountain side, which isn't bad. I think the city view picture on the website is a little deceptive since it's no where near that close to it. One downside is that they don't have a restaurant or a look out point on the high floors to check out the city. There are plenty of places to eat. Some are on the high end. But right across the street are Olive Garden, BJ's and some other places to eat if you dont want to stay in the hotel. A couple of intersections down the road is PF Changs and a few other restaurants. Plenty to choose from. We couldn't get into the pool because it was freezing cold, that is the water and not outside. The Gambling isn't too bad either. We enjoyed playing roulette at this place. Best to park on the East Parking Lot as it is much closer to the rooms. Red Rock Canyon is just 7 miles from the hotel. Very nice to visit. However, I would park the car at the entrance and walk in if you can. Not worth the drive all the way around the place. The best part is at the beginning of the drive. Shows: Do NOT go see Cris Angel. It's a waste of money. We felt ripped off. I would definitely stay here at this hotel again if I ever wanted to be away from the strip. And make sure to get a room closer to the elevator. Our room was at the very end of the looooong hallway. Not fun walking all that way.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: thisisoldnavy
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas Day at the Rock. Each time we return to the Rock we are surprised to find many changes in the Casino by replacing old machines and relocating current machines. Rooms are always a treat being so clean, neat, extra lage bath towels, slippers, and a warm robe. The Feast Buffet continues to have excellent food and you can't beat the price. Other resturants have excellent food and should not be overlooked. 16 different theaters with great movies to watch during your stay. All personnel are extremely nice and easy to talk with.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay wish it could have been more”
Reviews.Author: AnnlovesUSA
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, with first class rooms, yes its away from the strip but if you want a first class hotel with excellent amenities, helpful staff, 1st class food (the buffet is on a par with the top hotels on the strip) and a quiet relaxing getaway, with its cinema, bingo, bowling alley and spa choose this hotel. The strip takes about 15 minutes by car or taxi so go there for the razzamatazz and they come back to your oasis in the dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious/Posh Room with a Spectacular View of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: pamela b
Reviews.Content: The hotel/casino is one of the nicest we have stayed in. It was nice to be away from the strip, but also have the feel of Vegas all in one location. We will definitely come back to Red Rock. The amenities are many. Many great restaurants as well as fast food court, movie theater, hundreds of fun gaming machines, nightclubs & bars, and a luxurious pool. There was no need to go anywhere else. The staff at Red Rock was readily available and the decor of the rooms was elegant & very comfortable. Loved the bathroom! We ate at the Buffet several times, the Grand Cafe & the Sandbar and found the food & price to be very good & reasonable. There is nothing that we did not like at the Red Rock Hotel. We would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LovesColorado
Reviews.Content: We picked Red Rock so that we could be off the strip with our kids. Loved the pool, but wished it was open later. Loved the spa, but wished they let teenagers get massages. Loved the restaurants, the Cabo Mexican Restaurant was our favorite. Very affordable dinners. The onsite theater is very nice, as is the food court. We were excited to try out the bowling alley, but leagues have it pretty much reserved during the week, so we weren't able to get in. Our rooms were amazing, especially for the price. We ended up going to the strip a couple of times for a show and for shopping, and the drive was a little long. Overall, a very enjoyable spring break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Non-strip place to vacay”
Reviews.Author: akamai_gurl
Reviews.Content: This place is very cool. Right next to Red Rocks State Park, where you can hike and climb, and off the strip. When you walk in to the hotel, it is very beautiful. It has multiple restaurants to choose from for a variety of palettes. We ate at the Italian restaurant for dinner, and the coffee shop for breakfast. The food at both places were very good. Pool area is closed in winter time. The rooms were totally sweet. Up market looking, euro-techno style design very modern (so you have to like that to think it is cool) and bathroom had sunken in tub, and separate water closet. The bathroom had its own TV which was also cool. The best part of this deal? An internet booking made this room $59/nt, plus a resort fee of $25 or so. For the price, it was an excellent choice. The casino was fun too, and had a lot of choice for gambling. We only stayed there one night, but I would have stayed for longer if I could have done so.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to test the service... try ANY complaint...”
Reviews.Author: mark m
Reviews.Content: If you want to test the service... try ANY complaint... and you will find that the service desk, the players club desk, and the marketing team couldn't really give a rat-- if you are there or not. They lied about a promotion, refused to act up my complaint "i'm sorry, but that was not our department... and we can't help you... and that department isn't available right now... so up you" and that was that.... have a much better time at the RAMPART or the SUNCOAST, only 10 minutes north of this rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like you are not in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BigJuanJohn
Reviews.Content: At the last minute, my wife and I decided to get away for the New Year and go to Vegas. Our goal was to not be in the rowdy area of Vegas and just have a relaxing weekend away. We choose the Red Rock resort because of the good reviews and it was close but not down town Vegas. The hotel is fairly big with lots of amenities you would expect in a big resort: casino, high end resturaunts, food court and many bars around the casino. As others have noted, the rooms and actually the entire place is sparkling clean. Our room was spot on. Large than normal room and large bathroom. We did like that with the curtains drawn, you could sleep all day in total darkness. This is important for a new years eve night and sleep in day. We ate at the buffet and it was reasonably priced for dinner (23 ea), which is better than a lot of the resorts on the strip. Brunch on New Years was $16 each. A lot to choose from. We did however decide to go see a couple of shows down town and the consierge was happy to find us seats and we just charged to the room. ( although we did see Chris Angel and that was such a waste of money, but that is another review elsewhere). I guess if you want to go to Vegas, but be out of the hustle and bustle of the strip, this place is a good choice. The surrounding area has every conceivable store, restaurant and large town amenity. The resort is also only 10 minutes to take the scenic drive to red rock canyon for a drive through or a hike, bike or jog. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “great weekend”
Reviews.Author: Missacl
Reviews.Content: This casnio resort is perfect...you won't want to leave. We stayed for the weekend. Able to check in at 12 even though we were told 3. Hit the pool, there were plenty of really nice beds/chairs. We kept away from the main pool (that's where the children were) but the side pools were quiet. We also recieved great wait service by the pool as well. I highly recomend LBS and the Yard House! Best steak salad ever. We has breakfast in the cafe the next morning also we went bowling and saw a movie. A perfect weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book through a 3rd party”
Reviews.Author: momo3bigD
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews here the only reason I can come up with for our poor experience is that we booked through a discount website. We were not met by anyone at the door and had to haul our bags in ourselves without benefit of a cart. The front desk clerk was extremely pleasant but did not bother to tell us there that the room we booked was not the room we would be getting. After a walk to the end of an extremely long corridor we opened the door to find one queen bed for my husband, myself and our adult daughter. When we called the front desk they admitted that they did not have any rooms with 2 beds but they would send up a rollaway free of charge. We left to get some dinner and go bowling and when we returned 2.5 hours later there was no rollaway. More calls placed to the front desk (of course we could not locate the person who originally promised the rollaway) and we are getting very cranky as it is 12:30 in the morning at this point and we had been traveling all day. They finally tell us that there are no rollaways left. My husband went ballistic and said that he was coming downstairs to talk to the manager. They urged him to wait to see what else they could do. Five minutes later an employee shows up with a rollaway. No apology or offer to help set up--just "here's your bed"--even though it is 1am. We don't think this room had been used in awhile. The only drinking glass in the room was 1 martini glass. Also the furniture was very dusty. When I woke up in the morning there was a lighted space between the curtains and the dust in the air looked like little snowflakes. The 4 upholstered chairs also had stains. Upon checkout I took issue with them charging us the resort fee--we had already paid 1/3 of the room rate in fees and taxes. They would not budge (but did offer to give us a breakfast coupon but it was 11am and we had already eaten). Interestingly, others at check out were complaining about the fee and another customer shared her experience about the lack of glassware and the dust. It seems to me that people who book through the discount websites are not really welcome at the Red Rock Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip, but big enough you may not have to leave”
Reviews.Author: RoanP
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for two nights just before Christmas. Pulling up the the Valet it was everything I would imagine the posh Vegas experience to be. Red Glass doors opened onto a dazzlingly Modern interior. The check in staff were pleasant, although if you are traveling with kids and don't gamble you might get the slight feeling of unwelcomeness when they ask you to set up a players card and you decline. Our room was fabulous, gorgeously decorated from the head board wall to the marble shower and marble tub with TV. They had great amenities, we watched an IMAX movie in their 16 theater multiplex, it was a small IMAX, but still a worthy theater with stadium seating in each one. The bowling alley looked intriguing, but it was league night, so no dice. We used their complimentary shuttle, which is great, but watch the hours. You can't get back to the hotel after 10PM, in Vegas!! The Hotel/Casino is a 40 minute drive from the strip, so it would be an expensive cab ride. I think they want to keep us at their Hotel and Casino. But with all the food court choices, which were all excellent, that might not be such a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “superior local hotel”
Reviews.Author: USVItravel
Reviews.Content: the key here is local summerlin... if you are looking off the LV strip (perhaps near friends or family), but for a relatively large scale property, RED ROCK is the best choice. rooms are modern, clean and large, buffet average + and some of the restaurants are superior. the experience here is uniformly good, movie theatre, bowling, dining, gaming, pools, starbucks, etc... in sum, RED ROCK is a reliable 4 star experience with a well executed good design.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: brandonLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. I am looking forward to my next visit to Red Rock

Reviews.Title: “Try it. You'll Like It”
Reviews.Author: jancarol00
Reviews.Content: If you want to expierence an excellent casino with exceptional dining, service and ambience, then book your next Las Vegas visit at Red Rock. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay on Las Vegas when you want to treat yourself just make a reservation”
Reviews.Author: Bobby2646
Reviews.Content: As you check into the hotel one is greeted warmly by the Hotel Staff The rooms all have wonderful views Are clean there are numerous restaurants a 5 star buffet at a reasonable price. You just feel good and safe where ever you go at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good food Great gambling win or lose”
Reviews.Author: craig w
Reviews.Content: Over all great stay easy to get to from 215 or the streets always good parking

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock "rocks"!!”
Reviews.Author: sammijo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Red Rock Resort in Las Vegas! We planned a 50th birthday celebration in one of the VIP bowling lounges and had approx. 60 people who came and stayed at the Red Rock with us! Liz and Lisa were great to work with and helped us plan all the details! The rooms were very nice and all had amazing views of either the strip or the "red rocks". Management was very attentive to any requests we had. It truly is a beautiful resort and was a great place to hold a large party!!!

Reviews.Title: “RED ROCK LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: DON D
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and great staff. As good and as beautiful as any Casino/Resort on the Strip. I highly recommend Staying there.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY VENUE”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas is Las Vegas. There are all sorts of people coming through any resort location. Nevertheless, Red Rock goes the extra mile to keep the property in excellent shape. My room was beautiful, the staff was outstanding, and the grounds were lovely. NOTE: The hotel is a bit removed from the casino, so the guests do not have to treck through noise and smoke to get to their rooms. It was a very cold weekend /rain and a bit of snow. The valet parking staff attended to my every need and was very polite. I cannot address buffet dining, as such is not something I do. But there were many people standing in line, so something must be good. My family lives in Summerlin, so staying at the Red Rock is very convenient. You can have a casino with out the strip. The location is outstanding with the Red Rock Canyon view up the hill and the night lights below. This is a fun resort, suitable for the whole family. I'll be back in February!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: LeighHB
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of my stay was excellent. I was there for business and didn't have time to enjoy all of the amenities but hope to go again soon on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “The RED ROCK -- ROCKS !!!!”
Reviews.Author: K A K
Reviews.Content: Everyone very friendly and helpful. Rooms very comfortable even without bathtub. Beds were luscious and plush. Everything, including casino very elegant and tasteful. Good buffet and great prices.

Reviews.Title: “nice and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Sar C
Reviews.Content: I live in Las Vegas and this is where i stay if I want a quiet night in a beautiful room. The full-sized tub fills up quickly and is a decadent place to have a bubble bath and watch tv.

Reviews.Title: “If you're not into the strip....”
Reviews.Author: TeamLobsinger
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is a good hotel. The room was quite nice! We booked a standard room with a view of the strip. The bedroom was very tasteful! Comfy bed and SOOOO spacious! The bathtub had a t.v. mounted above it, which would have been nice, but it was hanging off the wall a bit precariously and the volume didn't work for a bunch of channels. I really liked the amenities of this hotel; casino, lots of nice places to eat (you don't have to eat at a buffet!!), movie theatre, spa, nightlife. So great! However, we didn't realize exactly how FAR from the strip it was. The cab ride from Redrock to Caesar's Palace was 45 dollars. They do have a shuttle, but when we inquired about it the girl at the desk didn't have much information, and she made it sound like it was pretty complicated to use it. We won't return, but only because we prefer the excitement of being right on the strip. If you're looking for Vegas without so much Vegas, this is a phenomenal option alongside beautiful scenery. Well done Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great non-Vegas strip option.”
Reviews.Author: LiskoPS
Reviews.Content: If you are in LasVegas to enjoy more than the Strip, including nearby attractions (Hoover Dam and Lake Mead, outdoor activities, etc...), then RedRock is a great choice. Easy freeway location 20 minutes from the Strip. Property feels newer - with contemporary design (no theme) reminds of W Hotel but with no attitude. Rooms are very large and well appointed. Very comfortable and all the latest technology. Quiet - no strip noise. Room service is punctual and great quality (food is hot when delivered to room).

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisMag
Reviews.Content: Everything you need is right here. If you love video poker, this is the best casino in all of America. The casino floor is beyond amazing. The best set-up of machines I have ever seen. All the newest games. There are Video Poker games here that you can't find anywhere! Great pay tables too! Nice dealers at blackjack, craps, 3-card poker, etc. Very classy, friendly, and lots of fun. We had a whole itinerary of other casinos we wanted to visit-after only visiting one other, we said "why are we here?, let's get back to Red Rock, everything we are looking for is right there"! We were there for four days and would of extended our stay if we could have! The rooms are beautiful, housekeeping did an amazing job. The food was really great-especially the Grand Cafe, sportsbook deli & room service! For the past 10 years we have stayed at the Venetian. For the next 10 years we are staying at the Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “red rock”
Reviews.Author: conairs2
Reviews.Content: i like to keep it short.Red rock is a fantastic place out of the way from the strip feels like you are in a different place.the view of the mountain is wonderful...rooms are very nice.the restaurants are great the staff very nice.will be stay there more often.

Reviews.Title: “New Favourite Place in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Uniballer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the Red Rocks. As I was traveling with family, it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the busier places downtown. It seemed to draw a 35-45yr old crowd along with tons of neighbourhood locals, so no risk of a frat party rolling past your door at this place. I tried both the burger place and the Mexican restaurant and the food was great and also really cheap for Vegas. Think 2 dinners for 30 bucks. Loads of other restaurants as well. I had a car so the 20 minute drive to the strip was never an issue. I imagine taxis would be pricey if you were looking to go out nightly, and didn't have a DD, so something to take into consideration. If you've done the strip once or twice before and have already had that experience, then this will be a nice change of pace. If it's your first time, you'd probably regret not staying closer to town. If you have a week, maybe rent a car for half the time and try both. Also, make sure to sign up for the Station Casino Players Card. You get anywhere from $3-$100 of free play at the slots and if that doesn't interest you, cash out and put the money in your pocket. Resort fee includes wifi if you end up selecting this option and the valet was great / friendly. If self-parking (there are two main lots), follow the signs for the spa. This will take you to the hotel entrance along with the self-park / valet. They are beside each other. Go up the ramp, and park on the first deck with the casino entrance. Leave your bags in the car, go through the doors and down the stairs to check in. The elevators won't work without the room card, so taking your bags down a windy staircase could prove tricky! Enjoy the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Keep on 'Rock'n'”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers55129
Reviews.Content: Just completed our second stay at the Red Rock this year. This time we enticed another couple to join us. Neither of us were disappointed. For our room, we were upgraded to a signature suite. It is the size of two rooms with a wet bar and min-fridge and a half-bath. There is a nice wrap around sofa - play pit and large t.v. in the living room. The bedroom is the same as the standard room - including the glorious bathroom. I would recommend one couple upgrading if traveling as a group - and the living room can serve as a great meeting area for cocktails before heading out. The standard rooms at the RR are just great. Again, this stay was enhanced by the great service of the hotel staff. This includes the front desk, car valets, bellmen, servers in the restaurants and dealers. I know I'm painting with a very large brush, but it's true. Why do we love the RR so much? The marble bathrooms are a great escape and spa on it's own. There's a t.v. over the two person tub and my wife has spent hours in that tub! There's a separate walk-in shower stall and the commode is in an alcove with a sliding door. The double sinks are well thought-out - with plenty of ledge space for personal items. How often do you find yourself cramped at the sink - when traveling? It will not happen at the RR. As it turns out we ate on property a fair amount: T-Bones and the Grand Cafe. In the past we have eaten in the mexican restaurant. The food is exceptional when compared to the strip in both quality and price. T-Bones is pushing the price/value line - but it was a great meal. So, here is why coming to the Red Rock can be a complete Vegas vacation: Getting to and out of the hotel is extremely convenient. There isn't the craziness or volume of the strip. Meaning - when you pull up at the end of your night (or morning) - there's no hassle or lines. The valet is ready to help you. The elevators to your room are short walk through the hotel lobby which is one floor below the casino/mezzanine. Another huge benefit of the RR - is just off-site, short walk or car ride are the local establishments of Summerlin - which is a happening suburb of Vegas. To the degree you want even more added value in terms of saving money on food, shopping etc - it is right outside your hotel. For Lifetime Fitness members, there is a club about a 1/4 mile away (or less). On this trip, we signed up for a hike/tour of the Red Rock National Conservation area (10 mins. away) through Red Rock Canyon Tours. I highly recommend this activity. There is also horseback riding and other outdoor activities as well. The hotel can arrange for golf or white water rafting and touring Hoover Dam is only 30 mins away. Other things to note about this property: There is live entertainment - AND NO COVER at Rock's Lounge. We saw a set by Zowie Bowie. A great local act. The bar in the middle of the casino area was also rock'n with a DJ and again no cover. I simply can't recommend the Red Rock enough.

Reviews.Title: “Love Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: RacCarp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in late November right after Thankgsiving. We upgraded to a suite for a very reasonable rate. We loved the rooms, so spacious and a beautiful view. We used the spa, work out room, and ate at the buffet for breakfast and the cafe. The food was excellent at all restaurants. We especially enjoyed being able to go bowling on Monday morning at reduced rates. We love Red Rock, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jcjss
Reviews.Content: The resort is gorgeous, rooms large and comfortable. Red Rock has something for everyone. Set close to the Red Rock Mountains, the views are beautiful whether looking out to the mountains or looking at the lights of the strip at night. A good selection of tables and limits. Slots are just as loose as anywhere else and more than enough selection to keep anyone happy. Restaurants to suite any taste, from high end steak house, buffet, cafe, to a grab and go food court. I for one enjoy being away from the chaos of the crowded and overpriced strip hotels. Close enough to go into town for a show, but far enough away to feel special.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort and Casino”
Reviews.Author: keno777
Reviews.Content: We visited here in late November with my wife's parents & aunt & uncle. This is a first class operation. Our room was comped due to previous slot play on other visits. However, this is the first time we actually stayed here. We had a beautiful view of the mountains, with the pool right below us. We did not use the pool, but it was so beautiful. The amenities in the room were first rate-even better than Bellagio and the Venetian where I used to stay. Room comps are better here than most casinos depending on your put through (coins in). However, Station Casinos all have very little freeplay to offer compared to other casinos. Their freeplay is very similar to M Resorts, who is also a little tight on freeplay offerings for out of town visitors. We are all big slot players, and the machines seemed a little tough at first, but improved as the three day trip went along. In fact all six of us did ok the last two days once we found our way around and played smarter. The food choices and variety of restaurants are the best in the LV area. I love the buffet, which has great service and plenty of space between tables. We never had a long wait at the buffet, but get there early during the week because 4.99 attracts a bunch of locals. The food court offers great variety especially if you like Philly steak sandwiches. The cafe was super and had good quality offerings. Fish and Chips was great there. We did not go to the high end restaurants, but will upon return. After the hubbub of the strip it is very relaxing here. Atmosphere in the casino is great, and a great clientele also-a mix of area locals (Summerlin is the best) and hotel guests. Machines are spread out and there are non smoking sections also. One tip though: Get a room close to the elevator or else rent a Segway. Wow, beautiful rooms, but at 3 in the morning it is a trek to the middle or other end of the hallways. We love Red Rock and hope to be back as soon as the pool opens. It is a first rate place to stay and gamble. Good Spa too. My wife used it before but not this time. Anyone who complains about any aspect of this resort has their head somewhere besides their shoulders. From the valet to service in the casino and restaurants I would rate this as five stars. Big Jim

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Off-Strip Casino”
Reviews.Author: the_ambler_rambler
Reviews.Content: Went here for a getaway weekend with my wife. We only stayed one night, but by the time we left we wished we had stayed here for the entire weekend. To start with, the architecture and visual appeal of the casino are amazing, and just walking around and looking at everything is a treat in itself. In this respect, it puts most of the Strip casinos to shame. Everything looks very new and fresh. Our room had this same visual appeal and was very clean and comfortable. Although I didn't win any money, playing the tables was fun, and the dealers competent and engaging. Plenty of slots and tables regardless of what your favorite game is. The restaurant selection was probably one of my favorite things about this casino. We only ate at the buffet, which was good but not great, and Yardhouse. There seems to be a restaurant here to satisfy just about any palate and budget. Would love to eat at T-Bones steakhouse next time we're there. The only real downside of the casino is its distance from "everything" i.e. The Strip. I don't know if I'd recommend this place for a group of youngsters out to have a night on the town, but it's perfect for couples, or if you're looking for a more laid-back or quiet Vegas experience. Between the on-site movie theater, on-site bowling alley, casino, and nearby Red Rock Canyon (great hiking!), we never felt bored. Great casino, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rocking”
Reviews.Author: fourdeuces
Reviews.Content: I was comped by the casino after giving them a few hours of action in September.The room was nice. Two sinks in the bathroom, the glass shower and a tub with a TV over it. Nice bed. Lighting could be better and they should get an HD signal for the nice TV in the room. They do have the dreaded resort fee but as a casino guest I avoided that. I did the 10 minute drive over to Red Rock Canyon a couple of times to run the trails.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is my home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Connie M
Reviews.Content: I love that I can easily get to Red Rock from the airport in no time, and I can see it from the expressway so I never miss my exit! I lived at Queensridge on Charleston and my Daughter and Grand Children live in our home now, so it's easy to get to the house. Red Rock has everything I need, it's my home away from home! Connie McLeod

Reviews.Title: “It's all under one roof, eat, sleep, gamble & play!!”
Reviews.Author: nermpook
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is off the strip, but the fun begins when you walk in the door. The main casino floor is full of new slots and winnings that will keep you going to the next machine. Then when it is time for a break, you can try your hand at bowling in one of the 16 lanes or sit back and watch a movie in their theatre. Should you still need more excitement there are shops to make additions to your wardrobe or just window shop. Dinner time was a real treat a the Yard House. Start out with one of their many home brews, all on tap. The meal was more than delicious. Ordered the rib eye with garlic butter, mashed potatoes and green beans. Now wihen the green breans taste good, you know the rest of the meal will too. Too full for desert. The buffet has so many choices you will want to wait for the next day to try that. Even includes choices from other countries, Mexico and China in addition to the traditinal American. All the food is fresh and presented in a way you will make several trips to fill your plate. As your eyes and body will need to rest after all of this head to your room in the resort and you will even be more amazed. The bathroom alone is such a warm welcome. Everything is modern and all your needs can be met. Then relax in the bed and you will be asleep in no time. Don't forget to check your players cards for comps to get credits toward your room or meals.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: kahalatravel
Reviews.Content: This resort has everything! Beautiful rooms! Great bathrooms! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Birthday Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinetraveler42
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and welcomed. The Red Rock is an amazing weekend get away offering every amenity you could imagine. The Yard House offered fabulous martinis, the restaurants were all delicious, the pool area was tranquil and the gambling, well we left happy. I would recommend Red Rock Casino for a great weekend escape.

Reviews.Title: “hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: denis a
Reviews.Content: I thought I was getting a good deal for a 4 star hotel but not so much. When I went to check out I was told there was a resort fee that I had to pay just for the privilage of staying there, never heard of such a thing. I reminds me of a guy offering me a camel ride for a dollar. The ride is so uncomfortable that all you want is to get off but the guy will only let you off if you pay him 10 dollars. They get me for over 27 bucks but never again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Karen W
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock is the place to stay while in Vegas! Tired of the busy Strip? Then stay at Red Rock! The rooms are absolutely beautiful! The entire resort was beautiful. The staff is the friendliest I've seen in Vegas. The surrounding mountains are a site to see and you can still look down on the lights of the city. We stayed in a signature suite and it was definetely worth the little extra we payed!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock made our Holiday Merry & Bright!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn H
Reviews.Content: I was here visiting my lady friend of over 20 years with a 'get away' to Red Rock! I was so impressed with the caring staff, and the room was absolutely exquisite!!! No detail was overlooked! Being off the strip with having 5 star accommodations & service (restaurants were top notch too) and with 5 star views was the perfect combination for a weekend get away, not soon to forget, if ever! The whole weekend, we never had the need to leave Red Rock! No 'on the strip' headaches or feeling lost 'on the strip' crowd, it truly was a memorable experience. You can't beat it; value, perfection, detail oriented, views and quality over quantity! I'll be staying here again soon, matter of fact, this spring!! ~ Jose & Mary

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Resort”
Reviews.Author: ultimateangelsfan
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Resort is an upperclass Resort/Casino that has superior customer service. You will not find luxurious rooms like these on the strip or anywhere else for that matter. Every dining experience we've had at this facility has been wonderful from the Grand Cafe to the Buffet. And talk about the Buffet... have not tried any item in the buffet that was not delicious. The bowling alley is clean, the movie theater is huge and the casino has enough variety to keep you from wanting or needing to go anywhere else. I highly recommend Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Escape From The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Fred D
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: Luxury Hotel is a 20 minute drive from the strip. Service is top-notch. Red Rock is a self-contained complex with Casino, Restaurants, Pools, Entertainment, Movie Theaters, Bowling Alley, state-of-the art Kids Club, and Spa. ROOM: Our suite was huge, quiet, luxurious, relaxing and it had stunning picture window views of the Red Rock Canyon. POOL: Although very large it was sometimes difficult to find seating by the pools as they sometimes close off sections to prepare for evening concerts. Also the early closing time for the pool is annoying. There is a private mostly adult pool near the spa pool that is oasis-like Overall this is a great place for families where all can play together (bowling, movies, restaurants, pool) and mom and dad can also play while the kids are having a great time in the kids club.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Revival”
Reviews.Author: Alice W
Reviews.Content: After being on the road for over a month I decided to treat myself on the last day of my journey home. We have stayed at the Red Rock before and love the atmosphere and out of the way location. Just one night in a amazing room with a fantastic dinner brought promptly and hot rejuvinated my body and spirit. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was nice to end my trip back to California in such a pleasant way. The layout and design of the property is perfect for all anyone would want to do. I will be back soon !

Reviews.Title: “beautiful off-strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: becsnider
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Red Rock, and it was wonderful. I only wish I had been able to stay more than one night. I come to Vegas once or twice a year and generally stay a several different hotels - some on the strip and some off the strip. In general, I think you get much better value and service from the hotels off the strip. However, you do need a car to stay at Red Rock unless you don't plan to leave the hotel and surrounding area during your visit. There are plenty of things to do other than gambling at the hotel - bowling, movie theatre, gorgeous pool, spa, shopping and there are numerous places to eat in the hotel. There are also restaurants and shops within walking distance outside the hotel. The hotel is just my taste - very modern with lots of interesting art throughout. I love the fact that the doors to the rooms are set off in short corridors off of the main hall. The room itself was nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable, the room was well lit, there was a large flat screen tv. The bathroom was beautifully tiled in marble, and the walls were covered with leather wallpaper. The bathtub was one of the deepest I have seen and the separate shower was a nice size. I was a little disappointed that the sound on the tv in the bathroom just above the tub didn't work, but that was a minor flaw. The bathroom also has double sinks and nice toiletries. I did gamble in the casino, but didn't win here. They do, however, had a good variety of slot machines and plenty of different table games with decent minimums. I will definitely stay a Red Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: msylee22
Reviews.Content: This our fourth stay at Red Rock and it was very nice. The beds are as comfortable as ever and the staff at registration was pleasant. Now that we have an infant, the instant checkout you can do on the TV is a life saver. Do not like to stand in line x 20 minutes. The bathroom is always beautiful with the TV over the bathtub and marble floors. They did forget to replenish our shampoos and soaps but one phone call and they appeared at the door within 30 minutes. The rooms are great size and we fit a pack and play in the corner without a problem. Some things that would have been nice would be a fridge I could have used for my breast milk/formula, but when I asked downstairs, they said they charged $15. I know that Wynn/Encore gives you one for free for formula. They used to provide free slippers in the rooms, I still have some from my first visit to the hotel, but they no longer provide those. And there was no ICE BUCKET in the room! There was an ice machine two doors down, but we had to put the ice in a plastic bag to help keep our formula cold. There is also no coffee/tea in the room, which is a huge surprise. But I guess that is how they keep the Starbucks downstairs in business. I also visited the spa and fitness area and the fitness area is state of the art and very well kept as always. The spa no longer serves these little snack bars and the oranges were kinda moldy. Otherwise, very nice spa. Because of its proximity to Red Rock Park and its good value, I can see us staying there again. Thanks for a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks”
Reviews.Author: arlynne
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful and exciting property. We have stayed there several times in the past year and always had a great experience. There are abundant dining choices and they are all good. We especially like the buffet and tend to eat there a lot. There are high end places but there is also a great food court. They have a huge theater with all the first run movies, a bowling alley, bingo parlor and plenty of slot machines and table games to keep you occupied. The rooms are very nicely decorated and you can request a strip view or a view of the red rock mountains. Both are great views. They could use a little more light in the rooms as the decor is somewhat dark. The bathrooms are all marble and enormous. First class accommodations. It is much nicer that any strip hotel and casino and I have stayed in several of the top names. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised...”
Reviews.Author: reneemaui
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved Red Rock Resort! Fabulous service, clean / spacious, awesome views and lots of shopping nearby. The casino was much larger than we thought and couldn't believe they had movie theatres and bowling alley!
