Reviews.Title: “RED ROCK HOTEL & CASINO”
Reviews.Author: oldspice43
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility, close to Las Vegas strip and Red Rock Canyon Park.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lolaluvey
Reviews.Content: Best trip I ever took. Location perfect, near canyons and away from the strip. Access to strip and airport A+++++!

Reviews.Title: “Great room & good service”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: Excellent room with a view of the strip. classy bathroom and comfortable beds. Now take a wrench and loosen the slots.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle W
Reviews.Content: This was my first time going to Red Rock. Although I only stayed one night I have to say I just fell in love with the place. I can't wait for the weather to warm up and go back and check out the pool . From the moment I walked in I was welcomed everyone was very friendly. The room was great, the view was great. Very relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: allaboutvegas
Reviews.Content: I loved my experience at Red Rock. The hotel and the rooms are some of the nicest around. The location is a little far from the strip but once you are there you will find that Red Rock has everything you need. The casino is quite large and they offer a lot of games. I really loved my stay here and can't wait to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fatheree Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful resort you have created. Every want was filled by your great employees. We have traveled all over the world and have found no better place to stay than Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “The real vegas!”
Reviews.Author: skip h
Reviews.Content: Great service friendly staff and a wonderful facility. Something for everyone. Views of the Red Rock area are fantastic. Rooms are very nice and comfy. We were there fot the Tony Hawk Foundation event and it was awsume. Thanks for making us so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Hotel & Casino Rocks”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan2012
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Red Rock Hotel and Casino. I can assure you, it will not be my last. This place has it all without the hassel of the strip. Easy to get to off the 215 and in beautiful Summerlin, NV, you can't ask for anything more. The restaurants are some of the best in Las Vegas and the casino is amazing. If you are looking for luxury without the hassel of the strip, this is your place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Option”
Reviews.Author: dj33161
Reviews.Content: If you like the gaming options in Vegas but are tired of the hustle and bustle of the Strip, Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa is a great alternative. Service, food and appointments are all top notch, plus the resort offers a variety of other non-gaming options to keep you busy. The rooms are extremely comfortable and well-appointed. I'd definitely give the resort two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it Better than the Strip”
Reviews.Author: renosparksVP
Reviews.Content: We had stayed a few nights on the Vegas Strip, and wanted to do some hiking in Red Rock Canyon in Summerlin, so decided to spend a night at the Red Rock Casino and Hotel. Wow. This place is just right in the classiness department. From the well appointed rooms to the piano player in the lobby, this was really a nice break from the garishness and presumption of Fancy-Schmancy Strip props. The casino had good Blackjack rules unlike the rip off 6:5 payouts at Caesars/Bellagio et al. There was a non-smoking area, and lots of full-pay and progressive video poker. Bar and cocktail service was very good, and the clientele gave off a mellow, low to mid-roller local vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brian O
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Red Rock and each has been a memorable experience. Starting with the ultra helpful and friendly front desk staff to the cafe staff, all were very courteous and professional yet friendly. The room was well appointed and clean as a whistle. TV was great as well as the convenient bedside clock radio. Overall, in my opinion, one of the finest inns in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “"Renewed our faith in Vegas"”
Reviews.Author: Jerry G
Reviews.Content: We came to the Red Rock as part of an event and were very pleasantly surprised. After coming to Vegas once or twice a year for many years and mostly visiting the strip we become tired of high prices, very plain accomodations, and frankly crowds of kinds of people that we found uncomfortable. We were unfamiliar with the Red Rock and came as participants in an event being held there and were we surprised! Everything about our visit from beginning to end, from the people at the front dest to the people handling the event to the housekeeping staff were first class. We felt as though we mattered to them. We are not high maintenance guests and don't require a lot of extra care, but the few questions and requests we did have were met with an attitude that was genuinly caring, not a corporate-trained response. The room was spectacular, very large with a great view or the Red Rock Canyon and the pool, great bath/shower, great bed, everything was very good with one exception - they don't supply cups in the bathroom and they seemed surprised when we requested them. Cups were delivered immediately, but were obviously not part of the plan. The casino, the bars, and especially the buffet were excellent. This will be our Vegas destination of the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ralphfuentes
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights with my wife, had a great time. Hotel is very nice and has everything you need inside. Awesome dinner at Hachi. Price was great for the upgraded room, did use a discount. Will definetly go again!

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock over Thanksgiving for a youth football tournament. The location was perfect. This hotel is awesome for adults and kids. The Feast is a great value and excellent food. Happy Hour at Cabo was great. We loved having the arcade, movie theater and bowling alley for the kids. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable. The Spa is wonderful. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, Great Sunday Champagne Brunch and lots to do.”
Reviews.Author: LinaLaQuinta
Reviews.Content: Our check in was smooth. Everyone very courteous and prompt. Room was large as were bathrooms with walk in shower, soaking tub with TV above on wall and dbl. sinks. Lots of machines to play if you gamble and also table games. Great for families with a 16 screen theater and bowling alley. Lots of restaurant choices incl. a food court and nice Sunday Brunch that is reasonably priced and lots to choose from incl. a Gelato Bar. Only drawback is that it is about 20 to 30 min. from the strip, but it is a destination in itself. We will go back!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: East Meadow, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel resort, casino in vegas”
Reviews.Author: Moshe H
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I had a very good time during the time I stayed in Red Rock casino resort. they are always for you with a smile. the room are very nice and clean, the restaurant are amazing. and the casino is beautiful and not so noisy. I loved that and I had a very good time.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Young K
Reviews.Content: Great place for all encompassing getaway. Rooms were very classy and the casino is full of amenities for a complete weekend getaway. If you're looking for the hustle and bustle of the strip, you won't find it here. But, if you're looking for Vegas experience without the Vegas crowd, this is the place to be. Plus, there are some outstanding golf courses, restaurants and entertainment within very short driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: mike h
Reviews.Content: Location cannot be beat, no strip traffic but everything is the Summerlin area, and if you need the hassel of the strip it is only a quick 15 minute drive. Red Rock nice new modern rooms, excellent spa and fitness Center at no charge (a big plus for me). The staff there take pride in providing excellent service. Would recommend it anytime, a great place!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: sparky329
Reviews.Content: Outstanding experience top to bottom from the moment we arrived to the of departure

Reviews.Title: “Off Strip Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: As other reviews well point out, there are some oddities built into the Red Rock property. However, if you want to stay in a fun, well thought out resort without any of the riff-raff that is always associated with staying on the Las Vegas strip, then Red Rock is where you want to be. Rooms are plenty big for a couple as well as cozy and stylish. The beds are blissfully comfortable, the tub has room for two (thank you Red Rock!), there is a separate shower stall and double sink in the bathroom. There are great restaurants around the casino (Tbones is a favorite for drinks, appetizers, steak and great service at the bar, LBS has outstanding burgers, The Feast buffet is worth the price of admission AND there is even a mall-style food court as well), an awesome bowling alley, a Regal Cinemas movie theater (great popcorn) and a huge, fun Bingo hall. In summer, you would be well advised to hang in the pool area and the spa and gym should NOT be ignored. Yes, the daily resort fee ads up pretty quickly, though it is worth it at the end of the day if you use the internet and well equipped gym. I have had several massages at The Spa and have not been disappointed. All in all, Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa has become my favorite Las Vegas destination and I will head back to it any time the opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Some great, some not so great”
Reviews.Author: MontereyWineGuy
Reviews.Content: Overall nice stay. Valet / Bell services were excellent, and check in was quick. Wonderful room off the strip, and overlooking Red Rock scenic area. Very nice room, even with a doorbell. Very quiet, except for the neighbors door shutting hard. Courteous cleaning service. The restaurants had good variety and menu, but the food preparation and service were poor, and overpriced. I will come again, but probably eat somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Hotel Casino Rocks !”
Reviews.Author: Golfing_Gregg
Reviews.Content: The family was itching to take a trip somewhere on thanksgiving break so I found a hot deal on American Airilines Vacations for air and hotel to Red Rock ($350 per person from dallas). I love Vegas and usually visit a few times a year. However, I have always been reluctant to take the whole family. My kids are older now (11 and 16) so I figured they would be mature enough to understand the Vegas concept. Plus, we are staying way off the strip in Summerlin at Red Rock which I figured would be away from the big crowds. I was right, Summerlin is a very nice suburb of Vegas close to the mountains. I have stayed at other "Station" properties like Green Valley Ranch and have been pleased so I figured Red Rock was worth a look. Boy, was I right. What a great hotel. Red Rock is a large complex with hotel, spa and casino. It aso has bowling alley, a movie theate and kids arcade. The pool area is large and beautiful but was too cool for swimming. There are multple bars, reastuarants and a fast food court. The decor is contemporary with lots of crystal chandelieres. The rooms are clean, modern and spacious. We had a small issue with a toilet valve that we had maintennance fix the first day (service was prompt). One odd feature, was the bathroom door made of an opaque glass that did not block the light from inside. So if someone goes to the restroom at night, the light wakes you up even with the door closed. The rooms were always clean and any service needs were quickly addressed. Our walk to the room seemed very long because of the configuration of the hotel. So if this bothers you, request a room close to the elevators. You could stay at the Red Rock Hotel the whole time and be totally content. The Red Rock Canyon area is about 10 minutes away and it offers some great views and hiking trails. We wanted to do this but ran out of time. We did to see a few shows on the Strip which is about a 20 minute drive depending on traffic. We rented a vehicle, but there is a free hotel shuttle to/from the Strip. I play poker, video poker and pai-gow poker adn teh teh ccasino was very nice and not too smoky. The poker room was spacious and busy. My kids had a gerat time in the arcade and the movie theater. Overall, this was a great trip and everybody had fun. Definilty, a good family Vegas spot and I recommend it. We will definitley go back.

Reviews.Title: “We Enjoyed Red Rock...Mostly!”
Reviews.Author: Trailblazer44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Rock Resort in a King Room 18th floor(of 20) facing the Red Rock Mountains. The rooms are plush and a perfect size for a couple to enjoy.The decor is a bit dark and the lightning takes quite some time to diagnose so you can adjust it to your requirements.The Bose Wave Radio is a really nice touch! We found the bed to be semi-soft but still quite comfy, and we slept quite well on it.Everything in the room worked fine and the deep soaker tub filled very rapidly, and having the TV in the bathroom was very handy. It is a long hallway if your room is located more than halfway down because the elevators (which are the fastest we have ever experienced) are located at one end and the building is long and shaped like a bow..For us it didn't matter at all and I even asked for a room farther down the hall. We ate at the buffet which is quite good and the Grand Cafe which had some crabby employees, one which gave us less than half full glass's of orange juice and charged us for them! We were not impressed with some of the people working in that restaurant at all. That said most of the interactions with employees were fine and when passing them in the hallways they acknowledged us with a hello. The spa amenities are great and after a workout in the nice exercise room I went and soaked in the large hot tubs and steam room.They also have a nice lap-pool just outside the exercise room which was very warm..The spa amenities are gender separated, the men have there caves that you walk to down a long corridor and the ladies are located in another area not far from the reception desk. It wasn't busy at all when we stayed there and almost felt like we had the entire 18th floor to ourselves..Never heard any noise at all except for the odd slam of the heavy entrance doors to a suite near ours. The location of the resort shouldn't be a issue since if you do your homework then you will discover that it is located about 10 miles west of the strip.If you rent a car it is a easy drive straight up West Charleston Blvd to the strip..If you like, you can use the hotel shuttle which will drop you at the Fashion Show Mall. We only went to the strip once to see a show and we parked in one of the many free parkades at the Fashion Show Mall. Their is shopping directly across the street from Red Rock (Costco,Best Buy) and back up #215 towards the airport there is another large shopping area with JC Penny etc about 2.5 miles. Another issue that we didn't care for at Red Rock is they charge a substantial $27.00 daily resort fee and then when we went to the 5th floor to use the business centre computer they charge a fee based on a dollar per minute to use a computer! That's Buffoonery Indeed...A quick log on to print boarding pass's is a flat fee of $5.21! All in all we enjoyed our stay at Red Rock and we definitely would go back and stay again and next time it will be when those very nice looking pools and loungers are open and the weather is hot.We will just stay away from the Grand Cafe and not use their Business Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Hits, but mostly misses at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Maggie R
Reviews.Content: We have been pretty loyal to Station Casinos, but that loyalty is waning. On the surface, this hotel looks beautiful and we were excited to stay and play there. But it was one frustrating detail after another, and while all of them we small, it started to add up. First, we (like others have commented) had a very difficult time finding the registration desk from parking garage. It was on a separate floor and not well marked. We schlepped around a bit with four pieces of luggage and we able to find registration and check in. Next: The room was visibly attractive and appeared to be well appointed. I had a bit of a headache and wanted to take something for it. As has already been noted, there was no water glasses in the room. I called the front desk to ask about that and she explained that "for safety reasons" they are not included in the room. Huh??? So I thought about it and thought that because of the glass and the marble floors in the bathroom, they might break and shatter - She had some sent up - and here is the ironic thing - they were plastic! Is plastic unsafe?? My last comment on this is - Okay, if you are not going to provide drinking glasses (or plastic cups) wouldn't a very nice little sign next to the ice bucket explaining that save a lot of frustration on the part of the guest and extra time wasted on the phone with the staff? The rest of the details left us thinking that whoever designed this place and called the shots was either a practical joker, a newly minted graduate of "if everyone expects a zig, I'm gonna give them a zag" school, or a self appointed expert on the difference between a hotel and a resort.. It was quite comical at times to witness the huge disconnect between what this "resort" wants to be, and what well traveled patrons need it to be. The room lighting was interesting... switched all over the place, different combinations of light. We had fun with that one. Only FOUR drawers!! Are you kidding me?? So in a RESORT, are we supposed to live out of out suitcases? That makes no sense to me, but that's what we were forced to do.. The TV remote was almost non-functional. When I called about that, I was told that they were having a hard time getting the new ones - they were on back order. Again, hard to believe that that detail was overlooked..When I went to see if I could turn off the TV manually, I ran my fingers along the top and was covered in dust. Ah-chew! The restaurants were okay - Dinner at T-Bones was excellent, as was the wait staff. We also ate at the Mexican restaurant and the Italian restaurant. Food was good, but wait staff was not very personable. Professional yes, but not at all warm or friendly. We went the buffet for breakfast. Staff was very nice - I ordered a cup of coffee and a glass of milk - the waitress was so sweet and apologetic - as she told us they were out of milk and cream for the coffee. Huh?? She was finally able to get some cream for the coffee, but no milk. I felt bad for her, having to tell that to her customers. The room we had was at the very end of the hallway - and it was a LONG hallway. No elevators in the middle, they were only on one end of the hotel. We made jokes about that too. Then the final problem - and it was a big one. My husband's casino host "Joanie" had promised him that, based on his play, she could comp the room and mostly all of our food. When we went to check out, nothing was comped. Absolutely nothing. It was 7 am and we had a flight to catch - she was not in until noon. He ended up using a majority of his points - points that elevated him to the Chairman's Club - points that he had acquired over the years as a loyal patron of the Station Casinos. They almost all gone now. He was able to speak to her, and while she was apologetic and thought it was all taken care of, there was nothing she could do to replace those points. She told him that he could've put it on a credit card and she could've reversed that charge, but that information was too late. The reason I took the time to write this is: a) for a place whose lifeblood is hospitality, I am shocked at the number of details this "resort" missed and b) I was the one who suggested we try the Red Rock and my husband obliged. I feel obligated to let others know that this place does not deliver on any of it's visible promise. It looks good, but that's all it is..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Gordon808
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights for our company's convention. The decor is a beautiful mix of wood and stone work. The restaurants throughout the resort serve everything from sushi to steaks, seafood to a world cuisine buffet. The casino has a cheap feel and is VERY smoky. Deep roomy bathtubs with instant hot water. My only complaint on the rooms is that there is no way to open a window, so a/c or stale air are the options.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: djm36
Reviews.Content: We loved the Red Rock. It is in Summerlin which is about 20 to 30 minutes away from the strip but had everything we needed right at the resort. Free shuttle to the airport and strip were appreciated. Lots of food options and prices were very reasonable - definitely a good thing after seeing the prices on the strip. Food was good too. Rooms were clean, spacious and nicely decorated. Bathroom was well appointed - loved the tv over the bathtub! Lots of nice amenities. Pool area is fantastic - even though it was cool, we did spend some time just sitting around the pool area. Things we didn't like - glasses in room were not cleaned/replaced each day, fitness room/spa closed too early in the evening (7 pm) for us and the in room fridge was not available for us to use.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Fun + Zowie Bowie!”
Reviews.Author: adampotash
Reviews.Content: We went for Thanksgiving to be with family up in Vegas last week and had the opportunity to visit this suprisingly fun resort. The rooms were very nice, had great views of the Red Rock Mountains and it wasn't like being confined in a smokey casino the whole time. The gambling was "eh"...but we're not huge gamblers anyway. The drinks they serve at the gaming tables were on par with most other casinos (i.e. they stink.) But Red Rock does have ONE attraction on Friday nights that was amazing. It's a band called "Zowie Bowie!" I had seen this cover band perform here in AZ where I live several times in the past. But several years ago they were snatched up and started playing venues in Vegas. It was SO good to see them again!! They're just awesome. NO COVER charge either (first time I didn't have to pay to see them!) True, the drinks were un-Godly expensive in the club they played in - but where aren't they fortune in a venue like that? My wife and I danced til like 130am! Everyone there had so much fun. For a family - Red Rock has everything you could want and more...without the bank busting fees like some other resorts. They have a bowling alley, huge movie theatre, reasonable shops and lots of fun food places (so you don't have to waste $$ buying your kids food they wouldn't eat anyway.) Check out the resorts web page and you'll see why. The pool is pretty amazing too! While this resort/casino is off the strip - that is what makes it great! No traffic, no congestion, no throngs of people all around so you can't breathe. PLUS, up and down the road in both directions is plenty of great places to eat/shop as well. Seriously, google map it and check out the surroundings. There's even TONS of parks within a mile (literally) in the Summerlin residential area (the best one was "Vistas Park") that you can take kids to play basketball, baseball, playgrounds and/or just running around in grass fields. Don't expect all the glitz/glamour of Vegas (i.e. don't go here if your sole purpose is to gamble,) and you won't be disappointed. You can still dabble in the games but do so much more - at a much more reasonable rate!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Red Rock.”
Reviews.Author: Margielee2000
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay to enjoy a true resort experience with a fantastic casino. I enjoy the strip, but I love to escape it as well, and the Red Rock has all the strip glamor without the chaos. Food costs are a screaming deal with great quality!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: may2tripad
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very clean and comfortable great spa and gorgeous pool. It is a high end establishment you get what you pay for. The Buffet and Steak house are very good. Italian restaurant good food small portions expensive Grand Cafe is OK but often long waiting times reasonable cost. A distance from the strip but easy drive to get there

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: cdegalvis
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the RED ROCK from Nov 1st to 5th and had a wonderful stay! The staff is absolutely amazing! check in-out is super fast. Rooms are spacious and clean even thought I'm not into those dark colors decoration it was cool and different. TV use can be annoy I prefer when they keep it simple. The hotel is very far away from the Strip (25-30 mins because of the traffic) which is not so nice depending on what you are going to be up in Vegas. For me it was a pain because I went for an expo show and I had to come and go many times during the day and the traffic was heavy. The Kids Quest is SUPERB! my children loved it althought the ckeck-in takes FOR EVER! they can only stay up to 5 hrs and parents cannot leave the resort which was ok if you want to catch a movie or stay in the casino enjoy the pools or maybe just go to sleep but if you need to go somewhere else you cannot do that unless you pick up your kids. The Casino is lots of fun...I'm far away from beign a player but I did spend some time there and had a good time. The bar cocktails are HORRIBLE!!!! don't trhow your money away on cocktails! just get some wine or beer or whatever you want but not a cocktail!!!! There is also bowling lanes, cinema, arcade for the bigger ones, BINGO, food court (very good by the way) specially Ben & Jerry's!!! Food is super super good!!!! The buffet has lots of variety but the service is quite slow and not very nice. Also I find important to mention that the valet parking is free!!!!! but the internet is incredibly expensive $1 per minute at the bussines center! So that's about it. I had a pleasant stay and so did my children we all had a good time. Have a safe trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay--loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kfreebay
Reviews.Content: Stayed here attending a conference and had a wonderful experience. The location is about 20 minutes off The Strip, which was perfect. Still a very easy drive into the lights and excitement. Starting with the front desk staff--the woman checking us in was very accomodating and helpful finding us a room that would work best for us (and getting us the view we wanted). One note, if you have a choice of room location, pick one that is close to the elevator! Holy cow, the hallways are so long! The room was very clean, nicely decorated, HUGE bath tub which I love. It's a bummer that they're not allowed to have coffeemakers in the room (front desk person said it was a health code thing, but I wonder if it's because there's a Starbucks on the 2nd floor). Housekeeping did a great job during our stay and I appreciated being able to pick and choose what they did each day. We had a view of the outdoor pools and they were gorgeous, but it was cold while we were there so they weren't open. Used the gym twice and it was also very clean and nicely set up. Nice to walk on the treadmill with a nice view of the courtyard landscaping and lap pool. Plus complimentary water! Ordered breakfast from room service one day and the portion was very generous--especially at room service prices. The conference rooms where the convention was were also excellent and the hotel provided great refreshments all day long. Our evening conference activities were at the bowling alley and the Rocks Lounge and both were set up nicely. I'm not a gambler, but the casino was pretty large and not too much smoke luckily. I could go on, the amenities were quite substantial including a ton of restaurants (fast food and sit down), bars, etc. The staff was always very cordial and pleasant. Oh, the concierge services were FANTASTIC. We worked with 3 different women and they were all great. They would text us info if we were away from the hotel, they rented us a car, recommend GREAT seats for the Human Nature show, they made our trip a hundred times better than if we had tried to plan things ourselves. I'm hoping the conference is here again next year and I get to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ann W
Reviews.Content: My husband I and recently went to Las Vegas to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We stay at Red Rock Casino whenever we get a chance to. This hotel is one of the most beautiful ones we've ever been to. The location is way off the Strip, away from all the crowds. The rooms with a Red Rock Canyon view are awesome! Every time you look out the window, there's this spectacular view just for you. The entire hotel is a class-operation; the front desk crew is very friendly, the bell desk crew takes your luggage up and offers to get you ice or anything else you need, all the crew in the dining areas treat you like their only customers. It's easy to say we fell like 'VIP's' each and every time we are there. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Noise all night - Beware - No disclosure”
Reviews.Author: TravelingD
Reviews.Content: This resort ruined my stay with an undislosed wedding party band that played all night. Terrible. Front desk would do nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for a Business Conference”
Reviews.Author: OneAverageJoe
Reviews.Content: I attended a business conference at the Red Rocks resort and couldn't say enough about the hotel and grounds. The rooms feature tastful retro decor, are spacious and very comfortable. The hotel premise is incredible, which a fantastic pool area and many, MANY unique onsite restaurants. Had some of the best food ever just within the resort. The only potential negative is the location -- which is about 20 minutes from the strip. However, the hotel does offer free shuttle service every two hours to both the strip and the airport. Would definitely come back again and would recommend the resort to business conferences, business travellers, groups of friends and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean rooms away from strip”
Reviews.Author: waiomaogirl
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here with my husband at the end of October for 3 nights. It's about a 25 minute drive from the rental car facility. We used the valet service and checked in at 11pm on a Wednesday night. The guy at the check in counter was very slow. He typed slow and it took longer than usual to check us in. He explained that the hotel was full and that the room type we requested was not available. We wanted a non-smoking king room. We got a non-smoking two queen room instead. He told us we could switch rooms the next day if one was available. He also told us that because our first two nights were comped, we would have to pay $15 if we wanted internet access and $10 for access to the spa. The thing that I didn't understand was that if the resort fee was comped for our first two nights, why wasn't the internet and spa included?! Our third night (a Friday night), we got a rate of $79 and had to pay the $27.99 resort fee plus taxes. That's when he said that the internet was complimentary because we had to pay the resort fee. I told him he shouldn't call it complimentary since we were paying for it in the resort fee. Anyway, we were pretty upset with this new policy. Why send us a promotion for a free room and then nickel and dime us with additional fees to use the internet and spa? Besides all of that drama at check-in, our room was nice and spacious. It was halfway down the long hall. Thank goodness it wasn't further. We've stayed here before and it can be a long walk if you get a room at the end of the hallway. The bathrooms are ultra modern and clean. The shower door handle was a little loose, but the dual sinks were nice and convenient for us when getting ready in the morning. We did check out of the original room and checked into a king non smoking room the next afternoon. That room was basically the same as the two queen bed room, except with just one bed. We did try the Feast Buffet for dinner on a Thursday night. We went around 4:30pm and there was a short line. The food was OK for the great and reasonable price. I think it was around $14 for dinner. We went again for breakfast on Friday morning. The line was also short on Friday. There are two lines at the buffet - one for the hotel guests and VIP and the other for the general public. For $5, the breakfast was well worth it and there was a decent selection. We did try going for breakfast on Saturday morning, but the lines were just ridiculously long! Even the line for their Grand Cafe was long. That was a bit frustrating and disappointing, but I guess the weekend is a lot busier. There is a decent food court, movie theater, huge bowling alley, arcade, and kidquest play area. We didn't go the pool this time. We did some gambling here and it didn't treat us very well. The machines weren't very loose. There is a wide selection of machines and many new machines we haven't seen before. We had fun. Just wished our money lasted longer! We knew this hotel was far from the strip, but we've stayed here before and like the rooms. We had a rental car and were fine driving to the strip and other Vegas locations. Since our room was free the first two nights and only $79 the last night we don't have much to complain about. We were just disappointed that they wanted to charge us for the internet and spa access on those free nights. I guess that's the new policy for comped nights. The resort fee of $27.99 plus taxes is also steep for Vegas standards.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Howard H
Reviews.Content: Nicest resort in Las Vegas. Many restaurants with excellent food. Service is impeccable. Beautiful rooms with nice amenities.Poo/spa area is spectacular. lComplimentary shuttle to strip and airport. Casino area is spacious and attractive, with little smell of smoke. Bowling alley and movie theatre provide extra activities for a long stay. You won't want to leave the awesome views of the city at night and Red Rock Canyon in the daytime. Short trip to beautiful canyon. Also, this is a great area for hiking or running.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: Everything about Red Rock is first class, from the room decor to the pool to the spa to the restaurants to the casino and to the location. Away from the strip with no traffic and terrific access. T Bones is one of the finest chop houses ever, with a terrific wine list and the service is perfectly awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty/Greedy”
Reviews.Author: Mafism
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty, you can hear the elevator squeek through out the night...The $25 resort fee covers internet, but it is as slow as dial up, when you complain, they offer faster internet for $19.95...They expect you to pay $45 for decent internet. Also the casino was very smoky!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it is worth the drive anymore.”
Reviews.Author: AZ-Traveler85253
Reviews.Content: I think this is my 5th or 6th stay here....so I will keep it short. I stayed at M last month, so they have a high bar to meet. They didn't. Although I love the value of the buffet (as do the kids) and the movies and bowling, the customer service of the casino staff is never stellar. In fact, many of them don't ever talk. I hate that. In addition, our room must have been located near the main water pipes as we heard noise and rushing water all night. Very smokey too....much more than usual. I have reviewed this hotel several times, and while there are a lot of great things, I think I am going to skip the extra 30 minute drive from Phoenix and stay closer.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is goregous. Very modern decor, clean spacious bedrooms, great entertainment. The only downfall was very that this place is expensive. I was in town on business during my stay at The Resort, putting myself in the middleclass, this was way out of my price-range. The in room mini-bar was outrageous ($4 for a can of pepsi), there wasn't vending machines on the hotel floors. You get suckered into spending way more then you'd need to normally. But for superior price you get superior quality.

Reviews.Title: “chill out in comfort”
Reviews.Author: groomer1941
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Rock casino, just to take a breather from my busy schedule .I found the spa very relaxing ,with the whirlpool/steam and sauna and to end my session with a massage .The restaurant choices were great from casual to up-scale.The rooms were the best and the bed oh so comfy.I enjoyed the gambling area with video poker at its best .I would surely tell my friends and family that this is a great choice when making their plans Even with being off the strip the location is inviting ,with beautiful views of the red rock mountains and the fantastic view of the beautiful pools below.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Paopogi
Reviews.Content: One of my best and relaxed Vegas trip!I highly recommend this hotel they have one of the best SPA and buffet aside from excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpexted pleasure to stay at local hotel”
Reviews.Author: bingpark
Reviews.Content: I thought Red Rock Casino Hotel is local hotel with very limited entertainment since they are far away from strip and many local people eats and have some fun with games. But my experience last week when I stayed at the hotel, Red Rock Hotel was top performing hotel in Las Vegas. It was very unexpected pleasure to find comfotable bed with amenities just right for you. I will definitely recommend Red Rock Casino Hotel as the one of the Top Rated Hotel in entire Las Vegas Area. James Park Realtor

Reviews.Title: “a change from 'the strip'”
Reviews.Author: newlydiate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2010. We had a room on the 19th floor we took forever to reach from the elevator. The room was nice, however we had just come from the Sanctuary in Paradise Valley, AZ, so we couldn't help compare the room to that, so we felt the room was 'ok'. It had 2 beds, huge windows so we had views of 'the strip' in the distance. Nice bathroom area, shower, bath & separate loo. Don't move the in room drinks and snacks, or you will be charged. No in room coffee either, so a long trip downstairs to Starbucks for our morning coffee's. A long walk to the pool area, which is huge, 10 pools, loads of comfy loungers/double bed loungers, drinks at the pool were expensive $20 for a pina coloda and a coke ! Casino was great, we love the penny slots, didn't eat at the hotel restaurant & only discovered on our last night here there is a huge food court area! The strip is about 10 miles away, straight down Charleston Blvd, which is a very busy road and can take about 30 mins. We enjoyed our stay here, but wouldn't stay again as we like to try out new places.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Ke C
Reviews.Content: Great venue! Comfortable rooms, great tub, cool casinos, great restaurants, loved the movie theatre!

Reviews.Title: “Your best bet in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Wallabyguy
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of selections in Vegas when it comes to hotels/ resorts. I have defaulted in the past to those on The Strip simply for access. This last time I was in Vegas for a convention that was being held at Red Rock. It's about 20 minutes from the strip but my friends who have been there and reviews have all praised it so I was kind of looking forward to it. Frankly, while I still love to party, Vegas can wear at you and knowing I was going to be there for a week, it seemed perfectly reasonable to have a sanctuary from the craziness. As it turns out, I hit the strip the first night and never went back. Red Rock really has it all in one place. Unlike some of the Strip casinos which figure if they have a hotel, gaming area and some spa they can call themselves a "Resort", the Red Rock actually feels like one. The pool is magnificent. The array and quality of the restaurants is excellent. While the casino isn't the best I've seen, it's as good as the upper tier on the Strip. The standard hotel rooms put to shame anything in the same range on the Strip. 42" flat screens in the bed room, a tv over the SOAKING tub, 2 person shower, modern yet tasteful furniture.... The rooms are simply stunning. And remember, these are the STANDARD rooms. Upgraded rooms are spectacular. The only room complaints were having to pay for internet service and a handle on the show which while it worked, would come off. Security is good and you never feel there are any concerns. Staff was a mixed bag. Everyone at the restaurants were very good. Front desk was also pretty impressive. Business Center, well, not as helpful and kind of snippy but we all have off days and I chalk it up to simply just her being off. She seemed nice just in a rotten mood and thus less than helpful. We ate at T-Bones (steakhouse), Italian, Yardhouse and "cafe" while there and all were very good. We tried all the bars and the Yardhouse became the goto-point during the stay. The Cafe was the best all-around option for breakfast and lunch. prices were good and food above average to excellent. We didn't have anything bad there. The Steakhouse was nice but VERY expensive and I still believe that Mon Ami Gabi at Paris is the best value in the city in that regard with better steaks than T-Bones. The Italian restaurant was a nice surprise. We were told by one of the staff to avoid the Mexican so we did. Red Rock runs a free shuttle to and from the airport and the strip so you're covered there as well. Overall an excellent property and now our default when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Too big, too spendy, too pretentious.”
Reviews.Author: SeasPlaces
Reviews.Content: This is a huge property with multiple outdoor swimming pools and a large casino. It is a beautiful place and the room was great except for the walk and annoyance of extra charges. Everything is an extra charge and not worth it, in my opinion. The minibar fridge is stocked and there are snacks on the table for purchase; however, be warned -- if you displace them for more than 45 seconds they have sensors that automatically bill your room. I found this annoying. I had to be careful to not disturb their "for sale" items, and that left me uncomfortable. I couldn't use the fridge without disturbing their items and generating a sale, so I asked for another fridge. It was delivered for another charge -- $15 per night -- and had no freezer, just a chiller. The chiller smelled funky so I had to put it in the bathroom to avoid breathing the smell all night. Internet service is an extra $15 to $20 plus taxes per night. Not allowed to use the luggage cart; only bellman can do that, and of course a tip is expected. Self parking was a walk away, so I used valet service. Good but again, more tips. The restaurant was ridiculously expensive for what was delivered and everything is alle carte. $48 for a medium size steak with no sides, $12 to $15 for sides and salads. The food was nice but not nice enough for the price, in my opinion. The multiple, beautiful swimming pools are all outside and no one was using them because it was too cool outside. No real need for an exercise room if you book the far end of the hotel. One bank of elevators on the far end of a very large hallway -- a design flaw. A fine place to stay if you can through money or Station points/credits away but if that is you, I hope you consider a more moderate location and giving some money away to help people out of work or in need of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: George C
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay at the Red Rock Resort very very much and found being off the strip was not a problem as every accomodation was available to get to and from the strip when you wanted to go we also enjoyed the Red Rock entertainment as well as the food .there were lots of other activities available to us if we chose to use them ,which we did rather than going out of the hotel .overall we totally enjoyed our stay at the Red Rock Resort and would heartily reccommend it to anyone going to Vegas for buisiness or pleasure .I am sure you will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay @ Red Rock, Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: This was our first time stay @ Red Rock Casino in Las Vegas. It's quite a ways from the strip. We arrived and check in was a breeze. Our room was like a mile away from the elevators. Gosh, we walked and walked to our room! It was nice room with 2 beds, a chaise lounge chair, plasma TV, closet, big marble bathroom with a walk-in shower and a separate room for the toilet. There is a resort fee at this hotel per day. It was $27/day! Pretty pricey. I like that I could access the free wifi in the room and that was about it. Bed was too soft for me. Plasma TV was a pain. Had to go near it to change channels. My biggest peeve is the door to the bathroom. What designer came up with a translucent door to the bathroom!?! When someone is in the bathroom, the light shines through the door and that bothers me. I had to ask for an extra blanket so that I could cover that door! No kidding. Buffet was OK. Not that fantastic but edible. Like the oxtail soup. Casino - not bad. Weekends - lots of locals at this casino and makes it very busy. Adds to the atmosphere. Food court - had Capriotti's Sandwiches. Had the Capstrami Sub. Great! My only peeve - there was a field trip or something of a group of high-school kids all wearing the same T-shirt. Some of these teenagers were hogging the tables and chairs and it was difficult to get a table or a chair!

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful time at Red Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Earinea W
Reviews.Content: I was having a stay break at the Red Rock. I live in Las Vegas my experience at the Red Rock is one of the best times I've had since I moved here 12 years ago. My daughter and me enjoyed everything about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kim W
Reviews.Content: From the pleasant airport shuttle ride, to the gorgeous red doors closed behind us on our way out, everything at the Red Rock was amazing. We were there for a conference, and yet were able to find plenty of pleasure in the off hours. The spa is amazing, and the employees at the spa were wonderful! The numerous restaurants and bars, along with multiple Starbucks made us extremely comfortable. The rooms are amazing as well. The deep bath tub with a tv to watch while soaking was perfect after a long day walking The Strip. The enormous size of the room made us feel less like we were in a hotel, and more like we were at home. The beds were so comfortable I almost hated to go home!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gracious hotel and conference center”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Red Rock for the E-Agent Summit was just wonderful. I cannot say enough about the accommodations, the staff, the meeting and conference areas, the restaurants we went to and the fun we had. We plan on returning on our own with family soon. Thank you Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: I_am_retired_early
Reviews.Content: If you are more interested in hiking and quiet than the glitz of the Vegas strip, then this is the place for you. The resort is 10 miles from the Vegas action. The hotel is more understated than hotels on the Strip. Modern, good restaurants and spacious rooms. Good place for conferences if you do not want to be distracted by the rest of Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasing the non-gambler at a casino”
Reviews.Author: jim r
Reviews.Content: The hotel is off the strip. The registration desk and hotel entry is in the back of the hotel, so you are separated from the gaming completely, when you enter. You can walk to the elevator and take it to your room, never hearing a dinging slot machiine or the roar of the craps table. (Yay! Craps) The room was perfect to relax in. Perfect for the gambler married to the non-gambler to have a great romantic stay together.

Reviews.Title: “Love Red Rock Casino”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth E
Reviews.Content: We went to Red Rock for the first time to celebrate my husbands birthday. Could not have been happier. Our room was so specious, clean, bed was so comfy, the bathroom was huge. The food was so good, we were never disappointed in the restaurants or the Buffet. We did not have enough days and time to visit all the restaurants but the Grand Cafe for Breakfast and dinner was really good, hugh portions, never disappointed. Sunday Brunch Buffet was fantasic, could not believe the selection of food they had and it was not just good, honestly it was delicious. Yardhouse was also good. We did not make it to the Steak house but next time we will, heard it was great. We also golf at the public course at Red Rock, nice course. Had a blast glambling, listening to music and dancing. Everyone is so nice and makes you feel special. We have stayed at two other Station Casino's in the past before we came to Red Rock and we do not see ourselves staying anywhere but the Red Rock Casino. Thank you Red Rock

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: sjloncari
Reviews.Content: Fantastic accommodations! The location is amazing -- not on or near the strip, but surrounded by many great restaurants and shopping, and just a short drive to the beautiful and scenic Red Rock Canyon. You will definitely need a car. The casino offers everything you could want in gaming along with a non-glitzy environment. Restaurant offerings range from high-end restaurants to a very good, budget-friendly food court. This is our number one choice for places to stay in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “The Red Rock Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Robert R
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at the Red Rock and it is the only place we stay when in Vegas. It is off the Vegas strip, but worth the effort. The hotel, casino and restaurants are always clean and the overall design is beautiful. It is close to the Red Rock canyon conservation area that has a wonderful visitor center, great hiking, and a nice scenic drive.

Reviews.Title: “Best room I've stayed in in years!”
Reviews.Author: Bizygrrl
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, spacious accommodations! This is the nicest room I've stayed in in years. The hotel has a great selection of restaurants and entertainment. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “"A hotel where you can be pampered"”
Reviews.Author: Domenica H
Reviews.Content: Everything about Red Rock is awsome. The variety of foods so you don't even have to leave the hotel to go out for dinner. The pool is gorgous. The rooms and beds are phenomenal. The staff is super friendly and helpful. Also try the spa treatments. They are wonderful. The scenery is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas10/2011”
Reviews.Author: Heaven142
Reviews.Content: We could not believe the view of the Canyon from our room. And what a room it was. Very very nice and 5 Star nice. The best part of our stay was the attitude of all the employees. When we started to leave the bellman that came for our luggage was very helpful. I asked if he knew where a local branch of Bank of America was located. He pulled out his smart phone and called BOA, got the address and provided directions to its location for me. Now that is service. We have stayed here three times and it keeps getting better and better. Highly reccommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Wayne Derek
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay and play. Wonderful people and a great property. If you don't want the crazy madness of the Las Vegas Strip then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: candy b
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property with a great location. We always spend one night here when visiting Las Vegas. We love the modern decor of the hotel and rooms, and the casino is huge with a nice variety of video poker and slots. The pool area is one of the prettiest we've seen and the views from the rooms are spectacular. We've had rooms from both sides of the hotel (Red Rock and Strip View) and they are both excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from the chaos of The Strip or Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Janice H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Red Rock many times. We love the area. No traffic or crowds. The rooms are large and well cared for. Several features are standard that we've seen nowhere else. For instance, how many hotels have you seen with a huge marble tub with a TV on the wall? There are several restaurants as well as a food court, bowling alley, movie theater, Starbucks x 2, keno lounge, sports book, the fabulous pools, cabanas, spa...pretty much everything is right there. It's a great place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock rules”
Reviews.Author: Christian P
Reviews.Content: Sunrise at Red Rock rules. Sooo beautiful on the pool side of the casino. Friendly staff was courteous and efficient. Wish there was a bit more variety in table games, but I never really had trouble getting a seat, so what is there to complain about? One of the best casino stays I've ever had, really.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Casino and Resort is da best”
Reviews.Author: Diego P
Reviews.Content: Our family loves this place. We go about 3 to 4 times a year. They have a great kids center (kids quest) where we can leave the kids while we go out to dinner or gamble. They have a movie theater and bowling. Plus the people there are great. Oh I forgot to mention how awesome their concerts are, we just saw Enrique Igelesis there. It is a bit far from the strip, but we hardly go to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TammyBee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four days. Was very nice hotel with beautiful swimming pools (but they closed at 6pm), and incredible view of the mountains. The bathroom was all marble, and was very elegant with very good water pressure and a HUGE bathtub with separate shower. Only two complaints: the design at the entry is round and quite confusing trying to get to the hotel elevators, and the location of the elevators was quite a walk to our room. Next time I stay here, I will make sure I get a room closer to the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great place away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SandraQuebec
Reviews.Content: For approximately $200/night, it was a pretty good deal. Our room was quite large (I'd say about 20' X 30'). The view from our 18th floor panoramic windows was stupendous, looking straight out at the Las Vegas skyline 13 miles away. The hotel is very pretty and run like a well-oiled machine. The decor is decidedly contemporary and, unlike most Strip hotels, has been spared the over-the-top kitch that seems so popular in that area. Clean and well designed, the place sparkles. Our only disappointment were the restaurants. Although we tried out the best ones offered at the Red Rock, none met our culinary standards. I have to say though, that the decor of each restaurant was most impressive. Too bad the chefs they hired weren't up to task. But I would certainly recommended the hotel in all other categories.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property Bad change in policy”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch property with good food, nice modern rooms. However a recent change in policy if you are on a casino comp, (free room) you now have to pay for the daily "resort fee" which used to be waived. Or pay ala carte for the services. Almost 30.00 a day Im am against mandatory resort fees as the advertised room price is then completely misleading and straight out inaccurate! How can i compare a rate here with, for example, caesars. Both advertise the same rate BUT Red Rock, as with stations Casinos" charge a MANDATORY resort fee you must investigate before booking as it can add almost 30.00 a day to your rate and is not clearly posted. I cannot believe this practice is legal Quality food, excellent service and top notch property but for the resort fee nonsense I will choose another property.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: ptutini
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. The Red Rock Casino is miles and miles from the action on the Strip, the room rates are totally unjustified, and our experience was not particularly good. The room was large, comfortable and dirty; the TV did not work properly; the "view of the Strip" was possible if you had binoculars. If you simply wanted to sit at gaming tables, this place is ok. But for the same money, you can be downtown at a premier casino.

Reviews.Title: “"No free Lunches" - 4 Star Facilities, but in our experience on 2 Star Service...”
Reviews.Author: MrMannsExperiences
Reviews.Content: Long way off the strip, there is a shuttle bus, but last leaves Fashion Show Mall at 10pm.... This is Vegas!..... Room big, tidy and well presented. Rather good big bed and nice view of the strip. $30 a day "Resort fee", gets you internet for only ONE device per room, your room WI-FI does not work by the Pool, please pay again........ Gym advertised to be open, according to documentation in the room, from 6am till 8pm. Went down at 7pm, to be told it was closed..... Outdoor pool area is very very nice, really impressive. BUT pool closed at 3pm when we were there. Eating in the "Royal Cafe" was disappointing, waited for a table to be cleared because we wanted to sit outside, but we were forgotten about, sat down 25mins later, got menus, then forgotten about again. Took an hour and a half to eat breakfast, good job we were not in a rush. High points were the driver of the shuttle bus, "Ian" the only real example of great service we had in 4 days. During our stay, the place was really really quiet. Feel that the staff could not really be bothered. Overall would not go back, I think it is far better to stay on the strip and pay a bit more. Ideal for people who are going to Vegas, but do not want to stay in Vegas, seems rather strange to me.

Reviews.Title: “Super Red Rock Casino Resort Trip!”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the beautiful Red Rock Casino and Resort and had a fantastic experience! Beyond the numerous gaming opportunities, the resort has an incredible environment with many choices for the whole family. In addition to the first-class theatre complex, bowling lanes, and arcade, the pool area is truly a feast for sun enthusiasts. The eateries are varied and can meet just about anyone's taste buds; although we really liked Happy Hour at the Yard House, where they have half-off specials. The room was gorgeous and the view of the Strip was breathtaking, The Resort has all of the availability of Vegas, without the traffic and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Rock for a conference in October 2011. In the grand scheme of things, my stay was perfect. Sure, there were a couple of hiccups, but nothing to blemish the experience. The room was great (19th floor on the "rocks" side). Plenty of space and the bathroom... I could have stayed just in the bathroom... was incredible. The tub was maybe 2 1/2 feet deep, great for soaking and the TV above the tub kept me from getting board. Separate big shower with great hot water and volume. All of it (including the double sinks) beautifully tiled in marble. Speaking of marble, the overall Architectural Finishes in the entire property are top-notch. In simple conversations with more than a few people, they all commented on the fantastic finishes. This is a beautiful, well maintained property. The wireless worked fine and was fast enough to use my VOIP to make calls home. Had two meals in the Grand Cafe and three in the LBS joint (I say "joint" with all the due respect and love a classic hamburger "joint" deserves)! The food at the Grand Cafe was spot on and the Plain Jane burger at LBS was exactly what a high quality burger should be (flavor oozing out of the thing and about two stages from still being on the hoof (as in RARE, just as ordered)). The crispy French Fry's were the perfect compliment to the perfect burger. So, for a hiccup? Service was a bit slow in the Grand Cafe. This is a Stations property and I've seen this "bit slow" service at other Stations properties. I'm not sure if it was on the wait staff side, or the cook side of the house, but it did take more time that I expected to order and receive my food than I would expect, given the number of people that were seated. The food was great, just the wait time was a bit long. I guess there was only the one hiccup. The conference was a "go all out" sort of thing, so didn't get to spend too much time in the Casino. The play I was able to work in was fun and while I didn't "break the bank", I didn't walk out broke either. :-) I really don't gamble though. I just spend money on being entertained in the only individual sport where the participants can still smoke and drink, besides maybe fishing. At least with slots, you don't have to clean anything when you get home. Maybe it's time for an Olympic Slot Tournament Team. The conference facilities were top-notch. There were almost 600 attendees at this conference and all the facilities were well lit, well laid out, comfortable (not to cold/not to warm) and in good condition. The projection screens were high enough that even those in the back had a good view. When it was time to split the conference room into three separate rooms, it was pulled off without a hitch and in about 20 minutes. If your organization ever needs a conference facility, tell the organizer to get on the phone with Red Rock quick :-) So, for the overall rating... On those goofy grading scales of from 1 to 10 (with 10 being the best), I'm hard pressed to ever give anything a 10. My stay at the Red Rock was absolutely an 11 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Super Experience at the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: NHLfan0212
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six days at the Red Rock as part of a business meeting. The hotel facilities were great. The staff was outstanding in meeting all our business and personal needs. There were great restaurants at the hotel and in the surrounding area and plenty of things to do. The casino was also very good. We had a GREAT experience at the Red Rock. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: JMDAXP
Reviews.Content: Been to the Red Rock many times over and it's always a great time. ( The property is beautiful and quite classy.) The Bowling Alley, Movie Theater, and Pool are great! Don't forget to dine at "T-Bone's Chophouse", which has an amazing 24oz Ribeye, and a spectacular wine list! Had dinner last night. Great service and food, much thanks to Darlene & Ricardo for their attentiveness, and professionalism! Joshua & Camilla

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Experience”
Reviews.Author: piggy909
Reviews.Content: Always top notch service and all the amenities in one place. Off the strip which is great and ample parking.

Reviews.Title: “Red rock resort is for me the best hotel I know”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: I spent 20 years working in hotel management in Europe and the Carribean, the Red Rock Resort is exactly how a hotel should be, every conceivable facility and service is provided the staff ate well trained and seem genuinely pleased to be there and proud of what they have. It's cool, clean and very impressive, my second time there and yes I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Brett A
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a bunch of buddies for a Golf Weekend, but I've been coming to the Red Rock for years. Super comfortable rooms, great Casino action, T Bone Restaraunt is superb, and Sports Book is one of the best. Property isn't too smokey, either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kpacaro
Reviews.Content: We had a awesome time! The resort exceeded our expectations. It us even child friendly. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Ann D
Reviews.Content: Came for a conference and was so pleased to be off the Strip. The rooms are large and well appointed. The banquet food was EXCELLENT. The staff is gracious. And do plan on the shuttle as the taxi ride is pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Great Massage!”
Reviews.Author: cre8dnrg
Reviews.Content: Came to Red Rock for my birthday weekend. What a great surprise, although the hotel is about 15 min. West of the strip, it's WORTH it! They have a shuttle if you don't want to drive in and out as well. The hotel is gorgeous, clean, very nice and modern. Comfy beds, great staff and reasonably priced... The spa is one of the best I've experienced. Had a couples massage and hour and half pedicures...amazing! The pools are beautiful.... can't wait to come back for a concert and spa experience! There's a casino and great restaurants as well. This was a FIND!

Reviews.Title: “There's more to Vegas than the strip!”
Reviews.Author: strongC
Reviews.Content: Had a conference here from Monday to Thursday. Arrived on Saturday and stayed in a hotel on the strip. Was afraid to miss something. Transfered on Monday. WHOA! What a pleasant surprise! Movie theaters, bowling alley and great food? Even if you're not a gambler, there's plenty to keep you occupied. Pool area is outstanding. This is DEFINITELY a serious contender for a future visit. Just work your jaunts to the strip around the free shuttle if you can. The difference in quality of the hotel is well worth it. Oh! And VIP Services truly go out of their way.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel/Casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Alan W
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I have stayed at many Vegas properties (Luxor, The Hotel and Mandalay Bay, Planet Hollywood, New York New York, MGM Grand) and this is my favorite by far. But, it probably isn't for everyone. Here is my suggestion. If you have never been to Vegas before, stay on the Strip. Planet Hollywood is a good one. BUT, if you have been before, and just want the luxury and fun of Vegas, stay here. Best pool in Vegas. Buffet is good. Casino is nice (although there was one rude cocktail waitress, but oh well). Amazing rooms. Good views. But it is off the Strip. You would probably want either to rent a car, or else just be okay with spending most of your time here (which by all means is a great way to spend your time!). All you need is right here.

Reviews.Title: “Read the contract you sign when you check in because they won't make it right if there is a mistake...”
Reviews.Author: Mfecker
Reviews.Content: ...even if it is their mistake. When I booked through a coordinator for a conference I attended at the hotel, my stay was scheduled for two days. When I checked in no one verified those details with me. When I checked out, they said we have you checking out tomorrow and I will be charged for the extra night because of their cancellation policy. Apparently someone dropped the ball when recording the reservation and when checking me in. However they didn't want to take any responsibility or care about their customers. This is compounded by the hotel being booked for this extra night so it would take all of an hour before that room would be picked up. Then they thought they could charge me for the extra night and check me out of the room so they could sell that room again. Unbelievable how money hungry with a complete disregard for their customers satisfaction they are. I will not be coming back, nor will my company. There are so many other options in much better locations in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas .. Away from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: beeclean
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two night stay at the Red Rock. We chose this property since we were coming to Las Vegas to see a concert that was taking place at the hotel. Under normal circumstances we would stay at the Wynn/Encore. However, this hotel definitely rivals either of those properties. It has a very upscale vibe from the moment you enter. The main lobby is understated, with an elegant lobby bar in the background, and soothing music being piped in. Our room faced the canyon. As such there was no reference to being in Las Vegas. It was a spectacular view, and quite a contrast from the flashing lights of the strip. The room was well appointed and comfortable, if a little bit small. The bathroom was also well stocked with high end amenities. The casino has a casual feel, with an incredibly friendly staff. This cuts both ways. It’s very comfortable, but you may miss the glitz associated with the high end strip hotels. Pros: Off strip means quiet relaxed environment Large sunny pool area Restaurant options at all price levels Excellent attentive staff Plenty of kid/family entertainment available Cons: Pool closes at 4:00 on concert days. HORRIBLE decision Off strip means fewer entertainment options. No robes or coffee maker in room Consistently slow service at all restaurants visited (except the non casino owned ‘Yard House”) Overall I would recommend the Red Rock if you want a change of pace from the strip, or are looking for a quieter Las Vegas experience. They treat all guests like royalty, and the casino attracts a friendly clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute at Red Rock Casino & Spa”
Reviews.Author: googooplex
Reviews.Content: Totally away from the Strip and for me this was a big bonus. The room with 2 large doubles was spacious, scrupulously clean, the beds were comfortable and the linen was of a very good quality. Everything was of an extremely high standard, including the toiletries. The bathroom with twin basins was brightly polished marble was huge as was the tub. The shower had excellent pressure and we never had a problem with hot water. The room was quiet and we barely heard our neighbours. Admittedly, the massive wall window had a view of a desert parking lot, but who cares? The casino was a casino, I'm not big on gambling so ..... The use of the gym and spa was included in the price and though the hot sauna wasn't especially hot, the eucalyptus steam room was great after a session on the tread mill. The pool area was relaxing and fun and there are plenty of places to eat throughout the resort. I'd give the Grand Cafe a miss; I ate there once, our meals were over priced and largely inedible, the wait staff were indifferent to our concerns about the meal and we had to ask for the bill several times. But the Buffet Feast was a plus, it wasn't Cordon Bleu but good hearty fare and LOTS of it at very reasonable prices. With a cinema, bowling alley a few nearby shops, the pool area, the spa and gym; Red Rock Casino & Spa is definitely a place to return to. Word of caution, we had a mid-week trip, not sure what the pool would be like over the weekend. Otherwise, loved every minute. Another word....watch out for the snacks and mini bar, they are on a pressure sensor; you get automatically charged if you pick up an item for more than 20 seconds!! The Red Rock canyon nearby has some amazing hikes, not especially well sign posted but if you manage to tag along with people who know the route (as we did) you'll have a challenging but enjoyable hike. We did the Calico Tanks hike.

Reviews.Title: “Love Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: kcarta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Labor Day weekend and loved the resort. We loved it so much, that we booked their Canyon Suite for our wedding next March. While it is not close to the Strip (as many others have stated), the convenient shuttle is available. Honestly, after a nice dinner on the Strip, I could only handle 30-60 minutes of the crowds before wanting to get back to the oasis of Red Rock. The pool, lobby, casino and bars were beautiful. The restaurants were delicious (we ate at T-Bones, the italian restaurant, and the breakfast cafe.) The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is our room smelled smokey, even after they defumed it. We had upgraded to a suite and apparently they do not limit smoking on any of their suites. Tough luck on our part. Did I mention the service was outstanding, though? They really did seem ready to drop everything to make sure our stay was enjoyable. They discounted our room substantially due to the smoke, and offered for us to move rooms after the first night (none available the first night being a holiday weekend), but we chose to avoid that hassle.

Reviews.Title: “My Red Rock Experience”
Reviews.Author: Meriam S
Reviews.Content: OMG!! This place is fabulous!!! The staff was incredible, the hotel was simple marvelous, so much to do. The room decor was out of this world!!! I would recommend this place to anyone, It was a great way to escape the hustle of being on the strip. The room gave a great view of the Canyon. It was also walking distance to some stores for shopping. Just a wonderful experience all around!

Reviews.Title: “This will become a favorite!”
Reviews.Author: yolos
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at Red Rock 4 years ago when I attended a conference. At first, I wasn't too thrilled that it was off the Strip: That said, I have returned to Red Rock every time I visit Las Vegas which is at least twice or more a year. It is absolutely one of my favorite destinations! The hotel accomodations, the service, the food options and, of course, the casino, are the BEST!. I've stayed at all the big casino hotels on the Strip, from Caesars to Paris, and Red Rock is on an equal playing field with them. You need to know that my husband is NOT a gambler and I am. Yet, he loves to come with me to Red Rock. There is so much for him to do here that doesn't include gambling. The pool rivals any 5 star resort anywhere. The variety of restaurant is incredible. What do want? Sushi, burgers, upscale dining, a restaurant with over 100 kegs of beer on tap (Yard House)? If you want a movie theater or bowling..Red Rock has it on premise. The health spa is great and we always find time to work out (a little) before we start our day. My husband almost forgets that I'm here to gamble! For those who like to gamble, the Station Casino Player's Club has some of the most generous comps I've encounterd. Come for one visit and you will get comps for something. If I sound like an advertisement for Red Rock, it's okay. I love this place and I tell all my friends they need to spend some time here. It's such a short drive (15 mins) and worth every minute. This 55 yr old plus couple loves Red Rock! And we will always visit on every one of our Vegas trips.

Reviews.Title: “Why is this hotel rated so highly?”
Reviews.Author: TiTiTG
Reviews.Content: Although this resort is rated quite highly with Trip Advisor reviewers, I would urge you to be cautious when booking. I was very excited about the possibility of staying here after reading all the reviews, but extremely disappointed after my stay here this past weekend. The staff was extremely friendly and the room service was very good. The room was quite nice and the bathroom was amazing. BUT... I brought my niece with me, who wanted to use the facilities while I was attending a conference at the hotel. Both days she was there the pool was closed at 3:00pm because of the evening's concert. We were not told at any time the pool would be closed so early. The true horror were the concerts on Friday and Saturday nights. They started at 7:00 and 8:00pm and ended at 11:00 and 12:00pm. Because the concerts were right outside the hotel, we could hear everything as if we were down in the stands itself. I cannot begin to describe how loud this was. I called the front desk and asked them what was going on the first night and was told the music would be going on until 2:00am. I don't know about all of you, but I don't appreciate staying at a hotel and not being told of what would be happening on the hotel ground that would affect our stay. I didn't sleep for the two nights I was there. I would NEVER EVER EVER stay at this hotel again, nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sacrificeofvictor
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel. The rooms are large and are very clean. The in room amenities such as drinks, snacks, liquor and other items are available to you if you are willing to pay for them. The bathrooms are very nice. Nice big bathtub with a mini flatscreen tv attached to the wall near it. Score!! I love the seperate glass shower. They have great restaurants at many differnt price points. There is a great pool there too! It's an easy property to manuever, and has a great casino. I love this place. Great staff and service at this as well. Everyone is very accommodating. I'll defeinitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: 619pride
Reviews.Content: Poor Customer service upon arrival. The lady didn't greet us or smile and just waited for us at the registration counter. Other then that, everything else was great. A great hotel if your not planning to visit the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Iddy64
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed in Vegas many times and our stay at Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa made this trip our most enjoyable ever--without ever having to leave the luxury and safety of the property. The staff/ customer service and esp our casino host were wonderful. The upscale accommodations/pool/spa, casino, restaurants, entertainment and activities--provided for an outstanding stay. Red Rock has it all! My husband & I agree that we will definitely be back to Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa next vacation and for many to come.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jlo29
Reviews.Content: Amazing services, friendly staff and emaculate rooms are what you look forward to when arriving at Red Rock Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Deb S
Reviews.Content: Went to Red Rock Resort for a business seminar. A wonderful trip over-all! Comfortable rooms, attentive staff, great business accomodations! I'm planning on staying there with my family during our next trip to Vegas! A perfect alternative to staying at The Strip, and if you want, there is a free shuttle that will take you down there, as well as to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ruthieg1944
Reviews.Content: Staying at Red Rock was one of the best experiences I've had. We typically come to Vegas for a total of 2 weeks each year. This is by far the best place to stay. The casino and hotel are outstanding and the close-up views of the mountains are breathtaking. It is so relaxing to be off the Strip but still have world class gambling right there. Awesome best describes Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “I Love Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: h0nulady
Reviews.Content: We stayed just 2 days and 1 night but it was wonderful, the staff, the service, the rooms.....wish we stayed the whole week!!!! We moved to "downtown" after and what a downer!
