I could've stayed in the room only and enjoyed myself, it was so comfortable,and the view was beautiful!!!! We will definitely stay again!!! Love Red Rock!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: VickiC147
Reviews.Content: The place is awesome! The Strip has nothing to offer that would keep me from staying at Red Rock. The service I received was outstanding in all areas of the resort and casino. Lots of machines that I like to play and an outstanding poker room for my husband. Oh yes, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Diana L
Reviews.Content: E IT THERE AND WILL ALWAYS STAY THERE. THEY ARE VERY FRIENDLY THEIR RESTAURANTS ARE OUTSTANDING AND WE EVEN WIL ON THE SLOTS!!!! WHO CAN We love staying at the Red Rock. It's the only Hotel we stay at. We have stayed there three times in the last 18 mos. We plan to go back for Super Bowl. The restaurants are the best especially T-Bones!!! The service is great and the Hotel is so clean. Its in the Summerlin area its all new in that area very upscale!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay but avoid T Bones”
Reviews.Author: DebraJG
Reviews.Content: Having visited Red rock resort on previous occasions as a day visitor we took advantage of the fantastic rates offered by the my vacation offer whilst in vegas recently. Overall the hotel is superb, Room brilliant, the height of comfort and luxury and the pool area wonderful, relaxing and stunning aesthetically. The Feast buffet has to be one of the best in vegas for both value and quality.Don't worry about the quality of the $6 bottles of house wine-its fine!!! The only negatives I would offer would be that the staff were not quite as warm as at the Aliante Station where we stayed subsequently and the generally poor experience at the T Bones Chophouse. They took quite a while to seat us, the food generally took a long while to come and was way too salty. The manager came over and spoke to us and said that due to the service failure we would be comped a dessert- we did not have a dessert but a couple of coffees instead and they did not even give us those free. The whole bill came to just over $200 including $60 dollars for a very indifferent bottle of wine . Save your money and visit the Voodoo Lounge , Beso or MRKT at the Aliante Station instead. Being English we did not complain which we should definately have done and it just added a very slightly sour taste to an otherwise near perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and pool.”
Reviews.Author: Aesowisl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a more low key,less crowded vibe then the red rock is for you. The rooms are beautiful and very modern with gorgeous marble bathrooms. It is basically all you need in one building. Tons of restaraunts to chose from and other activities to choose from besides gambling. They have a bowling alley, movie theater and arcade for children. Also a food court for a much cheaper and faster dining experience. I would highly recommend the red rock to anyone who is looking to relax in a great environment. Definetly the nicest hotel in Vegas by far.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaTlv
Reviews.Content: As a Las Vegas local, I've been to many hotel/casinos both on and off the Strip. Red Rock is by far my favorite place. The rooms are nicer than any I've seen on the Strip. They have a better variety of machines and with their new Boarding Pass program, you get more for every dollar you spend. They have great restaurants and bars/lounges. And the service at all of their venues is impeccable! I would recommend Red Rock to all my friends and family coming to visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful off the strip elegance”
Reviews.Author: Christyy41
Reviews.Content: I came here for a business convention, i have been to Vegas multiple times but have never stayed off the strip. I loved. it. First you dont have that super long impersonal check in line and attitude that you find at a lot of Vegas hotels. From the moment you pull up, there are doormen and courteous helpful staff. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby and downstairs bar are elegant without being over the top. The rooms are fantastic, large and comfortable with a TV over the tub. :-) The bed is comfortable too, the rooms are much better than the hotels on the strip. There are many good restaurants in house, a casino, entertainment, spa and a lovely lush landscaped pool area. It is a bit expensive to take a cab to the strip if you have plans to go to a show but they do have a shuttle service available. The convention area was well marked and spacious. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME time....”
Reviews.Author: Monic L
Reviews.Content: This is a great place.....We stayed 4 nights, and enjoyed every minute of it. We relasxed, had a spa day, ate at T-bones(great food), and also at the Yardhouse....GREAT too....and visited a couple other places to eat. All were VERY good and the service was terrific. We were ther for a reunion that was held at the Red Rock. We did have a chance to go tot he Strip, but really have not a desire to stay there. We got our share when we visited., The Red Rock is "off the strip", and we really enjoyed the tranquility of the atmosphere. THANKS RED ROCK....hopefully we will see you in a couple of years!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: BillsFan25
Reviews.Content: Decided to Spend 2 nights at the Red Rock before spending 3 nights on the strip (Bellagio) for a business convention. This place is a hidden gem in Vegas. It doesn't have the 'over the top' extravagance of the Venitian, Wynn, Bellagio etc... But if you want a place in vegas where you can just relax and still have fun you can't beat this place. The rooms are VERY nice- my wife and I agreed the room we had (King bed/Canyon view) was every bit as nice as the room we had at Bellagio. There is an issue with the lighting- certain corners of the room just don't have enough light but it's really not that big of a deal. The room was clean and comfortable and the view is stunning. The pool is very nice- they do play music in the main pool area but if you want absolute peace and quiet just go to the Spa Pool- the best kept seret about this place. As long as you are a guest in the hotel you can use the Spa pool for no additional charge, It's amazing! The restaurant options are very good- we ate at the Italian restaurant and it was OK- my food was very good but my wifes was just OK. Tbones however was fantastic! The boneless NY strip was amazing- way better than the steak I had at SW (the steakhouse at the Wynn) a few nights later. The only way this place can improve is to add another entertainment option. It would have been great if they had a small comedy club. Also- this place is not near the strip, the location is great if you want to be away from the craziness, but if this is your first time to Vegas and you want to see the strip and go to a show be prepared to rent a car or spend some time/money dealing with cabs or shuttles. If you do go- you must go to the canyon!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Convention Venue - Business Travellers Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Ulysses07
Reviews.Content: This place is a total con for the ill-informed business traveler from out of town. Its a $60 cab ride to the strip and their so-called shuttle goes only every couple of hours up to 10pm and if you miss out on one of the 12 seats then tough! Wonderful service. They claim to have an "A3" service - "Anything, Anywhere, Anytime". My wife (at the hotel for a convention) asked for a private meeting room for four people. They suggested she meet in the lobby or book a table at one of their restaurants. She again asked for a PRIVATE meeting room. Sorry, no deal. So in this giant complex of hotel, casino, cinemas, convention centre you can't find a room for four people for three hours? Answer: you can book a suite at $2,000 if we had one available, but we don't. Called some serviced offices nearby. No problem, couldn't have been more helpful. All this place cares about is casino dollars. If you're a convention or business traveller prepare to be given the runaround-you don't matter to them. That's fine, just don't go telling people how business-friendly you are when you just don't care.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: julierickbleu
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas every 1-2 years and have stayed at various Strip and Downtown hotels. Decided to try the Red Rock for our anniversary and for a change of pace and we may never stay anywhere else again! The resort is an oasis in the desert. There really isn't much reson to leave, although we get stir crazy in one place and therefore rented a car. We got a free upgrade to a mountain view room when we mentioned it was our anniversary. We were able to check in early. Room was fabulous. Pool is by far the best we've seen in Vegas and nearly as nice as some pools we've been at in Mexico. Casino is very nice and we consistently won. Good drink service while gambling. Good restaurants and bars. Pay attention to the happy hours on weekdays. Like another reviewer said, the place is not huge and sprawling, where you walk forever to get a coffee, like Caesar's. VERY friendly staff throughout. Many reviewers complain about the limited shuttle service to the Strip. PEOPLE...they don't want you to leave their casino! They are not going to make it super easy for you to leave and go spend money elsewhere! The resort fee was $27.99 per night while we were there. You just have to suck it up and pay it. Bring your laptop and use WiFI so you feel like you got your money's worth. OVerall, the Red Rock offers a great Vegas vacation with the feel of a resort. Even at the nicest hotels on the strip, you're not getting that resort feel.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, pool lovely but at times slightly smelly!”
Reviews.Author: Katie2381
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the price of this hotel, it was clean modern and comfortable to stay in with a lovely jacuzzi bath with tv above in its standard room/bathroom. The staff were polite and the pool was lovely, enjoyed the large orange round sun loungers, the breeze did bring in a nasty smell from time to time.. only issue with this place. It also offered a variety of food and a cinema - we stayed here at the end of our long stay in Vegas and Palm Springs and it was a fun place to stay, away from the Strip and yet it offered an all round good time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous across the board!”
Reviews.Author: intlroxy
Reviews.Content: First stayed at the Red Rock on a week-long business trip in February 2010 and was delighted by the venue. It is outside of the busy Vegas proper and although I am not a gambler, it does, of course, offer gaming opportunity for fans. Beautiful hotel with staff from varying nations offered an international flare that made me feel very much at home. Lovely, spacious and comfortable rooms with perfect bathing facilities. I have recommended the Red Rock to everyone I know who visits Vegas. I loved the location and the fact that you can stay here and never have to leave. Amazing dining is available within the resort. Some of the best Sushi and Italian dining that I've had, not to mention a great burger joint! There is something for every taste and budget. One of my colleagues had her pre-teen daughter on the trip with us so we were able to go bowling with her, see a movie and play fun games. Wonderful, albeit expensive shopping is available on the spot. I am not a fan of Vegas, but I would return just for a getaway at the Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Plush decor but poor location & service”
Reviews.Author: SajRussell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock for a recent conference. Overall the hotel rooms and the restaurants are good (particularly Hachi Japanese Restaurant which is excellent). On the negative side, the service does not live up to its Anything, Anywhere, Anytime motto. A more appropriate motto might be Nothing, Nowhere and Notime. I had a simple request for a meeting room for four people and in this giant hotel complex, I was told there was nowhere other than their lobby or one of their restaurants to hold a private meeting! No alternatives were offered and no creativity was displayed to try and meet my request. Certainly not what I would describe as AAA service. As for location - basically it is in the middle of nowhere. It's miles from the strip and including tips you will be up for nearly $70 for a trip via taxi. The shuttle service only goes once every couple of hours and the last shuttle at night is 10pm - hardly what you'd expect for a party town like Las Vegas! All in all, the rooms are nice, the restaurants are good, but the service and location leaves much to be desired. I certainly wouldn't host a conference here and I would recommend a hotel on the strip over this one if at all feasible.

Reviews.Title: “Like pulling teeth to give them money”
Reviews.Author: jjweide13
Reviews.Content: Checked in Thurs was supposed to extend to Sun. Everyday we've had to fight with them about reservation. Brittany- Front Desk is rude. Couldnt even comp free internet for their mistakes. Used to always stay here. Wont again. Especially for $220 a night and bad attitudes!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever to Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: camelobryant
Reviews.Content: My trip to Las Vegas and stay at the Red Rock Casino was one of the best trips I have ever had to Las Vegas. The room was clean and the amenities in the room were very nice. The staff were all very helpful. When I asked them about some of the noise from pool cleaning during the night time hours; they offered to change my room to the "strip" side of the hotel OR give me coupons for the breakfast buffet. I opted for the coupons and really enjoyed the buffet for breakfast the next morning. The pool is nice because there are many "smaller" pool and lots of lounge beds for everyone's convenience. There are tons of options for eating throughout the resort. It is also very close to shopping areas. Ultimately, what I liked most about this location was that it had all the "feel" of Las Vegas without the noise and congestion of the "Strip". I highly recommend the Red Rock Casino Hotel and Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BDG6610
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on a recent Saturday night. Immediately, the hotels swanky, cool appearance and attitude was all over you. From the red doors, to the greetings from the valet to the hotel desk agent, you could tell that they wanted you to have a great time. The room was larger than most hotels.with all the amenities and a great view.. The hotel was spotless. The casino had more than enough space and games. We ate at the Yardhouse. an upscale brew pub experience, with a great waitstaff. The casino bars have very upscale liquor, cigars, wine, and service.The pool was terrific, but a bit cold. Overall, a really cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Kersti
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: My husband and I spent a the weekend a few weeks ago, and it was WONDERFUL! Our room was upgraded to a junior suite for less than $50/night. Spacious, comfortable room; divine bed, very nice bathroom and bath amenities from their spa, plenty of outlets for charging phones, laptops, ipads etc. My only complaint was that our room was quite warm, and the problem was not addressed until late in the day the day following our complaint. We had to request service twice, and our first night was not especially restful. The hotel deducted the suite upgrade fee for our first night. The hotel property is JUST GORGEOUS...beautifully landscaped grounds, beautiful pool, great views of the mountains. CASINO: Pretty typical of Las Vegas, but more of a "locals" casino. The dealers were much friendlier and the tables much more relaxed than the ones on the Strip. SPA: Great services; amazing staff; fairly priced. My husband had an 80-minute deep tissue massage and I had the java and jasmine scrub and wrap. Both were fabulous. This is really nit-picky, but once you enter the spa, there isn't a window anywhere (and the views are so beautiful!) and the decor is primarily red and black...not my idea of a serene environment. Services were very good though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Gail H
Reviews.Content: Excellent property. Comfortable beds and bedding - outstanding bathroom with separate shower. Easy to navigate casino- lovely pool and great Mac and Cheese at the Yardhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Back to the Day When Vegas Was Great”
Reviews.Author: Stan C
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Resort is probably your best chance to experience Las Vegas, Nevada in the manner it was intended. Beautiful views of the mountains or the strip, well appointed rooms which are in close proximity to the pool, spa and casino and a staff that goes far beyond its competition in providing first class service. The Red Rock is located just off of I-215 which affords you the ability to visit downtown or the strip in a matter of minutes, but, if you're like my wife and I, you'll spend the great bulk of your time at the resort itself. It not obnoxiously overbuilt like so many of the modern hotels and casinos in Las Vegas, so you don't end up wandering hallways for 45 minutes to get a cup of coffee from Starbucks to start your day. Your room view is not obstructed by some towering hotel next door, and you will not have to fight huge crowds or unbearable traffic every time you leave the grounds. The pool is incredibly well designed, and the spa is great. We stopped by the Red Rock about four years ago on a tip from a friend, and it will be the only hotel/resort we ever stay at again when visiting Las Vegas. It has recaptured the glory of the city for us. Easily the best bet out there.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!!”
Reviews.Author: joinkb
Reviews.Content: I must say that I read Trip Advisor religiously before any trip my husband and daughter take. What I found when reading reviews for Red Rock were mostly awesome!!! I will admit I was a little hesitant staying so far from the strip, but when we got there all hesitation was gone!! We arrived early on a Friday in Vegas to take our 5yr old daughter to see Lion King that weekend. To our surprise they let us in our room at 12:00 noon no extra fee or anything. Our room was facing the many pools they have at the resort. The room had 2 double beds with contemporary styled decor with gorgeous marble tiling and dbl sinks in the rest room with a Jacuzzi tub. Totally enough room for all of us. We proceed to the pool area and this is where it's mind blowing. There are about 6 different pools in one area (incl the Jacuzzi’s) lil ones will have a ball for they can be easily used by mostly anyone swimmer or not. You can lay down poolside (in the water) and order food and drinks. The place is just beautiful!! Beware on Fri's they sometimes shut the pool area down early I think by 4p if there is a concert so get there early!! The casino itself is very massive. But the thing I really loved the most about the resort was their Kid Zone play area. You can leave your children in a wonderfully safe, caring and massive environment with food, fun, and entertainment for a very reasonable fee while you gamble your heart and money away. There is also a Multiplex movie theater and bowling center right on sight!!! This is one of the most family friendly spots I know of in Las Vegas. Now don't get me wrong we are not "old" parents, but I will say we are not in the 20 something bracket that feels the need to deal with the ungodly traffic, mounds of people, and the sometimes unusual entertainment that frequents the strip. We are the type of people who enjoy family esp. with our lil daughter and keeping her happy when we visit Sin City and NOT have to deal with Circus Circus (no offense). Lastly, I want to speak of the PRICE!!! Um...let’s just say there is NO WAY you'll find these rates on a weekend on the strip (we paid $98 plus $25 resort fee- per day) chk-in Fri chk out Sun. Granted they have something like a $25 per day resort fee added to the room rate, BUT it still doesn't compare to the elegance, atmosphere, and entertainment you can get here for much less if you have little ones!!! Also, if you truly don't mind driving about 20-25 min to get to the strip then this place is REALLY for you. And if all the hub bub about the strip has become overrated, then this place is your spot hands down!!! Photos will come as soon as I get them uploaded!!!!

Reviews.Title: “More to Vegas Than Just Gambling”
Reviews.Author: BobcatBabies
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Red Rock; this time for a 5-day vacation. The casino is nice (even has non-smoking gambling area) although we play only the slots. Fast food restaurants are convenient. Sit down restaurants offer a variety of foods. We ate at the Grand Cafe several times. At one meal we had great prime rib. We had breakfast one evening (served all day), and the blueberry pancakes were yummy. There were too many to eat at one meal so we boxed the leftovers. The guest room was clean, neat, spacious, and attractively decorated. It even had a door bell. There were plenty of pillows and bed linens were soft and comfy. The bathroom has both a soaking tub and separate shower plus plush white robes to wear to the spa facilities. For us there is more to Las Vegas than just gambling. We love the resort amenities included with the $24.99 resort fee. We liked the Red Rock exercise room, lap pool, sauna, steam room, cold dip pool, and jacuzzi. The changing facilities are private and very clean. Toiletries (e.g., shampoo, hair brushes, hair products, toothpaste) are so appreciated. We usually spent the morning enjoying the facilities. The casino's location, location, location was perfect. The drive to the strip was not bad. The casino is located very close to the Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area. Hiking there is fantastic and suitable for all ability levels. Besides hiking there is, for example, rock climbing, mountain biking, and canyoneering. Take a camera for pictures of canyons, red rock cliffs, and even petroglyphs. Just a drive through the park is worth the time. We will definitely stay at Red Rock again--probably in January for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Resort style, with all the ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Imua1972
Reviews.Content: Impressive room decor with the most comfortable bed ever. Great atmosphere with generous gambling spaces and choices. Restaurant selections to please your different moods. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Susan V
Reviews.Content: I was on a job and was fortunate enough to stay at the Red Rock Casino Resort. I was pleasantly surprised that I did not miss seeing the strip or downtown. The grounds are beautiful as it the hotel. I will definitely be coming back

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: KHynes
Reviews.Content: I love the Red Rock. It was my 3rd time being there and I am already dreaming of ways to get myself back there. The shuttle to/from the airport and the strip were great and very accessible. The best buffet in TOWN!! The rooms are nice and big with a great bathroom. The pools are amazing with great amenities. The Casino is big enough to get lost with lots of great places to eat and get drinks. You never have to leave with the bowling alley and movie theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock has it all!”
Reviews.Author: ReneeHB
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, new modern decor, very spacious rooms (comparable to Vdara), staff and service outstanding! All types of dining on site, steak, sushi, italian, mexican, Yardhouse, two starbucks and much more. It's imaculate. Its perfect if you are looking for a resort feel in Vegas. I've stayed there several times and keep going back. Their concert line up is pretty good, nice pool venue.

Reviews.Title: “first time at red rock-excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: squirrelland
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas frequently and decided to try something off the beaten path. Oh my god! Red Rock was amazing!!! We needed to rent a car for a day and the concierge made it happen totally simple-gave us directions and maps to all local canyon activities. I won a progressive $1500.00 penny too. The rooms were top notch, I am picky and they were outstanding, very big and good quality. You see all sorts of people from average joes to dressed up people so no matter what mood you are in you feel at home there. Buffet was really good, I'd give it 4 stars, very clean, good music, noisy and busy though. People to help you everywhere. Pool was very nice, didn't see the spa. There's a shuttle that goes back and forth to the airport an strip so that is really nice, just be at the pick up half hour early or it fills up; we missed it twice but then i went back in and won the progressive penny so it was all good. great bands in the casino and bars, all around awesome!!! oh, and the mattresses and pillows, they were five star; this was the first three days in a year that i slept in one spot and didn't move all night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Destination....very nice option for staying off the strip”
Reviews.Author: CARIBBEAN757
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas to see Tears for Fears who was playing at the Red Rock. We decided to stay there for the entire trip - a great location off the strip - much more economical - "free" shuttle to/from airport and strip - they do charge a $24.99/day resort fee - which is a bit steep compared to other resorts! The hotel and casino are beautiful - very comfortable and attractively decorated. Restaurants were okay - food decent but not notable. The pool is very large with plenty of seats - the first row is in the edge of the water which is great for a hot day! Concert venue outdoors was great - you could get into the thick of the crowd or hang back and have space to move around. Shuttle was perfect and right on time. Hotel is a bit of a drive from the strip so if you plan to go back and forth it takes a bit of time.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and away from all the noise”
Reviews.Author: Riverzlad
Reviews.Content: Great modern rooms and away from the Strip, which after having been to Vegas many times for work, is exactly what I want. It's one of my favorite places to stay if i have to be in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Anthembuckeye
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very nice for the price. Spacious, open feel to rooms and very comfortable beds. A bit off the strip, though. Decent pools but no great lap swim option and nothing as nice as water options at Mandalay and some other resorts on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mauigrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a wedding for 4 nights. The hotel is very beautiful, large rooms and gorgeous views from either side of the hallway. The hotel was very clean, food was delicious, and we enjoyed the casino. We also went bowling at the bowling alley there. Very cool! The reherseal dinner was at Cabo. Food was delicious and a beautiful view from the back room. Even though you are off the strip, it is a nice change and not that far away. It took us about 20 minutes from Red Rock to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, local hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: guccichik
Reviews.Content: My family and I stay here every year on Father's Day Weekend (we are Las Vegas locals). The rooms are always nice and spacious with great strip & canyon views. The pool is fun as well. I recommend the hard top cabanas. They can be expensive but are worth it most of the time (depending on your server). As far as the restaurants on property are concerned, I definitely think their service standards are not very high these days, but that can change very quickly. The resort has a lot to offer for the whole family and is one of my favorite places in town.

Reviews.Title: “really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: derek m
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nights during business travel. The staff is really efficient and friendly. The room is very large and comfortable. Really enjoyed the couple nights and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Joyce P
Reviews.Content: We recently were sent a complimentary stay at Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa. We go to Vegas and Laughlin regularly and have comps at other places as well. We recently went to Red Rock and were so pleased with the great experience we had! Service is excellent, hotel and rooms are beautiful and I did pretty good at the video poker machines! The selection of restaurants is wonderful and the buffet is very reasonably priced and food was delicious. We hope to return soon and would recommend it very highly to anyone wanting a relaxing and great time!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and relaxed Vegas experience. Highly recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Girl5678
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the resort for 4 days based on a friend's recommendation and had a fabulous time. The impressive lobby set the scene for our large double room. The room was very clean, modern with floor to ceiling windows. A great shower and a tub with a TV in bathroom as well. Staff friendly and obliging and concierge gave us great info and advice to plan our trips to Red rock canyon and also to the Grand Canyon. The gym and spa facilities were really relaxing as was the pool area. In addition to the huge casino (with free cocktails when you are gambling) there were lots of dining options and the Feast Buffet was very good value for money. The Grand Cafe on the other hand should be avoided. The resort is about 8 miles from the main Vegas strip, which makes it even more appealing. But there is a free hotel shuttle to the main Vegas strip or it is a taxi ride of about $45. This resort made for a wonderfully & relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “2nd year at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: david h
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Rock for the second consecutive year for a business conference. The conference facilities were excellent...very attentive staff with best in class conference rooms and amenities. I didn't gamble but everyone who did was impressed with the casino. The rooms were large and comfortable but could have better lighting. We tried both the steakhouse and Italian restaurant and came away more impressed with steakhouse but the Italian restaurant was good also. Nice respite away from the strip, if want to go there it's a short shuttle, cab or drive....15minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: johnskimarek
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel would recommend highly, great restaurants and amenities. Great place to take a family as well.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Definitely the place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: kmmindy
Reviews.Content: If you want a trip that isn't soley for casino playing and club hoping - this it the place for you. While they do have casino's here and a club - it's is also a very family oriented hotel. They have a wonderful pool area. It has 4 pools, 2 hot tubs, a wonderful bar and grill outside, shops, great wait staff - perfect for the family. The have concerts mostly every Friday in the summer. The rooms are absolutely magnificant - with either a pool view or a strip view. You won't be dissapointed staying here. Only about a 10 minute drive to the strip and they have free shuttle service!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Change of Pace off of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SDHokie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Labor Day Weekend. The hotel and resort are beautiful, well laid out, and most importantly, clean. Perhaps it is because the hotel is well off the main drag and relatively new, but it does not have that run-down feel that a lot of casinos on the strip have. It also doesn't seem to attract the same crowd (groups of 8+ 22-year olds from Southern California who decide to share a room for the weekend). The resort is well laid out and doesn't feel like a maze designed to confuse you and separate you from your last dollar. The restaurants were better than the usual casino fair and the service was very friendly and professional. We are not huge fans of Vegas but would definitely go back to the Red Rock Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is the place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: annieneddie
Reviews.Content: We love Red Rock! This place is our first choice on every trip to Vegas. A few standouts.. They don't make you wait until 3pm to check-in. Many times we have taken an early flight and have been able to check-in at 10am. GREAT SERVICE and very customer friendly! Free airport Shuttle and Fahion show mall shuttle. Rooms are wonderful. Bedding is soooo comfy. Free Wireless, upscale bathrooms. Fitness center is very nice and lap pool is separate from the massive pool (and no kids!). Lots of good food choices. Hiachi for Sushi is a must. Above average buffet, food court with Starbucks, Ben/Jerry's and Rubio Fish tacos (Huge for a transplanted Californian now living in the midwest).

Reviews.Title: “Wow and wow!”
Reviews.Author: Robert T
Reviews.Content: Our stay at to the Red Rock was great! So much to do for the family, the pool, bowling, movie theaters to name a few. Yet, elegant for adults to enjoy the night. Beside the amazing staff, the amazing view of the canyon which makes the lights of the strip look like another liight bulb.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential however service is appauling - Dont bother!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle B
Reviews.Content: My partner and I recently spent 5 long nights at the Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa. This resort has the potential to be amazing however the appalling level of service / assistance (or lack there of) really let them down. The resort itself is quite beautiful, rooms are well appointed and the beds very comfortable.... However, we experienced nothing but frustration when dealing with hotel staff. If you choose to stay at this hotel please be keep the following in mind: 1. The hotel is a good $55US cab ride into the strip. There is a complimentary shuttle but however it only runs every 2 hours (starting at approximately 11am & finishing at 10pm) and as there are only 12 seats, it fills up fast. If the bus is full also keep in mind that you will have to arrange your own cab as this is beyond the responsibilities of the valet / bell desk - They will not assist in any way. 2. Bed linen is not automatically changed - You will need to request for this to happen (often a few times before it actually happens). I had a hold in my sheet which is why I could tell it hadn’t been changed in over 4 days! 3. If you require any assistance that is even remotely out of the ordinary, don’t expect any help from hotel staff - They are clearly not interested and therefore not willing to help. 4. Restaurant cutlery and glasses were often less than clean (particularly at the Grand Cafe). I hope the hotel takes note of reviews such as this as it really does have so much potential - I hope they can improve so other guests don’t have the same frustrating experience as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort far from the action. Don't go for the BINGO”
Reviews.Author: MissEileen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my husband and myself, along with my mother and aunt to celebrate my mother's birthday. The staff was wonderful. They couldn't do enough for you and they are well trained in their jobs. Very polite and knowledgeable. The hotel itself is in excellent condition. The only thing wrong I had was one of the light bulbs was burnt out in our room. We had an upgraded king room. The room is beautifully appointed and very functional. A little on the dark side for my taste, but still lovely. The bathroom is beautiful. But I did have a problem taking a bath. The tub looks very comfortable, but I kept slipping and couldn't lay back with my legs extended. They need to put some kind of a mat. My mother and aunt had the same room with two queens. My aunt kept saying that the bed was the best bed she ever slept on. And they were rather comfortable. We were able to enjoy the pool area one day. There was ample space by the pool and we were able to find a place in the shade. The drink service around the pool was excellent, but the food service was very slow. We actually stayed at this resort because it was the only place I could find in Las Vegas that was at least a 4 star resort that had bingo. My mother and aunt must have their bingo. Well they do have bingo, but my mother and aunt were very disappointed with it. And these too ladies know BINGO. They would do a $38 buy in, and they win $15. To quote my 90 year old mom "The BINGO sucks here". So we ended up taking them downtown where they like to play and were able to win a decent prize. On a $35 buy in at Union Plaza, she won a $420 prize. Much better result. I must mention the rest of the casino I found more than adequate and unless you want to see a show, there is no need to go to the strip or downtown. This hotel has all you need. Also it is close to neighborhoods so many stores are located close by. This was also a hotel I didn't mind using the mini bar. I found the prices reasonable. I RARELY use the mini bar. If the casino steps up their bingo we would come back again. But as it stands now, my mother wants to stay downtown at the Golden Nugget next year for her birthday. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “All that Vegas has to offer without feeling stuck on the strip.”
Reviews.Author: Josh Z
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect trip from beginning to end. I didn't expect the level of service we received at the hotel, let alone the service we received weeks after we left the hotel. I forgot a camera battery charger in our room. Weeks later, we called to see if by chance they still had it. Not only did they still have it, but they also told us we had forgotten a library book and that they would send both items to us. The hotel is luxurious. The spa was my favorite - I showered and shaved there daily. The staff was genuinely helpful. My wife and I swore we would never go back to Vegas after staying on the strip years ago. We were intrigued by the location of Red Rock so we gave it a shot. Now, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility and location”
Reviews.Author: jimlarue
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels/resorts I have stayed at. Rooms were comfortable, quiet, clean and impressive. Facility was beautiful and presented a professional image at all times during my visit. I look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time!”
Reviews.Author: momflyingsolo
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely stay! Arrived early and they allowed me to check in early! Lovely room, great view, comfy bed, clean, confortable and quiet! Would have liked to make a cup of tea in the morning and a little room in the fridge for personal items but other than that, I thought everyhting was great! Staff was attentive, friendly and easy to get along with and had lots of fun playing blackjack and Blazing Sevens! Thanks Red Rock - I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Family oriented”
Reviews.Author: MrsGochenour
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the hotel and everything was very modern and clean. Room service was so nice and very fast. Most of the food service staff was nice, but some acted like they didn't want to be there. We were happy with the casino floor with the exception of the beverage girls. It was hard to find one and when you ordered, they took 20 minutes to bring a drink or just never came back. We were very upset with that service.

Reviews.Title: “Great room! Great Food! Great luck at the slot machines!”
Reviews.Author: USCfan83
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is far and away the best of the Station Casino Group of Casino/Resorts. Not only is the decor beautiful, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the buffet is probably the best we have had in Las Vegas. The fact that this hotel is about 15 minutes from the main strip was no problem at all. This was a birthday celebration for me, and the fact that I won for three days straight on the slot machines was the best present ever! We will definitely stay at the Red Rock whenever we are in Vegas again. We can't recomment it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Vegas, and a whole lot more!”
Reviews.Author: kimmyj702
Reviews.Content: Every time we visit the Red Rock hotel, it has been always a pleasant experience. We love atmosphere and the friendly staff! The rooms are super cozy and clean. The location is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Modern, and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: SnyderFlyer
Reviews.Content: An excellent, inexpensive hotel off 'the Strip' in Summerlin. It boast big time resort features, but scaled back to a comfortable not overwhelming experience. Plenty of casino games, an excellent resort, and great food choices. Rooms are modern with dim lights and chocolate hues. The Red Rock Signature bed is the BEST bed I've slept on - better then any of the other big chain's signature beds. Best value in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “It's number 1 on my list”
Reviews.Author: Nicki001
Reviews.Content: If the "strip" is overwhelming this is the spot to go to!

Reviews.Title: “From check-in to check-out fabulous, outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: richrome
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Red Rock to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. We were ready to enjoy the inviting swimming pool, dining and excursoins to nearby nature parks. We arrived way too early, about 11am, and planned to ask for luggage storage, until a room became available. To our surprise they had a room ready and it was exactly what we had booked: mountain view, king-size bed, 11th floor!!! What a great first impression! On the way to our room we were greeted by marble floors, crystal chandeliers and an incredible aura of elegance, that permeates this beautiful place. I noticed the pleasant music and sweet aroma in the air, little touches to enhance the hotel experience. Our room was flawless and the housekeeping staff did a great job cleaning and restocking it every day. We loved the generous and clean pool grounds: Relaxed atmosphere, up-beat music, shady palm trees, cool water and lots of space, not to mention the most comfortable beach lounge chairs w/cushions. We enjoyed the pleasant and appealing attitude of the Sandbar staff. We ate at the following restaurants, and loved the food and service at all of them: The Grand Cafe - breath-taking European-style decor, incredible value for the high-quality food. Special shout-out to our waiter Robert, who provided exceptional service! The Feast Buffet - so many sumptous choices for every palate and appetite! Our breakfast favorite: cheese-filled crepes w/ berry sauce! The Yard House - a beer lover's oasis! Great ahi and mahi-mahi creations, lunch or dinner. The 10pm specials came handy after a trip to the Grand Canyon! The Sandbar - impressive salad w/shrimp included 4 gigantic grilled jumbo shrimp on top! The quality and presentation of the food are world-class, and the wait staff made us feel valued and welcome! The location of RR is very desirable if you are a nature lover (like us) and the surroundings offer many destinations to explore: for example, The Red Rock Canyon (15 min. away), the Valley of Fire (60 min. away) or the Grand Canyon Tour (bus/helicopter combo, 14 hr. day trip). We stayed 5 nights and even check-out was very pleasant, when Stephanie the concierge printed our bording passes for our flight. We do not gamble and did not use The Spa and yet our stay at RR was a complete, once in a life time luxury experience!

Reviews.Title: “A great Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: callahanha
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent a 3 day weekend at the Red Rock Casino and we both enjoyed every minute of it. A rental car was needed as it is about a $50 cab ride from the airport. Check in was fast and easy and we were in our room within 10 minutes of entering the lobby. We were given a room with a pool view and I believe the bedding in the rooms is the best of any place I have ever stayed. The bathroom is very large with a deep tub and seperate shower. There are also 2 sinks and the toilet is in a seperate closet off to the side. The room comes with a large flatscreen TV and plenty of dresser and closet space and a free safe inside the closet. I played 3-4 hours of blackjack every morning and lost about $200-$300 each time ($25/hand) but the dealers are very friendly and the local players are very nice also. The video poker pay schedules are some of the best in vegas and I was able to play at the bars each night and made a profit each time. Drink service was excellent. We ate the YardHouse brew pub one night and it was o.k. and had the buffet another night for dinner. This is a great deal, for $16 you get the dinner buffet with plenty of selections and very good tasting meats and desserts. Good Tip: There is a bagel shop right next to the sports book where you can get a toasted bagel for $1.50 if you are looking for a cheap breakfast and I saw some people eating sandwiches there and the sandwiches contained about 3 inches of meat. Since it was 110 degrees we spent a lot of time poolside. The servers come around often but drinks are expensive ($7 for a beer). They do have free self-serve water at the bar though to keep you hydrated. The large pool was full of kids but there are 5 other pools that mostly adults use and it was no problem getting seats together. Even though I need to get a rental car, the Red Rock is one of my 2 favorite places to stay in Vegas and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with poor service”
Reviews.Author: Wolf W
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 days.Housekeeping was either late or did not show up at all.Sheets were not changed for the whole time. Bath towels were only changed after reminding housekeeping. Front desk was not helpful to resolve any matter. Red Rock could be an excellent hotel, but service has to improve considerably!

Reviews.Title: “Pay Attention to Detail”
Reviews.Author: JANET F
Reviews.Content: On the Central Coast of California (which is a lot like England and much of Northern Europe ) which is the extreme to the Las Vegas heat,. my husband and I came fto Red Rock Resort to just relax. What we found were basic imperfections that we want to pass on. 1. We had a wonderful refrigerator in the room, but no room to even put a water bottle, let alone a bottle of good Chardonnay. God help us if we removed an item to replace with our own.... we would be charged for removing their item with ours. We had 45 seconds to make up our minds. 2. If we wanted water, it sat on the counter for a $6. charge, Not Chilled. 3. No glasses to even pour the water in to. We had to call Room service for the glasses! 4. NO Coffee Maker???? Really???? Yes, we could hike downstairs to the nearest Starbucks, come back up and then sit in bed to enjoy the complementary newspaper. What a downer that is. 5. Here it is August 28th and the pool closes at 7PM - Still daylight out and the temp was still 102 degrees and we cannot enjoy the pool or hot tub???? 6. The room lighting was less than acceptable. If you need to get into your suitcase, good luck. 7.What a great bathtub, but unfortunately there was no bath suds to enjoy. That would have completed the experience. 8. We decided to get a pre-check-out invoice. Thank goodness we did. The invoice had several charges on it from the "bar" in our room. No., we did not remove anything. Why did they charge us?" They were kind enough to remove the charges that night. 9. On the final day - checking out, we realized the bar charges were not removed. They kindly did remove them then. Very upsetting. Thank goodness we checked. I am being very honest. I am not nagging, just being realistic in observations. I think for the price of this beautiful resort, there would be more attention to the guests. It appears that this resort is into any dollar they can extract from the guests that keep them afloat.. This hotel is dedicated to HIGH ROLLERS ONLY.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Just be prepared to pay for Resort fees and Taxes”
Reviews.Author: welovetotravel20
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Hotel is one of the great finds in Las Vegas. It was our anniversary and we wanted to stay off the strip this time to have a different experience of Vegas. It was such a great idea. Check-in process was smooth, they let us checked in at 10:30 am and no hassle. The hotel is very family friendly- has movie theaters, food court, bowling lanes,kids quest and buffet was very affordable and they offer some good selections for the price. Pool closes at 7pm, I think that's silly. It was 105 degrees and a hanging out at the pool at night would have been a great idea. We had a TWOGETHER package that includes: 2 nights accommodations, 2 movie tickets, 25$ in room credit and couples' massage. Original cost was 499$ for the package but we later found out that Resort Fee is $27/day plus about $25/day for TAX. And to top it all of : $54 for gratuity for our couples' massage. It was a lot of money but we still had a nawesome weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an oasis in the Desert!”
Reviews.Author: Jayne S
Reviews.Content: Classy, roomy, clean and beautifully decorated with outstanding hospitality. It's a half hour off the strip with shuttles than run frequently. The pool is the nicest I've seen in Vegas. Some rooms overlook the Redrock canyon and some overlook the strip. If your vacation isn't all about the strip then this is the hotel for you. Very nice for families too.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience, Hidden Costs, Not children friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Juan L
Reviews.Content: We booked our room on line. It seemed a good deal, but then when we checked out, we realized all the hidden costs involved. At the end, it cost twice as much. They charged for all the amenities on top of the room charge. The pools close at 7:00 pm!! That's ridiculous for a hotel located in a city that is above 35 degrees Celsius all the time. We had to argue with the front desk every time we had to get our vouchers for the "included" breakfast" or the $25.00 gift certificate. At the end they provided them, but it's ridiculous. Next time we'll choose a hotel on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! We Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: 3HBee
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas was on our travel list of destinations to visit but we don't gamble and are not into the glitz and glam so we didn't want to stay in the city. Since I am a hotel snob of sorts since I did my fair share of biz travel through the years, we wanted a full-service resort with wonderful factilites and staff, so a well-rated resort and casino was the ticket for us! As you pull up to the hotel, the outside of the hotel is very pretty and tropical. Regular king guest rooms were large, well designed, immaculate and very well maintained. The mattress was wonderfully comfortable. Front desk staff were terrific and accommodating and check-out was a breeze on the computer in the room where you can check on your charges to the room. Hotel has rooms either city view or canyon view and we chose canyon view and we were NOT disappointed with amazing views of sunrise and sunset on the mountains! We came to Vegas to enjoy the Red Rock Canyon Park which is 4 miles up the road from the Red Rock Resort (yes, access to the park is actually on Charleston, so it's a no-brainer to get there and enjoy the nature and incredible scenery.) The park has a 13 mile road that wraps through the mountains/park and has about 20 parking/rest lots to stop and look at the beautiful views along the way so don't miss the opportunity since it's so close. Hiking trails are noted on the map at the entrance gate for difficulty and length. The pools were wonderful because there were plenty to choose from. A main circular pool was mostly for children, then choice of saunas, heated pools, and cool pools that were always kept chilly to beat the heat - this was all thoughtfully laid out and it was quiet and relaxing. Towels are available at the pool and drinks and/or food can be ordered at the pool. There were lots of food choices from inexpensive, quick meals to grab on the run (like a food court), a buffet, or nice restaurants. All were great. We will absolutely be back to stay at the Red Rock whenever we come back to town!

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Not your (Grand)mother's Vegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mjmsf
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 days because of work meetings. Was (very) pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. 1) Rooms - so great...bathroom, shower, bed, tv, lighting, floor to ceiling windows...and the BEST part, entrance into each room is down a short 12 ft. entryway! 2) Views...I was on the 17th floor, and it really is beautiful 3) Decorating - the entire place, while BIG in its spaciousness, was wonderfully decorated and well appointed. I kept saying "wow...". Very nice. 4) Food - this was the only "so so" part of my experience. We at at Hamchi, the Cafe, and LBs (Burger). LBs rocked!!! The other food was only so-so. Starbucks on property, and since we were working at business meeting, that was GREAT to have. 5) Shuttle to/from was great. From airport even hours. To airport odd hours. 6) Being a Californian, about DIED with the smoke in the casino (had to walk through to get to food...) Hated it...took a Silkwood shower when I finally got back home and put all my clothes directly into the wash.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Canadian Hoping to Soon be a Las Vegas Local
Reviews.Title: “A Kid-Friendly Casino with Style”
Reviews.Author: lv_local_wannabe
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is a great property for kids. The myriad pools are in a kid-friendly layout and provide a variety of entertainment for kids up to around teenage years. There is a huge state-of-the-art cineplex with IMAX screens on property, along with a big games room, and KidsQuest (if you want to get a break from your young one occasionally). The restaurants are all top notch, and even the award winning steakhouse, T-Bones (which has a killer chopped salad too), has no problem with children. Red Rock is far enough away from the Strip that you don't get that claustrophobic people-density feel of the Strip, but is only 15 minutes away if you need to get back for a show, or event. While it is aimed at locals, I've been treated well there, although certainly it has some promotions which are less useful to a tourist (I've never understood the whole win a car thing in Vegas - how am I supposed to check that on my flight?).

Reviews.Title: “Stay here on your trip to Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Christie81
Reviews.Content: Loved the Red Rock ... Couldn't believe the property was 5 years old ... It looks brand new ... and "smells brand new" too ... no musty smoky hallways or casinos ... All kinds of choices for restaurants and night time entertainment ... We were there for a high school reunion and it was an amazing weekend ... Will definitely stay there on our next visit to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “A 'different' Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Duke149
Reviews.Content: Having experienced the usual glitz and glam side of Vegas and the Strip, Red Rock was a welcome change of pace. Very relaxing with an atmosphere that had us happy to just stay put for three days, no shows, taxi, nor rental car. Red Rock exhibits top quality in every aspect. From the desk, waiters, bartenders, and casino people, we received courtesy and friendliness. The restaurants fit any budget and provided good variety and quality, especially the buffet for breakfast and lunch. Get a Players Card for a discount. The room was very clean with a spectacular view but finding an outlet next to the bed was a problem. The pool complex was huge and relaxing. Being August, you will want to get out of the sun in the afternoon and there might be a problem finding shade.

Reviews.Title: “It was GREAT and we will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: aromanow
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from a standard room to a jacuzzi suite and O M G - we were totally impressed. The rooms were fantastic and the staff were great. Thank you Red Rock... We will be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hop International”
Reviews.Author: Irissia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Vegas to watch the Hip Hop International Championship which was hosted at the Red Rock. The hotel is very nice and we were happy with the amenities it has. The rooms were very nice and no complaints with the service. The hotel map could have been better, the TV monitors were fuzzy and hard to read. Only has free internet in your room and the TV internet is hard to figure out. The food at the buffet is ok. I'd say a 3 out of 5 but good for the price. The convention floor was very professional and very nicely done. It's far from the strip, ~ $60 cab ride but has a shuttle service, although it's not as convenient due to every 2 hour departure times and is first come first served.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: rubybouvier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock last week for a short business trip. This is my favorite Vegas hotel; I don't like the chaos of the strip, so this hotel is perfect for me! It is nestled against the foothills, with beautiful views. I love that I can check in and go to my room without going through the casino. The pool area is beautiful. The roooms are amazing, especially the marble bathrooms. There is a large choice of restaurants, a free shuttle to the strip and even a free shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice... Save money for cab rides”
Reviews.Author: The-city-bus-spaz
Reviews.Content: Great facility but shuttle service was lacking considering the location and lack of attractions within proximity to resort. I would suggest doubling the number of shuttle trips and offer late evening service. This was my first trip to Vegas and perhaps I should have stayed closer to strip. Enjoyed the dining offerings - breakfast and service at the grand cafe were excellent. The Italian, t-bones and the Mexican were fine but not overwhelming. Our group all felt the quality of food (and beers!) at the Yardhouse exceeded the other feature restaurants at the resort. The Italian and t bones were over rated in our opinion and a few other travelers shared our views. Overall - rooms were fantastic. Really enjoyed catching some great panoramic views of the mountains while doing the ..... you know what I mean fellas. I would not discourage people from trying the RR but experienced travelers (like us) felt like there is likely something better in Vegas that offered much of the same qualities the RR offer but at a more attractive location to the entertainment options (palms, cosmopolitan, Wynn). The resort seriously needs some quality entertainment and night club vs the occasional concert that it currently offers. The Vegas market is looking to attract the new demographic and replace the aging boomer/traditional gambler. The RR is somewhat on this track but could go significantly further to attract the age 30-45 market with interests beyond gambling and bowling.

Reviews.Title: “Always coming back”
Reviews.Author: mullinsd1
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the best place to stay in Las Vegas. We discovered Red Rock about 4 years ago and NEVER stay anywhere else. We come to Vegas 2 to 3 times a year and ALWAYS stay at Red Rock. Just love it there.

Reviews.Title: “Triple C Award”
Reviews.Author: ibizatan
Reviews.Content: Crooks. Cheats. Cant afford to payout winnings. Pathetic. no wonder they have to get the ufc fighters so they backup from screwing people out of their winnings.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat hotel if you want to be off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Clyde_Betts
Reviews.Content: Well, to start the Station Casinos are all very nice. Red Rocks is no exception. this hotel is beautiful and if you want Vegas but not the strip this is the place. The rooms are very large and spacious. immaculately cleaned daily and have beautiful views of either the mountains or the strip. It is quite aways from the strip so if you want that this is not your hotel. The beds are comfortable, the shower is nice, if your into baths well they have tvs in them so kinda cool. THe rooms are decorated very darkly and are not bright even with all the lights on. (I like this, but could see how some wouldn't) overall I really like this hotel. The only drawback in my opinion is the banquet food (if your there for corporate meetings) was among the worst I have ever tasted. OTherwise a near perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place away from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: mojopup
Reviews.Content: This place is great if you want to get the Vegas experience & relax too. Be warned it is quite a way from the airport & the strip but to me that is what made it nice. The pool area is huge, the only drawback was that it wasn't open most of our trip because it was off-season. Great rooms, very nice bathrooms & clean. The spa has a seperate little pool for hotel guests which was a nice quiet place with comfortable area's to chill. Restaurant's were good & overall a great place. Will be back again in September loved it so much!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Marya888
Reviews.Content: The rooms were wonderful and the resort first class. I will definitely stay here again. The front desk people were rude and unfriendly "just putting in their hours on the job" but all in all this is a very nice place to stay. free parking, good restaurants, but do be aware of a daily resort fee on top of your room charge. Internet is included in mandatory resort fee. Also don't make the mistake of moving anything in the mini bar fridge or it charges you ( but they will adjust it off)

Reviews.Title: “absolutely loved it there”
Reviews.Author: Michael L
Reviews.Content: upon check-in everything was well laid out. Beautiful lobby area with a bar under a beautiful flowing overhead light. Hallways on room floors with beautiful carpeting, and and nice curved hallway to the rooms. The room itself was very spacious, and had an extremely comfortable bed. Layout of the room was great, and the bathroom was very nice with marble shower and tub. Vanity very spacious, and nice fluffy towels and amenities. The view from the room was spectacular, looking right over the pool from the 9th floor. Nice view of the mountains in the background. The service was excellent, and housekeeping did a very nice job cleaning and stocking my room each day. The layout of the casino is very accomodating, with a vast selection of restaurants, and lounge bars. It even had Starbucks! The choice of slots was great, and I never got bored for one minute. The nicest place in Vegas in my book, and I have stayed at the majority of the casinos on the strip including the Four Seasons, Mirage, Venetian, Tropicana, Boulder Station, Flamingo, Bally's, and Paris. The staff was very helpful in all areas including the business center. Slot staff were very courteous and made me feel special. The food and the FEAST buffet, and Hachi restaurants was excellent! Thank you for a very nice get away and experience. Mike Larsen RM 9124

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility, with solid amenities, but obviously pretty remote”
Reviews.Author: jeremymmason
Reviews.Content: I attended a company summit which was held at the Red Rock Casino, and the property was fantastic. The amenities are extensive: from the bowling alley, to the IMAX theater, to the many restaurants, the shopping across the street, the comfortable rooms, the high-end bathrooms with luxurious fixtures, and on & on... Obviously it's quite a trek to make it out there, and it's hard to make it back & forth to the Strip late in the evening, but if you want a full-on Vegas experience without the crowds and hassle of the Strip, this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly professional service throughout the facility.”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Las Vegas since the 1960's and have stayed at the majority of strip hotels and the Golden Nugget downtown. They all have treated me well. I now have been to the Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa a few times and I can safely say it is a giant step above the rest. Everyone at every level of personnel is friendly, courteous and professional in their discipline. They seem glad to see you and happy to do what is necessary to make your stay as pleasant as possible. A special thanks to David Friedland even though he's a Lakers fan. Again, I feel the Red Rock is the premier place to stay in the Las Vegas area at this time for affordable luxury and comfort..

Reviews.Title: “Great mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: earle1231
Reviews.Content: We live in Vegas and could stay at any resort but find Redrock to be a beautiful resort and the staff go out of their way to make everything pleasant. Will be staying again next week.We luv it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Audrey-NL
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was huge and very clean! Same for the bathroom. We had a pool / Mountain view room. It was so nice to look at the window early morning to see to sun rise. The resort has a small foodcourt which is very convenient. We also tried the "Feast buffet". Everything was very good and service too. The hotel is located +/- 15 min from the strip. We had a rental car so this was not an issue for us. We thought the location was very good and very quiet. We stayed at the Mirage the year before and we really preferred our stay at the Red Rock Hotel (rooms were bigger, buffet was better and cheaper). The pool is amazing!!! We really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience-definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: sergio c
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort-casino full of courteous personnel and very good food choices. The room was very clean, quiet and very good bedding. We enjoyed the serenity of the red rock canyon and the peace and quiet of the surrounding area outside the strip. We hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: leasiesmum
Reviews.Content: we were at red rock resort for hip hop international, our time here was fantastic, from checking in all during our stay and sadly leaving. the resort offered everything we needed.we were travelling with a large group families and (crew of teenage hip hoppers) everyone of us was very happy. we will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for families!”
Reviews.Author: Freddientj
Reviews.Content: We got a spacious resort room with complimentary buffet breakfast with their bed and breakfast rate. The buffet was extraordinary and would have been a value even if we had to pay for it. We paid the same amount for a McDonald's breakfast the day before at the Grand Canyon! The pool and bowling were huge hits with the kids. Being off the strip the casino is quieter which is nice because everywhere you want to be requires walking thorough the gambling areas. Every bit of food we ate was delicious and not extravagantly priced. My six year old son called it, "the best vacation ever...I feel like a billionaire!"

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but too far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED our huge and luxurious King room at Red Rock. Really a great room (and fantastic bathroom - hello TV over the tub!) for the price. We also loved the adults-only pool behind the spa that was so relaxing (note that you can't get bar service there, just food). The staff was VERY helpful and friendly and I thought there was a nice mix of ages and types of travelers at the hotel i.e. not all 20-something party people or old folks. We were not especially impressed by the restaurants on site. They were fine and the food was always good, but never great. The steak place, TBones, was outrageously expensive for the atmosphere. The food was good, but not worth it. That's why we wished the resort were closer to the strip. The free shuttle to the strip took about 25 minutes and the last one leaves the strip at 10pm, which is pretty early. Overall, I'm very happy we went and we had a great time, but we probably won't go back due to the distance from our fav restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotals for a vacation.”
Reviews.Author: judylisa
Reviews.Content: Outstanding!!!!! My family loved it. We were treated like VIPS . The room was very clean, it had a nice scent and when I turned on the T.V there was a welcome with my name on it. It made me feel special, that was great!!! Thank you Red Rock for that memory that I will cherish forever.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, definitely will be back with the family”
Reviews.Author: sfscoutmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here midweek, from Tuesday til Thursday, and everything from the efficient and speedy checkin to the service at the pool, restaurants, and the Kidsquest supervised childcare, was wonderful. We grabbed the free shuttle from the fashion show mall and the driver had icecold water for everyone. At checkin, the reception folks were friendly, intelligent, professional. We had a two-queen room on an upper floor and never had to wait for the elevators. Room was very clean, spacious, and this is with 3 small kids aged 3, 5 and 7. Pool was less than 2 minutes' walk away from our room and was really nice: one huge circular pool with a shallow end and areas for kids and a giant fountain in the center. Several smaller pools around the "backyard" area, one that was heated and that the kids all seemed to love, and several large hot tubs. Well-equipped and clean gym was closeby with free headsets and water at every machine. The Kidsquest was great and the kids loved it: lots of activities for them to do, such as a bball court, ipad station, bouncy house, etc. We only had them there for a couple hours so we had a chance to eat a nice dinner with the quiet needed to actually have an adult conversation, which was such a luxury. Bottomline: yes, hotel is away from the strip, so if you want the strip experience, dont come here. But if you want an amazing value, no hidden surprise fees, cool pools, kids activities that allow for a couple hours of adult time, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing resort with everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Biznyers
Reviews.Content: My friends and I really enjoyed styaing at this resort. The rooms were very nice, the bed were very comfortable, the choices of restaurants were fantastic, and there were plenty of bars/night clubs to choose from. We really enjoyed eating at the Feast Buffet which was the best buffet I've had in Vegas. The pool was great and had plenty of places to sit and many different types of pools to choose from. I also liked that the food and drink were not excessively priced. The only problem I had with the resort is the resort fee seemed a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Rocks for our anniversary weekend. This was our third visit to the resort. We both love that it is off the strip, and has all the amenities you will need for a weekend stay. We took the free shuttle from the airport. The shuttle ride was comfortable, and dropped us off right at the door. Check-in was super fast, and we were able to get into our room as soon as we arrived 12:30. Our room was comped, along with free tickets to the Weezer concert, gaming credit, and a meal credit. This was all part of a promotion I received from the players club. The room was very clean. We could occasionally smell cigarette smoke in the room. Not sure where that was coming from. The concert was great! We had a great dinner at Cabo one of the evenings. The people who work at Cabo were very busy, due to a country concert taking place, but they were very friendly and the food was pretty good. What I love most about this place is that we never had to leave the property while we were there. My wife went to the spa, while I gambled. We went to the bingo hall one evening, and the people in the hall were very patient in showing us how it all worked. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want your stuff to be stolen from your room.”
Reviews.Author: criscouch
Reviews.Content: Just checked out yesterday. Worst hotel experience in my life. Staff that was allowed into my room went through my bag and stole items, many things in room didn't work, laundry service mixed up our items, food expensive compared to other hotels and the staff in housekeeping are rude. Hope I never have to attend another function at this hotel and will be advising everyone I know to go stay somewhere else. Very disappointing experience considering we were so excited when we laid eyes on it. Its beautiful and everything you could need is within it. Unfortunately, staff ruined our entire experience. Called today to speak to customer service and their staff was extremely rude on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Teersa
Reviews.Content: Giant puddle of water around the toilet when we checked in. Room was hot and musty too. Large pile of hair and a plastic cap in the corner of the bathroom. Splattered toothpaste all over mirror and sink area. Pillow cases and sheets stained with red stuff, they said it was rust. Every time someone shuts there door, our door opens and shuts, I stuck a rag in it and it helped. Called for housekeeping supervisor and after 30 minutes of waiting we went ahead and left so we could make our lunch reservation. This hotel is beautiful and the rooms are beautiful. I just think something is wrong with housekeeping in the rooms right now. It looks like our entire room hasn't been wiped down for a ling time. Crumbs all over desk chair. Stuff flung on ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel/casino in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: lilinanine
Reviews.Content: I love that it is off the Strip. It is fully self-contained; many food choices, movies, bingo, and casino. I haven't braved the outdoor pool under the hot sun or the spa. The service is great from check-in to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Miman44
Reviews.Content: Although this is 30 minutes from the strip (we were told it's only 10 miles away), this is a great place for a family. It has a bowling alley and movie theatre in the property and more than enough restaurants to keep the entire family happy. It's convenient in that you can go to the strip and then go back to the calmness and quiet of the resort. The amenities are wonderful and room is a good-sized room. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: prob125
Reviews.Content: The visit was for business puposes but the experience with staff and the property felt like a vacation. The property is located about 15 to 20 minutes from the airport, however, the hotel offers shuttle services to and from the airport, in addition, the hotel offers shuttle services to the strip. The restuarants were all excellent and the many activities inside the casinos will cover any age group in the family. I did not see a true night club at the location, but the surrounding bars will not disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jen261red
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing weekend stay at red rock. The room is spacious and clean, with an beautiful view of the mountains and las vegas strip. The decor is beautiful and the bathroom is total luxury! Huge bathtub and separate shower, beautiful marble and finishes. The beds are soft and comfortable with down comforters and soft pillows. We ordered room service for breakfast the staff over the phone was polite and very accomodating. The food was served quick and hot, and tasted great! Overall the service was over the top! The pool is well designed and lots of beds and room to sit. We had dinner at T bones, it was the best steak Ive ever tasted, and the staff was friendly. We will definetly be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Always love this place, has everything!”
Reviews.Author: Kalola713
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, super friendly atmosphere. Nice to get away from the strip, more relaxing and quiet. Movies, bowling, food court, kids daycare, good restaurants, and beautiful pool area. Everything you need is here.

Reviews.Title: “The Strip's Great Escape”
Reviews.Author: BurbankDan
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Resort is about 20 minutes off of the "Strip," and that's a good thing. Here is a world of the "one-stop" recreational resort featuring a comfortbale hotel, accomodating and well-layed out casino, many delicious dining options, a full service bowling alley and contemporary movie theater. There's also frequent entertainment from headliners known to many. Of course, there are the obligatory pools and full service spa as with many such entities. All-in-all, a great time can be had without having to leave the grounds for at least 3 or 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, I'd love to come back!”
Reviews.Author: nanrodaz
Reviews.Content: I was here for a work conference, and only left the resort once in 5 days! They really have almost everything you can imagine. Beautiful rooms, excellent service, I was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Garynspace
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Red Rock on two separate occasions and had absolutely fabulous times. The beds and pillows in our room were divine and we had some of the best sleep we have ever experienced on any vacation. Overall, the rooms are very quiet and quite comfortable. The pool area was nicely laid out and there always seemed to be plenty of spots to enjoy the sun and get into the pool. No matter wherever we went on the grounds of the Red Rock Resort, we were impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the entire staff. We kept within our budget and ate mainly in the food court, cafe and frequented the two Starbucks. We look forward to another visit to Red Rock in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding stay for only one nite”
Reviews.Author: KLE128
Reviews.Content: My wife and I drove from Park City, Utah arriving around 4pm. Our room wasn't ready but within the hour we were upgraded to VIP status and shown to a room on the 16th floor with a view of the entire valley and downtown Vegas. The room was outstanding and service well worth the wait. We enjoyed the casino and the Grand restaurant for dinner in the evening...and breakfast the next day with friends. We seldom visit Vegas as we are not big gamblers, but the hotel and casino decor and the staff make you feel at home. We only got to spend one nite but the experience was unbelievable..we definitly will be back

Reviews.Title: “The wife and I love Red Rock!!!”
Reviews.Author: enginedolt
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Resort Casino and Spa is like a land based Cruise Ship thats only 20 minutes away from the Las Vegas Strip and Fremont Street...The Strip and Fremont St are nice to visit but Red Rock is nice to stay at...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gotan116
Reviews.Content: Resort was off the strip yet close enough to allow easy access to and from. Regardless, the resport had a great atmosphere. For those who are looking for peace and quiet, this is the place to go and for those who are seeking the true Vegas nightlife, this place has it also. The staff was friendly and helpful and the room was fantastic with just the right of ammenities to make you feel spoiled. I highly recommend Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. We will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Merenguo
