Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and nice. The staff was very helpful. And the food in the restaurant was wonderful. Overall a great experience and a welcome change from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock was top notch in every aspect of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: mbostick57
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to visit Red Rock Resort and Casino again! The staff was awesome, rooms exceptional as well as everything else at this location!

Reviews.Title: “monthly get away....”
Reviews.Author: dandanthekenoman
Reviews.Content: hi all,, just to let everyone know, this is our third two night stay at REDROCK the wife and i ,wine and dine at t-bones the food was great. played a little b.j. and keno, went pool side for a while.to soak up some sun .it don't get any better than is....D.&M. P.S. WILL BE BACK THE 18TH &19TH SEE YOU THERE...THANKS REDROCK

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in Vegas again!”
Reviews.Author: NorCalGirl068
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and perfectly off the strip with the family!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: LaurelHungerford
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want to be close to the strip but not on it. This hotel is perfect if you want beautiful rooms with great views. This hotel is perfect if you want to check in and not have to go through the casino to do so. This hotel is perfect if you want to go to Las Vegas and have fun as well as relax, have plenty of food options and stay away from all the noise and craziness but still have a great Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Tonya777
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first trip to Vegas so we didn't know what to expect. We were picked up from the airport by the shuttle, which took too long to get there. When you are just getting off a 3 hour flight, the last thing you want to do is wait in the heat for a shuttle bus. But once we pulled up at the resort it was worth the wait. The staff was wonderful and we even got upgraded to VIP. I can't say enough about the room and most important, the bed. The bed slept like a dream. I wanted to take it home with me. Our rooms were cleaned everyday and we really felt like royalty. The only downside is the fact that the resort is so far away from the strip but that could also be viewd as a plus. Because this was my first trip to Vegas, I wanted to see the strip at night in all its glory. Unfortunately, I did not get a chance to do that because the shuttles don't run often enough and the last pick up was 10 pm. All in all, my experience at the Red Rock was second to none. We will be back in Vegas in 2013 so see you then. But trust me, we will be renting a car from the airport...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, definitely would stay again”
Reviews.Author: ksgirl8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a work conference and overall we were very happy with this hotel. The hotel is very nice and modern. The rooms are comfortable and well-appointed. The service was very good and all staff we encountered were very accommodating. The food was fine or good depending on what we got. We enjoyed the pool and bowling alley with our child and appreciated the fast wi-fi and 24 hour room service. We did not leave the resort during our weekend here and still had plenty to do and had a great time. If I had to choose things for them to improve on I would say there are not enough outlets in the room, especially for a modern hotel. I believe there were four in the bathroom and four in the bedroom. I would think something built so recently would have a charging station or something. Also, there are no vending machines and a soda is $5 for 12 oz from room service. I think you could get cheaper drinks downstairs, but late at night with a sleeping child I would have preferred a way to get something a little more reasonably priced. Overall we were very happy with this hotel and if I were to go back to Vegas I would prefer to stay there rather than on the strip. It was a very enjoyable and calm experience.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: DS-FLA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easily one of the finest in all of Las Vegas. Everything was first-class. Our room had a fabulous city view and was as comfortable and clean as the standard rooms at the Wynn. The bathroom was huge and had a large soaking tub and its own small TV. All of the staff - from the valets to the bellmen to the front desk - could not have been more friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was prompt and thorough. The pool area is very nice, although shade was not always easy to find. Service at the pool by the waitresses and attendents was first-class. As far as gaming, the casino is large and comfortable with a good selection of machines that have a decent payback. We did not play table games there. The woman at the slot club desk went out of her way to help us manage the free play and point multiplier we'd received in the mail. We ate at the buffet twice for dinner. There is a large selection, most of which was fine, although some of the carved meats were tough. The dessert selection was better than most buffets at that price point ($16-18 for dinner). We'd rate it as a "B", but good value for the $. We had a great time and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Close to fantastic, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: careyes45
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations and was not disappointed. Used their free shuttle to/from airport which seats 28 and has separate luggage compartment so you don't have to sit with your luggage or carry-ons. Very courteous driver. Hotel is beautiful, very new and chic. Check in was easy and we got complimentary bottled water. Depending on your room number you may have a long walk from the elevators. Gorgeous room decor! Loved the bathroom! Very reasonable room rates for such plush rooms. Requested canyon views and they are farther than you think (on the website photos the canyons look closer). Still a lovely pool view, though. There is only 1 robe per room so we requested another one. Also needed hypo-allergenic pillows and though it was 10:30 pm housekeeping was there in minutes. I love how there is a doorbell and electronic "do not disturb" and "please make up room" door signs. Staff was wonderful poolside, in the casino, restaurants, and everywhere else except for the buffet. It might've been because I was part of a large group that came in for dinner. We seemed to be an inconvenience to them. I also was not impressed with their buffet. I heard it was the best in Vegas, but it isn't. Stayed at the Rio last year and THEIR buffet is the best. If you plan on going outside the resort (visit the strip, shop the outlet malls) you'll need a car. There are shuttles to/from the strip and a shopping center (not outlets), but I didn't use them so I can't tell if they're convenient. If you have kids, this is ideal because of the pool, movie theaters, and bowling alley. It was overall a wonderful experience and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel room i've had in ages”
Reviews.Author: leslieinsf
Reviews.Content: I'm actually writing this from my room at the Red Rock. I'm here for a four-day business meeting, and this is day two. Vegas is not my first choice, but if you have to be here, this is the place to be. My room is excellent, very large, with a very comfortable bed, wireless and a faster ethernet connection if you sit at the desk. Two comfortable chairs, a jam-packed minibar (if you like that kind of thing) and even real martini classes. Dark walls give it a cozy feeling. The best parts are 1) the floor-to-ceiling windows that look toward the Strip, which is a couple of miles away. Twinkling lights of all of Las Vegas at night are gorgeous, and I kept the curtains open so I could wake up and see the sunrise. Gorgeous. and 2) the bathroom is off the hook Marble floors and a huge deep soaking tub with a TV on the wall to watch. Separate huge shower, two sinks, and the toilet has a separate door, so there's privacy if you're sharing a room. The service is great. The shuttles only run from the airport every two hours, but the driver was great, and it's only about 20 minutes or so away. Reception checked me in in minutes. There are plenty of restaurants, from a fast food court to upscale places of your choice. Good prices, and check out the Mexican restaurant happy hour. With free cocktails if you're playing video poker at the bar, it's cheap and excellent. The meeting facilities are huge with multiple events going on, but the place is big and it all fits and flows easily. Great place to hold events, and good block rates. Very happy here!

Reviews.Title: “A fun place for all members of family”
Reviews.Author: microphat
Reviews.Content: We can do an entire trip of a few nights at this place. They have Regal stadium seats theater, bowling alley, arcade, nice pool, food court in addition to find dining restaurant and best of all they have a Kids Quest where you can drop your kids for a few hours while you do your own things on premise. Kids Quest will require immunization card for the kids the first time you check your kids in (or you can fax them required items within 14 days). Socks are required, the maximum they'll watch your kids is 5 hour a day and the minimum is 1 hour. Our 8 year old twin boys love it here every time we're in the area. If you're not staying at this hotel, your best parking option is the West parking garage as it's near all of the attractions such as theaters, food court, Kids Quest, etc. However if you are guests here, park at the East parking garage since it's closer to the check-in lobby and elevators to your room.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Vegas spot...”
Reviews.Author: PJinAK
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent Vegas traveler and while I try other hotels, from the Strip to Downtown, I always come back to Red Rock. Great service, great location (easy on, easy off the new loop highway), beautifully decorated in modern, vibrant, sophisticated colors.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Red Rock Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaePahrump
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Hotel in Las Vegas for a weekend away. Since we are locals we usually stay in Vegas to see shows, excellent dining and sitting at the pool. Red Rock has the most wonderful infinity pool with cabanas, lounges with poolside restaurant, drinks. We dined at the Italian restaurant one evening sitting outside and enjoying a lovely meal, wine and excellent service. We will surely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: Virga017
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many of the casinos and non-gaming hotels in Las Vegas and this is one of the best. The room was one of the most comfortable I have stayed in this town, luxurious but comfortable. Terra Rosa is one of the best Italian restaurants I have eaten at in this country, with a superb wine list of many rare to see on menu Italian wines. The workout facility is excellent. And or me, with my interest in the outdoors, it location near Red Rock Canyon for hiking is a plus. The only downsides were that service at the front desk was slow and the hotel hallways are long (get a low numbered room).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the off the strip location, spa and concierge can use some help.”
Reviews.Author: adventuraNy
Reviews.Content: Location: Loved being off the strip Room: Amazing, huge, beautifully decorated, wonderful bathroom, the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Check-in/Check-out staff: Friendly Spa: Mediocre Concierge Service: Mediocre at best. I booked a wonderful package deal for 2 nights and included kayaking for 2 and 2 one hour massages. I spoke with the concierge about 4 weeks prior to our stay to make the arrangements. Unfortunately she did not really know the facts of the elements of package which negatively affected our stay. She suggested to schedule our massages after kayaking which sounded great. I was told we would be back from kayaking around 3pm, so she scheduled us for 6 pm massages which was the last appointment of the evening. Actually you return between 6-7pm, being off the strip the resort is the last drop off for the adventure company's shuttle service. I asked the concierge if there was any hiking involved or just kayaking and was told no hiking. There was hiking, which we were not prepared for with the proper gear/footwear. We were also told that lunch was not provided so we scrambled in the morning to figure out what to bring for lunch and lunch was provided. We were lucky and the rest of the guests were ok with us being dropped off first, we ran in the hotel, showered really quick and went to the spa getting there at about 5:45. Once arriving at the spa, we were repeatedly reminded that our appointment time was the last of the evening and that when we were done with our massages we were quickly get dressed and head out. We were called in for our massages at 6:10 and I was dressed and signed my receipt by 6:50- definitely not a one hour massage! I filled out a survey following the stay and received a letter from the concierge desk apologizing. It actually made me a little irritated because it felt like a pre-generated form letter and not very personal to my experience. Overall, I would stay there again if I was not going to the spa and would double check any services I book with the concierge which is silly to me because you use them because they are the experts. I also found the price of the package a great value.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: calibanker
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and modern. I enjoyed the modern feel of the hotel and the proximity to the casino. The courtyard area with mulitple pools was an interesting concept. I could see coming back and spending the entire time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off Strip Property in a Great Area”
Reviews.Author: 32847Apps
Reviews.Content: This is a 4 Star Hotel, Off Strip with great rates, great views, wonderful selection of entertainment & restaurants and near Red Rocks for hiking & biking. Staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: teechaz
Reviews.Content: Upscale for a reasonable rate. I felt welcome at this hotel. The employees were very friendly and did their best to accommodate us. It is a beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jetta8puma
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding, and this was the hotel for the guests. The bride and groom live in Vegas and picked this spot as the best resort in town. Very beautifully decorated and designed resort. Lots to do at the resort. Amazing pools and lounge chairs. Lush bars and hang out spots. Plush rooms with attention to detail, most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Wonderful view of the canyons and desert. Good restaurants for all tastes. Buffet is HUGE. Brewery has 1/2 yard beers, their own tasty brews. Poolside grill is very good too. From a fine dining restaurant to food court to Starbucks, everyone can find something to enjoy any time of the day or night. I didn't gamble, but they have a wide selection and cocktail waitresses and nice atmosphere. Only downside was the shuttle service. Needs improvement, especially because the hotel is on the outskirts of town and a cab costs $60 from the strip. I recommend your first trip on the shuttle originate at the resort so you know where the stop on the strip is, its really hard to find and staff on the phone have no idea where it is. They do give you cold water on the bus which is nice. Since it is owned by the UFC owners, we saw a famous fighter hanging out there!

Reviews.Title: “Always a good time here”
Reviews.Author: Lester808
Reviews.Content: Got lucky enough to stay 2 nights at the Red Rock for the Fourth of July. The fireworks was awesome and I had a great night of playing many of my favorite machines and some new ones to boot. My room was inviting and comfortable and the staff made my stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Rock is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: saints2010_11
Reviews.Content: Although the Red Rock is a ways from the strip, the rooms and atmosphere at the Red Rock is worth it. I will be back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family trip!”
Reviews.Author: standard04
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a family trip to Las Vegas I would recommend the Red Rock Casino. All of the staff was amazing! We have 2 kids ages 4 & 9 and they had the best time. The staff made us fell welcome every place we went. The pool is great! The kids loved the kids quest and the mivies! Great for a family trip!!

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like VIPs and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: cjpeery
Reviews.Content: The VIP experience started with Red Rock's complimentary shuttle that picked us up from the airport. The VIP experience continued throughout our stay. The entire staff gets an A+ in hospitality. The room was exceptional with a very comfortable bed, and a flat screen TV, . The bathroom was large and luxurious. A deep tub for relaxing, with a flat screen TV to view. Double sink vanity with a lighted magnifying make up mirror. A separate, glass enclosed tall shower. And the toilet was separated with a door. The staff was genuinely warm and friendly and the hotel manager welcomed us and gave us his card, expressing his sincere desire to see that our stay would be enjoyable. There are so many options for entertainment and dining. Besides gaming, there is a multi-screen cinema, state-of-the-art bowling, concerts, and a wonderful pool area. And, there are black jack tables, under a mister, at the pool bar. There are so many dining options, and each offer value, quality, and variety. I cannot select "one" favorite, we liked all of them. Tip: many of the restaurants offer "happy hour" specials that are a true bargain. At Red Rock Resort the experience leaves you feeling special. We visited with locals (who were at Red Rock) who said that they prefer Red Rock, to avoid the crowds at the strip hotel/casinos. Oh, and their slots do pay. I was lucky on a penny slot. This was our third visit to the Red Rock Resort and we will return! Tip: go to the Red Rock Resort website and register to receive specials via email. Their early December special is a must to take advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone enjoyed!”
Reviews.Author: Haganmom
Reviews.Content: We will be back. Our new 4th of July location. The fireworks couldn't have been more amazing and our view frm the king lounger poolside was fab! A little for everyone..bowling, gambling, movies, pool, great eats...ages 3 to 43 enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “4th of July Celebration”
Reviews.Author: KingTazz
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised to find an available room. We've stay here a few times and they consistantly exceed my expections! Awesome customer service and beautiful large rooms. This is the jewel of all Station properties.

Reviews.Title: “It was FUN and I will go back soon!”
Reviews.Author: bigdressy
Reviews.Content: It is a BEAUTIFUL big resort , The architecture is so lavish it should be a six star resort. A little known treat is to take a thee mile drive to RED ROCK National Park and enjoy a beautiful 15 miles per hour 5 mile drive of Red cliffs andother views.

Reviews.Title: “WE JUST LOVE THIS PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: raypesina
Reviews.Content: We like the fact that it is away from the strip. The casino is very comfortable and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: kbm1006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock over July 4th and loved it. It's 5 star all the way. Rooms are big, clean and comfortable. The pool is great and the food selections will please everyone. We cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected, but worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: mncampos5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went here during the July 4th weekend. We wanted to be near the strip but also not have to pay the price to booking a room so close to the date. The strip is about 20-30 minutes away and there is a free shuttle. It place is really a great family destination as there are loads for kids and teens to do. The place was big and crowded but not suffocating. The service was also very good for being very busy. The restaurants are all very good and the buffett always had a constant wait while we were there. If you want a break from the strip or are traveling with a family this is a great place to visit. There's plenty to do all on the resort.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay, and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: brooks8117
Reviews.Content: The room and service we received by all was wonderful. Great food at Cabos,Grand cafe,Terra Rossa, and The Feast Buffet. The Casino gaming area was well laid out. Not crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: ski37
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights 7/2-7/5 at Red Rock for a litlle R&R. We have stayed in Vegas many times and we havent been back to Red Rock in a couple of years. We had a great time! We flew in from Denver on South West. We had a great deal on a rental car from Alamo. It is so easy to get to Red Rock from McCarren Airport. We hopped on the 215 beltway and were there in 20 minutes with no traffic. Not having to fight the strip traffic is a big plus. We took advantage of a Red Rock promotion that gave us 2 free nights and we paid casino rate for the 3rd. All resort fees were waived! We ate at the Italian restaraunt and it was very good. We both used the Spa and it was outstanding. The pool while great was a little cold... We both played Blackjack and Craps. I also played Video Poker. They have tons of machines. The Yard House addition is a real plus for serious beer lovers. While the wait staff does not serve from there...you can gat a beer to go and enjoy it while gambling. All and all a great stay. We look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Laubster78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Red Rock a number of times since they opened and we always have an excellent experience. For us, we enjoy being away from the Vegas strip. The location next to the Red Rock canyons is great as it provides for fun and relaxing day trips for hiking, kayaking soaking in hot springs, etc. The hotel has everyhting we could wish for - a great full service spa, excellent restaurants, gambling if we choose to partake, a great bowling alley, a 16 (I think) screen theater, a nice pool... the list goes on. We like the cleanliness and modern, clean decor of the property as well. The service is top notch. THis hotel is our favorite spot for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not the Friendliest for Families”
Reviews.Author: lnjj
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay. We had a "Strip View" room on the 18th floor, which was really just a room overlooking the pool and nearby freeway with the Red Rock mountains in the background. The room was very clean and contemporary with chocolate colored walls, lime green chairs and feaux fur pillows. While the bathroom included a marble floor, glass shower, soaking tub and High Def TV. Traveling with a 5 year old boy, I must admit I did have to remind him not to play with the martini glasses and to be careful of the sharp corners of the bed frame. We also had to request a refrigerator, which was promptly delivered to our room for a minimal fee. However, I think the pool, bowling alley, movie theatre and arcade made up for these not so family friendly room elements. The main pool, which was very cold by the way, includes a fountain and wading area. The other small pools, and there are at least 6, are slightly warmer! Overall, this is a beautiful hotel, and a great alternative to the hustle bustle of the strip. The service was good and the food court and 2 Starbucks were also very convenient. However, if you're looking for a truly family friendly hotel, this may not be the best place.

Reviews.Title: “Just a fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: koby007jb
Reviews.Content: We have done the strip the last 4 years in a row and decided to try something different. The Red Rock resort was fantastic. We loved that the room was inset from the hallway, this by far was the most quite room that we have stayed in, at vegas. Great restaurants, especially T-Bones, cudos to Joseph and Jamie, they were great. Loved that you can do different things on the property like bowling or seeing a movie. Love the pool, you can fall asleep on the lounge chairs, they are so comfy. Loved the bingo room, very nice. Just a nice change from the crowded strip and all the staff members were very nice. Free shuttle to and from the airport and strip. Cant wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “My best Vegas experience yet!”
Reviews.Author: kclop10
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at many Las Vegas hotels (Aria, Caesars, Palms, etc.) this was far and away my wife and my best experience! The hotel is filled with friendly, helpful service people and is the perfect getaway spot! The hotel shows no signs of wear, The rooms are large and very comfortable and the spa is the best around! My wife enjoyed 3 spa services that she absolutely loved. The pit bosses even greeted me by name when I saw them and I am by no means a big gambler or someone that they should remember. There is also a 16 screen movie theater and 70+ lane bowling alley in the complex! There are also many dining options including many reasonably priced ones. We enjoyed every restaurant we tried which all included superb service and cuisine. Room rates are very reasonable as well! Thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort with so many amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Kthompson28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a great weekend getaway to the Red Rock resort and loved every amenity they have! The hotel is beautiful, rooms luxurious, restaurants delicious & the pool is both fun and relaxing at the same time. They really thought about everyone's preferences and provide so many options to choose from. Next time we will have to try out the spa! Dinner on the beautiful patio at T Bones is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort is a perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: GrammyBecky
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a business conference at Red Rock.. I stayed 5 nights. When I first found out the resort was a ways off the strip, I was less than thrilled. However, I found the resort to be awesome. The rooms are designed so that the doors are in short hallways making that conversation outside your door in a hall a thing of the past. Loved that! The rooms are richly decorated with fabulous comfortable beds. The bathrooms have lots of marble, deep soaking tub and tv to watch while soaking! The bedroom has a large flatscreen tv and beautiful views of the hills. The conference rooms are great and the conference food was high quality. Red Rock does a fine job of conference service. The Red Rock Canyon is gorgeous and has a great 13-mile drive with fabulous photo opps. It is a federal park so a fee is charged to get in but it is reasonable. Take the drive, well worth the experience. If you are a hiker, perfect place for you at different level.s of skill. The trip to the strip proved to be shorter than imagined and after walking the strip, the Red Rock looked more fun. A great casino, big theatre complex and bowling alley. A Costco is across the street as well as a bookstore and other shopping. My only complaint is the service in the restaurants is not consistent. The buffet was excellent but the Mexican restaurant sevice was slow, 15 minuytes just to get a menu and even after two requests, no chips and salsa were served. The Lbs. burger place had excellent burgers but slow lunchtime service. At a conference, this can be a problem. I highly recommend this resort for couples or families. I think this is a little different view of Vegas that's wonderful to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Business Center”
Reviews.Author: trk003
Reviews.Content: Here with family but need to work a little as well. Everything is great about the hotel other than the Business Center. It opens at 8AM (not great if you are from midwest / east coast). They have no wireless in the business center but do have 4 desktops so if you have info that needs to be transmitted off a laptop it is not conducive for that setup. You can basically touch anyone else that is in there when sitting down since the space is so cramped. There is a receptionist in the business center but when I was there it was used more as a social gathering employees for the staff so was noisy and not an ideal place to dial in for a conference call. They also had some packages sitting on the floor, which required me to navigate around to find a chair. I assume this was an isolated occurrence. While I know this probably isn't the case it appears they ran out of budget when building the hotel and the BC was last on order of importance. One of the worst (if not the worst) BC I have utilized and a little disappointing since the hotel is nice. Expected more....

Reviews.Title: “All around great place...”
Reviews.Author: Marie5597
Reviews.Content: Restaurants awesome - We ate at T-Bones the first night of our stay... just outstanding...great service, great atmosphere. The 2nd night we ate at Hachi - fabulous service and food!! We loved the pool and casino.... We have been recommending the resort to all of our friends and family. We can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinTraveler74
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at Red Rock in the last 4 months. I can't imagine anyone being disappointed in the Red Rock.....in any manner. It is a wonderful and exceptional hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful & best customer service in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ddaileynews
Reviews.Content: We will definitely stay at the Red Rock for future visits to Vegas, and definitely would recommend to friends & family! One of the best experiences we've ever had in Vegas. The service was outstanding - in all aspects of the hotel/casino. Each and every staff person we came across was very kind, courteous, & professional. The property itself is absolutely beautiful. We were very fortunate to have had this experience. Thank you for having such a beautiful property as well as wonderful employees! Debbie Salem, OR

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Roger59929
Reviews.Content: We stay at all of the best places in Las Vegas--Wynn, Bellagio, Cosmo. Red Rock is truly the best deal in Las Vegas. It has it all--it's new with beautiful rooms and a great casino. In addition it has a wide selection of first class restaurants as well as a movie theater and all types of entertainment from a great pool and work out area to bowling if you are so inclined. All of this and much lower prices and higher payout machines than what one would experience on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the Desert!”
Reviews.Author: Shemajo
Reviews.Content: Our recent trip to Red Rock Resort proved to be everything you could want and then some. We were greeted with smiling faces at the valet and registration desk. Just walking in through the front doors you know this is going to be a great stay! Very clean and classy. Liked that the room doors are in an alcove not facing the hallway. Also had a lot of little extras. The beds were to die for! Breakfast buffett was excellent and priced ultra reasonably. Food court offered a good variety and was very neat. Availability of movie theater and bowling lanes was great! Everyone we came into contact with was very courteous. Would recommend staying here without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “Fathers day weekend”
Reviews.Author: keldave
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun, our rooms were outstanding and it was so nice staying off the strip We did the poolside concert (Steel Pulse) sipping on a cocktails sitting in a lounge chair in the water on a warm evening...doesn't get much better I would go back in a heart beat....Thank you Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: heff1979
Reviews.Content: Best stay in Vegas!!!!!! Rooms were great, service was great and the whole atmosphere was great!!!!!Definitly coming back! Thanks Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: momdukes16
Reviews.Content: The resort is first class. All of the staff was very friendly and attentive. The buffet has a great selection and they are always filling, cleaning, and replacing. I booked a spa treatment which was an awesome experience. When you book a treatment you get full use of the spa for the entire day. It is well worth it. The guest rooms are spacious, clean and very modern. The bed was very comfortable. It there was a drawback to Redrock it is the location. This is about 15 minutes off the strip so if you don't have a car that might be a problem. I think they had a shuttle but we didn't need it. I would recommend this to anyone wanting a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with your family in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: triptime32248
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Rocks! The staff food and service were awesome. The room was very modern and spacious. A great place if you don't want the congestion, noise rude and sometimes nude themes of Vegas. Hey but if you do you can get there in minutes. I enjoyed the hotel with my husband and young son without having to cover their eyes one time. I have been to Vegas a few times and have stayed on the strip at the so called family friendly hotels. Not one was as tasteful and beautiful as Red Rock. Finally a true family get away. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great time everything you need or want.”
Reviews.Author: Jonnarh
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. You have all the features of Las Vegas in one spot with a little quieter atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: 55Elaine
Reviews.Content: Love this resort it is out of the hustle and bustle of the strip. The spa is spectacular and their spa services top any I have been to in Las Vegas. I recommend Red Rock to everyone it is a great getaway!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: KLinMI
Reviews.Content: This resort is far away from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas Strip. It is a little community in and of itself. The rooms are beautiful, the beds are THE most comfortable, the views of the mountains are fabulous! Everything is right there...food court, great restaurants, bowling center, theater, pool...you could easily spend a week and never leave the property! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The place to go when you want to be treated like a VIP and not go broke!”
Reviews.Author: jtt1966
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is my favorite Station Casino Resort! Great dining, gaming and relaxation opportunities! Consistently using the 'My Station' slot card results in great benefits. Sometimes I want a fancy meal, but often I want to grab some quality food at a reasonable price and quickly get back to the action! Red Rock accommodates both needs fantastically! On the strip you often get the extreme of either extremely high-end or low-end offerings... Red Rock has the perfect mix! Can't wait to go back! Send me an offer is can't refuse :-)

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Vegas Hangout”
Reviews.Author: dja777
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay here. My experiences have all been good. Friendly staff, clean rooms, BoseWave Stereo system among the many amenities. Plenty to do to keep me busy, from concerts to the spa and of course, gambling. Highly recommend that you book early, this place is becoming very popular and books up fast. I was tired of the Strip and wanted a change of pace and this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Love being off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: mbooke
Reviews.Content: One of the best stays I've had. Staff bend over backwards to help. No smoke and no noise unless you go to the Casino which is seperate from the hotel lobby and common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Strip View was great at night”
Reviews.Author: lowbrow56
Reviews.Content: The room was great staff was extremely helpfull Jeannie in room service was a delite and prompt (we pre-ordered breakfast for 430am before our kayaking excursion) bathroom was super nice soaking tub was awsome and extra large. This realy is a great resort and casino was great there are a couple of cons the food is on the pricey side and the elevator can be a hike if your room is at the other end of the bldg and they need a little more signage in the casino to help you navigate better the thing ig a huge circle w/ lots of spurs

Reviews.Title: “Family trip off of the strip”
Reviews.Author: familytravel75
Reviews.Content: My wife, two daughters, and I started a week long trip in Vegas and Los Angeles off at the Red Rock. We arrived at 0930 in the morning and were given a room immediately. The hotel is a short drive from the airport. The rooms are very spacious, and nice. The entire resort is perfect for families. There are several pools, bowling alley, movies, and a large casino. There are several choices for different types of eating. We rented a cabana for one day, and really enjoyed having the privacy to relax out of the heat and sun. All of the staff were very kind and eager to please. The beds were extremely comfortable. I had a massage in the spa and it was one of the best massages I have had. I used the steam room and sauna on the other days, as the fee is covered in the resort fee you are required to pay. It was very nice and large. We drove over to Freemont street for dinner one night, and it was about a 7 minute drive. I would highly recommend this hotel if you would like to be off of the strip, and enjoy some nice relaxing time. We had stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Lake Las Vegas before to be off of the strip, but we enjoyed the Red Rock much more for the amenities that were offered. You will not be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: livetwotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a weekend stay at the Red Rock. We were pleasantly surprised with this off-strip resort. The service was good and the property clean. We attended a concert at the SandBar on Friday evening, which was promptly turned back into their nice pool area on Saturday. The resort was well-appointed with food options and amenities. TBones Steakhouse served us an amazing meal, while LBS and the Yardhouse were also very good. All delivered a high level of service. The buffet was one of the best we have been to in Vegas. Our only gripes were the too expensive poolside drinks and that the Mexican and sushi restaurants were only open for dinner. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and not as good as 1st ...”
Reviews.Author: iluvmatt
Reviews.Content: We visited this property for the first time last September and had a great time, which is why we were looking forward to another visit. I don't know what happened in less than a yr but the pool water was dirty and mirky, pool chair cushions were just dirty and beated up. The furniture in room showed a lot of wear tear. Cocktails at the pool bar were ridiculously expensive - $16 for a mediocre mojito!!! Oh, by the way, the automatically add a tip to the pool bar bill. Ordered room service and was pleasantly surprised. The food was nice and hot with generous porion and the wait time was reasonable. Having a bowling alley and a food court on the premises was a plus but we probably won't return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “A two night oasis”
Reviews.Author: Eve G
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Red Rock after spending two nights on the strip and one downtown. This property was wonderful. It was clean, spacious and relaxing. Everyone we met went out of their way to be helpful and we couldn't have asked for more. The pool, however, was VERY cold so we didn't get as much use out of it as we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: losharos
Reviews.Content: We stayed there along with several other families, if was a Basketball Club tournament, so the entire club was there. It was a great resort for the kids, we all went bowling, to the movies, pool, etc... I recommend it 100%. The only thing we didn't like was that the mini bar inside the rooms had sensors, so if you moved something for longer than 45 seconds it would get automatically charged to your account, it didnt bother us, our children are older, but people with smaller children, that must've been pretty tough. Overall: Great Experience, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice off strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: astrofan12
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed in a Station Casino resort in years, but I have heard, and read, nice things about the Red Rock. And all the good things you've heard are true. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. I found this true for the door staff, the check in desk, the concierge, the buffet staff (look for the incredible Erica manning [womaning] the omelet station--six burners going, keeps the line moving and has a smile for everyone) and the casino staff. I stayed in a suite and yes it is very large and comfortable with a bath and a half, separate bedroom, two closets in the bedroom, plus one in the entry hall. I did have two problems in the bedroom: I never got the safe to work and the TV's (huge flat screens) picture was very bad. It look like it an old rabbit ear picture and also appeared to be in the wrong aspect ratio. But on a big plus I never heard anyone next door or in the hallway. In the casino I fortunate to always sit at tables where no one was smoking, but when the casino was moderately busy the smoke in the casino does not get sucked out as well as you'd expect from the high ceilings. The smoke did bother me. There is a convenient strip mall across the street--no too bad a walk when it's not 100+ degrees. The pool area is very nice with a good, but expensive, food menu. OK, yeah lots of good looking servers. A recent bad trend in LV, in the last two years, has been the return of resort fees. The Red Rock I believe has the highest of the resorts--$25. You can make it work out if you use their shuttle from and to the airport. Also you get the usual--wi-fi, worked very good, a newspaper and boarding pass printing. I also got the free shoeshine which again helps on the resort fee. Be sure to know what's offered to get the most out of the fee. Red Rock offers many good specials, mine came with a $200 resort credit, add to that how nice the place is and if you'd like to stay in a off-strip hotel it's a definite goto.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: ljtmontana
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for work and play in June and spent one night at the Red Rock-wish it was all three nights.....A true treasure off the strip! The staff was friendly and helpful and the building was beautiful, from the lobby, to the rooms, to the pool area. We were there to take in the Poison/Crue concert in the newly completed amphitheater. Cant say enough how impressed we were. It was like a well oiled machine, there were plenty of restroom facilities, no lines for drinks, not a bad seat in the place. CANT WAIT TO COME BACK!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Sletcha
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights last week (our sixth time) and it is as great as ever! The Signature Suite was spacious and the sound system in the room was awesome, as was the whirlpool tub. Great selection of video poker in the casino. Such a relaxing environment. Dinner at T Bones Chophouse was pricey but soooo good!!! Try the macadamia coconut pancakes in the Grand Cafe - yummy!!! Our only complaint was that our stay was too short! This is still our favorite place in Vegas and it will be hard to surpass!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY BEAUTIFUL RIGHT FROM RESERVATION TO DEPARTURE....”
Reviews.Author: MORETRAVELWORLD
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel very relaxed, private, and away from rowdiness of the strip.. This might be the place to be....I have been to several 4 to 5 stars hotel/casino resorts... My experience with red rock casino resort ranging from reservation, checking in, location of the property, staffs, till The last minute of my departure was simply great....I love the check in area which I believe was at a separate floor from the casino floor, The decor of the property right from outside to the rooms is very unique, The rooms, spa, and the pool area were all beautiful... The smooth chill-out and relaxation music in the room and around the property was very sorting ....Finally the great sense of hospitality and friendliness by the staffs was very much appreciated!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Red Rock is the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Jimbob057
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Red Rock in the past 18 months and it was fantastic. We have stayed all over Las Vegas and realized that the Red Rock is the place to stay for outstanding food, facilities, and service. The only phrase you hear from Red Rock personnel is "Yes Sir, how may I help you? No problem, we can take care of that for you." The concert out by the pool was fabulous and we can't wait for the outdoor concert area to be completed. The Sushi at Hachi is next to none and the Italian restaurant had the best dessert ever! The casino is also great and we won at muliple games. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Guest Rooms and Baths are very nice”
Reviews.Author: Lews52
Reviews.Content: This a a great place to stay, we live in the area and its away from the strip. You never have to leave the hotel, but if you do there is shopping and restaurants across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jadwiger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Redrock hotel and had an amazing time we felt very welcome the service was outstanding and it was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of the strip

Reviews.Title: “I'm going back”
Reviews.Author: bvluv2trip
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely going back. We had so much fun there. The food is great and the service is outstanding. Love the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: PhxPE
Reviews.Content: I just got back recently from 2 nights at Red Rock. I received a comp offer for 2 free nights in a standard room, $75 in food, and a $150 free bet (also the resort fee was waived as a part of this offer). I had not been to Red Rock in a year and had never played very much ($100 at a craps table) so I was surprised to receive this out of nowhere. I was in room 14-124 which is a canyon view. This seems to mean pool view. The other view choice is strip view and I can only imagine that it offers a distant view of the strip (clever). The pool view is great and I could also see the new outdoor concert venue from my room. No concerts were going on but I think I would have had a great view and I imagine I could have heard the music pretty easily (that Saturday was Poison/Motley Crue). The room is really nice. Very modern in its décor. If it has a negative, it is that the room is very dark. The lighting is minimal and the colors are darker brown (think Aria Casino right after opening). Since I don’t do a lot of reading or writing in my room (in fact, other than tv watching which provides its own light, all of my other hotel room activities involve having my eyes closed (most of the time)), the darker scene is ok by me. The bathroom is well lit (in here my activities are eyes fully opened – is this too much info for a trip report?) and has a separate tub (not jetted) with tv mounted on the wall at the end of the tub, a separate shower (not steam) which was a little small (or perhaps I am a little big), a separate toilet room with a pocket door separation with no lock (if that is a concern of yours), and dual vanities. All marble flooring, marble shower, and the toilet room had a faux leather wall treatment that was interesting in its uniqueness. The hotel was quiet with no noise from the neighbors (hey, Monte Carlo, are you reading this?) or the hallway. The elevators were quickly available and never crowded. Check-in was quick and polite. There were two people ahead of me when I got there but they were served quickly and I did not wait more than 10 minutes. I am not a foodie but I did enjoy the meals I had. I ate dinner and breakfast at the café and one dinner at the buffet (which is only $12.99 for dinner with a stations casino card (only $4.99 for breakfast!)). The dinner buffet was your standard fare. Not a huge selection of Asian cuisine but plenty of old standbys including a pasta station where they had cooks preparing made-to-order pasta dishes. For dessert, they had hard ice cream and pies/cakes in a case which they sliced for you. A nice touch. The casino is where I planned to spend more of my time although I ended up not gambling as much as I would have preferred. The reason for this is that this was a work trip and I spent more time on work than I anticipated. Back to the Red Rock casino, I hit the tables in the 6am hour before heading out for meetings and had the craps pit to myself. The dealers were extremely friendly and knowledgeable and I did not encounter anyone who did not appear happy to be there. I also played a little blackjack and their rules were hit the soft 17, paid 3:2 on blackjack, and DAS. They also had several double-deck games with the same rules (I think they were $25 minimums). It was a fun, quick trip and I am already planning on returning if they can send me another offer like this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the upgrade!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gina124
Reviews.Content: This is one of the premium hotels in Las Vegas. Away from the maddening crowd of the strip and a nicely-appointed hotel. The accommodations are comfortable and amenities abound. Sunken jacuzzi/bathtub, his/hers bathrobes and slippers, and the like. My husband and I enjoyed an unexpected upgrade given to us at no extra cost. We felt like top-tier passport cardholders (we're not!) upon arriving to our room. We've stayed at Red Rock before and expected to see (just) a bedroom. Imagine our surprise when we came upon a lviing room replete with a dining table, a mini-bar, a mini-fridge, etc. Oh, the view ~ to die for!!! One of the best stays ever! G. Recotta

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want upscale without the crowds of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: RMW80
Reviews.Content: We got a suit with adjoining rooms. Red Rock is very well run and upscale without being pretentious or overpriced. Rooms had a close view of Red Rock Canyon. It is ten degrees cooler than on the Strip and no crowds or seemingly endless walking. Casino odds are much more player friendly. My kids went horseback riding. Went to the movies in the casino. Had great meals. And the casino was better than on the Strip as far as drink service, friendly dealers, and payouts. Mt Charleston is about 35 minutes away where we drank on a patio looking at a green forest in 71 degree weather while it was 96 on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock was a nice change from the strip hotels...”
Reviews.Author: travelers1008
Reviews.Content: The Red Rocks Resort was great. The rooms were quiet and comfortable. The beds were comfy and the bathrooms were clean and very big. I normally have stayed on the strip and while we did take the complimentary shuttle to the strip to get in some extra fun, it was so nice to come back to the relaxing environment of the Red Rock. I loved that I never waited in line at Starbucks each morning, more than a minute to catch the elevator, and could always find a seat at the pool. The staff was very nice and helpful, which is a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “No better place in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: ClammynArizona
Reviews.Content: Went with my 4 & 5 year old girls, my husband, and our 10 month old baby. First of all, our room was spacious. That's saying a lot for 5 of us in a room. They sent up a crib with all the Johnson and Johnson baby products, complimentary. The Wynn does the same. Second, the room was very quiet. You don't here hardly anything around you. It's so peaceful. Third, the buffet is EXCELLENT with an EXCELLENT $13 price tag! Very good quality food. The Wynn's buffet is Top Notch at a $50 pp price tag!!!! So we ate at the Rock's buffet, every meal! Yes, EVERY MEAL! And, my kids are very picky and they loved the food. Fourth, the pool is so comfortable and has easy access from the hotel. Unlike most Vegas hotels, you don't have to travel 8 minutes by foot, crossing through public areas to get to the pool. There are pool elevators in the hotel. It's excellent! The lounge chairs are heavy wooden chairs with the thick cushions. And, most come with umbrellas that you can crank up or down yourself. There are quite a few pools, so the pool doesn't feel crowded. Fifth, is the Kids Quest. Ok. I don't even hire babysitters! But this Kidsquest was by far the best! It's approximately 8.50 per kid per hour. You can pay extra and the kids will get lunch, dinner or whatever snacks you want for them. We asked my kids if they wanted to go to dinner with us or if they wanted to have dinner at kids quest. My 5 year old said, "Mom, sometimes kids need a break from their parents. Us kids will eat here." That was priceless. Make sure if you use kids quest, you bring your childs shot records and a pair of socks so you don't have to buy them there. Buying socks there added $9 more to our bill for our 3 kids. So, have them with you. Sixth, is the location. Even though it is miles off the strip, it had all my favorite shopping within 1 mile, including my favorite coffee shop across the street, "The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf"!!!! Driving in the area is easy as pie since it is off the strip. And, you can walk across the small parking lot, across the street to Best Buy, Marshalls, Costco, or my coffee shop. Nice short 3 minute walk from hotel. Other hotels on the strip, take 10 minutes to get out the door and onto the street. And, that doesn't include the walking time to shopping! HOPE THIS REVIEW HELPS! I GO TO VEGAS AT LEAST ONCE A MONTH AND SOMETIMES EVERY OTHER WEEK! THIS IS MY FAVORITE PLACE TO STAY NOW! CAN'T WAIT TO COME BACK!

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pdbai66
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay off the strip. Great pool and atmosphere. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Las Vegas for a romantic gataway”
Reviews.Author: rento66
Reviews.Content: Not just the resort itself, but also the staff, whom was attentive, gracious and efficient. Great accommodation, the spa is perfect, intimate and relaxing. We highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “None better”
Reviews.Author: jimichonga
Reviews.Content: Wife & I have been regular visitors to Las Vegas for many years, and stayed everywhere from elite strip casinos to locals favorites. Most offer some feature or advantage worth experiencing....but we have found the ideal Las Vegas hotel/casino at the Red Rock Resort. What a tremendous value and experience - the rooms are spacious, quiet and beautifullt appointed. The staff is blow-you-away service friendly from houskeeping to pit bosses. Casino has great variety, excellent selection of high-return vp, reasonable table mins. Wife rated her spa treatments as 5-star, and the exercise room and pool among the best in town. Restaurants were simply superb - particularly the steaks at T-Bones - exceptional quality, presentation and service......don't miss it if you stay here; and by all means you must stay here. Sure, it's distant from the strip or downtown, but in fact it's just minutes by low-traffic 215 to everything else - but why leave? Nothing's missing at the Red Rock Resort, and you won't want to leave once you enjoy the ambiance. Oh yeah, to top it off, actual beautiful views of RR Canyon and/or the nightglow of the heart of Vegas are just a throw-in to everything else. We're done experimenting and trying the "hot, new" casino-hotel - Red Rock is our ideal destination, and why change a tremendous thing?

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great casino”
Reviews.Author: ICURNPHX
Reviews.Content: I had an outstanding time at this great resort. Fantastic video poker available. Excellent rooms and great service. My only complaint is the line is MUCH too long for the buffet - even on a week day for breakfast. Be sure to check out the free shuttle service from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “"RED ROCK ~ THE HOTEL THAT "NEVER FAILS" TO "PLEASE!"”
Reviews.Author: Chacha2u
Reviews.Content: Some say "Calgon" take me away, I say, let "Red Rock" take you away...on a ride that you won't forget, and one that you'll be surprisingly happy that you finally took.... I dare you to take yourself off the Vegas Strip and leave behind the hustle and bustle of both the "Strip" and the frequented downtown "Fremont Experience" too. Although we've always chosen Vegas as the final destination to meet up with family and friends we have not seen over the years, I myself continuously find a certain need to venture away from all that glitz and blinking neon signs which Vegas is so well known for. Should it be your first or last trip to Vegas, you'll never regret taking the time out to visit the beautiful "Red Rock Hotel Casino& Spa Resort," just a 15 minute drive up from downtown Fremont on Charleston Street, or just a 20 minute or so drive from the airport on the freeway! Haven't gone there yet? Waiting for you is one of the most gorgeous views of the Red Rock mountains if situated in one of their beautiful canyon view rooms. Full view windows from the top to the bottom that oversee the beautiful cabanas and pools with a backdrop of mountains that seem to take on a range of colors throughout the day. It is but a rare and overwhelming spiritual essence that seems to take hold of you as you gaze out to admire all that beauty within the confines of a very relaxing, spacious and wonderfully decorated room. Amenities such as thick lush white towels, beds & pillows selected purely for our comfort, a huge wall mounted flat screen tv, wi-fi if you need it, a white marbled floored bathroom and separate shower with a deep sunk in marble tub, and a private commode behind closed sliding doors makes this bathroom one to die for. You can entertain yourself in this bathroom hideaway by just clicking on the tv above while soaking in a tub of spa salts provided by the hotel. Before you know it, its time to leave this beautiful room and head on downstairs to one of the most beautifully floor planned Casino's I've been too. When you sit yourself down to play, it'll be in comfort on some cushy chairs, that I haven't found elsewhere in Vegas. There is no need to go elsewhere to play, everything is right here in this private get away, along with a variety of cuisine that is fit to please any palate out there, and at very reasonable prices too! Thank you Red Rock for always making it a pleasure for our entire family to visit you at least two to three times a year from Hawaii and elsewhere in the United States. We're always looking forward to meeting one another up there at your hotel & casino....why?...you've always made it a memorable experience for us all. Keep as you are and don't change what's already working for your hotel & casino! MAHALO from Hawaii!

Reviews.Title: “Highs and lows at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Pooley84
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Red Rock for one night, and overall had an enjoyable stay. I had read some reviews on this site before going and saw that the main complaints were customer service related. One review that really stood out to me was, "If anything goes wrong, you're on your own." This COULD NOT be more true! We had a great stay, the hotel and pool were beautifully decorated, and comfortable. However, we had a couple issues during our stay and they were IN NO WAY resolved. No apologies for any inconveniences, or suggestions on how to make things better... "No means no" at Red Rock. Also, if there is ANY chance your reservation plans might change, do not book an 'online exclusive' rate. In our opinion the "canyon view" rooms are not worth the extra money. Lastly, the pool area was PERFECT... my only complaint is that there is a constant foul odor that we could not put our finger on... our only thought was that it might be from the artificial turf. Bowling alley is great, wonderful movie theater and arcade for the kiddos.

Reviews.Title: “Best service EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Kshouper
Reviews.Content: I have never come across a group of employees that seemed to genuinely love their job such as the group of people i met at Red Rock! Morning after morning and meal after meal I met servers, busboys, hosts,etc that were friendly, helpful and had a true desire to not only meet but anticipate every need. 4 wonderful days with 100% quality staff! Unheard of typically - so happy to recommend The Red Rock! ** Red Rock ROCKS!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to next time!”
Reviews.Author: Dana2844
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property, well maintained and staffed. You ask and they will deliver, I am really looking forward to the next time I go to Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Resorts in all of Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: palmerrc
Reviews.Content: Thsi Resort is wonderful from top to bottom. Rooms are beautiful, casino is very large and is a great place for gaming. The pool is the most beautiful in all of Vegas. Many great restuarants and food choices.Look forward to staying there again. Would reconmend to everyone. Great place to get away from the crowds and confusion of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “FUN FUN FUN”
Reviews.Author: victoriawing
Reviews.Content: red rock hotel is amazing check in was so quick and painless they has some info that was wrong bu fixed it in a second the rooms are amazing, food and dinning is good no matter what you have a craving for pool area great, and so many different varieties of slot machine that you never want to leave. The staff was so great. everyone is so kind.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Casino well....rocks!”
Reviews.Author: nickcase
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. Great for families as it has a large bowling alley, food court and theatre complex all in one convenient location. New slots. Friendly service. Awesome views. Close to hiking and scenic drives. T-Bonz Restaraunt is the bomb! Awesome food and service!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort! My new favorite Vegas spot.”
Reviews.Author: DebbeC
Reviews.Content: I just spent 5 days at the Red Rock resort. I typically frequent Vegas 2-3 times a year and thought this off-strip location would be a nice change, but planned on driving to the Strip at least a couple of days. I never left once!!! I loved this place! The rooms were affordable, spacious and gorgeous. The dining options were fantastic; from a quick lunch to very nice dinner, there was so much to choose from. The layout of the resort made everything seem so close, even though it is huge. There is a large bowling alley (25+ lanes, I'm guessing), an onsite 16 screen movie theatre, arcades, dance spots, nice bars and lounges, and an outdoor summer poolside concert series with well-known decent acts. I also loved the pool(s); one beautiful large pool with a fountain platform in the middle, surrounded by many more smaller pools. So you can be in the middle of it all, or keep to yourself. Your choice. The kids were having a blast on that fountain platform. The selection of table games and slots were great. I saw some games there I've never seen anywhere else. I especially love the blackjack table with the flat screens built in to the table. Also, plenty of 5$ tables for those playing in that range. Oh, and the spa and gym were great too...(see, I keep thinking of more). Overall, we had a great time! I would DEFINITELY go back again. Customer service was great, resort was awesome. A+++

Reviews.Title: “i love the decor of the entire resort...”
Reviews.Author: whitney3
Reviews.Content: it is one classy resort full of style and grace. everything about the resort spells CLASS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the customer service and overall experience of staying at the Red Rock. I will definetely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: SmithWashingtonUtah
Reviews.Content: Best customer service in LV> A little off the strip but well worth the extra drive. Great restaurants! Beautiful Pools. Great Rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: k9clpr18
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay. We enjoy it every time. We have stayed at Red Rock about eight times. Every stay has been fun. We have had a mini suite twice. Very nice and spacious. The food in the restaraunts has always been very good. The service at the pool, restaraunts, movie theater, bellhops, valet parking, maids, all have been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry that we haven't stayed here before this”
Reviews.Author: billnade
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at Red Rock but not our last. Everything is first class. The front desk is run like a strip luxury resort. The room was large with great decor and amenities. I kept saying "This is NOT a local's casino-hotel". The views are either strip-view (miles away!" or mountain view. The pool area is great and the attendants are young, lovely and attentive. Now, all we need is to be able to win there!

Reviews.Title: “So Happy We Came Back”
Reviews.Author: hvtrillo
Reviews.Content: We had not styaed at Red rock for several years and decided to try it again. The Yardhouse was a new eating place us and was great. My afternoon at the pool was wonderful. Of course, we ended our visit with drinks and dinner at T-Bones Steakhouse. It is as fabulous as we remembered it. The hotel rooms are as nice as when the hotel first opened.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort/casino, I'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: ammbrr
Reviews.Content: I'll admit it, I'm in love with Red Rock. It's an amazing, beautiful, classy resort. I love being away from the strip. I like to visit the strip, but I love staying at Red Rock. This visit I went to T-Bones Steakhouse and was thoroughly impressed with the food, service and value. It didn't hurt that I won a ton of money in the casino too...in general, I find that the slot payback is better off the strip, and that was certainly true this time. I come to Vegas a couple of times/year and Red Rock is one of my very favorite places to stay. It is clean, safe, open and airy, big, but not too big, and has the friendliest staff! I highly recommend this property to anyone coming to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful destination resort!!”
Reviews.Author: kayfrayroth
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, loved the pool area!! Great service everywhere we went. A little far from the strip, if you're into that. They do have shuttles which we took to and from the airport, and they have some that run to the strip as well. We took a tixi to see Le Reve (highly recommend!) I would definately come back and enjoy some of thier weekend concert series, poolside!

Reviews.Title: “Goo Goo Dolls Concert”
Reviews.Author: amberlynnbrewer09
Reviews.Content: We came to the hotel for the concert, and were excited because it was off of the main Las Vegas strip. The hotel is so nice, has absolutely everything you need, we didn't have to leave for anything. The concert was so good, and it was poolside. They have very nice pools, and a spa. We had the Feast Buffet, and it was great for dinner, and breakfast. Prices were amazing. Loved everything about our trip, will go back again soon. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: laurieloops
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous view of Red Rock, great good, wonderful beds and bathroom. Friendly staff. Only complaint? We couldn't stay longer. We will make this our place for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great services and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJLadySharksU16
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I had stayed in Las Vegas. The room is super clean. I really enjoy the night view from my 19th floor hotel room. It was an amazing view, I can see the whole Las Vegas! It is a great hotel with a good shopping mall, good casino (not too much smoking), and good restaurant. Good hotel, good people, and good services!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in vegas isnt on the strip”
Reviews.Author: sxkaplan
Reviews.Content: By far the best customer service in vegas. I wouldn't dare to stay anywhere else even though I spend the majority of my time on the strip when I'm in vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Was a beautiful hotel and the staff was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: suzib225
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I had been to Vegas and was very impressed! The hotel had ample shuttle and limo service to both the strip and the airport. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and the room was amazing! The batht ub was splended and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. I cant wait to come back to Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Drewseph
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, modern, and clean. We loved our view of the canyon and pool. We liked that the hotel was away from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas Strip. However, it is about a $50 cab ride to the airport or the strip. In hindsight, I probably would have rented a car because the free shuttle was small and fills up fast, plus the times were not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JeffroT
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Station is a great place to get off the crowded hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas Strip. Very quiet and relaxing with all the amenities of the Strip. Great rooms, restaurants, pool area and gaming. The staff is friendly and helpful. I try to stay at least a couple of days there each time I visit Las Vegas from Ohio.

Reviews.Title: “Grand cafe corn beef hash is to fantastic”
Reviews.Author: drake63
Reviews.Content: Have eaten all over the country , and the Corn beef Hash was one of best if not the best i have every had , Service was warm and friendly , Will visit again on my next trip so to the Cafe

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business trip outside the strip”
Reviews.Author: robyn76
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at the Red Rock and truly enjoyed it. There are plenty of restaurants to choose from and the bar in the center of the casino was lots fun. Guest room: Very spacious, very clean and LOVED the bathroom! The views of the mountains were just beautiful. I wish I had more time to sit and relax in my room. My only complaint is the room was all the way at the end of the hallway, so it was a long walk from the elevators each time I had to go to my room. Meeting space: The meeting rooms were in good condition and the catering was great. I'm a picky eater, but I was able to enjoy every meal that we had onsite. The various breaks were also enjoyable. The pretzels and hot dogs were a big hit and I loved the make-your-own trail mix. The staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock - the ultimate Vegas destination!”
Reviews.Author: JMcCown
Reviews.Content: Three days at Red Rock just wasn't enough - we loved the whole experience from the choice of restaurants (and food court) to suit any taste to the 16 screen movie theater and bowling alley as well as the Bingo parlor and Arcade - so much in one place. We spent an afternoon at the pool, I had my hair fixed at the salon and toured the Fitness Center - you can find everything for a great work-out and so many spa services which I found to be very reasonably priced. We upgraded our room to a Resort room and it was spacious with a great view of the mountains. We especially enjoyed being away from the populous Strip - the employees were very friendly and helpful and it is truly a beautiful hotel. The casino offers such a variety of machines in all denominations as well as tons of table games (which we don't play). Red Rock is now one of our favorite Vegas destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Love the resort and everything in it !!!”
Reviews.Author: babs0540
Reviews.Content: Been going to Vegas for over 25 years and stayed at a number of hotels....my husband and I both feel that we have now found a new home away from home....Friendly people, great rooms, wide variety of activities, good range of slots and table games, wonderful pool area, etc......Can't forget the food...think you can get just about anything you want from the great buffett to great sandwiches in the food court....plus some very nice restaurants....really wish we could come out more than once a year, but those air fares are killers, lol.....want to see a new movie, it's there, want some excercise, go bowling, it's there, eyes rolling from the slots, relax and play some bingo...like I said before, you never have to leave the resort. They have it all....

Reviews.Title: “Besides all the good stuff, the BEST BAKERY IN GRAND CAFE”
Reviews.Author: axfoto
Reviews.Content: I'm from NY where they created the black and white cookie, and i must say i had the best frigin black and white cookie I have ever had since eating b/w cookies in 1970! And the cupcakes are darn good too... better than magnolia bakery in NYC. The bakery in the Grand Cafe is a hidden gem!!! The hotel is awesome, the service is great, everyone is very friendly and helpful.... slots suck but where don't they????

Reviews.Title: “Birthday package!”
Reviews.Author: TravelsHereNthere
Reviews.Content: The signature suite is amazing! It is very spacious.The bedroom has a super comfortable King bed and the living room has a large L shaped sofa. Th spa and pool are also great for spending a day with friends or family. Also, every employee made sure to greet us and provide great service!

Reviews.Title: “Ioved it, plan on staying again”
Reviews.Author: sweetdeeSoouthfield
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Red Rock was a very positive one, The rooms were great, large and roomy, Bathroom has a seperate T. V. viewing, telephone for your need while in the bathroom. Great resturants, to choose from along with bowling alley, bingo, casino, and night clubs. Staff was very eager to please.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Red Rock on my 2nd stay... will be going back !”
Reviews.Author: Catchtape
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Beautiful decor and everything you need. You don't have to be on the strip to have fun if you are staying at the Red Rock. My husband and I came down for meetings we both had to attend... so it was a mix of business & pleasure. GREAT burgers at LBS. Rooms were great, beautiful, clean, modern. Bathrooms are very cool. Only downer is the long walk from the elevators if you are staying at the opposite end of the hall... but no big deal. We used the bowling alley, pool, casino, buffets, meeting rooms, and spa area open to guests. They were all awesome I will be returning in July for another meeting and am planning on staying a couple extra days. The pools are great !! Staff is very friendly and food is very reasonable. Be sure to sign up for a players card.... you will receive coupons for free buffets and other things. Evidently this is the Resort that a lot of the Vegas locals hang out in... I understand why.

Reviews.Title: “Great escape from the strip!”
Reviews.Author: stevekub
Reviews.Content: We were overall happy with our stay at Red Rock Resort. We stayed for two nights in late May, and were assigned a double queen room on the 17th floor (17-123) that was not too bad of a walk from the elevator with a view of the strip. Housekeeping kept the room neat and tidy, and even showed up after we crawled out of (the very comfortable) bed at 5:00pm our first day. The bedding was extremely comfortable, as was the shower (with excellent water pressure), the tub (which even fit a travel companion at 6'2" and 300 pounds with ease). A few concerns were that there was a light bulb burned out in the toilet (maintenance took care of), the protective layer on the marble sink is peeling up right by the tub (which just either will make you want to pick at it or ignore it), and we were unable to use the checkout or view our bill via the TV. The free (included) internet was fast enough for our needs, and logging in while in your room gave us free access throughout the resort. Times we did not renew our internet gave us an "opportunity" to purchase internet throughout the resort at $9.99. Ouch! The resort has enough to offer that you really never have to leave. Which is good in a way, but it can also make for you being a captive audience. We took it as an opportunity to try some of the dining establishments throughout the resort, as follows: Buffet - Standard LV buffet. Reasonable costs, certainly, good food. Grand Cafe - Highlight of our trip. Great service, excellent food, and according to a traveling companion, "delicious bloody marys!" T-Bones Chophouse - left much to be desired. Too much "attitude" and a server/bartender that had too much attitude to be bothered with punching the right button, leaving us with fish tacos instead of fried oreos and a vicious eyeroll when we said something. The men's spa facilities must be tried, especially since it's included in the resort costs. A hot tub, cold plunge tub, sauna, and steam will take any jet lag right out of you. Enjoy a nice relaxing time with plenty of bottled water to help replenish and rehydrate you! We'll definitely go back - mostly because the service (with the exception of the bartender at T-Bones) was friendly and inviting. The resort is a nice oasis from the strip, and keeps you there especially if you like gambling, dining, movies, spa, and swimming!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: moxie44535
Reviews.Content: Great hotel was great. The service was awesome and it was very clean. Nice place for those how find the chaos of the strip overwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Our "go to" place in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: April093
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Vegas this is where we always stay. The service is fantastic, friendliest staff we've ever encountered, rooms are very large and very clean. We love not being on the strip, but just minutes away. Waking up to a view of Red Rock is amazing. Plenty to do if you don't leave the resort...theatres, bowling alley, restaurants, pools and of course the casino. They're building a stage for concerts...not large...but will get you up close and personnel with the entertainers...can't wait for that. We've been here many times both for business and pleasure and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, average service”
Reviews.Author: Matt_UKTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during March 2011 for a quick weekend break. Overall the hotel is very nice - nice rooms, good views, great amenities, good food and plenty to do. I also love the fact that it's off the strip and gives you some separation from all the action. They also do a nice job of separating the hotel from the casino. PROS: - Nice, spacious, clean and modern rooms with good views - Off Strip Location - Amenities (movie theater, multiple restaurants, food court, casino, spa, etc.) CONS: - Long lines at buffet on weekends - Front desk staff Overall, we have a very good stay, but service was a little lacking in some areas. Here are some examples: 1) I don't like down/feather pillows. I called down to get a hypo-allergenic foam pillow. It never came. 2) I had a headache the next morning. I called down to get some Aleve brought to the room (from the gift shop). It never came. 3) Our reservation offered as "late check-out" as an additional perk.
