We were planning to leave around 12:00 noon anyway, but at 11:55am we called down to tell them we would be out in 20 mins, and the girl told my fiancee that we had to leave "right now" or they would charge us for an extra night. Needless to say, I took my time, went downstairs, and spoke to the Assistant Manager, who was horrfied. She made the situation right by comping one night of our hotel stay. We also got a free lunch. You can't ask for more than that :) I would stay here again, but I think next time I'm in Vegas I want to try the M Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Relaxing and Scenic. See you again in August:)”
Reviews.Author: carding78
Reviews.Content: We had visited Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa in October of 2010 because we had young adults with us that wanted to go bowling. We had a great time but didn't get to explore the rest of the resort. We came back in May 2011 and stayed here. We were very impressed with the rooms along with the beautiful view. The casino has a wide variety of fun slots. A great selection of restaurants. We loved the Grand Cafe. Even ate at Fatburger for a late night meal. If you don't mind waiting in lines the Buffet is inexpensive and has a lot of good food (I think the locals come here for the buffet because you can't beat the price). The pool was relaxing and the chairs are so comfortable. We've experienced the exclusive strip hotels but we find that Red Rock is the place for us. Also they sent us email asking if we needed transportation and sent email asking how our stay was. They have it all covered. I give them an "A+" for hospitality. See ya soon RR

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Maujon
Reviews.Content: My husband & I haved stayed at The Red Rock Hotel & Casino, since they first openned. Every visit is as good as the first, from the moment that you check in, to the moment of check-out, the Hotel & Casino staff, make you feel very special & really take good care of you, Wonderful restaurants & the Buffet is one of the best in Vegas for the price. Rooms are comfortable & so relaxing, We love the Canyon view rooms the best. We will keep returnning & know if you give The Red Rock a try you will be very hapoy. So much to do for the family also, great bowling alley, swimming pool, video arcade & movies, also fast-food court for quickie meals, The Red Rock is great for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jharris01
Reviews.Content: I must say that this was a very pleasant and relaxed stay. The red rock is not only a beautiful hotel with awesome natural decor, it is also probably one of the most relaxing hotels in LV. Away from the strip, but close enough to check it out as well. I thoroughly enjoyed staying here and I think anyone in my age group would as well, which is older than 30 but younger than 50. Oh, I might add, that my room had a view of the mountains, which I found extremely beautiful all by themselves...

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Delivers the Best of Both Sides of Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: BernieO_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Las Vegas several times over the last 10 years, and stayed at a variety of hotel properties. We love Red Rock because of it's location, level of service and relaxed, Southwestern vibe. Being avid hikers, we appreciate the proximity to Red Rock Canyon and its breathtaking views and opportunities for exploration. This last trip, we rented a Harley and rode through the park - it was a definite highlight of our stay. The restaurants at Red Rock were unsurpassed, and unforgettable - everything from the elegant cusine at T-bones to the fun and casual atmosphere of Yardhouse. We also took advantage of the daily shuttle to the Strip to taste the "other side" of Vegas - the best of both worlds! And with it's ever-expanding entertainment venues and line-up, Red Rock itself is quickly becoming the "total package" in destination resorts. I highly recommend Red Rock to anyone who wants a true get-away and relaxing, renewing vacation experience!

Reviews.Title: “W e loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: coop1946
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, food was great, personal friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Super great experience and we'll be back in October 2011”
Reviews.Author: tburger3
Reviews.Content: 1) We had a super hotel suite with a fantastic room attendant. Very clean and tidy. 2) Attended a great outdoor concert -- top notch entertainment. 3) Casino offered wide selection of table games and many, many choices of video poker. 4) We had wonderful service including a super helpful front desk; they printed my boarding passes for my return flight! Simple but helpful. 5) Pool and work out room were fantastic and staff had great, helpful attitudes. 6) The buffet must be a great deal based the long lines every day! Buffet was good, not great.

Reviews.Title: “We will always stay at the Red Rock Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: wolfejo
Reviews.Content: Everyone that works at the Red Rock were friendly, curtious and helpful. The room ,casino, restrooms and restaurants were all very clean and comfortable. We had a wonderful stay and will be back !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: SparkyShaw
Reviews.Content: The room is nicely laid out, the bathroom is huge w/ separate tub and shower. Strip and Canyon room views are both very nice, regardless of side. The Pools are huge, well maintained and can be alot of fun for adults and kids. The casino seems nice, and I didn't feel pressured to gamble. They also have a movie Theater. For food, pass on the food court-nothing special, but the restaurants hold their own. If, for some reason, you want to go to the strip, they do offer a shuttle from the hotel as well as a shuttle to/from the airport (Note that Level ZERO is opposite where the limos and taxis are)

Reviews.Title: “Strip action without the hustle and bustle"”
Reviews.Author: showdj
Reviews.Content: Great casino/resort. I've stayed at 26 different properties in Vegas and this is top 5 for sure! Great options and now they're adding an amphitheatre with some great concerts coming up. Nice poker room...great restaurants and excellent rooms. Loved the flat screen by the bath tub.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with so much to do”
Reviews.Author: Nina2100
Reviews.Content: I went to Red Rock Resort for a retreat. When we arrived we had our first "competition" which was at their own bowling alley. As we made our way to the alley, I was amazed to see a movie theater, bingo hall and more in this one hotel. I felt like we never had to leave the resort. The bowling alley was so much fun and the staff was very accomodating to our group. We definitely had VIP treatment. When we finally were able to check in, the rooms were gorgeous. Nice bathroom, amenities and comfy beds. We also had a spa appointment and the massage was nice and relaxing, but would have preferred a bit more of a deep tissue massage. The pool area looked fun, but I never got to venture out there. We were on a tight schedule. The only downfall to the resort is the location being so far from the strip. We had some ladies say it cost them $70 to get from Red Rock to the Strip. That is a bit pricey in my book. Overall the hotel was a luxury resort, just needs to be moved a tad closer.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: msjazzy50
Reviews.Content: This resort is huge, beautiful and clean. Conference rooms were large and comfortable. The hotel rooms were up to date, large and beautiful. My only complaint would be they need new pillows. I sleep with2 pillows and here I needed all 4 to sleep on. The staff was friendly and helpful. The casino was nice and rewards center was helpful. Restaurants in the casino area The Feast Buffet, Grand Cafe and T Bones were clean with good food. This place has everything, bowling alley, movies, spa and gorgeous pool. The resort is not on the strip, but they do have lots of shuttles going to the strip and to the airport. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: mossfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a wedding. The resort was very clean and had a wonderful pool. The rooms were terrific. They do need to spend a little more time on customer service. When I called to make reservations they were very rude. I called back later to check and they had reservation mess up. When we got there all went well until we had a problem getting the bride where she needed to be with transportation arranged through the hotel. They were no help. Could not even get cabs for us. They did seem very sorry and were nice and polite. The place is a nice hotel. Just be prepared for the customer service problems that they need to work out.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and Miss-You just don't know what you'll get”
Reviews.Author: jtrn
Reviews.Content: On the whole, my husband and I had an enjoyable stay at the Red Rock. It's location is very convenient to family and friends. We have always stayed on The Strip so this was a different experience for us. And we liked it! We enjoyed the various restaurants within the resort, Lbs became a quick favorite! The resort had a variety of activities to offer the guest besides gambling, like bowling and a movie theater. My biggest complaint had to be the awful mattress. It's not that we went to Vegas to sleep but for the few hours that we did want to get some rest , it was too bad the bed was so uncomfortable that rest was impossible. Perhaps this is the way management keeps the guest out of the room and in the casino! Our friends, who stayed on the same floor as we did, had a very different experience. During their entire stay, their room was not cleaned once. I know they left very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Redrock ,Yes you wanna stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TheTruth1973
Reviews.Content: Top notch from the curb to check out! It seemed that the staff to guest ratio was awsome everytime I turned around there was someone taking care of me. Love the bartenders @ Lucky's (Carolina's scorpion tattoo is the hottest thing I have ever seen) Pool drinks are expensive but what the heck your on vacation! Yardhouse food was awsome. I can't say enough good things about this place its super clean if your on the fence I say JUST BOOK IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect retreat away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: chris1304
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with well appointed spacious rooms. The pool area is very comfortable but the water was a little cold. The hotel is 9 miles away from the strip but there is a shuttle service- the cost covered by the £27.99 resort fee (payable in most Vegas hotels). Over the daily resort fee seems like a daylight robbery to me. We had a great stay and enjoyed lying by the pool for hours. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who values classy accommodation but is not worried about being away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a try”
Reviews.Author: nolalady60
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Red Rock which is off the strip because we have done all that thing before. The whole place is as good as most strip hotels and far better value. Good restaurants,bars and entertainment,give it a try

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: RGlennan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock as our final destination of our final west coast trip and with having 3 young children and experiencing the 'strip' on our outbound journey thought it would be a good idea to stay away from the hustle and bustle of LV Boulevard! So glad that we did as Red Rock was simply perfect! From the staff to the decor of both our suite and the hotel building it was a great few days we had there. The kids also loved it as they had a play centre which is daycare (nursery) so it gave Dad and me a couple of hours casino playtime! They have a shuttle bus to the strip which runs hourly until 10pm but you need to get down to the lobby early as its quite small and its first come, first served! Great cheap breakfast buffet too! Would definately go back there on our next American trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place To Enjoy Vegas Away From The Strip!”
Reviews.Author: buckytrips
Reviews.Content: I love the Red Rocks area around Las Vegas. It's a great place to walk,hike, bike and just enjoy nature, so it was great to stay at the Red Rocks hotel with view of the beautiful Red Rocks canyon! The hotel is beautiful and has a great vibe with cool relaxing music always somewhere in the background. Love this place and will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: GinaSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: The resort had something for everyone.My room was bright, upbeat & had a nice view of the Canyon. The pool ambiance was fantastic; offering upbeat music & a friendly staff waiting on pool guests. I loved the bowling get together & had a fantastic time dancing in two of the numerous night clubs. The spa was truly amazing. The workout room had everything I needed for a great cardio & weight workout. The yoga class really helped & the relaxation in the steam room with aroma therapy hit the spot. Throughout my stay, the staff remained most attentive to all my requests. I highly recommend this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Rooms and Service”
Reviews.Author: wbk1711
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Red Hotel many times and have always enjoyed their comfortable rooms and friendly, well trained staff. Everything about the hotel was wonderful. The rooms are gorgeous. The beds are comfy. The huge bathrooms the the standard rooms are the best in town.....separate shower and tub, separate commode area, double sinks and plenty of counter space. There is also a TV in the bathroom and not one of those useless ones in the mirror either! We paid $29 a night due to a marketing offer. We are loyal Station Casinos patrons and receive offers regularly. The $24.99 nightly "resort fee" was waived because of the marketing offer. They have a lovely spa and my husband had a great massage. Pricey, but got 20% off with the coupon that came with the daily USA Today that is delivered to your room every morning. We are not fancy eaters so did not go to any of the sit down restaurants. We attended the buffet for breakfasts. All the food was very good if not great. The food court is also a nice option. I had a turkey sub at Capriotti's and it was better than good. The casino is large but do not go there just for the casino as we did not win a thing while we were there. The machines are tight (like everywhere in Vegas). The casino is fun if you treat like as your entertainment but be prepared to pay the price and oif you are lucky, you may get some money back!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock rocks!”
Reviews.Author: er061944
Reviews.Content: If you like to gamble a couple times a year with some moderate play, Red Rock is very generous with the rewards! My trip started off with a limo to pick me up at the airport (unexpected), then a HUGE suite. The casino has every type of gaming for anyone with a wide range of limits. The pool was especially nice. It was not over-crowded like most hotels on the strip and the service from every staff member in the resort was exceptional. I would highly recommend Red Rock for anyone who likes to gamble for a few days at any limit!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, luxurious,upscale surroundings for total pleasure”
Reviews.Author: bpharris
Reviews.Content: Always have enjoyed staying at the Red Rock..rooms and amenities can`t be beat! It`s a pleasure to walk into a Las Vegas Hotel and not be hit with the noise of a casino..although the casino is wonderful...along with the buffet and restuarants available. This is an all-inclusive resort...one does not have to leave the building..everything is available under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Comfortable and 100% Luxury”
Reviews.Author: TrishinChicago
Reviews.Content: My friend & I had a fabulous stay at Red Rock Casino & Spa in May 2011. We choose this hotel because of its location near our friend's home. Although we usually stay on the Strip, we were not all disapointed to be away from the 'action' as the views from the hotel are just beautiful. Our room was spectacular, the services offered are 100% right-on and the convenient shuttle to/from the airport or Strip was alwasy ion time with several trips daily. The casino was fine, and although I'm not a big gambler, there were options everywhere. If one is bored the hotel also houses an 8-theater cineplex and a huge bowling alley among many other options. great restuarants and the pool area is to die for!

Reviews.Title: “This was an educational event. The Hotel took very good care of us”
Reviews.Author: Matotanka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The staff wwas very friendlyand willing to help with any thin you need. The room were ecellent and clean this was a great value. The location was very good because you didn't have to leave for anything it was all there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel-Casino Has It All”
Reviews.Author: JGBrush
Reviews.Content: Nice spa. Extensive pool area that has fountains and more than a dozen pools -- usually you can have your own. Bed, bedding the best. Two flat screen TVs in each room. Bathrooms are extensive, deep tub, beautiful shower, great sinks. Cleanest rooms anywhere. No matter your gambling tastes, the casino has it. Eats are the best: a bagel deli, fine Italian restaurant, gourmet burgers, buffet, several fast food places, two Starbucks, steak house, several other specialty restaurants and an excellent Cafe if nothing else suits. Extensive deluxe movie theatres and bowling alleys. Now, here is the frosting on top: all appointments are fabulous and will take your breath away, even the hallways to rooms where doors are set back to reduce noise to rooms. And their service is excellent even when someone like me stumbles in in blue jeans. I've been to the Broadmor in Colorado Springs and The Del Coronado in San Diego and this place provides so much more. Can't say enough about them.. We do not leave the site for anything when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place Ever !”
Reviews.Author: Jhane05
Reviews.Content: Very Enjoyable Place . Definitely Coming Back , Husband & Family Enjoyed Their Time . Great Service , A Stay To Remember !

Reviews.Title: “RedRock is a wonderful hotel - but Room Service is too expensive”
Reviews.Author: CWJ57401
Reviews.Content: My stay at RedRock was for business and I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the hotel was. I usually stay on the strip, but chose the RedRock as it was close to my meetings. My room was beautiful, the restaurants were fantastic, and the overall hotel was simply awesome. Terra Rosa was especially wonderful - the food was FANTASTIC!! One issue I encountered was the Room Service. Since I was travelling alone my husband decided to send a fruit and cheese tray to my room as a treat after a long day of flights. He was quoted about $58 for a fruit and cheese tray and 4 bottles of Diet Coke. He was actually charged $88.00 for the order. $88 for fruit, cheese, crackers, and a few bottles of Diet Coke is very high. It was expecially high considering he was quoted $58. He did call regarding the charge and was told that the $58 was quoted was before taxes, delivery fees, etc. If I do stay at the Red Rock again, I will certainly not be ordering room service

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: allynfrancis
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and service. I was very pleased with the customer service and the quickness in which my needs were met. The room service food was amazing!! I highly recommend the lamb chops!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Class”
Reviews.Author: OrdinaryPerson23
Reviews.Content: If you want and affordable but extremely classy resort, Red Rock is for you. This property has everything you would need for a three or four day stay and never leave the property. Complete selection or restaurant choices from fast food to one of the best steakhouses in Vegas. Modern and classy rooms, awesome pool area and great mountain views. I've stayed there numerous times with no complaints. Service and hospitality and number one. Only drawback is distance from strip but there are shuttles or just rent a car and visit Mt. Charleston, another little Vegas secret.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered relaxation at it's best”
Reviews.Author: kdkman
Reviews.Content: The staff of this resort should be commended for their excellence of service and can do attitude. The facility has every thing you could ask for under one roof. From a poolside bar and grill with attentive great looking servers, to a five star steakhouse with mouth watering entrees. The deep fried Oreos for dessert were beyond delicious. The table games were staffed with pleasant dealers and helpful pit bosses that took the time to interact with the patrons. Although I did not hit the clubs,my friends said that it was a rocking scene and they stayed and closed the place. The rooms were some of the finest I have seen in Vegas and at half the price! The fact that there is a mall across the street is a huge bonus for those of us that always forget to pack something.I travel to Vegas several times a year and you can bet I will be returning to the Red Rock on my next trip. Thanks for a wonderful long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock was not a mirage...it was a rejuviating oasis for my family, mind & soul”
Reviews.Author: Chuckthetruckdriver1
Reviews.Content: Relaxing, posh, sensational hotel. It is located away from the strip, so it is a much more calm atmosphere. Plenty of pool room with awesome wait staff. As a single mom it is difficult to find an affordable, yet luxurious travel destination. Everything I needed to entertain and service my children & I was under one roof: marble deep soaking tub, posh room decor, very friendly and helpful staff, bowling, pool, IMAX 16 cinema, childcare, ATM,arcade, restaurants & Starbucks. The kids were entertained & all of us felt like royalty in our white robes, upgraded room to a suite & mountain view. The whole atmosphere at Red Rock is dialed in for spoiling their guests & making every effort to make everyone feel special. I've already booked an amazing trip in a few months....for the same it would cost me to go to the movies down the street with my family.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Red Rock after a week in Hawaii and it topped our honeymoon off fantasticaly!”
Reviews.Author: lvlvrs12
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautifully furnished hotels in Las Vegas. The staff were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent alternative in relation to the hetic chaotic strip.”
Reviews.Author: luckyd_11
Reviews.Content: Red Rock offers all the amenities of the major Vegas strip hotels without the hoards of people that you find on the strip. The hotel offers excellent restaurants, from the Feast Buffet for breakfast to super high quality steak, seafood and Italian restaurants for dinner. Perhaps the best quality of the hotel is, they cater to the locals that live in the Summerlin area. This is one of the reasons you are not just a number and makes you want to come back. When you stay at Red Rock make sure you take in the surrounding countryside,it is extremely beautiful and just a short ride from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: mosbey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at Red Rock since they opened several years ago. We absolutely love it! The fresh, sleek design of both the hotel and casino is a vision. The rooms are huge and extremely well-appointed, the casino is clean and fresh and there is a large variety of restaurants....plus some great fast food places. Because it is off the strip, we especially appreciate that we are not subjected to the rowdy night time crowds that frequent the strip casinos. I'm sorry that I don't have photos, but if you go to redrocklasvegas.com you will see the hotel and casino. We would highly recommend Red Rock to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Michele56003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas 3 times a year and we always stay at Red Rock Hotel. Our recent stay in April was as fabulous as ever and the staff continues to be some of the best in the industry. The rooms are wonderful and the beds very comfortable. From the restaurants (we adore Terra Rossa, LBS Burger Joint, and Yard House) to the great lounge chairs at the pool this resort has it all. The strip is just 20 minutes away but we very seldom even leave Red Rock because we enjoy the great casino, movie theatre, and bowling alley. My husband and I highly reccommend this resort to everyone it has everything!

Reviews.Title: “I come back to the Red Rock year after year.....love everything about it!”
Reviews.Author: jayMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: I find the staff especially helpful and courteous. Prompt service for check in and check our is a pleasant surprise. The "Hosts" saw to it that all needs were met . When I lost a personal item I was happy at it's safe return and the effort the staff put forth to find it. The Red Rock will certainly continue to be my favorite casino/hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Without the Hustle & Bustle”
Reviews.Author: ldspears
Reviews.Content: Great resort with wonderful views -- either mountains or city lights. Easy access but away from the hustle, bustle and hassle of the Strip. Restaurants are varied and good to exceptional. Entertainment options range from gaming and top music acts (though a bit too youth oriented for my taste) to movies and bowling. The pool area is beautiful and easy to enjoy even if you don't go in the water, and the spa is top notch in both appearance and sdervices. Casino is well laid out and easy to get around -- and it's also much more attractively decorated than most, with the design elements mirroring the natural Red Rock surroundings. Finally, the rooms are beautifully appointed, spacious and exceedingly comfortable, with a great bath. Put in a microwave and a full refrigerator instead of the mini-bar and I could happily live in one of them forever! Go Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “exceeds expectations in every category”
Reviews.Author: shakeann
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Red Rock hotel since it opened; it immediately became my favorite place to go; I live in Las Vegas so I have lots of options; the entire staff is always understanding and gracious, the multiple restaurants provide every type of cuisine, the gambling is great with many choices; it is the only place I take my out-of town visitors, the rooms are spacious and always clean; I especially enjoy the pool area which makes me feel like I am at an exclusive tropical resort with all its amenities; also, with its high ceilings, you don't have to look for a place to sit just because you are a non-smoker; and there is always a cocktail server around if you want some liquid refreshment; HAVE FUN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility and Service”
Reviews.Author: chrisk154943
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the week for an Easter trip with the kids. Very accommodating, facility well kept, peaceful, rooms quiet and roomy. Beds were blissfully comfortable. All request met quickly for extra pillows, etc. Used spa and it was very nice - service and facility. Have been here multiple times and would gladly go again and recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise - A Fabulous Experience at the Red Rock Resort”
Reviews.Author: ClubMedTraveler07
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I traveled to Las Vegas for his high school spring break. I wanted him to experience Las Vegas but not the strip everynight so I chose the Red Rock Resort based on reviews on this website and a visit to their website. The resort is about 20 minutes from the strip so I rented a car so we could get around. I am pretty sure that the resort offers a shuttle but we never used it. Our room was immaculate and comfortable. Our beds felt like heaven! The bathroom was gorgeous and large. The bathroom had a TV in it which was great as my son often slept in and I could get ready and watch the Royal Wedding at the same time. Everyone at the resort was friendly and accommodating. The restaurants were bountiful. They offered an amazing array of cuisine and price points. My favorite place was The Cafe - great food and service and a beautiful atmosphere. The Red Rock bowling lanes were impressive and we had a great time bowling. The movie theatre was beautiful and clean. There was so many lounges to choose from around the pool I had trouble deciding where to sit! The water in the pool was too cold - I am not sure if it is ever heated - we are from the Northeast and unfortunately are used to pools being heated. Sat out in the sunshine nevertheless and enjoyed lunch outside. The concierge was extremely helpful. My son and I took Pink Jeep Tours to the Grand Canyon and to the Hoover Dam. Be sure to ask for a guide name "Chris" - he was a true gentleman and a wonderful guide. Went to the strip several nights - saw "O" and "Las Vegas, the Show!". We had a great time! Went into most of the hotels there - the Mirage, Bellagio, New York New York, Venetian etc. - all were noisy and extremely large - the influx of people was overwelming. Red Rock was pure paradise - a welcome retreat from the chaos of the strip. We loved our stay and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aldenp76
Reviews.Content: While the reosrt is not on "The Strip" it is a wonderful hotel, and all of the rooms have wonderful views of either Las Vegas or the hills. The rooms are spacious, and very clean. The bathorooms are amazingly large and well equipped. The floors are qiuet. Services at the hotel are great, and the people are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “They need to learn Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: JDsAtNoWhere
Reviews.Content: While the Red Rock is a beautiful casino, the front desk staff do not have an idea how to resolve problems. I was made to wait for more than 40 minutes on check in because they did not have the rooms that we reserved ready. I would expect a hotel of this caliber to go the extra mile to accommodate us when they mess up. Instead, they were nonchalant and ambivalent. They wouldn't let me talk to the manager because "she's busy right now." I won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Best place if you like the luxury for either a business visit or a family visit to Vegas but without having to deal with crowds”
Reviews.Author: vvas
Reviews.Content: I took my family there for a weekend trip and my kids loved it! We really didn't have to leave the property because all of the amenities. With grade school and middle school kids the Red Rock has thing for everyone. We went to the movies, bowled, and they played in the big playground while my husband and I hung out on the casino floor. My kids can't wait to go back. I can't wait to go back when it's warmer to use the pools. If you hate the crowds and traffic on the strip then this is definitly the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful scenery, quiet rooms and great food - all here”
Reviews.Author: msn8
Reviews.Content: A wonderful property off the strip. Plenty of options for gaming, golf, and great food all right here at a first class resort. Make your next Vegas trip more relaxing. Rooms are very generous in size and you have a great view of either the strip or Red Rock mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Resort , we had a great time”
Reviews.Author: ghostly83
Reviews.Content: Great pool area, beautiful rooms, food and service was excellent. Gambling o.k. not as bad as some. Could be a little looser.......

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it if you don't mind being off the strip”
Reviews.Author: MarinsMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock while visiting with my Brother and his wife from LA. We have a 5-year-old, so liked the idea of being off the strip and away from the wild side of Vegas. Our stay was very enjoyable. The rooms were modern and clean, and the Restaurant choices were perfect for us. The high point was KidsQuest. Our daughter loved it so much, that she begged us to go back the next night. That meant 2 date nights in a row for us, and my daughter thought she won the lottery! The only tough part of that is when we picked her up at the end of the night, we had to walk her through the casino on the way to the room. We shared a cabana with our brother both days, and loved the pool experience. Staff throughout the hotel were very friendly and always available to help with any requests we had. Overall, it was a great mini-vacation, and we would definitely recommend this place to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place off the Vegas Strip with all the amenities of the finest on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Booziani
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had not been away without the kids for a few years, so we decided to stay off the strip where there would be less crowds. We were looking for a more intimate stay where we could relax and enjoy some time away. What we found was a beautiful place with all the strip has to offer with a more personal touch! We loved the pool which was way better than the Venetian where I had stayed for a conference earlier in the week. The staff was great and even the food poolside was nice. The restaurants were fabby , especially Hachi which was Awesome! Great staff all around this place, really! Everything was great at Red Rock and you should check it out for sure! My wife loved the Spa. She said the hot stone massage and the facial were great! Music and the Casino Lodges were also nice! We can't say enough about the staff at this hotel, they were really great!

Reviews.Title: “redrock resort is my favorite las vegas destination.”
Reviews.Author: lgsakane
Reviews.Content: redrock is entertaining, gorgeous, fun...the spa is fabulous, the grounds are stunning, the casino is fast and furious...i cannot think of a hotel in all of vegas where i would rather stay. and the food is seriously, deliriously, deliciously delectable! what more could a traveler ask for in a casino/resort?

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is great!”
Reviews.Author: miller3705
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Red Rock Resort and was wonderful. The customer service is tops, the buffets are all delicious and varied, room was great with a super view, slots could have been better, but I don't go to Vegas expecting to win much! We look forward to more stays at Red Rock in the future. I would recommend Red Rock to anyone. We were also excited that Yard House is now located at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas experience without the shows”
Reviews.Author: longocorp
Reviews.Content: The Hotel and Casino had a great look and feel. There were a good variety of table and slot games with low minimums. I was even able to play in their daily poker tournament on my visit. The downside is that it is very far from the strip. Although they have a great shuttle service to-and-from the airport and to-and-from the strip, if you miss the service window hours then you will be paying for a $55 one way cab ride back to the hotel. ie. Staying out after hours (10pm+) to a club, or catching an early morning event (before 11am). After my first $55 burn, I economically rented a car. I would say it would be more of a perfect family resort get a way with the attached movie theatre and bowling alley. My visit was during a conference, so it is fine if you have kids under 21. My wife could take the kids shopping via the shuttle and come back for a good variety of dinner choices.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: deeder024
Reviews.Content: Great stay we have stayed there twice now and hopefully will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Angel Blew It...”
Reviews.Author: RyanCBrewer
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Red Rocks. I loved being away from the Strip. I loved the pool area, the amenities, the rooms, the food and 99% of the staff was great. But as I was checking out with Angel she was rude. She acted like she was superior to me and that I wasn't worth her time (no other guest was at the front desk...maybe she wanted me to use video checkout!) She was snippy with me and that was my last experience with Red Rock which left a bad taste in my mouth. However, I'd still recommend it to others and if we ever took our kids back to Vegas we'd stay at Red Rock. I hope the management talks to Angel about her bad Customer Service. Oh and the last thing....I know they just want you in the Casino but I think its bad that the pool closed at 6 pm. After getting out of class at 5 I didn't get to enjoy the pool as much as I would have liked to.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: peachmom13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock Casino for a business conference. This was a vacation for me, but my husband attended the conference. We upgraded to one of the suites, which was very spacious and nicely decorated. The room had a living area with it's own bathroom, a breakfast table, wet bar, bedroom and large bath. The room overall was clean, though the shower could've been cleaner (there was mold around the door). Some repairs were needed as well. The toilet paper holder was falling off of the wall, the t.v. in the bathroom could not be adjusted because the mount was loose, & the shower drained so slowly the water would completely cover your feet. When we turned the jets on in our tub, black mold flooded the bath! My husband complained that his side of the bed was sagging & made it difficult to sleep; mine was o.k. We also heard construction every morning as SOON as the sun came up - (like by 6:30!) very annoying! We were on the 7th floor. The rooms are away from the casino, so you do not have to walk through to access your room or get to the pool. The pool is nice with plenty of lounge chairs. The music at the pool was very loud and mostly awful. I could not even listen to my ipod and drown it out! The service at the pool was extremely slow - 15 to 20 minutes to get a drink. There were lots of servers with few people at the pool, but we still couldn't manage to get anything quickly. This was a problem throughout our stay. Everyone was friendly however. The food served at the conference was mediocre, not as good as I would have expected. We did have the chicken nachos at Yard House, which were awesome! We also ate at the pool grill for lunch, which was pretty good. We ate at "feast buffet" for breakfast one morning and would not recommend it. (much like Shoney's) We did go to the bowling alley which is enormous! Lots of fun as well. There is also a theater on site and several shops. If you want to get to the strip, it is a $50 cab ride. The hotel does have a shuttle that goes to the Fashion Mall, but that's it. We did think the hotel was very pretty, but if we returned we would prefer to stay on the strip, closer to all of the shows & wonderful restaurants. We don't enjoy gambling enough to isolate ourselves this far away from everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maddon0
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at the Red Rock with another family of 4. The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Staff was wonderful and the hotel had everything you needed to entertain children. We put them in the Kid's Quest for 3 hours. They weren't impressed. Complained that it was not very clean and unorganized (they're a separate entity from the Red Rock management). Drinks at the pool were hugely overpriced ($13 for a cocktail). And beware, they will automatically add gratuity on your pool bill, and then leave room for additional tip. I went for a massage at the SPA, and was pleased. Very, very clean! Overall, the restaurants were good, rooms spacious (especially bathroom) and staff friendly. We will definitely be frequenting the Red Rock. A fabulous alternative to the overcrowded strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Time at the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Pooh2Pooh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Rock during their 5th year Anniversary. It was so much fun from the time I caught the shuttle at the airport to the time I caught the shuttle back to the airport. They have such a wide variety of things to do and play. I admit I love to play slot machines. They have such a good variety. I also played Bingo. The waitress that was serving our drinks the day before while we were playing slot machines was the server in the Bingo and she remembered us and brought our drinks. Every single one of the staff was friendly and helpful. We loved the Grand Cafe. They have a new menu and new staff. If you are looking for a great place to stay consider Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Visit at the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSunSpotter
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our last night in Las Vegas at the Red Rock because we wanted to go hiking in the canyon. Pros: Free Valet Parking, Polite and Courteous Valet Attendants and Front Desk Personnel, Very Comfortable Beds, Nice Decor, Huge Bath With TV Cons: Our IPod didn't work in the Bose system in the room so we called down to have it replaced. Woman who came with new unit seemed "put-out" to be running the errand. However, front desk did phone later to see if our needs had been met. Also, got room service for my son and then headed out to see Beatles Love show. When we returned someone had come in our room and taken the food cart which was disturbing for us because we had laptop, guitar, etc in our room. Also, paid less $$ to be on strip view side of hotel and when we checked in they gave us room overlooking pool which I thought was a bonus until 6:30 a.m. when construction started on the addition to the resort. Our room was way down at the far end of the hotel right above and next to the construction. Guess the hotel thought we were getting the upgraded room for a discount so we should be happy. Hotel itself is simply huge and without any character once you get beyond the lobby. I can't comment on the amenities because we didn't have time to wander beyond Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “very nice as long as you don't go to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: anondojo
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Very nice rooms, views. Pool was full but didn't seem crowded. Pool service was great. We didn't end up eating at any of the restaurants. Line for the Buffet was insanely long. I loved the Spa area and gym. The only problem? Much farther from the Strip than we anticipated. $75 cab ride from airport, $55 from the Strip. Last shuttles are around 9-10pm. Shuttle to/from strip is a small "party bus" only holds 14 people, first come first serve. We saw several people denied a ride because it was full. Bottom line: it felt like one of those "all-inclusive" resorts in Mexico. Very nice as long as you don't plan on leaving. We ended up wanting to be on the strip more than we anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay if you want to be off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Soapmanusa
Reviews.Content: The resort is attractive. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The staff is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay I ever had in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: 88robt
Reviews.Content: Off the strip so very easy to get in and out of hotel but close enough to see lights at night. Best view was of the mountains and canyons - Gorgeous. Resort was outstanding. Efficient, friendly staff. Dining at Hachi was out of this world. Beautiful room, very comfortable. Highly recommend Red Rock Resort. G. A. Claremont, CA

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock: Will Never Stay Anywhere Else in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl5454
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Red Rock Resort. The customer service (front desk, room service, maintenance staff, etc.) are top notch and quite friendly. The rooms are gorgeous - we are partial to the view of Red Rock Canyon rather than the Vegas strip. Peaceful getaway without the traffic snarles of the strip. The pool area is the best we've ever experienced. We will never stay at another hotel while in Vegas except Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Resort...If you don't want to be on the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: ejuscgrad
Reviews.Content: This is a great property. Very family friendly, but still has the Vegas 'feel'.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: sss555
Reviews.Content: Stylish accomodations without being "snobby". Great dining establishments and beautiful casino.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Serene, Affordable and off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: RedWinner
Reviews.Content: If your desire is to be away from the Las Vegas Strip and have the luxury of fine accomodations with affordable dining, then the Red Rock Hotel and Casino off the 215 north is a great place to stay. My favorites are: the lobby to the hotel is separate from the Casino, the rooms and decor are serene and most comfortable, the pool is very lovely, large and has cabannas you can rent for the day, the dining at the Yard house has an amazing selection with affordable pricing, the theater has the lastest movies and is easily accessible, the bingo hall is a good sized with prize money to match any floor jackpot, the gaming has variety with availability, and most of all the service is what you should expect in a resort setting. It is my favorite for a quiet, yet fun retreat. Next time I try the spa treatments!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation with a Flare”
Reviews.Author: educatedcalimom
Reviews.Content: Red Rock's ambiance, quality rooms, highly personable staff and appealing location is great if you are traveling solo, as a family or are out with friends for the weekend. Lots to do and you don't even have to leave the hotel. Spa is amazing! Rooms are luxurious! Casino is very clean and has much to offer! Bowling, movie theater and restaurants are also amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong room”
Reviews.Author: folimar
Reviews.Content: Dont get me wrong the hotel and casino are beautiful and my only complaint there would be that its very crowded on a Saturday night. But when you order a very expensive room and then when you get there they way its last room and you go room instead of the strip view you payed for your looking at freeway and a little bit of mountains something is very very wrong...

Reviews.Title: “Premium, but far away”
Reviews.Author: RFJ
Reviews.Content: I received a special convention rate, so I cannot speak to their typical prices. But the property is very premium. My room was well appointed, with a comfortable bed and nice mountain view. The bath was most impressive, with a double sink and deep soaking tub in the bathroom, in addition to a separate shower stall and no issues with water pressure or temperature control. Do be aware that the hotel layout is odd - you may have to walk quite a distance from the elevator to your room, so bring bags with wheels. The primary drawback that it is nowhere near the attractions of the Strip. Taxi to the airport and Strip was about $45. Their shuttle service only runs every 2 hours, even if they are hosting a convention (we were lucky someone came with a bus to take several of us to the airport for $10 each, but I wondered why the hotel did not just offer extra service, given the end of the convention). Location is the only reason I would not recommend it. Only other negative was that I've never been charged to print out a boarding pass at the business center. They charged $5 and it seemed so tacky for such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST for a quick getaway or extended stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: dgaudet3
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, casino and playgound! Red Rock is away from all the b.s. of the Strip but close enough to grab a cab if you want to see the tourist highlights. The hotel is clean and the rooms are large and upscale - there is safe for your valuables, mini bar, TV to watch while you unwind in the soaking tub and beds to cure insomnia. The casino has EVERY game you would ever want to play. If you need a break from gambling, there are movie theatres, a luxurious spa, an arcade, bowling center, GREAT pool area. Plenty of great restaurants to choose from or grab a quick bite at the Food Court.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pleasure in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: TinaTravel57
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I always appreciate being hosted by hotels in order to ensure the property will meet the needs of my clients. Although Vegas for some is all about the strip (casinos and gambling aren't my choice for travel); it was a pleasant trip for a recent Industry Wedding FAM trip when we stayed at the Red Rock Resort. Finally, I can send families and persons looking for scenery and relaxation to a resort where they will find beautiful rooms with all the expected amenities and more! The bowling aspect of the resort provides entertainment for the entire family or group looking for something different than typical Las Vegas...with all the Las Vegas extras nearby!

Reviews.Title: “My new regular hotel for all Vegas trips!”
Reviews.Author: DrGMama
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is beautiful and it has everythin you need for a relaxing weekend. The bowling ally is state of the art, the restaurants are amazing but they also have a food court for a quick bite, the rooms are lovely and spacious. The soaking tub is to die for. The casino offers everything you could want. I love that it is off the strip but there is a free shuttle to the strip if you want. They were very upfront about cost and what was free and what wasn't, which was a HUGE plus for me. Tw valet was free and so was the airport shuttle. They really took care of us, and I will always be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful & Peaceful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CaliSunshin3
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. Its away from all the hussel and bussel of the the strip. You can enjoy your self in a upbeat modernized resort, they have every thing you need here. Also a great place for a quick family getaway because their kid friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa is AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: brandisandry
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa is Located off the Strip but absolutely amazing...The rooms are 5 star, beautiful decor, we enjoyed a beautiful view of the strip and the sunrise from our floor to ceiling windows in our room. The decor in our room was trendy and I loved watching TV from my bathtub.. An Array of options to choose from for your dining experience..Affordable and outstanding service from their employees (Our Server MONA in the CAFE was 5 Star as well as the FOOD Mmmmmmmmmm!) The Pool area is like nothing I have ever seen - Covered Cabanas, Round Soft Lounge Beds, Comfortable Lounge Chairs in the Pool to Relax In..VISIT RED ROCK CASINO RESORT AND SPA - You will not want to LEAVE..

Reviews.Title: “A Mini-Vegas, without all the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: chellejhb
Reviews.Content: My overall experience at the Red Rock was quite pleasant. I'm not much of a gambler, but there was still plenty to do! The restaurants were excellent, especially the Italian themed one. For gamblers, it's like having a private casino.

Reviews.Title: “The whole Vegas experience off the strip, away from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: makosurf
Reviews.Content: Luxury, comfort, entertainment, food, and new. The Red Rock is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rocks Rocks”
Reviews.Author: conniepestot
Reviews.Content: Once again Red Rock came through with a great experience (in spite of the fact that my gambling was a losing experience). Standard rooms are spacious and comfortable with great beds and pillows, terrific bathrooms, and scenic canyon view. Our pricey treat night dinner at T-Bones provdided excellent service, superb steaks, and gigantic sides portions we could have shared with a couple more people. I particularly enjoyed the buffet breakfast. Rooms always quiet and conducive to getting some good sleep in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort is the Best Place to Stay in Las Vegas!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mobilmarg
Reviews.Content: Everything at the Red Rock was superior - rooms, staff, meals, choice of casino games!! And their pool and garden area is absolutely beautiful!! They have an amazing bowling complex, spa, and cinemas second to none. I would, without hesitation, recommend the Red Rock to anyone and especially to those who want to stay off the Strip but in close proximity to I-215. We went to all the Station casinos as well as others, with ease. As well, they have a shuttle which drops off and picks up at both the Airport and at the Fashion Mall on the Strip. We had an amazing stay there and will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort off the Las Vegas strip”
Reviews.Author: Cmurphy24680
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and have never been disappointed. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location has great restaurants and clean comfortable rooms. Already looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: koontzmama
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Red Rock was amazing from beginning to end. Check-in was quick and painless, and the staff was AMAZING - everyone had a way of making me feel like I was the only guest in the hotel. There were lots of food options, and the pool area was AMAZING........I can't wait to stay again! We already booked another trip for next month.

Reviews.Title: “looked so good/acted so cheap!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fourche
Reviews.Content: DEAR TRIP ADVISOR/ RED ROCK CASINO,HOTEL, SPA The accomodations and appointments at the Red Rock were very grand, even elegant. the liquor in the fridge and the desk top condiments made the resort seem cheap/money grabbing. At a frist class resort, I would expect liquor and other items to be provided only, at the request of the guest. The price of a 50ml bottle of Jack Daniels from the room fridge equates to $179.75 for 750ml bottle that can be bought from the local stores for under $20. A bit high even for Las Vegas. Add to this the cost and/or inconvience of getting morning coffee. Even Motel 6 has an in-room coffie pot and/or complimentry coffee in the lobby.. We originally booked a room with a "canyon view"; but we were placed in a room without "canyon view" Even though this fact was brought to the desk's attention March 23, we were billed for the "canyon view", We were billed for the "canyon view" again on March 25. If you knew I took a bottle of Jack out of the fridg for 45 seconds, why didn't you know that room #4125 does not have a "canyon view"? Why was the "canyon view" charged on the second nights bill? I have stayed in 1st class casinos in vegas and other places, but I do not believe i have ever seen the greedy/greasy hands reached out to this extent before. Needless to say I did not gamble at your tables!!!!!!! Cheap, cheap, cheap, cheap practices I wouyld have sent this to Red Rock directly, but their webb site does not have a "contact us" option. Suprise!! Suprise!! I understand that prostitution is legal in Navada. I am alright with that, but when I cannot walk down Las Vegas Blvd with my wife without being solicited, that is too much!!!. The pimping, magaxine racks, and other manifestions of the sex trade should be marketed with more class, taste, and style!!!! As it is being cone, it just cheapens the whole Las Vegas experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to strip”
Reviews.Author: joedoe587
Reviews.Content: This is a newer place, and a nicer quieter alternative to the strip. The rooms are a tad smaller than some, and have "only" two flat screen TVs, but have better decor than most. Unfortunately, like strip hotels, it is hard to navigate and there are few freebies that you will find even at most cheap motels these days, despite the mandatory "resort fee": No coffee maker in room, no free newspaper, no free business center, etc. Hints: 1. You can get the best deal by exploring and drilling down into the hotel website. Perhaps the best strategy is booking the cheapest rate you can find on the website, then asking for a free upgrade to a canyon view when you check in. 2. The buffet is very cheap and a terrific value, though we only used it for breakfast. Everything in the food court is awful and overpriced. 3. The best entertainment in Las Vegas is Red Rock Canyon 5 miles west and the 13 mile loop drive there, with spectacular views and short easy hikes available. Since there is no money to be made by the crooks who run Vegas, the local "guidebooks" ignore it and the suckers at the slot machines ignore it.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock lelax”
Reviews.Author: thulson99
Reviews.Content: Nice place.. everything 1st class I would recomend it to anyone who wants to go to Vegas, and not be too close to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelertoo
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Vegas hotel not on the strip. Having read the reviews, I expected something great, but it was not all that. Our room was located WAY down the corridor, away from the elevators. We met a couple whose wife used a walker; they had to ask for a room change due to the distance. I guess since I've stayed on the strip so many times, I felt like there wasn't enough to do at Red Rock. Yes, you could pay to see a movie or bowl, but is that really why anyone goes to Vegas? And so much for the "locals friendly" slots - I won more when we left after two nights and stayed on the strip. The buffet food was good and surprisingly cheap. Fortunately hotel guests can bypass the long lines - and they are lengthy. My biggest complaint was a little bit of false advertising. The printout of my confirmation clearly stated that the resort fee was $24.99 per night, but my bill listed it as $27.99. When I questioned this I was told that the fee was taxed. Okay, fine - but put that in the confirmation also. List it as $24.99 plus tax, or lump it into the total fee and THEN tax it. I just found it misleading. I also didn't get any love from the front desk when I questioned it. Would it have killed them to remove the $6? I'm really not a nickle and dimer, but it was the principle. I think Red Rock would be great if you have kids, but it wasn't the Vegas experience I was used to for my husband and me.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite place to stay in Las Vegas & I have stayed at many resorts!!”
Reviews.Author: JillRoxanne
Reviews.Content: From the decor of both the rooms and the hotel, the restaurant selection and customer service, this is the place for me to call home when I visit Las Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic place to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Peyton34
Reviews.Content: From the time you valet your car to when you leave you will be treated as VIP members, even if you are not. Everyone is so nice to you and wants to make your stay enjoyable. They have every game that you could ever imagine. The food variety is wonderful. Most people want to stay on the Vegas Strip when visiting Vegas. But it is worth going off the strip to the Red Rock Casino. Its a great Place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Las Vegas resort!”
Reviews.Author: ishredd
Reviews.Content: If you've already experienced staying on the "strip" a couple of times and no longer need all of that, this is the hotel/casino you should be staying in! It's new, modern, great restaurants, and all of the casino games that you would ever want to play...not mentioning how active the poker room is. Beautiful pool also.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful out of the mainstream facility with the an incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: tomuchofapaintokeep
Reviews.Content: I was recently travelling on business and our meeting was held at the Red Rocck Casino Resort and Span. My wife was able to travel with me and we both throughly enjoyed our stay at the Red Rock. The staff - concierege and housekeeping were extreemely helpful and accomadating. The casino staff and resturant staff as well are top notch. Since this facility is a ways from the strip, it is much quiter and definately less chaotic. If you want to expereince Vegas and have aquite place to stay this is it. It is a quick 20 minutes into the strip from the hotel. But the beautiful Red Rock canyon park is only 5 minutes away, where God's beauty awaits. If we have the opportunity to go to Vegas again, this is where we will hope to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: midnightflier
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Casino Had a wonderful time at Red Rock. Check-in was quick. Room was clean. Long Line at the buffett but food was good. Only real negative was the room was at the end of the hallway which was a major commute.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel, great casino”
Reviews.Author: DukeRocks
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 days on the strip and then came to Red Rock. A wonderful experience and we will do it again. Nice room, every casino option one could want and a nice variety of food options. Other than one grumpy lady that sat down at our card table it was a delightful 2 days. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Peace & Tranquility within minutes of Strip”
Reviews.Author: LTTravelInc
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a travel agent fam trip in Las Vegas. We stayed at the Red Rock Resort 20 minutes from the strip. Being outside the strip was not an inconvenience. The Red Rock has a courtesy airport and strip shuttle service, just be sure to check the schedule with the front desk. I really loved the Red Rock, the design was beautiful and the 1br Suites to die for! Huge bathrooms, seperate living room with huge flat screen, flats screens in bedroom and bath too. Soak in the jacuzzi tub and watch tv or enjoy the music, free wifi and awesome views of the red rock mountains. The pool area was really nice but is all outside so seasonal (of course). I enjoyed staying away from all the craziness of the strip - peace and quiet at the resort but when you're to kick it up a notch, hop on the shuttle and hit the strip for the night (or day). This is also a great place to rent a car - lots to see in do in Vegas besides the strip. Drive to Lake Mead/Hoover Dam or the Grand Canyon. There is a 72 lane bowling alley, arcades for kids and daycare for the little ones on property. The food here was excellent. I definitely will be visiting the Red Rock Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel/Spa in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: neuboy6
Reviews.Content: Enjoy the Vegas experience without the hectic pace of the strip. You are treated like a VIP at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Red Rock Casino was a MAGICAL experience!!”
Reviews.Author: kj7aa
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Red Rock Casino was one the best of the rest, superv service, room was cozy and so "sleepable", location was great if you are looking for an uncrowded place away from the strip and most of all, we liked the arrangements of everything in the stablishment where everything is so easy to find for our total enjoyment. We liked it so much that we are coming back in April of 2011 !!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great value”
Reviews.Author: vegaskay
Reviews.Content: My sister and I live in Las Vegas, but checked into the Red Rock for a day of R&R. The room was great, and a great value. The special on the hotel website included a $50 food voucher and two movie tickets. We ordered rooms service-the food was great and the room service staff could not have been more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “I had a fever. The only prescription was more Red Rock.”
Reviews.Author: cowbell_11
Reviews.Content: More cowbell. That's the normal prescription for a fever. When I got to Red Rock, I had a fever. The problem was, I had no cowbell. I was in a panic. What would I do? The prescription was simple. Red Rock Resort. Casino, food, fun, frolic, bowling, movies, shopping. Before long, my fever had gone away, that is, until the day I left. My fever returned and I fear the only prescription is more Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: stiljamn
Reviews.Content: 5 star all the way. Two days of pampering, relaxation and a lot of fun. All staff very professional and extremely courteous. Even the craps pit boss went out of his way to help 2 beginners. Our room was very comfortable and in between playing, enjoyed hanging out and relaxing in deep tub or just lounging and watching TV. Beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Reisblij
Reviews.Content: We (4 of us) stayed one night in Red Rock hotel, We go every year. The hotel is great, the rooms are wonderful and the view from the room is a joy. Reception was great. We visited the casino, had lots of fun, went to the movies, had the Feast dinner buffet (great food) and had our nightcap at the Yard House. 110 beers from tap, will take us a while to sample them all! One remark, it would be nice to have signs to guide you from the parking garage to the hotel lobby. Every time we get a bit lost. But we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but expensive extras.”
Reviews.Author: allizbal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, somewhat remote however. Airport shuttle hours very restrictive, I arrived and departed outside of these hours, so had to use expensive cab. Same story for Strip shuttle, last one back is around 9PM - why ???? Somewhat surprised at the "resort fee" added to the bill, was told that this covered "free" shuttles - which could not be used, and facilites ? Other strip hotels do not add this sort of fee. Remove these annoyances, and I would recommend the Hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: beepbeep77
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the nice room. The bed was real comfy with good soft pillows. We ordered room service and a very nice table was sent up for us. Everyone was nice to deal with. The only issues we had was a nice service the valet told us about and that was when we were ready to leave to just give the a call and they would have our car ready. Sounded wonderful, however every time we called we could not get anyone to answer. So a big disappointment there. Also they overcharged for every item on our room service order. We will still go back as I really love the gaming at this casino.

Reviews.Title: “AWWWW Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ichliebesky
Reviews.Content: Went there with a friend on th Spa package and had the best time of my life. We stayed in a nice room with a nice view. Really enjoyed hanging out by the window for a while and talk to my friend. The Spa was awesome. The Stone Massage is very recommended. That the clothing was optional in the Spa area was a nice twist too. (No wet bathing suits) We played at the tables and slots a little, lost but enjoyed it. I loved my one night stay and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “my first experience at the hotel was great, i'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: geo4257
Reviews.Content: From the moment i arrived, i was greeted by the most friendly staff that took care of my question about the Hotel and the conference i was attending. The meeting rooms were well organized and the exhibit area we use was setup and taken down without any problems. The business center handled all my needs for equipment and took care of all my shipping request. The food served during the conference was outstanding and had great variety, something for everyone. I would definitely recommend the venue to all my business associate's and plan on returning for my own weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you aren't planning going out on the strip often”
Reviews.Author: Smokiedokie2
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is nice. Good variety food to choose from. If you don't have a car, a little difficult get to strip. About 20 min ride to strip. They do have free shuttle to strip and airport but it is limited. You can see schedule on their website. For example, last shuttle from strip to hotel is 8:30pm. About 30 minutes from airport. With normal traffic cost about $45-50 airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It should be called "Red Rocks" because it does!!”
Reviews.Author: Mauibob2011
Reviews.Content: It's always a pleasure staying at this resort. There's so much to do and you have all the elements of Vegas EXCEPT for the crowds!! The staff, accomodations and facilities are all 5 star. I highly recommend Red Rock to anyone looking for a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “The most FABULOUS time was spent at the Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa.”
Reviews.Author: phines0317
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to valet parking until the moment we drove off the property, the staff and experience at the Red Rock Casino Resort was incredible! The staff were professional, courteous, knowledgeable and extremely attentive and helpful throughout our stay. The property is beautiful and has the feel of being in Vegas without being on the strip. We did not choose to stay at Red Rock ourselves. We attended a wedding in Vegas and the bride and groom reserved blocks of rooms for their guests. We were so pleased with the full experience that we are planning our next trip to Vegas and the Red Rock Casino Resort will be our choice to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant employees, but the hotel doesn't deliver on the little things”
Reviews.Author: juliet042
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room with beautiful design. That was overshadowed however when my pillow on the bed got a hole burned in it from the readining light which is mounted on the wall. After thoroughly wetting the pillow I was unable to get to sleep easily with the smell of smoke in my room. I told the from desk manager early in the morning. I then personally told the captain at the Fire Dept. near the hotel. I then informed the manager in the afternoon that the bulb on that particular light didn't have a cover on it and that I would be more comfortable if they rectified the situation before we went to bed that night. It was never resolved. They said the vice prez of maintenance said they didn't have the part. All it needed was a new lightbulb!! Obviously they never even looked at it. The assitant manager finally upgraded us to a suite sat night. The jacuzzi jets didn't work. Then I went down to the VIP lounge to get our complimentary coffee and it was empty!! It was refilled about 10 min later. A lot of little things went wrong such as these and that the hotel was sold out on fri night but the pool and jacuzzis were not heated, nor was the poolside restaurant open yet (it's to open in two weeks)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice, considering”
Reviews.Author: emastro
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock on March 4 and 5th. We usually stay at the Bellagio, but I was running a 1/2 marathon at Red Rock Canyon so decided to stay at the Red Rock Casino. It was our first stay off the strip. Pluses: - the spa was great. I had a massage, the masseuse was awesome! They gave me a 20% discount for being part of a group too! -Great view from the room - many different choices of restaurants - hotel is small compared to the hotels on the strip, which is nice - We actually won in the casino! I know most everyone says that , but in our case, its actually true. We left with more winnings than losings from the casino - Room was large - Newspaper to the room in the morning was nice Minuses: - the hot tub wasn't hot - the casino smelled a bit smoky. The room smelled a little smoky too, we even called the front desk to make sure we weren't on a smoking floor - the bathtub looked great but wasn't comfortable. The chairs in the bar weren't very comfortable either - the music in the elevators was really loud. Its one thing at 8 PM but at 6 AM, its a little much - the service at the pool was really great. Of course, not many people out there since it is March. But the service was very attentive. More open hours would have been nice. When we left, I thought that on our next visit, I'd choose to go back to the Bellagio. My husband thinks we'll be back at Red Rock...It will probably depend on what type of trip we want. If we want the whole strip thing, we'll be back at the Bellagio. If we want to be more low-key, we will definately be back at Red Rock (plus, if its not July or August, its proximity to Red Rock Canyon for some hiking is a definate plus)

Reviews.Title: “Suggestions for Creature Comforts”
Reviews.Author: VayKay54
Reviews.Content: Overall this i s a great hotel experience. Traveling from the East Coast, I loved the great bath and bed to refresh me after a long journey. The hotel is modern, clean with much to offer for entertainment. However, I was on business, meaning I had to keep up with my e-mails and normal business very early in the morning. It was a great inconvenience to have to get dressed and go out for coffee. Please consider putting coffee in the room. I understand that this doesn't happen in LasVegas, for reasons that benefit the resort. I beg you to consider the needs of your busiiness guests. Also, I was there to attend a conference, with many materials to distribute and to discard. I notices throughout the hotel conference rooms, trash cans were scarce. Where you have people, you'll have trash. Please make it more convient in the conference rooms and corridors to throw away trash. Lastly, we held breakfast every day for two days. The coffee was inside the dining room, while the rest of the food was outside. It left many of us wondering where the coffee was. Please make coffee easier to locate at conferences. It helps to stay perky and attentive. Thanks for a great conference and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas with out the Theme Park vibe or the crowded strip.”
Reviews.Author: GinaPitrello
Reviews.Content: Growing up in Vegas and now loving in Los Angeles, finging the Red Rock Hotel and Casino for me was a blessing. I love being able to wake up and see the Vegas skyline and/or red rock canyon, a place that brings back child hood memories. No hussle and bussle of the strip. the place is clean and the food great. One would never have to leave the hotel. Even the coffee shop is better than it needs to be. I think I like the vibe that it is where locals must go to get away. Besides, the Vegas I remember is long gone... All blown up and these new big shots trying to swank it. I will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LVNative2
Reviews.Content: We are locals so staying off the strip is nice. Red Rock is one of our favorite hotels. It has everything a nice hotel on the strip has without having to deal with the heavy traffic of the strip. Their customer service is outstanding and for us that means a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is perfect for Summerlin Area”
Reviews.Author: SeattlePoidog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in 2 months for business and really like this hotel. It's away from the strip and in a very nice area. Several coprorate office in Summerlin area so if you need a hotel in the area I highly recommend. Very clean and well kept rooms. Big bathtub and separate shower in a big bathroom. My last trip to Vegas the Red Rock was sold out and I had to stay at another hotel which had no restaurants or place to eat on property which made me realize the convenience of Red Rock having many choices of restaurant right downstairs so you don't have to drive out to find food. One recommendation if you have difficulty with lots of walking is to ask for a room closer to the elevator side of the building as the hallways are very long.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock, ROCKS”
Reviews.Author: mntravelers55129
Reviews.Content: I just want to put in my two cents - in addition to the other glowing reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor. Arriving to the RR Casino is like stepping into a desert oasis (no pun intended). Once inside you could be at the hippest hotel in L.A, NYC or Miami but without the attitude. In fact, the entire staff could not be more helpful - from housekeeping to the restaurants to the dealers. The rooms are spectacular and in an urban setting anywhere in the country, you will pay a great deal more for the same amenities at the RR. My other point will be to address the food. We we very impressed with both quality and price. In terms of negatives - some of the other reviews here on tripadvisor - are correct - the elevators are on one side of the building and all of the rooms are accessible via the extremely long hallway. Our room was towards the end on one of the floors and it WAS a five minute walk to the elevator. We weren't bothered by it...and I had run a half marathon during the trip. If you need a room close to the elevator ask. BTW: our room was quiet so think about what you are looking for the most (saving steps or a quiet room with limited floor traffic outside your door) The only other negative post on which we concur is the room lighting. The rooms are dark at night which can be a hardship when trying to get ready to go out. During the day, the floor to ceiling windows - with incredible views provide more than enough light. One other thought is the RR's distance to downtown and the strip. Even before staying at the RR, I have learned that it is more economical to rent a car - unless you know in advance you're staying close to your base hotel. Therefore, since we rent a car, the distance of the RR from the strip is not a problem for us - a 20 minute car ride. Valet and self parking on the strip is a hassle and that is where cabs are an advantage. In closing, my wife and I liked the RR so much, we have booked another trip in December. This was less than 24 hours after we got home.

Reviews.Title: “I had a magical experience at Red Rock Casino Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Leycrow
Reviews.Content: The staff at Red Rock Casino was the best of the rest..the room I was in was everything I could I asked for..I had a great experience..thank you RED ROCK.

Reviews.Title: “Style and value away from the hustle of the strip”
Reviews.Author: surf_n_sun_Canada
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Red Rock. This is our third return visit to the Red rock, and this time we decided to bring our children ages 10 and 7. As always, hotel is beautiful, and clean. Our room was a fair walk from the elevator, however we were asked if this was a problem at check-in and we were upgraded to a canyon view room! 10 of the 12 pools are unheated, so beware during winter months. 2 small pools and jazuzzi are heated. Kids enjoyed a movie and we even found time to bowl! Hotel is a 10-15 minute drive from the strip and shopping, however we love the local restaurants (Cheescake factory 2-3 min drive), and renting a car in Vegas is less than $40/day taxes in. We did not use the free strip/airport shuttle this trip, however have used it in the past to compliment the rental car. ie my wife took the free shuttle down to fashion island, and I picked her up later. For those of you who are wavering on the 10-15 minute drive to the strip, I ask you this. Next time you are staying on the strip, and you need to just zip over to the casino next door, I suggest that it takes as long if not longer to walk through the commotion on the strip, as it does to drive (and park) from the Redrock. We needed some extra blankets, and this request was fufilled promptly! Feast buffet is excellent and at $4.99 for breakfast, can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “A small slice of peace in the craziest place on earth”
Reviews.Author: sandy_delacruz
Reviews.Content: After three days on the strip we walked into peace and tranquility at Red Rock. Not too much quiet though, our fun machines and nightlife was there by choice but the whole feeling changes out at the canyon. Comfy beds, lazy lighting and great views from every room contributed to our excellent stay. Generous comps got us free buffets and the hotel restaurants gave us real options. One day we had lunch at the Yardhouse. Very good.
