I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a different Las Vegas experience, no dodging crowds, gaping tourists and tipsy teenagers wandering the streets with souvenir drink glasses. Upscale living surrounded by golf courses.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vegas Stay”
Reviews.Author: rom61
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Red Rock Resort for Super Bowl weekend. The room was spacious and elegant, with all the amenities of a first class hotel. Although the resort is quite a ways from the strip, the views from the rooms were spectacular. The resort has several very nice upscale restaurants, as well as the usual casino buffet and cafe. The food was quite good and although it was a busy weekend, service was excellent. The hotel was fully booked, but to our surprise, both check-in and check-out were very easy, with plenty of hotel staff and no lines. The casino is quite large, so something for everyone into gambling. The service on the casino floor was excellent, with someone coming by frequently offering drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Value, Value, Value at Red Rock Spa and Casino Resort”
Reviews.Author: Camstrips
Reviews.Content: If you want exceptional service, superb amenities, great food, health/wellness pampering, an exciting vibrant gambling experience, and the time and space to truly have it all, then the Red Rock is the place to go. Being off the strip does not mean compromising on anything that Las Vegas has to offer. Not one thing! The superb service is what keeps us coming back year after year. (That, and the casino winnings of course.)

Reviews.Title: “There's more to Vegas than the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Patti_Peppermint
Reviews.Content: This resort just minutes from the beautiful, scenic Red Rock Canyon Drive is a great place to mini-vacation. The room was beautiful. Buffet was wonderful and less than $8 for lunch. I ate solo at Hachi's, their sushi bar and was treated like a VIP. Never once did any staff member make me feel that as a 62 year old, averaged dressed, plane Jane I was not special. Wish I could be treated the same in other Vegas establisments.

Reviews.Title: “Trip with Family to Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: bonitaflor21
Reviews.Content: Place was great and diverse. There was something for all ages. Rocks Lounge is GREAT! The rooms were immaculate. I had a wonderful stay. My only concern is that there should be more accessible shuttles to and from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Not your father's Station chain hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jim_from_Erie_PA
Reviews.Content: Spotless. Posh. Shuttles to strip and airport. Lots of shopping and gaming. Terrific meeting and conference facilities. Some of the nicest staff I have ever experienced. I left my iPod and a book in my room and Sarah in housekeeping had them sent on to my next hotel, saving the day. Great restaurants. Quiet. Spacious and well appointed rooms. Would definity like to stay here again and take my wife so she can see and experience the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Rock is a good place in Vegas to have a business meeting if you want to stay away from the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: bigoloaf
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, really comfortable rooms and good service. Only issue was there aren't enough cabs if you are leaving at the end of a conference because it is so far off the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: CoryRyan
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock is a worthy alternative to the busy Vegas strip. With a large casino, movie multi-plex, bowling, nightclubs and shopping, you may not need to take advantage of the free shuttle to the strip. And the casino features some of the loosest slots in Vegas plus a great assortment of table games. Travel time from the airport seems similar to most strip resorts, with easy interstate access. The rooms are spacious and well appointed - we loved the leather and marble tiled bath. Even though we own a timeshare in Vegas, one earlier visit to Red Rock convinced us to arrange a stay during our next Vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “I love the Red Rock Resort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: lvrealestategal
Reviews.Content: I love the Red Rock Resort! I have stayed here many times and have recommended it to a countless amount of people. I love the variety and quality of the restaurants on location. T Bones has a great atmosphere and wonderful food! Terra Rosa has an incredible wine list and amazing chiopini. The rooms are beautiful with a variety of views... all are nice. The bowling alley is huge and alot of fun and the movie theater is clean and well run. I haven't even mentioned the pool or the spa. The pool is incredible. The spa is absolutely the best spa i've been to. I go and spend spa days there. The surroundings are perfectly sirene and they offer a great variety of treatments. I would recommend this hotel for people visiting Summerlin or the surrounding areas. There are incredible golf courses near by, hiking, shopping and its close to freeways.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!, The Vegas Surprise”
Reviews.Author: dwbrodie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Las Vegas to times a year (my wife's sister lives there). We are so excited about a summer return to take in the pool area in the real heat of summer, we can't wait. We have stayed at many differnt properties on, and off the strip, and down town. The staff was very friendly and very professional! The room was very cozy..the deep relaxing tub along with the built in tv was an great bonus!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Vegas I love”
Reviews.Author: alsorobocat
Reviews.Content: What I don't like about Vegas is the crowds, the sleaze, the plastic, and cheesiness. What I do like is the weather, the best hotels with fantastic rates, great food, gambling, spa, and night life. At Red Rock I get to avoid all that I don't like and get all that I do. I don't even need to see the strip, I can get a room with a view of the Red Rock canyons. But if I need to go to the strip its not that far away. I stopped going to Las Vegas 4 years ago because when every trip was coming to an end I could not wait to get out of there, and get that Las Vegas feeling off of me. But between July 2010 and February 2011, I have been back to Red Rock 4 times. It has a real resort feel, and you can bring the kids, they have lots of activities for them too.

Reviews.Title: “As always, can't wait to go back to the Red Rock Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mikeh391
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome facility, or more specifically, resort. We have stayed here a few times before and will stay again and again. We also stay at other locations in Las Vegas but this is one of our favorites. We have zero complaints and only positive feedback in all categories. So, if you have not been here, check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: Swainzzz
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about the Red Rock. The staff were wonderful, the resort was beautiful and comfortable. Easy shuttle to the strip. Food outstanding. Casino and lounges were great. We even saw a movie in the IMAX theatre. Who could ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot; First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mozart55
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Red Rock, and because it was a short trip in February, we were unfortuantely not able to take advanage of their fabulous pool and leisure activities. Red Rock rooms are first class, comparable to any five star hotel in Las Vegas; they are large. quiet and either face the Strip or red rock mountains. Being 20 minutes away from the strip, allows one to indulge in nearby big box shopping stores. They have a wide variety of truly great restaurants, both moderate and upscale. The Grand Cafe has terrific meals at reasonable prices. The casino is huge with friendky staff, and offers gamblers whatever they want. This really is a first class operation, and if you want to stay away from the strip, try Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Irishclancy
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great place to stay with no stress, Red Rock is it. The rooms are wonderful and allow a great rest. The bathrooms with the sunkin tub and the TV allow for a wonderful bubble bath. The food in all the resturants is great. Breakfast prices at the cafe cannot be beat. The casino is clean, machines are new and the staff at the tables are very welcoming. Now for the best part...the Red Rock SPA...oh my, what an experience. Staff is wonderful, the services are excellent with many choices and they make you feel like royalty. I have stayed here at least twice a year since it opened and still LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: “What a great resort”
Reviews.Author: Ching68
Reviews.Content: We have been regular visitors to Las Vegas for over thirty years and have not experienced a better resort that the Red Rock during all that time. We have stayed at this resort several times this past year. On each visit the entire staff has been excellent. They always give you a very warm greeting and go out of their way to provide excellent service. The rooms have always been comfortable and clean. The resort offers a very relaxing get away. The restaurant's and buffet are great, the casino is full of games and a lot of fun. Our family including children and grand children are planning another trip to the Red Rock in May to celebrate our 50th anniversary. The grand children are looking forward to the large pool which will be great in May. The facilities at the Red Rock will allow all of use to enjoy a great time on our next visit

Reviews.Title: “Quality & Customer Service, away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: StevieR
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Red Rock as part of a 8 day Super Bowl trip with some friends. THe other nights were spent at a downtown hotel and a strip hotel. My main reason for staying off the strip has been for the better gambling i.e. looser slots, better BJ rules, etc. At Red Rock I got this plus some of the best customer service I've ever encountered and the nicest room I ever had in Vegas. I've stayed at Wynn & Venetian before so I know what a top rate hotel should provide. Red Rock exceeded both of these properties which is no small statement. Everyone encountered from the valet runners to the Concierge really seemed to enjoy their jobs and did everything in their power to please you. This will be my first choice for future vegas trips!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Annetta8484044
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to thank Pam Cottrell and all the employees of the Red rock for making this the best trip i have ever had to Vegas. The hotel and rooms are beautiful and my family and i have never been treated so well.This is the place for food gambling and family entertainment. If you go to Las Vegas and don't spend your time at the Red Rock you have missed out.

Reviews.Title: “The diamond near the mountains”
Reviews.Author: mizzikelkr1
Reviews.Content: While traveling to Vegas I asked, "Where do you want to stay honey?" She replied, "Red Rock" We made the reservation online over the phone and the rest is history! We arrived at this beautiful place out of the way near the mountains. A courteous valet took my keys, we went inside and WOW!! The decor was impecable, our room was exsquisitely furnished, neat, and very roomy. This resort is totally self contained, you need not go anywhere, it has food, drinks, entertainment, and gambling. What more can you ask for! I will defenitely be returning for another stay. Red Rock ROCKS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Finest resort in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Steves557
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Casino Resort allows you to visit the Las Vegas strip, but gives you a place to return to, for relaxation and luxurious ammenities and comfort. Very close to golfing, mountain biking trails, hiking trails and shopping. I have now had the pleasure of being a guest at Red Rock Casino Resort two years in a row and I'll never stay on the strip again. If you do not have the opportunity for an extended stay, stop by for an evening of live music, dancing and one of the nicest casinos in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: wagn69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Rock about 6 times the last four years, have not been diappointed yet. Rooms are excellent and gaming seems much better then the strip. Love the variety of restaurants too.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip Sensation”
Reviews.Author: joeevegas
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the Lobby of the Red Rock you will be amazed at the size and spectacular view with plenty of places to relax while you check in with a really nice bar area in the back part of the lobby. The front desk people are very friendly and courteous and check in was very quick. The guys at the bell desk were also very friendly and helpful. You will find so many things to do at the Red Rock that you won't even miss being away from the strip. With so many theaters to watch one of the many latest movie releases and a really nice size bowling alley if you want to bowl a few games to a really large sports book room to wager on just about anything you care to place a bet down on. The people that work the sports book are also nice and friendly and helpful and also quick in placing your wagers. Just plenty of action and things to do at Red Rock you will be glad you took the time to check it out. The rooms were nice and big with a large bathroom also and very clean. Also most hotels I stay in the wifi is usually very slow but I did not find this the case at the Red Rock. The free connection is a huge plus. I didn't get the opportunity to check out the pool area but it looked very nice. The food court might be your best deal if you are looking just to get a quick lunch and don't want to spend a whole lot of money. The food I ate their was very good especially the cheese steak which gave me a taste of being back home in Philly. I did notice the buffet prices were really really reasonable but I didn't have enough time to check it out and the lines I have to admit were pretty long but that is not always a bad thing since you know the food must be good. So many other things that were nice about the Red Rock but just to some it up I was very happy with everything at the Red Rock and had a very pleasant stay. They also provide free shuttle service so check that out. Just try to get to the pick up spots early.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great rooms, to die for Spa! Make it your destination!”
Reviews.Author: 1_BusinessTraveler_1
Reviews.Content: The free shuttle to the mall and the strip made getting around very easy during our free time. The hotel was quick to respond to any requests and the variety of restaurants.....from the "T-Bone" to the fast food court allowed us to eat in a variety of venues for impromtu meetings. Yes! I would deffinitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Class act”
Reviews.Author: cap1916
Reviews.Content: Great selection of games, first rate hotel room and amenities. Advanced check in system and method to get luggage to room. Finally, a hotel casino where one is able to check in and get to your room without weaving through the casino. I love to play, but getting to room and settled in is first order of business. Designers should get an award for this! Festive during the week, but only show up on Friday or Saturday nights if you are ready to get your ear drums blown out by competing music venues.

Reviews.Title: “I haven't stayed at many places in Vegas,but I won't stay at another”
Reviews.Author: DoubleDownDougie
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Red Rock and have found a new home when I visit Vegas. I think it is great being off the strip, and if really necessary you can always take the shuttle to the strip, but really everything you need is at Red Rock. All resort personnel are extremely friendly and helpful. And from my experience I found the slots paid much better being off the strip. Don't think about booking anywhere else. Would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excitement, great food, best casino and hotel in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: boston173
Reviews.Content: Get away from the crowds and the traffic of the strip by staying at the Red Rock Casino and hotel. It is by far the cleanest, friendliest, place to stay with constant action and great dining. They offer shuttle service to the strip if you would like to do some shopping and check out the other casinos but you will be glad when you return to the comfort and security of the the Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Quaility Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: StarDogSue
Reviews.Content: I received some promotional offers to stay at Red Rock and I found the hotel very luxurious. Rooms were very nice with great amenities. Plenty of options for dining and friendly staff around to help you with your every need. I would recommend this place if you want to go to Vegas but stay away from the strip area. They offer shuttle services to/from airport which was very convenient and included in the hotel cost.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock: Serenity at it's Best!”
Reviews.Author: JudyR050
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for serenity and excitement at the same time, Red Rock Resort and Casino is the place. The resort is located "off" the strip and has all the amenities of a high quality resort. Entertainment and restaurants are on site, so there is no need to drive anywhere, especially if your stay is for just a couple of days. However, if your stay is longer (which is highly recommended), there is a shuttle bus that will shuttle you to the strip for more entertainment, shopping, and restaurants. For those that are outdoor adventurists, Red Rock National Conservative Area is not far from the resort. After a good hike or some rock climbing, Red Rock Resort is the perfect place to wind down whether you choose the beautiful pool, spa, or room. Other facilities on site at the Red Rock are movie theaters, arcade, and the Red Rock Lanes bowling alley. For bowling fanatics (such as myself), it is highly recommended. The PBA Tournament of Champions event occurred in January as well as my 50th birthday celebration. It was the perfect gift! Can't wait to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “BINGO LOVERS PARADISE!”
Reviews.Author: LadyPedro60
Reviews.Content: I love BINGO so why not stay where there's easy access. Red Rock Resort has its own BINGO Hall; who could ask for more! The entire stay was heavenly. The staff was very professional and always went above and beyond there norm to make me happy and comfortable. All inclusive and they even have a movie theater!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel but not in the strip.”
Reviews.Author: ferrinator
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Hotel and Resorts is definately an awesome choice if the non-stop action of Las Vegas is a bit too much for you. Though you're not right in the middle of everything, this allows for a more private feel and would be a great choice for both business trips when you're looking to stay focused and romantic getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vegas stay ever”
Reviews.Author: TSears
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the strip, way off the strip but you don't miss a single thing! I have never in my llife stayed someplace where the staff made me feel like i was the only person staying there. Somehow Red Rock did that. Not only was the place absolutely gorgeous, but it is the type of place where you can bring your entire family to Vegas, get the fun and excitement of Vegas but get none of the sleeze. I loved it! Friendly staff, amazing food and the best sleep I ever had. Not something I ever expected in Vegas but I got that and more at Red Rock spa. Red Rock will now be my ONLY place to stay in Vegas. I will see you in a couple of months Red Rock! And to anyone out there who has kids and wants to go to Vegas but don't want to worry about walking your kids down the strip, stay at Red Rock, use the sitter service and shuttle service. This place has an arcade, bowling alley and movie theater. If you have teenagers they can stay there and have fun at the resort while you the strip. Perfect place to stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy a piece of paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Goodie300
Reviews.Content: Considering a trip to Vegas, do not over look the Red Rock Casino. It may be off the strip but the place is off the hook with comfort and enjoyment. My wife and I always stay there when we are in Vegas and always have a fantastic time. Very fair slots. Great food. Super rooms. Simply a pleasure! Thanks Red Rock from a old soldier and his wife!

Reviews.Title: “Off The Path Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: wicowboyfan
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas for the Heartland Poker Tour January 13th thru the 16th, 2011. I have to admit, we were pleasantly surprised at the accomodations. Overall, the experience was above average, and I would recommend this resort to everyone. Some problems/issues came up, but we are reasonable people and dealt with the issues. Pros: Shuttle service to/from the strip, Buffet, appearance, "Zen" like feel, comfort. Cons: Pre-booked upgraded room had one bed for 2 guys, moved to smaller room with 2 beds, one cockroach in room was squashed, shower drain was plugged for the entire stay. Like I said, overall it was a great experience and the poker tournament was fairly smooth. We will definately be returning next year and may even stop for a night next time we visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: SusanDelawareOhio
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and the restaurants were very good. Tip: Be patient with the line for the buffets - they are worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “service and scenery will bring me back.”
Reviews.Author: hdt75
Reviews.Content: We wanted to see the beauty outside of Vegas, close to outdoor activities, like horseback riding and hiking. The resort was full of excellent restaurants and family activities, so we drove to the strip to see shows, etc. It was better than I expected, and the service was great. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The Rock (Red Rock) must be part of any Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: Dickinflorida
Reviews.Content: The beauty of RR covers many aspects for a leisure trip. The gaming available from tables to machines in general, and video poker in particular, offers a reasonable return that with some good luck you can leave a winner. The food choices, with the recent addition of The Yard House, are all excellent, including the fast food. One evening we took a bottle of wine up to the room, put it on ice and drank it with the Capriotti Sandwich we picked up from the good court. The sandwich was excellent, add the wine and some friends and it turned out to be one of our favorite evening meal occasions. We had dinner at the Yard House, which has huge menu choices from appetizers that will you up to many reasonably priced sandwiches and entrées, plus other fine food entrée choices, and of course way too many on tap beers from around the world. Dinner in the Mexican restaurant was excellent, but the best was T Bones. Fine dining at it's finest. One suggestion is to split an entrée with your spouse or friend as the portions are massive. Although it was too cold outside in January to really enjoy the heated pool (at least for us older folks) it is a very nice place to enjoy a couple of hours of relaxation and a few cocktails during the warmer months. Some may say the entertainment is limited due to the distance from the strip, but I would disagree. There is plenty of evening entertainment and music, plus you always have the opportunity to see a movie at the multiple theater complex. We find a movie every now and then is a nice diversion from gambling, as a good relaxing movie can recharge you batteries for all the other activities. We rarely use the spa, but just knowing that it is there makes Red Rock a destination Resort for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “I Really Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Ozinvegas
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is just the best. It's a beautiful hotel and the staff is very helpful and professional. Everyone is much nicer than the people at most of the "upper class" resort/casinos on the strip. The odds are better as well if you're a slot player. I get comps from other places like The Rio, Harrah's, The Orleans, The Gold Coast, The California, and other Boyd properties but Station casinos have become my first choice. They just treat me better than the other places. When you take into consideration what a classy place Red Rock is, it's not even a close call. The only negative is the distance from everyplace else in Vegas. But heck, that's what cars are for.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better places to stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysinVegas2
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas several times a year. We've always stayed on the strip,but this time decided to try something a little different. Red Rock was fabulous --- The rooms were as nice (or better) than ones we have had at Aria & Mandalay and significantly better than Luxor (which we didn't like). Good size casino with lots going on. The pool was even open over the Christmas holidays. All in all one of the better places we have stayed in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “"Red Rock" is like a mirage in the desert. If I were Samantha in "Sex in the City," all I need is my prince charming!"”
Reviews.Author: Gina124
Reviews.Content: I give this resort an excellent rating. Our service is par excellence. I'll never forget the service that the bell men at resort had given me and my best friend. They helped us with our luggage and made sure that our shuttle to the airport (which by the way is an excellent service and within appx. 20 - 25 peaceful minutes). Very prompt, efficient and polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!! Great Value!!!”
Reviews.Author: ourkohrner
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind being about 15 minutes off the strip (to which there is a regular shuttle), then this is the place!!!! The Red Rock is a terrific hotel/casino/spa which includes a movie multiplex, a bowling alley, an arcade, and a fantastic pool area!! The food choices are extensive - T-Bones(steak), Hachi (Japanese), Terra Rosa (Italian), Cabo (Mexican), LB's (an upscale hamburger joint), a food court (Panda Express, Rubios, Fatburger, Starbucks, Ben and Jerry's, and others), a buffet and a cafe (coffee shop type atmosphere). All this, with incredible views of the red rocks, make this my number one choice for an off-strip hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What was promised”
Reviews.Author: Tmoma
Reviews.Content: Be clear on your contract. The business center was no user friendly and I had a misunderstanding about my contract amenities and the answer I received from my sales representative was less that pleasing.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay, hands down!”
Reviews.Author: HappilyMarriedNow
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. The atmosphere and comfort level are way above the top. The customer service is always A+++. The food and casino, incredible. The staff extremely responsive and friendly. I will stay here every time I visit Las Vegas - worth the few minutes extra drive. The suites are DIVINE!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: brandonLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderfyl time. Our rooms was fantastic as always. I can hardly wait until the next time I visit Las Vegas so that I can stay at the Red Rock Casino and Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Casino In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Vegasgman
Reviews.Content: We love Red Rock for many reasons, our trips almost always turn out wonderful. They have the best Steak House T-Bones and the best rooms and pool. We like that its away from all the strip carrying on! and its a way better place to gamble than anything on the strip. We tell everyone its our best home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, people are very accomodating !”
Reviews.Author: snady41
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Red Rock on many occassions and I find this hotel to be one of the best in Vegas. The hotel decor is very nice and inviting. The rooms are very comfortable, beds are great. When you request something they are very attentive that your request is fulfilled. In fact I have a whole group of people that used to stay at another hotel in Vegas for Superbowl and they all wanted to try the Red Rock Casino and Spa because of the good things they have heard about this hotel. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Graig2
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock is a great place to stay. The hotel is great and the amenities are top-notch. I recommend the restaurants, food court, movie theater and bowling alley. All were great. If you are going to Vegas to see the Strip I'd suggest actually staying on the strip, but if you want a great resort that you don't need to leave to have an excellent vacation then I'd recommend Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look for better in Las Vegas because it doesn't exist.”
Reviews.Author: LadyFenwood
Reviews.Content: From the minute I pulled the car into the valet area I was treated kindly and in a way I felt special. This includes bell service, VIP check-in, etc. The room was impeccable and smelled fresh. The only shortcoming is (for older guests) there is not enough lighting in the room. It is mostly mood lighting). Sleeping was very comfortable and room service was terrific. Ate at T-Bones again, and it has become my favorite restaurant in all of Las Vegas. Again you are made to feel special from the moment you are greeted at the entry until you leave. The food is cooked to perfection and the quality of meats and seafood is the best. The selection of wines more than met my standards andmy eastcoast wine afficianado friend agreed with me. Red Rock has one of the finest poker rooms in Las Vegas and offered a wide selection of games and tournments. The spa is very classy and offers great relaxing services and has a first class exercise facility. Overall my stay was most enjoyable and I look forward to the next opportunity to be a guest at Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “This resort has everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: reidbo99
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very well appointed. There is a great selection of restaurants to cover every budget and pallet. Everything you need is close by if you desire to shop. It is far enough away from the strip so that traffic is never a problem. Great mountain views from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes you feel ripped off.”
Reviews.Author: Paula981
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Red Rock as part of the NTRA Handicapping Contest. We have been at the Red Rock every year since the contest moved out here. We have always enjoyed the hotel and the service was great. This year not so much. We asked on Friday if it was possible to extend our stay for one more night and were told we could but that the rate jumped to $300.00 for the night!! Can't imagine what we were going to get for that increase??? Seeing as on that very day, no one cleaned our room, and when we called it took them almost an hour before they came! My husband was expecting a very important delivery from the Business Center and after not receiving that for almost two hours, we called and the woman said "oh I didn't know he wanted it"!! Sad to write this because I as said we have been here many times and just feel that they didn't hold up the customer service end of the deal that I listened to for over a half an hour when I was on hold trying to find out if we could extend our stay. Maybe they ought to listen to the recording! But as the contest will be held here again next year we will be back, sure hope they get their ducks in a row for next year! I wouldn't recommend this hotel if it was someone's first time to Vegas. Too far off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock, the way to relax in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SimplyRedRock
Reviews.Content: Don't miss out on the Red Rock experience. It's off-strip location is actually a plus because of the relaxed pace as opposed to staying on the strip. In fact the old adage probably applies "The Strip is a nice place to visit but I wouldn't want to live there." The resort itself is self-contained. You could spend the whole weekend there and not get bored. Pubs and restaurants are cool and classy. We enjoyed the happy hour at by the piano bar at T-bones; great food and drink specialties that we savored right by the grand piano counter. Place has a movieplex, bowling, and bingo. It's family-oriented and there were a few teens and kids around. Pool looked big and clean but it was winter when we stayed and so they were closed. They had buffet specials and so we took advantage of the cheap price but really above average dishes (comparable if not better than ARIA's or Wynn's). If you get tired of stuffing yourselves there are fine restaurants just within Summerlin area (you don't need to drive far). We saw different ethnic eateries which are good quality as they cater to the office crowd at lunch and middle-upper class locals at night. As far as value, we went on comp but their nightly rates are lower than most of the hotels on the strip and we're talking about a four diamond hotel. It's easy to recognize a great deal when you see one.

Reviews.Title: “Made our wedding weekend special!”
Reviews.Author: dpal25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Red Rock New Year's Day for our wedding. We only booked one night, but it was such a great hotel, we extended our stay for one more night. The staff is so helpful. The rooms are lush. I have trouble sleeping even in my own bed, but slept like a baby at Red Rock. We won't stay anywhere else now when we go to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Hotel and Casino is my favorite place in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: joannelalonde
Reviews.Content: I love everything about Red Rock Hotel and Casino. The rooms are beautiful, clean and spacious. The employees are helpful and polite. The entire atmosphere is welcoming and enjoyable. This place has fabulous restaurants, a wonderful huge movie theater, bowling lanes, fabulous spa, swimming pool and plenty of gambling if you want. There is something for everyone here. We always stay there and reccommend it to all of our friends and family. It's our favorite place in Las Vegas! And we live here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing location in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: charlielv
Reviews.Content: Red Rock has all the features of the strip hotels, but you are off the strip. Many choices for gaming and restaurants are available at the hotel. If you want to go to the strip it is a 10-15 minute ride. Red Rock has all of the amenties of the strip hotels, but without some of the crowds.We have stayed at Red Rock twice in the last 6 months and the service has been excellent. The staff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice ...enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Bizzygal1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Rock Casino for 3 days/ 2 nights for a business summit. The hotel is very nice with luxurious and upscale decor and amenities and nice views of the red rock canyons. If you're looking for a cheesy "Vegas" hotel on the strip...this is NOT it. The hotel is earthy, yet glitzy...not tacky and only about a 15 minute drive to the strip and 20 min to the airport. The standard rooms and bathrooms are very spacious and the beds/linens are TO DIE FOR comfortable. I peeked into a larger suite while housekeeping left the door open and it was also very large with beautiful sectionals and huge flatscreen TVs.....would make for a very swanky group stay. The food served during the summit was very good and always appropriately hot/cold (which seems to be impossible at other hotels). The pool area was very large & inviting although it was too cold to swim. There are several restaurants within the hotel (that I heard were very good, although I did not get to experience them 1st hand sadly). The only complaints I have about this hotel are that the room had minimal lighting and it was somewhat difficult to see even during the day with all the lights on and the shades curtains open. There was no coffee pot in the room (because there is a Starbucks in the lobby area and room service coffee was VERY pricy). I also waited in long lines during check-in in and my colleagues waited in a long line while checking out (to obtain a receipt for business expense). The business center wanted to charge $5 to print my boarding pass....HA!....Vegas:/ This hotel is VERY large and covers alot of square feet, so be prepared to WALK long halls and wait for elevators, otherwise.....very nice if you prefer a slightly more relaxed Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mothermadusa
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel...I have stayed here several times and am always pleased. Rooms are large with very comfortable beds and HUGE bathrooms. Several good restaurants, I don't usually go to buffets but the breakfast buffet is really good, T-bones steakhouse is great and a must for happy hour! The recent addition of the Yardhouse is a plus great for beer. The pool area is the best in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great All-in-One Vegas Location”
Reviews.Author: BillyLG
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the Vegas experience, but want to be a bit removed from the craziness of the strip, this is the place to go! All of the amenities of the major, on-strip casinos but a little bit more contained. Great for business trips, and families.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: salsagev007
Reviews.Content: Stayed there numerous times before and well worth it. Rooms are spacious and the soaking tubs are awesome!! Even the huge granite shower was relaxing. Everything was excellent with the hotel. The maid service was dependable and always willing to assist. The front desk was timely on any issues that were brought up. The toiletries are some of the best I have ever used and I am constantly taking them home as they work and smell great. Overall it is a great hotel and a great room to stay in. Its not even close to the strip but thats ok. When your visiting Vegas you can feel like a local and relax where the locals relax at. Get the best rate by booking ahead or atleast getting a players card and getting the cheapest players rate thru the casino hosts. The only negative I would say would be that the fridge provides no room for your own beverages. Request a higher floor to see more of the valley i also suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Off Strip Casino and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cigarman99
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a classy, modern hotel away from the hustle and bustle of the strip this is it! The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. Restaurants outstanding! They comp freely so be sure to use your players card. Only 15 minutes from the strip. A quiet oasis after an exciting day!

Reviews.Title: “Rocking red rock”
Reviews.Author: sanchak75
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as I was attending a conference in the same Hotel . The hotel is too good and is worth the money that I paid for i.e 110 usd per night.the resort has excellent facilities which also includes a bowling arena which is very good. Though the Hotel is away from the strip but as I was having a car as the hotel had a parking lot , it was easy for me. Good hotel to stay in , good for family and business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility, Bad Help!!”
Reviews.Author: tadams7003
Reviews.Content: I would stay away from this place. There are many places to stay in vegas, the help at this place was rude and not happy to be busy. I don't think they get it. Book the Golden Nugget, the people are friendly!!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed if you stay at the Red Rock Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Pooh2Pooh
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at the Red Rock Hotel. At the airport, I collected our checked luggage and found my way to ground zero by 3:30pm. The Red Rock has a FREE shuttle from the airport that picks up every even hour. There is also a FREE shuttle that takes you right to the Strip. Our room was fabulous. We requested the Strip View and the view was unbelieveable. There was a resort fee of $24.99 per night plus tax. So, for two nights, the fee was a price of one cab ride from the airport. I go on vacation to relax and that is just what I did. There were no crowds. I even took in a movie which I would've never done had I stayed on the Strip. They have fast foods and several really good restaurants. I will definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: peerster
Reviews.Content: We were passing through Vegas as a family, to comfortably relax a bit, in between national park trips. I choose Red Rock based on reviews on this site and I am incredibly disappointed. The place is WAY over-priced, relative to Vegas and not at all an enjoyable experience. 1) I chose this place based on reviews claiming it relatively friendly to kids, what they did not say was just how much one has to go through the casino, to get anywhere. One can not get a bite to eat or do any of the kid friendly activities without trekking through the entire extremely smoky and stuffy casino. I don't mind the gambling, but the smoke is TERRIBLE, and people even smoke near my smoke free room in the hotel itself. I don' t know what makes this hotel more kid friendly than others, but the SMOKE is a disaster. 2) Many people said that the hotel staff were friendly and helpful and I feel like I am in a different hotel. The staff lack basic knowledge about their own hotel, I kept on getting contradictory information, such as pool openings, spa offerings, buffet pricing etc... I had to run after them 4 times to get a tiny fridge in my room a day later than promised (tinier than other hotel fridges, too tiny to fit anything really). Any time I asked the reception a question, they acted as if they were doing me a huge favor in answering. I did not feel welcome. I am a seasoned traveller and the staff is considerably less friendly than what I regularly encounter at hotels around the world. 3) The room is far more expensive than most in Las Vegas, and especially for being off strip I had higher expectations. For example, the beds were low quality considering the price of the hotel, I was not comfortable. Another example, there was no coffee maker/coffee in my room, like most hotels. Also, I developed a headache, likely from from all the unavoidable smoke everywhere in the hotel, when I asked for Advil (most hotel receptions have some) I was sent to the gift shop, to pay $3.50 for 2 Advil pills. To cash in like that on my headache, after all I paid the hotel, a slap in the face. They could have at least sold a full bottle at reasonable prices. It is little things like that, again and again throughout the day, that made the experience bad. We did not enjoy ourselves. Our one positive experience was at the hotel, Hachi the Japanesse restaurant was excellent. It was like being transported to another place with excellent food, service and atmosphere. The entire family really enjoyed that meal very very much, food and atmosphere, but that is pretty much the only thing we enjoyed at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - way off the strip”
Reviews.Author: biilsusan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay @ Red Rock Casino Resort. The hotel was beautiful. We had a king room on the 18th floor. It was spacious, very clean and well maintained. I loved the tolietry items. All of the staff that we met were very accomodating to our needs. It was too cool to use the beautiful pool area & we didn't use the spa. The hotel & casino had many good food/restaurant choices. The hotel is in a business park. The hotel does provide a free shuttle service to & from the hotel to the airport every 2 hours, as well as the hotel & Fashion Show Mall. We arrived 10 minutes after the shuttle left the airport. Instead of hanging out @ the airport for 2 more hours, we opted for a taxi. The taxi ride was around $48.00, not including the tip. Next time we will get a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, nice, clean and a pleasure to stay at”
Reviews.Author: egellman
Reviews.Content: Really nice and clean hotel. Great property. A lot to do. Wish they were a little more kid friendly. Kids under 18 not allowed in the spa or gym. They also closed the pool area at 4pm. We were not allowed to use the hot tub at night. Besides that we really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not designed well”
Reviews.Author: cpamomma
Reviews.Content: We normally stay on the strip, but we had a family emergency in Summerlin so we stayed at the Red Rock. The casino area is very nice and there are lots of restaurants to choose from. The rooms are not conducive to sleeping. The door from the hallway opens right into the sleeping area, so the bright light right outside the room shines on whoever may be trying to sleep. Also, the door to the bathroom is frosted glass, so if someone has to get up during the night, the entire room lights up. We also heard a ton of noise in the room. The resort fee is pretty high and we did not even get the promised newspaper. All of the rooms we have stayed in on the strip (Bellagio, Mirage, Palazzo) have doors that open onto a small hallway and the bathrooms also open onto the same hallway, avoiding the problems of light and noise pouring in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Las Vegas alternative if you are tired of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: GeoPeg14
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three nights at the Red Rock. We were very happy with the quality and the service. There are plenty of alternatives to keep you occupied and the restaurants we ate at were very good. The room was very nice and comfortable. We went to a movie at the Regal and that was a very nice theater. We liked the casino, although we wish we would have found the no smoking section sooner. only feedback there is it seemed like there were a lot less tables for blackjack, etc than in other casinos we have been to. Stores were not that much to write home about, but there are plenty of nearby alternatives and we werent expecting anything like the Strip. All in all a very good experience, reasonably priced too. We will be coming back. FYI, Vegas in November can be VERY cold.... dress warm.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon--it was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: blhappypets
Reviews.Content: Quick 3 day honeymoon. AMAZING massages and spa, great poolside food, average restaurants, fun casino floor, good movie theater, excellent overall design, great room design, can't wait to go back! I was a bit disappointed with the restaurants. I think they aimed to be top of the line, but fell short. Good service on both dinners, however. Very chill but fun pool area, best spa, great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great opportunity to enjoy Vegas without being on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: erikasmack
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Red Rock. We stayed a week. Yes, that is rather long but we needed to get away. Everything Trip Advisor says about the shuttle from the airport is absolutely true. We missed a shuttle from the airport because 1) we didn't know exactly where to go on ground zero (first set of benches, not the farther second set) and 2) we didn't know what the shuttle looked like. Apparently the bus with the big Red Rock signage was out of commission. We were in no rush and stayed at the airport and got something to eat/drink until the next shuttle. During the rest of the week we traveled down to the strip several times. Work your schedule around the shuttle that takes you down to the Fashion Show Mall / Strip to do what you need to do. Just keep in mind that the last one back to the hotel stops running around 9:30 pm. So, you will need to do a taxi if you do a show. Or, you can do what we did which was rent a car for the day. The hotel concierge helped coordinate it for us. $50 a day for an intermediate that is delivered to the hotel. It was perfect for what running around we wanted to do. The hotel is almost in a residential area (Sumerlin) but has a fabulous view of either the strip or the red rocks. The rooms are reminiscent of the Wynn and rather nice. Only issue were, the doors to the room were heavy (yet not sound proof from the hallway noise) so when you close it it does so rather hard. At 2 am in the morning that is the last thing you will want to hear. And, although the bathrooms were a beautiful marble with a deep soaking tub and tv, we had issues getting the temperature right on the shower. We didn't complain because it wasn't our water bill. Oh, one more thing. We did each of the restaurants in the hotel for either lunch or dinner. T-Bones, the high end steakhouse was terrible. I certainly don't mind paying for a good steak, however, this was grossly overpriced for what we received and the service was only average. The sushi bar (forgot the name) was actually very good along with the mexican cafe. All in all, I would definitely go back. The movie theater and bowling ally are a great touch. Next time we will probably plan our stay around the hotel entertainment a car rental for going off the beaten path.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsJEP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock for our Las Vegas wedding. It definitely has a relaxed resort atmosphere. The staff in the lobby is very helpful, check-in was fast and easy. The room was clean and the bed very comfortable. The pool was beautiful!!! I had appointments for a pedicure, hair and makeup. As expected, the prices were steep but I felt the hair and makeup were well worth it. The "classic" pedicure was not worth $7. This is nothing against the staff, they were wonderful. I just think $75 plus tip is a lot of money for a foot soak and polish application. The next day we had a couples massage that I highly recommend! There are a couple of warnings for your visit. When you register, do not take any room with a number over 125. If you do, you have a long walk to the elevator, especially if your room is number 151 (almost the end of the hall) like ours. We definitely got our exercise during our trip thanks to the trips from our room to the elevator and back. Check the shuttle schedule (on their site) BEFORE you book your flights because the shuttle only runs every two hours, and a cab ride will cost about $50-$60 not including tip. Enjoy!! If you are looking for a relaxing and quiet vacation, the Red Rock is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!”
Reviews.Author: golfergirl6269
Reviews.Content: After reading the negative reviews here, I was concerned that I may have booked the wrong resort. I was pleasantly surprised, from the moment we started our vacation and all through out. The front desk staff, bell hops and valet were all VERY nice. I never experienced any rudeness from the hotel employees. Our room did not have a blow dryer. I stopped at the front desk, explained the situation, and one was delivered to our room within 20 minutes. The pictures posted on the hotel site, are accurate pictures. When we checked in, we were asked if we wanted a mountain view or strip view. We chose the mountain view, overlooking the pool. Every morning, the first thing I would do was open the drapes and gawk at the mountains. It was a fantastic view!! The hotel was very clean. The rooms were clean. The soaking tub was wonderful! The bed was very comfortable. The restaurants were fantastic! The hotel is about 20 minutes from the strip, it's also about 20 minutes from Henderson. It's convenient to shopping and to the highway. I don't have any complaints about this resort, and my husband and I will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service-crappy management”
Reviews.Author: disgusted600
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and our toilet overflowed twice all over our bathroom floor. It was disgusting and when we called for a manager no one called us back. There was obviously a problem with the toilet in our room, no cared and no one fixed it!!! Disgusting

Reviews.Title: “The Time has come to Praise the Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: UncommonSmith
Reviews.Content: Recently we booked a three night stay from an Internet site (that shall remain nameless). We arrived at Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa ready for a relaxing vacation only to learn that we had been scammed. NO RESERVATION...AND THE CREDIT CARD HAD ALREADY BEEN HIT. To make matters worse, they were completely sold out for a weekend poker tournament!! Without going into too much detail, suffice it to say that the staff at Red Rock made our problems their problem and then proceeded to FIX IT! We were shown to our fabulous suite and throughly enjoyed the next three days of fun and relaxation....as guests of the hote...they comped our room while they tracked down the scammers!! Wow!! Honestly, the staff throughout the entire hotel couldn't have been more friendly and accomodating. From the front desk to the spa to the guy who cleans the pool.....it was like they all got together and decided to give this couple from Missouri a great trip and make them "word-of-mouth-ambassadors". Well, if that was their intention...then they succeeded at every level. We have done nothing but sing the praises of Red Rock since we got home. We have been to Las Vegas close to 10 times and this was, by far, the most pleasant stay of all. Do yourself a favor and get off the Strip! Book a reservation at Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa. You'll notice I mentioned nothing about the decor or the food. Of course, it was fantastic! At a certain level, all the high-end hotels hit those notes. Ahhh, but SERVICE! That's what sets a great hotel apart from it's competitors. Red Rock has it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another awesome stay at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: jwilliamsen1
Reviews.Content: In my opinion this is the only way to go to Vegas. No rediculous winding line to check in (i'm talking to you Venetian!!). Check in staff was excellant. Had to wait a little while for room to be ready. No problem they now have a Yardhouse, one of my favorite restaurants, adding to their already excellant restaurant choices. Room was great, closer to the elevator this time which was nice. The night of arrival Don Henley was playing by the pool. Went to the ticket office and bought tickets no problem and what a night. Beautiful warm desert night experiencing this amazing concert while literally standing in the pool. Awesome, I will definately go back and stay just to see concerts out there. Restaurants were great. As I mentioned the Yardhouse is a great addition. Had breakfast on an outdoor patio by the cafe which was nice. Also had breakfast at the buffet which has a great selection but I always eat too much there. Tried the Japanese/ Fusion restaurant Hachi which was excellant. Lunch poolside at the sandbar is a must. Try the coconut shrimp, (drinks I have to admit are a bit pricey and not marked on the menu). Cocktails all over the place including T-bones. Service was outstanding everywhere. Again I say the best pool in Vegas!!! Only 800 rooms means plenty of room even on a hot Saturday afternoon. There is truly no better Vegas resort experience. Want to go to the strip? Go ahead. I've been there and done that . This is The Place, it has it all and it's all enjoyable. Even the valets.

Reviews.Title: “The best off the strip resort Vegas has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: goodgollyholly
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to get a taste of Vegas, but aren't looking to stay on "the strip" this might be the place for you. This resort is a short cab trip from the strip, and a short bike ride (or drive) from Red Rock Canyon. The canyon is an excellent place to hike, for beginners or advanced hikers. You can even rent a car for a few hours and simply drive through the canyon and take in the views. The hotel pool is amazing. Its not a meat market like so many pools are in Vegas, yet at the same time its not a kiddie pool either. There is a good mix of families, couples, and young people. The food options are many, and very good. There is always something open and making reservations for the nicer restaurants is easy. The spa is flexible. I was able to make and cancel an appointment in one day without suffering a penalty. Casino floor is really nice. The table minimums are low, and the floor is not overly crowded. There is not a lot of shopping in this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4.5 star hotel! Great casino though.”
Reviews.Author: LASteve1977
Reviews.Content: Went to Red Rock with my wife, and had a good time. Great casino, movie theater, bowling alley and good restaurants. ONE BIG PROBLEM though... The doors in every room SLAM shut automatically, which jerked me from my sleep more than once. The rooms look like the Wynn at first... but then take a closer look and realize it's more of a cheap lipstick copycat. The walls and windows were not sound proof or think enough, could hear rooms above, bellow, and to the sides. Even heard the street, and I was on the 18th floor. Plus, if you've never been to vegas, not at all the place to stay... to far from the strip, and the true Vegas experience. However, if you're a regular visitor worth checking it out, if you don't get woken up easily. Overall I would say the Hotel was built poorly but the casino was great, so I loved it and was disappointed all at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stylish hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: neversummer1911
Reviews.Content: Had to go to vegas for a conference, and the event was in Red rock. Despite being off the strip, it is a awesome hotel with great modern interior design, and attentive service. There is a wide variety of food options, and things to do. The room is also nice, i have nothing bad to say about this hotel....modern, new, and if only it was close to the strip...it would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great off the strip hotel & Casino...although very isolated....”
Reviews.Author: dolphin80
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here at the Red Rocks Casino Hotel & Spa by choice, as I was sent here by my company for a conference. However, I won’t hold that against the hotel, because I wouldn’t have preferred to stay on the strip, but I will give this place a fair and balanced review based on my experience. Arrival: The hotel offers a FREE shuttle to and from the hotel. Somebody mentioned that they paid for this service. Somebody is wrong, but I can certainly attest to the fact that I did not pay a dime to use the shuttle during my trips to and from the airport. The hotel is nowhere near the strip, being about 20 miles away from the airport & strip area. It’s definitely isolated, but some people like that. Check-In Process & Reception Area: The check-in staff was extremely efficient and helpful. I was at the desk for less than 3 minutes and on my way up to the room in no time. The reception area is beautiful and quiet as the Casino is located on the floor above. There is a fantastic bar area here in the reception area as well. Trip to the Room: Most Casino/Hotels have you haul your luggage through the casino on the way to the elevator bank, which is annoying as hell. Not so at Red Rocks, as the elevator bank is about 100ft from the reception area. Very nice. If your room number is above the 30’s, bring your track shoes, because the trip to the room from the elevator is a HIKE. You pretty much have to walk the entire length of the hotel building to get to your room, but this not a biggie in my opinion, but it should be mentioned. Most hotels in Vegas are like this due to the massive sizes of the buildings. The Room: My first impression of my room was excellent. The room was spacious, and had two double beds. There is a small desk area with an internet connection, and a lounging area in front of the big window that offered me a tremendous view of the strip 20 miles away. The bathroom was cavernous, with double sinks, a tub with a TV, a separate shower, and a separate area with the commode. The temperature concerned me when I first walked into the room, but you can control the thermostat and adjust the temperature to your liking. The Food: We were a bit hungry from our trip so we had a late lunch in the café on the way into the casino. The food was delicious and the service was excellent. On subsequent days, I ate at the breakfast buffet, which was your typical Vegas buffet style. All of the food was delicious and the service was excellent. I did not eat dinner on the property, but I understand the steakhouse is recommended. There is a Starbuck on premises as well as a gift shop that also has basic toiletries. The Conference Area: I was here for a conference, and while there were about four conferences going on, the hotel did a magnificent job of segregating everyone to their respective areas. Eating lunch on the veranda was fantastic, as it afforded a view of the Red Rock canyon. The facilities to hold a conference we’re top rate and first class. The production crew was incredibly helpful and I can see why its desirable to have a conference at this location. The Casino: The Casino is your typical Vegas casino. The layout is circular with a very nice & quiet bar located dead center of the casino. You have everything here, table games, craps, blackjack, roulette, slots, etc. My luck was not so good here though! Pool Area: The pool area is as nice as any hotel in Vegas. It was on the chilly side while I was here, but the environment is very relaxing and there are tons of spots to sit with people or quietly to read. Service here is also excellent. Cherry Nightclub: The club was reserved for a private party for my company, but I can certainly see how this place could become a hotspot on the weekends. It’s a spacious club with an excellent sound system and a well laid out bar area. I got a kick out of the bathroom, as the urinals we’re shaped like lips. Very funny stuff. Staff: Any encounter with the staff was a pleasant experience. Everyone was very helpful or went out of their way to ensure I got the help I needed. Check Out: I checked out electronically, no issues with my bill and the shuttle got me to the airport without a hitch. Summary: The hotel is a very nice property. It could easily fit on the strip. It’s an excellent self-sustaining facility that one would never have to leave to get their Vegas experience. I understand why companies have conferences here, as it allows for employees to still have fun, but limiting the amount of trouble they get into and also guarantee attendance to the conference events. If I do go back to Vegas, I would, however, prefer to stay at hotel on the strip. Taking nothing away from Red Rocks, as it was an excellent experience, I prefer the hustle & bustle of the strip. Just as an FYI, cab rides to and from the strip from Red Rocks run approximately $45 bucks, so that was kind of a downer. I heard that there is a shuttle that would take you to the strip, but unsure if there was a cost involved. Bottom line is that I recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SaraPaterson
Reviews.Content: It's like 20 miles away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, however if you want a nice classy, scenic, relaxing place to stay I highly recommend this place. The casino is laid out perfectly, They have the same friendly workers at the table games year after year, they hire locals and Americans that can communicate English and grammar well. Which I find a problem at some other casinos on the strip. The rooms are very clean., nice with marble floors flat screen tv's they even have a flat screen above the bathtub with the sound coming from the ceiling. I had a cannon view which was very nice. It would have been nice to see the Cherry Club open this year it closed down and also the Cherry pool area. As a consumer and table game player, Black Jack, Roulette and Craps this is the place you want to wager you money at. They are honest in the casino and will bend over backwards to serve you, like free cigarette pack tokens and anything you want to drink. T-Bones is a great up scale restaurant, I got the biggest Lobster Tail there I ever had in my life a 32 ounce Australian Lobster Tail which was done perfectly. The Feast Buffet is also one of the top 5 in Vegas the prime rib is out of this world. I just wish they had more seafood at the buffet. My only complaint upon checkout was a Indian mid manager trying to pound smoke up my butt on a issue he was trying to pass off and refused to own, that really upset me. I had proof of something and he more less lied to me about the issue. The issue was taken care of by security which is also best of the best here.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world”
Reviews.Author: sylviapingleton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Red Rock Friday Oct 22 thru 25 as we were in a bowling league, the hotel is to die for, and everyone was very pleasant, helpful, and the rooms out of this world, and the bowling alley WOW!, I'd stay here again, better than being on the strip, everything is in this hotel, and easy to find, Yes, love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “About what you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: SCDevsFan
Reviews.Content: Went on a golf trip and stayed at the Red Rock - stayed in late October, the weather was miserable (not blaming the hotel!) so didn't get to see the pool epect to see it, and it was large and pretty. The bad - on check in, they said my reservation didn't exist and the hotel was booked, after an hour I went to VIP services where they easily located my reservation - the girl at the front desk wasn't helpful at all and had the attitude it's my problem, not theirs and didnd't even try to solve the problem. Only other bad thing is cell service, in the room, was horrific, very hit or miss. The good was the hotel was gorgeous, staff helpful and friendly, tables had low limits, and the food in the steakhouse and italian restaurants was excelent, buffet wasn't anything memorable. Rooms nice - although they had two guys in a king bed, gave us a roll away for free - with large, comfortable bathrooms. Overall I'd stay there again if staying in that area, be mindful however it is a $50 cab ride to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious, friendly. Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: NHPLUMBER
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times. Although I was concerned because the company is going thru bankruptcy, the day to day operations seem unaffected. The service and attention to detail is what makes this place. It is not cheap, but remember you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a bargain, bachelor party drunken weekend, this is not the place for you. Get a package deal at one of those run down strip hotels and party my friends. if you like the finer ameneties, being off strip, close to good shopping and red rock recreation area then this is the place for you. The rooms are clean, check in a breeze and wireless in room internet easy, a few mouse clicks. If you stay logged in over 24 hours however it will make you re-log back in, a minor inconvienance. Bathrooms are LARGE! Rooms quiet. Get a high floor room. If you like the strip views at night get one, otherwise enjoy the mountain view and red rock rec area. T Bones is excellent but pricey, but no more than in NYC or Miami. The table games are adequate. The pool is great, but BEWARE of screaming children in the summer months, they take over the pool. My only complaint would be to keep those rugrats in their own pool so they can not pollute mine. The food court, theatres and bowling are first rate. If you like to be out of the hectic strip, book a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: LM77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at Red Rock Resort. The room was beautiful, had a huge bathroom and a great view of the mountains. It had almost everything we needed (we brought a cooler and coffee maker with us). The facility was huge and there were lots of restaurants - all good. There are also many restaurants close by. The pool area was very nice - the only two complaints were they closed the pool area early (5 pm) and during the day they played very loud music. Not good if you want to relax and read. In general the service was great. The only exception was at check in. We reserved a King non-smoking room. They had none available when we checked in and did nothing to offer us something else. They just told us our only option was a non-smoking room with two queens. It turned out ok, they just could have handled the situation a little better (it helps to apologize for the problem). The second problem was with the buffet. The food and selection was great. But, they had many choices of which line to get in and it was not clear which was the right one. We were seated and then told to go pay first before eating. The person who we paid made us show ID when we paid. I guess they get customers who sneak into the buffet without paying? They could have been a little more customer friendly. We would return to the Red Rock Resort. We are not gamblers, but we enjoyed the resort and all there is to do in the area (Red Rock Canyon, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “I will be back”
Reviews.Author: pjfmpls
Reviews.Content: I am not a gambler so being on the strip wasn't important to me. I found the service to be top notch, I loved the pool and the spa. The room was nice size with an updated bathroom and everything was clean. The bed was very comfortable and the room was pretty quiet as well.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rocks Rocked!!”
Reviews.Author: stargaze98
Reviews.Content: We went here for my 30th birthday and were very pleased with what we found. We did book the birthday package which included a suite, champagne and strawberries, free drinks vouchers and a few free bowling games. We booked this for Saturday night but got in Friday night (well 1am Saturday morning) because of our very late arrival we asked the front desk if we could get into our suite early for the birthday package and not the normal room we book for Friday because we knew we would be in that room for such a short time. It was a no go. She told us that the rooms are pre assigned when you make a reservation and she can't change that. We though maybe with the birthday and late arrival that would be a nice thing to do, but I guess not. We were very pleased with the regular king room and would not book a suite here again as the regular room is plenty big and nice with a fantastic soaking tub. When we did get into our suite it was pretty much the same room with a living room. The tub was now a jacuzzi tub but the black and white marbling of the tile made it all look dated. The shelves in the suite were very dusty as well. The Casino itself was great! We loved the bingo room and in the morning/afternoon you can find $5 blackjack. The pool was the best I have ever been, the big plush lounge chairs were fantastic. Most of the kids stay around the big pool and then there are 3 other smaller pools where most of the adults with no kids lounge. The drinks by the pool were great too. We ate at Yard house which was good, and they have the largest selection of draft beers. We ate at the buffet for breakfast which was good and were more surprised by the cheap price. Overall we had a great time and will stay here again, may even bring the kids with next time. One more thing if your flights are right they have a free shuttle to and from the airport, this is much better then the $40 cab ride. They also have a free shuttle to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnotherParrot
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Red Rock for a Business meeting. My wife and I extended the stay. The place is lovely. Great casino, great food, great entertainment, great pool complex, and excellent service. Drinks are expensive and cab fares are high if you don't catch the las shuttle of the evening. I would definitely go back. Very nice and new rooms. Got to see Train in concert poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort is the perfect venue for business conferences”
Reviews.Author: AlohaKona
Reviews.Content: I attended Office Dynamics 17th Annual Conference on Administrative Excellence "ADMINOLOGY 2010," at Red Rock Resort and Spa from Sept. 21-24, 2010. I invited my older sister to tag along and we really enjoyed our 3 night stay there. I found it very convenient to stay at conference hotel. There must have been at least a half dozen conferences or trade shows going on at the same time. That conference wing is gigantic!! The hotel rooms are spacious, especially the bathrooms,with double sinks, shower, and tub and the beds are soooooo comfortable. We enjoyed a panoramic view of Red Rock Mts. and the rest of Summerlin from our room and directly below was an enormous swimming pool. Red Rock R & S offers that luxurious mega hotel feel away from The Strip. There are several restaurants, a food court, and two Starbucks to service your appetite. We dined at The Feast Buffet and The Grande Cafe. Both were not very impressive, though reasonably priced. Conveniently located across the street is a strip mall with various restaurants (The Olive Garden and BJ's Brew Pub). RRR&S's casino is huge and offers an array of slots and other games to entertain you. I sure had fun playing those crazy penny machines. There's even a game room for kids, making it perfect for family vacations as well. If you drive to Vegas or rent a car, it really isn't that far from The Strip. Summerlin is quite an impressive new community, with so many big stores and restaurants lining Charleston Blvd. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet spot to relax”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Red Rock Resort for a business convention. The Red Rock is 12 miles from the Strip just off the 215 on Charleston Blvd. Our room this time had a wonderful of the strip off in the distance. It had two queen size beds. The bathroom had a bath tub with a TV, a separate shower that was big enough to towel off without touching the walls, a separate room for the toilet, and two sinks. The rooms were very quiet as we never heard any noises from neighboring rooms. The resort has a spa and a large fitness center that includes a lap pool (which is a quiet place to relax). The gym has rows of treadmills, ellipticals, and weight machines. The only negative thing I could say about the gym is that it did not open until 6:00 am. For someone from the east coast who is getting up at 4:00 am, it would have been nice to go down and work out before breakfast and our meetings. I had to go outside for a run. There are several restaurants located in the casino including a Yard House (114 different beers on tap), T-Bones Chop House, an Italian place, Japanese place, buffet, and food court. They have the famous Red Rock Bowling Center where the professionals come to play each year. There is a large cinema with 16 screens. They offer free shuttles to the airport and the strip. They leave every two hours, but the one to the airport does not start until 7:00 am, so you have to get a cab for an early morning flight. The resort is very nice and a quiet spot to relax if that is what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: BlondeMaggie
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Resort and Spa is fantastic. The staff were so helpful, polite, friendly and there is enough staff! How rare this is! The Good: There are staff manning the front doors who make sure you never have to do this yourself, a conciedrge desk with someone helful actually there, a bell desk where they will store your luggage, for free, for as many hours as you need. If you are wandering about the hotel looking lost or confused one of the staff will come up to you and ask if you need assistance. Without fail, the staff as helpful, polite, friendly and everyone greeted you with a smile and looked you right in the eye. Yes, even the gift shop staff was polite and helpful. I was very impressed. Shuttles: Red Rock is off the strip. Guests can take the free shuttle from the airport. There are also shuttles to take you to the strip and the outlet malls. The rooms: spacious, immaculately clean every day, the best hotel bed I have ever slept in. Very little hallway noise and no noise from your neighbours. The casino is extremely clean, new and has such good venting that even on Saturday night which was extremely busy, there was virtually never a smell of cigarette or cigar smoke. We really enjoyed playing the machines, even tho we are not big gamblers. There is also an Imax movie theatre, bowling alley, several clubs, Starbucks and a food court in the casino area. The food: always fresh and available. The buffet is huge and has wide variety of food. We did not try the other restaurants. Entertainment: Don Henley played the Saturday of our trip. Sadly, I waited too long to try to order tickets and it was sold out. Other guests told us it was a fantastic show. There are some pretty big names coming to perform here. We did not see the other on site shows . Conference areas: the staff here is just as wonderful as the rest of the hotel. The rooms were always perfectly set up with tablecloths, fresh icewater etc. This is no small feat as there were 500 attendees and we had many break out sessions during the day. Our group had two cocktail parties in the conference area and once again, the staff outdid themselves. The bartenders were very fast and really fun. The bad: hmmm.....there isn't anything to say! I really had a great time and will go back for sure. Red Rock is a place where singles could go solo and not feel awkward or out of place.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: milly123Nice
Reviews.Content: Fantastic is the first word that comes to mind to sum up this hotel! We travelled with a teenager and 2 kids of 5 and 10 years and this was our favourite stop of our US trip. We tok 2 rooms: a strip view twin with 2 queens that was very spacious and a signature suite that was far beyond what we were expecting - extremely spacious, modern, classy, clean etc. Would advice taking a strip view room as the red rock views are not that spectacular and are more expensive. Pool area is fantastic although would advice liking lively music to appreciate it especially at a weekend. Great choice of restaurents including a buffet one that is extremely good value for money. We had a car and so didn't use the shuttle service and anjoyed being off the stip that we found far too busy and impersonal. We would love to cme back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: aneczka
Reviews.Content: Me and my spouse stayed at Red Rock over the Labor Day Weekend. We checked in very early on Friday and was surprised to get a room this early and also get upgraded to a canyon view room on 15th floor. The rooms are beautiful, modern, spacious and very private/quiet and a very comfortable mattress, I wish I can take the mattress home with me . Rooms had all the things you need - enough towels, toiletries, rope, hair dryer and ironing equipment and safe in the closet. Hotel is also beautiful, lots of amenities including spa services which yes they are free to hotel guests (massages, hair and nail services are extra) and it's not stated anywhere, even when the clerk at check-in invited me to enjoy the spa, she didn't mention it, we https://tonic.tripadvisor.com/SavedPhotos-g45963-d596543-i27528128%2C27528129%2C27528130%2C27528131%2C27528132%2C27528133%2C27528134%2C27528135%2C27528137-w1-Red_Rock_Casino_Resort_Spa-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#27528128only found out as our friends knew about it from previous visits to this resort.
