At the spa you can relax in the sauna, steam room and shower with all the toiletries needed including shaving equipment, hair dryers, hair products and etc., worth checking it out. There is room service, which we didn't use but we asked to make up room only once, and got a very nice thank you note for the tip we left. There are many food establishment to choose from on the grounds of the hotel, we ate breakfast at the Grand Cafe - it was ok, and had lunch at the buffet which was good, all the other times we ate off the hotel grounds. The pool area is very nice, they are many areas to choose from, big pool and many small ones. The drinks were kind of expensive at the pool bar, but you're on vacation - live a little! We used valet for parking our rental, it's free but a tip is appreciated and they were quick and efficient. Overall amazing stay and a view of the canyon was priceless, I definitely will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for hidden Spa Charges”
Reviews.Author: VegasLoverss
Reviews.Content: There was $100 special for a 50 minute massage and when I went to sign up the massage therapist behind the desk said she can focus on sore areas if I wanted to. I said sure. When I was finished, i was charged $160. This was a total surprise and this kind of subversive way to increase spa charges is totally unacceptable!!! I would not recommend the Spa and be leery of any Spa specials.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda like Vegas, but family friendly”
Reviews.Author: FamFieldTrips
Reviews.Content: Tagged along with hubby while he was attending conference. Location was nice and out of the way in more residential area than the strip. I walked to a real grocery store and we went to restaurants that didn't have long wait times. The resort was nice -- clean, nice food options, good service, relaxing pool area. Buffet restaurant was amazing and affordable. We took advantage of the free shuttle to the strip and got our fill of casinos and people-watching, then came back to a relax. This is the one hotel we would bring our children and not have to worry about what they would see.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I just got back from our...”
Reviews.Author: hmhrn2001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our trip to Las Vegas and we had a blast. We stayed at the Red Rock Resort for the first time and we will be back! Everyone who worked there was beyond helpful and friendly. I don't have one bad thing to say about this place. We have stayed at Hotels on the strip like Treasure Island, Bellagio, and Mandalay Bay and we will never go back to these hotels especially after our stay at Red Rock. Our son loved Kids Quest and it gave us a little time to be by ourselves on our Anniversary. Excellent staff, restaurants, rooms, casino, and pools. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AveryHudson
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with a GREAT pool, beautiful rooms, nice spa and friendly casino. Best of all it is far away from the chaos of the strip. Having booked my stay on the strip, we swtiched to Red Rock after 3 nights of nothing but crowds and this hotel saved our vacation! We will DEFINITELY be back and soon. Can't rave enough about this place - it is what Vegas USED to be!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mazeandblue
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock casino is off the strip in the town of Summerlin. It's a beautiful hotel. It looks like it belongs on the strip. It's quiet there. The inside is great, with one of the nicest keno lounges in town. The staff is nice and helpful. Even though I have yet to stay there I visit there a few hours a day on my vacation. The Sports book is huge. By the way I would stack their buffet up against any big time strip resort.

Reviews.Title: “Married at the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: RoadHogCharlestonSC
Reviews.Content: We booked a Signature Suite for our ceremony and a King room for the other nights. The staff could not have been more accommodating. The food and the cake were excellent as well as the service. This is a great location, especially if you are not into the craziness of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: rhondab65
Reviews.Content: Picked Red Rock because it's of the strip and better for families with impressionable kids. From the moment we got there to the time we left, we experienced nothing but incredible service. We travel "alot" and usually stay in 4 to 5 star resorts. This exceeded our expectations. There were a lot of pools, so none of them were very crowded. A lot of kids, but there was a wonderful spa pool for adults only, if that is what you're looking for. Bowling alley, arcade, movies, casino, and restaurants right there at the resort. Can't say enough good things. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Clarieberry
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel!!! It is the perfect spot for a family vacation. It has everything you need, so there is no need to leave. The cabana rental at the pool is top notch and totally worth it. I think the o Lu negative reviews are from people who wanted to see the strip. I have no desire for my 2-year-old to see what the strip has to offer. They even have child are available. It is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Option Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: viajera725
Reviews.Content: This is a good option if you want to stay away from the chaos of the Strip but still have plenty to do. The rooms have really comfortable beds and great views. The pool and spa are beautiful. Be warned that it is a 15-20 min. cab ride to the Strip, though, so if you plan to do a lot of trips back and forth to the Strip, rather than just a night or two, it may not be conducive to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Nary a red rock to be seen - stay in Las Vegas instead”
Reviews.Author: Gwen88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thinking, judging from the photos on their website, it was against the red rocks and out of town. Well, it was way out of town but my view was of a parking lot and the red rocks were miles away. When we changed rooms, a fan we brought disappeared and housekeeping never found it. The pool closed very early although it was fun for the kids and had shade. We booked a horseback riding breakfast which was disappointing as it was not at the property at all. We were driven to a place and fed breakfast in a restaurant then taken on a short, slow trail ride and forced to stay until after noon to see a western show. The driver and the wranglers and guides hit you hard for tips. Do your riding elsewhere and skip this hotel altogether.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is amazing”
Reviews.Author: CatfromBuffalo
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love Red Rock. The pool is amazing, the rooms are great and the choices of restaurants is the cherry on top. Drinks pricey by the pool, but they do have water if you want. I look forward to the Eggs Benedict from the Cafe every time I go. Looking forward to my next trip there. The spa is out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort is Posh – but beware of Lil Miss Tropical Smoothie”
Reviews.Author: Faxgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trade show during April 2009. It’s swanky, modern with all of the latest high-tech features. The location is quite far from the main Vegas strip, but that may be part of its appeal for many. This resort is like an indoor city of its own. Be sure to pack some cute walking shoes – walking from your room to the conference center and the casino can be a real workout. You may want to request a room near the elevator. The casino is massive and very impressive. I was there for business - wish I had more time to stay and play. The slot machines are a favorite. I even won some fast cash. This casino is nearly as packed as those on the main strip. It was nice to avoid all of the typical casino cigarette smoke. The outdoor pool was very inviting. If only I had more time to relax. The resort has several restaurants. The Italian restaurant was phenomenal! I’d go back just for the dining experience alone. There are several other nice restaurants too - a steak house, Mexican restaurant, all-American diner, a buffet and others. They have a huge food court – Sbarro Pizza, Ben & Jerry’s, Stabucks, Tropical Smoothie, etc. During my 4 day stay, I became a loyal customer of Tropical Smoothie. But on the 4th day, my breakfast turned sour. Here’s what happened… Each morning, I ordered a toasted bagel with cream cheese. The same young woman waited on me. Half way through my breakfast, I ran out of cream cheese – so I requested an extra packet. The same woman obliged my request without hesitation. On my last day, I was so pleased with her customer service that I actually planned to tip her. Rarely (almost never) do I tip a fast food counter employee. Suddenly, little Miss Tropical Smoothie did something that warranted me canceling her tip. You’ll never believe what happened next… So, I placed my standard order for a bagel w/ cream cheese. This time, I requested extra cream cheese in advance. She smiled in acknowledgment. I felt like a “Tropical Smoothie regular.” But, the total on the cash register was different this time – it was much more expensive than my previous breakfast orders. I immediately noticed and pointed this out. It must be an honest mistake. Her explanation was cheerful and matter of fact -- they charge for extra cream cheese. Ok, well that’s no big deal – it can’t be much. I reached for my wallet to settle up for the extra charge – I then realized it will cost over $3.00 more. She then explained that she had to charge me for the previous 3 days of extra cream cheese. I laughed, but this was no joke. I didn’t understand why she had not made this clear during my previous visits. The “extra” charge wasn’t even listed on their menu, nor had she bothered to tell me it normally costs a buck extra. I was led to believe it was “complimentary.” I was so dumbfounded by her sneaky back-log-tally-tactic for extra cream cheese. At the time, I didn’t have time to debate the extra charge as I was checking out that day and headed to the airport. I wonder if Lil Miss Tropical Smoothie ever remembered that she forgot to charge me for a 4th packet of cream cheese. I actually ordered 4 bagels w/ extra cream cheese during my Red Rock Resort stay. Perhaps that extra packet of cream cheese was “on the house.” Of course I won’t let Lil Miss Tropical Smoothie’s shadiness interfere with my overall impression of Red Rock Resort. We had a beautiful posh room with a distant night view of the Vegas Strip. The bathroom was one of the most luxurious I have seen. It had double sinks, marble shower, private toilet closet, and a sleek flat screen TV above a roomy tub. This hotel inspired my husband to install a new TV in our bathroom at home. I highly recommend this hotel to others. I'm pretty sure cocktails are still complimentary while you play in the casino. Just be advised that you won't be able to score any free cream cheese at the food court. Good luck at Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conferences/competitions”
Reviews.Author: tripsmomma
Reviews.Content: Went with my daughters for a sports competition. We stayed 1 week. The hotel is nice. There are a few resturants and a foodcourt. There is a bowling ally and movie theater attached to hotel. The pool was nice too. The hotel room was very nice, the bed was so so in comfort. They do offer a shuttle to the strip a few times during the day. That is one of my few complaints. If the shuttle is full (approx 19 people) then you have no choice but to wait 2 hours for another shuttle or take a taxi (approx $39 plus tip one way). The last shuttle back is 9:40pm, it would be nice if they had one alittle later. Basically I wouldn't choose this hotel unless I was there for a conference, etc.. It is too far from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing... blew me away, and I work in the Hotel Business at a front desk”
Reviews.Author: cberry1224
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I work at the Boca Raton Resort and Club at the front desk and I've been in the industry for 7 years. That being said.... it's very easy to pick out the minor things, because you have that mentality. From start to finish, it was impeccable. Arrival experience was great. Valet greeted me with a warm welcome, 2 bellman offered me assistance, the door was opened for me with a smile, and the front desk looked genuinely happy to see me. At check-in I was informed by Angel that my room was not yet ready (I was quite early). She took my cell number, informed me that she would call me as soon as the room was ready, and directed me to the spa. The spa was amazing (as everything else in the hotel). They had full amenities in the spa, and after relaxing in the hot tub while enjoying complimentary ice cold bottled water, we were able to freshen up and head back out to the airport to pick up friends. On the way out, a bellman (Rick) gave us very clear and concise directions to the nearest liquor store. =) On the way back from the airport, we got a call to inform us our room was ready. The room blew me away. It was spotless, well coordinated, and had a breathtaking view. Throughout our entire stay, everyone we encountered was friendly and helpful. The casino had more than enough tables to accommodate everyone regardless of their gambling preference. I ate 3 times at the hotel. First night I ate at the buffet. It was good. 2nd night I ate at LBS (a burger joint). My burger was great, friendly service, and fun atmosphere. Next night I had dinner at Terra Rossa (Italian dining). Again, we had a very fun, friendly server. Despite the fact that we showed up with a party of 12 without reservations, they seated us rather quickly in a private room in the back. Food was great, promptly served, and fair priced. Used the concierge and front desk several times for directions, they were always helpful- especially Brett at the front desk. This hotel gets 5 thumbs up! I highly recommend it for group business, as they have the ability to accommodate large numbers, and provide a variety of activities and shows. It is a self sufficient resort and I found it hard to leave the hotel at night for the Strip. Thank you for the great stay and I hope to be back soon. -Rich

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: kymee1028
Reviews.Content: Pros - nice room, clean, nice pool Shuttle - limited to 14 people, doesn't run often enough ($40 each way for cab to strip) Nightclub advertised (Cherry) but closed for months Drink specials not as advertised $15 Refrigerator fees/per day Incidental expenses on checkout Spa is average

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nv180
Reviews.Content: You cannot get better a better deal and a 5 star hotel than Red Rock. Everything was perfect, from staff to pool. Would stay there anytime. We are locals and have been to almost every hotel and Red Rock empressed us to most so far. Well done!!! Pool drinks and food are expensive but worth it Our 2.5yr old had a blasssssst.........So did mommy and daddy.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock does not disappoint-overall very good property”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo95023
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a long weekend stay at this resort with my wife. We are frequent Las Vegas travelers for business and pleasure with more than 50++ stays in the area. This was the first time we decided to stay off the strip. The reason for our visit was to just get away, relax, gamble a bit and not have to deal with the typical Las Vegas crowd. We also wanted to experience life away from the lights and noise. Overall, the resort is well appointed. There are plenty of places to eat and enjoy music and night life. In addition, you don't feel too secluded as there are many restaurants off property within walking distance or just a short drive away. There is a large 16 screen cinema connected to the resort and a large bowling facility. We immediately noticed the hospitality. No stuffy Las Vegas concierges or wait staff.....everyone was very personable and friendly. The resort is very kid friendly and the main pool was loaded with kids between 10:30 am and about 3:00 pm when the pool thinned out a little for adults. There is an adults only area (Cabana Club) on the weekends, but this resort was certainly family friendly. Year after year, I have always been one to do anything to NOT take children to Las Vegas, but I can assure you that the reasons I choose to not expose my children to Las Vegas are all washed away at this resort....The place is well decorated and classy. The pool is great....the main pool has a large center fountain that everyone can enjoy. There are a variety of open seating options including in pool seats, round lounge beds and secluded lounge areas throughout. For eats, we visited T-Bones steak house....good meal and the prices are moderate. There is Italian, Spanish and other restaurants as well that all look great. The sports book is huge and I have never seen so many televisions and projection screens in my life! We visited the spa and I would say the ameneties were average. If you are looking for a luxury spa that includes the indulgences of the Wynn, Bellagio or Venetian, then pass.....but the treatments were good and the staff was again great. I have a couple small complaints - the gaming was sub par. Slot games, video poker and video Keno (one of my favorites) were all strange to me. I did not see many "main stream" games that you find at the bigger hotels in Las Vegas.....(Wheel of Fortune slots and others). That's ok, because I probably saved $250 bucks not gambling as a result. As I mentioned, we just returned......today and as of 6pm today (July 19, 2010) the resort was boasting a whopping 110 degrees.....Why do I bring this up? I think the hotel might have insufficient air conditioning for the climate. The room we stayed in would not cool to the frozen standards I have seen at other hotels, the elevators were all warm or very hot....seriously strange. Summary....overall, I have to say that I am planning a trip back to this property. I am sold that you can bring kids to Vegas and have fun without bombarding them with sex and hooker cards (if you go to Vegas often, you know what I mean). I plan to return, hit the pool, relax, probably go to another spa treatment and try some of the other eateries on property. I will take the family bowling near by, eat off property, drive the 15 extra minutes to the strip for an adult night and return relaxed. Thanks to the staff, hotel and Nevada for another gem in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “The UnVegas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jooksing
Reviews.Content: Firstly - it's a long way from the strip. Don't stay here if you plan to go back and forth from the strip. It is about a $40 cab ride. On the other hand, it was nice to be away from the hotel and still get the Vegas feel. The rooms are awesome and an amazing value. The food options at the hotel are above average. Getting on the tables is very easy because it is not near the strip. The lounges are awesome. The not so good - the service at this hotel is well, well, below Vegas standards. It has been almost 3 weeks and I am still waiting for the Manager to call me back about my hotel bill. They made a mistake at checkout and supposed to get back to me. Check in staff was slow and unresponsive. Restaurant wait staff was also poor. They got our food wrong and the service was very slow Best part of this stay? Room are an amazing value. It is a good conference hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rocks Your Socks Off!”
Reviews.Author: billabong00217
Reviews.Content: --The Best Hotel In Vegas (Off the Strip) So it is alittle out of the way from the strip, but all the craziness and overwhelming feeling you can get from being right in the action. The Red Rocks is a great place to unwind and at the same time have a great experience. The rooms are overall really clean and comfortable. They can be alittle smaller but the bathroom is amazing mini T.v's and beautifully decorated. They have gorgous views on both sides of the hotel. I always get Pool View becuase is it great!!! Speaking of the Pool it is awesome it can be alittle cold and closes faster then most hotels but for laying out in the sun its excellent. --Spa, Bowling, Movies, Fast Food, Upperclass Food, Night Club, and Arcade- Anything from a relaxing day at the spa to a Movie night with the family is what the Red Rocks can provide. It is amazing how many different choices you can experience from this ONE hotel. I would recommend this to anyone. :) --This hotel also gives you the option of the outdoors part of Nevada. Hiking, and climbing are the 2 things the Red Rocks can offer that not alot of other Vegas hotels can. Views are amazing and very cool to see.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaRandy
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock is a very nice hotel. The rooms are very modern and up to date. The bathroom was great. The beds were ok, not quite as good as similar hotels. The pool was excellent, however the pool closes early each night as do other casino hotels. The staff was professional, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to drive on vacation, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: newsanchor
Reviews.Content: I was not being sarcastic with that opening quote. I'm someone who LIKES to drive to get around on vacation, so I have no trouble at all with staying 20 minutes off the strip... In fact, I think it's one of the best things about Red Rock - It's away from the hordes of humanity, and I hope the hordes of humanity never ever discover Red Rock - If they do, they'll find a hotel that has an attractive and uncrowded casino, better and less expensive food choices, movie theaters and bowling alleys for the kids, affordable shopping in the neighborhood, and the nicest rooms I've ever seen in Las Vegas - and I've probably stayed at 15 different hotels on the strip! If I actually cared about nightlife (i.e. crowded clubs), that would probably be my biggest quibble about Red Rock. I don't think there are any of those... Which is just fine by me. I go to a casino to gamble, relax at a blackjack table, and enjoy a good meal. The buffet, by the way, is an outstanding value, whether you're having breakfast, lunch or dinner. Even if you're staying on the strip, take a ride 20 minutes west some time, and give Red Rock a visit. The next time you go to Vegas, you may find yourself staying out there... That's exactly what happened to us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wedding venue with BOWLING”
Reviews.Author: OldDogsTour
Reviews.Content: Our nephew got married here and we all had a great time, plus good discounts on our rooms. The wedding itself was tasteful and (dare I say) brief, set on a nice spacious balcony w/ gorgeous views to the SW. The bowling party after the ceremony was just terrific -- so much more fun than a boring reception! I enjoyed the whole resort experience -- spa, pool and yummy food too....been to Vegas many times, so didn't mind not being downtown or on the strip for this special trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative to Strip”
Reviews.Author: richnaples
Reviews.Content: Stay 3 nights and it was great. Staff was courteous and helpful. Rooms were clean, spacious and up to date. Bed was comfy. View was spectacular. Pool area is one of the best in Vegas. Fitness CT. was well equipped. Did the food court and buffet which were fine. The Yard House restaurant was excellent with a nice happy hour. Only negative was the background music which was annoying at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perks......but it is far from the strip!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmhartman
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Red Rock was good. I visited the hotel in 2007 and it still looks to be in the same great condition. There is an AMC theater on site and a bowling alley. We were there for my birthday with my brother and sister-in-law. When I booked I forgot it was SuperBowl weekend! It was not too crowded and there were plenty of specials. My biggest problem with the resort is the distance from the strip. It is an easy 30 minute drive and a $50 taxi ride. That can add up over the course of your stay. They have a shuttle, but as mentioned in other reviews it I not party friendly. If you need a great place to stay and relax in Vegas, without the strip, Red Rock is your place. Otherwise there are hotels on the strip that will work just as well.

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: atlantis300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 5 times now in last 6 years...what can I say the hotel is very well maintained and the rooms super clean ! I work in the industry and think this is a great hotel if you want a resort in Vegas...if you need to be by the strip DO NOT STAY HERE ! The pool is also one of the best in Vegas for kids....loved this place and will be back

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: rene_susanne
Reviews.Content: Probably the most expensive short term stay I ever had. Not worth the money. You get nickeled and dimed along the way. On top of a steep 150 dollars a night, you pay 23 dollars resort fee, child care which is implied to be part of the Hotel package is ~ 8 Dollars / child / hour, which adds quickly several hundred dollars to your bill. You only have a choice of a buffet, which is reasonable priced and "ok" or very high end restaurants, which run your tab easily beyond 100 Dollars for 2 people. You are at least 30 min from the strip, thus a rental car is required adding another 50 to 70 dollars a day. The free shuttle only goes every 2 hours and the last trip back is at 11 pm. Bars are closed in the evening due to lack of customers. Thus you need to go to the strip if you want to have a little fun. Pool is awesome and they hired very nice looking waitresses and life guards, probably as eye candy for the bored dad watching his children at the pool. Overall you get much better deals for your money that you will spend there.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: RJ3301
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock during the last week of May for a conference and I must say that I was a bit apprehensive after reading some of the reviews posted here. First, I would recommend renting a car from the airport instead of paying $50 each way for a taxi. I had a rental for an entire week that totaled $104 with tax. The property itself is well maintained and is near shopping, restaurants, grocery stores, etc. Parking is plentiful and it is a short walk from the garage to the hotel. Definitely a benefit over the strip hotels. The casino is definitely one that caters to the locals and it is not too crowded. There are many choices for dining, a movie theater and a bowling alley which makes it a nice place for those traveling with family. I have only some a minor issue with Red Rock. I booked my room back in November 09 and specifically requested a canyon view room. I confirmed this reservation a week before leaving and all was fine. On arrival and after checking in I went to my 18th floor room and found a lovely view of the……Las Vegas strip. The woman at the front desk who checked us in was not very friendly and had a bit of an attitude so I assume this was due to her apathy or inattentiveness. I called the front desk and was told that they must be out of canyon view rooms and that was why I was moved to a strip facing room. The attendant went on to tell me that they did not have any canyon rooms when I made my reservation but could move me to a one if I wanted to move. ???? This didn’t make any sense to me and I elected to stay where I was. Not a big deal. The room had a great view of the strip. Red Rock has a great spa, pool and work out room. We drove to the strip a couple of nights and it was a breeze to get back and forth. The girls at the spa, which is first class, were very nice and helpful as were those at the concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but distant from the rest of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: First off, let me state that I am not a Vegas gambler; I was in town for a conference. The hotel is nicely appointed with attractive and comfortable rooms, free wireless internet inside and outside at the pools, good restaurant choices along with a food court, on site bowling and a multiplex cinema. Some downers-- a half hour wait to check in, and a far distance from the Strip and the Airport ($30 and $60 cab rides respectively). The hotel does have a free shuttle to both destinations but the scheduled times are limited. All of the restaurants are beside the casino with smoke drifting in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: deeann622
Reviews.Content: I used the car service that is contracted with Red Rock. My driver was pleasant and was waiting for me at baggage claim. Once I arrived to the hotel it was such a beautiful property and lobby. The check in line went by fast and the front desk was efficient and offered bottled water. I was happy that I did not have to have a long walk to the elevators as most Vegas hotels/casinos are designed. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was luxurious. The beds are comfortable. The entrance to the rooms are away from the main hall to minimize the noise level. I slept well. A few plumbing problems: toilet kept running, a part of the plumbing from the tub came off. Housekeeping did not seem on top of it. Minor things like not making it to my room to freshen it up during the day, and yes the notice was on. Dirty cups left a couple of days in the hallway. I did get a chance to use spa/fitness center. The spa facility is beautiful. However, I think that the fitness room is just okay. Again minor things, noise levels while you are getting a massage was a bit annoying. The constant question of "are you a local?" As if it meant a code for something, perhaps better service. There are a million other questions to ask, but I was asked about 5 times from 5 different staff members. I just thought it was a bit much. Not a big deal. Massage was great. Shuttle service was reliable and is a great amenity. All in all, I would stay here again. All of the little hiccups are not enough to keep me away. Though, I hope that management will address the issues I encountered. Its a great property to stay off the strip. They offer many amenities that other resorts offer. Nearby restaurants I enjoyed: Kona Grill, Vintner's Grill and Rosemary's. I did see a shopping center across the street with a grocery store, but did not need it. However, its nice to know that its across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort is declining...used to be our favorite.”
Reviews.Author: msylee22
Reviews.Content: I used to be a huge fan of Red Rock Resort and Casino, stayed there several times in the last year. We go to Vegas maybe 6 times a year and Red Rock has always been our favorite because of the beautiful rooms, wonderful spa and proximity to the Red Rock Canyon. On the positive side: the bathrooms each have a TV over the bathtub, marble bathrooms, spacious rooms, comfy beds, far from the strip traffic jams, and hotel guests are welcome to use the spa and fitness center. Red Rock, I was more than a little disappointed this last weekend. I had requested 2 beds and when I got there, we were stuck with either a King only or 2 queens in a handicap room. Now I've stayed in a handicapped room before and it was no fun, the shower curtain had mildew on it, so we had to opt for the single bed option. Nobody offered an alternative, like an upgrade. When we got up to the room, the shampoo bottle was already half empty!!! And there was soap grime on the conditioner bottle, so obviously your housekeeper did not bother to change it. Now, this gave me the willies, because obviously, whoever cleaned the room, did not pay attention to cleanliness and I spent the whole weekend not wanting to step into the shower. The next day, I went to the pool and was stopped even though I had a card key, they wanted a wristband and said it should've been in my room. What? So, he said, go to the lobby and get one. I went to the lobby, waited, and the front desk lady asks me suspiciously, didn't the person who checked you in give you one? No, i answered. Well, then we need to see your ID and room key. Now, what if i didn't have my ID on me? I would've had to backtrack again to get that. Luckily I did. And what's with the third degree? I'm a guest, should not be treated like a suspect. I decided at this time to tell her about the half empty shampoo bottle, she then proceeded to call housekeeping to send another one up for me right then. I told her not to bother my roommate, who was sleeping. She ignored me and kept calling housekeeping. When she hung up, i had to ask her again firmly to cancel that request. Then i decided to visit the spa and there was mold on the fruit!!! Ugh! I used to love coming to Red Rock, but since I've been 1. treated like a teenager, 2. not listened to, 3. was not given wristbands at check-in, 4. experienced poor room toiletries, and 5. saw moldy fruity, I am very suspicious of another experience there and probably won't go again unless they comp me.

Reviews.Title: “Don't dwell on Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Diabloshrmp
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed three nights here during the first week of June. The first thing we noticed is it's distance from the strip (around 25 minutes). This can be a negative if you are frequently making trips to and from the strip but we found it kind of peaceful being on the outskirts of the city and Red Rock Canyon. The quality of the hotel and it's amenities is absolutely superior and excellent in every way. Rooms are comfortable and quiet with an impressive bathroom that includes a soaking tub and glass shower. Yes the hotel is large lengthwise and it can be a bit of a walk if you are placed on the opposite end. Service was fine as we did not have any negative encounters and everyone seemed genuinely nice. Recommendations: Definitely go for a hike or drive in Red Rock Canyon, it is so close. Tbones steakhouse was a great restaurant albeit pretty expensive. Try a Capriotti's sandwich. Try out Hash Hash A Go Go for breakfast which is nearby the hotel on Sahara.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; excellent rooms; front desk staff not very helpful..”
Reviews.Author: pedzsw
Reviews.Content: hotel room was incredible; the red rocks view was disappointing for the price; mainly we had parking lot and poor view with some hills in distance. Bathroom was incredible. Tub was deep and amazing as was shower; spa services were awesome too. Front desk staff were very slow and not friendly and seemed to really not like their jobs if you understand my meaning. We arrived after a 5 hour trip from Grand Canyon and had to wait for 2 more hours before our room was even ready! this was after check in time!!! then they added some charges on our bill that had to be addressed and corrected before we left!!!anyway, very pretty hotel and don't care for Las Vegas generally so this was much classier than places on the strip!

Reviews.Title: “The spa is where it's at...”
Reviews.Author: artemiss1977
Reviews.Content: We got married in Las Vegas, and this was our primary digs. (spent our wedding night at the Nugget's new Rush tower) We paid significantly more than some of our travel companions who got last minute deals on the Strip, and handsomely for a cab back out the next day, but several things made it worth it. 1) the spa. I cannot say it enough, the spa amenities alone are worth the resort fee. A decent gym, nice lap pool, hot tub, steam room, sauna, tea, fruit, water, use of a robe, slippers and nice toiletries are all included, gratis. Also available by appointment are massages and treatments, which while pricey,if the massage I had was any example of typical quality, are WONDERFUL. The facility is really nice, really clean, and have soothing pipe/flute nature-y music piped in. There are magazines to browse in the sitting areas as well as cold towels and water on ice outside of the steamroom/saunas. The lighting is muted, with red and blue accent-lights, and there are clean towels everywhere you turn. 2) The staff was beyond helpful, sending housekeeping up at 11pm to get pants that needed hemmed last minute for the next day, and providing an in-room fridge ($15 a day..grr) within a few minutes of our request. I don't know what happened that made other people review the staff poorly, our experiences were quite the opposite. (Well, aside from one unhelpful pool "guard" who couldn't just tell me where the darn potties were, I didn't want a tour that he couldn't finish, when pointing would have sufficed.) 3) being off the Strip has it's bonuses. It's a straight shot down Charleston to either the Strip by the Strat or Red Rock Canyon if you have a car. We ate lots of BK breakfast wraps because there is one in the Plaza right across the street, as well as a McD's, Albertson's and a CVS. After trying to get out of the Venetian on a Saturday night, and seeing $20 breakfast buffets this is a good thing to us. 4) The canyon view is AMAZING. As is the pool. Oh, and the food court wasn't overpriced at all..it was your typical food-court prices. And the Fatburger is open 24 hrs, which comes in handy when you need a 2 am post gambling/drinking protein-fix. The bad? It wasn't cheap. Seriously, a Coors Light in a can is the same price as your top-shelf margarita elsewhere in the world. Best to just get the dang pina colada in a pineapple and expect to pay out the nose. (it really isn't that much more..) It's way the heck off of the Strip. The bathroom and shower area doesn't have a vent..not bad so much as just weird.

Reviews.Title: “General Manager M.I.A.”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyUSA
Reviews.Content: I booked our rooms without checking TripAdvisor and after I saw the terrible reviews I tried to call the general manager to find out how they were dealing with the issues. The receptionist said she could not give out his number or email. Instead she connected me with his secretary's voice mail. I left a message but never received a return call. Upon arrival I saw that the welcome packet contained a form letter from the general manager saying that guests should contact him if they need anything. Well, I left another message but never heard back. When I made my reservation I requested two canton view rooms close together. I was told at check-in that they didn't accomodate my request would move us the next day after some people had checked out. They never did. So we had one room on the 3rd floor and one on the 12th. Like most hotels in Vegas the music is inescapable. I hate music in the elevators and in the parking garage! The room was fine. I took the reviews seriously and never ate, drank or gambled at the hotel. The rate was very inexpensive and based on that, I would recommend Red Rock as an affordable place to sleep. But beware, the general manager doesn't seem to exist, so if you have questions or concerns there's no one to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Very Overrated, Extremely Low Quality People and Experience”
Reviews.Author: spir9716
Reviews.Content: From the poolside service, to the business center, to the location, the entire Red Rock facility was a huge letdown. Service overall was terrible, with some exception, and the location of the facility leaves you effectively stranded from the rest of the city without an over-the-top cab fare, or through using the shuttle at its inconveniently scheduled times. The hotel was well maintained, and on the surface appeared to be impeccable. But, at it's core, the Red Rock was sorely lacking in nearly all areas and grossly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good convention hotel far off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short business trip and a convention held here. The hotel's rooms are very nicely adorned and roomy. Another perk is the free shuttle to the Strip and to Fashion Boulevard - unfortunately, it was a long ride - at least 1/2 hour. Did not use the pool, but the grounds looked beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: LifeOnD-Go
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to celebrate our 12th anniversary in Las Vegas. A big event in Vegas prevented us from booking a more local room so we decided on the Red Rock. Our stay was very pleasant. The rooms are very nice but the deserve honorable mention. They are soooo comfortable. We are normally early morning risers, but we slept in until 9:30am. We would've slept in longer but we wanted to enjoy the pool. And this is my only gripe about the Red Rock. My wife bought coffee and bagels at the Starbucks that is adjacent to the lobby to enjoy poolside. My wife was told by the person guarding the pool entrance that no outside drinks or food was allowed. Later on, we noticed that peoples bags were even being checked. That's carrying a bit far in my opinion. However, overall it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and a Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CCParrot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (in our 40's) stayed at Red Rock along with our 3 yo dd for 4 nights.I'd like to say that I was concerned at first because of the recent reviews being so negative. I almost switched hotels at the last minute. Don't listen to those reviews! Probably lost alot of money in the casino or something (which I did but that's my fault). Red Rock Hotel and Casino was great! We rented a car, quick and easy at Enterprise even using a debit card.Arrived at the hotel and valet parked. Great service! Check in was easy and painless. Asked them to remove all the snacks that I had read about because I was concerned with a 3 yo costing me quite a bit if she got ahold of them. No problem, it was taken care of within a half hour. Room-Beautiful. Nice view of strip. Clean and comfy. I miss the bathroom already it was grand! Marble,counter /w double sinks seperate tub and shower and a tv which we didnt try but the 3 yo thought that was really cool. Our room was by the elevators and it was suprisingly quiet. Pool-Wow! DH said that this was the best part especially how pretty all the girls where that worked there lol. I knew there was a reason why he insisted on giving me a break daily and took our dd to the pool. Seriously though, he was not searched and he was not hounded to buy drinks like other reviews said. Casino- Tight, tight, tight. They all are though. That's how they build the fancy hotels in Vegas so dont expect to win a new car or thousands of dollars. I spent $800 and that was $300 over what I budgeted. Will have a little more control next time and leave the bank card with dh lol. DH played texas holdem the whole vacation and he had a great time. Dining- The buffet twice, good food and well priced. Pleasantly suprised that they had fried okra at breakfast. I am from Florida and you never see that here. I love it! Ate at the cafe breakfast 2 days and dinner 2 days including mother's day which was delicious. KidsQuest- I can't say enough. My 3 yo hates daycare, refused to go to kids club on carnival cruises the 3x we took her because she said they where mean. Kids Quest, my dd wanted to stay there forever! One day we left her while we had a peaceful lunch and when we picked her up she hugged me and yelled "this is the best vacation ever". Wow, if they got that out of her they earn big kudo's from us. Sightseeing-Hard to do with a 3 yo but we went to Red Rock Canyon (which was very close) and took lots of pic and did the scenic drive which was about 14 miles. We drove down the strip and we where going to stop and see the tiger show but our dd fell asleep on the car ride. It was still nice to drive down the strip and see some of the sights. I would like to thank Red Rock for a wonderful vacation. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....its that good”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack_247
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place, Great vibe and fantastic views. The buffet is fab and so so cheap more great food for less $. The pool area is superb plenty of pools and two large hot tubs. The beds at red rock are just awsome and so very comfy, you need to try em. Cant wait to get back across the pond to Vegas and Red rock.

Reviews.Title: “happy surprise”
Reviews.Author: teinegirl
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas to visit our son and his family. We usually stay on the strip but decided to stay closer to their home. We traveled with our daughter and two grandchildren (11 and 14) and had a two-room suite. I was a bit concerned that we had made a mistake after reading some of the negative reviews on trip advisor but our reservations had been made, the price was very reasonable and the set up was good for our family What a happy surprise! The staff were very helpful and polite. Service was excellent. Special kudos to Nicolle at the pool and Kelley a server in the buffet. Speaking of buffets...I usually avoid them but our grandson wanted to go and it is by far the best and most reasonable in Las Vegas. The beds are very comfortable, the bathrooms lovely, rooms are very clean and comfortable. We plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelertraveler93
Reviews.Content: Chose this resort based on other reviews. Staying here was a big mistake. Here are my reasons. 1) We called one week ahead to insure we could get a refrigerator in our room for my wife's medicines which must be kept cold. We were told that a refrigerator would be supplied at an extra cost - no problem. When we arrived no refrigerator and we could not get one. Only after two days of constant calls to the desk a refrigerator was supplied. 2) The pool closes at 5:00 PM Go figure. We were told that the pool was heated. Not true. Pool temperatures in the 60F degree range. 3) The pool area whirlpool tubs were O.O.C. We like heated whirlpools, but both were down. After two days they got one working but it was not heated. cold, cold cold. The pool area manager was very apologetic however. 4) They do not allow you to bring your own drinks or snacks to the pool area. Two frozen margaritas were $35.82. And then they wanted a tip! They actually inspect your hand bags before you are allowed in the pool area. Totally humiliating. 5) Unsavory people in the Grand Cafe. This is an incident I could not believe. We went for breakfast and there were two "boyz from the hood" types sitting in a both mocking some of the resorts older guests. Finally, an older man whose wife the two punks were making fun of got angry and confronted the two punks. The punks threatened the older man and the waitress made the two punks move to a table in the back of the Grand Cafe - not leave just move. We asked the waitress about the incident, and she said the two punks worked for the Red Rock as night shift bartenders. Incredible. When we asked the front desk why this was allowed to go on they said they did not believe us. Even though we gave them the name of the waitress. the time the incident happened and a full description of the punks. They did not even check it out. 6) If you do make the mistake of staying here keep in mind this resort is thirty minutes from the strip. The resort has shuttle service, but the last shuttle is at 9:20 PM just when the strip starts getting exciting. If you stay later it is an $80.00 cab ride if you can get a cab. 7) The restaurants are extremely expensive, but the food in mediocre. Not bad just mediocre. Not worth the price. The Olive Garden across the street had better food at half the price. 8) There is a $25.00 dollar per day resort fee. God knows what this is for; maybe just to breath the air. 9) I would never stay here again. You can hear the Casino all night in your room so if you are alight sleeper you will lose sleep. 10) Stay somewhere else. I do not like writing reviews like this.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort outdoes them all.”
Reviews.Author: margiesuecont
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo and then went out of downtown to the Red Rock Resort. Wish we had spent the entire 2 weeks there. I am telling you everything was perfect.....the room, the service, the personnel, the food, the spa (excellent) and having a movie theatre -wow. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Not a positive experience!!”
Reviews.Author: dan3266
Reviews.Content: Once you walk thru the "red doors" the negative energy begins. The price of the rooms far exceeds the customer service. You can also call the "A3" special button they offer on the phone - but expect to be transferred several times and/or put on hold. I tried the "A3" three times throughtout my stay with no results. The bed was marginal. Room was nice and clean. Definately stayed in nicer/comfortable hotels for much less money. Casino seemed to be a ghost town. Never could seem to find any customer friendly staff, When I booked my rooms I choose the MVP package which offered $200 bonus hotel dollars for each room. Caution - Not all places in hotel accepts the MVP package. Nor does the Red Rock automatically deduct it from your bill. You have to ask for the deduction at check-out. Bad Management! The free shuttle to the airport seems limited - I had to use a cab at the cost of $53 for a single person. Also, hope you enjoy a long walk down hallways. The best feeling was of the trip was walking out of those "Red Doors"!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to splurge and relax!!”
Reviews.Author: pacislander81
Reviews.Content: I wanted 3 things for my birthday this year. Hiking, pool time, and amazing service. I got ALL of these at Red Rock Resert & Casino. The Canyon View King room was spacious and clean. We agreed it was the most comfortable bed in a hotel EVER. The service was always excellent. The concierge provided us with maps and directions and local information. The restaurants are a bit overpriced, but I expected and planned for this and the food was very good. Visit the buffet. Worth it! The casino is a very nice size but the minimums do go up considerably after 10pm on most tables. The pool is large and the waitresses were friendly and quick (not to mention totally hot). If you want to do Vegas, but not deal with the craziness of the strip this is the place. Hiking in Red Rock Canyon is awesome in the month of April. My only complaint was the lack of entertainment. There are no shows here. Not even a live band in the evening at the bar. No night club. And the pool closes at 6pm. If you like bowling and gambling non-stop you are set. Families with children should also be pleased. But for me, I could have used some live entertainment or shopping. I will be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock --> Thumbs DOWN ... W A Y down”
Reviews.Author: MarkBeres
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is a total disappointment, and I give it a well-earned thumbs down. Without question, the reason for my harsh review is the service - it was so aweful as to be embarrasing. When it comes to a resort of this 'perceived' esteem, a traveller expects more. In that environment, service isn't "one of" the things travellers key in on - service is EVERYthing. The entire guest chain, from booking, arrival, checkin, interim service, in-room service, housekeeping, checkout, et. al., was down-the-line terrible. First, be very aware that the advertised "shuttle from the airport" is on THEIR schedule, not yours. Red Rock is NOT close to the McCarran airport - rather, it is a good 20-30 minute drive from the airport. So, at $75, a taxi is simply out of the question (unless money is no object). Think about it - the money you 'save' by staying off-the-strip is quickly piled back onto you when you consider just commute to and from the airport. A round trip by taxi is going to run you $150. So, if you don't take my advice and insist on staying at this place, you need to add that on to your budget. Unless you take their shuttle. If you do so, it runs at 6P, 8P & 9P. If you get into Vegas around 7P, you get to wait with the throngs of people trying to get to the Strip. A better option is to rent a car. A 3-day rental ran me $100 total, and I had the convenience of coming and going as I pleased. Trust me - you'll want to leave the hotel and go to the Strip, or to hike. More on this in a moment. Lastly on this, when I called the hotel to inquire about the shuttle (on my cellphone from the airport), the guy on the other end was rude, uncaring, unconcerned, and he pretty much gave me the impression of, "well, too bad, sucks to be you". That attitude - that arrogant, condescending attitude exhibited by this single person at the beginnning of my stay, was an attitude that runs through the entire staff at Red Rock Casino, Resort & Spa. I am not embellishing for effect - the service here is THAT bad. Once you arrive at Red Rock Resort, you immediately feel like you're in a prison. The check-in attendant will greet you with a smile, hand you a small bottle of water (which was a nice touch), then put $300 "pre charge" on your credit card and give you the rules. Pay attention - the in-room minibar drinks & snacks are "weight sensitive", and if you pick up a minibar item, you have 45-seconds to put it back or else "big brother" automatically charges you. This may seem like something small, but let me tell you - when you enter your room, the minibar is like kryptonite. You deliberately find yourself avoiding it, not looking at it, walking around it - whatever, to avoid being charged for a tiny bag of peanuts at $4.99/bag. "Big Brother" is everywhere in this place, and it is the CREEPIEST thing. They have an in-room button that you push to identify your room as "do not disturb". Be careful - it looks like a lightswitch, and it's easy to inadvertently hit it. I did this in fact, and the big brother central computer system monitors whether or not your button is pushed. So, my room wasn't cleaned. True - it was me who pushed this button and didn't realize it, but big brother verified this on the central Red Rock computer mainframe, just to make sure I wouldn't be "comp'd" unnecessarily for complaining about it. Folks, this place is watching you with a fine-tooth'd comb. It was just a discomfort to me, and downright creepy. Red Rocks' rooms are not iPod friendly. They have a nice Bose radio/CD player in the room, and I believe it has an Aux port, but I didn't use it. There is no docking station, however. The last thing I want to warn travellers about regarding Red Rocks is the prices. You simply need to brace yourself, but you will be stunned at what dining, drinking & playing here costs you. One Mojito drink in a plastic cup at the pool cost me $19. I am not kidding, either. The volume of the cup is probably a pint and no more, if that. The food is even more expensive. Hungry? How 'bout some chips n salsa! It's only gonna run you $12. How about a nice Chateau Briand at the T-Bones Chophouse? Can you say $99? A nice glass of red wine is gonna run you between $12 to $30. As a recommendation, I suggest you bring your own wine and enjoy it in your room. At the pool, a way to save some money is to buy a pitcher of Mojitos - it'll run you $50, but contains about 4 individual servings. So, at $19 per, you save about $26 by going with the pitcher. Finally, the service. Everywhere in this resort, the service was horrible. The only people I saw smiling were the pool staff outside, and I give them a thumbs-up. Not one single casino worker, nor a house staff, and especially NO ONE at arrival or certainly checkout smiled on time. I swear, the people at Motel 6 smile infinitely more than these folks. At checkout, upon my insistent and persistent complaining of the terrible service we received (for a different issue), the manager comp'd us a single in-room service and one day's resort fee. I'm not complaining - that was appreciated, but I thought it was a cop-out by the staff, since I made very clear that the service and experience we received at Red Rocks was abysmal and anything but sub-par. So, if you get terrible service (which is quite likely), don't expect the Red Rocks staff to stand behind their gurantees - they'll throw you a small bone and whisk you on your way. Red Rocks isn't all bad, and I have to give some credit to the Lbs burger joint (which is awesome) and the pool & pool staff. Red Rocks' pool is one of the most beautiful I have ever seen, and the pool staff was excellent. Red Rocks is a really beautiful resort, but there are a LOT of beautiful resorts in Las Vegas. What sets one place apart from its peers is UNQUESTIONABLY service, and in that department, Red Rocks is totally lacking and fails in all categories. After my experience here, I cannot recommend this place. For my Las Vegas trip, I would stay, play, dine and unwind elsewhere. Given the commute out to Summerlin, you save nothing by staying "off the Strip". And, given the terrible service at Red Rocks, you'll probably get treated better on the Strip, too. As an addendum - we did go hiking at the Red Rocks park. This was definitely a nice part of the trip, and Red Rocks is ideally-situated near this park (it's NOT within walking distance ... you'll need a car), which was a really nice thing. So, as far as location, my bad review is primarily focused on the cost of getting to and from Red Rocks Resort from the airport, given that their shuttle service is inconvenient and suits their needs, not the traveller's. But, once you're out there, if you do not take a hiking trip (or just a sight-seeing drive-thru) to the Red Rocks Park, you're really missing a great part of Las Vegas that's not well-known.

Reviews.Title: “The "other" Las Vegas - go to get OFF the strip”
Reviews.Author: lostinthesupermarket
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: I've stayed in Vegas many times for work-related conferences and always on the strip. The Red Rock was a welcome diversion. I had no idea that the Red Rock Canyon was so beautful. The hotel is close to the park which has great hiking, petroglyphs and rock climbing (there are plenty of easy rocks if you have running shoes). Our room had a view of the Canyon. If you want the strip - this is NOT your place. It is a serious 15 to 20 minute drive. AESTHETIC: The hotel has a modern, sleek design that is a little European but not cold. ROOM: Nice size room with comfy bed, nice view and huge bathroom. Separate tub and shower - both were huge. Robes and high end, lime-scented amenities were nice. Double sink. Big lighted closet. I noticed a few stains on fabrics (eeww). Don't EVEN think about picking up an item from the mini bar because it has an electronic sensor and if you remove an item for more than 30 seconds your room gets charged. This was the source of much amusement amongst meeting-goers who had picked up the "Love Kit...." RESTAURANTS: We ate twice at the sushi bar - very good. The food court was convenient for lunch between meetings. Starbucks. PARKING: Ample and free - but again, you've driven 20 minutes from the Airport and you're off the strip. POOL: Beautiful design - but it was too cold during our stay to enjoy. CONFERENCE FACILITY: Meeting rooms were very large, well-lit and had windows and a balcony to get some fresh air. Nice food at cocktail reception and breaks. A/V and HVAC good. I'd recommend the hotel for a business meeting/conference. CASINO: Well, I'm not a gambler and I get the sense that serious players don't hang here. The dealers were kind and instructive to a novice like me. Very friendly. I'd return to the Red Rock for another meeting or to get some sun in a non-vegasy environment.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at the Red Rock.”
Reviews.Author: REQSVC
Reviews.Content: - Hotel service was very bad. - It was as if they were always looking for a way to take more of your money. - Comment overheard from 2 hotel employees: "It's always easiest to overcharge the drunken nice guys." - No consistency in rules. It seemed everytime you returned to a service, there was alleged to be another policy in place. All "policies" were determined to make life easier on the service personnel and life less enjoyable for the guests. - If "policy" wan't quoted as the reason for not offerin an accommodation, the next most used excuse was that it was "Nevada state law." - For a large group the bar attempted to charge for 16 bottles of champagne when only 6 were consumed. - Hotel markets itself as "child friendly." The only activity allowed for children was swimming in the pool. All other activities, gym, yoga, etc.....excluded children up through late teens even with parent supervision - Just up the road, JW Marriott allows guests to bring food and beverages to pool side. Red Rock specifically prohibits it. They do bag security checks on guests attempting to access the pool. There are too many other nice places to stay in Las Vegas. Why stay at someplace where you are not made to feel welcomed?

Reviews.Title: “Disrespectful staff, management, and security”
Reviews.Author: Youngmm
Reviews.Content: "Would you recommend this hotel to a friend?" - not unless my friend slept with my wife. The staff at this hotel consisted of the most disrespectful group of people I have ever done business with. As a paying client I expect some level of service that doesn't involve getting kicked out of my hotel room while sleeping and then being charged for the night without reimbursement. I found myself paying $40 to wander the strip at 2am after having being told numerous times that if I don't stop trying to state my case that I would be fined $2000 for trespassing. No yelling was involved. I have never been so disrespected in my life. If you want to go to Vegas you should stay on the strip... why else would you go? The casino was trashy and despite the look in the pictures, it is not nearly as clean as it would appear. Please, please don't take the risk of staying at this establishment. Even though I am sure my experience is 1 of 100, nothing about this place is worth the risk. Stay at the Palms.

Reviews.Title: “not that tight”
Reviews.Author: bighitta11
Reviews.Content: Dissapointed with amenities, nightlife, and size of casino floor. Rooms were nice but too far from the strip to gain full Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: onlythebest-48
Reviews.Content: My partner and I chose Red Rock from our local straight friends suggestion (we are a gay couple). Red Rock is WAY off of the strip so if you are looking for strip hotel this is NOT the place. BUT...(I would call it upscale mid century modern) it is warm and BEAUTIFUL and a very upscale resort. The rooms are fantastic with a HUGE tub and large separate shower, robes included! The tub in our king room was the largest I have ever seen, with a flat screen TV and remote...we both fit comfortably while watching NASCAR...VERY NICE! As this is a LV Resort, the mini bar, movies and Room Service are not cheap but they are VERY NICE, great food on tables with flowers and a completely stocked mini bar with EVERYTHING and VERY upscale (beer, soda, water, Grey Goose, Patron, Crown, Juice, candy, etc.) . The perfect place for a quiet ROMANTIC, sexy couples get away...really perfect! Fifths of Vodka and Tequila in the room for us as well as martini glasses and a martini kit (jar of olives) and "love making kit"...LOVED IT! Even got a complete shaving kit and tooth care kit for free when I asked. Very comfortable bed and Bose radio with iPod dock. The food at the place was great from steaks, sushi to a great buffet...REALLY GREAT BUFFET, movies, bowling and every slot machine and table game around. And the pool...OMG...it is out of this world and HUGE. We splurged for a Cabana and it was 100% HIGH CLASS. Sexy servers come to you with drinks and food! LUVED IT...speedos would have made it perfect :) . They said they have European sun bathing at a separate pool but we did not check that one out...sorry to say :). And I had a massage at the spa which is breathtaking as well. Treated me like a KING! Great hot tub, steam, workout room, and a full salon where I had a hair cut. The staff were VERY NICE for such a large place. It seemed like it was B&B from the treatment we got. Of course not everything was perfect, but all in all it was really top notch! I am sure that this is different for everyone, but if you ask for something they really did deliver. Again,,, FAR FROM THE STRIP but a beautiful place for a couples get away...gay or straight! And that bath tub...nuf said!

Reviews.Title: “The whole family loved this place”
Reviews.Author: chrishan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our two children ages 7 and 5. We stayed at Red Rock Resort for 1 week. We all loved the place. The kids loved the pool and so did we. The rooms are big and the beds are comfortable. There is even a TV in the bathroom which the kids thought was so cool. They do have a mini bar and a fridge that is stocked with beverages so if you move something you will be charged for it. We just told our kids not to touch any of that stuff and they didn't. The casino worked out great for us because my husband and i both like to gamble so at the end of our very long days of sight seeing and doing all the kid friendly things, the kids had a chance to take a break from the parents for a couple of hours at their kidsquest. The kids loved it there. It's a lot of fun for them. They looked forward to kidsquest every night. The poker room was perfect for my husband and the casino table games and slot machines were perfect for me. Everyone in our family was happy with this hotel. If we were to come back to Las Vegas as a family we would stay at Red Rock. It's a bout 25 mins. from the strip but now that I have stayed off the strip, i don't think i would ever plan to stay on the strip again, It's a nice quiet area. We also had breakfast at he buffet for about 21.00 for our entire family everyday. We ate at the LBS Burger place and that was good. We ate at the Grand Cafe, nothing special just plain cafe food. We also tried the food court restaurants also. The kids had a blast at the bowling alley at Red Rock. They beat the parents at bowling. They also have an arcade too.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort - away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: sed
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant resort away from the Strip in Las Vegas. Relaxing, very moden and clean rooms, excellent service. Nice to be able to self-park without valet. We very much enjoyed our two night stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: bettinewburn
Reviews.Content: I had prepaid for the room through their website and when I checked out they told me about the hotel amenities charges of $27.99/day. They said this was for newspaper, use of exercise room, and WiFi (which says complimentary). I could care less about a newspaper, would have used my Verizon hookup for internet,except it would not work in the facility, and I have never been charged before for a gym in a hotel. The room was so dusty I could write my name on the desk and beside tables. I had stayed here once before and did not get hit with this charge. Guess they just lost another potential regular guest - I have family nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but”
Reviews.Author: cajas1
Reviews.Content: The good: value-spa(very nice and you have to pay for it so use it)-food choices-service-clean-modern-away from the strip if you want that-starbucks in lobby-kid friendly(newborn -12) teenagers would fare better on the strip( curfew 7pm for kids under 18 in entire resort unless accomp. by 21 or parent)-bowling lanes The bad: pool hours(horrible) close way too early and the water is too cold-takes forever to get hot water in the shower/bath-smoke smell in the halls from casino-the walls are paper thin(i am not sure about reference too sound absorbtion in another review i found quite the opposite)-no coffee in room-amenities could be better-15-20 min to strip min-slots seem a little tight- My wife and i would stay again just because of the spa and price. However I prefer the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great for the kids too!”
Reviews.Author: sdmamagaga
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Resort during spring break for the kids. There happened to be a soccer tournament nearby, so there were a lot of other kids too. The hotel was very nice, upscale even. The room wasn't bigger than most, but for some reason the way it was laid out and the decor made it look bigger. I did my HW and made sure we got a room close to the elevator, actually it was the first set of rooms after the elevator. We got adjoining rooms (traveled with 4 kids and a husband). The 3 big kids stayed in the 2 queens room, then my husband and I stayed with the baby in a crib. Plenty of room for all. I was a bit concerned when the front desk told me we were so close to the elevator, but there was absolutely no echoing in this hotel, it had great noise absorption. Another thing folks complained about was the sensor activated snack and drink display....no problem for us, we called housekeeping and requested they remove the whole thing. With a 2 year old we can only imagine the issues we would have with that. Food: loved the food court, everyone got what they wanted and the prices were the same as at home. No inflated price tags there. We did the buffet and paid twice as much as we did with the food court. Try Cappriato's (Deli) great sandwiches! Kidsquest: We loved it and so did the 2 year old, everytime we walked by it, he wanted to go in. They take 6 months to 12 year olds. It's like kids heaven in there. Bowling: fantastic bowling alley, great fun. Beds: so comfortable, didn't wake up the whole night, and my 2 year old slept till 8 or 9 each morning which he never does at home! Pool: Um, this wasn't so great. They only had 2 small pools heated. The other 4 or so pools were FREEZING. That really sucked. But the layout was nice and it would be nice to go back when the weather is warmer. SPA: Lovely, lovely, lovely. Take advantage of the $25 resort fee you're paying and hit the steam room, sauna and whirlpool. Just take your clothes, because they have everything you need down there. The steam room and saunas even had the greatest aromatherapy going on. We had a great time, there was something for everyone there. Just stay away from the slots, they are evil.....

Reviews.Title: “Great locals resort”
Reviews.Author: utsixpack
Reviews.Content: Stopped by and stayed at the Red Rock for two nights on a driving/hiking trip. The resort was fantastic. The room was excellent with a very comfortable bed and good insulation from outside noise. The batroom was very spacious with a double sink. The resort is very well planned out to service the locals. There are two parking garages. One attached to the casino for the gamblers and those coming to enjoy the bowling alley and movie theatres. The other parking garage is for the hotel. We made the mistake of parking at the casino garage when trying to check in to the hotal. Don't make the same same mistake. We saw several other people in the same predicament. I particurlay enjoyed the casual and laid back atmosphere. We happened to visit the MGM Grand for a show and were overwhelmed with the intense crowds. The food was great at the Cabo Mexican restaurant. There are a large number of restaurants and shopping options very close by. Check out the nearby Red Rock Park for hiking.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: KatzFamily
Reviews.Content: We were very apprehensive traveling to Las Vegas with an 8 year old and 5 year old but were so pleased with this resort. We were far enough North that it didn't even feel like we were near Las Vegas (actually only a 20 minute drive from the airport). We spent 4 days hiking in Red Rock Canyon, which is only 10 minutes away but from our Canyon view on the 18th floor it felt like it was just outside the window. The Summerlin area is very safe and offers great restuarants only a short drive from the resort. There are fantastic restaurants on property as well. Grand Cafe is terrific for breakfast while LBS is good for lunch. Definitely recommend this hotel if you are looking for an alternative to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Alternative to the strip”
Reviews.Author: jwilliamsen1
Reviews.Content: First off so you know where I am coming from, I hate the Strip. 3000 room hotels do not make me feel like I am in a special place. I also get no thrill from walking around taking pictures of imitation sites that I have already seen for real such as the Eiffel Tower, the Empire State Building or a Venetian Gondola. When I go to Vegas, I want VEGAS!! That is why I usually stay at the Golden Nugget and I now stay at the Red Rock. The Red Rock in my opinion was awesome. Best pool in Vegas. Not as big as Mandalay obviously but there is not 3000 people from LA posing in it. The rooms were great, possibly the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. It may be worth the trip to Vegas just sleep. Bathrooms were first class as you would expect in an upscale hotel. The restaurants were well varied and excellant. The hotel had great places to wander. The basic spa and workout facility were included in the resort fee so you can take the best shower of your life down there. Overall this is a great place to get away. I still think the Golden Nugget is the best Casino in the world but during pool season this is were I will go. Only downside, if you are on the opposite side of the hotel from the elevator, it is a hike. Doesn't sound like a big deal but it is really a hike and gets a little old

Reviews.Title: “Modern Rooms, silly charges”
Reviews.Author: CaseyMD
Reviews.Content: Well, many reviews already elude to this, but this hotel does seem to nickel and dime you. And I don't think I am cheap. The room was large, modern, and comfortable. Has the amenities you come to expect in Vegas: Large bath with TV in the tub, flat screen in the room, clean styling, great view. I was not impressed by the coffee shop, so we usually just brought coffee up to the room in the am from the easily-accessible starbucks. Valet was quick and easy, the only way we ended up parking. We had a blast playing bingo with the octogenarian locals in the bingo parlor. The pool was pretty cool, cabanas were a nice touch and the fountain was nice to look at. Even though it was february it was warm enough in the sun to enjoy outside a bit. I would have been pretty unhappy if after paying the resort fee we didn't have access like some earlier reviews stated. We would stay here again, esp if we got a better deal on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Sad and silly pricing mars a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Danhedonia
Reviews.Content: I am a long time LV traveler, and also lived here for a while; I am very familiar with the different options and pros and cons involved. Red Rock is a nice place at the edge of town, should you want to stay away from the Strip. You will know whether or not you want that. As a "destination resort," I would say this is lacking; just not big enough. The best attraction is the proximity of the utterly gorgeous Red Rock National Monument. The rooms, as mentioned, are lovely, new and clean. Staff are helpful (this is 'average' in Las Vegas - a service industry city). The place is clean and things run well. But I cannot write a review without mentioning their pricing, which borders on ridiculous. A resort fee of $28/day? For: internet access and a few other meaningless things. I believe that does NOT even include health club privileges ... and then we get to the mini-bar. I'm a business traveler; I understand that having snacks in my room is going to cost extra because they're right there, at my convenience. That does not mean I should be paying you $10 for three small chocolate chip cookies that look suspiciously like re-packaged Chips Ahoy. That's embarrassing. Ultimately, I would *only* recommend this hotel to someone who has a need to stay in Summerlin. There is no other reason.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: UtahMikester
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge and plush. Much cleaner than the hotels on the strip -- cleaner air, better crowds. There's also a lot to do at the hotel, with a great pool, bowling alley and restaurants. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: malvlover
Reviews.Content: Was booked for 2 nights but extended another night. Really enjoyed it! The hotel is beautiful; the service outstanding! Very comfortable room, but there are very long hallways if you do not get a room close to the elevator, as it is only on one end of the hall, not the middle like most hotels. Food choices were good. Nice pool area and this place has a movie theater and a bowling alley as well as the casino! Main drawback is the location. You either must have a car, or don't mind staying close by. About a 20 minute drive from the Las Vegas strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Kellieherrmann
Reviews.Content: Amazing amenities from multiple bars, a bowling alley, and a private Texas Hold 'em tournament. The layout of the hotel was a bit confusing and the rooms were a bit dark. This hotel is relatively new and everything was up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and paly”
Reviews.Author: ScottieN
Reviews.Content: I love a hotel that gives me fee water bottles and has 2 starbucks! The food is all the restaurants is excellent fresh and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell everyone!”
Reviews.Author: palletlady
Reviews.Content: I love the Red Rock because its away from the strip! Limited lines and the resort treats you like a guest... not like just another tourist! Beautifully decorated with plenty of amenities including movie theater, arcade, bingo and a bowling alley! The spa is outstanding with fitness facility and private quiet pool area for relaxation. Sometimes there are limited tables, during the day, but dealers and pit bosses are friendly and you can have a good time - even if you're not winning! Highly recommended - but don't tell everyone, or I won't be able to get a reservation at a moments notice!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: nighteyesnoire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock with our softball team. We originally booked rooms at another hotel a block off the Strip, but we had to go outside the hotel for dining & entertainment, and the surrounding area wasn't good. So we moved our whole team to Red Rock. It was last-minute, but Red Rock agreed to match the room rate of the first (cheaper) hotel. So glad we moved! Red Rock is self-contained: restaurants galore, gambling, movie theaters, bowling, kids' play area. You never have to leave, so it's great for families (or for tired softball players & parents, who need a respite from the heat)! Rooms: The door of our room was recessed & was not facing the hallway, so we were exposed to less hallway noise. We had 1 king bed. The bed & pillows were so comfy, and the room was huge! The color of the room walls was a dark brown. I found it a bit dark, but my daughter found it very relaxing & a nice break from the Las Vegas sun. Plenty of space around the bed. There was both a desk & a small round table in the room. Closet is a good size. Food: Such an assortment of restaurants, all indoor & a short walk from the rooms! The Grand Cafe is open 24/7, so convenient for early or late softball games & insomniacs. Feast Buffet has a huge selection (get there early!). LBS had really good burgers. Hachi (Japanese) was a bit pricey & I've had better. There's also Starbucks, Italian & Mexican restaurants. Red Rock is in western Las Vegas.
