Not close to the Strip, but I liked the less hectic surrounding area. You feel like you're away & relaxing. Lobby is modern, colorful & stunning. Staff at front desk are very friendly & helpful. I would definitely stay again, softball or not! Bathroom was beautiful with granite floors & tile. Shower & tub were separate; so was the toilet with its own door. Very practical & lots of room for people to move around in.

Reviews.Title: “Stands out in a crowd”
Reviews.Author: meliachia
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five night stay at Red Rock. My husband was there for a DICE conference, so my 6 year old daughter and I decided to tag along. I was VERY impressed with the level of service. From start to finish every single person we encountered went above and beyond. While I've stayed at many hotels that have a great front desk, or wonderful room service, it's rare to find this high a caliber staff consistently across all departments. I would note, as someone else did, that, if traveling with young children, it's a good idea to try to get a room near the elevator. It is a LONG walk to the end of the hall. The room was spectacular. Very posh (my daughter loved the TV in the bathroom) and very comfortable. The views were spectacular. We also took advantage of many of the hotel amenities. We loved the bowling alley (although it was wicked crowded on a Saturday night with 45 min waits), the arcade was my daughter's favorite place, and we even took a chilly dip in their insane pool! We had room service on several occasions, and, while expensive as all room service is, they do go above and beyond in delivery and presentation. My only bit of a complaint would be the schedule of the shuttle. It runs every two hours starting at 11am to the strip and every two hours to the airport. A two hour window is quite limiting and I would strongly suggest increasing the times it departs and picks up (we almost missed the 5:40p on the strop and would have had to stay the extra two hours OR pay $60 for a taxi). I'm not a huge Vegas fan, but loved our stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best place we've EVER stayed”
Reviews.Author: CBM_20
Reviews.Content: Just came from two nights at the Venetian and I would say that Red Rock equals that in quality, maybe better. Staff at all levels were exceptional. The hotel is located on the outskirts of Las Vegas, 15-20 mins from the strip. Surrounding neighboorhoods are fairly new and there's lots of restaurants & stores nearby. We had a signature suite which is the size of two regular rooms - over 1000 sq.ft total. The en-suite bathroom was 150 sq.ft and absolutely beautiful. Another half-bath in the other room, three TV's, four telephones, highest quality ammenities. We had a strip-view room which gave a great view of the whole city. Free high-speed internet was the best I've seen at a hotel. Parking was close to the elevators. The hotel includes a bowling alley which is designed for both kids & adults - automatic lane-bumpers come up when its the kids' turn. Sixteen-screen movie theatre & great pool. The Feast Buffet was the most reasonably priced that we've seen and better quality than most. The kids loved hiking in Red Rock Canyon. We highly recommend this place to families!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent All Around”
Reviews.Author: HollyF3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. The rooms were very nice. The casino was not overwhelming. The spa was a dream. The only down side was the distance from the Strip, but in the end it didn't matter because there was so much to do right there.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Casino/Vegas”
Reviews.Author: vikngrl
Reviews.Content: great property, great restaurants, great location. roos were very modern and bathroom was incredible witha n excellent bath tub!

Reviews.Title: “When you dont want to be on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sandysouz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Zen inspired spa and resort. Great decor, great restaurants--Japanese fantastic and the steakhouse. Pool area with cabanas. The perfect place when you dont want to be on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Worst customer service EVER”
Reviews.Author: KristiK77
Reviews.Content: The hotel customer service was horrible. Bellman told me they wouldn't call a cab for me. Valet ignored my questions. Front office staff was not helpful to put is nicely. The hotel is 30 minutes from the strip. So it is further then you would think. Plus the hotel is about a $60 cab ride from the airport. This hotel was created for locals and it shows. Hatachi Restaurant has fantastic food and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with some limitations”
Reviews.Author: philo88
Reviews.Content: If you want to avoid the sometimes pricey strip hotels, with difficult parking etc, but not be too far out, this is a great choice - around 10 mins from the centre - especially if you get a good rate: I paid $120 while the strip hotels were quoting twice that and more. Check in and arrival is very efficient for a big place and they have got good guest parking reasonably lose to the elevators. The design is modern, sleek and almost boutiquey - a bit too much of the translucent red panels, but other than that, really nice. The rooms are huge and very well designed and appointed. Downsides - the concession restaurants are pricey and not that great except for takeaways like Fatburger. There's really only one cafe for breakfast and that is very expensive. Wifi is also not free and if you put anything in the mini bar, the movement makes a charge to your room even though you have taken nothing - the check out girl I credited me back the $80 of mini bar stuff they had charged, but rather gracelessly. I got a double rate of $120 which was great value, but there is also a resort/spa fee of around $25 - if you don't want the spa, that's a pain, but if you do, it's a really excellent spa and you get a pool, hot room, sauna, excellent washing/shower/shaving etc facilities all included. Remember tho' that although Red Rock has far more space than the strip hotels, it's not a resort with a lot of outdoor areas in the sense that some of the further out resorts are. All in all, with some drawbacks, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “First class property with impressively responsive general manager”
Reviews.Author: jg56
Reviews.Content: This was one of several stays at Red Rock over the past two years. It is a very well maintained and well equipped property with a beautiful pool area in warmer months. Buffet prices are significantly lower than those on the strip and I think the quality is generally good. Rooms are stylish with all the expected amenities and there are often very good specials on the web. I am writing specifically to commend the staff. I find the front desk staff and concierges to be extremely pleasant and helpful. The parking crew is very professional, they remember your name and greet you upon return to the hotel and they turn around cars very quickly. None of the 15-20 minute waits like at strip hotels. And finally, when I wrote a letter after the last visit to make some comments and offer opportunities for improvement, I received a timely reponse from the general manager and incentive to return the the property again. I was very surprised and pleased. Only significant issue is the resort fee which, as others have said , is quite high for what you get, and VERY HIGH if you do not make use of the services (if you rent your own car and don't use shuttles, go on vacation and therefore don't need wireless internet etc, use your cell phone and don't need the in room calling option etc). A $27 resort fee plus tax is hard to swallow when some nights the room rates was $60! It is rather insulting and very annoying. I wish the hotel would find another way to recoup their expenses. I hope someone from hotel management or Station Casinos reads these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Improve your Shuttle service!!!”
Reviews.Author: wingsfan6497
Reviews.Content: This resort is very beautiful, and clean...However it is a $50 at minimum cab ride from the airport and the cab driver may be very grumpy when he has to take you ALL the way out there. When I was leaving I was told the shuttle didn't start until 7am, my flight was at 7:45, and they couldn't get a cab for sure, but I could reserve a limo for $65, So my advice is rent a car on hotwire for sure if you are staying here, The hotel shuttle has very limited schedule and it is a treasure hunt to find it at the airport. The internet was $1 a minute which seemed pretty excessive. We asked for batteries for our remote one night around 9:30pm and at 01:30 someone was banging on our door, finally bringing our batteries. We were not impressed. It also took over 30 minutes for our bags to be brought up to our room, and the Check in Dude handed us the wrong bill with some other persons name and billing info when we checked in. They definitely have a few bugs to work out still.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed It - Except for the 'Resort Fee'”
Reviews.Author: wisnat
Reviews.Content: We intentionally booked Red Rock because of its location (near where we had a business appt.). Although we had stopped at the casino previously, this was our first time staying there. Positives: Nice rooms, deep tub, instant hot water, most of the staff, decent casino, variety of restaurants, movie theaters, bowling, proximity to Red Rock National Park. Negatives: Cherry Night Club blasting until the wee hours of the morning (no sleep); bright lights in the Grand Cafe (& lackluster service), and the daily resort fee. Not much is more annoying than paying for something you don't want / use. Ask customers if they want to use those amenities and then charge for them. Better yet - just include them in the rate! (Also, don't nickel & dime customers - for example, the business center charges .25 cents for 5 rubber bands!)

Reviews.Title: “Exceedly Average”
Reviews.Author: tt9237
Reviews.Content: Yes, the facility is beautiful, but the service just wasnt there. Impersonal, understaffed... even the employees that we talked to expressed dissatisfaction. Need to concentrate more on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort - Best Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: royal516flush
Reviews.Content: The property is just beautiful (check out that lobby chandelier!), room was spacious even with a rollaway bed. Closet lights up! There is a safe in the closet area. Super bathroom with deep soaking tub! Instant hot water in shower & sink. A shower drain that actually drained! Very comfy beds with lots of pillows. To avoid the Cherry Nightclub noise, get a Strip View room also the hallway is very long so ask for a room not too far down the hall. We ate in the Cafe and Buffet, both with great food & service. The buffet manager even came over to ask us how our meal was. Gambling area is roomy, machines are not all crammed together. Loved the large Bingo room. Tip: If you drive in and park in the East Parking Garage, the elevator does not go down to the lobby level. You have to get off at the Casino Level, find the bank of hidden elevators behind the Gift Shop and those will take you to the lobby/check in area. Our check in experience was fine; staff was glad to see us, polite, attentive. The internet in the room did not work with my computer & I was not going to pay extra for higher-speed internet. That really needs to be fixed if they want to keep charging the high Resort Fee. Luckily my stay was comp (even the resort fees). Would love to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: AlbanBerg
Reviews.Content: We went to Red Rock on a family getaway for three days straddling New Year's Eve. We have two young children, who were mostly excited about the ten or so swimming pools at the hotel. The hotel is a good spot if you have young children, as there is a multiplex movie theatre, bowling alley, and children's play/care center on site. The restaurants were very mediocre, particularly the lower-priced, kid-friendly eateries. Some things to watch out for, that soured us on the hotel: (1) We needed high-speed Internet access, checked in advance, and were told that it was free in every room. It is not. The "free" Internet access does not hook up to anything and instead shunts you to a site where you have to pay for Internet access. We found that to be too much of a "bait and switch" for our tastes. (2) As mentioned, our children were excited about the pools. All of them were closed, and we were given no notice of that when booking our stay. Nevertheless, we were charged the full "resort fee" for our stay (about $27 additional per night). The hotel refused to discount it due to the closure of the pools. (3) This is the first hotel I have stayed in where none of our mobile phones would work in the room. They would only work down in the lobby or casino. As a result, we had to use the land line in the room. We made a few, very short (no more than 5 minutes) long distance calls to Los Angeles. We were charged between $30 and $40 for each call. Part of me thinks that the hotel shields or somehow interferes with cellular reception in the rooms in order to force guests to use the very expensive land line.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and stay for price”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock over Christmas with two teenagers. We purchased this great deal - 2 night stay, 8 games of bowling, 4 movie passes and babysitting for their club (which we didnt need) all for $225 plus fees. We ended up adding another day arriving early and upgraded for $50 a night to a resort room which is at the end of the long long long hallway but gave us an extra 100 square feet of room which was totally worth it. We were able to get a rollaway bed in addition to the two queen beeds which allowed everyone to sleep comfortably. The beds were great and the bathroom was huge, two sinks and bathroom with door on it which is a good thing when sharing a room with two teenagers and a husband. What was nice is that the kids had things to do - bowling, movies, food court within the hotel. We did lots of bowling and since we had a car we traveled to the strip often. We ate at the Cafe and the buffet - buffet was good, cafe service and attention was lacking. The food was okay in the cafe. Customer service was great at check in but lacking at the players card booth. But overall the stay was nice and hotel is very clean, rooms very modern and well kept. We visit the spa which was pricey but the pedicures were great.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock - Very tricky!”
Reviews.Author: karlseidel
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel - with one caveat: when you book see the part about the mandatory $25 up-charge for the spa (or something like that). Personally, given the opportunity I always use the facilities. But, since I know not everyone enjoys this type of thing it bothers me that you're required to pay it no matter what. So, if you think you're paying $175 for the room (+ tax) - you're not. You're paying $200 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good Strip Alternative”
Reviews.Author: jsaul
Reviews.Content: Another Vegas gem! It is a refreshing change from staying on the strip. Our room was modern with a view of the pool, city, & mountains. Although not as large as our suite @ MGM Signature. The overall design is elegant & spacious. The pool is beautifully designed & landscaped. My favorite areas where the workout room & spa...luxurious. Although you are far from the strip there are upscale shops & restaurants nearby. Since we love to dance its' location near the Suncoast Casino was super convenient. The Suncoast Ballroom is great for Salsa, Swing, or Ballroom dancing.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay, By And Large”
Reviews.Author: SteveinSoCal
Reviews.Content: We capped off our 2009 summer vacation with a stopover in Vegas at the Red Rock. Let's start with the positives: 1) The rooms are just immaculate. One of the only places where I have stayed with my family and almost thought the room was *too* nice for us. 2) A lot of family-friendly options in the hotel. While we did not avail ourselves of the movie theatres or the bowling alley (again, only one night at the resort), we did have a fun night in the arcade with our little guys. We also hit the pool (more on this later), which was absolutely beautiful. Now, the negatives: 1) About that pool...in the middle of summer, closing a pool area at 7 PM is just ridiculous. It means that unless you are staying for two nights or more, you basically have to run to the pool immediately after check-in to have any chance of using the facility. 2) The mapping and signage could have been better. It seemed to be a pretty tough place to negotiate.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Locals Only - a great Strip alternative”
Reviews.Author: marence
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Red Rock, and we were even more impressed with the service and setting at Red Rock this time around. From McCarran airport, Red Rock is less than 20 minutes away by the less-traveled County 215, which seemed nearly empty except at rush hour. The entrance to the casino is the first thing you see, with water fountains by day and fire fountains by night. Drive all the way around to the hotel entrance, and use the valet parking, where the staff takes your car promptly and politely. The red glass doors are opened for you, and just to the right inside is the front desk, staffed with quietly friendly people who offer bottled water and any assistance you'd want as part of their new "A3" service. The elevators are hidden behind the lobby bar, and require a room key for access. We stayed in a 19th floor strip view room. The view was wonderful, especially at night, and seemed much nicer than our "mountain view" room last year, which was on the 3rd floor and gave us a view of the entry and valet parking more than the mountains. The bed was extremely comfortable, with clean and soft linens and plenty of pillows. The room decor is exactly as advertised on the website; remember to not touch the mini-bar items if you don't want to get charger. There are signs reminding you in-room, and the check-in staff also mentioned it to us. My favorite part of the Red Rock room was the bathroom - it contains a separate water closet, a shower with an incredible massage/rainshower showerhead, and best of all, a huge soaking tub. The bath amenities include bath salts as well as the usual shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel, two different soaps, and cotton balls, q-tips, and a sewing kit. The housekeeping staff replaces everything but the sewing kit during your stay. The room comes equipped with a doorbell/electronic notice, which you can set for privacy or to signal housekeeping to make up the room. If you have the "do not disturb" on past noon, someone will call your room to ask if you'd like anything (like extra towels.) A daily newspaper is left every morning (The Las Vegas Sun and the Review-Journal - a nice touch to have local papers rather than USA Today!) Being a cold December, the pool wasn't open, but there's enough to do on the property that we didn't miss it- an IMAX theatre, bowling alley, numerous restaurants including a food court, and the spa and shops as well as the casino. Our hotel promotion included 2 buffet meals, and we took advantage of the Feast buffet for a breakfast and a dinner. I must highly recommend the breakfast selections - perfectly crisp bacon, moist and flavorful scrambled eggs (plain, with cheese, or with onions and peppers), a huge selection of various ethnic breakfast specialties ranging from lox & red onions for bagels to chorizo gravy, and absolutely fresh fruits. The omelet station had a long line which moved quickly, and everyone seemed delighted by the dishes. Dinner selections we tried were all tasty, except for an odd-tasting mac and cheese. The carved roast beef, the freshly-rolled sushi, and numerous vegetable sides were more along the lines of a good cafe dinner than run-of-the-mill buffet food. The selection of pastries was on a par with other high-end hotel buffets - I recommend the shot-glass tiramisu especially! The hotel staff was friendly but deferential, and all went out of their way to please. When we arrived in our room, there were no bathrobes in the closet. A push of the A3 button on the phone, and a staff member was apologizing that it could take up to ten minutes. Within 5, the robes arrived with another apology. Although we saw a lot of families in the food court and movie theatre area, children weren't noticeable in the casino area.

Reviews.Title: “Can you believe it?”
Reviews.Author: olaopa
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa is a real gem. We couldn't pick better. A 5 stars luxury hotel for less than 100 $ at night, can you believe it? incredible! We booked the rooms through last minute travel web site and it was quick and easy. We enjoyed being close to all the main attractions but if you ask me, I enjoyed staying at the hotel just as much as going out side. The recreations inside the hotels were just amazing. All went so well. I hope all my future vacations will be as nice as this was.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms too far from the action”
Reviews.Author: TK100
Reviews.Content: We were at a 3 day conference at the Red Rock and for a conference venue the hotel is superb - the conference center is really good and well managed. The rooms are beautiful (the bathrooms are huge and have a TV over the bath - fantastic)! if you are however wanting to partake in Vegas nightlife - this is not the place to be. there is a curtosy shuttle to and from thestrip but the last one leaves the hotel at 06pm and the last one back from the strip is 21:00 - it's understandable that the hotel wants travellers to gamble at their resort but it just lacks that Vegas feeling.... a taxi ride to and from the strip is $55 one way which becomes quite costly. So if it's the typical Vegas night life you're after - i would not reccomend staying at the Red Rock. We spent a day at the pool on the Saturday, which is beautiful - the only problem is that they pump loud R&B music out of the loudspeakers and it becomes more of a teenage party than a relaxing day at the pool... The Italian restaurant in the hotel is OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “Civilised Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: PatrickB
Reviews.Content: A real find for those who are overwhelmed by the hype at the Strip. Beautiful, and restrained, decor; fabulous staff; excellent eating places for all tastes; and a casino that is more open and friendly than any of the major ones Downtown. It's easy to get to from the Airport. You can be at the Red Rock Canyon in 20 minutes---ideal to recharge the batteries with some striking desert scenery and hiking. Complementary valet parking is an added bonus. And the rates when we stayed were great! Can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice alternative to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: lambert1133
Reviews.Content: When planning our anniversary trip, I wanted to find a place away from the craziness of the strip. The Red Rock Hotel is a perfect alternative. We aren't gamblers so the change of pace was very welcome. It's not as flashy and noisy as the typical strip hotel. They also have plenty to do on site like a movie theater and bowling. It's within 20 minutes of the Red Rock Canyon park and about 25 minutes from the strip. Unfortunately, it was too cool to enjoy the pool but we did check it out and it also was very nice. The workout room is a little on the small side but has everything you need to get in a decent workout. We have family that live in Vegas and we typically try to visit every couple of years so we'll definitely be going back to the Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than I expected that I am going back next week”
Reviews.Author: TravellingRover
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at The Venetian, Wynn or Bellagio and wanted to try Red Rock because it had a movie theater and bowling alley within the hotel complex so we wouldn't have to drive to find other entertainment. Red Rock was on top of their game and the whole experience, from check in to check out was flawless - except for one glitch at their Feast Buffet which could have been avoided. The bed and linens were BETTER than expected and extremely comfortable. The jacuzzi in the signature suite was the best I have experienced in Las Vegas with a light therapy and amazing head and back jets. Food at the Feast Buffet was excellent - service a bit slow and needs to be tuned up. I was told I could not order beer or wine unless I paid for it in cash as the server wasn't able to add it to the room charge (not acceptable). This led to the purchase of one beer rather than several. The "resort fee" which I had dreaded really was a good value as it allowed us internet access, access to the spa and valet parking. All the hotels are charging these fees one way or another and the spa is worth going to. I liked the casino a lot and it was very busy - unlike the Venetian. Enjoyed the Italian restaurant Terra Rossa - great service and comfortable table. They had fresh white truffles from Alba which we enjoyed on the rissotto with porcini mushrooms - truly one of the best rissottos we have ever had. Both dinner and brunch were very busy at Feast Buffet - which gets my vote for second best buffet in Vegas. Number One is Studio B at the M Resort - it is going to be very hard to beat that spread, which is so good it seems impossible that they can still do it. If you want to relax, unwind and not be subjected to tons of people everywhere trying to make it to their convention - I strongly recommend Red Rock - it is a 5 Star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Vibe, Great Rooms, All On a Techno Sound Track”
Reviews.Author: wwTraveler1
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our four day stay here. It is a large hotel trying to have that South Beach boutique feel. I think it worked very well. Upon arrival, drove around looking for self parking. There isn't any as far as I could tell. That's actually OK here, because they have the best valet service I have ever experienced. Friendly, fast and enough staff to grab your car pronto. They always asked if I needed directions and always provided two little, ice cold Red Rock bottles of water. I liked the two rooms we had. The first was a "Canyon View." Nothing wrong with the view except it isn't quite as close to Red Rock Canyon as their promotional pictures would have you believe. This side also has the pool view.... and Cherry Nightclub. Cherry Nightclub is a really serious design and execution flaw for this half of the hotel, because every Friday, Saturday and some Sunday nights, half the hotel guests aren't going to get any sleep 'till 4am when the "boom boom" stops pounding. You may as well go clubbing these nights, since you're listening to the music either way. I couldn't sleep even with earplugs. Day two, we were moved to a strip view room right across the hall on the 22nd floor. What a fantastic view of the entire Las Vegas Valley plus the strip front and center. In contrast to the Cherry Nightclub side, this was one of the quietest hotel rooms I have experienced. Everywhere you go in the hotel casino and even elevators, your life will be set to the techno soundtrack that plays like a 24 hour nightclub. I thought it was funny how you knew your elevator has arrived when you suddenly hear the beat "doosh, dooosh doosh" Room design an amenities were exceptional. Nice big 42" plasma on the wall. The room even had a Bose Wave radio with a pretty good Red Rock Casino CD featuring more techno music. (In case you needed more since the elevator ride!) The pool was ultra hip and there were poolside blackjack tables. Wait staff and dealers were dressed for the part in skimpy bikinis. We were nicely surprised by the friendliness of all pool staff. One little caveat though... I have never had to go through a bag search in order to access my 4 star hotel's pool. Security? OK, I guess they want to keep non-guests out, but nooo they want to search your pool bag too. Why? "To look for outside food and beverages" Kinda tacky and almost a deal breaker for a repeat stay. Casino was nicer than most local's joints. Although it was surprisingly smoky even when not busy. Enjoyed the movie theaters and decent food court as well. Did not eat at any of the restaurants because right across the road are all kinds of mid priced places. Thought BJ's Brewhouse was exceptional. Islands is always good for lunch There are several others including Olive Garden. Costco, Albertsons and a small strip mall are all right across the street. To sum up: Beautifully designed four star hotel lacking certain considerations for the guest you would find at most other four star resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Great price at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: mkover
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the Red Rock so decided to go for the weekend. The resort was about 20 minutes from the strip but we drove down so it wasn't a big deal. It was very quiet and not a lot going on, which was nice. Not too much smoke, not too crowded, not too loud, perfect. T-bones was phenomenal, one of the top 3 steaks we've ever had and we've had some damn good steaks! The mattress left a lot to be desired, not sure if we got a bad one but it had two large craters in it didn't complain because we didn't want to move for one night. Also, the views were less than impressive after looking at their website. The mountains, were more like ant hills and I didn't see the strip view but it was quite a ways away. I am a bit spoiled though I have views of Mount Olympus out my front door and 180 degree views of the Salt Lake valley out the back. The pool was wonderful as was the room and lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Sinbad06
Reviews.Content: The Red Rocks was a great place to stay for my recent conference. Located about 30 minutes from the Las Vegas Strip, this resort and spa is a gem. The rooms were clean I had a wonderful view of the mountains. If you'd like to stay at a hotel that has all the amenities you want, but not the hussle and bussle of the Las Vegas Strip, this is the place to stay. "Cherry" nightclub was a blast and it was nice to play $5 blackjack at a nice casino. I'll be visiting this Hotel again in the future. Oh, and before I forget, the Buffet was awesome, and a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLarab
Reviews.Content: Went on a thursday - hotel was fine - rooms are nice (although no coffee maker), liked the bathtub, although would not be suitable for older guests. The big problem is that we requested a canyon view but no one told us that on the weekends the Cherry Nightclub starts at 11:30 at night and even on the 10th floor -- you can hear it very loud and clear as if it's coming into your room - complained, but was told first - we can give you earplugs and second that they would ask them to turn down the music, which they clearly didn't since it went on for hours. The hotel did seem a big understaffed - the tv checkout didn't work and the $30 resort fee per person seems a bit steep. I think the hotel could have made more of an effort to help us with the noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property on the inside...........”
Reviews.Author: AnewMunsterfan
Reviews.Content: A bit on the expensive side but for a newer hotel.........great design. They have done a decent job of controlling the smoke. Our business experience was good but the attitude of the contact we had left a bit to be desired. Not very open or friendly. Our group had a great experience at Red Rock. We were there when the property first opened. Ate there recently (2009) ....at T Bones actually - it was very good food, expensive but nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel insolvent and it shows - Atrocious service, mediocre food, understaffed, overpriced and overvalued....”
Reviews.Author: swg126
Reviews.Content: Everything on the surface seems like it should be a top place, but in just about every aspect, it is severely lacking. From rooms that look beautiful but are poorly insulated from noise when a door is shut nearby or the late night music at the Cherry club which was fantastically designed so its music penetrates all the rooms with scenic views, to trying to reach the front desk just about anytime, to the terribly mediocre food, to the spa which feels more like a factory than a relaxing place to unwind, to incompetent/poorly trained staff who generally don't seem to care or follow-up on anything. Hotel is understaffed and service level is atrocious- hotel parent is on brink of insolvency and this property is supposed to be one of the good ones. There's a reason and it is not just the economy. I know it is Vegas, but do you have to feel hustled and nickled and dimed and treated the whole time they don't care about anything more than just trying to take more money from you without any concern to your experience or building a longer-term relationship? Their creditors only care about short-term getting cash out- not whether you have a good experience or not. Caveat Emptor!!! http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2009/aug/24/stations-legal-battle-heats-bankruptcy-case/ With so many other choices and better deals, even if you want to be off the strip, why go to a place that it so clearly just doesn't seem to care about its customers, much less even try!?!? FYI, I have stayed at properties from the economy to Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton's, etc. It is not about the price point- better service at lesser places and way too little for what you get should you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is awesome”
Reviews.Author: paredesjp
Reviews.Content: This new hotel/casino/resort is really nice and has updated rooms. The package I booked gave us a $50 food/beverage credit and $20 gas cards. Although there is a resort fee, the pool/ spa/ gym were well worth it. Went to the club during the nightime and caught a nice little performance.

Reviews.Title: “Expert Las Vegas Traveller- a good hotel in a niche market”
Reviews.Author: TCUtexan09
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock for three days for a wedding at their golf course, less than 2 miles away. It was with extended family from all parts of the country and the world. I have been to vegas over 50-times since a lot of my family lives in las vegas. I usually fly out to vegas about two to three times a year. A little background about me, I am a business college student who has extensive world-travel experience. I like luxury and usually 4-5 star hotels when I travel but I know when I get a good value and when it is overprice. I have stayed from a range of hostels in Europe to the Shangra-la in Asia. So, overall I prefer 4 stars and higher but I am not ignorant of cost. I payed about 135 a night for the hotel room, not including the resort fee. This included two free buffets and two free movie tickets. This is more than the hotels on the strip. This is about as much as a Paris stay or a good deal at the Bellagio. It is on the expensive side but there is no other hotel even near the Red Rock. It is the only hotel really in the area. This is NOT a hotel to stay at if you want to go to the strip. It really serves locals and those who are going to Red Rock Canyon. It is about 30 mins to the strip so it is far. Plus, the traffic and street lights suck. If you stay at Red Rock, do not plan on going to the strip much. Casino- They play the "21" movie sound track everywhere! The techno music tries to make it feel hip like the entire place is a Starbucks or a club. The hotel elevators BLARE the music. When the doors open on your hotel floor, the music fills the entire hallway. It is not too loud like at a club but you have to raise your voice to talk.The decor is great and modern. It has a very new feel. The entire design is basically minimalism with a splash of sixties colors. Red, orange, brown, and green are the main colors they play with in the entire resort. The chandeliers are amazing and well placed. Relating to the gaming, the actual slots do not pay out much (this is coming from my family who lives near the hotel). I mainly played the tables. I tripled my bet and won a 100 dollars at blackjack. Irena is great. She is from Greece and she was amazing. She told people when to double down. Rooms- I am used to staying at the other 4 star Station Casino called Green Valley Ranch. Red Rock and GVR are suppose to be the nicest Station casinos. Red Rock has nicer rooms and better furniture. The bathroom at Red Rock is very nice but the fixtures are kind of weird and over done. They give you everything you need. Plenty of towels. GVR has a much bigger room and bathroom. The Red Rock room is basic and small. If you spend more time in your room, a larger "Resort" room might be a good investment. i heard the suites are AMAZING! I do not know why they chose to make a small room, especially since it is supposed to be nicer than GVR. The TV in the bathroom is kind of pointless but a nice touch. The color of the marble is cool. The sliding door on the toilet seems like a afterthought. The main TV is nice. The A/C was great. Beds were very nice and the pillows were great. Most of the rooms are set back from the main hall with a private hall way for the room next door. So you only face one door. This reduces the noise a lot more than in GVR, which has a usual hotel design with all the doors facing the main hallway. I thought this was a good idea but it really does reduce the size of the room. Also, the only elevators from the casino is all the way at one end of the hallway. So if your room is above 130 be prepared to walk. I was the next to last room. It took about 3 mins to walk from one end to another. it is annoying but not a huge disadvantage. Red Rock was a quiet hotel from internal noise, but if you face the pool, be prepared for Cherry. Cherry- Cherry is their cool club. It is mainly local. The music is modern and decent. The design is really cool but if your room faces the mountain side thus the pool and the club, it has a potential for disaster for light sleepers.The club opens up the doors to the pool at 1:30 am till about 3:30. Even before that you can hear the bass in your room. I was at the 18th floor and all the way at the other end of the hotel. Basically, I was as far as I could get from the club. Yet the music was very very loud. It sounded like the TV was on. I finally called down to the front desk and complained. He said that he received a lot of complaints. I told him "duh!" After 30 mins they turned down the music a lot. This only happened one night at my stay and I heard other hotels on the strip do this and do not turn down the music, like Tryst and the Wynn. So it was nice that they did that but it should not happen to begin with. I feel bad from the rooms close to the club. So request city side not mountain side so you can sleep at night! Customer Service- This was a huge plus. The housekeeping was very very nice. I was honestly surprised. The Spa people were kind of rude but not surprised from a US hotel. Staying abroad at good 4-5 star hotels really spoils me as they know how to treat their customers. In America, we put up with more from the hotel staff. But I was surprised how nice the front desk, casino staff, and restaurant staff really were. The BIGGEST mistake the hotel made is with the 45 second rule on the snacks they leave out in the room. These are pressure censored snacks that sit on the platform that sends a signal somewhere. There is a sign that says if the snack is removed longer than 45 seconds they charge the room. This is EXTREMELY bad customer relations. I laughed out loud. Take some trust in your guests. If you want to move up a star, this must go. I know other LV hotels do this but it is inappropriate and un-needed. I know there is also a senor in the fridge because they tried to charge me for the entire fridge when i moved the stuff around for some water I bought. This whole idea comes across as trying to scam the guests and get everything out of them. This entire idea must go! I know someone from management will read this so I hope the comment on this. Take some effort and have the housekeeping look at the snacks. Spa and Pool- One of the strong points of the hotel. The main pool area is huge. There is not much shade but plenty of swimming space. If you like to tan, this is the place to be. The pool area is gorgeous. The spa is another strong point. The gym was very nice. It was above average and well cleaned. The spa pool was really quiet and almost no one was ever there. It is free for all guests. My recommendation is to go to the spa pool not the main pool. No one is usually there. Also the locker rooms were great. The hot tubs were amazing. Buffet- I think they lowered the prices dramatically. Breakfast is about ten and so is lunch. This is a steal. Before the economic downturn, it was about 20 dollars. It is a good buffet but do not expect a Mirage buffet or other top line casino food. It is good for the value. Overall, good place to stay if you are in the summerlin area. Stay here if you want to go do nature stuff in Red Rock Canyon. This is a good solid 4 and maybe leans to 4.5 with some possible improvements, such as upgrading the customer experience. This is above GVR. If this hotel was on the strip, it would have stiff competition. It would probably be above the Paris and MGM, on-line with the Mirage, but below the Venetian and Bellagio. The Suites at Red Rock might even be on par with the Sky Lofts at MGM which is a huge accomplishment. Good place, good value, you can't go wrong if you plan ahead with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing location with modern and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: TheRottSpot
Reviews.Content: Very nice location. Away from all the hustle and bustle of Vegas...but with everything you need. Beautiful views of either the Red Rock Canyon or the Strip. Rooms were very modern, spacious and nice. Can't wait to come back and stay again. Look for specials, because rooms can go for over 200....however there are deals to be had. Staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “great off strip option”
Reviews.Author: travelguy1291
Reviews.Content: Service very attentive, hotel facilities plentiful and a great lobby bar and spa

Reviews.Title: “everything you can ask for in one place”
Reviews.Author: RoseWally
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Wednesday to Saturday...had plenty of space to ourselves mid week from pool to casino to restaurants. Spa is beautiful. There is a quiet retreat using the spa pool and private spots to read and enjoy the peace & quiet. By the weekend, it was much busier as two concerts were scheduled making for some intersting people watching! Drinks at pool are very expensive. Food at hotel buffet was good value. Ask about two for one coupons at the casino courtesy area and check the daily paper they deliver to your room for discounts, as well. Don't take anything out of the fridge in room...if you don't want it within 45 seconds, you'll be charged. No coffee pots in room which was a bummer...never stayed at a hotel that didn't have one. Rooms very spacious and bathrooms great. Staff was very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: Redfed
Reviews.Content: The service at the Red Rock was outstanding. The staff was accomodating making our convention completly successful and enjoyable. The room was very tastefully decorated and overlooked the pool area. With only one exception , each night was very restful and quiet, not common for the casiino type environment. I had family in the immediate area and the location was perfect for our get together oppurtunities. I liked the large size and features of the bathroom probably as much as any other thing about the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas stay at Red Rock Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: jyoder17
Reviews.Content: To preface my review, a four day visit to Vegas turned into 30 days. After the pre-planned four day excursion with my nephew and his friend (his high school graduation present from me), I decided to quit my job, fly a few friends in, stay for a while and relax! Let's start with poolside where we started our vacation. The view of the pool from our 16th floor suite was spectacular, in the daylight and particularly lit up at night. The Red Rock staff of girls (Kai, Todd, Brad and Darnell weren't half bad either) were beautiful, always smiling and genuinely service oriented. The layout was cool, a series of pools and hot tubs with full bar and blackjack tables at one side, and cabanas lining the other side and back end. The bar offered food that was beyond what I would classify as "bar food" as well as a variety of colorful and fruity drinks. The absolute "must drink" is the Java Monkey, an iced delight of Starbuck's liquor and other sweet ingredients! Inside the casino our focus was on FOOD as we are not big gamblers. Don't misunderstand us though, we did indulge in moderate play of roulette, blackjack and slots within the casino. The food at T-Bones, Feast Buffet, Grand Cafe and Hachi were all memorable dining experiences at differing tiers. The menu at Hachi though offered such a wide variety of high-grade food, we dined there a total of eight times. The Spa was a relaxing and wonderful experience. We got haircuts, massages and utilized the exercise room daily. My favorite were the two massages I received from Julie. Ask for her by name because she's clearly qualified in deep tissue massage. To conclude this review I will assure you that I will be back to Red Rock Hotel & Casino very soon. The level of service, from valet to bellman to concierge and throughout the service staff inside and out of the casino, was impeccable! And don't be afraid to ask for a deal. Red Rock's flexibility with room rates was an integral part of my decision to extend my stay. I hope you all enjoy your next stay at Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa, Great Room, Poor Pool Service”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoSpaLover
Reviews.Content: The room was gorgeous, large closet, huge bathroom Service in the spa was amazing. There is an outdoor pool in the spa that is included in the hefty resort fee but no one told us about it. It wasn't even covered in our spa tour. I walked past it on the way to a treatment room and I had to ask what is this pool? Can any guest use it? The service at the pool was bad. Servers would only check on certain guests and ignore others. I started to wonder if I had a Do Not Distrub Sign on my chair This location is beautiful but very far from the strip. You need a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Casino/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvroatan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at a delightful refuge in the desert, Red Rock Casino & Hotel. It was truly wonderful and relaxing experience and only 20 minutes from the hustle & bustle of "Sin City". Whenever we return to Las Vegas, we will most certainly stay here as it is much more beautiful and tranquil than the Strip area. We made reservations each night for dinner at one of the Strip hotel restaurants and saw Cher perform at Ceasar's (great show!); but each night we were happy to drive back to our room at Red Rock Hotel and sleep until the sunrise was illuminating the red mountaintops outside our floor to ceiling windows each morning. The pool area was quite nice but the polite, attentive staff was the most outstanding feature of this resort. The only negative we experienced was the extremely long walk from the elevators to our room ( about 75 yards!). If you have knee, foot or ankle problems..... this is a difficult trek and they were unable to move us until the next day due their high occupancy.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and claustrophic "resort"”
Reviews.Author: beckyok
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Red Rock are all in alcoves off the hall. While this may seem like it would provide a quiet and relaxing atmosphere, in reality it creates a wind tunnel that makes the room shake any time a door is closed within 10 rooms of yours. We have stayed in many resorts and this hotel is a 4 star at best.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Off-Strip Hotel that will DEFINITELY see my business again!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler1983
Reviews.Content: I visited the Red Rock Casino, Resort and Spa in Las Vegas for an Event Planners Convention in August of 2009. The facility offers complimentary shuttle service to and from the Las Vegas airport as well as the Las Vegas strip. This service is a fantasic asset since the hotel is located quite a distance from the Las Vegas strip and typical taxi service costs approximately $50 each way. The room was fantastic! I had a Las Vegas strip king-room. The room itself was very clean and the bathroom had a separate shower and roman-style soaking tub. In addition, the toilet is housed in a separate water closet. The casino was rather small but since I was not visiting for gambling, it didn't matter to me. In regards to dining, the hotel offers a low-cost food court as well as several theme restaurants and a buffet. One of the restaurants, T-Bones Chophouse, was absolutely INCREDIBLE. I highly recommend that all guests enjoy this restaurant! The hotel also offers a large pool, and two smaller pools. In addition, there are many bars and a nightclub. Entertainment venues were superb. I also enjoyed spending a day at the Spa. As a meeting planner, function space is key to a successful event. This hotel offers and entire floor of ballrooms and breakout locations. Overall, I am giving this hotel a 5-star rating because of the kindness of their staff, entertainment options, dining, room amenities and function space. I will definitely be visiting this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Generic Behemoth Las Vegas Hotel/Casino”
Reviews.Author: Spirit
Reviews.Content: Generic Behemoth Las Vegas Hotel/Casino OR Too Far From the Strip I couldn't decide which title to use. -The Red Rock Casino Airport Shuttle Bus leaves the airport every two hours on the even hours from about 8 am to 8 pm- It’s a big dark red bus with the name Red Rock Casino on the sides and front. At the airport you catch it on the level below baggage claim. From Baggage Claim, take the escalator down to the next level, walk straight out the door (Don’t end up on the other side of the building!) and go to the island in the middle of the street. Go all the way to the right where there are benches for people catching the city bus. The city bus stops right there at parking space 22. The Red Rock Casino bus stops in one of the spaces just before that. The bus has seats for 28 to 32 people. There were about 18 more people who wanted to get on our bus than there was room for on the bus. Presumably these remaining people got together and shared limos or taxis. There was no line and no take a number system. The bus is free. Taxi for the 14 mile, 20 minute ride is $63. (September 30, 2009) Good points -Beautiful chandeliers! (I wanted to take that one in the bar home with me!) -Large rooms. -Clean -View from our room through the wall to wall and floor to ceiling windows was nice. The pool area is artfully laid out and colorful and has many tall palm trees, then you see the hugely massive spreading unscenic roof of the casino and parking garage, then a big housing project, and beyond that the majestic mountains and blue sky. -Air Conditioner and Heater were very responsive to their digital settings. -TV in the bathroom. -Restaurants right across the street from the casino are cheaper. To get there, walk all the way through the casinio and leave through the doors by the Terra Rossa Restaurant. Follow the street through the parking lot and cross Charleston Street at the traffic light. On the left is shopping like Best Buys, Borders, Marshals, Costco, etc. On the right is the nest of restaurants: Olive Garden, B.J. Brewhouse, McDonalds, an Asian place, a Mexican place, The Coffee Bean, and others. Bad points -Noisy Disco from 10 pm to 4 am. Rooms anywhere near the disco on that side of the hotel are noisy. We specifically asked for a quiet room. The room we were given was on the 16th floor at the far end. It was quiet there. -Looong hallways. Elevators are at one end of the building. Our room was one tenth of a mile from the elevator! -Snacks and Mini Fridge. There is a tray of liquor bottles and boxes of snacks. These items are electronically monitored. If you remove them from their position and don’t put them back within 40 seconds (!) their cost will be charged to your hotel account. -When we walked into our room it looked like a furniture warehouse with beds and whatever wasn’t permanently mounted to the wall all over on one side and in the adjacent corner of the room. Housekeeping was good enough to find a man to arrange the furniture properly. I suspect maybe they had a rollaway or two in there prior to our occupancy. It's the only explanation I could come up with for the mess in the lay out. -Toilet is in a separate little room but the only access to it is through the bath/shower room. -Inadequate light for reading in the rooms. -Elevators can be hard to find and don’t necessarily go where you want to go. -Restaurants are scattered around the periphery of the casino. The food court is the one you have to walk farthest to get to. -The Grand Café - We almost had to trip someone to get our order taken and it took a full 30 minutes to get our breakfasts after ordering. The restaurant filled up while we were there because people were waiting so long for their food to be delivered. Food was kinda warm but not hot when it arrived. Quality of the food was low average to not very good. (A friend told me the buffet restaurant was good!) -Awkward layout of the casino, hidden elevators, and grossly wasted space in the hotel wing led us to suspected the architect had never graduated from architect’s school. And he had definitely never studied feng shui! -Not many people gambling in the casino day or night the Wednesday -Friday that we were there. -This hotel is too far from The Strip!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice property, huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: JFulton
Reviews.Content: Just back from a soccer tournament in Vegas and the hotel was super. Staffing is a little on the light side, but with the exception of the indifferent check in clerk, everyone we met with was super nice and responsive. ONe example, a bunch of us all left the hotel early on Saturday at the same time. I called the valet early and he told me "don't worry - call when you are ready and it will take 3 mins." Well, when we were ready, I called and no answer after 3 mins of ringing. Rush down in person only to be pleasantly surprised by the valet pulling the car around and apologizing for not being able to pick up with all the car requests he had there in person. We had adjoining rooms, one king, another with 2 queens. Beds were exceptional and the bathrooms were very well done. Separate soaking tub with a small TV was a hit with the teenagers (although more to soak in ice between games than to watch TV). Did not venture into the casino, but the lobby bar was nice. Happy hour price on a premium martini was on $5. Not sure about the hours, but it was 630 and we got that price. Pool looked great but I was surprised it closed at 6pm on Saturday. We did hit the strip and a cab on Saturday night was $55 each way. Did not mind the trip, but if you want to spend a lot of time on the strip, be warned that its a 25 minute trip. We will stay here again. High;y recommended.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed here 14 or 15 times... it's worth the trip off the strip”
Reviews.Author: bermuda_explorer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many many times, and I don't understand how anyone could have anything "bad" to say about the place, other than minor nitpickings. I have stayed at 75% of all the strip hotels and by a LARGE margin would rather stay here or their sister property Green Valley over ANYWHERE else in Las Vegas. It is worth travelling the 15 miles or so off the strip unless you've never been to Las Vegas before. Red Rock is best described as a large, hip W meets Frank Lloyd Wright. The attention to detail and design quality is really asonishing if you appreciate that sort of thing. It's ultra cool, but at the same time, ultra laid back. One trip here, and you'll kiss the strip goodbye forever. The casino is seperated from the hotel, so you don't have to aimlessly wander through the casino to get to the hotel. I prefer the Canyon view over the Strip view for room choices. The view of the Red Rock Canyon is breatakingly beautiful. I stay here on business 2-3 times a year, but also come back for quick getaways with the wife and kids. The Kids Quest I think it's called is awesome... your little ones won't want to leave... You can drop them off for up to 6 hours and when you come back they STILL don't want to leave! Just remember to call them in advance if bringing your kids!! They require up to date immunization records which you can fax over in advance. Red Rock Canyon is literally right across the highway, only a few miles away. This is a really neat experience, whether you want to drive or hike it. The only thing that Station Casinos (Red Rock) is somewhat bad at, is communication. For comps, general questions, you name it, it takes FOREVER to get an answer. Calls are transferred around, front desk refers you to someone else... That person doesn't pick up.... nobody seems to be that much of a decision maker there. But aside from that it's truly a wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “Customer beware”
Reviews.Author: DanCormany
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Casino is a beautiful property, owned by a corporation teetering on bankrupcy. Perhaps this has resulted in reduced staffing, and a callous attitude by some who remain. I visited the casino on Sunday morning, August 9. In two hours, between 8 am and 10 am, my car was broken into in the casinos parking deck. They pried out the door panel, pried open the trunk, and still not getting inside, cut (twice) the convertible top. Now, no place is without some criminal behavior - although I was surprised that during Sunday morning daylight hours the burglar could have so much opportunity to attempt destructive breakin in so many ways without any security camera or guard seeing him. My caution to others is in how Station Casinos responded. They took a written report. No apologies (even for the inconvenience), no follow-up written or telephone contact. Essentially, it was "too bad, now leave". I didn't expect (nor did I ask) that they pay for damage, but some expression of concern would have gone a long way. Clearly, the person doing the burglaring had some heavy-duty tools with them - I'm glad I didn't return to the call sooner and interrupt their violence, or Red Rock could instead to ignoring my medical needs rather than just my vehicle damage. Know that if you go here, YOU ARE ON YOUR OWN if anything happens.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel lacking in customer service & bias (for a lack of better words)”
Reviews.Author: Artiva
Reviews.Content: Flew to Las Vegas from Northern Ca for a party at the Red Rock Casino; checked-in after 8pm only to find out that my stay was not on list even though she stated that there were rooms booked for this event in the family member's name. I stated that I was a family member, and I was the only member arriving on Thursday night. This event was planned approximately 2 months in advance. Common-in sense should have played a role in this conversation, i.e., I was part of the event. Needless to say I/we had no choice but to stay for the night and was assured that they would adjust my room charges to the group rate the following day (Friday). Following directions I went to the Hotel desk the next morning only to find out that the Clerk/Reservationist could not make the adjustment, it could only be handled by the person who reserved/booked the rooms (Mara). The Clerk/Reservationist stated that she would email her to phone our party who reserved the rooms. The phone call never came. We had to call her. Sunday, finally we tried again and was told that she spoke to the hotel manager and he said "No" this was not going happen, I would not be receiving the group rate, even though that was not what I was told. But, they would adjust/remove the "resort" fee. By this time I'm not sure I believe anything this hotel is saying or doing. I go down stairs so that I can speak to Mara directly. Wouldn't you know she would not come out to talk to me, I had just spoke to her, and it was obvious to me by the expression on the gentlemen's face who had went in to call her to the desk that she was there. Unfortunately for our group we had spent collectively over $4000.00 in this casino, meals, gambling, shopping, etc. during our entire stay. Oh, I don't want to forget the meal we had at the Grille Cafe after checking-in on Thursday night. Upon entering I noticed a man sitting on a bar stool on the back wall, but paid it no mine at the time. We were seated right away. We waited, and waited, and waited. Thirty minutes had passed, no water, only in passing "some one will be right with you". My daughter saw the waiter pass our area again and summoned him to our table and asked was someone going to wait on the two of us? He responded in haste that he was sorry (mind you every one around us was being waited on) that he was getting off work now and that they were trying to find someone to help us! Trying to find someone, are you kidding me? He did not seem embarassed that we stopped him but it appeared that he did not want to wait on our table. About 5 - 10 minutes later another waiter comes to the table to take our order. Now by this time (45 minutes later) I am frustrated with a loss of appetite. He takes our order. While waiting again I noticed a group of five people walking in to be seated three tables ahead of my table by the man I saw sitting on stool when we entered the restaurant. He seated them right away. I said to my daughter I wonder how long they're going to have to wait to eat. No sooner than I said this (less than 2 minutes) a waiter was at their table with his pad and pencil writing. Amazing. Meanwhile, we've been sitting close to an hour now and the waiter that was leaving to go home was still serving food. Imagine that! Wow! Unfortunately, I could not get the word to our group to not patronize this restaurant until after the fact and they experienced the same thing. I'am a working professional. I 've owned 2 small businesses, and 1 restaurant. I treat all customers the same regardless of race, gender, creed, or color. If you are only serving a certain race/group of people then you should post a sign outside your restaurant stating that fact. That way guest arriving will know not to stop. If your staffing per customer ratio is low then you can relay this to your customer upon their arrival, i.e., the wait time may exceed 5 or 10 minutes, etc. Never again! You can keep your "rock". The shopping I did in your casino, especially the shirts we purchased with your insignia engraved on them, will be donated to the Goodwill Stores. I believe in the power of the consumer, and the rule of 10. Which means I will not book another stay at your hotel, and tell ten people about my experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: goalieguy35
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel! As long as you don't mind the drive to the strip (YOU MUST RENT A CAR OR BRING YOUR OWN FOR THIS HOTEL), this hotel flat out rocks! I stayed there for a couple nights with my ex-gf...she complained all the time about the distance to the strip...she is 23 and I am 36...maybe that explains why I love this place! You wont find the Circus Circus next door. Check in was a breeze. The room was just awesome! Dark wood...great colors...floor to ceiling window that you could see the strip in the distance from. Fantastic bathroom...just really well done and thought out. I think the only issue I had with the room was the door. Seemed to really rattle when the people across the hall closed their door. The doors do slam shut at this place. We did go to their steakhouse one night...skip it. Food sucked...server seemed to want to get us out of there quickly. Would never go back to T-Bones. Didnt really hit the clubs there. Did do the buffet though...here is a tip that one of the locals gave us...PICK UP THE LOCAL NEWSPAPER on the weekend! In the front section, they put a buy one get one free coupon. This saved us prob $75-$100 for the trip! If you want to stay away from the strip and really enjoy yourselves...stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas,nevada”
Reviews.Author: artful-7
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Red Rock Hotel and it was great and upscale and 30 min from the Strip, which was so much better than staying on the Strip! the strip is where TiJuana meets Disneyworld. but all the restaurants were incredible on the Strip. if you take a cab, make sure you know the fastest and cheapest route otherwise you will get ripped off. the best part of the trip was taking a heliocopter ride to the Grand Canyon-totally incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, the best!”
Reviews.Author: mazdreams
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vegas frequently as our son plays poker professionally there. On our last visit, he took us to Red Rock as he thought we would like it. We got home and booked a stay there. We fly Allegiant and got a great deal for labor Day weekend, Air plus three nights for about $237 each. Our last stay was at TI, a supposed "4 Star" hotel. It looks like Motel 6 next to Red Rock. We arrived at noon on Fri. and walked right up to the check in desk. We asked for a room on a higher floor, fairly close to an elevator as re had read the hallways very long. Much to our surprise, we were given a room on the canyon/ mountain side on the 16th floor with incredible views, including views of the pool. The room was fantastic!! We travel a great deal, for both work and pleasure and this was as nice a hotel as I have ever been in The beds and linens are amazing, the furnishings and room art pleasing and the bathroom, with a separate walk in shower, deep dub with flat screen tv, double sinks, separate toilet area was amazing. The room could not have been any more comfortable. The pool area was great. Never overcrowded. Lots of servers and quick, personal service. Best poolside food I have had in Vegas- much cheaper than the pre-packaged crap the serve at the Wynn...Laid back atmosphere at the pool and uncrowded $5.00 blackjack tables at the pool bar. Found $5.00 BJ and craps tables in the casino as well. Slots seemed looser than on the Strip and the Race and sports book as nice as any in town and- they keep the drinks coming. Had a wonderful meal at the Italian restaurant our last night. Room service breakfast was prompt and delicious. All employees were friendly and seemed to go out of their way to make sure people were having a good time... friendly, helpful dealers9Jason at the BJ table and Steve the stickman and EVERYONE at the sports book! The pit bosses were even friendly! Smoke was no worse than other places. We did go to the strip on night to see Santana @the Hard Rock, great show BTW. Fortunately, our son drove as the free shuttle stops at nine. BUT Red rocks has a great lounge band and a lat night club along with theater complex w/ IMAX and a bowling alley w/ cosmic bowling. We had an incredible, relaxing stay here.Yes, you can hear music from the club on the west side of the building but at 1 or 2 am, I was too tired to be bothered. Yes, they do tack on $25 a day resort fee but, our trip was much cheaper than our last stay in town it did not matter. Only complaint was that we had a 7AM flight home Mon. and the airport shuttle doesn't start until then. Other than that, our stay was amazing and I can't see any reason why we would stay anywhere else. Mellow and laid back- if you need trendy, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! A great Conference location A+ Pool A+ Staff A+”
Reviews.Author: daniellepal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and could not be happier! Conference facilities were top notch. Food was great! The Italian place was the best IMO. Clean big rooms with a huge tub and bathroom. Great pool! Lots of servers out there! Free airport and strip shuttle service that were always on schedule. Easy check in and out. Fun gambling facilities. Shout out to C.J. a fellow bulldog fan! Great Staff in casino as well. Oh and Tryst was good. Good staff here as well! This was a new different type of Vegas experience for me but I would go back. Off the strip but, convientent with the shuttle!

Reviews.Title: “6th Stay - Still Awesome!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HomaChgo
Reviews.Content: Better than ever!!!!!!! This was our 6th stay. After 3 nights on the strip at the Flamingo, with it's loud and disrespectful crowd of college students and other undesirables, two nights at the Red Rock was a welcome escape. Everything you need is right there, no need to ever leave the resort. We still love it!!

Reviews.Title: “It was very restful.”
Reviews.Author: MaUigUrL808
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very spacious for 2 beds. The rooms were clean and organized. The pool was amazing. I have never seen a pool deck like that. They had one big pool and several smaller pools surrounding which was great because there were not as much people in the pool. Everything about this hotel was spectacular. There were activities for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy cell service-typical Vegas 'resort'”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights for a conference in August '09. What I found most interesting, & most annoying, was the fact that cell service & aircard service, for the laptop, were essentially non-existent as soon as one turned down the hall towards the guestrooms. Service for both was fine in the convention center & lobby, but in the room, even standing right next to the window, nothing. I realize these casinos don't want guests in their rooms for any reason, but this is just silly, not to mention petty. They also charge an additional 'resort' fee, on top of the nightly room rate, which includes guest room internet, allegedly wired & wi-fi. I ended up having to use the wi-fi, because the wired wasn't connected, which also confirms my suspicions that they were using some kind of blocking device to ensure only their own signals got thru. Again, very petty. Beds in the room were a platform type, w/no box spring, making them very low to get in/out of. And, since they don't use fitted bottom sheets on the bed, the platforms made it a bit difficult to remake the bed each night to keep the bottom sheet from wadding up. Bathroom was large & lovely, but not a single bit of ventilation in it. Considering the lone AC vent for the room itself was completely opposite of the bathroom, it would be quite steamy in there very quickly. Interestingly, this is the same set up as the Bellagio making me think they had the same designers! AC in the room also has a motion sensor that will turn the air flow off when no movement is detected; this made it difficult to really get the room cooled off or stay cool at night. As far as dining options go, we ate at the Grand Cafe, LBS, & the Salt Lick BBQ. Definately recommend the sweet potato fries @ LBS along w/the fried chicken & blackberry cobbler @ Salt Lick. Would I recommend this hotel to others? Depends on your reason for going. If you are simply going to gamble & sit by the pool, go for it. However, if your trip includes business for which you will need your cell or laptop, I'd suggest a non-gaming hotel, of which there are plenty, in the Vegas area instead (I've also made the same recommendation to the conference organizers).

Reviews.Title: “That Place Rocks”
Reviews.Author: TravelcookieGermany
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Red Rock Casino & Resort in July 2008 and found this a really fun place! As we booked at very short notice during the week we had a very good rate for our stay. Despite the last-minute booking via internet in the afternoon, check-in went smoothly in the evening. Our room was huge as was the bed and we had an impressing view onto The Strip in the distance, which was especially beautiful at night. There was a small exquisite hi-fi system in our room, including a CD especially arranged for the Red Rock Resort and the music brilliantly matched the surroundings and the view. The bathroom was equipped with very good smelling shower gel, body lotion etc. and very fluffy towels. It was shiny clean and in the evenings we found a note with the weather forecast as well as a small bedtime candy on our bed. A bit disturbing though was the mini bar, where you had to pay as soon as you lifted one of the contained articles for more than a few minutes. We also didn’t really like the hip hop music blaring all day at the pool, but this might be quite subjective. But as we stayed there during the week and the place was full of families rather than party people we didn’t really see any use in loud party music. But the pool area itself with all its different sized pools was just too divine to let the music spoil the lazy days there. Furthermore on the positive side of our stay was the lunch buffet offered for $10, 99 which was extremely diverse and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: San Diego is best
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel in N. Las Vegas for business. Red Rock was running an internet special for $75/nt plus $28 resort fee. The $28 resort fee included wifi which worked great, access to the spa, free shuttles to the airport & shopping (although the timing was not that convenient for me) and a daily newspaper.You could find a less expensive option, but not for the luxury. There was always someone opening the door for me, especially appreciated as I juggled a suitcase, a briefcase, a purse and a latte. Check-in was easy and I appreciated the mini bottles of water. You don't have to walk thru the casino to find the hotel elevators-very convenient. My room was on the 16th floor (16108) which overlooked the pool and setting sun. The higher numbers are further away from the elevators. The room was lovely and spacious. I took full advantage of the soaker tub with a plasma TV on the wall. The bed was so comfortable.My only criticisms are the blaring music throughout the hotel & elevators all the time and the room was dark in the morning as I was getting ready for the day-not enough lights. Minor issues. Next time I will bring my husband!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay on the strip again”
Reviews.Author: Anniesez
Reviews.Content: Red Rock was a diamond among gems in the Las Vegas area. Being away from the crowds on the strip and being able to actually see the natural beauty of Vegas was thrilling. The hotel's spa and amenities were unparalleled. The facility itself had everything a guest would want, from Starbucks, to movie theatre to bowling alley and of course, a great casino. And, jump in your car and you're 13 miles from the Vegas spectacle. Great place to stay, for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Loved it, Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kymberlee1967
Reviews.Content: Ok, first of all, this resort is quite a ways away from "the strip", so it would be wise to rent a vehicle. The hotel does offer a shuttle, however, it's last trip back from the strip is pretty darn early, and it will cost you around $100 for a cab. If you are looking for all the noise, commotion and crowds, then stay on the strip, because you will not find that at this hotel. I was soooo pleasantly suprised to NOT find one machine anywhere around the check in desk. How refreshing! ( I understand this is a gambling town, but all the bells and whistles get a little old after a bit!) We had two rooms and before we could even request they be together, the lady already had us in joining rooms. One room was ready and one was not. But hey, we checked in at 11 a.m.! so that was not a big deal. Extremely accomodating people at the check in. The pool? What can I say... OMG as my 17 yr old would say! Again, because you are away from the strip, you don't have the 35 kids in the hot tub splashing all over the place, or running by you and practically runnin ya over! There is no problem getting a lounge chair, in or out of the water. There are "mini" pools also. There is a separate pool, The Cherry Pool, which is for 21 and over and tops are optional. One thing? The drinks are some of the yummiest I have ever had, but they are $12 plus tax and tip. Just an FYI. Rooms? Another OMG. One of our rooms had 2 beds and the other a California King. The beds? If I could have stuck one in my suitcase, I most definately would have. They were truly THE most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. No lie. The bathrooms were fabulous...the tub was the size of a small pool with a plasma tv for you to watch while soaking (or swimming for that matter!) There is a 42 inch plasma tv in every room for all the boring people who spend their vacation in their room... :) The entire resort area is positively beautiful, from the landscaping to the chandalier (sp) in the area between the shops and casino. The shops were not so overly priced that you couldn't afford to even window shop. If I had one complaint, it would be one thing. I WORK for a living; and I had walked in and there was this poor lady on the floor with a spray bottle and a cloth...with a man in a suit (manager I imagine) pointing out a spot on the floor to her! I actually said to her "hand him the towel and tell him to do it himself". I don't think he liked that. I understand that she has a job, but to me? That was just demeaning...as a woman and as an employee... but that is my only complaint. I could go on forever, but I won't if you would like to e-mail me, please do so (kymberlee1967@aol.com)

Reviews.Title: “It was suppose to be a girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dahliah
Reviews.Content: Talk about dissappoinment! My 12 year old says she will never go back because the service was so poor! The front desk was laxed and could care less about anything. The pool so beautiful however there were only 14 umbrellas for the entire pool meaning if you didn't steal one or rent a $200.00 cabana you could bake in the 102. degree sun. The list could go on but the best thing I could suggest is miss the rock as I won't be going back there for a planned concert.

Reviews.Title: “Not like any other 3 star hotel, 1 star maybe”
Reviews.Author: JZJT
Reviews.Content: Started off bad when we arrived and the room was unkept. The luggage rack was broken, the floor was unvacuumed and one of the robes had something green and flaky on the collar (not a stain). We didn't have bath rugs until the second day. I guess you don't know what your supposed to have until you get it. The alarm had been set to go off at 5:41am - not by us. We were on a nonsmoking floor, but that doesn't stop cigarette smoke from coming in through the vents in the bathroom. About once a day I would come back to my room and it would smell like someone had been smoking in my room. The first restaurant we went into the seats were dirty and I cleaned them off before I sat down. Two other couples were seated after us, both of them were waited on first. After a 10 minute wait, we left. The restaurant wasn't busy. On my last day, the housekeeper knocked on my door around 8:30am - even though I had my do not disturb light on. She said she was told by the front desk that I had already left. I'm glad I answered the door when I did, or I have a feeling she would have walked on in.
