They like to make sure your awake early at Red Rock I guess. There was no sign to have them make your bed, they just don't. After 4 nights it might have been nice to have been offered linen changes - even though I probably wouldn't (to conserve water). When I made my reservation I told them that I was making it two months in advance so I didn't end up at the far end of the hotel from my conference. That didn't work either. Although they did offer to let me wait around until someone else left. I contacted the front desk 4 times, once by phone and 3 times in person with concerns. Apparently they didn't care because when I made them aware of the problems again at checkout, they said they didn't have any records of my concerns. I have been told twice since then that they are looking into concerns but need to "investigate". Didn't know a crime took place, just wanted good service. You may just want to save money and go the Days Inn. This is the 4th resort we've stayed at in Vegas and we loved all the others. Not a relaxing place but if your planning on being drunk the whole time, then may be OK. Also, don't plan to relax by the pool after 7:00pm, it closes early and your not even allowed to sit on the chairs and relax. They did have a great spa.

Reviews.Title: “had a very unimpressed time”
Reviews.Author: paulk1234
Reviews.Content: if you are over 30 do not go to this hotel as the disco starts at 10.pm till4 am and there is no where in this to hide we were on the 19th floor and all night long it was boom boom

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience”
Reviews.Author: elle2769
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Red Rock about 5-6 times and each time it is a great experience. We enjoy being off the strip and away from the crowds. This hotel has a large casino, many restaurants, a food court, a nice movie theater and is still only a few minutes from the buzz of the strip. The rooms are always clean and roomy and well appointed. The only complaint is the length of the hotel corridors. Highly recommend that you request a room near to the elevators - otherwise you will have quite a walk ahead of you each morning and evening.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a local and this is where I went on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tconk40554
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is a good bargain for a resort hotel without resort prices. Everything is fresh and new. The views are the best in Vegas and even though you're only a short ride away from the strip you might as well be a hundred miles away. Me and my wife just spent our anniversary there and we had a blast. If your a die hard, have-to-hit-10-casinos-a-day, tourist, then you might not like this property. But if you want a laid back, full service resort with the option to hit the strip only when you want to ...you like it here.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy Service”
Reviews.Author: A32mil
Reviews.Content: I've stay at Red Rock hotel many times and I finally experience an horrorable experience. Booked my room 2 months prior to my visit. Requested for 2 queens at the time. Got to the hotel today. Checked in around 6pm (check in starts at 3pm). WAS told absolutely no more 2 queens and pretty much gave me that "too bad crap attitude". Begged for one without success. Gave me the key/room number to my room and later found out they put the wrong room number on the key-holder. Furious went down to tell them about the wrong room number and was given that "it happens attitude" without no apology. So I have been here no more than 2 hours and I already can't wait to leave this hotel. After many good visits, I might have to say that this is probably is my last stay here. This type of customer service is totally not acceptable during this time. I'm waiting for that roll-away bed and typing this review at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon2
Reviews.Content: Just like the title WOW we stayed in the presidential suite wow a pool table a bar a couple TVs 2 bedrooms and 2 bath rooms and a giant bathroom let me tell you about the bath room two TVs a sunken bath tub and two state of the ark beday/toliets i mean wow it IS worth the price if you want hotel luxury get a hotel host to help you get the big suites 100% great

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: hvtrillo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Red Rock over 4th of July weekend. Two favorite hotels in LV are Red Rock and Green Valley Ranch, the 2 high-end resorts in the Station Casinos lineup. Excellent steakhouses are always our last night splurge. Pools are fantastic, and we spent 5 hours at the pool each day - still have umbrellas at RR but they are gone at GVR as of our trip there last May. Beds are soooo comfortable and rooms very clean with nice decor. Don't touch the honor bar unless you want to buy the stuff as it's on an electronic system.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Copas2008
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel is the 3rd time i stayed there and for me is the best one in Vegas the only really bad thing is the location but if you don;t mind to drive couple of miles to get to the Strip you will be fine...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: goolow
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful rooms, clean workout facilities, huge movie theater on site, lots of good restaurants. I liked that it was off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “awsome”
Reviews.Author: KennyPowers1
Reviews.Content: i have stayed a alot of hotels in lasvegas and the red rock is at the top me and my family have satyed at this property numerous times and each time its the same excellent. the staff treats you like a king the rooms are clean and nice the reasturants and great and there is something for everyone. if your looking for a break from the strip and a great plaace to take the family visit the redrock

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PJinAK
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms with beautiful views. Staff helpful; even the facilities engineer stopped to ask me if I needed directions. Modern, crisp, interesting style. Negative: pool didn't seem to open at night.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience under one roof!”
Reviews.Author: Audi4d
Reviews.Content: I have been to LV multiple times staying mostly in hotels along the Strip. This last trip, I stayed in Red Rock with couple of girlfriends for a relaxing weekend. Our stay was great! Here are what I considered plus factors of RR: Room: rate was low (thanks to my local friend), clean, smells good, nice amenities, comfortable beddings, spacious; Pool: big and very inviting; Buffet: considerable selection of food; Cafe: heavenly dessert; Cherry's Club: shorter line compared to other clubs along the Strip, plus girls get in for free!; Spa: free use since we were staying in the hotel; free newspaper; hotel staff: nice and courteous. I just wish that they have a coffee maker in the room and a better wireless service. Will definitely stay in this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion ruined by Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: SBfamily
Reviews.Content: We had been planning a family reunion for my parents' 50th wedding anniversary for many months. We had 4 families all traveling from afar to stay at the Red Rock. My sister arrived first and secured her room and my parents' room. An hour later, my brother and I showed up with our families. We were told that they overbooked and had to move us to a Marriott "just down the road" that was suppose to be of "equal caliber" as the Red Rock. We saw them tell other bewildered families the same story. Red Rock's management was vague about why we were being moved, but what I pieced together is a large convention was coming in and they were giving away our rooms to conventioneers. They even said that they didn't know of the "problem" until this week, and admitted that we place our reservation well in advance of the convention being booked. But, the conventioneers came first in their eyes. They couldn't tell us why they didn't contact us prior to our arrival to let us know of this problem, to allow us to find other accommodations. So, my brother and I went to the Marriott. It was NOT right down the road. It took 15 minutes to get there from the Red Rock. It was NOT EVEN CLOSE to being at the same luxury level as the Red Rock. It's like comparing a 5 star hotel to a 3 star. It was filled with an over-70 crowd. It was horrible. Our family reunion was ruined, as two families were in a different hotel than the other two. Our kids were heartbroken. So, if you want to take your chances and book this hotel, I hope they honor your reservation but you might not want to take the chance and instead head out to a luxury hotel on the strip. I was a repeat customer at the Red Rock, but sadly, I can't allow myself to ever return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “I could feel the bass from the CHERRY BAR on the 19th Floor”
Reviews.Author: DriveBMW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock for 4 nights business. The Hotel was great except the Cherry Club was to loud. I could hear the bass BUM BUM BUM until 3:30 AM on Friday and Saturday this waste $250.00 a night. I check out on Sunday. I tried ....

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Luxurious accomodations. Everything under one roof.”
Reviews.Author: SCManatee
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I never had any desire to visit Las Vegas. I was "wowed" by the accomodations. Sightseeing was not an option, although I did step over to the GORGEOUS pool area for about 15 minutes to take a break from our work. The room was SO beautiful and plush! I was in awe of the marble bathroom with both the walk-in shower AND the wonderful tub with flat-panel television. The beds were comfy and I enjoyed opportunities to retire to my room for absolute comfort between duties. The variety of restaurants, including the buffet-style feast, were very reasonable and quick to serve. I would LOVE to go back with my husband for a leisure trip. The water provided in the lobby and spa areas were a welcome respite from the heat in mid-June, but I highly advise packing your lip balm! A trip to the gift shop to ease my chapped lips cost me $8.00!

Reviews.Title: “The best off the strip”
Reviews.Author: digitalrenee
Reviews.Content: I love Vegas, but in small doses. If you're looking for a place to stay that has all the amenities of a real resort without the obnoxiousness of the strip, this is the place. It has more than just a casino with a movie theater, bowling alley, tons of restaurants (although not the BEST), and a spa to die for. Even if you don't end up staying here, GO TO THE SPA. If you get a massage, go early to soak in the mineral pool before hand. You get all day access to a private pool as well and you can have your lunch delivered to enjoy on the deck. It is the top of luxury and the nicest I've ever been to. The rooms are to die for. I was ready to take the bathroom home with me. The tub was perfect for a romantic evening soaking with your lover. Everything about this place was top notch. Yes, it is about 15 minutes from the strip, but it's close enough that it's not a big deal to drive over there for the evening. And unlike the other hotels on the strip, the lobby doesn't get crowded with herds of people passing through. We went with a family group (all adults) and the hotel had enough going on that we could spend time together, but not too much :) We also did the kayaking tour they offer and it was TOTALLY worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Almost Perfect Resort”
Reviews.Author: HuntingtnBeachGidget
Reviews.Content: The Good: This place is really beautiful in every way. The lobby, the casino, the restaurants, the rooms were all very upscale. The staff members we dealt with, especially the parking valets and the pool people, were friendly and seemed to genuinely care about whether or not we were enjoying ourselves or needed anything. We like the location away from the Strip because we like to fly to Vegas and rent a fun car like a Mustang convertible, so driving to and from the resort is no problem, and then we can also drive around in Red Rock Canyon which is beautiful. Who needs to be on the Strip (especially if you've "Been there/Done that") when you can have views of Red Rock Canyon? Also, there is almost no smell of cigarette smoke in this resort. The only time we smelled cigarettes was when we were in the casino and were right next to a smoker, and then we could just quietly walk away. (By contrast, on a previous trip last month, we stayed in a condo, and we went into the Tropicana to eat a quick bite, and we were literally blown away by the disgusting smoky smells at that old hotel - from the minute we walked in the door, throughout the entire casino, and in the restaurant. Our clothes and hair reeked after we left the Tropicana, and I doubt we will ever go back in there again!) The Red Rock must have more modern air exchangers, because the air was truly fresh, everywhere we went in there. The backyard is what they call the pools area, and it was also spectacular. You can tell from the photos on this website that they don't have any of the traditional old-timey lounge chairs around the pools. Instead there are these really comfortable single and double beds. Some are round, and others are in the shallow water at the edge of the main pool. There are many pools and an interesting fountain. We had booked a package called Party at the Pool, not something I would have chosen ordinarily, but I happened on it on their website, and found that we would actually save significant money on our room and as a free bonus have some fun at the pool with a ca-bed, some snacks, and liquor thrown in. The room in the package is a signature suite which is very very nice. It has a living room area, bedroom, and two bathrooms, one of which is a toilet and vanity, and the other is a full bathroom larger than some hotel rooms I've seen. Everything in the suite was first class from the three televisions to the linens and bed, to the toiletries. The sound proofing was excellent and we heard no noises from the hallways or footfalls from rooms above us. When I booked this package, I had no idea what the ca-bed is or what bottle service at the pool means, but the cost of the suite went down and the rest of the package was thrown in, so it was a no-brainer! Here's what it turned out to be: The ca-bed is a little upgrade at the pool. It is not a traditional cabana which is much much nicer, but very expensive. The ca-bed is like a canopy structure around the lounging bed. It has canvas curtains on the sides that you can untie for privacy, I guess, but no cover on the top of the canopy to shade you from the sun. I do not think I would have found the ca-bed to be worth its cost separately from the package, but, by booking the package, as I said, we got the ca-bed, chips and salsa, bottle service, and the suite for much less money, so yeah the package was a great deal. By the way bottle service means that the server at the pool brings you a bottle of your choice of a premium liquor and whatever mixers you want, plus lime slices, cups, and ice buckets. Things were looking pretty good to us after that!!! The food we ordered at the pool was excellent, by the way. We got some appetizers like chicken satay skewers and coconut shrimp, all with different dipping sauces. Later, my husband also got some hot dog sliders which he loved. Do not leave any of your food when you get up to dip in the pool as the crows are always watching for any opportunity to move in for a feast! The bad: The only problems we had on this trip were with the suite. It took them three tries to get it right. At first we were sent up to a suite with a view of the backyard and mountains that still had the previous guests' luggage in it! This was a new experience for us. It was really a shock to open the door (yes, our keys worked) and find someone else's luggage standing inside the door as if the people were maybe waiting to move to a different suite. We called out, but there was no one inside, just luggage. It was about 3 p.m., too late for them to be waiting to check out (check out time is noon), so the only thing I can think of is that they were waiting for a better room to be ready. We beat a hasty retreat back to the lobby, and they were as surprised as we were by the luggage in the room. They couldn't find us another equivalent suite and told us we may have to wait a while for one to be cleaned. At this point we were getting pretty frazzled, and when they wanted to give us a suite on a floor designated as a smoking floor (I think there are two of those floors), we asked if we could just have an upgrade (no) or a break on the price. The clerk offered us $50 food credit for being on a smoking floor, but my husband was not happy about having to do that. The clerk went to talk to a manager, and after about 10 minutes came back having "found" another suite for us. When we got up there, oh my gosh it was horrible! I think they had taken it out of service and that is why it didn't show on the clerk's computer. The minute we walked in we could hear the water pipes rumbling like a locomotive. The sound varied from a drumming sound to a very loud chugging. If you turned on the water, it stopped. My husband was getting cranky and looked at me like I was crazy when I asked him if he wanted to go back down to the lobby and try for yet another room. Since the sound was mainly in the living room, that night we just closed the bedroom door, and we could barely hear it unless it was in its chugging phase. At about 2 a.m., he yelled to me over the chugging sound, "Let's call the desk in the morning and ask if there is another room!" Two other problems with the room were that it was on the 4th floor, "Strip view" side, and actually gave a view of a parking garage and the side of a building. It was depressing, especially since the windows were totally coated with grime. When I called down, they apologized and found us another room which was to be ready between 1 and 3 p.m. It wasn't ready at 1 or at 3. After 4, they finally had a room for us, and it was spectacular. It was on the 8th floor and had a view of the backyard and those beautiful mountains we had come there for! Clear windows! No noise from the pipes! Hooray!!!!! Bottome line: I do not hold it against them that they had to try three times to get us a decent room, and I will definitely go back there again! The food at the pool was the best. The buffet was really good as was the cafe. As another Trip Advisor reveiwer noted, the beers you can order brought to you within the buffet were the best price, so thanks for that great tip! By the way, we had a ball gambling at the Red Rock. Although we've been to Vegas many times, our most recent gambling had been at some of the Indian casinos like Pechanga and Pala where the slots odds do not seem to be good at all. But at the Red Rock, we got many many smaller payouts all the time which made it lots of fun, and we got one or two nice bigger payouts so we didn't feel like total idiots. All in all I'm sure we left a little more money in their machines than they gave back to us, but it seemed like the slots were looser there, and it was much more fun hearing all the bells and whistles going off all the time. All in all, I highly recommend the Red Rock. It was well worth the money, especially since we found that special on their website that brought the cost down and the fun way way up.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly Vegas”
Reviews.Author: keirao
Reviews.Content: This being my 12 trip to Vegas, I wanted to try out a new hotel (as I usually try to do each time) I will keep this brief... Red Rock is WAY off the strip. Not Palms off the strip, but $45 cab ride off the strip, so don't plan on having any "traffic" in your hotel with the exception of hotel guests and LOTS of locals. The only way to describe the pool is odd. Although it looks very pretty, there are limited umbrellas (as in all of Vegas) and the first row of chairs is immersed in water so there is really no place to put your stuff unless you grab a mini table. Even still the tables are tiny, so my friend and I had quite a few things fall into the pool throughout our stay. LOTS of families and kids (which is fine if that is what you want) Music was great for one day while we were there. The second day they were preparing for a concert so music was shut off and we listened to sound checks all afternoon at top volume. The following day "Cherry" the topless pool/bar area had their own music which wasnb't really loud enough to hear, but obviously loud enough for them to not put on their music. Because of the things falling off tables into the water, there were quite a few floating cups and bottles in pool which just made it look disgusting. Food was good. We ate at Terra Rosa (which was okay) and TBones (which was also okay) There was NO stanbd out service at all here, and the steak looked like about half the size of one I would get in NYC for the same price. Although prices were pretty reasonable. The bartender in the lobby bar was the one exception to stand out service. He made the best chocolate martinis and balanced us all night with fresh water so we wouldn't get drunk! Food at the outdoor/pool restaurant was surprisingly good and service was pretty fast. Spa OUTSTANDING. best massage and facial and facilities were very very nice. They do tack on a 20% gratuity automatically, but they ask if you would like to adjust it at the end of the service. I left the 20%. My bill was close to $500 for two treatments, so be prepared to buck up. Casino Most tables were $10 minimum and they had pretty much every game. I only played blackjack and craps. Dealers were pretty friendly. Overall I would NOT recommend this hotel if you have never been to Vegas. Stay somewhere on the strip. This hotel seems like it wants to be hip/trendy/cool, but it ends up being something else that I just cannot identify. Still hail Bellagio and Mirage as my favorites ( I have written reviews on them as well)

Reviews.Title: “Has the amenities...if youre willing to pay”
Reviews.Author: jensational829
Reviews.Content: The resort was nice of course, but I thought it was overpriced. The rooms werent cheap, then the "resort" fee charge, and way too expensive minibar compared to other places in vegas. It was a nightmare for me to call the resort and have them give me specifically where the shuttle pickup was, then my check in took forever. While its a nice place no doubt, I felt the service was hit or miss and I hate being nickel and dimed.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find - Looking forward to our next visit”
Reviews.Author: pots2005
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Red Rock as we had tickets to see the Allman Brothers who were appearing there. We were impressed by the reviews and hoped that the Resort would live up to them - it certainly did. Our room was well appointed, clean, very comfortable and the television over the deep tub was a real bonus! There are plenty of dining options to suit all tastes and budgets. We ate in the 24 hour Grand Cafe and the excellent Buffet. The food was excellent quality in both however the choice at the buffet was terrific from soups to salads; Asian to bbq; American to Italian; Desserts to Pastries, to name just some of the stations. During our three night stay as well as the Allmans concert and playing the casino we took in the new Star Trek film at the excellent 16 screen cinema but didn't have time for bowling at the in house bowling lanes or even relaxing by the beautiful pool. It is a very different Las Vegas experience and one we thoroughly enjoyed and will repeat. It is a great way to get away from The Strip for a few days to relax and unwind but still be able to play the tables or slots. It is not the place to stay if you want to see a differnt show on The Strip every night as it is about a $50 cab ride into the City. It is also about $50 to and from the Airport. One tip - the Lobby and Casino elevators are at one end of the hotel. We had room 155 out of a possible 158 and had to walk almost tjhe length of the hotel to get to our room. If you dont want to walk so far to get to your room ask for one with a low number!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you have kids”
Reviews.Author: MeltemB
Reviews.Content: Our stay @ Red Rock was just awesome. The pool was very kid friendly and it was not crowded at all. We visited all other big hotels on the strip, and they were all packed with people. Since Red Rock is about 20 min away from the strip, it's a great choice if you have kids. Kidquest offers a great daycare service so you can have some alone time with your significant other or do some gambling while your kids are playing with other children. A rental car is a must if you are staying at Red Rock cause transportation may get expensive. We had a great time and wouldn't stay anywhere else when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our return already!”
Reviews.Author: makin-memories
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Las Vegas twice before and stayed on the strip. We don't gamble much other than cheap slot machines, so this time we wanted to stay outside of town, away from the crowds, and do some hiking. The Red Rock fit our needs perfectly! This is a beautiful resort and there are so many things to do here that you could never leave the place and still have a great time! We went bowling there and ate at three of their restaurants, gambled a little in the casino, and had a wonderful time. We rented a car and went hiking in the Red Rock National Park, which is lovely and well worth spending a day exploring. We drove to the strip one day and walked around. The pool at the resort was beautiful, but we never had time to go swimming. We only stayed two nights, so we didn't get to do all that is available at the resort. I highly recommend the LBS restaurant---the hamburgers and salads are delicious! Also, be sure to try the Grand Cafe---luscious desserts and superb sandwiches---also a very good breakfast. You can get a dessert and cup of milk to take to your room for a late night treat there. We ate at the Feast Buffet only once and found that the alcohol is MUCH cheaper there than anywhere else in the resort---2 dollar beers---that's a bargain, and the food and service were good. The only drawback is the waiting in line---but the price is worth the wait. As in other reviews, it is true that the mini-bar in the room is way overpriced and you get charged if you even move anything in it---so we did not touch it! Also, the bars in the casino can get quite smoky---for non-smokers this is a drawback. We liked sitting at the bars playing the slots, but as soon as a smoker sat by us, we left and went to the non-smoking part of the casino. As for the room, it was perfect! The bathtub is HUGE---you could almost swim laps in it! And the toiletries are very good quality. The robes are a nice touch, too. Also, we discovered that there is a "Do Not Disturb" button that you can push that is right next to the door---it is easy to overlook, and if you don't use it, the maids will knock on your door constantly in the morning to check and see if you are ready to have your room cleaned. I didn't see the button until our second night. The only thing about the room I didn't like is that it is pretty dark---there are no lights in the center of the room. Other than that, the bed is heavenly and the view is amazing (we were on the canyon side). My husband and I have traveled all over the world and rarely go back to the same place twice, but we want to go back to the Red Rock and stay for a week, rent a car, and visit all the national parks nearby. We are already planning to return during Thanksgiving week next year. We loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Get off the strip be where its hip”
Reviews.Author: winetour
Reviews.Content: Friendly door man no pressure to tip ! Check in was the normal wait . The lobby is clean The rooms are clean house keeping is friendly and quick . The pool is where its all at if your not in the casino , the pool side service is the best Ive ever had !!!! , where we had great payouts on the slots. Plenty of places to eat . The wife always said she never wants to go to Las Vegas but we had to be there for busniess SHE LOVED THE RED ROCK HOTEL POOL ! We are going back

Reviews.Title: “Top notch rooms, plenty of food choices, friendly dealers.”
Reviews.Author: PhxPE
Reviews.Content: Just got back from one night at the Red Rock and I am really impressed with this place. I booked it on Hotwire (they don't tell you the hotel until after you confirm payment) and got a great deal (choose a 4-star west of the strip and this is probably the hotel you will get; got the room for $65 plus the resosrt fee). From the airport, if you are lucky you will catch the free shuttle to the hotel but if not, a cab can run $60+ (it will vary on the driver and the route). Go to the other side of the terminal and you can get a Town Car for $66 (fixed rate). There is also no line usually for the Town Car/Limo area while the cab line can be long. It is about a 30-40 minute drive to the hotel from the airport but it could take longer during rush hour. The check-in was easy and quick and I was off to my room in no time. The room was great. Clean and well designed with a very comfortable bed and a 42" plasma on the wall (no HD channels). The room reminded me of The Hotel at Mandalay Bay but without the living room (hopefully that makes some sense). I had a view of the pool which looked awesome but I didn't get to it on this trip. The bathroom in the room is well appointed with a soaking tub with LCD TV mounted on the wall at the foot of the tub. The separate shower is nice but no rain head as I thought I saw in some other reviews. (The head is a little higher on the wall so for some, this may have appeared to be a rain head but I am on the taller side so no such luck for me.) There are a bunch of restaurants but I only tried two of them. Since the Mets were playing and I wanted to catch the game, I got a burger from their food court (Fatburger-what an unfortunate if not accurate name). It was tasty. Also I had breakfast at the buffet. One tip-get their player's club card and you get a dollar off the price but only if you also set up a pin number first. Do this at the player's club area. No pin number, no discount. The casino workers were friendly and there were plenty of tables available. I played craps and they had $10 min at night and $5 min during the day. (Typical 3x4x5x odds) Overall, the entire place was really attractive and without the nuttiness of the strip. I will definitely stay here again. (The free shuttle back to the airport is a lot easier to get since it runs on a consistent schedule but get in line 10 or so minutes before it leaves otherwise it may fill up. They do have a couple of cars there to take you to the airport for $55 fixed rate according to the bell man I spoke with.)

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the hidden fee”
Reviews.Author: dennisfr
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, there is a $27 "resort fee," which supposedly covers airport shuttle service (whether or not you use it), the fitness room (whether or not you use it -- and of course fitness rooms are generally free), etc. When I checked out, I told the young lady at the desk that this meant the room was actually $217, rather than the $190 I had agreed to when I made my reservation on the internet, and she politely agreed. I then said that this meant the hotel was lying on its website, and she politely agreed. (I can't swear that the fee isn't mentioned somewhere on the website, but it certainly isn't noticeable.) I then said I thought she should waive the charge, and she politely said no, they used to do that when people asked, but not any more. Other things about the hotel were fine, but for me, this bogus hidden charge is disqualifying -- I wouldn't stay there again, and I wouldn't recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: brians6542
Reviews.Content: (review being written by a 30-something year old male) Just spent 4 days and 3 nights at Red Rock Resort. Overall my 6th trip to Vegas, and first time ever staying "off the strip". Past hotels include "TheHotel", "Bellagio", "Monte Carlo", "Venetian", and "Wynn". For the price, this is definitely up there. Pros: ***Spa was really nice and relaxing. Secluded private 'spa only' pools, hot tubs, cabanas, etc etc... ***Poolside cabanas 200/day weekdays 350/day fri-sat-sun. 32" plasma tv, couches, mister, ceiling fan, spekers, private changing room in cabana, dedicated wait staff, complimentary unlimited water, red bull, naked juice (4 flavors), sparkling water, fruit platter, nuts, and salsa/chips. Poolside bar a little expensive, but not over the top. $15 burger, $12 margarita. ***King signature suites are about 1000/sq feet. 2 42" plasmas, bose clock-radio with supplied iPod hookup cable, 1 and 1/2 bath, 4 phones, complimentary shoe-shine service (i got mine done twice!), wet bar, 2 fridges, really comfy beds. HUGE whirlpool tub, plasma in the bathroom, separate water closet in master bathroom, room safe was oversized and in the wall so it didn't take up 1/2 the closet, very clean. ***LBS burger joint was great ($30 for 2 people incl. tip - not bad for lunch - average) ***Diner 'Grand Cafe' was good and super cheap ($20 for 2 people incl. tip for lunch) ***Starbucks on site open 24/7 right outside of casino ***TONS of non-smoking sections within the casino ***There's a CVS/Supermarkey nearby which is definitely 'walkable' if you're in halfway decent shape if you need some incidentals, or would like to stock the spare fridge with some stuff. ***Bingo Hall had secluded smoking section. (Yes, we're 30 and tried playing bingo hahaha) - very fun ***Staff was super helpful and friendly. They have "A3 Service" which stands for "anything, anytime, anywhere" - basically you call down and if you want cocoa puffs with a pair of Adidas at 3am - they'll get it for you. Didn't test it out, but seems like it would be nice to have in an emergency. ***Overall clientele was on the 'clean-cut' side. Not being a snob, but you know what I mean... not too much trailer trash and/or hood-rats. ***Town Car Drivers from BLS Limo out front were great. Even offered free line cut passes to us for Ghost Bar and Excess for nothing. I'm not a club person so I didn't take them up on it. Either way a nice gesture. Cons: ***Free "Shuttle" to the strip only runs a few times a day, and is first come-first serve, and only runs until 10pm. (lets face it ... do they really want you spending your money at other casinos?) We took it once, and it only drops you off at the fashion show mall which is all the way at the northern-most end of the strip. It was crowded and hot. The rest of the time we took a town car to the strip at $55/trip....Probably spend a good $300-400 just on transportation to and from the strip for the 4 days/3 nights we were there... Then again, if you're looking to save $$, stay in old vegas. ***Free Internet is only available in the rooms, while all public areas are billed at $9.99 for every two hours.... ***Shower wasn't as hot as I liked it - but not everyone likes a super hot shower, so this may not be a 'con' to everyone Hope this helps you plan your trip. Feel free to email me at [--] with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff is Unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: WVMountaineerTravel
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Las Vegas and stayed at the Red Rock Resort. The front desk employees were unorganized and unhelpful (lost reservations, double charged credit card). When I called the desk, I was told that it would be up to a week before the charges were revfersed.There is a $27 per night fee (mandatory) for amenities even if you don't use any of their services. The fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, but did not work on every floor. We had to call the front desk each day to make sure the billing was correct, and it was still wrong. The hotel advertises free shuttle service to / from the strip and to / from the airport, but it only runs a few times a day. Our flight arrived at 8:10 and was told that the shuttle stops running at 8. We had to take a $120 limo to the resort. The shuttle to the strip runs only at 3 and 6 and return trips are at 6:30 and 9:30. Most of the time the shuttle is full, and a cab ride is $50 one way or $100 round trip from the strip. The rooms were clean and well-maintained. The scenery is good, and the pool is very nice. The consierge was very helpful and is one of the few bright spots to the trip.

Reviews.Title: “$27 resort fee, but can't get a cup of coffee in the morning”
Reviews.Author: Victoria_BCTabitha
Reviews.Content: There was no coffee in the room. Up for an early flight, we wandered around for 30 minutes looking for coffee, finally paying $2.50 for a stale cup at the casino bar. We were charged a mandatory $27/night 'resort fee', the value of which was never apparent. The room was comfortable, but the front desk staff were aloof at best and seemed determined to not tell us any information about what the hotel had to offer, besides the obvious casino. The website advertises free shuttle service to the airport, but be cautioned that the shuttle only operates on a schedule from 7 am to 9 pm. No other shuttles go to the hotel, so be prepared to spend $60 on a taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “What an Experience!”
Reviews.Author: JustATravelGurl
Reviews.Content: Walking into this hotel was breath taking! We had made reservation online from their website and when we went to check in there wasn't a hassle in finding our paper work. The girl at the front desk was very helpful, and answered any questions we had. When we got to our room it was perfect! Perhaps it's because this Hotel is just 'new', but everything in it was clean, fresh and tidy. Although, at about 1AM we heard a knock on the door and someone was attempting to come in! When we called to the Frontdesk and asked who it might have been she was just as astounded as we were and suggested it was House Keeping - at 1AM! It seems they work 24hrs, so i advised that when you head to bed to keep your door lock inside and put the DO NOT DISTURB switch on! But other then this little incident, we were left alone for the remainder of our stay and totally recommend this hotel. Just a quick tip: please note that this hotel is is located off the strip and it's quite a drive out if you rather be closer to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “VEGAS at its best - AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: skay448
Reviews.Content: Lots of reviews already saying the same thing. Great place, great pool with plenty of room (not like Bellagio, Pillazo, Mandalay). We loved it here. We landed here by mistake because it was last minute and all the comps we have at other properties were not available on the Fri/Sat we arrived. So nice, so luxurious, so open, so clean, so friendly ... the food is reasonably priced at their fancy restaurants. This is more of a local spot where they go when they want to go out fancy. The locals don't hang on the strip which is touristy! HIked in Red Rocks Canyon for the day. That is amazing must do especially if you bring your kids. Will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rocks as a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: miznina
Reviews.Content: We traveled here with our kids, ages 10 and 12, and I thought I would share some of the aspects of the hotel from a family perspective, with some practical tips about the hotel that might help others out. First, the hotel is new, and all decorated in a post-modern style in dark brown, red and lime green. The rooms are spacious enough for a family of 4 not to feel cramped. There are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room, and the mini bar is packed. They have a 45 second mini bar rule...if anything is moved in the mini bar for longer than 45 seconds: it's yours! Unlike many hotels, you do not have the option of empyting your mini fridge. Views: one side is the Red Rocks canyon (a few miles away) and the pool; the other side is the Strip (about 10 miles away) and some very empty, open dirt spaces for construction that has come to a screeching halt. The canyon side is great if you are going to be in your room a lot during the day; the Strip side obviously for night time. Elevators: There are about 60 rooms on each floor. The rooms are numbered this way: You have your floor number, followed by 1, then your number, with the number closest to the elevator being 01, and the furtherest being 60. So, if you were on floor 17 and had room number 49 (49 rooms from the elevator!), your room number would be 17149. There is only one elevator from the lobby, and as many have commented, it is a loooooong walk to those rooms with the high numbers. I would try and ask for a room number lower than 30. There is a second elevator in the middle of the hallway, around room 30, but that only goes out to the pool area. If you think you're going to spend a lot of time going back and forth to the pool, the rooms around 30 would be great. There are a lot of family friendly activities possible on-site. There is a movie theatre, and a bowling alley. Monday has $1 games, and there is a family bowling package available for a family of four: 2 hours and 4 shoe rentals for $40. There is day care center for kids up to age 12, with things like Wii and Xbox games, but we were told you needed vaccination records to check your kid in. Since that's not really high on my packing list, we didn't inquire further. Next to the day care center is an arcade area with all the usual Chuck E. Cheese/Lazer Star games. However, never forget that the reason this hotel exists is to keep people gambling. The pool closes at 6 pm, and there's a sign saying that no kids are allowed to be unaccompanied in the hotel past 7 pm. There were a lot of kids in the pool when we were there (it was Spring Break); if you want a serene getaway, the spa has it's own lap pool. The spa is available for free (well, there's the daily resort fee) to all guests and is a wonderful place for guests 18 and older. You have the exercise room, outdoor lap pool and cabana area. In separate men/women's sections you have a hot tub, rain shower, dry and steam saunas and full shower facilities. Tea, fruit and water free to guests. Towels and robes provided. A great place to hide from the kids for an hour! Food: The Feast Buffet is great for families. If you sign up for their hotel 'Boarding Pass' card, breakfast is only $6.99. Check out the daily newspaper that gets delivered to your room. While we were there, page 2 of the paper always had a 'buy 1/get 1 free' coupon to the Feast Buffet. If you are a guest in the hotel, you may enter from the right side, rather than standing in the normally very long line on the left side. On the hotel website, I signed up for their 'dinner and a movie' package, but when we checked in at the hotel, we were allowed to convert all that credit into just a food credit, which was great, since we never did end up seeing any movies while we were there. And last, I can't emphasize enough that when you stay at this hotel, you are a LONG way away from Las Vegas, and technically you are in Summerlin, not LV. There is a definite feeling of being in the middle of nowhere (although you do have shopping centers right across the street). We liked that quiet and the isolation (as well as the proximity to Red Rocks Canyon - a definite recommend). However, if you are coming to Las Vegas for fun and action on The Strip, this is NOT, NOT, NOT the place to be. Oh, and if you are driving, GoogleMaps has you getting off at Sahara. The better exit is Charleston, which exits right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great time.”
Reviews.Author: padddie333
Reviews.Content: The wife & I have been coming out to Las Vegas for 20 years now at least once a year. After all of these years we are able to get our rooms and meals comped to us at about seven different casinos. At most of these casinos we have a casino host which is very helpful. This year we decided to try a couple of sites we haven't been to before. We choose Red Rock for the first four days and New York New York for the last three days. We went thru a casino host at both properties. We were not scheduled to arrive in Las Vegas till 10:30 pm, so we basically figured the 1st night at Red Rock would be sort of wasted, because we still had to get a rental car after we got out of the airport. Our hosst arragned for a limo for us at the airport which saved us a lot of time and hassle. If you have never done this before I strongly suggest it. It was no time and we were out of the airport and we felt like a million bucks. The next day we took the hotel shuttle down to the airport and then got on the rental car agency shuttle bus with no problems. You can also rent cars right at Red Rock. The wife and I are both slot players and consider ourselves to be in the mid range of gambling level. We bring about $10,000 out with us and if we lose it we lose it. Red Rock had a large variety of slot machines to choose from. Including all the machines we like.From pennies to dollars we found the machines fairly loose. I won 2 hand paid jackpots and the wife came out about even. The food and service was good at the restaurants and the cocktail waitress were better than most casinos we've been too. If you just want something light to eat I strongly suggest the Garden Cafe. The food was better there and you didn't have to wait in any lines like at the buffet which we weren't impressed with. Our room was great especially the soaking tub and the bed and pillows. We didn't have a view because we were on the 3rd floor, but we were close to the elevator and views are not that important to us anymore. We get suites at the other properties we stay at, so when we say the rooms were nice, we mean it. The only complaint we really have about Red Rock was the kids. I've never seen so many kids running around in a casino. The pool which is really nice was packed with little kids everywhere you went. Go out to the pool at 10:30 am if you want a good spot. We had water splashed on our camera and cell phone the second day we were at the pool by 3 kids out of control. Their mother finally came over and told them their behavior was unexceptable. I'm 53 and never heard that before. They just laughed at her and kept it up. Overall I'd have to say our stay at Red Rock was excellent. It was nice to be away from the hassles of the strip. Our last three days we stayed at New York New York, check in was great going thru the VIP lounge and they put us in a nice marquis suite. The gambling wasn't nearly as nice as Red Rock and neither was the food and service. Parking and driving there was bad. You can only get into valet from one direction. Driving on the strip was impossible. We did have a good host who comped us all of our meals. Make sure you put your meals on your room so you can get comped at the end of your stay. The one thing nice about New York New York is that there is lots of places to walk to from there. All things considered for people our age who have been coming out to Las Vegas for awhile, I strongly suggest going to Red Rock and give it a try. The pace is much more layed back there and you can still get the Las Vegas experience by renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice....very nice”
Reviews.Author: TheDuffer
Reviews.Content: Upscale in the middle of nowhere USA. Conferance facilities were fine, food was good. As nice a room as I've seen in a hotel. Pool for closed during conferance for remodeling! Isn't this place relatively new? (big disappointment) . Nice layout. I liked this place. It helps when the slots were very generous to me. House money always makes for a nice stay! Overall thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill fast.”
Reviews.Author: seaswho
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Red Rock several times in the past year. It is a very nice hotel, but the service and attitude are quickly going down the toilet. I suspect they have new management that is being very short sited. For example, if you buy a cigar in the gift shop they will not have matches, because they want you to buy a lighter instead. It is okay if you buy a $15 dollar cigar but they can't give you ( or even sell you ) a pack of matches. If you go down to Starbucks for a coffee in the morning and do not have photo ID a nasty girl who has been taking cranky pills will send you back to your room without a coffee. It can be a long to your room and back again for a $2.00 coffee. This gives you plenty of time to get your blood boiling. But then again I am sure they get a lot of con artists with a room key (that they know the billing details for) trying to scam a coffee at 6:45 a.m. In my case I was on my way back from the spa wearing a Red Rock housecoat, so for sure that would be strong indication that I was not a guest of the hotel and must have just walked in off the street to try to scam a coffee. My room had lights burned out and a pile of what looked like dog food crumbs by the bed when we arrived. The lights got fixed after I complained but the dirt on the floor took three days to finally be cleaned. Every day was a mystery as to what would and would not be cleaned. In a week, the ice bucket only was cleaned twice and the glass wear was a complete crap shoot. I read one of the previous reviews saying the internet is free. Well actually they charge a $25.00 resort fee in addition to your room rate so it is not free. They had a promo that included a free buffet, but this was billed to your room and would only be removed if you requested it on checkout. This was not a mistake but the standard procedure and obviously set up that way to cheat people. Pretty sleazy. Many of the staff are fabulous and the rooms and beds are excellent. It is a shame that the management and their policy is ruining a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property - but Slots are Tight”
Reviews.Author: 2Puppies
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week's stay at Red Rock. The property is less than three years old and still looks brand new. The rooms are very comfortable with a unique contemporary style. The beds are "way" comfortable, the marble & chrome bathrooms are large -- with a deep soaker tub that has a flat screen TV on the wall for bath viewing. The large plasma TV in the room is nice but there isn't any HD programming, so it's a waste. The little fridge is packed with overpriced items and has no room for anything you want to put in. If an item is lifted for more than 45 seconds it is charged to your account, so be careful. Same goes for the snack items on the dresser. Our room was on the 19th floor facing Red Rock Canyon, and the view was ok. I requested a strip view room, but none were available. Keep in mind that the higher the room number the farther the room is from the elevator. If your room is above 20, it's a loooong walk. Buffet fair is good and the 24-hour cafe is convenient for all meals, snacks and morning coffee. There are two Starbucks for those who like burnt coffee. There is a food court that offers smoothies, Italian, Chinese, and my new favorite -- FatBurger. We did not eat at any of the fine dining places -- they are all expensive and we didn't see the value. Gambling: I play video poker and the machines were very tight. The only time I did well was when I kept cards that would be condsidered a long shot. I would go through long stretches before getting a pair to keep. Three of a kind at draw was rare and I was dealt four kings once, and I must have logged 20 hours on various machines around the casino. The pool area is awesome, but wasn't open until we were there several days. The weather wasn't great because of storm systems and many days were too windy. The spa has nice freebies but spa services are also expensive. Overall, my wife & I had a pleasant stay. We booked through Expedia and the room cost us under $600 for seven nights. Beware the $27+ daily resort fee. We'll probably select a different location when we return to Vegas, but I would recommend Red Rock for those who do not want to stay on the strip. It's a 15 minute drive away when you want to visit, which is our preference. Those of you who have never seen "Valley of Fire State Park", Nevada's first state park, I highly recommend it. It's about 45 minutes up I-15 north of the city and well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “It was so relaxing”
Reviews.Author: swingkid92677
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Las Vegas about 4 times per year. This time we stayed at the Red Rock, as we enjoy the station casinos. The Red Rock was more than either of us could ask for. The rooms were gorgeous, the pool was relaxing, the $25 day amenity fees gives access to the Spa, which was wonderful for jacuzzi and relaxation. The casino is large, the staff very pleasant. Red Rock was able to check us in early, 200 pm after busy weekend was perfect. Overall, we loved everything about the red rock, including the regal cinema, starbucks and setting. The Slots did seem tighter than I would have liked, but overall a glorious stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: DaftDev
Reviews.Content: After spending some time at Zion National Park and Bryce Canyon, my wife and I decided to spend an extra night in Vegas. After checking reviews, we decided to check out Red Rocks for its location away from the strip (we already had a night planned on the strip) and their dinner and a movie special. Check-in was prompt with a minimal wait. We did have to specifically ask about the dinner/movie package during check-in. The lobby has a very modern and refined feel, of course the giant chandelier definitely didn't hurt that image. The King room was very comfortable, and had a great view of the strip from a distance. The bathroom was nice, and had a shower and soaking tub. The Feast Buffet, which was part of the dinner and movie special, had a wide selection of food and great desserts. Overall, we would highly recommend this hotel and would come back if visiting Vegas again. Just be aware of the location away from the strip, and be sure to check their website for specials. If you travel during the off season, you can find pretty good deals on Hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of luxury and calm”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Casino is a gorgeous resort and definitely worth staying at. The rooms are beautifully appointed and maintained, the beds immensely comfortable and the bathrooms pleasure palaces in their own right. Internet is free, as are newspapers delivered daily. Turndown service with chocolates and the views are spectacular. One can happily hole up here for several days, relax, gamble, enjoy gourmet or simple dining and be pampered and not bother with doing anything else or going anywhere else. Puts the strip casinos to shame.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the drive”
Reviews.Author: watsonc49201
Reviews.Content: About 6 miles off the Strip is a gem of a resort and casino - Red Rock. Located at west of the strip at the base of the Red Rock Mountains, this place offers a serene retreat in 1st class accommodations. Rooms have true spa like quality with beautiful views. Pools and Spa Services are top notch. Dining options are fabulous and suited to all budgets. Casino offers lots of video poker and gaming. We stayed two nights and wish it could have been longer!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by pool closure”
Reviews.Author: KCSouth
Reviews.Content: Our family and another both with 2 young children thought this would be a great spring break location due to the warmth and the pools. We went specifically so the kids could swim, and the adults could gamble, use the spa and other amenities. We were shocked to learn upon our arrival the pools were closed for annual maintenance. We were not informed of this fact either via direct communication with the resort prior to our arrival or via their website. The resort tried to make it up by providing guest privelages at the other Station Casino in town, but we had to rent a car to get there but the kids had a great time. Otherwise, the resort and casino were exceptionally clean, over-the-top customer service, great kids facility w/ Wii games, basketball, hair and nail salon- they loved it, and the bowling. We would go back but check ahead first about the pools- it was a fluke.

Reviews.Title: “One of the gem resorts of Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Frbill92
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we felt pampered. The check-in service was excellent. The front desk was very friendly and helpful in answering all of our questions. We found all of the hotel and casino staff very welcoming. Unfortunately the pool was closed but the weather was cooler so that did not effect our plans. We ate at the cafe/bakery and the meals were very reasonable and the food was excellent. We had dinner and breakfast at the cafe and enjoyed both. The rooms are spectacular! They are large and beautifully decorated. We stayed on the 11th floor and never had to wait for an elevator. The bathroom had both a tub and shower. The tub was deep and there was a flat screen TV mounted to the wall so you could soak in the bath salts that were provided and relax. We found the casino slots to be very liberal and there were plenty of machines. There was plenty of parking and you are only a few steps from the hotel or casino. One day we took a ride up to Red Rock Canyon and that was beautiful and only about 15 miles from the hotel. If you want a break from the casino/Strip scene, this is an excellent place to visit. We had a reasonable room rate because we signed up for the players club last year so our room was even cheaper than most mid-priced rooms on the Strip. All in all, it was a wonderful three night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: half-life2
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/22/09 - 3/25/09 The hotel is perfect with everything you need. The decor is chic, modern, and urban. It has restaurants in every price range to meet your needs. Buffet is decent: approx $8 for breakfast, $12 for lunch, and $18 for dinner (all prices listed are without the "Boarder Pass", Red Rock's frequent players' card). For the kids, Red Rock has a movie threatre and bowling alley. I stayed on the 16th floor with a beautiful view of the canyons. The $27 daily resort fee includes internet access and gym access - so it's fairly reasonable. Staff and valet were friendly. Highly recommand having your own car when staying here.... The view itself is worth the stay. Red Rock is more for relaxation, spa, and beautiful sunsets/sunrise at the Canyons. This place is away from the crowds yet it has everything you need. I booked through Expedia and got a good rate (under $100 a day). I stayed Sunday through Wednesday. I've been to Vegas over 20 times, and stayed at most hotels on the strip. Red Rock is one of my favorites, and with the low rate it was a GREAT deal!

Reviews.Title: “I could have spent the whole weekend in the bathtub”
Reviews.Author: cujo31
Reviews.Content: Red Rock is a beautiful hotel/casino. I don't know how old it is but still looks quite new and therefore quite nice. The casino is clean and has a non-smoking area with frequent drink service. (Play Planet Moolah - it's a hilarious slot machine.) The pool is only open til about 4:00pm during this off-season but again it was very nice and very large. The sleeping room was just great. It has a large, wall-mounted LCD television in the sleeping room and a smaller one in the bathroom perfectly situated for watching television while soaking in the very deep bathtub. (There is also a separate shower.) The room decor is great and the whole thing is well done and rather peaceful. I think the hotel was fairly well booked during my stay but the corridors were quiet. The spa and workout rooms were also very nice albeit a little crowded at times. The hotel runs a shuttle service to a local mall as well as the airport, but it stops running around 8:00 p.m. You will have to take a taxi from the airport after that time and it runs about $50.00 without traffic. Most of the staff was very friendly and helpful but I was surprised that the young men at the front doors watched several people struggle to open doors while juggling their luggage. I guess if you tell them you don't need their help with the luggage - you don't get any help. A small inconvenience. There is a $27 per day resort fee which handles a few things including internet access in your sleeping room. I think it was high for what you get, but again, not a reason to stay away - just something to consider.

Reviews.Title: “The pool was closed - no advance notification!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Megam22
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I realize that Vegas is not considered to be child friendly BUT no where on the Red Rock Hotel website did they say that there would be no place for a child to swim on the property. that's right we were handed a letter advising us that all the pools were closed because they were hard at work on the pool decks except for two that would be available for 18+ only. Needless to say we spent a lot of time explaining to our daughter that she cannot swim, only adults can swim. Our room overlooked the pool deck and in the 4 days we were there, NO WORK AT ALL BEING DONE. Nice. Why lie about it? We won't stay there again - child or no child with us - BUT I will say this, it was a gorgeous hotel, the music is relaxing and I didn't smell smoke anywhere. So....why can't they get it right and ensure that ALL Of their customers are satisfied....even those that are under the age of 18??? So close....and by the way if we had received advance notification that would have been no problem as we would have stayed somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “They Only Care About the Super Rich Guests”
Reviews.Author: TechSavvyMom
Reviews.Content: If you are not a millionaire ("VIP"), I do not recommend that you stay at this hotel. Our large group rented this hotel off of the Vegas strip. Our conference ended at 2:00. We paid extra to stay overnight so that we could go to the "Vegas Strip". However, seven of us (the hotel's guests) were standing in line and waiting to get onto the shuttle ahead of time. Because the shuttle only had 14 seats, were not able to go to the Vegas strip. The hotel staff was unsympathetic; and had a general nonchalant attitude. They did not provide transportation until 6:00 and their last van that retured from the strip was at 9:00 - on a Friday night! Do not waste your time! They don't care about the average, everyday working person. Spend your hard earned money at a hotel on the strip. It will be cheaper and the customer service will be better. Despite seven different people's attempts to speak with a manger, we were consistently told that "all of the managers were in a meeting".

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, excellent casino, quite and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: callahanha
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early March for 2 nights. i have visited Red Rock Casino on day trips before but this was my first time staying there. Took free shuttle from airport and there was no line to check in. Room was on 17th floor and had a great view of mountains. Weather was low 70s but pool water was too cold to use. I imagine this would be a great place to stay in the summer. Casino employees (dealers, pit bosses were very friendly) and I played about 3 hours each morning wagering from $25-50 a hand. They do have $5 tables in the morning also. The buffet is above average although there is no shrimp on the lunch buffet. The coffee shop turkey dinner was awesome. It was real roasted turkey and was better than my mother's Thanksgiving dinners and it was only $10. There is a shuttle that goes to the strip every 2 hours or you can do I what I did and rent a car. I will definitly be returning on my next trip in august.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay close to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Yellowdog442
Reviews.Content: I was at the Red Rock for a convention and simply loved it. The style of the hotel is much more of an upscale boutique-style than typical Vegas behemoth. The rooms were much more spacious than I've had on the strip and I loved the casino (my relative good luck probably coloring that view a bit . . .). The interesting thing about the setup at the Red Rock is that you can completely avoid the casino if you want to. Access to the pool and cabanas, spa and restaurants does not require you to pass through the gambling areas like in other places. I found that refreshing even though I was gambling at the casino each day. The pool area is large and there is good food and bar service there. The cabanas and spa areas are very nice and there is a good workout facility. Getting downtown will take you 25-50 minutes depending upon traffic, but I didn't find it to be that much of a hassle. If I were spending a lot of time gambling in Strip casinos, I would stay there, but the Red Rock is a relaxing getaway where great gaming is available (there or elsewhere) if you want it. The convention space was great, among the better setups I've seen in the last few years. I appreciated the ability to get wifi in the convention area and do work between sessions.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms,spacious,2 flatscreens!!”
Reviews.Author: darren15
Reviews.Content: The flatscreen to watch while you are soaking in the bath tub is excellent. Views of the strip are interesting. We stayed on the 7th floor,and it was nice. 10 miles to strip,but to be honest...it is a nice break from the huge crowds. casino is good,buffet is excellent...Bed was great,clean room. The fitness center was adequate. The chandelier in the lounge is awe inspiring. Great for a couple who want to kick back in Vegas for 4 nights,or so....Younger,partying types may prefer to stay on the strip. Hotel was newer,clean,good service....great stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice to be Away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: allisonhnewport
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a long weekend getaway with the kids (3 and 10) and thought Las Vegas would be something different as they had never been. I didn't really want to be on the Strip so we chose Red Rock. The hotel and surrounding snow covered mountains were beautiful. I loved the location. Every staff member that we encountered was pleasant and knowledgeable, many going out of their way to assist. The kids absolutely loved the TV over the bath tub (an added perk--they actually begged to take baths). The restaurants in the Hotel are overpriced but we expected that. The first night we chose LBS, a gourmet burger restaurant and after we got over the initial shock of a $16 burger we really enjoyed the meal. I ordered a veggie burger and I honestly have to say that it was definitely the best one I have ever had (and being a vegetarian I order them often and am usually disappointed). The next night we discovered several mid-range chain restaurants within walking distance of the Hotel. The only negative comments that I have were with the cleanliness of the room (as the last person commented), the icy pool and the honor bar. When we got to our room I noticed that in the bathroom, along the wall near the toilets had not been cleaned. There was dirt and hair that needed to be removed. We are used to having a coffee maker and refrigerator in rooms when we travel. The room had a refrigerator but it was full of overpriced honor bar drinks with no extra room. Also, on the low dresser were several cartons of snacks, etc. that were displayed in the open in plain sight. We were warned by the front desk that if these were moved we would be billed ($10 for what looked to be a 100 calorie pack of chocolate chip cookies etc.). Throughout the stay I was concerned that one of the kids would lie something on this display, knocking over the carton causing us to be billed. Not a good idea Red Rock! Put the things in a cabinet, please. Last on my list is the pool. We were told that the pool was open during the day. We were NOT told that it was not heated. The pool area is lovely and there are several pools and hot tubs. Unfortunately, only one small (12 person?) hot tub was heated. Needless to say it was the "kiddie pool" as like us, other parents had promised pool time for the kids. The kids were very disappointed as the main, unheated pool was even too cold for them! Next time, please warn us ahead of time that the pool is open but unheated! If you are looking for non-casinos side trips, don’t miss the Hoover Dam and Mount Charleston as well as the Red Rock recreation area. Las Vegas is a beautiful place once you get away from town!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great place to stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: lesilek48
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Red Rock and we are always impressed with the beauty of the interior of the hotel and casino. Service has improved dramatically from the front desk staff to the cleaning staff. Very friendly and accomodating. We got a great rate and even though it is a bit far from my in-laws in Henderson, the freeways make for an easy commute. Only disappointment was the cleanliness of the rooms. Carpets had not been swept and there was quite a bit of hair and lint in the corners of the bathroom. Second day was better but not at the level it has been previously. Beds are great and the views either strip or mountains are wonderful. Make sure to ask for a room close to the elevator if you do not like to walk as the higher number rooms are quite a hike. The casino has all newer slot machines with quite a selection of penny slots (we are not big gamblers!) compared to many of the strip casinos. We would certainly stay again for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cmtreloar
Reviews.Content: This hotel and resort spa was seriously one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. From the minute we walked in the door to the minute we left after 4 nights for a business trip, every single staff member was amazingly friendly and proud of where they work. The food was great, not that we ate there too much. The casino staff were very friendly and helpful. Most of all the facilities, rooms, cleanliness and extras were all second to none. I cannot say too much more, but if you are going to Vegas, stay here for sure if you want something different other than the main big older hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, contemporary resort and spa!!”
Reviews.Author: metalartist111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days a month and a half ago. It was an exceptionally clean, comfortable and beautiful Hotel. The service and staff were excellant. It was approximately 18 miles from the strip, which we loved because it wasn't sensory overload. We stayed there because it was down the street from Red Rock Canyon so we could go hiking. The room was impeccably clean and very contemporary, but not gaudy. The king size bed was SO COMFORTABLE! And the linens were very soft! Even though it had a casino (we're not gamblers) It wasn't too crazy as far as the noise and as guests we didn't have to walk through it when we wanted to come in or go out of the Hotel. The Japanese/Sushi restaurant there was great! Try some of their Sakis..there are some brilliant ones! We will definately be staying there again when we go back to the area!! We highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: halcyonzero
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my girlfriend somewhere special for our anniversary, so I thought we could have a week of fun and exploration in Las Vegas and the Grand Canyon. I'd previously stayed here with friends and enjoyed the hotel for the brief time I was in it, so I thought we were in for a treat. I called well in advance and asked them to have a bottle of champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries for us when we arrived. These never showed up to our room, yet I was billed for them. Then I called to have them taken off the bill, and the charge sneakily reappeared on my credit card the next month. I ended up finally getting in touch with someone in the accounting department who finally removed the bogus charge from my account and took ownership, assuring me it wouldn't happen again without a good reason. Again, well in advance, I told the front desk person that it was our anniversary and that I wondered if they had a lotions/bubblebath basket available for sale, not telling me that nearly everything that I bought for $120 was also available complimentary in the room, and the lotions/soaps available in the room were pleasant smelling, unlike the foul-smelling disaster that was the gift basket. I can't stress this enough: don't buy the bath basket. We arrived to our room and there was a pile of dirty dishes and a bag of used linens outside of our door, and when we got inside, our minibar was about half-stocked, leaving me to wonder if the room had ever been turned since the last customers had left. I called the front desk to inquire about the missing minibar goods, and they assured me that they wouldn't be charged to my account - after a week of charges and room service, I don't know that I would catch those small charges if they did happen. The week ended up being a pretty disappointing trip due to the staff's blunders and indifference, not to mention the several phone calls to resolve the fraudulent charges to my credit card, but I have to admit that the hotel's accommodations were beautiful and the place was relatively relaxing partially because of its distance from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: epictraveler11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding night here before heading out on our honeymoon. They were nice enough to upgrade us to a suite, granted my wife had her wedding dress on so that kind of help. We are both Vegas residents and we always wanted to try this place out and it was a great decision. The service was great and the staff was very kind. The hotel itself has a trendy and modern feel to it. If you want to stay at a very nice hotel that is off the beaten track (being the strip), the Red Rock is the best. Although it is off the beaten track, it is really only 20 minutes from all the action. The view is outstanding regardless if you have the strip or canyon view!

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BeamerVirginia
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vegas and don't want or have to stay on the strip, the Red Rock is your perfect choice. Our best friends joined us for this exceptional visit. From the moment we arrived, the staff was exceptionally accomodating from the front door, to the room service, to the restaurant staff. We couldn't have asked for anything more. We were particularly impressed with the decor of the property and its cleanliness. It is only three years old, so that helps. But, the combination of rock including marble, granite, red stone, etc. with Swarski crystal chandilers was brilliant. Then the food. TBone was exceptional, in fact the best meal we had in Vegas! The decor was both steak house with contemporary comfortable design. The steak was the best I've had in a long time and I am a steak snob. We had also eaten in the Luxor's Tender, which doesn't even hold a candle to TBones. In fact, do not eat at Tender. If you want a delightful time with great service and food, oh yes the casino is roomy, then go to Red Rock. A bit about the rooms, we were completely spoiled and stayed in the two bedroom suite, complete with a pool table and an outdoor jacuzzi spa and barbeque! The bedrooms were huge and the bathroom included a toilet with toys! Ask for one!

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: redheadswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Jan 3-8, 2009. We were there for a photography conference, and as one of the speakers, we were put in a suite. It was fabulous. Very clean, spacious, and beautiful. We were in room 19-102, and the one problem I would say is you could hear the elevator all night long. We had the mountain view, and it was gorgeous. There is plenty to do in the resort to keep busy. Bowling alley, arcade, movie theatre, resturants, shops and of course, casinos, which we didn't use. There is a free bus that takes you to Fashion Show Mall on the Strip. It runs about every 2 hours. Very nice, esp since a taxi ride is about $50. You can also take the bus to and from the airport. We were VIP, and there is a private check in room, where coffee and soft drinks are provided all the time. The vip elevator goes directly into that room. It's awesome. I would highly recommend this hotel if you don't mind being out away from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: redhand
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a pleasant 8 night stay at the Red Rock Hotel over New Year. The room was large, comfortable and well furnished and all staff were attentive, friendly and helpful. Two issues however prevent us from awarding the hotel 5 stars. Firstly we felt the 27.24 dollar daily resort fee was a very expensive way of having a daily newspaper and a spa dip. Second and more importantly, we were blasted by cigarette smoke from the casino each time we made our way to one of the restaurants. Obviously a design fault here. That said, the buffet was good for breakfast but disappointing for the evening meal. There are many good restaurants in the vacinity. Our best meal was probably at The Melting Pot on Charlestown and our worst, by quite a distance, at Gordon Biersch on Rampart. I can still taste the salt more than a week later.!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: flaffle
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here as a layover on our way out to the Grand Canyon. We had passed this hotel last time we were in Vegas on our way out to Red Rock and thought it looked pretty cool and the location was very convenient to the park. Since we were planning on doing some hiking in Red Rock it was a no brainer to stay there. The Good -The rooms are fantastic! I couldn't believe the size of our standard king room. It was clean and tastefully decorated. I know others have complained of the Strip view being too far away but I loved it at night. The lights were just mesmerizing. We actually spent our last night drinking champagne and just staring out the floor to ceiling windows at the twinkling valley. -The location was perfect for what we were looking for. If you want to be close to the strip this is definitely not the hotel for you. It's about a 10 minute drive into Red Rock Canyon which is a must do if you stay at this hotel. The place is just gorgeous! There is a variety of hiking options for all skill levels. We did the turtlehead peak hike which was awesome but not for the inexperienced. If hiking isn't your bag, the 13 mile scenic drive is well worth the $5 entry fee. There are plenty of stores near by which was great for picking up little necessities at non-hotel prices. -When we weren't playing in the park, we were eating/drinking/gambling. We ate at the Grand Cafe, Cabos, and LBS. All meals were good- reasonably priced and the service was exceptional. Everyone, and I do mean everyone, went out of their way to provide friendly and prompt service. I really can't say enough about how friendly and courteous the staff was. The casino is very nice and well ventilated. We actually were able to get cocktail service at regular intervals while playing! There are plenty of cheap machines to drain your wallet at a slow pace. If drinking and gambling don't make you happy there's bowling, a movie theater, and an arcade. The Bad -Elevator layout.
