We had the first room off the elevator so we never had to experience the full walk but just for fun I did it just to see how far it was. It is a very, very, very long walk. I don't understand why a hotel of this level couldn't put an elevator in at the other end of the loop. I really feel for those who have to lug all their stuff down to the other end. Even if you pack light and are in good shape it would still be a major pain. -Noise Level. Being close to the elevator had it's downside. You could hear every word of every conversation in the hallway. The people weren't even being loud. The walls are just paper thin. What's even weirder is that the room is actually set back aways from the main hallway! I've had better sound proofing in an Econo Lodge. Again, this seems to be a major design flaw like the elevators. -The Resort Fee. Something really bothers me about having to pay another bill for services I don't even use after I've already "paid" for my stay. I don't understand why they don't just put it into the price of the hotel. I know it's only another 25/night but it just makes you feel like you're being nickled and dimed. The Bottom Line I will definitely stay here again but it will be more for it's proximity to Red Rock than the hotel itself. The hotel is very nice and the rates are decent but if all I wanted was luxury I would probably stick to the Bellagio.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth time-much improved”
Reviews.Author: AZ-Traveler85253
Reviews.Content: I took the family for our December trip to Vegas and gave Red Rock another chance because the kids love it there. We hit the cold stretch (snow in the mountains), so outdoor activities were a bust. Good thing the resort has so much to do. My casino host gave me a nice rate, and I upgraded to the suite with an adjoining room to give us more space. Well worth the small fee to upgrade and if you have kids, I would suggest doing it. The service was so much better than our last trip there. All the casino dealers were wonderful, and the front desk, bell and outside staff were the usual stellar performers. The rooms were kept very clean and we enjoyed all the things there that the kids love; bowling, movies, Kid's Quest, and the arcade and food court. Sign up for poker is easy to do with your card, and hanging out in the sports room is very nice. The breakfast buffet was a hit with the kids, and really, the prices are very reasonable, except on Christmas morning, when it's $17. Coffee shop is a great substitute. Lastly, a reflection of the economy. When we ventured out christmas 2007 for food, we were lucky to find one pizza place open. In 2008, there were scores of restaurants and shops open, both on Christmas eve and day. Even vegas is struggling! Back to loving the Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Red rocks---Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: lrobin622
Reviews.Content: We spent our 10th wedding anniversary at RR. I had noted that we werespending our anniversary at RR and when we checked in in the young man thefront desk notice that we were spending our 10th there and upgraded ourroom. The nicest thing was that he sent up a bottle of champagne for us tocelebrate that night! Great customer service! We are pool type of people so we enjoyed sitting by the pool most of the daywatching both families and young singles mingle around the pool. It seem tobe a nice mix of both. I will tell you get to the pool early since theseating seems to go fast. As for things to do RR, we enjoyed bowling, casino (no money won), and wedid manage to get a round of golf in at the TPC Canyons which is a short 10minute drive away. Food wise we enjoyed the Salt Lick BBQ. We tend to belate eaters and we found many of the restaurants tent to close early. Thecafe is open 24/7. All and all we loved the RR and will continue to come back, they understandwhen you do the little things right customers will return. Well done RR!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: henrock
Reviews.Content: I had an incredible stay at the hotel. The rooms were awesome and the views were spectacular. The casino, bowling, movie theater, food selections and sports book were all great and provided many options for activities on site. The night club was nice and had a good atmosphere. The pool area should be a hot spot during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “Gigantic and Fancy”
Reviews.Author: NFA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. All in all it was an incredibly luxurious experience. It's fancy, clean, nice furniture, nice nature picture decorations. We stayed on the 10th floor-got a free upgrade to a bigger room. It was huge and clean. It had an enormous bath tub and a tv to watch while you are soaking in your bath salts. The view was amazing. It was a strip view-at night, the lights from the strip made a great backdrop. Housekeeping was very thorough. The people at the front desk were friendly and answered all my questions. If I wanted to, I didn't need to leave the hotel-swimming pool, bowling, food court, gambling, bars, restaurants, spa etc...but my husband and I really wanted to go to red rocks park to climb. It was very close to the hotel-easy to go back and forth from. The second night we went to the strip. Driving to it was easy and we found free parking right away. Only two things annoyed me- 1. the free shuttle to the strip stops shuttling pretty early at night, so it is not something to take if you want a night out on the town. But if you have a car, it seemed easy to park on the strip so it worked out okay. 2. The casino owns everything, of course. So when I tried to be cheap and get breakfast from the Starbucks in the hotel with my gift card, I found out that the Starbucks does not take gift cards or Starbucks credit cards. They want all your money! I would definitely stay here again for my combo night on the town/climbing all day experience. I got the hotel for 90/night not including lots more money for the casino tax and resort fee-i think the total was 250 for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service for the $$”
Reviews.Author: tsmutek
Reviews.Content: Husband & I shose to stay at the Red Rock - in spite of better rates at other Premium resorts on the Vegas Strip - because of reviews that described the service as top notch - sadly that was not our experience. • Spa was closed the week we stayed • "Complimentary" shuttle service and Gym admission is not free - we were charged $27 per/day (though we did not use any of these services) - fee was charged upon check-out. • Specialty cocktails advertised by 2 restaurants on their web site menus were not available due to ingredients being out-of-stock • The bar at the on-site bowling alley did not open during our play (though staff said that it should have opened at noon). • The movie times listed at the on-site theater posted incorrect times (staff said that the marquee had not been updated) • We sent back the coffee at the Cafe because it was weak - looked like tea - received more of the same - did not drink the coffee - but was charged (for 2 cups of coffee). • There was only one craps table open during our first night - it was full, so we kept checking back before and after dinner - it was still too full to join the game - so we drove to the Strip (to play). • Room was extremely dimly lit (even with all of the lights on) • There are no signs for the Registration Desk (from the parking garage) FYI: it's not in the area labeled as "Casino/Lobby" - it's actually one floor down from that - was very inconvenient wandering around with our bags looking for the check-in counter. Paid top dollar for a premium resort experience - don't waste your money (too) - save it for Mandalay Bay or the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “9 Days of Relaxation - Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Vegasdic
Reviews.Content: Booked this vacation through US Air Vacations. Stayed 7/11-18/08. Stayed with the wife and our two kids. Love it. Two rooms and enough space to make the kids feel special. The staff was great to us and our kids. Resturants were very good and the food court was great for lunch. The movie theater and bowling alley were a perfect match for our family vacation, just another reason why we picked RRCRS. Spent a day at the Grand Canyon, went to the strip twice. Ate at Mesa Grill on time. Rent a car it's worth it. Casino was not smokey and tables paid out. Sport book is nice and the bars are great as well. The resort charge (@$22/day) is worth it for tte water, fruit and workout room. Had been to RR on a business trip before. We wanted to keep the kids away from the strip, RRCRS was perfect. Thanks.....We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Just "Deserts"”
Reviews.Author: Carabinerqueen
Reviews.Content: Sitting away from the 'Strip' on the edge of the Mohave Desert, the Red Rock Hotel outshines the competition in style, design, service, views and luxuary. We went, not for Vegas, but to climb in the magical Mohave Desert. This very smart hotel cheerfully accommodated our clinking through the lobby laden with climbing gear each morning and our grubby return each evening to freshen up and then luxuriate in the sensational spa. Only open for two and a half years, the entire hotel buildings and fixtures are immaculate, and most of the staff have been there from the start; loyal, attentive, informed, unobtrusive. If you want the garish excesses of downtown Las Vegas, the glitz, crime and continual in-your-face marketing of prostitutes, then stay at one of the ludicrous plastic theme-park dumps on the Strip. If you want quiet luxury, peace and top notch service, the Red Rock is for you. You can drive or take the courtesy transport in to Vegas and sample it without being contaminated, then return to relative sanity, big beautiful bedrooms with breathtaking views of the desert , a gorgeous pool area with four posters for sun beds, and, with the gambling set well away from the main guest amenities, It really could tempt you not to go anywhere else. Having stayed at hundreds of hotels, from Travelodge to the Ritz, we are not easy to impress, but impressed we are. This is the first hotel we definitely want to return to, if only for that unforgettable view of red rock glowing across a magical desert landscape.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property!”
Reviews.Author: BrandiNecole80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended up booking our last night in Vegas at this property as Caesars Palace had no space for the final night. I am so glad that we did! We picked up the resort courtesy shuttle from the Strip ( at the Fashion Show Mall) after checking out of Caesars. The shuttle was basically a limo bus and was so much better than hailing a cab. At check in we were greeted with bottled water and our bags were brought up to our room promptly, we were even allowed to check in at noon- instead of waiting until 3 as it stated. The room was on floor 17 overlooking the Red Rock Canyon ( if they give you the option choose this over the strip its was more beautiful!). The room has a huge flat screen tv in the room and floor to celing windows, the bathroom has a seperate glass enlosed shower and a separate tub with a flat screen tv above the tub. This was nice for watching the Today show before check out :) The resort itself was great, we went bowling onsite the first night and had a great ( but kind of expensive ) dinner at Terra Rossa. The restaurant had great pasta, not crowded, and a nice open kitchen. The resort was fairly easy to navigate and all of the public areas were on that main floor, same as the casino. They also have non smoking slots- this was much appreciated as well. It was a little to chilly to get in the pool but we did sun ourselves besides it. Nice zero entry pool and 2 hot tubs as well in a big courtyard they call the "backyard".

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney B
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on lowest price seeing as we were only staying the one night, but once we got there we wished we were staying longer. The standard was amazing! The staff were all very friendly and great to have a chat with. The room was unbelievably beautiful for such a low cost! Very clean and very nice decor and a tv in the bath! Apparently it's the casino that the movie "21" was filmed at. It's about a $35US taxi ride to the strip which is ok, but catch the free shuttle bus the have if you can. The only problem we had was from the people in the room next to us who were very loud and obviously there to party the whole night away and after being told by the staff to keep it down (more than once) were kicked out in the morning. We would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: jp5o
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but isolated I was there for a work convention. We all had a grand old time there. "The Salt Lick" restaurant is one of the best BBQ joints in Las Vegas. The pools were quite nice and the staff were friendly. The only problem is that you are separated from the strip. This is a nice casino to visit if you want to get off of the strip and hang out with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rooms! Awesome Views!”
Reviews.Author: graphics82
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock during a recent convention trip. It was a fabulous stay, with great rooms. The rooms were sumptuous, and above average. The beds were heavenly, and I have stayed in numerous hotel beds. The bathroom was just as great. The huge, deep bathtub was a welcome retreat after a long day. The stand alone shower and separate toilet area was great as well. Be careful of the mini bar as it is a touch sensitive mini-bar, and if items are removed after 45 sec you will be charged. If you come with small children, be warned that they are just at child level. I was lucky enough to have a wonderful mountain and pool view, a few of my fellow travelers overlooked the parking garage and a very distant strip view. It truly was awe inspiring to see the mountains every day. The lobby may not be as impressive as some of the strip hotels, it surely is welcoming, and the property is very family friendly as opposed to many of the strip properties. I would say that the hotel restaurants leave a bit to be desired. The burger place, LBS was okay, but as was our experience in all of the property sit-down restaurants, the service was painfully slow. There are a few restaurants, as well as a food court in the hotel. The sandwich place in the food court was one of the best experiences I had as far as food on property. As many of the other reviewers touched on, the property is a u-shaped property, with the elevator located in the center, so chances are your room will be a far haul from the lobby and elevator. There is another set of elevators but it only goes to the pool. The hotel shops also leave a bit to be desired, if you forget anything or would like a late night snack, i guess the hotel wants you to order room service, as the shop has very little to offer, besides over-priced clothing. There is a shuttle to the strip if you plan on heading down, make sure you pickup a schedule from the concerige desk. It runs limited hours, and a cab is about a $50 trip one way. The shuttle runs to the Fashion Mall, make sure if you are planning on using the shuttle you get clear specifications on where to catch the shuttle on the way back. They pick up on the lowest level of the mall, by the Gap. Helpful info as on the schedule it only says North Entrance, not marked very well in the actual mall. Overall the stay at the Red Rock was great, just watch for some small pitfalls. Be prepared to relax and have a wonderful sleep in a fabulous bed!

Reviews.Title: “Enforced swankiness”
Reviews.Author: minnie_n
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big fan of LV and I was on conference #2, so a little cranky when I stayed here. At the time of my stay, this hotel was out on the periphery of LV past Summerlin, well beyond the strip. I got there via a $50 cab ride from the airport. They do have a shuttle from the airport that runs every 2 hours. The lobby and room are both elegant and modern in sort of that fake LV way. The service was lax. It took nearly 45 minutes for room service. The casino looked like any other to me, it was huge with several restaurants. But, the best thing about the place was the pool, which is just meant for lounging and cocktails. The service just ok. No one was ever in a hurry there. Apparently, they only hire 20-something year old brunette women 5'2" waitstaff for the pool and insist they wear Juicy Couture type sweats. (I realize that might appeal to some people...but all I wanted was my cocktail and a reprieve from the conference blah, blah, blah.) They encouraged us to check out using the keyboard in the room; the batteries were missing in mine. Another instance of 'just sort of shrug your shoulders' service. And, this hotel is like a lot of others that likes to charge for every service, like wireless, the resort (because you're staying in one), which I find annoying.

Reviews.Title: “NOT so great!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey025
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vegas on Friday and stayed at the Rio which was wonderful! We then moved to the Red Rock for Saturday and Sunday. We had a suit reserved of which they gave away and only had a regular room available. The room was dirty and had hair in the tub. The next evening we were moved to a suit. We had the “do not disturb” sign posted and found the cleaning crew in our room. The TV in the bathroom didn’t work and they only provided us with one robe (the rooms are supposed to have two robes). Certain charges were to be compd. Come to find, I have many charges to my credit card. The last day we ate at the buffet for breakfast and the waitress was extremely rude. Needless to say, we will not be staying there ever again!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Floridagirl92
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Red Rock and loved it in spite of the fact it was not on the strip. The rooms were very spacious and nicely appointed. They did not spare any expense on this property as the hotel was spectacular. My only problem was not having a coffee maker in the room. There was quite an assortment of restaurants to choose from and even a food court for families on a tight budget. My only issue was with the Service I received when I was looking for my materials that I sent to the hotel for a tradeshow. NO one could find them even though there was a clear signature on the tracking form....All in all it was a great stay and I even won money in the casino. My only suggestion would be to rent a car if you want to make trips to the Strip as the cabs rides are very costly...It cost me $55 from the airport to the hotel and $45 dollars from the strip to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: slc1963
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock is the best hotel ever! I would want to stay here even if it wasn't in Las Vegas. The hotel is very clean and not smokey at all. The rooms are beautiful and spacious. There are plenty of entertainment options besides gambling (e.g. bowling, movies, shopping, fine dining). The pools are amazing and it is free to use the fitness area of the spa, which is VERY unusual for Vegas. The restaurants are awesome. I have spent a perfect afternoon at the bar of the Salt Lick, eating BBQ, drinking wine, and playing video blackjack. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! The one drawback is that it is pretty far from the airport and the strip, however I just found out that there is a free shuttle from the airport!!! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you value sleep!”
Reviews.Author: indyjourney
Reviews.Content: This is a luxurious hotel decorated in an art deco style. Rooms are large and well appointed, there are plenty of dining options covering a wide range of cuisines and the pool area is beautiful. Staff is friendly and courteous. The problem is the hotel's night club, which is allowed to blast loud rock music until 3 a.m. on Friday and Saturday nights. The bass and percussion are clearly audible in guest rooms facing the pool area. This is not the type of noise that can be blocked out and makes sleep extremely difficult. When we called to complain, we were given two options: move to another room or use earplugs. (we had already tried earplugs) We were there for a seminar and had a substantial amount of clothing and belongings with us, so moving was not practical, especially in the middle of the night when we were already dressed for bed. The staff was well aware of the problem with the night club, had received many complaints and told us they "felt sorry" for the guests. Our recommendation: don't stay if you actually want to sleep at night or unless you are willing to pay extra for the "strip view" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “a great place”
Reviews.Author: lechat43
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation (room, space and decor of hotel) and fantastic pool (lots of chairs), staff very cordial and eating place of your choice. Concierge (purposefully) don't want to mention across the street Olive Garden, Mexican and great Asian restaurant, plus Costco for wine. Shuttle stops pick-ups from strip at 9 PM so difficult to get back from any show but this is the only disadvantage of this fabulous resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Service not so good”
Reviews.Author: blillard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock this weekend. While the hotel was beautiful and some aspects of service were excellent there were still some troubling issues. 1. After a long morning at the pool on Friday we asked to order lunch. We were told that the hotel no longer served lunch at the pool on Weekdays and we would need to buy food at the foodcourt. I complained at serveral different levels about this and shockingly no one knew this was a new policy (it was). 2. The wait staff as the pool was young, inexpereienced, and not at all interested in service. A contributing factor could be the fact that they don't have to earn their tips, the tip is automatically added to your bill. 3. The concierge left alot to be desired. My first call to them regarded show tickets, I was told they couldn't help me and I should call Ticketmaster. My second call for dinner reservations consisted of me being put on hold, then being told I would receive a call back. I was never called back. For a high end resort such as the Red Rock I would expect a much higher level of service. Several employees we spoke with seemed to infer that the economy was to blame. I surely hope not.

Reviews.Title: “Third visit, still great!”
Reviews.Author: borisnyc
Reviews.Content: I don't want to repeat what everybody else is saying, but we had yet another excellent time at Red Rock. I've noticed that many people have issues with the Front Desk. Our check-in could not have gone more smoothly. I called a week ahead and spoke to somebody at the front desk that would be there when I checked in (This works quite well in any hotel). I confirmed my reservation and any special requests. When we arrived, everything was ready. The Valet, Bellman, Front Desk, and Housekeeping treated us like Big Shots (we're not). We ate at T-Bones Steakhouse and Terra Rosa. I liked the steakhouse, as usual, but the Italian restaurant seems to put quantity before quality. I hate to waste food, and the portions were way too large. However, our server did "entertain" us with stories of how the chicks really dig him. The food fell short of our expectations, but we really had fun! Be sure to rent a car, try some local retaurants outside the casino, the Concierge is always very helpful. Have fun but be careful, times are tough and crime is up in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Rock rocks!”
Reviews.Author: IheartLasVegas
Reviews.Content: Highlights: 1. The Onyx Bar. Better drink prices and they have a tiny humidor. The staff are lovely. 2. The room. Simply and utterly gorgeous. Italian marble EVERYWHERE. The most sumptuous bed I have ever slept on. 15th floor with the best view of the Strip. The tub was to die for. (I'm still trying to figure out a way to take it with me! :P) 3. The food. Everything from cheese steaks almost South Jersey worthy to upscale dining. If you leave out of there hungry, it's your own damn fault! 4. The view of the Strip and mountains on the other side. You can't lose. 5. The amenities: IMAX theater, kids only places, kick [-] bowling ally. 6. The bowling alley's food. OY. Cheap as hell and OMFG good and tons of it. 7. Room pricing. MGM Quality rooms but not the price. 8. The front of the hotel LOOKS like a hotel. The casino itself was upstairs and off to the right. In 99% of hotels in Vegas, the first thing you get slapped with is the casino. It's loud, it's noisy, and while it may be how Vegas makes it's money, to be slapped with that right off the bat can be a bit disconcerting. To paraphrase a friend: Sensory Overload. I adore this hotel and cannot WAIT to get back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Change of Pace with a Preschooler”
Reviews.Author: funtoddlertravels
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a two night stay at Red Rock. First of all, I had read and heard that it is a very family friendly property, so I was eager to see what they had to offer. I am pregnant and we traveled with our preschool-age child. How it looks The rooms, hotel, casino, restaurants, and pool areas are spotless and modern, so no complaints there. Things were easy enough to navigate quickly. Check in was easy and set apart from the rest of the casino area which made for a more relaxing and quiet arrival and transition into the resort. There are two Starbucks and a foodcourt in addition to the buffets and restaurants. More on the layout later. Charges As another reviewer mentioned, there are quite a few extra charges or potentials for extra charges that irked us. The resort fee is daily and seems excessive. Why not work this into the room charge? Makes no sense! I know this is done more and more, but I will say, I don't like it one bit. Rooms First of all the views are spectacular- right to the red rocks. We were on the 9th floor. Loved waking up early every morning and seeing the mountains glow. As promised and mentioned by other reviewers, the beds are amazingly comfortable, pillows great, robes and slippers wonderful. I too considered purchasing them and taking them home (pricey though). Bathrooms are spacious and spotless, well stocked. Deep tub and there is a flat screen tv over it. Our daughter thought this was really cool. Unfortunately, there are about 10 different boxes of snack foods right at toddler reach level. If the boxes are removed for longer than 45 seconds, you are charged for them. I was constantly jockeying with my daughter and trying to explain that for the first day. I actually really appreciate snacks being available but there was absolutely nowhere to hide them once their existence was made known. I'd prefer them to be in a cabinet with the minibar as I've seen in other hotels. Or, since they knew we were traveling with a child, they could have been removed or put up high. So if this is the kind of thing that irks you, be sure to request their removal in advance. For what it's worth, the quality of snacks and goodies was pretty good- for adults and kids. Not just a bunch of snickers and cokes. On our second night there, we were interrupted not once but three times by the housekeeping staff trying to do turn-down service. Thought I made it clear the first time it wasn't needed. We had adjoining rooms, so the first time I answered the door, said no thank you. Then they came to the second door, and though I called out, "no thank you, we're all set" they used a card key and entered the room anyway, terrifying my daughter. Then the maid insisted on handing me chocolates which again, my daughter could not stop asking about (after she was already in bed with brushed teeth- argh). I conveniently noticed the fancy "do not disturb" light button by the doors- after she was finally asleep. This is picayune, but the cable channels weren't all that great for kids. I realize we're not there to watch tv but it is helpful. No PBS, just Nick and Disney. No kids movies available on their pay movie service, either. Odd. This is an easy fix and one I hope they make. Pool The pool area was lovely. Our group had pre-reserved cabanas which was nice, but they were a little far from the main pool area (but I didn't choose my cabana, so no fault on that). It took over an hour after we arrived for them to stock the fridges as promised. They were very kind about it, but we were literally told four times by the same two staff members that they were "just about to take care of that" and it didn't come until ages later, when we got a selection of one kind of juice and sodas. They were able to bring us some breakfast goodies, coffee, and other snacks later in the day (and the entire pool menu is available, of course). Cabanas in our area had no backs, so it did get a bit too windblown for us. The entire area is well laid out and there were plenty of chaises and cool bed/cabanas that were also reservable, but the all of the pools are completely cool and shaded until late morning. Maybe this is nicer during the prime heat of summer. But this time of year it was a bit chilly, so all the kids at the hotel congregated in the jacuzzi tubs, and once most of them had a taste of it, the bigger pools were just too cold even when the sun blazed on the pool. The biggest of the pools was absolutely perfect for small kids- major kudos on the design there. There is a wading area around the entire edge which is safer and a lot more fun for the pre-swimming set. And a fun waterfall right in the middle. Lots of chaise lounges that come right up to the edge of the pool, very convenient (and they're comfy, too). The pool area has a snackbar/cafe area, but we paid $18 for a virgin colada for mum and an icecream sandwich for our daughter. Um, wow. We did get three different flavors of ice cream- but one would have been fine. Sometimes simpler is better with a kid, eh? We got towels on the way in on both days, and both days they were scooped up by other folks. On the first day this actually happened twice, so we came out of the water shivering to find someone had taken them. Then upon requesting new ones, the pool staff had to go all the way back to the check-in area to grab new ones- but I noticed they first attended to some VIPs in a roped off area before attending to us. Maybe they need some towel stations located throughout the pool area instead of just at check-in. Or perhaps they just need to be absolutely sure everyone entering the pool area is well stocked with towels so people don't feel they can grab others? Room Service Always a nice thing when you have young children. $6 for a box of cereal. Can't order tea or coffee in-room without ordering an entire carafe. That means $8 for a cup of tea or coffee. I couldn't order a single cup, and no tea bags or coffee machine in the room. Sigh. Guess they want you to go down to Starbucks. However the menu was lengthy and did have child-friendly items on it. And the order process was smooth, delivery fast. Kids Activities The arcade was crowded but fun. Bowling alley- very neat place and something different for us in Vegas- we were surprised that even our 3 year old enjoyed herself there. We did not make use of the KidsQuest because apparently vaccination records were required- so if you plan to use this service, plan ahead. There's a movie theatre, too (Regal Cinemas). Food court has a good selection of different types of kid-friendly food (Italian, Ice Cream, Chinese, etc) though we had catered food through our group for the weekend (which was delicious and service was excellent). All of these child-friendly amenities are on the opposite end of the hotel area, so you'll have to cut through the casino smoke and chaos to get there. This walk got a little long, but I suppose that can't be changed. Bring a stroller. Spa Spa is lovely and I had one of the best treatments I've ever had. I usually get the same type of treatment whenever I use a hotel spa so I've had a good comparison. This was excellent. Check in and out was quick. The list of available services is extensive- from massage to salon services including manis and pedis, but no body waxing (why is this?), first time I've seen that glaring omission, especially at a nicer hotel. Service For us the most important thing at a hotel when traveling with kids is the service and respect you get as parents. This is especially true in Vegas which is primarily a playground for adults. Nobody wants to feel like a second-class citizen with kids there, and we have certainly felt that way at other casinos/resorts there. I have to say Red Rock did deliver excellent service in this respect 95% of the time. Every contact I had from check-in to check-out, bellmen to casino security to arcade staff to restaurant staff, always smiling and happy to make us happy. It was a very friendly, summer camp kind of atmosphere and that made me feel really taken care of the entire weekend. Moms and dads need pampering too and they made that possible. Will I be back? Probably yes. I think what I liked best about Red Rock was the feeling that I was being taken care of, despite a few very minor inconviences I can plan ahead/troubleshoot for next time. The staff really were friendly and at our beck and call. The beds were a dream and the rooms were intensely quiet. Loved the views. Though we didn't use their "Adventure Spa" the idea of a guided hike to a hot spring or kayaking was a wonderful idea and I'd love to take advantage of that aspect of Las Vegas. Red Rock is closer to these activities which makes me more apt to do them- plus they have gambling, a great pool and the wonderful spa. Pretty much everything you'd have on the strip, plus the outdoors activities, and a few extras for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Urastar
Reviews.Content: We first visited Las Vegas in 1994 and stayed at the Flamingo. This is when Vegas wasn't as glitzy as now and the food was extremely cheap ($1.99 turkey dinner) because they wanted you to gamble and it was pretty much an adult only playground back then. Boy has it changed. In August 2007 we went for the second time and went to the Red Rock and loved loved it. We really only heard about it because of the reality show Hells Kitchen and really wanted to meet the winner (which we didn't boo hoo...hehe). It was moderately priced compared to the strip's 5 stars and the pictures on the website were fantastic so we gave it a try and what can I say we just fell in complete love with this place. So we travelled there once again this year and our love for this place continues to grow. We always rent a car to do the whole Vegas strip thing but we always feel happy happy returning to our little oasis in the mountains. It's a great place to just chill out and relax. The pool area is more a disco with the loud music and there is tons of kids but there are a few quiet pools which if you are lucky the kids don't take over. We always found chairs and the chairs are extremely comfortable. And you never have to worry about towels. There are plenty and you can have as many as you want. The waitresses at the pool constantly come by which is great because you get really thirsty in Vegas in August. The room is great. Clean spacious and the bed is so very comfy. It's the only casino hotel I can actually sleep in. If they do pump oxygen in the air at the Red Rock it doesn't keep me or my husband from sleeping. And the curtains keep out the sun really well so you basically can sleep all day if you needed.. Lots of restaurants to choose from. You can eat fairly cheap or go all out and have a fabulous fine dining experience. We had a wonderful steak dinner at Tbone. Or you can opt for a burger at Fat burger or a pizza slice in the food court. And of course there is the buffet which is quite reasonably priced and the food isn't bad. And if you have a players card you get a discount. Last year we went to the Wynn because of the hype of the buffet. We waited in line for almost 2 hours and then you had to wait in line at all the stations so when you finally sat down to eat the food was cold and not worth the $50 per person price tag. My absolute favorite part of the Red Rock was the poker room. It's a great place to play. The dealers are actually quite sociable and you don't have to wait long to play. They have 1/2 no limit or higher stake games. There is no ante or hidden fees just the rake which we didn't even notice being from Canada and paying $6 every half hour at Niagara Falls. The Red Rock runs a very professional poker room compared to ours and I was really impressed at how many hands you could actually play in a half an our because the dealers are fast and sufficient. It was a complete pleasure to play there. One night we drove to the strip and figured we'd play at Belaggio because they say they are the best. But between the ante's and rakes and the rude pit boss we said see ya later and drove back to the Red Rock for a nice relaxing poker experience. Lastly this year we actually drove through Red Rock a couple of times and it was breathtaking. Just beautiful!!! We had suck a relaxing time in Vegas. Stress free holiday in Vegas is that even possible...? It sure is at this place. Can't wait to go back!!! Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Loved Red Rock Casino and Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Red Rock casino and reosrt in July. I have vacationed in Las Vegas many times and have always stayed on the strip. After staying at Red Rock we will never stay on the strip again. We were impressed the minute we arrived. The staff from the valet people to the lifeguards were wonderful. Our check-in went very smooth and the front desk people were very kind. Our room was wonderful!! We had a view of the mountains. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was emaculate. The casino was great. I liked the food court in the casino, very convenient. The pool was clean and the Sand Bar Grill out in the pool area had delicious food. We loved eating lunch by the pool. Red Rock, thank you for a great vacation. Vicki from Strongsville, Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, but trouble at the desk.”
Reviews.Author: jrodemich
Reviews.Content: The resort and spa are beautiful and modern. The casino and resturants are accomidating. The problem is that this resort is so far away from the strip. Your kind of stuck at the resort if you don't rent a car. So rent the car. You'll regret it if you don't. The pool is beautiful. Throughout the resort security is abundant. It was actually kind of annoying. One day my room key stopped working. So I went to the front desk, and they acted like it was my fault. They had security escort me to my room so they could check my ID. It was outragoues! The guy at the front desk was smilling at me when security arrived, he expected me to make a run for it! He seriously thought I was lieing. I told them I will never stay there again and I would let everyone know how I was treated.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, and look out for the hidden add-ons”
Reviews.Author: Tucolex
Reviews.Content: Red Rock tries to portray itself as an upscale, sleek, luxury hotel and resort, but my experience was frustrating, at best. I had several issues with my hotel room and hidden charges: Room: The rooms were nice, but not $300/night nice. Additionally, the rooms have an electronic sensor on the snacks tray, so that if you lift up a package of nuts to examine it and it's off the tray for more than 45 seconds, you get charged for it. For Christ's sake! Does the hotel mistrust its supposedly upscale guests so much that it has to install electronic sensors to ensure that they don't steal the 45 cent package of nuts that the hotel has marked up to $9? Give me a break. This sort of behavior -- treating guests as if they were poorly behaved small children -- is ridiculous, and left a very bad taste in my mouth towards the hotel. And why are the pistachios marked up to $9, anyway? Isn't the hotel making enough money at $300/night, plus whatever guests spend in the casinos, bars, and restaurants, to cover its expenses without the ridiculously overpriced nuts and sodas in the room? This really steams my clams. Hidden charges: But what REALLY steamed my clams was the $20 fee the hotel adds to your bill to cover "concierge services and shuttles to the strip." What?? Are you joking? What kind of hotel marks up your bill for concierge services, especially if you don't even use them? I am a Las Vegas local, and I stayed in the hotel after seeing a concert at the pool area. I had my own car and didn't need shuttle services to the strip (besides, I stayed on the hotel property the whole night). I also didn't use any concierge services whatsoever. When I called the front desk to ask about this charge, I was informed that it was a surcharge that was added to all guest room bills, regardless of whether the guest used the concierge or the shuttle. I was also told that it could not be removed from my bill. This was enraging! When I booked the trip on Orbitz, and when I checked in, I was not informed of this hidden charge. I would have cancelled my reservation out of principle and driven home after the concert if I had known about this absurd ripoff. Why is Red Rock Resort nickeling and diming its guests? Are they actually TRYING to destroy any goodwill they may otherwise have generated? Red Rock did such a great job of pissing me off that I will never stay here again, nor will I recommend them to my out of town guests. Nice going on the goodwill front, Red Rock! Elevators: Look out for the Olympic-length walk to your room! The hotel is crescent-shaped, and unfortunately, some genius decided to place the elevators at one end of the crescent, while the rooms extend along the crescent beginning at the elevators. I'm a healthy, in-shape male, but I had to walk about 500 feet to get to my room from the elevator -- and I was only about halfway down the crescent! I pity those who were at the very end. This is a very tiresome walk, especially with luggage. There's not much the hotel can do about it, but my advice is to get a bellhop to deliver your luggage to your room, instead of carrying or wheeling it yourself. Restaurants and Pools: This was perhaps the highlight of my visit. The Salt Lick, a BBQ joint on the premises, is outstanding. And the pool area is gorgeous and a great place to see a summer night concert.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: desertdocnv
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Red Rock five times in the past two years and each time was a wonderful experience. Red Rock Canyon itself is (of course) beautiful, and is a great change of pace from the usual Vegas strip view. The hotel itself is within five minutes of several of the best golf courses in Vegas. There is an excellent mix of tables in the casino that range from low stakes to high rollers. Plus - poolside blackjack in the summer! The hotel itself is gorgeous and the pool is in the top three in all of Vegas (recently featured in the movie "21"). The rooms are modern, clean, and beautiful, and the bed is extremely comfortable. My first visit I actually bought the pillows off my bed and now sleep on them every night. Yes, the Red Rock is very far from the strip, but if you're looking for a relaxing resort vacation this is actually a plus. Summerlin is a beautiful neighborhood with excellent dining options. If you plan on going to the strip, the best option is to rent a car at the airport. It's much cheaper than cabs and more convenient than shuttles. If you have kids there is a great deal for them to do at the Red Rock as well. In addition to the pool there is a bowling alley, food court, movie theater, arcade, and a Kids Quest. The hotel also has a number of family friendly restaurants (I particularly recommend the rock shrimp burritos at the Mexican restaurant). The staff at the Red Rock are very helpful and courteous. I have had two visits where I actually got to the hotel early and was given an early check in. I have always felt very welcome and appreciated by the staff. I have never had a major issue at the hotel and the minor ones have been handled perfectly. Bottom line - this is the best hotel in Vegas if you're traveling with your family. If you want a strip vacation there are a number of perfectly good hotels on Las Vegas Boulevard. If you're looking for a relaxing resort vacation (spa, dining, pool, golf, outdoor activities at Red Rock Canyon, and perhaps a little gambling) this is THE place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' It Like a Rockstar at Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: DesertOwl
Reviews.Content: My first time stay at the Red Rock Resort for two nights was awesome. Modern and tastefully designed property with all of the amenities you could ask for at this chic off strip hotel & spa. The place is huge, a world within itself without the cheesiness that permeates Las Vegas. The room was super clean and quiet, beds comfortable and the views of the strip were amazing. I requested a quiet room and was promptly accommodated on the 17th floor (did I mention that the view was fantastic through an entire wall of floor to ceiling windows? The spacious room included a a large flat screen TV, deep soaking tub with a second, smaller flat screen in the marbled bathroom. Service is there when you need them to be and respectful when you want privacy. Food options abound, ranging from an inexpensive food court, two buffets and high end sushi and steak house. Several stylish bars, a night club and of course, the casino were all equally welcoming. If gambling is not your focus, the Red Rock offers a 14-plex movie theater, bowling lanes and an arcade for the younger family members. I was incredibly impressed with the pool scene. Good music, colorful towels, lounge chairs and cabanas were all arranged in a circle around the main pool, sporting numerous additional pools throughout. The spa has its own pool and lough area, which makes it nice for those who want a little distance from families with children. There is a bar complete with misting to keep you hydrated while sipping a wide variety of cocktails offered on the menu. The casino and hotel are both easily accessed from the centrally located pool area. The hotel spa was impressive and you automatically gain access through your resort fee of $20 a day, which gives you the opportunity to not schedule a treatment but still use the spa. Red Rock Resort offers free, prompt shuttle service (it's actually a small bus) to and from the Airport every two hours. A cab will cost you $55, depending on time of day and traffic. My wake up call was right on time and the bellhop, front desk and concierge staff were all friendly and helpful. You can arrange to go for hikes, bike rides and kayaking a short distance away in the Red Rock National Park area. I didn't get to take advantage of this so I can't review the activities. You can't go wrong staying here. A few things to keep in mind though: The pool closes at 7 or 8 PM and staffs security who will oust you from the area if you are there after hours. I would like to see the resort offer an area where you can sit outside and chill, AWAY from the casino in the evening. Also, the mini bar and snack tray have electronic sensors. As is typical in Vegas, you touch, you pay. Red Rock Resort is a fantastic alternative to saying on the strip! Go Rock it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel; Incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: dalegainey
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Casino is an incredible hotel! The room was cool & mod; bigger than expected and the hotel service was so much better than the massive Strip hotel's du jour. The rest of the hotel was geogeous as well. The pools were very accomodating with a bunch of room to spread out. I swam in one of the 7 smaller pools (all by myself) in the middle of the day! The speakers were playing a bit loud everywhere, but we never had a problem finding our place in the sun. The casino was cool and inviting - many, many drinks for such a short amount of time:) As most LV hotels, smoke was an issue for my asthmatic wife. Mandalay was the best hotel for this issue, but RR did an OK job with the ceiling architecture and fans to pull the smoke upwards. Everything runs in a circle around the central bar; table games close to the center and slots all over the friggin' place. The room was extremely cool! Much bigger than the West Wing at MGM, and as "decked out" as Paris and Mandalay Bay, but in a hip/mod design. We stayed on the 15th floor with a RR view, which was stunning. Initially, our view overlooked the pool, then the RR canyon, which was beautiful! We did have a long walk to our room (the higher you go - the longer the walk), but this was not a big deal in the grand scheme of things. We loved not staying on the strip! This trip was a vegas vacation without the strip hassle. We took the hotel shuttle 2x, which came in handy. There was a $60 cab fee to and from the airport as we didn't take the shuttle at those times. I could have avoided this if I'd planned the flight/transfers better. I love this hotel. I've been to vegas 6 times, and Red Rock was my best trip. Mandalay Bay was the best strip hotel I've stayed in, but I'll go to RR from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “A real Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Bunnye1223
Reviews.Content: The first thing I liked about the Red Rock is that they have an airport shuttle bus downstairs. One level below the regular shuttles (It was somewhat difficult locating the shuttle from the airport, because I thought it would be with the other shuttles) Once on the bus, the driver, gave us each a bottle of cold water, which was very much appreciated, as it was hot. Get to the hotel, it is simply stunning.... Check in was pleasant...they have small bottles of water and apples for your enjoyment. Now, the room was alllllllllllllllllll the way down the hallway...... away from the elevator, but that too was ok I could use the walk. The room itself was very stunning, and lavish....the marble in the bathroom and the flat screen t.v. in the bathroom were a treat. The tub and shower are separate. Again, stunning. The bed, oh my goodness, was like a dream come true. It was so comfortable and relaxing, that I didn't want to leave it..... There is a large flat screen t.v. Now, the view, was of construction, but even that didn't bother me. There is the casino, Starbucks, buffet place(where you will get a couple of dollarsoff your meal with their station card) There is a movie theater and a place to go bowling. At night I left the curtains pulled back, and was able to enjoy the lightening show. I can't wait to go back to this place. Even though it is no where near the strip, you have everything your little heart desires in this fabu hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: TJDora
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that was recommended to me by one of my business partners. Upon arrival, there were not two rooms available for checkin which is understandable. The front desk rep was robotic. She told us it would take an hour and she would call us on our cell. Three hours later they called (about 345 pm). I arrived at the front desk and they had one room available. They could not get the second room until later. Other people were checking in as we continued to wait for our second room After a few minutes I asked why we could not get a second room. They said our room had already been assigned and it was not clean. Again, no apology, no sympathy. The seemed to feel I was lucky to be a customer. I asked if I could just cancel my rooms (3 night stay) and go somewhere else. They said I would have to pay for one night for both rooms. When Vanessa, the manager, got involved she was kind enough to allow me to pay for just one night for only one room. I felt that was unreasonable, since I had never been in a room, had the priveledge of hanging around their lobby for four hours even after the published checking time. I asked to see her superior and she said I could speak to him but he would give me the same answer. She said he was in a meeting and would not be available until later. I had the option of leaving and paying one night for one room or wait for him. I opted to checkin to both rooms (the second one became available) and check out the next morning without penalty and stay the next two nights at another hotel. Unbeleivable. The management of this hotel is just processing cattle. They could care less. It is an honor for you to be their customer. I finally spoke to Joe Saldana the front office manager. He agreed with my position and assured me he would speak to Vanessa. He asked what he could do to make amends. I told him nothing. I don't want anything. I am not asking for compensation. I want to be greated nicely, provided a room in a timely basis, treated as a human being and enjoy my stay. None of these things happened. I just wanted to have fun in Las Vegas for three days. Now I get to find another hotel after being forced to stay at Red Rocks. I would not recommend Red Rocks. I would look for a hotel that is focused on customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Ayleszona
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel was going to be a ways off the Strip; however, I thought the pictures on the website made the drive worth it. Luckily, I was right...and in a BIG way! This hotel is divine! Loved the interior decorating...everywhere! The hotel has a way of making every guest feel 5 star. My financee and I absolutely loved it. We're not sure if we'd stay any other place in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: dsn4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Resort for 7 days and it was fantastic! Check-in was swift and efficient. I had requested a room by the elevator (helpful because some rooms can be a longer walk to the elevator), and even though a strip view room was not available, they gave us a (more expensive) canyon view room for the same rate. The staff was very helpful and friendly with any requests that we had. (When we checked in our room was missing one bathrobe, and after one phone call, they brought it up within 5 minutes). With the restaurants, casino, movie theater and bowling ally on site, there is so much to do there, and the pool area was magnificant! One tip though is to avoid the severely overpriced food at the pool grill -- $14.00 for a hamburger is ridiculous! However it was otherwise terrific. If you head down Charleston Blvd to the Strip, it's only about a 15-20 min drive...not bad! I highly recommend this resort and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is the definition of Fabulosity!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaGirl22
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to the Red Rock every New Years for the last two years and intend on continuing the tradition. We arrive on New Years Day and the Hotel is fairly empty. The hotel itself is a beautiful resort in a breath-taking location. It is the perfect Vegas experience without the hustle and bustle of the Strip. However, should you love everything the Strip has to offer (which I do!!) you are only 13 miles away. During busy hours it can take 30 minutes with traffic, but I have made it to the Strip from the Red Rock in 12 minutes without traffic. It really is the best of both worlds. Cherry Nightclub is a lot of fun and the pool is great for singles, married couples, teenagers, and children. The Spa is a tranquil and relaxing setting and all the procedures I and friends have had are everything we expected and more. I personally recommend the Ashiatsu massage for those that enjoy an interesting and "harder" massage. The Sports Massage is also great for getting your body feeling loose and relaxed. While the prices aren't cheap for the Spa or Hotel, they are certainly comparable to other luxury resorts and definitely worth the money. The slots can be tighter, but that is expected at a higher dollar establishment. I personally don't gamble very much but the facilities are perfect if gambling is your pasttime. They are many varieties of machines and games. However, the cocktail waitresses do not come around as often as other places. The rooms are extremely modern and even the smallest room is a very decent size. I have had both the Strip and Canyon views separate times and they are equally nice depending on ones preference. The beds are extremely comfortable and the bathroom is large with a bathtub and plasma screen (which I have enjoyed relaxing in, every time I have been to the Red Rock). There is a movie theatre for kids and although it is a upscale hotel, they do have facilities the kids can enjoy. Many people have complained about the $19.95 resort fee. It is mentioned all over the Red Rock website and they make it clear when you book a room over the phone. Although it is not optional, it allows you to use the pool facilities, the trams to and from the Strip, the gym (which is exceptional for a hotel gym), and Spa. I may be forgetting other things that I have not used. Either way, going to the Spa each day to unwind (whether you have a treatment or not) is worth it. For those that don't believe me, just try it! This establishment is my favorite place to stay off the strip. And as much as I love the Strip, I would rather stay at the Red Rock and drive back and forth to the Strip since this hotel is so amazing! Word to the wise: It is not cheap and if you can't afford it, don't bother. There is no point in going to be miserable about spending so much money and not enjoying a cocktail, dinner, gambling, etc. I have had dinner at different restaurants in there and they are delicious. If you are frugal with money I suggest not staying here, as you may not enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: ucliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rocks for the first 5 nights of our honeymoon. Overall, the property was clean and gorgeous. The staff went out of their way to help us with anything they needed. The free apples and bottles of water were a nice touch. The casino didn't feel crowded as some do, and the restaurants were awesome (although we stuck to the buffet for breakfast or lunch, which was probably the best we had in a 15 day trip). We also enjoyed the movie theater and bowling alley. It is a really nice alternative to the strip. It was still Vegas, just a laid back cleaner version. There are a few drawbacks. The pool, while beautiful, was freezing!! Get there early if you want an umbrella. It was $23 for a margarita and a rum runner. The view is of a parking garage, even with the canyon view. Well, a parking garage, some suburbs, and then the rocks. We had a major issue with our keys. By the time we left, I had 5 keys. The first day, they didn't have the smoking king we requested, and we moved the second day. My curling iron disappeared in the move. I called housekeeping, and never got a response back. We were locked out of our room 5 different times. The elevator at the pool didn't go to our floor either, which was extremely frustrating. The hallways were VERY long, and the elevators are on one side. The curved design makes you feel like you are on a neverending quest! Also, the buffet lines were extremely long. Our last day, I waited 30 minutes in line (while my husband checked out). I gave it a higher rating though because this was a great place. A little tip- there is a CVS about a mile away. Go there and get your drinks. We saved a bundle by doing that! We brought our own to the pool the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rockilicious!”
Reviews.Author: HogFan1
Reviews.Content: We returned last Friday from a 5 day 4 night stay at the lovely Red Rock Casino Resort & Spa. The entire experience was better than I had anticipated. The accomodations were above par, as were the dining, pool area, and spa. The soaking tub was totally awesome with the flat screen t.v. right over it. The bed and bedding were heavenly. Although I am not a proponant of Las Vegas as a 'family' vacation destination, I will say that this facility has everything you could need to entertain everyone. Having stayed at the Mirage often for the pool atmosphere, I believe that I prefer Red Rock. There are multiple pools w/ varying degrees of privacy and accessiblity. You are charged a daily resort fee and I strongly suggest utililzing the spa facilities that you are paying for as well as the spa pool for quiet get away time. Utilize the water bottles, fruit juices, teas and fruits to recharge and energize. The staff is among the friendliest and most helpful of all the Vegas properties at which I have stayed. If sleep is a consideration for you, I suggest you request a strip view close to the elelvator. The night club on the weekends is a boomer and you don't want to be near it unless you're going to be up past 3a.m. The strip view was nice and twinkly. The casino was nice and easily navigated and not too smoky or loud. I enjoyed the 5$ tables and the variety of slots. Prepare to wait for the hotel shuttle at the airport or pay 50-60$ for a taxi/car. I highly recommend this property and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Resort review by The Travel Center at Steamboat”
Reviews.Author: Roxydmb21
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Resort was a very welcoming hotel. On arrival via the shuttle bus from the airport we were all handed bottle water and greeted by the staff. The frront desk clerk was very informative about shuttles and services. She was very friendly and handed me more bottle water and gave me an apple. The hotel room was very modern with a nice view of the pool and the bed was soooo comfortable. This hotel would be ideal for families because it has a lot to offer for every age group. There is a movie theater and bowling alley for the young ones. A variety of restaurants for all different budgets and food choices. This hotel is approx. 20minutes from the Vegas Strip. I would reccommend a rental car and or check into the shuttles prior to see if it would suite your needs. Overall this hotel was a very positive experience for me.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock quiet & nice”
Reviews.Author: Kari63
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel and clean rooms with wonderful beds. However, very quiet at night --Cherry Lounge was closed when we were there monday-Wed. wasn't any lounge bands and the casino was very quiet --didn't see many players or winners in fact in our group of 15 everyone lost --very tight slots. Arcade was small & many of the lower priced machines were not working. Pool was great because they have the most comfortable lounge chairs that u can place right in the water! Drinks at the pool were outrageously priced - $12 for a drink in an 12 ounce plastic cup--that's a bit of gouging! Be aware that there is a charge of $20 per day added to your bill even if u don't use these additional amenities like the shuttle or fitness center--and the 3 nights we were there we only had turn down svc once-- I just hate when hotels add these additional fees to their room rates when u check in --just put it in your room rate to start with if its mandatory. Also we had requested rooms close to elevators and received rooms on the oppositie end of the hall furtherst from elevators --wierd design only elevators on one side of the floors. Overall if your looking for a very quiet relaxing stay away from the strip then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: dwallner
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why people would put this hotel down. It is the best deal in Vegas. You will need a car if you plan on going to the strip. The room is the best I have ever stayed in. I scored big at the blackjack table---I only play the five dollar tables. We ate at the T-Bone resturant was awesome but a bit pricey. If you want a laid back experience stay at the Red Rock. The only thing I would fault them for is not telling me about a 150 dollar hold they put on your credit card so their room is not destroyed--that is 150 dollar a day. The people are great...I do not understand why people on this web site put down the people that work there--they all were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.. But...”
Reviews.Author: dreamia22
Reviews.Content: I booked a four night stay at the Red Rock Resort. The complimentary shuttle to and from the airport was nice, but we ended up having to wait an hour for the bus, because it only comes every couple of hours... The hotel was beautiful like everyone had claimed it to be. It was very modern and nicely decorated, not like your normal strip hotel. You also don't have to walk through the casino to get to your room. Infact, you don't even see much of it at all, because it's on the second floor so that was nice that we didn't have to trip over people at the slots to get to our room. I really like the fact that the doormen were always there to open the doors for you and greet you every time you enter and leave the building. It was a nice touch that most other casinos didn't do. The check-in took a long time because there was a line, but they were friendly. There is free water and apples at the counter so make sure to grab some when you can. When we went to our room we ended up getting one somewhere in the middle which is still far from the main elevator, but really close to the pool elevator. We didn't mind the walk really.. The view of the strip at night was very beautiful but a lot farther away than the pictures on their website suggest. And the first thing I saw when I looked out the window besides the strip in the distance was the eyesore of construction directly below. They are building another parking lot, so I strongly suggest staying on the canyon view side, because they ended up having to move us after two days due to the sound waking us up at six in the morning. The canyon view is much nicer anyway. You get the view of the pool as well which is a really beautiful pool even though we never got to use it. It was kind of chilly when we were there on Memorial Day, but the hot tub was nice. I liked the flat panel tv's and the bed was VERY comfortable. Probably more comfy than mine at home. The bathrooms had his and hers sinks, a deep soaking tub with tv and a stand up shower. You receive the daily paper in the morning outside your door. Again, very beautiful. Probably the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed in. For eateries they had many different choices. I wanted to eat at Cabo Mexican Restaurant, but we never had the opportunity. I strongly suggest the breakfast buffet at FEAST buffet. It is a very reasonable price. We had it the first three days. We also ate their once at supper time which was also just as good. The food court is pretty pricey though.. We ate there only once. We didn't go to their night clubs, because they weren't ever open and even if they were I don't think there would have been too many people in there.. We didn't get to see Zowie Bowie because he's only there on Thursdays through Saturdays.. We didn't go to their cinema, because I mean come on... you don't go to Vegas to watch a movie. You can do that at home! I heard the spa was worth going to, but we simply didn't have time during the day to go because we were always out at the strip. So we pretty much just stayed in our room at night and went on the casino floor for a little bit. We're not big gamblers, but they did have five cent black jack on the machines which was pretty fun. Didn't win much, but didn't lose much either. The reason I probably won't come back...I read nearly hundreds of reviews before booking this hotel and I probably should have listened more closely to one of the most important things people were constantly saying... If you're going to spend time on the strip you should probably stay at one of the hotels on the strip, because this hotel is probably about fifteen to twenty minutes away. I didn't think this was going to be a problem with their complimentary shuttle service. And if you're anything like me, driving in Vegas (especially around the strip area) is no option. It is just way to crazy for me and even my boyfriend to drive around there. However, upon arrival I found out that the shuttle bus only leaves every couple of hours and the last time they pick you up from the strip is 9:00 PM... Why? I kept asking myself this question. We missed all the night life and shows which is the reason why you go to Vegas in the first place. It would be different if they had something else to offer at Red Rock besides gambling at night, but their pool closes at 8:00 so by the time we come back there is nothing to do.. I couldn't believe they didn't offer a later shuttle service... Unfortunately, this is probably the only reason we will never stay at the Red Rock again which is a shame, because it really is a beautiful hotel. The upside of the location besides the beautiful view is that it is only eight miles from Red Rock Canyon. We rented a car for a day through enterprise which they have available at the hotel concierge office. They always have a couple of rental cars available at the hotel itself. The drive out there wasn't anything compared to the traffic of the strip so it was a nice drive. The views were spectacular and the canyons were a lot of fun to hike around. I suggest the first couple of stops on the scenic drive. Personally, I thought those were the most fun to hike because those rocks are easier to climb around and the most beautiful, because they have the red color. My boyfriend and I will definitely come back to hike the canyons again. Overall, the hotel was beautiful and elegant for the deal I recieved.. I wouldn't want to pay more than that. I loved how it was close to the canyons also. However, it is still way too far from the strip and the shuttle needs better drop-off and pick-up times.. If they could change their shuttle times to 24 hours I would come back in a heartbeat. I guess if you didn't want to visit the strip at all this would be a good place for you, but I mean come on this is VEGAS... if you want rest and relaxation go to Cancun...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a 5-star property!”
Reviews.Author: yam1976
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights over Memorial Day weekend. Paid $69/night at Hotwire three months prior to. Rooms are very modern, big (about 500sqft), elegant and clean. Big 42’ LCD on the wall. Floor-to-ceiling windows with amazing view of the Strip, though the view is a bit far. Bathroom is big with a small tv facing the tub, separate door for toilet for privacy, double sink, and separate shower. Robes and slippers are provided as well. The “Do not disturb” and “Make up room” signs are electronic, all you need to do is push the button in your room beside the door if you want either request. The lighting in the room could be better, even when the reading lights are on. The beds are heavenly, comparable to Palazzo’s beds and more comfortable than Paris’s, Flamingo GO’s and South Point’s beds. Hotel is about 2 years old only. The grounds around the hotel are marvelous, lots of palm trees. Hotel registration took less than five minutes.The lobby inside is gorgeous. The whole atmosphere is very hip and trendy. You will need a car if staying at this place. The car ride is about 25 mins. to the Strip. There ‘s also a shuttle for hotel guests, part of the $21.79 daily “resort fee”, up from $19.95 recently. Aside from the shuttle, services included in the fee were free bottles of water and apples in the lobby, daily newspaper delivered to your door, and turndown service. If you happen to stay here, ask for a room near the elevator, it'll save you lots of walking because the elevators are only on one side of the hotel. The pool is great, one big round pool with fountain in the middle, and several small pools including Jacuzzis. Lounge chairs have cushion and are plenty. Pool is open from 8-8pm when we were there. The Feast Buffet is very good. Lots of variety and the ambience is the best of all the buffets we’ve tried. Very bright, modern. Price is reasonable at $16.99 per person for dinner with players card (18.99 without card). The buffet is slightly better than Mirage and Green valley ranch’s but below Mandalay’s Bayside buffet. Overall, I cannot complain anything about this hotel. One thing I noticed though is that this hotel is family oriented because of the pool, arcade and cinemas. But even for couples this is great. With their amenities, you don't need to leave the property if you don't want to. Only time we left the property is when we had evening shows to attend or to meet up with friends. This is definitely worth the $69 a night for a five-star property in my opinion. P.S. I apologize for the wrong date on the attached pictures. It should've been 05/25/08. Just forgot to reset the date on my camera while there.

Reviews.Title: “Love It - Especially if You're Not a Fan of The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Highcon
Reviews.Content: I've never been big on the whole Vegas concept...and we're avid hikers who love the desert...so I wanted a place that wasn't the typical "strip" hotel. Boy, this really met the bill. It's about twenty minutes from the strip on the outskirts of town, near the "red rocks" that give the hotel its name and inspire its decore. We loved the Frank-Loyd-Wright-ist meets postmodern style of the place; it's also wonderfully self contained with the casino (of course) plus bowling alley, movie theater, fully equiped spa, and concierge service for hiking in the canyons next store. You can stay there a week and never need to leave the area. The spa services - which really distinguish this place from the strip experience - were excellent and definitely one of the highlights of the stay. We were there in January so we had the pool area to ourselves (and it was too cold to swim), but there were plenty of amenities, including a fully equiped work out room and several jaccuzzies. The casino itself has higher ceilings so it doesn't feel as closed in as a lot of places on the strip. Mostly, though, we loved the convenience to Red Rock Canyons and the wonderful hiking trails. We even made it over to the strip for dinner one night, but coming back to Red Rock we were so glad to be able to escape the crowds and return to our little corner of paradise, where we could see the lights of the strip in the distance from our window. It was a memorable vacation at Red Rock and boy, am I glad I chose it over one of the typical strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cab1230
Reviews.Content: My sister and I usually go to Las Vegas every year in May for Monday-Friday trip. In the past, we've stayed at Treasure Island, The Mirage, but usually at Mandalay Bay, which we absolutely love. This year, we decided to try something different, "off the strip" and when we saw that The Red Rock offered a free shuttle to the airport and the strip, we decided to try it. The rooms were beautiful, the pool area was really nice and not crowded. The food at the buffet was good and the Bar B Que restaurant was excellent. There are some expensive restaurants there, but there are enough reasonably priced places to eat, as well as a "food court." They also have movie theaters and bowling alleys. The casino area was bright and the air wasn't smokey, even when you were next to a smoker. The slots were pretty good and we were able to play for a while without losing a lot of money. There are so many penny machines!! We took a shuttle to the strip one day, and were really disappointed with the slot machines at the casinos we went to on the strip. The only things we didn't like was the timing of the airport shuttle and the $21.75 per day casino fee. Our plane got into Las Vegas at 2:00 p.m., so we missed the 2 p.m. shuttle, and had to wait 2 hours. Our plane left Las Vegas at 6 a.m. and we had to be at the airport at 4 a.m. There are no shuttles at that time but the bell desk arranged for us to have a sedan take us to the airport, which was cheaper than a taxi would have been (wonderful!) Just make sure you leave your name with the bell desk the day before your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent VIP treatment for the young successful type”
Reviews.Author: fuellenbach
Reviews.Content: I have never heard of this place until a friend told me about it. The Red Rock Hotel and Spa was recommended with such exclusive repertoire that I flew into Las Vegas with doubts about my choice to stay there. Luckily I have fantastic friends whom knew that I would love the first class VIP rooms overlooking the strip. The rooms were way under priced spending only $600 a night I had my own large private living room separate to my own marble bathroom and lush inviting bedroom. My room was divided from others with it's own VIP elevator, concierge service, complimentary fresh fruit, breakfast, and paper in the morning. Mornings were good but at night is where the Red Rock really shines. It doesn't matter if you are playing at the tables, going to there clubs (which were a bachelor's dream), or going to dinner with new friends from the clubs the Red Rock treats VIPs' like they should be treated. There was no waiting in lines for anything. Overall I rate my experience to be the best hotel experience I have ever had. The Terra Rosa has chocolate lava cake that can make a grown man cry it's so good. The pool is huge and the VIP treatment is the best I have ever had with spending so little. This will be the hotel I choose to stay at when I return to Las Vegas. That lava cake was so good!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DontesGal
Reviews.Content: STAY HERE ON YOUR NEXT VEGAS TRIP!!!! This is my 2nd time to Vegas, and I stayed on the Strip last year. This year, I wanted a more quiet getaway as we did not plan on seeing shows or shopping this time. We had just missed the free shuttle and in lieu of waiting 2 hours, got a sedan to take us out - it was $70 We checked in at noon and our room was ready. We had a standard room and it was awesome! Bed was so comfy!!! AMAZING Bathroom!!!!! We planned on bowling and going to the movies and playing bingo, but never had the chance so I can't comment on those activities. The Pool area is AWESOME!!!!! We walked around the area, but actually hung out at Cherry's pool - it was more intimate. Just a note: topless is allowed at this pool. We ate at the BBQ - really good food, but GIGANTIC portions!! Terra Rossa was really good. The sushi restaurant came highly recommended, but we never got there. The Grand Cafe has ok food, but found the service to be not so hot. The Mexican place in the food court was not good, but Villa Pizza was really good and Fatburgers was just ok. The Feast Buffet was really good provided you don't wait in line. There were l-o-n-g lines Sun and Mon, but none on Tuesday so we ate there that day. The bar in the lobby is a neat place to drink and chill out and people watch. We weren't there when Cherry was open - I had wanted to go there. The elevators come really fast - a nice change of pace from last year's experience at NYNY. We took the free shuttle back to the airport. I cannot wait to stay here again - it was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a resort=Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: Valueskr
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. I liked the new and clean room. All techy, in room amenities, 42in LCD tv, great work station and amazing bathroom, yeah the tub (separate from shower) has its own LCD tv.
