The price was great compared to those other LAS 4 star resorts. Spa access (steam, sauna, jacuzzis etc), fitness complex are included. The pools, no shortage on this side, it has at least 7 pools. So plenty of room to move around in the pool area if you want to be by yourself or get to main pool and meet others. Yeah the drive is around 15 mins from strip, but once you check in there is no big reason to drive out of there....also there are many other restaurants within 2-4 min drive. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Within resort there are high end restaruants, your typical food court ones, plus bars and bowling lanes. Definitely a great value!

Reviews.Title: “A different vibe and a new favorite place in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: onoman
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure to stay at Red Rock for a business meeting recently. Was a little bit surprised that our meeting was so far off the Strip and other Vegas activities. So I came here with fairly low expectations. Surprise! When you drive up there is already a different Vegas experience. Staff is very friendly, not very "uppity" or stressed as at other Vegas strip hotels on a Friday afternoon. Decor in lobby is very modern, very cool furniture and chandelier. A general feeling of openness about the hotel and had great views of surrounding Red Rock mountains. During stay, staff was very friendly and helpful, check in and check out was a breeze. Free water bottles and apples available in lobby and gym. Free newspapers each morning, always a nice touch. Hotel is spacious both vertical and horizontal. Casino is on second floor, meeting rooms above, lobby and shops below. My room was on floor above Casino and I did not hear a sound. Also did not hear any noise from the Kanye West Concert that was going on around the pool that evening! Meeting facilities were great, many of the meeting rooms had great views of the Red Rock State Park. Also the large balconies in these rooms allowed for the meeting breaks to be very refreshing, did not have the claustrophobic feeling of some of the meeting rooms at the Strip Hotels. Never realized that Vegas had any natural beauty until I stayed at this hotel. Room I got was two queens, very large with large HD flat screen TV and another flat screen in bathroom, set up to watch in the bathtub. Shower was separate with glass enclosure. I used the gym facilities--very nice, had a small pool outside of the gym that was very private with lounge chairs and cabanas available for use. Great place to relax after a workout in the gym and not have to worry about the crowd at the main pool scene. Spa services also available, but did not partake. They can arrange outdoor activities--hiking, biking and even kayaking! No onsite golf course. Outside main pool is a happening place--lots of lounge chairs, cabanas available, fountain in middle of pool. Loud music, lots of activities. I did not hang out at this pool. Casino was not smokey! Also very friendly crowd, I think lots of locals hang out here and the crowd age was definitely on the younger side. Casino minimum bets were not as high as at the Strip hotels. There is a movie theatre and a bowling alley as part of the hotel--did not have time for either one on this trip. I was surprised by the food. Some of the best hotel food I have had in a long time, ate 4 meals at the hotel as part of our business meeting. All meals were different and the food was very good, even the Asian dishes, I am Asian and am very picky about this type of food, but was really surprised by how good the food was. Did I miss not being on the Strip? No, I actually enjoyed the lack of crowds and the chaos of the Strip. Would I come back again--definitely. May not be for the first time Vegas visitor--it is about 30 minutes northwest of the Strip or a $50 cab ride, but if you are looking for something different, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Oasis-Will return again”
Reviews.Author: frg1995
Reviews.Content: We have been to Las Vegas several times prior to this trip and usually stayed on strip or at the Orleans which we like very much but this time we wanted to do things totally different. What a gem of a resort this is for all. Booked for 5 nights and just was not long enough. We had late check in at night and the staff greeted us very professionally and very helpful. We had booked through Allegiant Air and chose this resort package. I had called direct and requested higher level floor and possibly with mountain or pool view. Well, we got it all. They placed us on 12th floor to begin with but upon walking in and going barefoot into the bathroom we noticed carpet very wet. Called down to desk and was told they would move us up to 16th floor, sending bellman up with keys to change rooms. The rooms are awesome from furnishing very contemporary to the view of not only of Red Rock Canyon but a direct view of beautiful pool. Everywhere we looked the rooms were well cleaned and no problems with staff. In fact, our check in guy, Alfonso was extremely pleasant and sent to our room the next day bottle of sparkling wine to celebrate our anniversary. Did not open then but requested from T-Bones restaurant if could bring down but would charge $35.00 corking fee! Well, we chose to open in our room and enjoy. The pool staff is very accomodating and pleasant. Pool area--well, it is the best and always plenty of places to lounge. Too bad the hours are 9:00am-7pm because would be great to have evening swim or sit by pool area and relax at night. We loved the starting mornng with breakfast buffet, wait staff very nice and attentive. Grand Cafe was okay but we ate most away. Not gamblers but loved the hotels decor and amazed how well built and corrdinating interior and exterior was through out. The Valet was very good and never kept us waiting long and ALWAYS ask if you need directions anywhere (nice touch). Also, in the main hotel lobby they keep bottled water available all the time and you can have whenever you like plus the best crisp apples. Would we stay here again? You bet and I don't think you would be unhappy at all with this choice. Booked a Grand Canyon West Rim with Skywalk and we had rented car so drove out to see Valley of Fire (what views). This is great place if you rent a car but can see if fees for taxis are high and you like the strip scene, you might want to reconsider. We have enjoyed many shows in past and been on strip at night enough that we chose to enjoy the ambiance of Red Rock hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, truly awful service”
Reviews.Author: siopup
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a two night stay at Red Rock only to be greeted by an extremely rude front desk person advising us that the two rooms we had booked had only come through as one. And a blank, bored stare. We asked if this could be fixed, showing the confirmation with TWO ROOMS CLEARLY LISTED, and we were told snottily that it wasn't up to them. Cue blank stare again. It took 20 minutes for them to check with a manager and finally let us have two rooms. They admitted there was several rooms available anyway. OK. So we go to our rooms. Which are BEAUTIFUL. Make no mistake, this is a gorgeous hotel. The rooms, the spa and the pool area are particularly wonderful. However, we continued to get stuck with horrible service from front desk. We called to confirm that our room had breakfast (per the booking) and spent 15 minutes going in circles between security and front desk before anyone could help us. The next morning, we went downstairs to confirm the details and spoke to Carmen. Oh, Carmen. I wanted to throttle her! She was so rude, rolling her eyes and sighing and not ONCE apologising for any inconvenience. And she could NOT agree to the breakfast until we asked to speak to the manager. We left feeling extremely disappointed and pretty angry with the whole experience. Coming from Australia, we had hoped that this was going to be wonderful and it turned out to be a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 77Molly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock for a business event and the hotel and the staff were wonderful. We had a standard room and it was nicely sized, with a very large bathroom. The pool area was beautiful and nicely kept, as was the spa. I had a spa treatment while I was there, which was also great. The only drawback is that since you are far away from the strip, unless you are willing to pay the relatively expensive cab ride, your only options for entertainment are to stay on premisis or wait for the shuttle to take you to the strip. We didn't know about the shuttle until our last day there since the one staff member said there wasn't one then another said there was, but this was the only lapse in the service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Billiebob
Reviews.Content: We loved our suite! Very comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was beautiful! The Japanese restaurant in the hotel has very good sushi. We enjoyed the casino. We loved the spa. We loved the pool! We enjoyed our stay! Close to the Red Rocks which I highly recommend seeing; a 13 mile trip around the beautiful red rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Rates #1”
Reviews.Author: RazConnecticut
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Resort was outstanding. The hotel was quiet, clean and comfortable. This was my first time to Las Vegas and we also stayed on the strip. If we return we will stay here. Roy the bell man was very helpful, knowledgeable and took care of my every request. I went to the Spa for a deep tissue massage which I ended up spending most of the day there. They have a private outdoor area away from the larger pool which gave me some time to rejuvenate. Dave the massage therapist was excellent. I have been getting massage for 15 years and he gave me one of the best ones I have had. The concierge, Annette, was more than helpful. She got us tickets to "O" , which is a must see show if you are in Vegas. The restaurants at Red Rock are just as good as any on the strip. If you want a great time without the craziness of the strip stay at Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: kristierae35
Reviews.Content: My husband had to be at Red Rock for meetings, so my 12-year old daughter and I accompanied him. We were very pleased with each aspect of the stay from the variety of restaurants, price range of the restaurants, the beautiful pool and surrounding areas. The staff was quite friendly and helpful as well as very effecient. The views from either side of the hotel were amazing and the beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was to die for with the large soaker tub and flat screen tv as well. Needless to say, we will choose Red Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock, Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Laslo55
Reviews.Content: 5 days at the Red Rock was just amazing. The best of Vegas in all considerations. This property is located off the strip, but our rental car took care of this, and allowed for side trips during our stay. We found the Red Rock very clean, ready when we arrived, with a duly attentive and courteous staff at the ready. The casino was managable in it's size and scope, with a layout that took only a little getting used to. Gambling staff was forgiving and even helpful to those of us who don't live at the blackjack tables. So much so, that we even managed to take a little bit of their profits home with us. The hotel was quiet and just far away enough from the late nite crowd. The pool was fabulous. One could have a drink, smoke a cigar, play blackjack in a bathing suit, all the while, working on your tan, and people watching. For just a few days, it was easy to imagine just how much fun, "old Vegas" must have been! I thoroughly enjoyed my time at the Red Rock Resort and Casino, and can recommend it heartily to others, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place- loved it”
Reviews.Author: kattykatt
Reviews.Content: really enjoyed out stay there- Husband there for a conference- me and kids for fun. The quality of the room was excellent, we heard no hallway noise, next room noise- matter of fact if you had both tv's on and closed the door between the room and bathroom - you couldn't hear the other tv. the bed was comfortable, lots of extra pillows, nice fluffy towels, huge deep bath tub (don't forget the bubble bath) my son is 6'1 and fit well in the tub (all you could see is his head, thats how deep it was). the kids hung out at the Arcade while we gambled one night (lost more on tokens then slots) - they also have a 6-12 kids quest but our kids were to old for that. The pool was awesome, lots of smaller pool areas but the coolest thing so far was the doorbell on each room!!! door bells that light up the 'do not disturb" or "make up room" . Housekeeping was friendly, gave out more shampoo when asked and a large bottle at that. The desk clerks at check in and out were nice- we asked that all snacks be removed from the room, they took out the table top snacks but non in the refrigerator, which was ok we had our cooler. Buffet was nice, typical vegas buffet, several fast food areas in the food court closed early on the wed that we arrived but fat burger is 24 hrs. We tried to bowl on Thurs but they had leagues there and there was a 1hr 45 min wait for a lane (which was empty when we arrived) we also saw a movie while we were there, nice theater, popcorn/drinks kinda pricy but not overwhelming and the ticket prices was right on track to what we usually pay. I am hoping hubby goes back next year- cause I am going with him-- maybe w/out the kids :) A very nice place A++++

Reviews.Title: “Potentially Great but Needs Better Management”
Reviews.Author: travelrob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Casino from April 1 to 4, 2008. The property is beautiful and "potentially" one of the best in Vegas. But the management is very poor. So poor, in fact, that it is on the verge of absurdity. Example number one....their beautiful pool area is the best place in Vegas to be choked by cigar and cigarette smoke. We were absolutely amazed that time after time we got "comfortable" only to be run out by another new cigar smoker. It was truly a flashback to the 1960's. Example number two......the sports book personnel "assured" me that they had 24 hour ticket cashing. Well, the actual number of hours to cash winning tickets was more like 18 hours. After the NCAA semifinals were played I drove from the Venetian to cash my tickets. The computers were "down." Their 24 hour computers were more accurately "closed." There was much confusion as to when they would re-open. Each employee that I talked to gave me a different time. Finally, the NIGHT MANAGER told me that they would "correct" this problem so no one would be "inconvenienced" by faulty information in the future. When I inquired "what's in it for me?" she replied that she was "sorry." I had a plane to catch in three hours and no time to come back. She said that I could "mail" the tickets in. To me an "I'm sorry" is very poor compensation for going way out of my way on an already busy morning. Example number three.....we were told at the end of our last visit on President's Day (2008) to contact a "certain high ranking manager" on our NEXT visit to receive "considerations" for finding "illegal substances" in our room upon check in. We left a message for this manager on our FIRST day and checked out without ever having our call returned. Very disappointing. They also ignored these same complaints on our "customer evaluation card" and never contacted us to "follow up" on those concerns either. In conclusion, one of the "potentially" best places in all of Las Vegas is in dire need of improved leadership and management. Although, all "front line" employees were extremely nice and helpful the quality of management is woefully inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is Nice!”
Reviews.Author: tbowman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rock for a business conference. The rooms are very nice and comfortable. Large bathrooms with seperate shower and bath. Also seperate toilet. Beds are very nice and comfy! Hotel itself is beautiful! The conference food was not as bad as I have read on some reviews here, and I am a picky eater. Now, for the bad part.... taxi ride to the hotel from airport is $50. If you want to go to the strip, either stay on the strip or rent a car. The hotel will help you with that, or it's cheaper to look online before you get there. Ask for a room near the elevator. It's a long haul with luggage if you stay on the other end of the hall. Room service is expensive, and just ok. You have to pay for internet in the room. If you remove anything from the fridge, or snack area in the room for more than 30 seconds-1min. (can't remember exactly) you pay for it, whether you use it or not. If you are just going to relax this would be a perfect place. IF you want to see the strip, etc. it would be cheaper to stay on the strip, and more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: pampam
Reviews.Content: My visit to Red Rock Resort took place over Spring Break (last week of March). My reason for choosing this property (and I have not heard or read any reviews on this topic yet) was the ADVENTURE SPA activities. It is a great option to Las Vegas to see the beautiful desert and enjoy the beauty that doesn't entail drinking or bright lights. The hotel offered to book outings - rafting down the Colorado, hiking throught Red Rock Canyon, kayaking, and bike riding just to name a few. My 13 yr. old nephew really enjoyed our rafting trip on a pontoon boat from Hoover Dam south to Willows Beach. David Bert is the manager of the adventure spa activities and he is the one to talk to for all the details. He is very knowledgable! The Hotel amenities were wonderful and the staff was friendly. My only complaint was that the pool did not open up untill 9am and while I was waiting for a treadmill in the fitness room, I sat on a lounge chair in the pool area. A "suit" came up to me and told me I could not be in the pool area. It was 8:30 a.m. I felt he could have used more discretion and not kicked me out as I was not planning on jumping in the pool. Bottom line: I would stay again here especially to get away from the strip and hike through Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Peace of Mind off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: walkerboydog
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Red Rock was our second in a years span and it remains one of our favorites. For a slower pace, give this place a shot if you have a car. The hotel lies several miles off the strip, at the edge of Red Rocks Conservation area, but has all the amenities of the strip without the congestion, traffic and prices. Our room was 80 dollars per night and was more than adequate with king sized platform bed, flat screen tv, soaking tub, TV over tub, and shower all done in marble. The bed was unbelievably comfortable. the rooms are also very quiet and at times I thought we were the only ones on our floor. We have stayed on both sides of the hotel. One side has a night view of the city that is amazing while the other has a day view of the canyons that is wonderful if you are up early enough to catch it. The swimming pool is top notch and the gym and spa are included in the room rate and resort fee (at 21 dollars a bit steep if you do not use any of the amenities). I can't say enough about how nice the pool is in the summer-great lounge chairs and a very relaxing atmosphere. The hotel and casino staff are fresh and friendly. Apples and water are free throughout the day in the lobby and a turn down service with chocolate was provided. Parking was ample and wait times for valet service was minimal. The casino was stingy to us but they all were. The buffet was good and cheaper than on the strip. Getting to the strip is a 20 minute drive. Take the freeway (215) to the north end of the strip or drive right down Charleston (the hotel is on Charleston and the 215 freeway) to go to the southern end of the strip. The neighbor hood has all the food stores, Borders, more restaurants etc. across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel blew us away”
Reviews.Author: Olivia101
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire and received a fabulous price of $79.00 per night. We love everything about it, right down to the hallways leading to the rooms. The room itself was modern, large, with a fabulous bathroom. We had a great view of the pools and mountains and our bed was unbelievably comfortable. We found the staff to be especially courteous and we had dinner at T-Bones and had a great time. We brought our two young kids and the staff there were fantastic with them. The pool area is gorgeous and the staff were once again very pleasant. Yes, its true, this hotel is not that close to the strip, however after spending three nights on the strip at the Bellagio (which we enjoyed), we felt the Red Rock was a welcome relief of the intensity of staying on the strip. Our only negative is that we can no longer find this hotel on hotwire and are wondering if others have found this secret gem, so its no longer on there. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others and we are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: tennisfan12
Reviews.Content: I must admit, after reading some of the reviews posted I was a little hesitant to visit the Red Rock, but WOW! We are so glad we did! Among a family of six, the Red Rock was by concensus our favorite hotel of our trip. The rooms were fantastic and extremely clean--of the utmost importance in a huge bathroom that boasts a soaking tub (used frequently by our group--twice as nice with two rooms!). The TVs in the bathrooms were a hit. The beds were comfortable and well-fitted with pillows and comforters. The sofa in one room, reading chairs in the other, were great. We were blown away by the gorgeous pool area (enhanced by perfect weather after leaving snow at home!). Round, mattressed loungers easily fit three, the more traditional cushioned lounges by and in the pool were also great. Service for food and drinks was easily available, but not pushed. Towel and chair-finding assistance was pleasantly provided. Every, yes, every staff person we encountered smiled and greeted us. Valets remembered us and used our names, as did bell, front desk, concierge and housekeeping staff. People were polite, helpful and fun! We didn't take advantage of the water and apples provided in the lobby as we had some on hand, but found this to be a nice touch. The facilities and amenities of the resort are outstanding, but as is true anywhere, interactions with people are what make travel memorable, and the Red Rock delivered in a big way!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - A Little Farther From Strip Than We Thought”
Reviews.Author: vadreamer
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, but it definately was further from the strip / airport than we anticipated. I called the hotel prior to making reservations and was told it was 17 minutes from the strip. That didn't sound too bad. Well, it was more like 30 minutes and a whopping $50 cab ride from the strip (we were tired one day and didn't want to wait four hours for the next shuttle and chose to take a taxi). Yeow! $50 plus tip = not doing that again! The room was beautiful and we didn't have any problems with anything being broken. We were on the 9th floor and we unfortunately did have a room at the opposite end from the elevator. It seemed like a mile walking down that hallway. My son joked about how fun it would be to ride a dirt bike up and down the LONG hallway. The bathroom was also beautiful and I particularly loved the shower. Appreciated the TV in the bathroom also. Nice touch. We never made it to the pool but it did look beautiful. We ate breakfast every morning at the buffet (make sure you get your players card for a discount). The buffet had a lot of choices and was decent. The hotel has a movie theatre with many choices and has a bowling alley. We were able to bowl one day and had a blast and it wasn't extremely expensive. There's an arcade for the kids too. I hate cigarette smoke but I didn't find the casino to be overly smokey. I knew I would smell some smoke but it wasn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be. Other than one shuttle driver (our first ride from the airport to the hotel) being aloof and not speaking to us at all, the other drivers were outstanding and very helpful. We forgot our camera one day on the bus and really thought we would never see it again. Tom, our morning shuttle driver, found the camera and turned it in to the security desk. A huge shout out to Tom. Thanks so much. I'd definately stay at the hotel again, but I might rent a car next time so that I wouldn't be so dependent on the shuttle service to come and go to the strip. It was nice to stay away from the hustle and bustle of the strip, but I can see the advantages of staying on the strip when you get tired and just want to go to your room and take the shoes off and put your feet up.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: lmwOhio
Reviews.Content: The good: -Beautiful lobby & pool area -Large, modern rooms -flat screen tvs in room and bath -large tub -comfy bed & pillows -FANTASTIC spa (but pricey) -daily poker tournament -close to red rock canyon -20-30 minutes by car to the strip -easy self-parking The bad: -casino is WAY TOO SMOKEY (I instantly had an asthma attack there - but not at the Bellagio casino or other strip casinos) -the buffet has yucky, dried-out food (don't waste your time or money) -long, long, long walk to rooms - over-priced drinks at the pool and poor pool drink service (hard to get their attention) - rude kids splashing people in and next to the pool (parents ignoring it, and staff did nothing) Overall, I'd recommend Red Rock. I've stayed on the strip before and this was a nice (more relaxing) trip. You can always go to the strip if you want, or you can relax in the resort. I liked being near the Red Rock Canyon - beautiful scenery. Very easy access to the highway, too. Only 20 minutes to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Having a Piece of Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: LadySand121
Reviews.Content: We were on the Strip for two nights and we agreed that our last night in Vegas would be off the Strip - we just didn't know how far off the Strip. Although it was a 'short journey', it was worth it. The hotel lobby was beautiful and so contempo - chic. Our room was not yet ready, but the check in consultant worked with us to ensure we had no stress while waiting to get into our room. She also asked which room view we wanted (Red Rock / Strip) and if we wanted to be closer to the elevator and explained that otherwise it would be a walk. While at Red Rock, we visited the Spa and it was to 'die for'! The spa employees were so attentive and so knowledgeable. The available services were extensive and the prices (coming from the North East) were actually reasonable. The pool was great, the atmosphere, the available food choices were wonderful and the choices of clubs and lounges were many; a small, self-contained city within itself. What I didn't like was the idea of pets in the hotel; unless there are rooms solely dedicated to pet owners, I'd prefer to have no pets beyond seeing eye pets. The employees were ready to assist - even without a tip. Overall, this was a wonderful, off the Strip adventure. Ladydivasan New York.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: folsomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: overpriced and rude staff at the pool. room is nice but nothing worked:broken scale, broken night lights, broken drape rods, broken safe. long boring walk to room. we definitely felt they were working class trying to be upper class and do not quite make it!. the Bellagio was definitely a better experience. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: poopsyhop
Reviews.Content: I'm a little disappointed with the previous reviews on Red Rock. My husband and I found it to be quite nice and relaxing. If you are looking for a great resort that is not too crowded, great food and service, then this is your kind of place. The rooms were very spacious with a great tub and shower. We were on the 19th floor with a beautiful view of the pool, which is just magnificent at night. Because it was on the cool side, there wasn't any service out by the pool but it was also never more than a handful of people. Yes, it was a little hike to the elevators but who doesn't need a little exercise. I would not rave about the famous buffet there. It was mediocre at best. The Italian restauraunt was very good. Also, the cafe is good for a quick bite. There are so many different places to eat at this resort, you really never have to leave. The casino is ok and what I liked about this place is that you can walk through the lobby and casino and it seemed virtually empty, whereas you can't even get through the casinos on the strip without bumping into people. Tables did not get crowded and the staff was very helpful and friendly. It is a bit distant from the strip but if you rent a car,no problem and it's nice to escape back to Red Rock for a relaxing night. I did not find it noisy at all. I could hear the ajoining jacuzzi but good for us they didn't take a bath at 3 a.m.. I would strongly suggest seeing the Love show. It was absolutely amazing and I am not a huge Beatles fan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, BUT Beware”
Reviews.Author: kingsandi
Reviews.Content: Red Rock was a very nice hotel. Newly appointed, above average size rooms. The room had a nice flat screen (42") with either a view of the pool or strip. It had a very nice pool, even by Vegas standards. The night scene was very good for the 20's, 30's and 40's crowd. If the W Hotel had a casino it would look like Red Rock. If you self-park, you don't have to walk thru the entire casino to get to the hotel elevators. Casino was large, clean and spacious with good places to eat...a little expensive though. If you find the following acceptable, you'll truly enjoy this hotel. Now here are the negatives.....1) It's about a 30 min drive to the strip. 2) My room was less than clean. 3) I ran into four different hotel guests with pets during my first 6 hours at Red Rock. I'm not a big fan of animals in hotel rooms. 4) You have to ask for a room near the elevators. I've never walked so long at a hotel to get to an elevator. 5) Finally, beware of housekeeping....they knocked on my door four times in two nights to do a "room check."

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: BODDCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very nice , they are actually suites. Plasmas in both room and bathrooms. Seperate shower. These are the positives. Not as crowded as the strip. The negatives. Far from the strip expensive cab ride. Walls in room are thin, sounds can be heard from the next room. Lots of construction next door that starts real early in the morninig. Poor customer service. We asked that the mini bar be removed twice during our trip, it never was. $27.50 daily resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “best in LV”
Reviews.Author: colesloough
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. A bit pricey cab fare to strip (be wary of LV cabbies), but this place has a nice room set up, great meeting rooms, beautiful pool area and excellent restuarants (especially the italian one). Only negative is that the casino is MUCHO smokey. Lung cancer haven.!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Resort, 3 Star Location”
Reviews.Author: BeachBabe121
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days at Red Rock 2/28 - 3/5. The resort is quiet nice and very upscaled. I agree with many of the reviewers, that to travel back and forth to the strip is difficult, time consuming and expensive. I went to the Strip only once. I am a quieter personality type, hence I really enjoyed this resort. The Conference I was attending booked the trip in this resort so I did not personally choose the resort. The spa is the nicest I have ever experienced and I have traveled quiet a bit. My room was not ready, and I spent the morning in the spa area with the bellmen being very nice to tot my luggage around for me! Honestly, though, if I was planning a trip to Vegas on my own, with Vegas being what it is - I would prefer to stay on the Strip. I would have liked the opportunity to walk down the Strip at various times vs. having to plan large blocks of time to get there. I just don't see the logic in this large nice resort being so far from the Strip. The T-Bone restaurant was excellent as well as the Italian Restaurant. I ordered room service a few times and it took 75 minutes and was not very good. If you are a coke drinker - the resort only serves Pepsi products. And, yes everything in Vegas is expensive. Do not touch anything in the mini-bar or the food on the dresser. The TVs appeared to be nice (flat screen etc) but the one remote did not work very well and the bathroom TV had very limited TV channels. For the money, I'd recommend that most folks stay on the Strip. Other Vegas comments: -The Cirque O show was outstanding -Golf at the Badlands (5 minutes from Red Rock resort) was beautiful and great golf -The Bellagio is a must see.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: DJ1973
Reviews.Content: I had to go to Vegas for work. My birthday was the next day, so my husband booked us a room at the Red Rock on a friend's (who lives in Summerlin) advice. It was wonderful! It is far away from the strip, but we only live a short distance from Vegas, so that was not a big deal. Been there, done that! The room was amazing! It was like a little spa! The bed was huge and a non-smoking room really was a non-smoking room! The tub was fantastic! Very fancy and really upscale. I cant wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Truly Rocks”
Reviews.Author: SweetRipley
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Las Vegas, NV and was convinced to stay off the strip (really off the strip) at Red Rock Hotel. It was nothing short of phenomenal. The staff were ultra-friendly, and genuine. The food choices were many and afforadble. The rooms still had the new car smell. And it was just a fun place to be, even on a weeknight. Looking forward to going back in the summer and enjoying the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth half the Cost”
Reviews.Author: ArturoPrat
Reviews.Content: For a new facility expected good to excellent location and service. Extremly disappointed. Room not properly clean at check in, wall between rooms so thin that I thought a porn movie was being made next door. Complaint to security un-answered. A female consiguer was so un proffesional and rude, actually laughing at me, because I had complained about the service. I would not recommend this hotel, and the Mexican restuarant had only one bus-boy during the rush of meal time that the bar tender had to clean our table to eat. The food was terrible, for $68.00 I got a small piece of fish with some rice and beans. I could have gone to Chili's and had gotten a great meal for a quarter of the price. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiDidi
Reviews.Content: If you want something a little more laid back than the strip then this is your place. The hotel decor and rooms are phenomenal, the best I've ever seen. Two plasma TV's and incredibly comfortable and luxurious beds. Spectacular view of the mountains. Less crowds than the strip. Bowling alley and movie theatre on site. Great staff. Only negative - although the buffet was fantastic our other restaurant experiences here were just okay, even though they were pricey. I'm not a complainer but my meal at the italian restaurant was actually inedible (agreed by everyone at the table, not just me!). And no, there's no coffee pot in the room so prepare to go downstairs (or send your sweetie!) for that morning cup of joe. Even with that, we will absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone. We stayed two nights here and two at the strip and wished the entire time we were back at the Red Rock. It is a drive (15 minutes or so) to the strip so be prepared for that. But if you've already "been there and done it" on the strip and you're looking for a different las vegas experience, definitely try the Red Rock!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Snob72
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was hesitate to stay at the Red Rock. It is quite a ways from the strip and didn't want to feel trapped if it was as some of the reviews noted it to be. Upon arrival I knew we had made a great choice. The drive wasn't as bad as I had feared after reading some of the reviews. We picked up a rental car because we knew we would want the freedom to come and go and not have to wait on a shuttle. Upon our arrival we were greeted by Angel at the front desk. She was great, she made us feel welcome. We arrived around 11 our room was ready, even though check in isn't until 3 pm. The room was very nice. We have been to Vegas numerous times. This has to be one of the nicest places we have stayed. The casino floor was nice, with a great mix of games. The dining options were also very extensive. We left the casino twice to get some shopping done on the strip but were very happy when we returned. If you are visiting Vegas for the "Vegas" experience this is probably not the place for you. I didn't have a drunk person run into me once and nobody tried to hand me porn. But if you love the gambling, relaxing and dining, then you will not be disappointed. The spa is wonderful and although I didn't use the pools, they looked very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Blood Boiling”
Reviews.Author: dhowbad
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11 am for a 4 night stay in a $634 a night suite. Our room wasn't ready, but was promised shortly. At 1 pm a trip to the front desk again got us a "promise" for the room to be ready "shortly". At 3:00 pm another trip to the front desk got us another promise that a manger would personally find out what was going on and call us right back and a "promise" of a $50 credit. At 4:30 we got a call that our room was ready. No apology, no $10 fruit basket, and no $50 credit appeared on our bill. Other people in our group checked into dirty rooms and or didn't get room service for 2 days. One of our party checked into a room that had a used condom in the sink. At check out, a review of my bill didn't show the $50 credit, but showed a additional $43.58 resort fee per night that was never disclosed to me. On checkout, the front desk made my blood boil, again when they said that they could only issue the $50 credit against a room service charge and the only room service charge we had was for a $40 bowl of oatmeal, so we would only be getting a $40 credit. The outrageously expensive $246 massage didn't count, nor the very expensive $300 and $400 dinners, not even the $2.50 per local call. There only saving grace was their bellmen. Those guys where excellent. Who ever is running that dept. should take over for the fired front desk and maid service managers. If you enjoy a nice pool area, forget it, the main pool was cold and the pool area was closed more than open. The spa Jacuzzi was also non operational. I guess that $43 resort fee is badly needed to fix those things. I've been to resorts and they have disclosed a resort fee of $10 - $20 upfront. That gets you free internet, free local calls, etc. Not here, a local 1 min call is ridiculas $2.50, internet, you name it, is all extra charge. If you want to go some place that is only interested in taking your money and raising your blood pressure go there, if you are interested in service and a relaxing experience the choices in Vegas are hugh.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: retiredvp
Reviews.Content: I agree with many of the comments on Tripadvisor. Overall, I had a good experience and found the staff very helpful and pleasant. The bed was supremely comfortable and the room was very quiet and could be made totally dark at night--something important to me. I did not use the pool facilities or visit the casino. The food was of reasonable quality. The view from my room was magnificent. The long hallways were good for my health! One or two things I didn't like, although these tend to be matters of personal taste: --The walls in the room were painted dark brown. Even with multiple incandescent lights I couldn't get it light enough at night; indeed I was hard pressed to find stuff in my suitcase. I found this color quite depressing, although I believe it is currently fashionable. --The carpets in the common areas are designed to mimic waves or sand dunes. They are too realistic! People in our group complained of feeling seasick or drunk! --There are no coffee pots in the room. This maybe because there is a Starbucks in the hotel or because they feel that at these prices you can afford to pay $13.00 for a 3-cup room -service pot. I called to request a coffee pot. I was told that they were all in use by other guests, but that when one was available it would be delivered to my room. I never got one. This alone would deter me from staying there again, as I love my early morning coffee. --It is quite hard to find the hotel bus at the airport--the directions they give you are not explicit enough. The bus is not all that frequent, and I was told by others that a taxi cost around $60.00. I hope the hotel will find way to address these issues, as it is really a very nice place, if a bit far out.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: Pippsyo
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late on Valentine's day 2008 after long drive. The lady at check in assigned us a room with two beds and told us that the King wasn't available. We really needed a romantic break but the lady made no attempt to make it up to us. She could have offered anything to compensate but offered nothing. And I was sorry to say that she appeared to enjoy our disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness at VIP Services”
Reviews.Author: RaJay
Reviews.Content: I usually don't write reviews, but after reading "beevcat"s review, I thought I'd add my two cents. I also booked a Signature Suite and came away deeply disappointed. My wife and I booked a Signature Suite from Christmas Eve through the 27th. We really looked forward to "Christmas in Vegas" and when we first arrived, we were extremely impressed. The Parking and Bell staff were some of the most friendly and efficient I had ever seen. When we went to check-in at the main desk we were told that since we had a suite, we could use the VIP check-in. There we were given coffee and tea as we waited for check-in. It seemed all would be great. We got up to our room about 6pm and figured we had a lot of time before dinner. So a quick soak in the jacuzzi was in order. But just as in beevcat's review, our jacuzzi didn't work. For the next hour and a half we played phone tag trying to get this resolved. We finally got the night manager involved. He was sympathetic to our problem and made sufficient resolution to the problem. He also promised us a different room in the morning so we could enjoy Christmas hassle free. We repacked everything on Christmas morning and were told that bell service would move everything to our new room. Everything would be set by 1pm. At one o'clock we checked with VIP services and were told the new room still wasn't ready, come back at 3pm. Well, to make a long story short, it wasn't. In fact, another room wasn't available. We tried getting this resolved with a VIP services representative, but were told it wasn't his job to resolve problems. We asked to see the manager again and were told, "I can't leave this area to get him." After 20 minutes of arguing with this guy he made the comment, "I shouldn't be helping you, cause your not really VIPs, your just plane customers." That did it!! Does that mean "plane customers" aren't worth the trouble??? We finally did get a manager involved again and again the manager did make significant resolution. But we much rather have had a hassle-free Christmas than the comp amount.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Red Rock!!”
Reviews.Author: tahoekat
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before going from everywhere. Was worried due to mix reviews but many of them were from when hotel first opened (currently hotel is 2 years old). I also noticed in every circumstance of unhappiness the hotel offered a reasonable solution but many of the complainers didn't take them up on the solution or still unhappy. My opinion is that sometimes things go wrong but if an effort is made to solve the unhappiness is acceptable. Many hotels don't even try but the Red Rock does. This is a fabulous hotel/resort. It has everything and the service was wonderful!!! Everyone was helpful, polite and went out of there way to serve us. The rooms are large, comfortable and great views. Extremely comfortable beds/linens. 2 plasma TVs (one in room the other over the marble bath tub). The bathroom is gigantic. The bose music system in great. Limited electirical outlets. I use my lap top in early mornings to read news, usually in bed with coffee. There is no outlet at the beds. Next time I will make sure I charge my laptop when arrive. The restaurants are wonderful! The meal at the mexican restaurant was large enough for two. As usuall anywhere in vegas, plan on a line for the buffet. If you have kids you will love the pools, theatres, bowling, arcade, spa adventure trips. If you are 21-40 you will love the night clubs and gambling. If you are 50 and over you will love the comforts and the relaxation but might be a bit annoyed by the loud music at the lobby area to give this a young exciting atmosphere. It bothered my husband but not me. I like the excitement of casinos and this was nothing compared to the chaos and noise at the hotels on the strip. Tips: Grab complimentary water and apples in lobby on check in. Ask for a room between elevator and the middle of the floor. This way you are not too far from elevators and you have a great view. I like the view of the red rock from the panoramic windows. If you want to spend time on the strip be sure to get a rental car. It is 11 miles to strip. We valet parked at central location then did walking and monorail of strip. Use the spa facilities even if you are not having a service. Don't get angry about the extra $22 resort fee, just consider this as part of your room cost. I will definately stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Rooms with Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: Christine15
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip to Las Vegas. We stayed at the Red Rock because the event we were attending was there. It's a newer hotel- not located on the strip (about a 15-20 minute drive to get to the strip.) I loved the rooms- very modern, decorated nicely. The beds were super comfortable! The hotel has a casino, movie theater, spa, bowling alley, arcade, food court (2 Starbuck's), a few lounges/bars, and a handful of restaurants. The service at the Cafe (open 24 hrs) was slow- at least to get seated! The line for the place was constantly out the door, even though tables were open. Once you were seated they did serve you quickly, however. We ate at the Mexican restaurant- was average. The hotel is long and the elevators are located only at one end! The walk to the other end (if your room happens to be down there, which ours was) is quite long! If you have any problems with walking, make sure you request a room by the elevator. I did go to the spa. Was probably one of the best spas that I have been to!!! Nicely decorated, has a steam room, sauna, whirlpool, showers and everything you need to shower (shampoo, conditioner, hair products, etc.) If you're staying at the hotel- you can use the spa's facilities without having any services. I had a great 50 minute swedish massage:) I recommend at least checking it out. The gym was very nice. Has everything you could need- machines, free weights, etc. Everything was in working order and plenty of bottled water available. I was disappointed that they did not have the yoga or pilates classes that are advertised on their web site- seasonally offered only. Overall, a very nice hotel and spa. A lot to offer but know that you are nowhere near the strip. The rooms have great views of the strip and the canyons. The pool looked great- was just too cold to check it out! I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I hope they've improved in two years”
Reviews.Author: Frogger67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Rock Resort a few weeks after it opened in May 2006. I sincerely hope they've improved since then. Positives: It is a beautiful spot. Nice shades of browns and dark reds everywhere. Nice to be away from the madness of the Strip. Negatives: SENSORY INPUT. Too much of it. Loud house and trance music all over the joint--casino, restaurants, pool, even the elevator. I couldn't read or even listen to my iPOD at the pool since the "music" was so loud. Ridiculous mini bar that charged me for just lifting a candy bar (luckily the hotel removed the charge from my bill). Who came up with the idea of a robot mini bar, anyway? Elevator door closed so quickly it nearly took my arm off. The place seems to cater to uber-rich twentysomethings who are the rudest people you can imagine. The staff (especially the pool bar staff) was rude. I wrote a very constructive letter to management after my stay, and never heard a word back. I guess they didn't value my business. I won't be back--unless someone pays me to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the view and service”
Reviews.Author: cattleyagirl
Reviews.Content: As soon as we checked in, the service was impeccable! The concierge, the staff, the valet ...all gave great service !! i was there for a high school reunion, and all my classmates loved my suite! It was like prom night..after 35 years.....Beautiful view of the Red Rock canyon and the pool from my suite....The buffet was the best! ...All water and soda and fruits are free at the lobby ...Great weekend experience away from the maddening crowd at the strip...You can always drive to the strip which is only 20 minutes away...Rental cars are cheap in Vegas. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: beevcat
Reviews.Content: Mixed report here....the rooms were modern, spacious, comfortable and I agree with all other reviewers that the beds are divine. However..... We had a Signature suite which is basically 2 room with a middle room. (or 1 standard bedroom with attached bigger 2 rooms) We had the jacuzzi suite, which you would expect have a...jacuzzi! well, there was one but it was not working at all. There was however a big gaping section of paint from the room above whose jacuzzi was leaking, through our roof over the towels and on our floor. To their credit they did send a maid to clean up and offer to swap rooms, but trying to clear up 3 rooms to move just did not seem worth it. Add to that the following: of a resort fee of about $45 per day which we were not informed of when booking- when I queried this I was told this was for the resort facilities at our disposal ie the pool (which was closed for both days we were there due to wind and rain.) Turn down service which we did not recieve either night....oh and we were on the 10th floor and the elevators all broke so we had to walk it up.... Again, they did credit this $45 per night, but only after I got really upset about being charged for facilitiies that were neither provided or they were unable to provide. As Australians we always tend to find service staff in the States to be really really attentive and just so much better that we tend to have at home (no doubt due to the wages/ tipping structure Im sure!) However....nearly all of the staff employed by the shops within the complex including the hotel shop were not at all what we had come to expect. The male staff at the kids amusement centre were just horrible, the girl at the ice cream parlour left a tap running at full steam for the full 10 minutes we waited to be served. Hello....you are in Nevada, and you are in drought! The queue to go to the bowling alley was over 1.5 hours both days (so we did not go) The staff at the souvenier shop were unable to finish a conversation with each other whist serving me! My sister has moved to Vegas for work, and lives 5 minutes away. This would be so helpful if only this was somewhere I would be prepared to go to again. I am not a negative person, nor do I have unrealistic expectations, but this cost me over $800 per night and indeed have given glowing reviews to Chateau Marmont where we also stayed, but to be honest, when I go back this christmas, I will not stay there again. I would rather stay on strip, where its all a bit more tired and you know you are a number, but at least it has an air of electricity and fun an theres always something to do or see!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel off the strip and totally worth driving...”
Reviews.Author: myszka27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I searched high and low for a nice AND NEW hotel to stay at while we visited Las Vegas in December of 2006. Everything looks nice on the website but the truth can be much different. Finally, we chose the Red Rock Resort, about 15 min. car ride from the strip. It was breathtaking!!! The hotel is new (about 2 years old), beautiful, tastefully decorated and very modern. The entire resort is impressive. Our room was very spacious, with a large, comfortable bed, many fluffy pillows and a flat screen tv to complete the experience. The bathroom had a separate tub and roomy shower, another flat screen tv and two sink area, where my husband and I could not fight for the space. Room was always clean and the bed made-up daily without exception. Staff was beyond helpful and courteous. The casino floor was enough in itself. Beautiful decor, fresh air and great pay-out. As for food, there are so many delicious restaurants to choose from but my favorite had to be the great buffet, filled daily with the most delicious things, including 20 varieties of cheesecake. It is too bad that it was December because the outside pool is so beautiful that I would have loved to use it. After experiencing the noise and filth of some of the hotels on the strip, we were very glad to be back into our hotel. Even though it is off the strip, it is like a diamond in the rough. Not to mention that the very famous red rock mountains are just a short ride from the hotel. Actually, if not for the fact that we wanted to see the strip, we would have never left the resort because it is so self-sustaining, and as long as you are a guest of the hotel you can use spa amenities such as hot tub, whirlpool and sauna with no charge. I invite everyone to stay at the Red Rock Resort and Spa anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino and Resort”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Rock for one week on business. Overall this is a great hotel with many good aspects. The meeting facilities were spacious and the staff did a good job with our group. There were several events happening at the same time, and it felt like our group was lost a little bit because it was smaller. The rooms are spacious and very modern. The view of the strip is great, and the bathrooms are large with a tub big enough for at least two. The casino itself is very beautiful with several lively bars to choose from. The wait staff is one of the best looking we have seen in Vegas, and they are friendly and efficient as well. The pool is very nice, and the bar at the pool is a great place to hang out during the day. The restaurants at the casino are good as well. We ate at Salt Lick (good barbecue) and the Mexican restaurant. There really aren't many downsides to this casino. The only thing may be it's remote location away from the strip and other restaurants. If you aren't concerned about visiting the strip casinos than this isn't a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Red Rock Casino & Resort”
Reviews.Author: bsatre
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Thanksgiving weekend for a soccer tournament. The hotel was packed with all sorts of teams, football, soccer, lacrosse, etc. in town for tournaments. Despite the crowds, we were very pleased with this hotel. The beds are so comfortable you never want to get out of them. Filled with down, high-thread count sheets, comfy pillows, etc. We needed a cot brought in and instead of a typical hotel cot we got a twin-size bed that was nearly as comfortable as the king. The rooms are big and roomy. Flat screen TVs in the bedroom and the bathroom. Because of the crowds it was a bit hard to get into some of the restaurants. In hindsight, we would have made reservations earlier in the day instead of "walk-in".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: selrahc1967
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work and it was great! Everything in One spot! More than you can ask for!. Word of a advice...ask for a room close to the elevator, there is only one elevator on one of side of the building, if you get a room on the other side of the building its like a 1/4 mile+ walk to your room, this gets old going up and down 10 times a day

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convient”
Reviews.Author: LVITraveler
Reviews.Content: It is an easy drive from the airport to the hotel. I enjoy staying away from the strip and above the city. View of the strip is spectacular from the high vantage point to the west. Front desk friendly and met me with complimentary water and an apple. Quick check in. A major plus is you don't have to negotiate the casino to get in and out of the hotel. The layout is a little confusing but quickly learned. Room was very nice and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Love the walk in shower and large deep tub. No complaints. Will definitely stay there again. Bets the heck out out the Sun Coast. and equivalent to the Marriott. LVI Traveler.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED -- Just know what you're getting!”
Reviews.Author: camelduke
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock Casino and Spa is a great casino & hotel. It's a cool, hip place with a clean, modern look. The rooms are top notch--very similar in style to a W Hotel. Some of the best that I've stayed in Vegas. It's got a sizable casino, great pool, excellent spa, some good restaurants/bars, a big bowling center, full movie-plex, and a fun after-hours club. It's very clean--only a few years old. And, nowhere near as crowded as the other casinos. On top of that, you're not going to get comparable rooms elsewhere in vegas for anywhere near the price. For what you get, It's a steal. HOWEVER. There is one caveat. The Red Rock IS NOT on the Strip (e.g. all the other Vegas casinos you're used to). The Red Rock is not even NEAR the Strip. You're at least a 20-minute drive from the Strip. (Note: The "Strip View" rooms at the Red Rock are a tad misleading. Yes, you can technically "see" the strip, but it's a long way off). I knew this because I've stayed there before. And frankly, since I was going to Vegas for some R&R (and I'm not a gambler), I welcomed that. I liked the idea of both being able to go to the strip and enjoy the shopping, dining, and shows that the other casinos offer...while also having the luxury of spending time at the Red Rock where I could get away from all the massive throngs of people on the strip. (TIP: If you're going to be going back and forth to the Strip a lot, rent a car. Cab fare is going to be at least $40 each way). If you've never been to Vegas before, the Red Rock is probably NOT for you--because you'll likely want to spend the majority of your time exploring the Las Vegas Strip. As such, you'll want to stay somewhere on the Strip. However, if you're looking for a getaway where you can enjoy both the nightlife and bustle of Vegas...but also get away from it for a while.... I HIGHLY recommend the Red Rock hotel & casino. Just know what you're getting...

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shotgun_Joe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed this past weekend in Las Vegas for the LV Marathon. We were tired of the hassle on the Strip and all the flannel-clad strip club hawkers and obnoxious obese drunks, so we decided to stay off the Strip and chose Red Rock largely based on the quality of their website and the fact that they were featured on a recent cooking contest TV show. We were thrilled with the place the moment we arrived. The hotel and property is of a very modern design - think post-modern Tokyo - filled with clean lines, dark, rich colors, and well thought out contrasting textures. The front desk personnel were efficient, cheerful and helpful. The rooms were spotless and large and included a HUGE marble clad bathtub w/ flat screen TV. I don't know about you, but soaking w/ the tube is all right in my book! The bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in - better than the Westin's. The casino was a visual delight and remarkably not smoky. I enjoyed the fact that $5 craps and blackjack tables were abundant throughout the morning and afternoon. We ate lunch at the Cabo Grill or whatever their Mexican restaurant was. The fare was ok...but we're spoiled w/ great San Diego Mexican food, so we're hard to please in this realm. We also ate lunch at the Italian restaurant on the property and enjoyed it. The restaurants are reasonably priced. One thing I didn't like was that the room service menu seemed overpriced compared to other places we've stayed (Hyatt, Sofitel, etc...) and the minibar was tantamount to highway robbery. All told, this is my new favorite place to stay in Las Vegas. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Service has MUCH to be desired”
Reviews.Author: actg
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this resort. I had read some reviews about poor service but hoped they had fixed the problem by our visit. Didn't happen. Lots of little things, but I will highlight a few......I booked the hotel for my boyfriend's birthday weekend, sending them an email request for champagne prices because I wanted a bottle in our room upon arrival. No one got back to me via phone or email, I left both pieces of information. I called weeks later, just prior to us leaving for the trip (had to call twice because they hung up on me the first time) and managed to get an order in. Once we arrived, we hung out in hotel until check in time. When we went to check in, they told us they had no rooms available and it would be a few hours. I told her to cancel the champagne, because I wanted it upon arrival, not sent to the room later. She told me they had no order in the system. We walked around looking for a "nice" bar to grab a drink. None of the "nice" bars were open ~ they do not open until 4, an hour past check in time. At 4, the lobby bar (beautiful) did open, but when I requested a white wine, we were told that their white wine shipment had not arrived that day. I ordered Merlot. We finally checked in and the front desk DID send a bottle of champagne (very nice and put us on the right track again), but service issue happened ALL weekend. I had booked a birthday dinner (Sunday night) in their Italian restaurant and requested an out of the way table for a romantic dinner explaining that it was his birthday, etc. Once we got there, we were put in the middle of the floor next to a table of 9 men drinking. Also, they had a door that opened to the outside that they continued use (it would stay open for some time before finally closing again). It was a cool November night, so cold air kept coming in, making it difficult to stay warm. Men around us were giving women their sport coats, my boyfriend and I did not bring jackets, we did not expect to need them in a restaurant. Lastly, on many occasions, at least one item we ordered (all at different restaurants) never came. There were lots of small problems with service as well and several rude staff that would ignore you, walk away from you or act annoyed that they had to help you. The actual resort is just lovely, as are the rooms. But so many small things kept going wrong, I wished we had booked a different hotel. I have been to Vegas enough times to know that plenty of the high end locations have service nailed down. Red Rock does not. They put much energy and effort into the image, but failed to provide matching service.

Reviews.Title: “what are you looking for?”
Reviews.Author: billatharbor
Reviews.Content: my wife went to a conference at this hotel so my brother and i tagged along-i will give my review as a first timer to vegas- the hotel was awesome- i liked everything about it-plenty of good restaurants plenty of good bars, nice movie theatre,cool bowling alley,rooms were great, very comfortable and newer,they let us check in a little early and check out a little late, all the staff was professional and helpful, i never heard the word "no" from anyone, i liked the casino it had plenty of games and tables as i said i was a first timer to vegas and as excitied as i was about staying at this hotel i did want to go to the strip and hang out down there- this as other people have reported- is where i had issues with the hotel and why i labeled my review "what are you looking for" again i personally wanted the fun and excitment of the strip but everyone is right- the hotel shuttle only runs every couple hours and only runs to 6pm and the latest it picks up on the strip is 9pm -a cab ride is a good $35-$45 dollars depending on traffic and where you are on the strip- i also planned on doing some drinking so i didnt want to rent a car so i was really limited with my choices long story short-if you want to go to vegas and the strip isnt really your scene- than stay here and have a great vacation- if you plan on going to the strip more than once and you are going to stay on the strip for more than a few hours than i would say just stay on the strip and maybe come to visit the red rock for a few hours one day?

Reviews.Title: “Cool Option in Hot Town”
Reviews.Author: jackfurlongesq_123
Reviews.Content: We spent three days this past midweek while visiting family on the west side of Vegas. I have been a casino player in my misspent youth, from Nassau to Atlantic City to Reno, but no longer. Still, I feel capable of rating a casino as well as a hotel. But first, permit me to address concerns of those posting this past week. Las Vegas is set in a desert valley. It gets its water from Lake Mead, man-made after construction of the Hoover Dam. This has had an impact on development as much as the casinos themselves. In short, Las Vegas Blvd. is where it all started, and the big name casinos are all found within a mile of one another on that ugly stretch of asphalt otherwise known as The Strip. There is nothing inspiring about these monuments to all things tacky. But if you want to see and be seen among the faux statuary and balloon-sized breasts, this is where you go. If on the other hand, you actually want to combine a vacation of good food, good room, modern pool scene (including legitimate lap pool), first rate spa, and family-friendly diversions, you'll want something removed from the center of the plastic universe. If you want to go east of town next to Lake Mead, try Ritz Carlton at Lake Las Vegas. But be prepared to pay RC rates for rooms, and most Ritz properties charge the so-called resort fee which has apparently shocked some of Red Rock's customers. It is a nuisance, but it is increasingly industry-wide. If you want to go west of town, you might try J.W. Marriott, but for my money (and the rooms are incredibly reasonable), you'll want to stay at Red Rock. (Several posters: ‘cab rides downtown were $40;’ ‘the complimentary shuttle to the Strip took too long.’ Would that be the shuttle taking you away from this hotel’s casino to gamble at another hotel’s casino? And it’s free?) Of course you'll need a rental car. This is Las Vegas, not New York, and there is no public transportation. There's also no charge for valet parking, and despite another poster's complaint, self-parking lots are easily identified (dude, there's a sign) for those too, um, thrifty to spring for a $2 tip for the guy who brings your car to you. The vibe upon entry is a sophisticated, sleek, modern resort, where nearly every reviewer agrees that staff is courteous to a fault. The hotel entrance is behind the casino, so non-gamers can avoid the casino crowds altogether if desired. Rooms are spacious, dark wood and carpet (a Kimpton-like fuscia/lime/chocolate brown motif), with pleasant indirect lighting and a massive flat screen facing the bed. But the bedding is too comfortable, so you’ll fall asleep before the end of the movie. A smaller flat screen overlooks the ample tub, with separate marble shower and a commode enclosed in its own leather-lined room. Bath products are private label. Rack rate in November was something like $169/night, with spacious suites roughly twice that. Adding tax and resort fees still brings you in under $200/night, which just ain't gonna break the bank like a bad night at the tables. Room service was timely; house keeping desperately understaffed. Concierge and valet services were thorough and prompt. (I've waited a lot longer for my car at much more expensive hotels, and car rental rates are less than the cost of a couple of cab rides, so I'm not sure what the beef was for some of the reviewers. My advice to them in the future would be to look at a map before booking.) Pool scene was again low-key, elegant, but understaffed (probably owing to time of year and day of week). Spa was well-stocked and well-run. Others have pointed out the kid-friendly options: a legitimate movie theater with multiple screens; a substantial arcade; a mall-sized food court; a retro-cool bowling alley. The casino was ringed by themed restaurants, including Italian, Asian, raw bar, steak house, etc. There's a complimentary cocktail party with sushi service on Friday nights, a Starbucks above the lobby. In short, you never have to leave, but you can. If you do, you are on a beltway (215), which can take you to Hoover Dam in half an hour, or on a main road, which can deliver you to Red Rock Canyon for authentic mountain scenery in ten minutes. Contrast the Strip, where the crush of cars and construction trucks will only serve to remind you of the traffic jams you thought you left back home.) The casino itself had ample table space in addition to the electronic game and slot aisles dominating today's casinos. $5 and $10 minimum blackjack tables were easily available (and I haven't seen a $5 table in Atlantic City in this century.) Pit bosses were business-like and cordial, unlike some of the heavies you run into on the Strip. But the best example of management's style can probably be found in its casino hosts. This cadre of troubleshooters and concierge professionals give the resort a quiet dignity too often lacking in the mega-resort meat markets. I dealt with a gentleman named Winston Morgan, who handled dinner reservations, social concerns, and a private movie screening with equal aplomb. When we canceled the movie party, he asked if I needed a limo for the next morning. In short, I was able to stay at a complete hotel-casino resort with more amenities than many better-known upscale chains and decor from the cool earth tones of modern prairie design, and never have to worry that I wasn't spending enough time at the tables. I was able to relax, which is something most visitors to Las Vegas don't seem able to do. Odds are I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock in November”
Reviews.Author: Austinperson
Reviews.Content: Traveled for a conference/weekend getaway. Luckily we figured out in advance how far the hotel was to the Strip and got a rental car. If you plan on making more than one trip there, it's a must. Hotel shuttle looked nearly impossible during conference nights....long lines for both shuttle AND taxis. (Note however, you must have a valet park and retrieve your car each time you want to use it--with an associated tip.) Pros: Room was awesome and very comfortable. (TV, stereo, plush bathrobes) FItness facility also very nice and well equipped., pool area, Red Rock Nat'l Conservation Area (close hiking.) Cons: "Resort Fee," not fun to drive back and forth to the Strip--especially later at night, crowded shuttle service, closed down the pool area early--about 5 or 6 if I recall correctly. (This is probably not the case in summer I imagine.)

Reviews.Title: “You Had Me At The Faux Mink Pillow”
Reviews.Author: MrsDallasMatt
Reviews.Content: The room was a HGTV dream. Loved it. I'm a sucker for a flat screen tv, marble bathroom, upgraded lighting, platform bed with high thread count sheets & mountains of pillows, not one but two bathrobes and a Bose stereo. The Red Rock Casino/Resort makes everyone who purchases a standard room feel like a High Roller by the amenities and nice touches in their sleek chocolate brown/lime green rooms. Yes yall it is far from the Strip/Las Vegas Blvd and if it's your first time to Vegas you'll get cranky that you had to spend lots of money on a cab. But if you've been there, done that scene, look no further than the Red Rock to stay on a property that can entertain you for days. 9 restaurants, multiple bars, night club, huge gaming space, several pools, nice outdoor lounge/chill out areas, movie theater, bowling alley and a spa. Remember, it has to be better than the Strip to get people to stay out there. They succeded!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice but you have to like orange”
Reviews.Author: Schlockette
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Red Rock. I was there for a conference. Its not anywhere near the heart of Las Vegas, so you are stuck there or have to take a 40 dollar cab ride to town. The rooms are very nice. Loved the plasma TV at the foot of the bathtub. Room was clean, bed was great and room was quite large. The orange decor of the hotel could get on your nerves though. Fortunately, the room was not orange. Pool area was very nice and spa was lovely. loved the quiet pool area near the spa. Staff was very nice. Ate at the steak house on the premises--Mr T's-- and it was excellent. Great food, great bread, wonderful beef and very good service. However the food for the conference was very bad. Terrible salads, soups and entress. Breakfast was soggy eggs. They really need to do better that what they are currently doing. Conference facilities were very good. Overall, a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for families in Las Vegas LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: Shmoopee
Reviews.Content: I am completely shocked and mortified at how non-family friendly Las Vegas has become! It had been about 5 years since we had gone to Vegas before we planned our trip this year. Our first stop was the Bellagio- terrible! Naked statues in the halls, naked people at the pool, beer bottles floating in the lazy river! We had had enough! The Red Rocks website is Awesome! You can see each day what the room rate will be. They have so much stuff for the kids to do. My kids loved the Kids Club and we loved having 3 hours to ourselves to see a movie, eat, or enjoy the casino. We also loved bowling as a family and their is a movie theater on site as well. The pool is great and there is lots of shade. The service was wonderful and we will stay there again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not if you want to spend much time on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Teresa567
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Red Rock before moving on over to the Strip casinos. We have been to Vegas many times. This hotel is a bit out of the way, so I wouldn't stay here if you've never been to Vegas before or want to go to shows on the strip or spend a lot of time there. That being said, the rooms are great. Large, modern, plasma TVs, clean, great tubs/bathrooms...very inviting and spa like. Restaurants closed early around 10pm, so we ate at the one 24hour place. Food not so good, but service was great. My well done burger was very raw and my husband's chinese food not very good. Don't know anything about other restaurants or the spa. They do charge a $15-20 resort fee per day....I guess you get to use the pool and drink free water. Personally, I rather them add that to the room rate than feel nickel and dimed....but that's just me. We probably would go back for R&R sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel OFF STRIP!”
Reviews.Author: nyy927
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a Thursday to Sunday stay at the Red Rock. Here are some of my observations: 1) Hotel is off strip and not "off strip" like the Palms or Hard Rock. It's REALLY off strip. It is a $40-50 cab ride from the airport and probably that much to the strip (factoring in trafifc). The hotel offers shuttle service to the strip and airport. I didn't take the strip shuttle but heard it drops you off at the fashion show mall. My airpot shuttle (on a Sunday) left every odd hour between 7am and 7pm. Shuttles are complimentary. 2) Casino is your average Vegas casino with less wacky folk (since its off strip) and has probably more than its fair share of locals. $5 BJ tables were around most of the day and $10 BJ tables were around almost all day. 3) Amenities - Pools are awesome - looks exactly like the pictures on the website. Pool side food is so-so. There is also an on-site bowling alley, movie theater, game room and food court. Bowling alley was clean/nice/fun. Food court was a decent alternative to restaurants (especially for lunch). 4) Spa - A+ spa. Great locker area, sauna, jacuzzi, spa pool, etc. I did experience some banging (from construction upstairs) during my massage but was promptly given a 20% discount which I thought was fair. The banging only lasted about 5 minutes during my 50 minute massaage. Only complaint is that the gym is small - almost an afterthought it seems. 5) Food - I only ate at the Grand Cafe and Hachi (Japanese restaurant) while I was there. No complaints on the food quality but with all hotel food, it was a bit on the pricey side. Overall, I would give this hotel an A. It is a great hotel for those who are sick and tired of the strip and just want a relaxing vegas vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but Far from Strip”
Reviews.Author: kyoto5301
Reviews.Content: The Red Rock has lovely rooms which are very well appointed. A particularly nice touch was the plasma tv over the bath tub. As other noted, we found the weighted mini-bar items a bit odd (if you move them for more than 45 secs, you are charged, even if they are replaced un-used). However, overall this was a very nice resort. While it cost less than a comparable hotel on the strip, it cost about $40 each way to get to the strip. Its probalby wroth staying in a hotel on the strip, rather than here, if the strip is where you want to spend your time. The money we saved, ended up being spent on cabs.

Reviews.Title: “greedy greedy greedy”
Reviews.Author: cacls
Reviews.Content: Location - middle of nowhere, don't count on shuttle, it takes you nowhere too// Does not qualify for resort, not even a coffee in the room, cold bathroom, few tv channels, so greedy that cannot offer free WiFi. BE CAREFULL BOOKING THROUGH HOTWIRE OR ELSE. Greedy hotel will charge you extra $20+ per day for ridiculous services, and this is MANDATORY charge, otherwise they won't let you stay even you were charged by Hotwire already (who really do not care). Greedy hotel will ask you ridiculous money in case you need to rent something (like camera, guess - $100 per day). Depressing hotel interior. Pool and spa closed early.
