The only good thing I recall is bath tub and faucets, however even this was spoiled by annoying noise of water when draining :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in a land far, far, away”
Reviews.Author: Knotty999
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock in October for 3 nights. We didn't spend much time at the hotel itself, but here are some comments on our experience. On the pro side: -Our room was very comfortable: feather king bed, nice bath, etc.. -Everything was very modern and clean. -Large well equiped gym. On the down side: - The hotel is far away from the strip. Being our first trip to Vegas, I think we would have been better off on the strip. Fortunately we had a car and could avoid the hassle with either the expensive taxis or the infrequent shuttle bus. -The $20/day "resort fee" that gets added to your rate. I've never stayed at a hotel that did this. -the Bose system in the room sounded great, but we didn't enjoy hearing our neighbour's music. Unlike other reviewers, we didn't encounter any construction but there is a large empty lot beside the hotel. Something is going to be built there. If the location and rate suit you, it's not a bad place.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: Travel2241
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the pervious posts. I would not stay here again. I like one of the other posts also had a very bad stay at this hotel. I also received an email from a Mr Ronan O' Gorman asking me to comment on my stay. I replied to his email and advised him of the problems which included rude staff members. Despite sending it three times I never received any response. Does anyone know if he actually works there?

Reviews.Title: “Better then the Best.....!!”
Reviews.Author: LOOCHIE
Reviews.Content: There is always someone that happen to have had something not so pleasant happen (like the a/c in review before me) that you have to consider could happen at any hotel, anywhere. The construction is to add and make better and is everywhere life is, call first and make sure it doesnt interfere with your plans. We never knew it was going on. Listen I am a 45 yr old mother of 3 (came wthout them). I go to Vegas once or twice a year among other vacation spots so I know hotels. I mostly go for the hotel getaway experince so trust this review. This visit we stayed 2 nights at the Venetian payed alot of $$, it was just nice. Then without plan or notice I walked into Red Rock just to check it out and said "change my flight, I'm staying the night" I mean I knew it while driving up to it. Now dont get me wrong, if you want the hustle and bustle of the strip constantly then there are a ton of great hotels there (Mandalay Bay being one) but if you want a "get away" resort/casino then Red Rock it is. Here is how you base a great hotel, not on your stay and what happen to you that night, but on the actual hotel itself Clean clean clean everywhere, every spot in that room was sparkling. AHH & comfort, from the big deep tub with the tv in front of it, the chairs by the window views, the new clean carpet, to the most comfortable pillows and bed ever. How about cool and modern? Everything is ultra sheek, new, high tech, even the mini bar didnt just offer drinks but oh so much more (like fun stuff for adults, if you choose and pay for of course). Dont forget the 2 comfy bathrobes and slippers, the incredible fast, accurate and kind room service. I mean this guy didnt just bring our coffee and leave, he poured it and stayed a minute to converse. How about they turned our bed sheets down, fluffed our pillow, put slippers by our bedside, all while we were out at the casino for the night, so nice to come back to. Now for the hotel! Unbelievable decor, I mean seriously I can only attempt to tell you, you have to see it! The lighting is not only breath taking its all real crystals, just ask, I did. There is so much art everywhere, but cool calming stuff. The absolute coolest bars each with ther own cool flair, every kind of restaurant , from sushi to mexican and more.. (have at least a drink outside of Tbones) , a food court, bowling alley, bingo hall, and a Regal 16 movie theater, yup right there. So I guess you could bring the kids.They offer a great adventure tour to the mountains, kayaking hiking etc...You know sometimes you dont just want to gamble, but if you do...its great and doesnt have only $100 minimum tables, for us $5 minimum folks, it has alot of both... All the prices are average like, not strip like prices, I mean we had dinner and drinks for $41.00 dollars at Cabo. At the end I hated to go ( they asked me what time I was checking out 11:00, 12:00?) we took the Red Rock luxury free airport shuttle back to Us Airways and off home back to Florida! I felt a little more relaxed this trip home, guess it was the great night sleep our last night at the RED ROCK BABY!!! We'll so be back. GO LOOCHABELLA!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: rogerfromchicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a place to stay in Las Vegas that was different, and removed from the hustle and bustle of The Strip and seeing the Red Rock website, thought we had found it ("Red Rock's serene surroundings", to quote the website). It was anything but. It's the perfect place if you like being in the middle of a major construction project that starts work at 6am every day and adjacent to a busy freeway! Don't be fooled by the hotel's website. The first night the room was very hot, despite our turning the thermostat down and the fans up full blast. The next morning we were awakened at 6.30am by an incredible amount of noise from the work being done on the top floor. It was a grinding, buzzing noise that literally vibrated throughout the room and continued the entire day. Later that morning, I went downstairs and complained to the concierge about the noise. She called the manager, who apologized and said the workmen were not supposed to start until 10.30am and that if it happened again I should call and they would see that it was stopped immediately. She also said she would "make an adjustment" to my account to compensate for the problem. She asked if we were checking out the next morning, which I confirmed to be the case. She also said she would send people up to fix the air-conditioning. Two men arrived to work on the AC and while my wife and I were sitting in the room they managed to disconnect a hose and some kind of gas sprayed out into the room. Not a pleasant experience and the thought "Legionnaires Disease" immediately sprang to mind. It really seemed they didn't have a clue what they were doing. But eventually the AC was working again 24 hours after our arrival. Despite my conversation with the manager, the next morning we were rudely awakened even earlier, 6.15am, by the same noise coming from the top floor construction crews. I phoned and the noise immediately stopped, but the damage had been done as far as we were concerned. The noise started up again around 9.30am. When we checked out, we complained again about the noise to another manager. She said the other manager wouldn't be in until 2pm (three hours after checkout time) and she had done nothing to "make an adjustment" to my account, or even leave a note about my complaints. The manager said she would make a note, speak to her colleague when she came in to work and email me about a resolution. I told her this was entirely unacceptable. So I had to detail all of the above to her again and she agreed to cancel the room charge for one of our two nights. All things considered it really should have been for both nights. But more than the problems we had once there, we actually feel slightly deceived by the way the hotel is marketed on the website. Having stayed there, I realize that some of the photos have been faked to make it look like the hotel is something that it is not. Just compare the photo I took from our room with the shot from the hotel website showing a Strip View room. It has clearly been "photoshopped" to make the The Strip appear much closer (and to mask the reality of the hotel being surrounded by a massive construction project). My own photo of the view from our room has not been altered in any way. Similarly, the view on the website of the red rocks from which it gets its name has been manipulated. In reality, you have to look very hard to see those rocks, as they are on the other side of the freeway. After we returned home I received an email from a Mr Ronan O'Gorman, VP Hotel & Casino, asking for feedback about our stay. Despite replying with a long, detailed account of our nightmare, I've yet to have a reply from Mr O'Gorman. So I decided to share our experience her on Trip Advisor. So avoid this place as it's not what it's cracked up to be. It's a very long way from The Strip, surrounded by a massive construction project and freeway, and has construction work going on on the top floors that makes the place totally unbearable and the management have no regard for their customers.

Reviews.Title: “I could live here!”
Reviews.Author: sunnnychick
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I stayed at Red Rock in June for 3 nights and most recently at the end of September for one night. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It is definitely one of our favorites. The rooms are large, the beds are comfy and the bathrooms are great. We didn't have any problems with the maid services on either of our stays, and hubby can be picky! Both of our rooms were very clean. We received turn down service with chocolates on the pillow every night. For both of our stays we had strip view rooms on high floors but they were far away from the main elevators and it was quite a hike. We did request a closer room on our first stay but after checking it out opted to stay in the first room we were given. Apparently the rooms past the pool elevators are in the "newer" wing of the hotel and we both thought that the "newer" room was slightly bigger and nicer than the older one. The pool area is amazing. It is large with comfortable lounge chairs and plenty of room. In addition to the main circular pool there are scattered hot tubs and smaller pools as well. The spa is great for relaxing or working out and for a little more peace and quiet the spa pool is perfect. The hotel is far from the strip, about 20-30 minutes. We always rent a car though so it was not a huge issue for us. The only issues we had with the hotel was that during our first stay the pool closed early two nights in a row for a private function. There was no warning of this till midday at which point we were already gone. We specifically left the strip early to enjoy the pool only to find it closed once we arrived back at the hotel. The spa pool was open though, and it wasn't crowded so at least we could use that. On our most recent stay; we were awoken at 5 am by construction noise. Hubby is a light sleeper so he was pretty annoyed. Definitely stay on the mountain side if you are a light sleeper. Again, I can't say enough good things about this hotel. The service, staff, everything has been impeccable on both of our stays. If you've already done the strip thing and want to enjoy Vegas but away from all of the hustle and bustle and at a slower, more relaxing pace, then Red Rock is perfect. We already can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Truth about Red Rock Casino and Resort”
Reviews.Author: Corvalis
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Red Rock Casino Resort and Spa in early July 2007 (Excuse the delay in posting). Here is an unbiased review of the property. Upon check-in, we were greeted by RJ (BJ?). I use the term greeted lightly since we felt less than welcomed by her. Honestly, she came across as very stand offish and putout. Not friendly at all. No welcome, have a nice stay etc. First impressions count and checking in with her was definitely not a pleasure nor a highlight. First impressions count. She should be in the casino money room, out of sight from the general public with her bad attitude. Some other clown at the front desk kept repeating the same mantra to everyone that checked in “Only the best for you”. What a bunch of BS…We found out that our room was not ready (7-7-07) which was to be expected on such a busy day since there were so many weddings in Vegas that day. So off to the casino we went. We went to the sports book to wager on some baseball. First and foremost, the Sports Book royally rips you with their drink rules! The Sports book gives 1 drink ticket for each $20.00 wagered. You only get 2 drink tickets for $50.00 wagered which is a complete ripoff! Also, they will not give you a drink ticket unless you ask for one. Also, for 1 import beer and a Bloody Mary it is 3 drink tickets, not 2 as one would think. So basically you would have to wager $70.00 for 3 drink tickets! In the main casino you can get any drink you want while playing any of the games, even the lowest wager games. The casino overall was nice but ran into a glitch there too. The casino computers were down on the morning we checked out so could not cash any tickets at the sports book. Very bad for a supposedly top notch casino to be having computer problems! The Blackjack dealer said the computers had been down for an hour when we asked and was not sure when they would be back up! We finally checked into our room around 5:00pm. We had a strip view room on the 17th floor. Great view of the strip from the upper floor. Room was larger than I expected, however, the bathroom was small but did have a small flat panel television above the tub which was nice. The main room has a 42-inch plasma television, however, the remote control was touchy and did not work all of the time. As for the housekeeping, I must say they are one of the worst I have encountered at any hotel/resort. A supposed top notch resort should not have that many glitches with housekeeping. First off, we did not receive turndown on our first night even though it was requested. Also, we had asked for 2 extra pillows. Well, 2 hours later someone came up to the room and even though the do not disturb sign was lit still banged on the door! VERY BAD!! Also, after a day at the pool we returned to the room to find one of the maids dirty slop rags on top of on of our bags in the room! Cheese curls from the previous guest were found near the bed on the floor upon checking into the room! The carpet in the room is dark and was not vacuumed on the edges, apparently ever! Also, the bed reading lamp was missing a bulb on one side, which was later found on the floor under the bed. We were warned by the front desk not to touch the mini bar unless absolutely wanting to use and item! Anything that you pickup from the mini-bar for more than 45 seconds will be charged to your room. Very weird policy! Just get rid of the passé mini-bar! Hello, nobody wants stale nuts and skunked beer! There was an “intimacy package” on the mini bar. Not sure what was in it but it was around $30.00. Must have been good for that price! Hmmmm. The Bose CD stereo in each room is a blessing and a curse. Knuckleheads next door to us blared their stereo at top volume. Walls are thin in rooms too so all could be heard. As for the pool, first and foremost, Alexandra the pool waitress sucked big time. She had a nice big, smug attitude. We ordered two Bloody Marys and 2 waters from her. She brings us the $4.00 per tiny bottle waters, when all throughout the hotel there are free tiny bottles of water available. We sent them back and she apparently copped a tude about the returned waters and refused to come over and wait on us the rest of the time we were by the pool. She seemed to wait on the folks who were flaunting their wealth quite fine though. Hmmmm?? We ended up going up to the pool bar to eat lunch since she would not come over to wait on us. Beware that an 18% gratuity is added to everything when ordering poolside. Definitely would have stiffed Alexandra if given the option to do so without having been forced to tip. I totally agree with other postings that throughout the resort, there is an air of arrogance with some of the staff - it seems that they REALLY cater to the people that "probably have money" but provide minimal service to others they deem not worthy. I must say that Allison the lifeguard was very friendly. She actually showed us to our pool chairs and carried towels and also brought us some waters since Alexandra the Witch would not wait on us. The pool area did have nice lounge chairs with cushions. Some larger bed type loungers were also available but appeared to be reserved well in advance. Also, apparently we are in another era of population growth in the U.S.A. so prepare yourself to be surrounded by lots of kids in the main pool! Fountain in center attracts them like flies on you know what! Prepare for no R&R or P&Q around the main pool with screaming brats everywhere! Cherry pool next to a large wall which was a bit strange. Smaller lap pools also scattered about pool area. Water was ICE cold in pools, almost too cold even with air temperatures around 110°. The “MIX“ music blaring at pool was nice for the first hour, then got a bit old. They need to mix up the music a bit, no pun intended. The pool bar was nice with Arizona Misters and table games. The pool bar food was good too. The valet and bellmen were very nice, actually the nicest employees we encountered in the whole resort. The gym was not very big for such a large resort. It was adequate, with some dumbbells, treadmills and a stairmaster that squeaked to high heaven. The treadmills had flat screen televisions mounted on them but no sound, only closed captioning. Have seen much better resort gyms for sure. Anyone who has ever stayed at the JW Marriott Cancun knows what I mean. If you do stay here check all of the available pricing options such as Orbitz, Travelocity and the hotel website. Actually got a better rate for a strip view room on Orbitz which included a $50.00 resort credit. Red Rock Resort also gouges you for $19.99 per day for a Resort Fee so don’t be surprised when it appears on your final bill. Don’t pay more for the Canyon/pool view which overlooks I-215 which is not much of view. The strip view is much better, particularly at night and from the higher floors. On checkout, our bags almost left in another guest’s car, who happened to have the same last name as ours. Now that would have been ugly! I could imagine the look on their face when they got back to California with someone elses dirty underwear! Ate at Cabo Mexican in the Casino which was good. Also ate at the fast food Mexican in the food court which was excellent! If you have LOTS of money to burn and like screaming kids surrounding you while poolside this may be your place. Otherwise, steer clear of Red Rock Resort Casino & Spa. We would definitely not stay at this property again. The JW Marriott down the street is much less pretentious and nicer in our opinion. And you can always take a taxi to the Red Rock Resort Casino & Spa if you feel the need to make a donation! Overall rating would be 3 stars since the casino is nice so I cannot give it a low 2 star rating…Feel free to email with any questions at big7ben@gmail.com!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: scbs4boo
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I traveled to Vegas to see a concert at Red Rock. We were going to stay on the strip for the action but, didn't want to have to cab it to the concert. I heard it was quite far from the strip. What a wonderful surprise! We took the complimentary shuttle from the airport. We had to wait about a half hour but, the shuttle was very nice. Good thing we did because the hotel was further than I thought maybe, 25 minute ride. As we pulled up, I knew it was worth it. The hotel is gorgeous! From the moment we walked in the door, everything was perfect. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was genuinely nice, and the room was gorgeous. We had a canyon room (17th floor) overlooking the pool and mountains (breath taking). Someone else wrote that the music bothered them on the pool side. I had to put my ear to the glass to hear it. Besides we didn't sleep much. We attended the pool side concert , amazing. What a great spot for a concert. Pool area is huge with about 15 pools. Plenty of room for everyone. Nice chairs with cushions. Family friendly but, nice for two single girls too. You could almost have your own pool. Drink service was slow but, our waitress was working hard in the 110 degree heat. The spa is very nice. Go early to use the private pool, steam and sauna rooms. Very pricey but, we were on vacation. Dining - We had lunch at Sandbar, about $15 a person. We had dinner at T-bones Chophouse, excellant. Two of us had a bottle of wine and filets about $160. Well worth it. We also, ate at the food court and Grand Cafe. Good food and prices. Cherry club - good mix of music, great time! Casino - fun, fun, fun. I saw drink waitresses more than ever on the strip. Didn't have to fight to get a drink. They have $5 blackjack and everything else you need. I lost, my friend won. I will still stay on the strip but, I would definatley stay here again too. It was nice that everyone at the hotel was staying at the hotel. You didn't have masses of people walking through like on the strip. I can't say enough about the staff. As we were walking out of our room, a maid even asked us if we had a good time, I said best trip ever!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Las Vegas Resort”
Reviews.Author: delpreston
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Red Rock Station twice in September, both times have been fantastic. Red Rock is the perfect place for long time Vegas visitors who are sick of the LV Strip experience. Red Rock is everything that the strip is not. There's a large gaming area, with plenty of room to walk. You don't feel like you're being run down by tourists. Overall, it's relatively quiet compared to its strip competition. As far as their hotel product, my coworker said that it reminds him of a brand new Westin. The hotel could compare to Wynn, Bellagio, and Manadaly Bay. The rooms are modern and stylish. It has everything you need to relax, yet all the modern electronics hookups if you're there for business. I found the bedding to be comfortable, yet my coworker had to have housekeeping bring him a new pillow. The shower was a good experience, as was the tub with LCD television mounted to the wall in the bathroom. The only complaint is that if you're room is not near the elevator, expect a long walk. There is a mid hallway elevator that takes guests to the pool. I found it was easier to cut through the pool area to get to the casino vs. taking the regular hotel elevators. During my first stay there was construction at 6am, but the hotel moved me, and credited me for that first night's stay. Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and definitely would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort but there are challlenges”
Reviews.Author: TampaTraveler06
Reviews.Content: Exhibiting at a conference and loved the hotel. The challenges: They charge $13 per day per laptop in the hotel room. If you are exhibiting and need to use internet in other areas of the hotel or on the conference level they are going to charge you $295 per day. per laptop! Crazy! Housekeeping staff are the friendliest I have seen! I have to say the server staff in the Grand Cafe and the staff attending to our conference food were leagues above those in the 3 star restaurants at the resort! Watch out at the pool, they include a 20% gratuity on your bill and the service is not worth it, don't tip twice since they don't have to earn it. The cab rides to and from the airport are $50 and the hotel shuttle only runs every two hours to the airport. The shuttle to the strip is a good idea but if you are going to see the shows keep in mind the last shuttle picks up at the strip at 9pm-before the shows get out so you will have to get a cab back to the hotel for $36. Booked the combo Hoover Dam tour and the flight over the Grand Canyon thru Vegas.com. Be prepared to sit on a bus while they pick up passengers at almost every hotel on the strip. Hoover Dam tour very good and flight over Grand Canyon was unbearable hot in the plane. A couple of people were sick. We don't think the A/C was working. I would go back to the resort especially if you want to be away from the strip. That is really the only reason to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The low-down on the Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: CSTOntario
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great hotel to stay at in Vegas & had seen & heard good things about the Red Rock so we decided it would be a good place to celebrate our fifth anniversary. The good: - Pool area is great although the cost of the private cabanas is a little extreme. Not really needed though unless you want complete peace & quiet. - Fitness centre is very good for a resort although several of the cardio machines with tv's were not working. It would also be nice if there was disinfectant available to clean off the machines between users. - The rooms are very nice & the plasma tv's are a nice touch. - The Feast Buffet is a great place for breakfast. For less than $20.00 you can eat until your content. Staff were friendly. - Also had great food & service at the Cabo Mexican restaurant. - The movie theatre & bowling lanes are a great touch. The Bad: - The $43.00 cab fare if you don't feel like waiting for the shuttle is a bit of an opener & really lets you know how far away you actually are from the strip. - Do not let a cabbie take you to Meadows Mall. We took the shuttle to the Fashion Show Mall one day & then thought we'd go out shopping another day. We had passed all kinds of shops along the way in from the airport & thought we'd check them out only to have the cabbie take us to some run-down mall close to the strip. Not a very fun experience! - We were upgraded to a Canyon View room which also looks out onto the pool. Big mistake! Good luck getting a good nights sleep because the music never stops! If the nightclub is open you'll be kept up all night. When I called down to the front desk to ask what was going on I was told it will stop at around 4am. We were given the option of moving to a room on the Strip Side but at 1am I thought I'd just try & grind through it. - I know it's Vegas but the prices for food & drinks around the pool are insane. $34.00 for a hamburger, hot dog & a pepsi. Some of the servers are friendly but others are just miserable (although walking around in a bikini all day might do that to you). - Spa prices were double what you'd pay if you weren't on vacation. That might explain why you don't see alot of people using the spa services. In a nutshell...if you're looking for a place to stay but not feel like you're in Vegas then this is it. It's a great resort in the middle of the desert & if you couldn't see the strip then you'd never know you were even in Vegas. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “My New Vegas Resort of Choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelRevue
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Resort & Casino is an outstanding property and will be our first choice accommodation for future Vegas visits. My girlfriend and I went to Vegas for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday and stayed at the RR for three nights. We were originally scheduled to spend two nights at RR and two nights on the Strip (TI), but spoke with the front desk to extend our stay at RR an extra day shortly after checking-in. The property just blew us away. Would have spent the entire trip at RR but we had exceeded the 48 hour cancellation window at TI and had an early morning flight out that would have been difficult given the distance of RR from the airport. Room: Wow! Outstanding room with a most comfortable bed. Big flat screen TV, two nice loungers and an iPod docking station/radio. Huge bathroom containing a separate shower, deep-soaking tub, water closet and double vanity. You also get a second flat screen TV if you want to spend a little extra time getting ready! Good toiletries and nice robes and slippers. Casino: Impressive facility with high ceilings, dark woods and beautiful chandeliers throughout. Personnel were uniformly nice. Even had a little luck there. Restaurants/Bars: - Salt-Lick was very good, but don’t have any late-night plans if you order the all-you-can-eat…I’m still full a week later. Excellent brisket and ribs. - Grand Café: Very good breakfast and sandwich items. Late night service was a little slow but given the crowds and the hour, not excessive or too be unexpected. - Sandbar: Waiters weren’t the best, but not bad. They seemed to be trying to be a little too cool to provide great wait service. Food was very good and seating/location was great. - Bars: Really liked Onyx and Lucky, especially the later. Cool vibe, great drinks and good music (nice mix, not just dance/club music). Onyx was nice, but a little too quiet on weekdays, much better on Saturday night. We didn’t go to Cherry as that’s not our style but looked to be a happening place, even on weekdays. Rock’s Lounge and the Sports Bar were both nice places to get a drink and the marguerita at Cabo was excellent. Pool: Our favorite part of RR. Truly a beautiful pool area, with lots of different pools and amazing lounge chairs. Spent a couple of days napping and reading by the pool. Never any problem getting a chair with space around you (Sunday and Monday, may be different on a Saturday). Waitress service was excellent, with a waitress there before you ever needed a drink. Service. Outstanding throughout the property, in all departments. My girlfriend commented continually how nice everyone was. I think this is where the difference between an 800 room hotel and a 3000+ room mega-resort really becomes clear. Check-In/Out: Very nice woman at the front desk (Angel). Room wasn’t ready when we arrived (11am) but she checked us in and took our cell phone number. We received a call ~1pm that our room was ready and to pick-up keys at our convenience. Check-out through the TV was painless and was able to pick-up copy of bill at front desk on way out (no wait). Valet: Car was delivered within a couple of minutes each time, with A/C running and cool. Helpful and clear directions provided by the valet. Bell Desk: Bags were delivered within 5 minutes of calling down for them. Very helpful and knowledgeable bellman (Rich?) showed us our room and provided a wealth of local info. Good experience checking the bag as well, with two very nice bellmen to take our luggage while we waited for our room. Room Service: Ok, not great. Arrived with only one setting (silverware, glass of water, etc) despite telling them two were dining and ordering two meals. Forgot dipping sauce for chicken fingers, although they offered to return quickly with the missing item. Food was tasty if not gourmet. Tray sat in hallway a little longer then expected but was gone within a few hours. Overall, we were very impressed with the RR. This was a different Vegas than either of us had ever experienced, but one we can’t wait to experience again in the future. Highly recommend, especially if you’re looking to get away for a fun and relaxing (at least by Vegas standards!) couples trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: JenDSantaBarbara_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose Red Rock for our anniversary after scoping out several different places in the Palm Desert and Sedona. I am so happy we came to Red Rock . We were awestruck the entire time, and were sad to leave. We stayed in a standard room and couldn't believe how gorgeous, emaculate and comfortable it was. The bathrooms are amazing, with soaking tubs about three feet deep and big enough for two people to soak. The flat screen TV in the bathroom was a nice touch. Marble everywhere. Beautiful. We loved the pool area, where we never had to wait for a drink. There are several bars at the pool area, and friendly roaming waitresses make sure your glass is never empty, if that's what you want. There is also a 21 and over pool, with large circular, raised beds big enough for three people, along with overstuffed mattress-pool lounge chairs. There are bungalos at the pool for rent that can be stocked with food and drinks. The bungalos at the 21 and over pool all had flat screens with cable. We went to the Cherry nightclub. The DJ was alright, he played a lot of weird mixes. Overloaded the 80s. The resort is amazing, you will not regret coming, no matter the price. We are already planning our return trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: sampleminded
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotel rooms we've stayed in. Very comfortable beds, stylish furnishings, *clean*, bathrobes, slippers, very classy. We liked that it was off the Strip and very close the Red Rocks national park.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Red Rock - except for one area”
Reviews.Author: Lil2
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Casino and Spa in Las Vegas is a beautiful hotel with excellent amenities and staff. There was only one area that suffered and suffered greatly. The Concierge was of no use at all. When asked a question she did not answer just shoved a map at you. When asked about tours a group of booklets were shoved in your hand. Neither person at the concierge desk was helpful. We saw someone else having a problem while making reservations for restaurants so we quickly went back to our room and made our own reservations. Red Rock Casino is very near the red rock area with many many things to see. A very nice girl that worked at the pool actually told us where to go and what to see. She was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dr_C_NY
Reviews.Content: Red Rock Resort is on the same level as you would expect in any world class hotel. This was the best stay my husband and I have ever had in a hotel!! I am a frequent guest of the Four Seasons Las Vegas where I met my past Lead Concierge (Scott), and now a Casino Host at the Red Rock. Our Casino Host that we have known Scott he is the most service oriented person I have ever met!!! He personally met us at the front desk and walked us to our room and hand delivered our show tickets to us, in addition to checking up on us periodically and doing everything and anything for us. The service is unbelievable at this hotel, they must recruited everyone from the Four Seasons!!! We particularly enjoyed the relaxed and attentive service at the pool so much that we spent everyday there. If you reserve a cabana they do charge a 18% service charge that no one ever mentions. Red Rock has the best rooms in Las Vegas and we would have never came off the strip if our host would have never convinces us to. Once you go out to Summerland you will see that it is worth it. We enjoyed our Vegas experience but even more so the peace and attentive service we received at The Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the food, not thrilled with the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Portland456
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to be designed for the younger set, and couples looking for a room. The pool area is littered with what appear to be beds . . . a novel idea by day, but after witnessing the spillover from the nightclubs at night, I dare say I'd want to go bleach myself after sitting on one of their lounges. Thumping music oozes out of every orifice of this hotel. This is not the place to go if you like to relax by the pool and read a book. Also, it was far too hot to hang out by the pool without shade, and shade was in short supply. If you want a spot with shade, head down early in the morning or get a private cabana ($$$$!!). The rooms were large and well appointed and the beds were very, very comfy. At least in your room you could turn off the music. The spa provided one of the best massages I have gotten. The spa was clean and had lots of options and the therapists were friendly and did a great job! The spa pool is where you want to go if you want shade and a quiet place to read. However, the highlight of our stay was clearly the food. I was with a group that was served at various functions so I expected the typical banquet food. I was tremendously surprised to find not only a huge variety of really nice foods, but they were all done well. Everything from the sandwich beside the pool to the multi-course dinners were delicious! We even visited the buffet one morning for brunch, expecting slightly better than average buffet food, and they even outdid that. The variety was absolutely overwhelmning, yet everything there was being served nicely (not icky looking buffet food) and was very, very good. This seems to be a foodie paradise--surrounded by good food, done very, very well. Casino, theatre and bowling alley all seemed average. They are all on-site so there is the convenience factor, but nothing about any of these wowed us. It is a good 20-30 minute ride from the strip, so guests at this hotel largely stayed on the property. I would not stay here if I intended to spend any amount of time on the strip. The shuttle times were so inconvenient they rendered themselves useless. Overall, it was a good experience, but next time I go to Vegas I'll be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: am10
Reviews.Content: Europeans can be a pill on holiday but I could not fault a thing with this hotel and was sorry I stayed only 1 week.From the Gorgeous room )12136-I wish I could live in it)to the wonderful staff from check in to everywhere else, spa, pools, even room service food, shuttles etc etc.DON'T stay on the strip-stay here-but not when I'm going back next Aug-I want it all to myself!!!Thank you Red Rock for taking such good care of my jet lag!

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Definitely Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Missjeanie
Reviews.Content: we went the last week of July which is the week between my b-day and our anv. We were married in LV 12 years ago and try to go back for our anv to celebrate again. Used the shuttle from the airport which is very convienent if your plane arrv close to their schedule. Check in was flawless. Staff very nice and helpful. Room ready in less than an hour and we arrv @ 12:00 pm. Room with strip view, fine with me cuz I brought nice binoculars. Room was awesome. Every detail attended to: huge plasma TV, excellent bed and linens, bathroom-couldn't ask for more. Tv @ soaking tub, robes, slippers, scales, hair dryer, nice toiletries, lots of towels,marble, instant hot water-no waiting. Nice bose stereo,mini bar,loved the panel for house keeping & doorbell, no stupid thing to hang on the door; whatever I'm forgetting I'm sorry. Room was cleaned 2 X daily with nice turn down service. Pool area was awesome-very attentive staff. Loved the extra padded loungers. Spa was nice. loved the hot tubs & showers. Vey disappointed in the Salon. Could have been anywhere-even Walmart except for the prices-WOW! Nice selection in the food coourt. T-Bones very nice-Staff was above excellent, food good. Tidesis great for oysters and seafood. Bowling & movies, most excellent. Took shuttle to strip to see the Frontier for the last time and take a picture, it will be gone before we return. Dropped by the Wynn while in strip. Glad we didn't stay there again. Way too many people. Gambling STINKS at RED ROCK. Stations must make sure you love your room enough because we went thro ALOT without any wins or comps. They need a better convience and logo shop. The store is very lacking-bought all stuff at the strip when we visited. Would Highly reccomend RR for those who love an excellent place to stay. Four Star or better. Would not reccomend RR for those who like to gamble.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Attyweb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights for our 10th anniversary. The hotel sent a complimentary bottle of champagne. The only thing we did not like was T-Bones, the restaurant. The food was horrible and definitely not worth the price. The next night for dinner we ate at Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris Hotel for 1/2 the price and the food was out of this world. A cab ride to the strip will run you $100 round trip, so you may want rent a car which you can do right at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: conners107
Reviews.Content: What a lovely change ffrom the strip. Getting tired of Bellagio, yet hesitant to change. Read about the Red Rock, and was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed the change. My husband loves to play the tables, and enjoyed the casino. I found the rooms fresh, large, inviting. There is truly something for everyone, and even though I don't gamble much, was not bored. I liked the idea you could dine a different style and price range at any time. We are already planning to go with some old friends who are tired of the strip. Give this a chance, you won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Red Rock!”
Reviews.Author: monieb1922
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Red Rock for 1 night for his birthday. We are locals, and have eaten at their buffet a few times and have been very satisfied. We were even more pleased with our overnight stay. Check in was quick and efficient, and they honored my request for a room on a high floor (17th floor). They also offered bottled water and apples. I love the decor of the Red Rock. It is artistic and plush- somewhat like THEHotel at Mandalay Bay, but not quite as dark. The hallway on our floor seemed to go on forever, and our room was quite a long walk from the elevator! The way the rooms are situated in the hallway are similar to that of The Signature at MGM. The door is in a small alcove across from another room. Each room has a doorbell and buttons you can push for "do not disturb" and maid service. When we entered the room, we were quite pleased! It was very large, with the same artistic vibe. 2 green lounge chairs with brown pillows, dark wood, a large flat screen tv, plush pillows on the bed, a large dresser/desk and minibar, and a big marble bathroom with a steam shower, his &her sinks, another flat screen tv, and a large tub. 2 robes were also provided for our use. We had a view of the Strip, but directly below us was a construction zone. The only noise we heard was from our neighbors. Nothing major, just like they were trying to move their luggage and it bumped the walls a few times. We didn't visit any of the restaurants, but ordered room service instead. Our order was taken very courteously and arrived in about 45 minutes. The presentation was wonderful! The food was delicious and hot- my husband got the Salt Lick bbq pulled pork sandwich and fries, and I got the make your own omelette with potatoes and a bagel. We split a slice of Italian Cheesecake for dessert- which was heavenly! Room service returned in about 1.5 hrs to take away the table. The bed was quite comfortable and the shower was refreshing- just hot enough and great pressure. There was even a scale in the bathroom so we could see how much damage we did from our meal. They provide a complimentary newspaper in the morning. I checked out quickly using the express checkout through the tv. We were sad to leave the Red Rock and have resolved to come back soon so we can try out some of the other ammenities such as the spa and pool. The only (very minor) complaints: Not enough lighting in the room, door to the toilet room didnt slide properly, the bathroom door is glass, so if someone uses it in the middle of the night, the light may disturb the person still sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel, relaxing - our new Vegas favorite!!”
Reviews.Author: ibetterwynn
Reviews.Content: Since it's a fairly new hotel and there is a lot of different info out there about the property I wanted to add our experience. We chose RR because we had just been to Vegas about 3 months ago where we stayed on strip (as always). We wanted something different and quieter than the strip environment. From the moment we arrived in the airport we knew we made the right choice. Even the airport was a zoo. We easily got a rental car and off we went to RR, which was an easy 15 min drive or so. Checking in was one of the only confusing parts of the trip as there were no good signs around showing where the lobby or check in was, especially not from the parking garage. We of course found check in grabbed some complimentary bottled water and apples and were up to our room. We requested a high up canyon view as I heard the noise from the cherry lounge could be loud on the lower floors. We were on floor 7 and I would say the view was fair-good. There is some construction so we had a view of the pool, dirt/construction area and the canyon off in the background. I would highly recommend asking for a room close to the elevator. We were towards the end of the hall and it took about 1 1/2 mins to walk to the elevator. Why aren't the elevators in the middle?? There was also some bumping noise from the bar, it wasn't that bad, but it was there-so make sure you ask to be higher up if you are concerned. But the room was really nice, probably close to as nice as Wynn, and the bed was super comfy!! The casino has all your games and slots. The poker room is very nice and has lots of locals. The dealers were very nice and laid back. The only thing about the casino is that it's done in a circle so it takes a while to figure out where you are and where you're going. By the end of the trip I was remembering where good slots were by remembering what restaurants they were facing. Other than that I could never find anything. There were locals and tourists here, you will find a mix of everything. Yes there were kids, older people and lots of young people, too. I think everyone felt comfortable there. The pool is really nice. Comfy chairs, good drink service, very clean. There is a main pool area with a fun fountain for the kids and then lots of smaller pools behind it. It can be very private and where we were there were no kids. There is also a pool at the spa which I would highly recommend as no one uses it. Just walk into the spa-go through the fitness room and you'll have your own pool with service, beds, everything. We loved it. I did use the spa and it was among the best I've been to. Very nice facilites and my treatment was wonderful. The fitness room is also very nice with good machines and weights. I don't have too much to say about the food. We had room service twice and it was fine. It wasn't great, but it was just breakfast room service. Took a long time I thought, about an hour and was a little cold. We also ate at the 24 hour cafe and it was fine for sandwiches, pizza. The only fairly nice food we ate there was the mexican restaraunt and we enjoyed it. Good guacamole, good service and great drinks. The nice restaurants looked good and were very full, the new japanese restaurant looks great. There is also a bowling alley which we did not use, but we did see a movie-it's so fun that there is a theatre right there, just walk through the casino/food court and you can take a break with a movie! Because we were off strip it was so nice to just relax and enjoy. We didn't feel like we had to go to another casino or go see anything. We did go to the strip one day and it was an easy short drive. Also note that Rosemary's restaurant (one of the top in Vegas) is very close to RR resort. I am a big fan of staying at Wynn when we go to Vegas, but I think we will switch to RR from now on. It was much more laid back and we enjoyed that. It was probably our best trip to Vegas yet!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Brizzy_3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights in early July. Loved the rooms! Spacious, marble in the bathrooms and two plasma televisions. We chose the canyon view which had a nice overlook of the pool area. Ordered room service a couple of times which was in my opinion worth the money. The breakfast buffet was quite good with a large selection of food. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Casino & Spa”
Reviews.Author: lornem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock Casino & Spa from July 8th to July 14th 2007. Wanted to find somewhere off the strip for some fun and relaxation and THIS IS THE PLACE! I had booked the room online through Expedia and upon arriving I was immediately upgraded to a Canyon View for no extra charge! The rooms and beds are very comfortable and a plasma tv and bose stereo was incredible. The maid service and turn down service was beyond expectations. Even with being located on the pool side I didnt not hear any music from the night club. The pool area was uncrowded and the ability to find a COMFORTABLE lounge chair anytime of the day was quite a difference from other hotel located on the strip, where u have to go first thing in the morning for any chair. The very cool part is that ALL the Round beds are free as well. There is a $50 charge for the square beds with the canopies and are availble first come first serve. Casino area is very personable and all the dealers were friendly and very talkative. Had a great time all hours of the day when we did play. Being able to walk up to the cafe at 9am and ask to sit outside and not have to wait for an hour for breakfast was very pleasant. Also ate at the Saltlick, they had great food and portion sizes as well. Movie Theater has very comfortable seating and a HUGE screen! The spa adventure for the Black Canyon Kayaking was simply amazing! Great service! Great people and we had an amazing trip down the Colorado. The only complaint I had was when my daughter wanted to workout in the exercise room. She is under 18 and once we talked to a Manager then she was permitted to use the equipment. When we checked out of the hotel on saturday, I asked to see if any of my accommodations could be comped. The casino host responded quickly and covered a nights worth of our hotel stay and one of our meals. That was pretty incredible considering we really didnt gamble that much. If you are looking for the Vegas adventure without the hassles of being over crowded then the Red Rock Casino is the place to stay. We will be staying there many more times.

Reviews.Title: “Beware construction works”
Reviews.Author: harleyWorcester_UK
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault the hotel or resort at all it is really fantastic - the only problem is the construction works going on right outside the hotel which I think is an extension to the resort itself. We had one night in a mountain view room which also overlooked the pool - the building site could be seen from here. This however was not the problem, it was the work beginning at 7a.m. We called down to reception to complain. They told us that work is not meant to start until 8a.m for light work and 10 am for heavy work and they telephoned the site to tell them to stop. Which they did until 8am then they unleashed the pnumatic drills. We were offered a free lunch voucher as compensation but we were checking out that day so couldn't use it. So 5 stars to the resort and minus points for the building work. Go here when it is finished!!

Reviews.Title: “HOT HOT HOT”
Reviews.Author: dawn1pc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Rock for 3 nights at the start of July. The weather was hot but the hotel was even hotter. My husband and I loved the beautiful, trendy and luxurious feel of the hotel. The roon was really modern and spacious. We loved the plasma tv in the bathroom to watch while we were getting ready for our nights out. The pool was the highlight of our stay. We woke up pretty early, around 9:30 every morning and got to the pool around 10. By getting there early and with the help of the cute pool girls, we were able to get two great lounge chairs with an umbrella to fight off the hot vegas sun each day. We sat by the pools in the back of the complex because the main pool was crowded with kids. The back had a much more relaxed spa vacation feel. We ate at Cabo and Terra Rosa which were both great. We also spent a fun night at the Cherry nightclub... which was kind of small inside but the outdoor patio was a great place to drink a few cocktails. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who has been to the strip before and is looking for a "spa getaway" that is still close by.

Reviews.Title: “Hot property, Staff COLD”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsGood15
Reviews.Content: Didn't stay in a room, but spent half a day roaming property, gambling and having a few drinks. Clean, very nice pool area, spacious casino layout, great bingo room, bowling alleys, 16 theater movies on site along with fast food alternatives. Good place to bring family and just let them run. No need to leave the property which is rare in a remote location. Staff defenitely needs lessons in courtesy and understand we are their customers. They were cold and had attitude. Especially in the gaming pits. I was playing craps at a $5 table and a gal at one end of the table was throwing the dice a bit hard and one bounced off the table. On the one hand, she was told to make sure the dice hit the end of the long table, yet chided on her first attempt (ever) for throwing them too hard. Craps is intimidating to a first time player anyway without criticism. Dice moved to a guy next to me and again, he threw a bit too hard and one hopped over the table and a pit guy had to pick it up and scolded him, angrily... rather than instructing him or teaching him how to do it properly. Next couple of rolls were perfect. Then on the next roll, his pace was good, but one die hit the point puck and took a bad hop off the table. The pit guy chased down the die off the floor again but returned to the table enraged, yelling at this poor guy who had no malicious intent at all. So I speak up saying, "Hey, he didn't throw it too hard, it just took a bad hop off the puck." Well, at this point he became unglued... "Oh I see, and now you run the casino! I've got better things to do than chase dice around the floor all day." He was really pissed. I immediately took my bets down, except for the pass line which you can't. The shooter made his point, I got paid and left the table thinking this place [--]. It's a $5 starter table and people need to be taught, not yelled at. At a minimum, they should be made to feel welcome. If this guy has anger management issues, he should watch over the $25 minimum table instead. I joined my wife for a drink in the bar and the service was cold, merely took the order and served it up. No thank you, no how's your day going, nothing. We felt as if we were an inconvenience for ordering a drink. It was only 4:30 in the afternoon. I might understand if it were crowded. The property is amazing, too bad the people aren't and in the end, that makes or breaks a place. I'll give it one more shot on my next visit, but if I have a similar experience, I'll never return to it, nor one of their properties. Play downtown at Golden Nugget or on the strip at Harrah's, Bally's and your welcomed to the table, treated with respect. If it were my company, I'd fire this guy on the spot. He really has ego issues and was totally full of himself. Gaming is supposed to be fun, the Red Rock Casino definately isn't!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel....”
Reviews.Author: k2rider
Reviews.Content: What can I say, we loved, loved, loved this place. We have never stayed off the strip but my wife wanted to just relax for her birthday. I'm usually a go, go, go type and worried I may crack from too much relaxing. Alot of worrying for nothing!!! Everything went great from the get-go. The front desk hooked us up with every request we had....high floor, canyon/pool view, close to our friends. The rooms were all around awesome. Great decor and very nicely sized. Huge bathroom with marble floors and LEATHER walls, an LCD TV over the tub. The beds were nice and plush (2nd only to The Palms), 50" plasma TV on the wall, Bose CD/stereo in every room. The pool was great for relaxing and checking out the scenery. As if the guests weren't nice enough, the staff was beautiful. This place was 2nd only to the Hard Rock for attractive people. The drinks were pricey but they gave you your moneys worth. Food outsid was very good as well. I was surprised at how good it was. The ladies in the group used the spa and gave nothing but rave reviews for the beauty and service. The gym was very nicely appointed as well. Well worth the resort fee. We went to the bowling alley one night, non-smoking and very clean. What a great time we had!! They have a 13 theater movie complex on-site as well. It did draw in some local riff-raff teenagers but were easy enough to ignore. If there was any drawback to the overall resort, it was the onsite retaurants we visited. Both Terra Rosa (high end Italian) and Salt Lick BBQ were just OK and service was less than stellar. The exception to that was T-Bones......GREAT food and exceptional service. Bottom line for us....I didn't miss the strip at all. We'll be staying here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Try it out to see how great it is!!!”
Reviews.Author: LBurgie
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent two weeks at The Red Rock for our honeymoon / celebration with our close friends for our wedding (We eloped at The Four Season's in Las Vegas four months prior) We are in the hotel business and were very pleased with the resort itself; the rooms are AMAZING, the SPA was fantastic, VIP services were very helpful, casino was great, the pool..... well, it's heaven! Especially Cherry (The adult pool) The restaurants there are great too. We went to a private tasting for the new Japanese restaurant and it was divine! It opens next month. It's great to be off the strip and The Red Rock has a shuttle to and from the strip if you have the urge to go to town. We only left once it two weeks. It was paradise and had no desire to be in the caos of 'Vegas' From my understanding they have only been open for a little over a year and perhaps some of the previous travelers were there during a time when they were still working out the kinks because our experience could not have been better. We plan to go back frequently and think that other people should be informed about this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic long weekend at Red Rock”
Reviews.Author: dew192
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I was a bit concerned by the mixed feedback but figured with the Conde Nast 2007 Hot List award and a desire to stay off the strip, we'd give it a go. Sooooo glad we did. First off, compare Expedia prices with the hotel site. With the package deals on their site, saved about $100 PLUS got free breakfast. The overall atmosphere is cool/hip, not tacky OTT Vegas. The room looked exactly like it did in the photos and was bigger than predicted. The pool area was great but very little shade so sun block and mojitos were in order. It was fairly mellow on Friday and Monday but Saturday/Sunday was a "pool party" and the volume of the music was not great for relaxing/chatting/reading. The solution? As a hotel guest you get full access to the spa facilities which includes a small pool with lounging area. You still hear the music, etc. but was just a bit more mellow. I don't think other guests knew or thought to go there because we almost had it to ourselves. Food options? Salt Lick was mediocre. Terra Rossa was great (ask to sit on the small patio - it wasn't too hot in the evening and so was really chilled, almost romantic). The cocktail lounge with the fire pit at the back of TBones was great as well. We rented a car so can't vouch for the shuttle service but it was about 15-20 min to the strip. Highly recommend renting bikes and touring through Red Rock canyon. It's a 6 mile ride from the hotel and then a 14 mile loop. First 5miles of the loop are uphill but the view is worth the effort if you can do it. Also head out early if doing it at this time of year e.g. around 7am. The hotel will organize rentals for you and its the same price as going to the rental shop. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to come back - Best hotel in a LONG time”
Reviews.Author: RickFL
Reviews.Content: Just got home from 4 nights at Red Rock. As far as those negative reviews, I wondered more than once if I were at the same place they went to. I read them before my trip and got a bit nervous, but as I was going to a small conference there, I was going anyhow. I am very pleased to report that they couldn't have been farther from my experience. I related the reviews to several others that went and they found it hard to believe they were true. You've read elsewhere about the facilities - top notch. I won't go into them much except to say they were as nice as the website portrays. Sorta South Beach meets the Ritz. One of my colleagues mentioned that the hotel was more like a nightclub than hotel in feel. The entire place was quite upscale in look and feel. The pool was equally cool - particularly the adults-only Cherry Pool. More on that below. Back to the service.... From the moment we arrived, service was stellar. The valet relayed our name via radio to the staff (unnoticed by me) and we were greeted by name all the way to the front desk, including the guy at the front door, the manager standing in the lobby, and the desk clerk. Nice touch. The service continued all the way through the place - from the dealers to the wait staff, the maids and even people we simply walked past throughout the property. The second day of our conference, I rented a cabana at the Cherry Pool so the wives could all hang out while we were off conferencing. We figured it would pay off as the girls intended to spend the day down at the pool. I went down in the am where Blair introduced herself, let me pick out a cabana, and told me to simply have the ladies say hi when they showed up. At break, I came down to see how they were doing and my wife simply said "I feel like a rock star", and how attentive both Blair and Jennifer (who came on later) were. Scored some points with the wife there! When my wife closed out at the end of the day, there was an issue with the bill as we had apparently been quoted the wrong price by reservations. After some brief discussion, it was handled in our favor and all was well (thanks Chris). We had such a good time down there, and they treated us so well that I rented the cabana the second day (at the correct price this time), and proceeded to use it as a "meeting place" to demo products to people I met at the conference (we were exhibitors). This was not a normal thing to do down there, but the staff was willing to accomodate us with "whatever we need" (thanks again Chris). What more could one ask for? The second day, the girls took EXCELLENT care of us again (Blair and Katrina I believe). Granted we spent a fair amount of money this time around (buy drinks for 20 people or so over a couple hour period and its bound to happen), but even on the first day where we didn't, they treated us great. My dad overheard someone say "I feel like I am in a movie". How cool is that? Oh - and it was quite successful from a marketing standpoint too I think. As if that kind of service wasn't outstanding enough, when we surprised the TBonz staff with a group of nine for dinner and no reservations (at 7:30pm no less), they accomodated us in minutes (one cocktail) by opening up a private room. Service was stellar there too, as was the food. Note: big portions - split side dishes. Very fine dining experience. Others that were at the conference mentioned that the Mexican restaurant was good. We also enjoyed breakfast at the Grand Cafe - great fruit plate. I gambled a bit the first night I was there - craps and roulette. Dealers were friendly and courteous, cocktail service was decent. If you are bringing kids, you will be pleased with the plethora of things for them to do too. Other than the incredible pool setup, I also walked past some sort of "discovery zone" area near the food court, and an arcade. There is bowling and a movie theatre there too. I didn't have any kids there but one of the wives said that the movie theatre was very nice, although it appeared that there were only a few movies as two were in multiple theatres. All in all, my wife, my family, my business colleagues, etc. all had a blast. We all felt it was spectacular and cannot wait to go back - we demanded (begged) that the conference be there again next year. For reference, I travel some 15-20 weeks of the year for work, and try to do 3-4 vacation trips a year (including weekend getaways). We typically target lower priced hotels (i.e. Red Roof or Comfort/Sleep Inn) when on business and better hotels (i.e. Courtyards or better) when on vacation. This stay was nicer than virtually any hotel I ever stayed in, including the very upscale Manhattan hotels I stayed at in a "previous life". If I were to look for negatives, I felt that the business center was overpriced. But then again I own a pretty small business without the marketing budgets of other companies. Also, there is an Office Depot across the street which I found very useful, convenient, and comparatively inexpensive. Finally, I don't always write reviews this upbeat - check out my review of the Imperial Swan in Lakeland, FL (I did the 12/05 review from Ft. Lauderdale). That should convince you of my impartiality. :)

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!!! Absolutely Incredible Five star all the way”
Reviews.Author: MarriedinVegas95
Reviews.Content: I've read the cons and don't understand. no ventelation in bathroom, come on?!? Expensive cab ride....they offer a free shuttle to and from the strip and the airport. If you call the front desk when you arrive or leave and tell them you have missed the shuttle they will provide transportation for you. If the strip is what you came to vegas for then stay on the strip. This place is spetacular in all aspects. Their motto is 3-A's Anything, Anytime, Anywhere. I have not experienced service like this since Wynn owned the Mirage. From the moment we arrived to when they provided a limo for our trip back to the airport nothing but helpfull smiling faces. We had planned to go to the strip a couple of nights, but found that we had no desire or need to go. ROOMS: Beautifully appointed. Just wish we could have found a way to take that bed and pillows with us. Turn down service every night. bose radio. minibar. GREAT view of the mountains or the pool. The way the rooms are organized with the entrance down a seperate hall from the main hall, NO SLAMMING DOORS OR DRUNKS WANDERING THE HALLS!!! Just quiet. Tell me where you can find that in Vegas. Newspaper at your door in the morning. They also have a way to notify housekeeping when you are ready to have your room done with a push of a button that activates an light outside of your room, NO more hanging a sign. The bathrooms are beatiful with a double sink and shelf below the mirror for your personal items. Complimentary robe and slippers for your stay, the slippers are yours to keep, the robes are $85.00. Seperate shower and tub with a 20 inch plasma at the foot of the tub. Room has a safe and plenty of cloths storage for a week or more stay. POOL: The pool is great. It has a row of lounges in the pool. The service at the pool is fast and efficient. They are expanding the pool to triple its size. I would get a bit packed on the weekends and seating was hard to find after 10:00am but with the additional space that won't be a problem. They had black jack tables at the pool. CASINO: Slots were much looser than the strip. The casino is HUGE. Any game you want is here for you. Big sports book with huge tv screens. table gaming and min. bet tables well appointed. There is a 72 lane bowling alley and a 16 screen movie theater. Popcorn smelled so good had to get some while we were playing. Players club is stations casino and comps are very good. FOOD: Full assortment of resturaunts including a very good buffet, food court, fine dining, and a cafe that is open 24hrs. The cafe was running great food specials while we were there including steak, shrimp, potato, salad and drink for 7.99. Try the mexican resturaunt they serve quacamole that is made right at your table. T-Bones serves incredible steaks. SERVICE: The service we received was top notch. From the bellhops, front desk, pool. It was the best I have seen in 15 years. Vegas on the strip has become so corporate they have forgottenthe little guy. Red Rock treats everyone the same and that is with the best service they can. Smiles everywhere, and the servers on the floor actively searched you out for drink service.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock ruined our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: sessumshhh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to celebrate our first marriage anniversary at the Red Rock Spa. I called the resort two weeks in advance to make an appointment for my wife and myself. I spoke with the customer service rep at the spa and the appointment was made. I then called the spa back to add a facial for my wife and I asked for the total which came out to $405.00. The lady I was speaking with asked if I wanted to add anything else and I told her no because I was in the military and could not afford anymore. On the day of the appointment my wife and I arrived 30 minutes early just like we were suppose to to check in. We were greeted warmly by the staff and so we proceded to check in. My wife and I were told that we were not in the system and that there was no appointment for the two of us. We were told that Red Rock was using a new system and that we propably didn't get put into the new system. So my wife and I left and had our entire morning ruined by this event.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Allikat613
Reviews.Content: We were quite leary about after booking our stay at Red Rock, with the shaky reviews lately we weren't quite sure what to expect but can happily report were surprised and satisfied. We chose the Red Rock because it was off the strip, and knew that we wanted an experience not like typical Vegas. We caught the Noon complimentary shuttle from the airport to the hotel very easily and found no fault. The check in was a breeze, and the front desk associate was pleasantly helpful. He made us aware of the "Cherry Nightclub" and how it can become louder at night and suggested a room on a higher floor and on Strip side for us, which we oblidged. He also indicated that our room was far down from the elevator - which is was, but we didnt mind a walk. It makes a difference when the clerk atleast alerts you of these things and gives you the option to make different arrangements, we were very happy to receive this service and hope they keep it up. The rooms are just a nice as everyone says, no fault there. And when we had a missing bathrobe when we called for a second they send one with no questions even though they were short handed on runners that day. Room service was prompt, and friendly, gratuity included in check (handy when you are out of singles). The casino and decor were great, but the Slots are tight - new casino and holiday weekend do not make it financially viable on the complete luck games. However, we did very well with black jack and roulette. Players cards get you discounted meal at the Feast Buffet - which we recommend. Definetely "not your Mother's" Vegas Buffet. Amazing variety, and very nice atmosphere. Grand Cafe was average, take it or leave it. And the Food court with the Burrito place is GREAT! We didnt try any other places as we spent a evening on the strip. We engaged in one of the 'Adventure Spa" package which was by far the highlight of our trip. Dan and Deb at Evolution Expeditions took us on the Anasazi tour hike/hot springs/kayak. Definetely recommend it for those who are active. We spent our morning/afternoon exploring Arizona caverns and the beautiful river, came home that afternoon with a good bit of healthy exhaustion and then was able to spend our late night in the casino having a ball. Pool area was very enjoyable - we liked the layout very clean and simple, no problem with children and it was a holiday weekend. The only issue we had was getting service from pool side cocktail staff. We were there an hour and not one stopped to serve us even with our prompting - we were told "someone would be over." All in all it didnt matter because we left to do something else, but if we were going to spend more time at the pool we would have rented a cabana - $150 a day with full service, cold towels and water. Overall, we enjoyed our stay. Our best Vegas vacation so far has been elsewhere - TheHOTEL, but Red Rock slides in very easily as second. Great non-typical vegas vacation with potentional to get even better. I'd say give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful alternative to downtown LV”
Reviews.Author: RELJD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Rocks Resort (RRR) for 10 days. We were there primarily to rock climb at Red Rocks Canyon, and RRR is only about 5 or 10 minutes away! Very convenient for rock climbers or people who want to hike/horseback ride in the Canyon. RRR was wonderful - the environment was classy and relaxing, not gaudy like so much else in LV. The service was generally very good, and it is worth valet parking (they apparently don't have a charge except for tips.) I did not experience problems with service that other people complained about on here. The rooms are beautiful. The bottled water available in the rooms is overpriced, of course, but you can get free bottled water in the Spa (which all guests may use free of charge). The main pool is nice with a party atmosphere and lots of cool places to lounge. I prefered the more tranquil Spa pool. The Spa itself was gorgeous and you can get free water, juice, tea, granola bars, and fruit in there. We did a couple's massage, and my masseuse, Michael, was great. (I recommend him.) The business center is overpriced and has short hours. Restaurants: T-Bones was very good, but way over-priced. They give you huge portions of food, and we would have been better off splitting an entree. (Would have been reasonably priced if we had done this.) The Grand Cafe was great for breakfast, and has a nice bagel with salmon & capers. The Italian place is good for dinner, but you should make a reservation. (We split an appetizer, pasta course, and entree and it was more than enough food.) The oyster bar place has good oysters (of course) and we had a great etoufee there. Warning: There is almost no extra space in the little fridge in the hotel room, and no way to reheat, so you can't really take leftovers back with you. Casino: We only gambled a little, but we won on the $.25 poker machines. The casino is smoky (which I hate), but no more than any of the other LV casinos. Other: There is a movie theatre, a cool bowling alley, and some sort of kids club in the hotel. It is about a 30 minute drive into downtown LV. The road does have heavy traffic and lots of lights, and is not a carefree drive. Parking is free and ample at the downtown LV hotels though. RRR would be inconvenient if your main thing is going to downtown LV, but since we only were doing this on a few nights to see shows, it was fine. I would highly recommend RRR, especially to people who are more interested in exploring Red Rocks Canyon and having a more elegant and low-key spa experience (rather than the classic drunken-all-night-gambling Las Vegas experience).

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock - Great - but inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: jackrabbit91
Reviews.Content: This resort is a really neat place - and much larger than I expected. In addition to the hotel, casino, and pool area, there are MANY restaruants and bars, a 60 lane bowling alley, and a 16 theatre cinema. The pool area is great and we really enjoyed the pool attendants that "walked you to your pool chairs" - this helps avoid the people that run down and grab a chair at 8:00am only to return at noon. The room was outstanding. When you check-in, ask to be close to the "elevator" since there is still a lot of construction going on at the "other" end of the hotel. We had a "canyon view" room that looked over the pool area. We were on the 12th floor and never had a problem with noise from the pool. And, the pool area is closed and monitored at night, so I'm not sure about the other reviews complaining of noise all hours. T he food was great at T'Bones Chop House - but expect a long meal and big bill ($150+ for two). The other restaruants - Mexican and BBQ were average. There are a couple Starbucks and big food court (like a mall) in the resort for quick meals. We found the best service during check-in, room service, and T-Bones. However, the food and beverage service in the pool area was fair to poor.....and very inconsistent from one day to the next. The spa is really nice - but get a tour to you know where everything is - lockers, sauna, steam room, showers, etc. My wife got a full tour and I did not. (Just one of many instances where the service was inconsistent. Throughout the resort, there is an arrogance with some of the service staff - it seems that they REALLY cater to the people that "probably have money" but provide average service to others. This is a great place but could be better. We would return. It's a great place for a couple's vacation or a gals/guys getaway. One last thing - as you might expect - the resort was MUCH busier on Friday and Saturday.....so plan your trip Sunday - Thursday if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return - even if someone else is paying the bill”
Reviews.Author: Mary4130
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at this hotel May 21 - May 23, 2007. Fortunately, I didn't have to spend my own money to stay at this poorly run hotel. I will not return, even if someone else is paying the bill. Now that's bad. There is a shuttle from the airport to the hotel, but it only runs every 2 hours. It is a 20 minute ride one way. I missed the shuttle by 10 minutes, so I took a taxi. 20 minute wait in the taxi line, followed by a $45 taxi ride. Check-in went smoothly, except for the fact that the room wasn't ready as promised. After a 2 hour wait, I was told that the room was ready. However, when I entered the room, it was obvious that the room had not been completely cleaned; for example, champaign corks littered the floor along with various other debris; the robes and other amenities had not been replaced; a dirty wine glass remained on the desk. The room was nice (once it was cleaned), but if your room overlooks the pool, bring ear plugs. My room was on the 12th floor, and I could plainly hear (and feel) the constant "thump, thump, thump...." from the 100 or so loudspeakers that sourround the pool. The "thump, thump, thump..." goes on 24 hours per day. I guess that is one form of psychological torture designed to keep you out of your room and in the casino. The pool had been drained for cleaning on the day I arrived and was reopened as I checked-out. I was still charged a mandatory $19.99 per day resort fee even though the only resort option (the pool) was closed. That was a quick $39.98 for nothing. All of the restaurant options are way understaffed; and the staff that they do have are rude and disinterested. On the first morning, I waited 20 minutes, after being seated, for someone to take my order; the food took another 20 minutes to arrive. The second morning was maybe 5 minutes faster overall. I used the Business Center computer to print a one page boarding pass; I was charged $5.89 (I don't know how they decided that was the number). Every other hotel I have ever stayed at charges nothing. Ouch. This hotel is very isolated from The Strip and any other dining or entertainment option.
