If you don't have a car (and I didn't), you don't have any options. You're stuck at the Red Rock with their poor service and high costs. Spend your money (or your company's money) at a place that appreciates your business. Avoid the Red Rock at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort, avoid Salt Lick BBQ”
Reviews.Author: kwtraveller22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Red Rock for a company convention and had a great time! We were a little leary about the distance from the "strip" but actually found the location even better than the Bellagio, where we have stayed before. The casino is very nice, lots of fun without a lot of cigarette smoke and not overly noisy. You do have to pass through the casino to get to the restaurants, food court or bowling alley (yes, bowling!) but not to get to the lobby, the street or the pool or spa. The spa area was gorgeous, really nice and the service was amazing there! The buffet restaurant was incredible, with more choices than I have ever seen before and everything fresh and tasty. We ate many meals at the Grand Cafe, where the portions were generous and the Barbeque chicken salad was a taste treat. Service was great in all the areas of the hotel, except the Salt Lick Barbeque restaurant, where the food was disappointing at best and the service was awful. We phoned ahead to warn them that a group of 16 people was coming in, and wanted separate bills and a table together. Even with 2 days warning, they only gave us one inexperienced server and the food arrived at our table cold. It also took over an hour to get our food. They did comp us with dessert when we complained, but still charged us a gratuity on the bills. I can't say enough about the rooms in this resort - top notch all the way! From the leather coverd walls and the huge soaker tub, to the extremely comfortable beds, great views of the mountains and the pool, to the quick response to a complaint about a missing bathrobe, all of the amenities were covered. I will certainly stay at the Red Rock again.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock is not holding up”
Reviews.Author: runninginbama
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Red Rock on previous visits and always liked it. It is wonderful to be away from the congestion of the strip and the amenities and food are significantly less expensive (I am sick of paying 4 dollars for coffee at the Wynn). All the reviews are correct in stating that the rooms are wonderful and the overall design of the hotel is tasteful and relatively smoke free. Unfortunately, the other reviews are also correct in that the staff is not exactly "kind or helpful". Beware of the concierge...they don't smile and look annoyed a lot. This stay, I think may be my last. The whole experience of a high-end (and the rooms sometimes go for 350+) property is ruined by the Disney vibe. The pool was NOT SEXY and teeming with screaming kids. It is also very strange to see the amazing amount of strollers being strolled about the casino floor. I would take my kids to Disney NOT VEGAS. For the same money, I will pay four bucks for coffee at the Wynn and enjoy the stroller free casino and calm pool. What happened to you Red Rock?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: mohammed10
Reviews.Content: Multiple trips to LV previously...so I knew what to expect. RedRock Casino is one of the newer hotel/resorts in Vegas Location: Located approximately 25-30 minutes from airport and nearly equidistant to the Strip (Summerlin, NV). Off by itself as far as casinos, so if you do not have transportation, you will be limited. Plenty of upscale shopping within a short drive. Red Rock Canyon itself is about 20 minutes north - recommend for nature lovers/rock climbers! Facilities: Ultra-chic, upscale hotel/casino. Plenty of traditional surroundings, gambling, etc. Good ventilation system - not as smokey as other LV casinos. On Site construction still ongoing with a new office building going up directly across street. Construction noise may be a problem if staying in cityview room - beware! Dining: Many very good eateries (Try the Italian style Terra Rossa - excellent!) Salt Lick BBQ is also quite good. Buffet style is adequate. Starbucks on premesis. Bottom line is food is plentiful and relatively cheap - a must for an off-Strip locale such as this. Rooms: Large, ultra modern with flat panel TVs and iPod connections (no HD, though). Confortable trappings, including bed (soft with abundant pillows). Not a large sitting area, unless you are staying in a suite. Bathrooms are spacious and have small flat panel TVs as well. Malfunctioning fire alarm went off constantly for two straight days - placed a damper on festivities. Highly recommend canyon view room. Staff: Needs work - not very accomodating to guests paying upwards of $350/night. Front desk personnel not familiar with check-in/check-out procedures. Asst manager is borderline rude to guest requests/suggestions. Overall: Not bad...would not stay here again until 'bugs' are worked out.

Reviews.Title: “Sadly disappointed in Spa”
Reviews.Author: lroden
Reviews.Content: Was told it was "a short cab ride from the Strip" - HA! more than half an hour each way, $80 round trip! and NO ONE told us there was a FREE shuttle from the Strip we could've taken! The massages were totally incompetent (the luscious descriptions in the brochure are written by the massage oil vendor , we were told - no one teaches the staff how to administer them!) and my daughter was left forgotten in a corner by the staff, then rushed to her treatment 1/2 hour late, yet, it ended at the scheduled time and charged the full price. Maintenance of the facility was also poor, the fountains didn't work so were dry, the shower flooded the locker room, the "zen garden" is carpeted in wrinkled Astroturf, etc. Cost over $500 for the spa day and we ended up sadly frustrated. Management did NOT respond to our comment card. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: GNS
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed in a hotel that was not on the strip. Red Rock Casino is atleast half an hour west of the strip. That indeed is a blessing in disguise - away from all the crowds. The room was excellent and very comfortable. The only drawback I found was that the restaurants were sub-par. Given that there is nothing around this place (or atleast I did not know of any), you were basically captive to eat at the restaurants. I am not saying the food was bad, but it was not great either. Like all other casinos, the rates for everything were high. Do not get bottled water from the mini bar, they keep loads of free bottles of water every day next to the registration desk. You can take as many as you want. Very good place to hold a conference because there are no distractions. The blackjack dealers were very nice as well. Given that I am no expert at blackjack, the dealer helped me out when I was going to make stupid decisions. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who want to experience Vegas by not staying on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, but has some issues”
Reviews.Author: JFSD
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Red Rock resort. While we think the resort is great, there were some issues which the hotel should address. On the plus side, the rooms are fantastic (the best I have experienced in Vegas), the spa faculty is great and the pools are amazing. Because the hotel is off the strip (20 minutes to the strip) a car is necessary, but things like food and alcohol are noticeably less expensive. The resort is also about 5 minutes from Red Rock Canyon which has great hiking. On the negative side, there is a mandatory $19.99 per room per day resort fee. While it does cover entrance and use of the spa facility, the other items “included “ in the fee like turn down service, a newspaper and free shoe shine are ridiculous as any decent hotel should include these services in the price of the room. Spots at the pool were also hard to come by; if you did not get to the pool early you couldn’t get a chair. It also appeared that there were a lot of locals at the pool (taking spots away from paying hotel guests) although it was not clear how they gained access to the facility. In additional, the pool staff “reserves” the nicest spots and pool beds for no reason, and we noticed that some of the best spots remained empty all day because the pool staff put reserve signs on the spaces and would not give them up to the hotel guests. While the staff and housekeeping were OK, the service and cleaning was not up to the standards of a 4 or 5 star resort. This hotel would like to be a 4 plus resort and in some respects it is (rooms, pool, spa) but in other respects (service, excess fees, housekeeping) this resort has a long way to go. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lefty0418
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort because of a business conference. The rooms were great and the staff were very pleasant. I had some issues with my room due to neighbors and the manager was extremely accomodating. The only complaint that I had was with breakfast. There were limited restaurants that served breakfast, the sit-down ones had long lines and the only fast food option was Fatburger...the wrap place didn't open for breakfast until 10am (which made no sense to me). Also, this is a great resort if you've already done the Vegas thing before and don't really plan on going back and forth. The cab ride is expensive and the shuttle service times are lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock Reduced Rate”
Reviews.Author: Swamilama
Reviews.Content: We (wife and teenage son) stayed at the Red Rock Resort between Christmas and New Years in 2006. We are frequent visitors to Las Vegas, but we rarely stay on the strip. Normally we stay at the Suncoast, but when booking the reservations for this trip I found that the Red Rock had greatly reduced their room rates, so we opted to try it out. The hotel is just off of the 215 in Summerlin, so it is very easy to get to….and its close to Red Rock park…don’t miss out on hiking around this great place. The resort is beautiful. There are plenty of excellent places to eat and the casino is very nice, although trying to find a low limit table is a little tough. There are movie theatres, and they were in the process of building a bowling alley, which may now be complete. The rooms at the Red Rock are gorgeous. The beds are very comfortable, and the soaking tub is a dream come true (it has a small flat screen tv to watch!). The bathroom is all marble, big, and again, beautiful. There is a large flat screen TV, but as usual in Vegas they try to rip you off for internet service. There looks to be a fantastic pool area, although it was windy and cold when we were there so we did not get to try it out. There also some fun nightclubs. One drawback we had at the resort was upon our arrival. We arrived at 2pm, which is a little early for check in, but usually there will be something available. But not this time. We waited until nearly 4pm for the room to be ready. This was on a weekday arrival. At least they had a nice big lobby to hold up in. I would recommend a stay at the Red Rock if you can get the rate that we found (under 150), or if you’re just splurging on a special occasion, but for the frequent visitor (non-high roller) like us it’s kind of pricey. Gorgeous place, but too expensive...and they stick you with that obnoxious "resort fee" and then again another fee for an "extra person". The room has two queen beds, isn't it made for more than two people? Hopefully if you end up with one of those 300+ rates they don't stick ya for these extras.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: yanna
Reviews.Content: This is a four star porperty with marble bathrooms and lots of amenities. Please note that they are really pet friendly. There were at least 8 dogs during my Christmas stay, and they are put in any room, any floor, and are walked outside where you valet. I used the hotel website for booking, and didn't see anything about pets. I am very alergic and phobic. The JW Marriott is just as nice, with no pets if you need an alternative.

Reviews.Title: “This place is Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dandar
Reviews.Content: one of the best places to stay in Vagas, Most of the other reviews are right on the money about this place. Since its almost brand new you dont have to worry about alot of things that plague old properties. The rooms are super modern with nice views of the mountains from any window in the building. This place is currently the locals favorite place to gamble at. The food at the chop house was one of the best meals that we have ever eatten, the buffet was great with more quility food then I have seen at one of these. No smoke in the casino, The pool looks great, with a bar and card games right next to it. Not a huge swimming pool but nice for wadding or letting the kids play in it (we didnt see many kids at the hotel). The staff was super nice all around. This is not a budget hotel so if your shopping for price pick some place else, from what we saw of the other hotels this place is about as good as it gets and the price is still close to lots of the lower class/run down 4 to 5 star places.(We walked through all of the other hotels in this class except the wynn) We took the pink jeep tour to the grand cannon and flew down in the helicopter if ,you want to see some great places ask for chris. The only thing to keep in mind is that they are still working on new parts of the hotel and there are other projects being built all around this area. This goes for any place in Vegas that has open land to be built on. Just dont let any of this distract your great view of the mountains. If you think its better near the strip just ask someone that been to Vegas about that because the strip is jam packed with taxis, people and plenty of construction or run down buildings to look at. The only slightly bad comment We had on the Red rock was the transportation. The shuttles only run every 1-2 hrs to the airport and near the strip with only enough room to hold about 12 people(So you have to wait in a line durring prime time to hold a spot for the ride you want(if its full you have another 2 hr wait,and thats if theres any more runs). If you dont have a car and plan to be comming and going to the strip this may be a problem. We picked this hotel because we wanted to hang at the pool, hike and relax a big chunk of our Vacation. So if you want a wild party and to hang at the strip every day pick the Bellagio or ceasars, heard the wynn is really upper end too but didnt go in so cant say for sure. Doubt anyone could say that they hated this hotel. I worked for hilton and have been in a descent amount of hotels that could not hold a candel to this place. Dan schutz

Reviews.Title: “Lots of pluses, but handful of flaws too!”
Reviews.Author: Bobm5508
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, almost perfectly laid out, and even has easy access to a major highway from the airport. It is probably easier getting here as say, The Venetian or the Wynn. Check-in was a breeze on a quiet Tuesday afternoon and we got to our room early. The room and view of the neighboring mountains were breathtaking. The amenties (i.e. 42" LCD TV) are very upscale for the price, which was a great buy by strip standards, but pretty high for the suburban location. The on-site restauants are all good, but service is strangely cold and detached. Hard to find fault, but they fall short of a true dining experience. This was especially true in the Steakhouse. The hi-style is evident in all the restaurants. The buffet was truly amazing and the late night coffee shop was 1st rate. I'd never had a $2.99 Cheeseburger served in a room with chandeliers and three prong silverware! The casino is bright, elegent and perfectly laid out. Easy to manuever thru, with beautiful floorings and restrooms. Nice sports book as well. So where's the flaw? The staff is a sleep walking crew, almost to a person. The shuttle to/from the airport doesn't fit most schedules and the shuttle to the strip takes an hour each way. The sensational lounge had entertainemnt for 20 year olds, and there weren't any there! People sat, listened and left every 10 minutes. The bar refrigerator is down right dangerous and the nice turndown service and daily newspaper are part of the $19.95 per day "resort fee". I saw one reviewer rave about the saved $50 cab ride from the airport. Its in there, whether you use it or not. Light a small fire under the staff, add a shuttle bus or two and bury that resort fee into the room rate (I know... it just seems wrong!) and this is a 4+ star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sumptuous Spa Treatments!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2nat
Reviews.Content: WOW, what an amazing and large hotel! We parked in valet, grabbed our luggage out of the car, and headed towards the wall of RED glass doors. The decor inside the resort was rich and dark. Our check-in went smoothly. We strolled over to the elevators, put our card in the slot to summon an elevator, entered, and rode to the 11th floor. The floors were carpeted in warm stripes, the walls white, the overhead lights draped in red fabric. Our room, 2 queen beds with Canyon View, was luxurious. The bathroom walls were lined in brown leather. The black & white marble tub was deep with a flat-screen t.v. mounted above the faucets for easy viewing. Twin sinks, lighted vanity mirror, scale, bathrobes, q-tips, lush towels, nothing was overlooked. The closet light turned on automatically when the door was opened. Padded and wooden hangers awaited our clothing. The queen beds were large with 4 sleeping pillows and 3 or 4 decorative pillows each. The mini-bar was stocked with Italian bottled waters, sodas, liquors, candies, even cookies, a disposable camera, a first-aid kit, and a sex-aid kit! A printed notice warned that items removed from the display tray for 45 seconds would be charged to your room! Look, but don't touch. We had a large, flatscreen t.v. to watch from our beds, but only turned it on once. The Red Rock Canyon view was gorgeous, and the pool below was amazing! A very large, round pool with a fountain in the center and plenty of oversized lounge chairs and beds surrounding the pool. After dropping off our bags, we headed downstairs to get a bite to eat before bed. The Grand Cafe is open 24 hours, and it fit our needs perfectly. My sister had a very thin crust pepperoni pizza that promised basil but the waitress warned they had no basil. I had a bowl of lentil soup and fresh crusty bread, a mini loaf in it's own mini bag. We awoke early the following morning. Our spa appointments weren't until 10am, so we headed downstairs for breakfast. The Grand Cafe greeted us for the 2nd time in less than 7 hours. My sister ordered an apple pie ala mode, but alas, their pies hadn't yet been delivered that day. The waitress offered cream pies, but we both settled on a skillet breakfast: 3 eggs over easy / over medium, bacon, sourdough toast, and hashbrowns. Delicious!! Next we walked the casino floor, stopping at a craps table. I quickly lost $100. We went back to our room to get ready for our spa treatments. Grabbed our swimsuits to kill some time in the whirlpool, and hairclips to keep our tresses up. We rode the elevator down to the spa, and entered the tall, glass, red doors to the spa. We signed in, and were led to the women's spa area. We were provided lockers, sandals and robes. Bottled water was within reach nearly everywhere. We soaked in the whirlpool for about 20 minutes, then headed over to the lounge to await our masseuses. Michael called out my name, and I was off. Nice dark room, relaxing music, warm sheet & towels on the table. Perfect! Michael was very gentle and had very soft hands. In talking, I learned he has been at the Red Rock Resort for 1 year, but with Station Casinos for 5 years. He's excellent and I'd recommend him to anyone. After 50 minutes, my massage was through. I headed back to the lounge, drank more water, and waited for my facial. Vicki was my facial technician (I'm not sure of the exact term or title). I had never had a facial before which really excited her. She explained ahead of time everything that she would do, then was quiet the rest of the procedure. That was perfect, allowing me to actually doze some of the time! The facial surprisingly came with feet & hand treatments. After our facials, we headed up to the casino's food court. We had Panda Express and Fatburger. My masseuse, Michael, had recommended the Baby Burger, but when I got there, I was told the Baby Burger Buns hadn't been delivered. They could make my Baby Burger but serve it on a Fat Burger Bun. Fine. A side of "Skinny fries" and a diet coke, and I was all set. The burger was delicious, very much like an In-N-Out burger! Back to the spa we went for our 2pm appointment, manicures. My sister's manicurist was awesome, a bubbly blonde named Lori. My manicurist was named Bonnie. She didn't speak much, not even to tell me what products she was putting on my hands (there were several small dishes of creams). Regardless, my nails look fantastic with a gorgeous light shade of pink. Next were our champagne pedicures! We got into the pedicure lounge chairs. There were supposed to "massage", but mine just vibrated, so I turned that feature off. This was another quiet treatment, this time with a seaweed wrap and caviar cream on my tootsies (I learned from listening to Lori). Our pedi's looked great! For dinner, we headed to T-Bones steak house for dinner, and were promptly seated near a loooonnnng gas fireplace. It was really impressive! Kirsten, Rick and _____ (sorry, I forgot his name!) were our servers. Kirsten told us of all the specials, told us of her favorites, and really made everything sound so tasty! We ordered a bottle of wine... a German Riesling. It was DELICIOUS!!! For an appetizer, we had Oysters Rockefeller. They had a minty flavor, and were COLD. We were shocked & discusted by our first bite, but graciously tried to eat two. Couldn't finish the plate, and it was obvious something was wrong. When Kirsten pointed out we still had oysters to finish, we had to confess they just didn't taste good to us. She apologized and removed the charge from our bill. Our entrees were Surf & Turf, and thankfully the steak and lobster were so good they made up for the discusting oysters. Our side dishes were o.k. The petite filet and lobster really were the stars of the show. The mac n' cheese side dish was not your mama's mac n' cheese. The cheese was white. White cheddar? No... gorgonzolla. Pew! Actually, the first bite was stinky, but it aged into the delicious creamy taste & texture as the night went on, and I had 3 servings of it! The other side dish was garlic mashed potatoes. They merely sprinkled some garlic on top, torched it, and served it. The garlic really should have been incorporated throughout the mashed potatoes, in our opinion. Now the topper. We asked for dessert to go. It was a triple chocolate cake. They said, sure, no problem. Cut it, boxed it, and put it in a bag. Off we went to our room, opened the cake (which looked glorious), and ... where are the forks? We went back down to the restaurant to request forks. The young lady at the front desk said they did not have disposable silverware, that she had been after them to order some, but they had none for us. As we stood there dumbfounded, the portly balding man next to her (also behind the counter) said, "Room Service", to which the girl responded, "You could call room service and ask for a fork". Off we went, no thanks to them! We walked over to the food court and "borrowed" a spoon from Ben & Jerry (Thanks B & J!!!). We strolled past the craps tables. Two tables had now raised their minimum bet to $10... too pricey for me. The $5. table was dead. So I played $20 worth of video poker. Bye $20. Back to Ben & Jerry's we went to get 2 scoops of ice cream, then back to our room to enjoy our desserts. The next morning we had 10am hair appointments. The stylists were having a meeting about new products, so they ran a bit late, but soon we were seated at the washing stations. My stylist was Michelle, and I think my sister's was named Anika. Anika wasn't much of a talker, but Michelle was very nice and made me feel right at home. She did a great job on my hair. Trimmed it, blew it out... looked fantastic. We said good-bye to the spa, and headed to the reception area to check-out. $1,900 later, we were totally relaxed and refreshed!

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed Reservation + Another Customer Tipping for Upgrade = Sleeping in Car!”
Reviews.Author: ericcwhitaker
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, Red Rock is a beautiful modern property in line with some of the better boutique hotels I've visited. Problem is their hotel staff can't seem to get anything right nor do they put the customer over the high roller in the casino. In Feb 24th's onslaught of last minute reservations due to weather back east leaving stranded travelers, as well as Priceline's inability to do anything right, I booked a room though an American Express special rate with Travelocity (note, linked through Travelocity but an AmEx rate) for that night and proceeded the long drive from the Strip to Red Rock in Summerlin. Cue arriving in beautiful lobby. The initial desk clerk, who was wonderful through all of the process, could not find my reservation, but printed the confirmation I gave her and assured me they would find a room somewhere for me. Note that during this wait, a guy checked in next to me, slipped the clerk a 20, and got an upgrade in the classic Vegas 20 trick. Cue the clerk telling me they are sold out and can't add reservations, but will be rearranging me to get me in. 4 hours and lots of run around later with no offer of a place other than their stiff lounge couch and a bottle of water to tithe me over, out comes a staff member to tell me that they are rearranging some guests into their "still open but reserved for playing customers" suites and villas. I then wait another half hour for their hotel director, a pitiful customer rep of a man, to come and tell me sorry, even though we're sold out, we can get you a room 50 miles away or nothing at all. I declined and explained the story of the upgrade to which I was immediately dismissed as "lying as that would never be possible." He then did invite me to make a reservation and come again as the hotel "would love to invite me back" on my dime. I thanked him and assured him that because I would have to sleep in a car that night I would most likely not return. Go to Red Rock at your own risk, because a beautiful property with a lousy hotel staff can't get it right, no matter how many stars they are rated.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved IT!,”
Reviews.Author: TwinkieCat
Reviews.Content: Received a terrific rate of $179.00/night thru the hotel. Stayed Sunday thru Tuesday. Upon arrival we met the hotel's shuttle out at the airport's luggage level. Only waited on the bus for ten minutes before it left. Great way to get to and from the hotel to the airport. We tipped the bus driver, cuz the ride was FREEE. Saved a $50 cab ride! Upon check-in, was very impressed with the hotel's interior, which went VERY smooth. The design is something out of Architectual Digest. Simply beautiful! We requested a room away from any noise but with a view of the Strip. We opened the 18th floor door to the most beautiful view of the mountains and the Strip. The hotel design continued thru out the room. Unbelieveable! One warning, don't touch anything in refrig. Everything from soda, peanut, etc. is on a sensor and if it leaves its spot for 45 seconds...Bingo Baby, your charged. Loved the LCD TV attached to the bathtub room wall. The picture wasn't as good as the bedroom's HUGE LCD screen. The restaurants and fast food had high quality food. We did have HORRIBLE service at the Italian restaurant...finally complained ... we had to wait over 30 minutes for our food. Even our waiter was embarassed. Reward for our patience was... a half of glass of champagne :(((. To top off that evening. The diners next to us was an old man, definitely drunk, with a 20 year old hooker with him. He had an awful mouth on him. The manager finally came over and ask them to leave after everyone around complained. Would never eat there AGAIN and don't recommend it.! Highly recommend T-bones for a special occasion. High priced, items are bought on an individual price. Food was EXCELLENT. We had four waiters waiting on us. Salt Lick BBQ was good as well as CABO for Mexican. Fast food places were Rubios, Panda Express, a hamburger place and deli. Also had Baskin-Robbins and Starbucks. The casino exceptionally clean and definitely catered to locals. Had 1, 5, 10 cents slots. Poker room was VERY crowded and often had to wait for a table. Many locals play there. The pool area was once again, absolutely high class. Cabanas and lounge chairs with 5 inch thick pads. My husband did say the pool was quite chlorinated. Took two massages...welll, what can I say. Gym is upscale. We did not miss the excitement of the Strip and can hardly wait to return very soon. we've stayed at Mandalay, Bellagio and Caesar's and have paid up to $400/night. My friend I can not recommend this place any higher. One time and I know you'll be hooked like we are!

Reviews.Title: “Relieved!”
Reviews.Author: ljb247
Reviews.Content: We were a little wary after reading all the hot and cold reviews on Trip Advisor. But overall, we were thrilled with the Red Rock. The decor is amazing - very unique and contemporary. Our standard Strip View room was large, the bathroom was huge, and the tv in the mirror was pretty cool. The room was clean, and the bed was soft and luxurious. We ate at Tides Oyster Bar and had the freshest oysters we've had in a very long time. They also have the BEST banana cream pie ANYWHERE! The waitress was very personable and helpful with menu selections. The next night we ate at TBones Steak House. The food was delicious, and like all steakhouses, the servings and the bill were huge. However, the service was very impersonal. We had a "team" of 3 servers and they all were unkempt looking (not clean shaven, shirts rumpled and half tucked in, not very refined). They basically just put the food on the table. No help with menu or wine selection, just order takers. When we go to nice restaurants, we like to feel special, and we did not at TBones. If that's not important to you and you're just wanting good food, this place is great. If you're looking for an overall special experience, look elsewhere. The casino was great. Excellent variety of machines, never too crowded and contrary to other trip reports, I won $500 throughout the weekend, on penny, nickel and quarter machines! We rented a car for $20 per day because we didn't want to bother with using a shuttle service. This allowed us to go hiking at the Red Rock park at our leisure and get to and from the airport without a hassle. For a quieter Vegas experience in cool surroundings, you can't go wrong with Red Rock. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: atcdp
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel & property. The crystal chandeliers are breath taking. The rooms are very nice with everything you need. Turn down service every night. A paper delivered to our door every morning. DO NOT touch anything in the refrigerator or next to it. You will be charged ($4.00 for a can of soda?). You can't even put your own things in thr frige. You'll be charged for that too! The restaurants are quite nice but expect l-o-n-g lines. T-bones is exceptional. The breakfast buffet has a very large selection and the staff is always there to help but I would suggest hiring bus people to service the tables. The lines waiting to get in would move much faster. Very nice & large casino but don't expect to win at the tables or slots. The pool is very, very nice with a fountain at the center and cabanas all around. There's construction on the property and our room faced it but it never woke us up. Our only complaint is the suttle service and the lack of cabs. We missed our flight after waiting half an hour for a cab to arrive. The shuttle wasn't leaving until 3:00 and our plane left at 3:30 so we couldn't use it. I recommend renting a limo if you can find one that will go there. They really should schedule hourly shuttle service. We'd love to stay there again but we can't chance the hassle of missing our flight again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Terrific Rooms, Far from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: BC97
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Rock in late January for a convention held at this resort. I've read reviews with issues about the service, noise, etc., but I didn't run into any problems. I arrived at the Vegas airport at a time when I would have had to wait about 90 minutes for the free shuttle to the hotel (runs every 2 hours). So I took a cab. Cab fare was about $50 including tip during rush hour. Took the shuttle back from the hotel to the airport a few days later. Shuttle was on time and a nice ride. Upon arriving, check-in was easy. Requested a room as far away from the club as possible since I had read reviews about the bass from the club all night. Received a king room on the 18th floor with a strip view. Never heard the club at all. The strip was quite a distance away, but the lights were cool at night. This side of the hotel also had a view of the construction still going on below. These guys start before sunrise! Could hear them hammering away at around 530am. But I don't think it would have been loud enough to wake me up. I was already up because I was still on east coast time. Of course, I was on the 18th floor and if I had a room down lower, the noise probably would have bothered me. The room was terrific. Nice king bed in the center of the room with two chairs, nightstands, Bose Wave radio, desk, floor to ceiling window. The bathroom had marble tile, two sinks, separate sunken tub and shower and a separate door to the commode. The little LCD TV over the sunken tub was a nice touch. The 42" plasma TV in the room was cool, but the reception was typical of hotels - poor. So the picture was that much more grainy on a big screen. Conference areas, lobby, casino area were all very nice. Didn't gamble, but walked through to go to the Italian restaurant (this is the one that is run by the winner of Hell's Kitchen). Had to try the seabass that was her claim to fame on the show and it was absolutely outstanding. For $32, it had better be. Prices for everything else were much more reasonable. Pastas were in the $10 range or so. Not too bad. Transportation to the strip ended at 3pm from the Red Rock. Makes sense that they want you to stay at their location to lose your money. Didn't get a chance to check out the club or any shows while I visited there. All in all, this was probably one of the nicest hotels I've visited. Got a group rate for the conference of $200/night plus the resort fee of $20 which doesn't include internet of another $13/day. Good thing I was able to expense it. Otherwise, I probably wouldn't stay there again because of the price and distance to the strip. If traveling to Vegas to party and hit the town, this is probably not the best place to be unless renting a car or taking cabs works for you. However, for something a little more upscale, this is a cool place to hang out.

Reviews.Title: “Above average.”
Reviews.Author: JCashMoney
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Red Rock. Nice hotel, nice view if you're on the valley side. Rooms are very nice. Not as big as The Hotel at Mandalay Bay which is where we usally stay. The bathroom countertop, while holding two sinks, is not very deep. Therefore, there's not much room to put your stuff. Towel bars are on the front of the sinks just below waist level, so you're always knocking them onto the floor. Strange spot for towels. Request for non-feather pillows and bedspread were filled promptly. However, one of the sinks did not drain at all because the stopper was broken in the down position. Our request to have this fixed was not responded to for our entire stay. His and her reading lights on the bed were a nice touch, as was the Bose Wave Radio on the nightstand. The hotel was very clean. The casino was laid out almost exactly like Green Valley Ranch (e.g. circular design). Unfortunately, the casino was relatively smokey on an otherwise slow weekend. Compared to other strip casinos with higher ceilings, the casino was smokier than average. Huge poker room with a very alluring Jumbo Jackpot feature for bad beats. Every player in each of the 9 Station Casino poker rooms gets paid a minimum of $200 when the Jackpot is triggered (i.e. getting beat when you have 4 nines or better). Unfortunately, all of the blackjack tables require the dealer to hit on soft 17 which increases the house advantage. Players are allowed to touch the cards in blackjack which is not the norm in most strip casinos. Dealers were all very friendly. Restaurants were above average. We had nice meals at Cabo and T-Bones. Cabo had excellent Mexican food. Red Rock Canyon is only 5 miles up the road and offers absolutely breathtaking views. There is a 13 mile car loop that costs $5 to access. With little doubt, the best deal in Vegas. Highly reccomended. The Spa, while very nice, is on par with other larger strip hotels. No individual lock boxes for valuables, so leave them in the room-safe when heading down to the spa. If you want to feel completely removed from the normal Vegas nightlife of the strip, this place is for you. You'll forget you're in Vegas. However, if you like the feel of the strip, you'll feel isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Could've Been Better...”
Reviews.Author: padrinho1
Reviews.Content: Date: January 31, 2007 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Bronx, NY We were comped for four nights at the Red Rock from January 21 through the 25. Getting to Red Rock from the airport and the Strip is a breeze now that the southern and western portions of the Las Vegas Beltway (Route 215) are completed and reach as far as West Charleston Blvd. where the exit to the hotel is, a 15 to 25 minute drive. The property is beautifully located near Red Rock Canyon in the Summerlin area and is a nice and quiet alternative to the hustle and bustle of downtown or the Strip. Now the hotel itself. The check-in process was a little strained. When travelling to Las Vegas, I travel with someone (who is in her 70s) who prefers a room away from elevators and vending machines. The clerk initially gave us a room on the 12th floor (room 12-102) closest to the elevator, and as I would see later on, it would've been fine based on the floorplan. She then gave us a room on the 16th floor (room 16-140), which we took. Based on our request, and whether her actions were to comply or to be downright mean, the clerk sure knew what she was doing. When we got up to the 16th floor, we walked. And walked. And walked. Because the rooms are so big, the corridors are long, so a casual walk from the room to the elevator took over a minute. Because of our long trip, the comfortable room, and In lieu of playing 'musical rooms', we opted to stay where we were. But the clerk certainly could've put us halfway closer. Now our baggage. We drove into the hotel's valet and used the bell service and everything seemed okay. Then the bell captain gave our stub to the hotel clerk. We get to our room, a whole hour passes by, and still no baggage. Several phone calls later, our baggage appears with apologies from the bellman. It wasn't his fault, this was the fault of the hotel clerk, whose actions were either accidental or intentional. And while I'm on the subject of the hotel clerks at Red Rock, their overall demeanor seems somewhat hardened. The check-in process should be relaxed, friendly and professional, not a clearance of customs to enter North Korea. The rooms are very comfortable, with wonderful amenities like the flat-screen TV, the Bose radio at the bedside and the comfortable bedding. Beware of touching or moving anything in the minibar - the minifridge or the outside tray of goodies - or you'll automatically be charged. The TV in our nice spacious bathroom didn't work, and the construction outside the hotel in the morning didn't really faze us. We did most of our dining at the buffet and found the food to be quite tasty. The gambling wasn't great in terms of winning, but then you can't expect to come to Vegas expecting to win. Overall, in spite of the minor glitches, we were quite pleased with our stay. But then again, we were comped for four nights. If we had been paying $300 per night for the room and the resort fee, then I probably might've felt cheated

Reviews.Title: “Weak Effort”
Reviews.Author: SDJackstraw
Reviews.Content: These folks are trying to be W or THEhotel or a Kimpton but it is not working for them. The rooms look nice but as for the the servce and food you might as well be at the low-rent Palace Station (same ownership). The housekeeping staff missed the boat several times. When we had to ask for the second robe I was bruskly handed the card warning me I would be charged if I ran off with it. The turn down service consisted of a knock at the door and the question "you want anything?" The restaurant experiences (except for Salt Lick) were very unstaisfactory. High prices, poor quality. We like wine with dinner and they may have the worst wine lists in the county at the more casual restaurants. We won't be back. For those prices, I can do better on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty on the outside, lacking on the inside”
Reviews.Author: TheReverendMother
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days as part of a conference. The hotel looks great. Kind of like W Hotels meet the dessert. However while it looked great, the resort failed to deliver on the following items: 1) lightbulb missing in floor lamp for duration of my stay 2) bath robe missing upon check in 3) cold water faucet fell off in my hand 4) on day 2 housekeeping never came - had to call to complain at 5 pm 5) mysterious and "mandatory" $20 resort fee not told about at checkin 6) annoying $2/day maid "gratuity" 7) no turn down service the first 2 nights of my stay 8) construction noise that awoke me every morning at 6 am I resent having to pay a "resort fee" and "maid gratuity". Apparently you don't pay your maids enough? And I never had time to take advantage of the free shoe shine, gym or free newspaper that were part of my "resort fee". And the turndown service, which was also part of my resort fee, was only given to me one night. Charge more for the room if you have to but a "resort fee" is an unnecessary annoyance. What happened to customer service and just doing what guests expect? While all problems were handled, I had to wrangle my satisfaction out of the front desk staff, which appear to have been hardened by other unhappy guests. They were well-rehearsed in how to handle guest objections. The most pleasant staff to deal with were the housekeepers (despite overlooking cleaning my room one day) and the concierge (all very professional). Convention services staff did try hard. Food service was well above average for a convention hotel. However, meals were not timed well and some people received their entrees when others had finished. Water replenishment during seminars was frequently noisy. Yet the convention staff were very responsive and accommodating, if not always able to anticipate the needs of our group. All in all, I would not return nor can I recommend the property. Too many details overlooked, and too far from the strip for supplementary entertainment. At $220/night, I would much rather pay $300/night at another property I love on the strip and be done with all of the petty extra charges. Looks good, but doesn't deliver for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend absolutely”
Reviews.Author: Madelines
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Las Vegas, Red Rock casino was perfect for a weekend getaway. The rooms are spacious, clean and well-appointed with a flat-screen TV, Bose radio, down comforters and plush beds. The decor is dramatic with red-tinted lobby glass, red curtains, and red rock. Our room overlooked the red rock canyons(and some ongoing construction). Overall pleasing and a relaxing alternative to the frenetic Strip. I'd strongly recommend renting a car; the Strip is an easy 20 minute drive away, the Red Rock Canyons are 10 minutes away, airport 20 minutes. Initially, we took taxis but this quickly became prohibitively expensive; r/t Strip about $80. Waiting for the valet is about 15 minutes; parking free. The service is impeccable. The concierge was helpful in obtaining tickets to Cirque de Soleil's Zumanity(essentially a cabaret) and dinner reservations @ Mandalay Bay's Mix. The restaurants are adequate and reasonably priced ~$40/lunch for two. We particularly liked the Tides Oyster Bar - recommend the gumbo. The spa is busy; reserve ahead. I had a manicure and body polish that was okay though nothing spectacular. As this was January, the weather was in the 50s and hence, the gorgeous pool with canopied beds was left woefully unused. Compared to some of the casinos on the Strip e.g. Mandalay Bay, Caeser's, this casino was much quieter, less smoky, and well, cleaner. Though construction is still ongoing @ the periphery, the room was well-insulated and the resort appears mostly finished. Also recommend the Red Rock Canyons, doable hikes at every skill level. Also offered rock climbing, mountain biking, road biking which we'll try on our next visit. Completely reasonable prices and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Service has mostly improved.”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at (and second review of) this hotel six months after my first stay. The standard room at this hotel is the best of the many 4 and 5 star resorts in the LV area, with the possible exception of THEHotel at Mandalay, and in some particulars I like it better than THEHotel, particularly the decor. My only complaints in the last review concerned the overall unprofessional/untrained service personnel and so-so restaurant choices. The restaurant choices are the same, although the service has improved immensely in restaurants, as well as service from the front desk, valet and bell service. Everyone was friendly and efficient. I really appreciated the bellman who brought my bags in from the car waiting for me while I checked in and going up to the room with me, so I didn't have to ring down and wait for my bags to come up. I stayed in one of the more recently completed rooms. I should note, depending on the location of your room, the hallways are very long. It was quite a trek from the elevators to my room about midway down the hall. Rooms at the end of the hall should be for marathon runners! The only remaining problem service-wise is housekeeping. They are obviously short-staffed leading to careless cleaning. On this occasion, I checked in very late (almost midnight.) I first noticed a half empty gooey bottle of bath gel on the floor outside the bathroom. A robe, hanging on a hook in the bath was obviously used by a woman who was still of childbearing age if you get my drift. Grossed me out. During my three night visit, I noticed trash not emptied and either careless vacuuming or no vacuuming. Other than the housekeeping issues, I love this hotel, especially the luxurious and spacious rooms. For the price you can't go wrong if you don't mind staying away from the strip, and plan to spend most of your time at the hotel where you are staying.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock---- Very Service oriented”
Reviews.Author: jaybeezer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Red Rock 3 times now and are going again in a week. We find the Red Rock very service oriented. Housekeeping attentive to our needs. Room service timely and the staff in general very gracious. Used their business facilities and that was without incident. The hotel itself is very comfortable and cozy.(they have mink pillows for the couch!) The dinning is quite varied although I would not make a special trip for it. The noise factor which earlier may have been a problem seems to have ended.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: KatwomanWA
Reviews.Content: Lets start with the positive Beautiful rooms Friendly Staff Beautiful location Fabulous pool Good Casino Waitresses Great dealers Pet Friendly The fitness room (best one I've ever been in) And now, the minuses. The free shuttle service to the airport runs only from 7am to 7pm, and leaves the hotel every other hour. If you have a flight before 8:30am or after 8pm, or during one of their 'off' times, you are pretty much SOL. Their Escalade car service (not even a limo or towncar) is $70 +tax&tip. They don't care that you paid a $20 "resort fee" for the shuttle. The comps [--]. After playing thousands of dollars over 3 nights, we earned about $6 in comps. Sure, you can beg a pit boss for more, but chances are slim to none in getting them. It doesn't matter if you are a local or a tourist. The club "Cherry" was incredibly loud when we were there. We had a room on one of the top 5 floors, a room we paid extra money for, and we were kept up by the stupid club. And keep in mind that it goes until 4am. Bring ear plugs. Maid Service. Of the 5 visits they should have made, only one was done without having to call and beg for service. Even with the 'maid service' light on for 5 hours straight, we still had to call for service on numerous occasions. Right now, the hot tubs are broken and the pool is not really heated (even though it's supposed to be). There was one smaller kiddie sized pool that was heated and the fitness room pool was also heated. Resort Fee is $19.95 a night. While it's supposed to include comp airport shuttle (see above), comp strip shuttle, free shoe shine, newspaper, and pool usage, it's a rip-off. Just raise the rate $20 a night and include those things. ** Because of the good location for visiting the people I went there to see, the absolute pet friendliness, and the proximity to good casual dining (PF Chang's, Bj's Pizza, Cheesecake Factory, and several grocery stores are all nearby), I would stay there again. However, I would demand a strip view room so that I wouldn't be kept up all night again. These are the cheaper rooms, but being kept up with bass until 4am is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: the3travelers
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the resort I knew going to the strip would be hard. The exterior is awesome as well as the inside. Red Rock has a modern aura and it works! We were privy to the VIP lounge. The signature suite was fabulous w/ a full view of the pool and a scenic view of the canyons. CASINOS ~ Very well lit unlike the Venetain and the Aladdin. It was even better lit than the Bellagio. Low demonination tables were also a plus. They had a BIngo room too. RESTAURANTS ~ Thanksgiving week Red Rock offered cheap dishes at each of the casual dining restaurants. We took advantage of them. Each low priced dish earned 2 thumbs up. 'Salt Lick BBQ' was delicious. Their BBQ sauce is VERY GOOD. I had smoked turkey 3 times during our stay and the pecan pie EVERY DAY. It was that good. The smoked ribs were good also. 'Grand Cafe' was also tasty. We ate their $1.99 and .99 cent breakfast every chance we could . 'Feast Buffet' far exceeds the over rated Spice Market buffet @ the Aladdin. We ordered breakfast in 1 day and the service was quick and the breakfast yummy. XTRAS ~ a full Regal Cinema, an arcade, KidsQuest ( a place were parents and drop their children), a food court and the cabanas makes me wonder why anyone would stay on the strip. SERVICE ~ Prompt, professional and with a smile. Thanks to Red Rocks Concierge ~ she got us great seats for the O show and booked us on a horseback riding tour of Red Rock Canyon. When you go to the web site click on 'spas', then click on 'adventure spa' for all the cool stuff you can do. Maintenance came up quickly for 1 of the 2 42 " plasmas ( it was just unplugged LOL!). Loved the VIP lounge. We dropped by constantly for the beverages and kept some in our frig beneath our wet bar. A lot of reviews mention the construction ~ it didn't phase us. Thanks goodness for shopping complex near by. My husband and son were able to walk over to Best Buy to get a charger for our camera. Here's a tip ~ when you're in your room and housekeeping knocks yell out that you're coming to the door OR keep the latch on it. They are a bit quick at entering. We did use 1 day for the strip. The O show @ the Bellagio was EXCELLENT! Also good were watching Bellagio's water fountains. This is the ONLY place I would stay. It was our first time in Vegas but when you strike gold why try anywhere else. We got a cab ride back from the strip for $30. He made a left up Flamingo Rd. and breezed us back to Red Rock.

Reviews.Title: “Red Rock should offer better gambling to attract people”
Reviews.Author: crickerpicker
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at Red Rock but spent a November day there gambling. The place was lovely, clean and inviting. BUT.........the slots were very tight. You would think they could offer better gambling to people since the place is so far out of town, kind of like what Green Valley Ranch did a few years ago: looser slots to make your trip worthwhile. Well, OUR trip was certainly NOT worthwhile. The machines just gobbled our money , we got very little play and never saw a cocktail waitress. No wonder the casino was just about empty. Heck, I can gamble on the strip to lose money....I don't have to drive a half hour through traffic to lose money!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: J&J1176
Reviews.Content: We booked the Red Rock Casino and Spa for a 4 day birthday weekend in early November and were impressed with everything we encountered. In booking the trip months before the concierge was very attentive and did everthing she could to arrange everything we needed prior to arriving. When our plane landed I don't know if it was incredible luck or fantastic service but the shuttle from Red Rock was waiting outside to pick us up within minutes of landing! The driver was wonderful and funny. The inside of the shuttle was very nice and gave us a great frist impression of the property. I will say, pulling up to the hotel side was a bit of a let down due to the construction. I sort of wish the shuttle had driven past the front of the property first...the view from the front far exceeds the view from the back. I know this will improve when construction ends but that won't be for quite some time. Check in was a breeze for us and I loved the fact that since this resort is off strip you don't have the hustle of gawkers getting in the way of checking in or requesting things from the concierge. The room...amazing! can't say more than anyone else has said but loved the beds and the linens...all very well done in fabrics that set a relaxing tone for the weekend. Little details were everywhere you looked. I was thrilled with the fact that turn down service included turning our stereo to a wonderful jazz station, turning down the bed, and even leaving a note about what the weather would be like the next day...including what time the sun would rise and set!!! The construction for us was not a huge concern, maybe we just arrived on a slow time, yes there was a crane blocking our view of the strip but honestly, it was very hazy, and if you want a view of the strip, stay on the strip! Ate dinner at the buffet every morning..it's a buffet. Food was okay but our service on Friday morning was top notch. Our waitress gave us great recommendations and little hints about the hotel. Went to Terra Rosa for dinner Saturday night...highly recommend it, and make use of the staff in regards to the wine list, very knowledgeable. Spend time exploring alll of the property...the pool area is awesome and all sort of great places to people watch on the weekends. Tbones has a fantastic outdoor fire pit and bar area that was a wonderful cozy place for intimate conversation with new friends. Our entire experience was top notch...I am thrilled with our stay and cannot wait to go back. Awesome staff, great service, and a entire hotel there for whatever we needed!

Reviews.Title: “Know Before You Go!”
Reviews.Author: WeTryItOnce
Reviews.Content: We went to this Resort after reading and understanding what to expect. Yes, it is true that the Resort is in a phase to complete the second half of it's room capacity. Yes, it is also true that you can expect construction noises as early as 7AM, temporary walls, black plastic partitions at the end of your floor, and workers on scaffolds. Construction on the rooms and Spa is planned for completion by July of 2007. This could all be a disappointment if you went to the resort to sit and watch the plasma screen in your room. We went to see Red Rock Canyon, Mt. Charleston, the Valley of Fire, see Shows on the Strip and as many hotels as we could, and of course use the on premise Spa every day. The on site Night Club Cherry is Co-owned by Geo Clooney (who is often spotted there) and is complete with a clothing optional outdoor pool/deck only accessible through the 10PM opening nightclub. The beds were superb as was the service, but keep in mind that even though this resort is 15 -20 from the Strip, it is still Vegas and 'tips' keep things moving, create opportunities, and increases your learning curve of the property. I learned that by the second week in November, every year, Las Vegas lays off approximately 30% of its workforce. Keep it all in stride when you order drinks at the pool and it takes awhile to get service. This is truly a beautiful property, admitted by management to have some flaws, but a pleasant experience for a traveller who demands a smoke-free room. Some rooms may have a door to make an adjoining room accessible for perhaps a family. If you are travelling alone and don't want to hear the next room's conversation, ask to be moved to a different room.

Reviews.Title: “The Casino is Great!”
Reviews.Author: FrediFizzx
Reviews.Content: What can I say? We left after 3 days a winner so we thought that was just dandy and paid for our trip. The odds on their machines were not all that good compared to the Strip but odds don't matter much if you win. We were knocked out by this Hotel Casino. Very much different than the Strip Hotels and all the crowds. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs major help”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 night stay for a girls weekend. Ended up paying around $400/night and spent around $700 in spa treatments. First issue came with the "shuttle". It runs at the most bizzare hours (last to the Strip is 3pm, last home from the strip 7pm, last from the airport 5pm). If you don't make a shuttle you end up taking a cab and spending around $50. The next issue came with the fact that they are still building the second tower and there are ribrations and excessive noise through out the day that makes utilizing the room almost impossible. When the issue was given to the front desk, they said that they would be able to move us the following day (it was currently after 3pm that day) and I would be notified when it was available. I was NEVER notified and had to seek out information all day (10am, noon and 3pm) to the point that we finally went to dinner and were moved to the new room at 10pm! That didn't help since the whole reason for the move was to be able to use the room during the day without the horribly annoying noise. I DO NOT recommend this property what so ever. Stay on the strip and save yourself a headache.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous First Class Hotel but only half done”
Reviews.Author: Msk6261
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this is a gorgeous hotel. If you like contemporary, hip surroundings, this is a wonderful choice. The major drawbacks are: #1 As of Oct. 06, they are still building what looks like the other half of the hotel. Construction begins at 7am (not 9 as I was told by the front desk), goes until 5 and is LOUD! Imagine drilling that rattles the building! They originally put us in a room at the end of the hall (the next half of the hallway was visqueened (plastic) off). When I complained they moved us closer to the elevators but you could still hear the drilling and hammering during the day. Our last morning, they hit the hot water pipes so no shower to be had. Typical construction issues. #2 You are WAAAYYY out there! It's a $35-$40 cab fare to the strip. Not convenient if you want to go into town for an evening's dinner or show. Other than that, they have really done a nice job with the details. Beautiful contemporary furnishings and bathroom. Comfy beds. Besides the construction, noise level from other guests is low (except maybe from adjoining doors). Fresh Flowers everywhere. Fun pool. Hip bars (I think one is a Randy Gerber club) Great restaurants. Helpful, friendly staff. The casino is not smokey yet but who knows what will happen when they get more business We ate at TBones and had a wonderful steak for dinner. Lots of places to hang out and people watch. A nice touch is that the spa facilities and gym are incuded in your resort fee even if you are not having a treatment that day. BEAUTIFUL spa! All in all a good choice if you want a lower key Vegas experience...................when the expansion is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy & Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Randy_C
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 days at Red Rock. We are not gamblers or smokers so Vegas was not our first choice of places to visit but we had to go for business reasons. We arrived on Saturday night. When we first went to our "non smoking room" it was very smokey smelling. Since it was late and we were tired we didn't complain. The next morning the maid apparantly spayed the room to try to clean it and it was better. We walked through the casino to find a restaurant and it was very very smokey and very crowded. My first impression was not good. I do have to say that things got better after that. It seems like Saturday night is the busiest night with the smoke and noise. The rest of the week we hardly noticed it. ROOMS: The rooms are big and comfy. The decor is very relaxing and we had a great view of the pool and the mountains in the background. Don't be fooled by the pictures on the website because you can see the mountains but they aren't as close as they look on the website. The pool area looks great at night when it's all lite up and it closes early so we didn't get any noise. The beds are very comfy (even better than the famous 4 Seasons beds) complete with lots of pillows and down duvets. The bathroom is amazing with the deep soaker tub and tv. SPA: Most people don't realize that the spa has many free things for the hotels guests. The exercise room with lots of very good equipment and a boxing ring, lockers and showers, a lap pool, hot tub/whirlpool, cold pool, sauna, fruit, juices and water. Even if you don't want to use the equipment, it's worth it to go and see the beautiful decor. FOOD: We ate at all the restaurants (except the buffet) and they were very good. The swordfish at Terra Rosa is the best. SERVICE: 95% of the staff were very accommodating and friendly. The pool staff, front desk staff, houskeeping and spa staff were great. 2 out of the 3 people working at the conseiger(sp?) desk weren't very helpful. Maybe you have to tip largely to get them to look up the info you want. If they didn't have an answer they just said they didn't know. Usually, they offer to find out for you but not here. POOL: On the weekend the pool area had a lot of kids (during the week it was very quiet). Most of the pool furniture is not adjustable and is comfy for laying down but not for sitting up and reading. They have round beds around the pool which you can use for free but the square ones you have to pay for. Most people found it a little confusing which areas were free and which you had to reserve and pay for. Ask the pool staff on your first day because there is a small area with adjustable loungers that are free. LOCATION: If you are a gambler and want to spend a lot of time on the strip this is not the place for you because it takes 1/2 hour to get to the strip. If you want a relaxing place away from the strip this is the perfect location. We loved the location because it was only 2 miles away from Red Rock canyon (cycling is great there). You feel like you are at an relaxing mountain retreat instead of in the middle of the hustle and bustle and bright lights of Vegas. This will appeal to some and be a turn off for others. CONSTRUCTION: Still a lot going on but the noise never bothered us. They were working on the other side of the pool while we were sitting out there and it was fine. OTHER TIPS: If you want to go to the outlet mall. Take the hotel shuttle to the airport, then a taxi to the mall ($12.00). This will take you about 35 minutes total from the hotel. If you take the shuttle to Fashion Mall, then the bus to the outlet mall, you will have to tranfer at the bus station and it took me 2 hours to get from the hotel to the outlet mall. Overall, I loved Red Rock and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: kjmema
Reviews.Content: We decided to try the new Red Rock Resort in Vegas as we got an offer for 2 free nights. It far surpassed our expectations for a resort of this price. The rooms were huge as was the bathroom, complete with two sinks. Beautiful décor and spotlessly clean. The beds were wonderful, rooms quiet, lighting was good and the Plasma TV was a fun touch. We liked the lay out of the property and found it easy to get around. Not always the case in a huge resort. Places were well marked and nothing seemed too far. The pool area is spectacular. We visited with one of the Security men in the pool area and found that a lot of Movie Stars are visiting RR these days and staying in the $10,000 a day suites. For you casino lovers this is the nicest casino I’ve ever been in, and I’ve been in a lot. All the machines are the table type and the chairs are adjustable to different heights. All spanking new and clean. The casino was well laid out also. The smoke was a non issue as the ventilation was very good. With just a two day visit we didn’t even begin to explore it all. My husband and I take walkie talkie’s with us when we go to casinos. You can get a cheap pair at Radio Shack and they are perfect. We may use them at the mall also…We can always find each other that way. We are not food connoisseurs and don’t require fancy meals. The coffee shop was wonderful, with a lot of good selections and the Feast buffet good as always. They have two Starbucks for the coffee crowd and although there were no coffee pots in the rooms, (that I missed) one of the Starbucks was right in the lobby so you could go down and get a cup and bring it back to the room to sip while you dressed. The room lay out is different. Each two rooms have a separate small hallway. Very nice and a classy touch. If you can afford it and don’t like the noise and confusion of the strip a definitely great place to stay. We found the staff to be helpful, polite, and well informed. The cleaning lady was really sweet and asked if I liked the soap and spa items in the room. When I said yes she gave me an entire set to take home. It took only 20 min. from the airport to the resort. They sent a Limo for us which was fun….

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BevScollins
Reviews.Content: I stayed three days at this beautiful new hotel property. It is lovely, the rooms are spacious, the view is spectacular. You can spend a few days here and go nowhere else! The room: comfortable beds with lots of pillows. 42" plasma tv in the wall. View of mountains....breathtaking. The bath: Lovely marble, huge "soaking" tub, separate shower and toilet facilities. Bathrobes and slippers! A hair dryer and a scale! A small extendable TV over the tub! The hotel: Beautiful contemporary decor. Hotel has a full service spa, 16-screen movie theaters, casino, many restaurants (all price ranges), beautiful pool area, and very pleasant and accomodating staff. Location: This hotel is outside of the strip area toward the mountains, but even with traffic under half hour to strip. They also have shuttle service to the strip and the airport. For a traveller who has been to Vegas many times and wants some place to relax and still have the Vegas fun...this is the place. The Red Rock also houses a conference center for large meetings, but I did not investigate this. I am told it is the most expensive hotel ever built off the strip. It is really lovely.....I hope to go again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travlgal
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews on this site, This property has the potential to be a top notch resort.... IF they IMPROVE their service. My husband and I were also continually amazed at the lack of service. The small things.., PENS with chits at the restaurants. We always had to wait an extra 10 minutes no matter what restaurant, bar we went to, for the server to come back with a pen. When I asked, I was told they have a lot of locals come to the resort and so to prevent walk outs and forgeries, they don't bring a pen right away.......huh???? Seems to me, the first line in the greeting should be "Good Afternoon, Evening, are you guests at the resort? If so may I have your room key to verify? They do that to verify your entry to the pool, don't see why that wouldn't work at the restaurtants and bars. As for housekeeping, don't get me started. Yes they made the bed and replaced the towels. But again, that was it. Didn't throw out the used coffee cups(from Starbucks) or replace the water glasses in the bathroom or replace the broken ice bucket. No turndown service at all, one night they did leave chocolate on the dresser, didn't turn down the bed tho!!! And we left a tip for our housekeeper the first day! It is that kind of stuff that keeps this property from being rated higher. Hopefully, they will fix it . The dealers were great, they were very friendly and made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Going Through Growing Pains...”
Reviews.Author: ctc917
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend’s family invited me to join them on a trip to Vegas over Labor Day weekend. As the patriarch is a high-roller, we generally stay at places like the Mirage, Bellagio, etc. We were going to a bat mitzvah in the North Vegas area and he was invited to try out the Red Rock in hopes of that becoming his preferred hotel. That won’t be happening anytime soon. Appearance-wise, the hotel is absolutely beautiful. It’s clean, shiny, and classy. The valet service was pretty prompt (it took a while once or twice) and generally polite. A road bump came when we didn’t see a valet beckoning us to his lane to park; when we got out, he asked us to get back in the car and move it into his lane (despite the fact that he had already come over to us and could’ve—and eventually did—taken the car from us right then and there). I found the front desk staff and concierge friendly as well. Our two rooms were great (we booked one as a comp, the other at casino rate) and always made up promptly in the morning. However, once we exited our elevator onto our floor, a musty odor greeted us every time. (I liken it to the gymnasium at an elementary school where my mother once taught). Apparently, the plumbing was still being worked on at another part of the property. We eventually adapted to the smell after a while but it was still rather unpleasant. We awoke on our first morning (at 8am) to drilling coming from the room above us. We ventured to the pool, which is a great area. There’s a fantastic poolside bar & grill with decent service and great food and drinks (my girlfriend would like to recommend the shrimp wrap). The waitresses serving the sunbathers were charming and relatively prompt. There’s a fun little waterfall island in the middle of the pool which is a big hit with the kids…which brings up another observation: there are too many darn kids at the property—but not the hotel’s fault as capitalism rules :). The casino really left more to be desired. The dealers were very hit (no pun intended) or miss. Some were friendly but others were not—and really acted as though we gamblers were a burden on them. One in particular seemed to be having a bad day and was not welcoming at all. Another took a gambler’s money after he won; when the gambler called attention to this and politely asked the pit boss to come over, the dealer became very agitated with the gambler and seemed to be condemning him for becoming upset that his money was, you know, taken from him when he WON. There seems to be a major lack of cocktail waitresses; if I got my drink within 15 minutes of ordering it, it was nothing short of a small miracle. When the waitresses would drop off a drink and someone else at the table would request one, the typical answer was a curt “Uh, I’m not taking orders now—just delivering!” We played $1 slots for well over an hour and a waitress never got within 50 feet of us. On a personal note, I’ve never, ever had the bad luck that I did at this casino; I’ve never seen the dealers get more face cards than I did this past weekend. Alas, I brought it upon myself but for those of you superstitious-types, beware.
